Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.7
Reviews: 

Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.

Rating: 4.7
Reviews: 

Tried the 7 course meal for a celebratory lunch.

The food was great - loved the Maryuko Uni, smoked organic egg and the desserts. ‘Blanc’ the dessert was phenomenal.

However, service was quite average. The waiters rushed through explanations of their dishes. And while they tried to entertain our questions about the dishes, the way that they did it was quite cursory and generally seemed quite reluctant to hold a conversation.

My first 3 star Michelin experience. I found the service a little stiff, as the evening progressed the staff loosened up a bit which was nice, everything was so extra, the presentation of the food was so interesting and exciting. The food was good but I can probably tick off this experience. Make sure you like seafood! A once and a lifetime experience!
It was pretty cool we got to meet the chefs after.

I certainly had very high expectations of Odette, it having 3 Michelin stars and being #14 in The World's 50 Best Restaurants list at the time of the visit (november 2023).

Well, fame is definitely not everything! From start to finish, what lacked was soul and personality, and the whole experience made me think reputation by terms of media and rankings might be increasingly decadent.

To start off, we were offered a small and uncomfortable-looking table right by the entrance door, even though I had reserved a table in the Private Dining Room over a month prior. We had to insist on being placed in the intended room.

The whole time, it felt like we were doing the restaurant a favor being there and I could sense so much pretentiousness in service, food and ambiance. The flavor and even the high quality ingredients were shadowed by this and the gimmicky presentations of the food.

At a USD 500/SGD 700 price point per person (without wine pairing), I most definitely cannot recommend Odette to anyone.

What a lovely and delicious evening out in Singapore. Service was what you would expect from a 3* establishments. All the dishes, from the butter to the pigeon, were out of this world. The staff was well orchestrated and did a great job of providing information on each dish and engaging us in conversation throughout the evening. Having been fortunate enough to dine at other 2 & 3* restaurants around the globe I would put this in my top 3 in a very close race with Mudec in Milan for number 1 and edging out French Laundry in terms of the menu. I will definitely try to secure another reservation next time I'm in Singapore.

Odette has always been on my to-try list and this year I was treated to a birthday dinner here!

An amazing French experience savoring the 7-course meal. We were totally impressed by the presentation as well as the flavour of each dish. Not to mention the excellent and attentive service by the crew! It was also nice of them to gift a bottle of strawberry jam for every guest.

An unforgettable meal, or rather gourmet journey at this 3-starred michelin.

Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)

Other than the desserts and A5 miyazaki wagyu the rest is just average. Burnt A5 miyazaki wagyu comes with bitter taste. Would still recommend diners to top up and try the wagyu beef. If not you might get the duck which is just average.
Waiter was coughing while serving so not sure if that is a good service.
The desserts is awesome and the balsamic vinegar is nice too.

An exceptional experience, very fortunate to have visited this unique restaurant last night. These folks have real flair, making the visit enjoyable from the moment we arrived. I think that I can relate to the chefs “cross roads” concept, an amazing set menu with elements from across the globe. Great wine pairing, loved hearing the story lines.  Loved the casual, relaxed atmosphere. Everything presented with confidence and fun.  Well deserving of its Michelin status.  Each course was remarkable, but I was particularly taken with the chocolate fish ball!

I recently visited Nouri and I must say, the experience was outstanding. The food was absolutely delicious, with a unique blend of cross-cultural flavors that truly impressed my taste buds. From start to finish, every dish was beautifully presented and expertly prepared.

The renovated space is also fantastic, with a modern yet elegant atmosphere that adds to the overall dining experience. There is also a renewed chef table.

The service was top-notch and the staff was incredibly attentive. I highly recommend Nouri to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in Singapore.

Thank you, Nouri, for an unforgettable evening!

The owner did a wonderful service. We went in for lunch before our flight and the service was prompt and the food came out in a nice pace for lunch. The food was ok and this is my second time here. It has been consistent during the years. This is a nice spot to bring business guest for lunch as it is usually quiet during lunch in the area where most of the comparable restaurants may only open for dinner.  Yes, it is quite pricey.

Food was great, service was great, atmosphere was great. It was relaxed and we had a good time over good food. All the options were presented to us so well; tea, opening drinks, etc. I was just slightly shocked that the selection of tea to end the meal costed $30ish per pot. But other than that, I enjoyed dinner.

Unique flavors, warm, friendly service, beautiful plates, reasonably priced. Staff generously explained every dish and ingredients and an energetic open kitchen made for a memorable dining experience.

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

Very mixed thoughts in Labyrinth. The restaurant is exactly as advertised - chefs take on Singapore food - however I didn’t think it was necessary better than hawker stalls (especially if you consider the price). The other thing with the menu is it switched between hot and cold dishes too often (cold as in frozen). For example, the salad was cold, then the frog pie was hot, then the chili crab was partially cold, then switched to hot prawn mee, then the fish was even cold (I think the sauce not the fish itself)…. And so forth.

It’s so apt that this 1 Michelin starred restaurant is located within the Esplanade — Singapore’s National performing art centre.

Having dinner here is like being treated to the whole Singaporean experience… not only showcasing the cuisine, but our culture and way of life. Will not spoil the surprise for u, but they go all out with the props here!

If u are visiting Singapore, I highly recommend this dining experience, which is not only delicious but highly-entertaining! We left the restaurant with our bellies full and very happy.

Locals may balk at the high price we are paying for local favourites, but I think the creativity and presentation is worth a visit.

Creative spin to local dishes, knowledgeable staff. Definitely an experience not to be missed!

Although I’d have preferred lesser influence from Japan, got confusing for a bit when dishes tasted like it’s from Japan instead of Singapore.

Overall a great experience and highly recommend!

Crazy off the hook amazing experience at Labyrinth Restaurant. Singapore is blessed with so many incredible places to eat and Labyrinth is right at the top. The food is impeccable in terms of flavour and presentation, the service is on point and close to perfection, but it is the story and creativity that is infused through the entire dinning experience that transcends the gastronomic journey. I loved every minute and can’t wait to go back for more. I now know why Labyrinth is #11 on the best Asian restaurant list for 2023, was awarded the highest climber award in 2023, and have 1 Michelin star.

[Late review]

Visited in May 2023

A truly fantastic dining experience which beats some of the ‘higher star’ restaurants in Singapore (from a flavour and cuisine creativity perspective) quite comfortably in my view. Labyrinth’s rise in recent Asia Best 50 rankings is well justified.

The dishes are a tribute to some of the classic Singaporean flavours and the menu does justice to the various inspirations (hawker food, old SG restaurants). The starting course (Roti Jon, Otah, Satay) set the tone and it just kept getting better. Every main course item from Chili crab to Prawn Noodle Soup to the Sizzling Plate Steak was exquisite. Among the dessert dishes, the Orh Nee preparation was fantastic.

For drinks, I did not go with the wine pairing and just ordered a few cocktails. Average cocktails and nothing exemplary.

A 200% recommendation for all SG residents and visitors

Absolutely loved the food here. The sea urchin is terrific - we had the 1/2 portion with the pudding and it's more than enough as it's quite rich. The quail is a must order, so tender & juicy. Service is top notch. Although I will say that the cheesecake was just so so. Will definitely return soon. Easy to make reservations online

all the chef standing there when preparing food are very friendly willing to talk to customers probably is close to all the chef at the counter seat , feeling very close and cozy, when enjoying food there.  floor staff are also friendly, since self pampering with friends there every tue , is like a canteen for us.  Expensive for a quick lunch, we always go back there for uni pudding & salad, is a place that food won’t goes wrong have a stable quality.  All chef there not much break 3-5pm still need to prep for dinner.  Maybe not the food attract us but are the chef n waiter waitress we enjoy chitchat with them during our lunch very warm.

This restaurant is hands down one of the best, if not the best restaurant we have eaten at. The food was exquisite, the quality of the food was just incredible. The staff were lovely, chef Jo even come out to check on how the food was. Cannot recommend this place enough. My 9 year old even had her own 3 course menu just for her. Will definitely return when we are back in Singapore! Thank you to the team at Lolla 🙏😍

Food - good but for the price I’d expect better quality. It’s way too salty. That being said, nobody comes here for a healthy meal, perhaps
Service - five stars, attentive but not overdoing
Atmosphere - need improvement on music choice, too loud and cannot hear conversation well

The course was very good. I particularly love the prawns and the potato bread. The mushroom with the broth was executed perfectly!  The chairs at the basement was uncomfortable and the room was a bit warm. Service was better when another senior staff took over the table.

Visited in Jul 2023

The last time I had visited Rhubarb was 4-5 years ago. So a revisit was a long time coming. Good food and great service as always. There are 3 options/dining experiences you can choose from. I went for the most comprehensive one - 3 starters, 1 main with chef’s premium ingredient and 1 dessert.

While I can see how Rhubarb has been able to maintain its 1 star for so many years, I struggled a bit to find some key differentiating factor versus other French contemporary Michelin places. Good food nonetheless.

Service was really good. The dishes kept coming fast and I was done with my entire dinner in an hour.

All in all a very good dining place. If you haven’t been there, it is definitely worth going.

The 4-course lunch Omakase was very very satisfying, with interesting notes and flavours that I’m pleasantly surprised by. I also really enjoyed my chat with Joseph as a solo diner, so that my lunch was a little livelier. I had an absolutely lovely time and would return again.

Decided to go last min as I suddenly met a long time friend. She said she didn’t want to eat something too heavy. The starters were mainly seafood and fruits, which opened up her appetite after a full day of hard stress work. The main was a tender slowed cooked beef. Dessert was a coconut sorbet I think (?). Accompanied the meal with a Riesling. We quite enjoyed the night.
Funny note, one of the appetisers is a mix of fruits and seafood, I confused the apple with an olive. The taste was good though. Please don’t change the dish because of my comment.

Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Outstanding food, worth its Michelin star. Service is friendly. The atmosphere is a little bit let down by the lighting and impersonal musical background. Overall a very nice place to have an amazing meal. Prices very reasonable.

Reviews: 

The food was really good and quite surprising. Everything was really original and tasty. Special mention for the main courses which were amazing, espacially the Mussels one. I was also quite surprised, in a good way, by the wines. The only thing I can say is that it was a little too cold in the room for me. Thank you very much for the experience.

The dining experience was very enjoyable. I thought the overall ambience and plating / presentation were 10/10. What stood out most was the hospitality. The staff noted it was my husband’s birthday and gave a little something which was thoughtful and useful - a little goodie bag comprising samplers of Irish cream, the very same bacon butter that came with the soda bread in the menu, and a useful fridge magnet with the recipe of the said bread. Such a nice way to remember the meal by!

Visited in Oct 2023 as part of the SG Restaurant Week

Good starters where my favourite was the treacle bread. The foie gras brûlée was also decent. Among the mains I really liked the beef preparation and also the fish & squid laksa. The meal rounded off with a couple of very nice dessert items. The “Irish Cloud” dessert was particularly good.

All in all, Cure is a very solid restaurant and should be on your F&B places to visit in SG.

We had the Restaurant Week lunch set. The meal was a 6 course meal with add on for an extra mains and cheese platter. You can also add on extra for wine pairing.

The appetiser consisted of 3 small snacks. The Soda Stout Treacle bread with butter was soft and served hot and the fkavours was a delicate balance of savoury and sweet.

The 2nd appetiser consisted of their rendition of Tayto, which had a potato skin with soft cheese, and captured the flavour of potato crisps.

The next appetiser was pig head cheese wrapped with cabbage. Light texture and flavour.

The main course of wagyu  beef was nicely plated, and we really like the flavours of the sauce. Beef was also perfectly cooked rare/med rare, but the portion size was a bit small.

The dessert Irish Cloud was one of the star dishes, it had a white chocolate outer shell with vanilla cream and basil sherbert. The flavours  are light and allows the ingredient flavors to blend with each bite.

Service and ambience was also good overall, small restaurant, with enough space between each table, and acoustic panels also helped dampend any noise.

The service staff was attentive and introduced each item on the menu

Excellent and innovative creations from beginning to end.

We started with the Soda, Stout and Treacle Bread.  Oh what and experience it was as it came with butter that had bacon bits and black onion powder infused in it.  The bread, served nicely warm, looked like a muffin and had great texture.

The Tayto Cheese & Onion was a tad too small, so could not taste the potato, nor cheese nor onion.

The Lovage & Jameson Soft Serve Asparagus Morel was like a tiny ice cream cone, delightful and playful.  Morels were made into a Ragu mousse and hidden deep in the cone.

A family favorite was the Salmon, Juniper & Seaweed which had Japanese influence, as salmon was cured for 3 days, then wrapped with seaweed and covered with crusty bread crumbs deep fried.  This was really a winner and we could eat 10 each, if given a choice.

Queen Scallop, Cider, Horseradish was a refreshing dish with icy yuzu taste, like a palate cleanser.

The Porridge of Sea Urchin was lovely, with generous amount of sea urchin and barley porridge covered with a beef tartare, another crowd pleaser.

The 7 Tales of the Fox & Silver Duck was a good mains.  With duck in 4 renditions, foie gras custard and green apple, chewy ball, crispy tart and duck meat with mulberries.

Childhood Memories of Peat was interesting.  Like eating charcoal.

Shanty’s Whip Citrus Custard is a fruity sweet custard.

We topped up with Tipperary Brie Cheese, Onion Eccles.  Brie was nice and Eccles was amazing!

Reviews: 

I have been in shinji two times but my previous visit was excellent! we had long omakase. the sequence were balance, materials are fresh and excellent quality of freshness. two kind of uni were also still firm (not watery). I think that would be better if some “aburi” are added, that would give some equisite medley on the whole omakase. special sake for shinji was well presented with balance, elegant body and fruity. well served by the chef that can speak little indonesian that made us even relax, the waiter is very attentive. thank you for an excellent gourmet and services.

Had the 15 course sushi and enjoyed it very much. Highlights for me were the Chutoro, Aji, Shiro ebi and Uni. The Chef and staff were very hospitable and I look forward to my next visit!

Amazing omakase experience with fresh ingredients. It's one of the best i have in singapore so far (and I've had a lot!). The uni is to die for.

That's the Japan standard you should be talking about in Singapore. The price tag matches with the quality they delivered. I have never tasted such refined Japanese foods in Singapore before. Shinji may be able to go up against some of the best sushi restaurants in Japan. Chefs are well trained and able to converse in English fluently.

They even surprised me with the desserts in the Omakase menu which usually people don't pay attention to. I would definitely visit again soon.

Inadequate service staff. Turned amazing gourmet experience into a very bad experience! I suggest everyone who goes there CHECK YOUR BILL!

I went for lunch Omakase chef special. The waitress only mentioned to me, it will be $350 and plus. I said it is ok. But she never mentioned where this plus comes from. Automatically everyone in SG would understand it as service charge.

In the end I received a bill of $400++, which got me very confused. And first waitress explained to me the price is decided by chef. Second one came to me, said, I told you, it is going to be more than $350.

Well I only said ok to $350 but not $400. On the menu it says “please specify a cap if you wish.” Instead apologies for her miss communication, she started pointing finger at me arguing it was my mistake not mentioning the cap. She told me “I SAID, it will be more than $350, everywhere in singapore it is PLUS PLUS so “A PLUS” means chef decides how much you pay.”

Whoever would go to a $350 and more lunch would never care about $50 more, however her attitude of justifying her mistake and miscommunication, push the responsibility to customer is definitely revolting.

The argument waitress had with me was ugly, not only an embarrassment to me but also an embarrassment to the chef, and to other customers who were still eating!

I left the counter to the reception with my dignity not to continue the embarrassment.

In the end the accountant charge me $350, which wasn’t the best solution. She should have removed the service charge of the waitress.

No one who goes to this kind of restaurant care about paying more, $350 or $400 aren’t much different. But it has to be properly explained, not by how much restaurant wishing to charge!

Food was great, in the end I left without chef’s gratitude. It wasn’t a complete meal, and service doesn’t qualify as Omakase.

Suggestion to the restaurant:
1. Notify customer how much more it will be, be clear in advance!
2. When the miscommunication happens, it’s definitely the waiting staff’s responsibility! Don’t blame the customer! Especially not at Sushi counter!

Price Level: 4 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax
Top-rated seafood restaurants in Singapo:
Option: 1:

Rating: 4.1
Reviews: 

Was hosted by a generous friend as we had colleagues from overseas visiting us. What an exceptional feast! Our guests were very impressed by the size and freshness of the crabs. They also enjoyed the prawns.

I personally loved the herbal soup that the prawns came in. I also ladled the yummy gravy from the chilli crab dish into my fried rice and polished off 2 bowls in that fashion.

There was also a particularly yummy toufu & vegetable dish that I enjoyed. I would certainly order that again.

Whilst we were there I ran into other friends who were also hosting their overseas visitors so I guess this is the place to be in these situations. A really big draw is the wonderful view right outside the restaurant and opportunity to walk along One Fullerton after the heavy meal!

To  Ms  May
The taste was good, but the male staff was the worst. Don't talk about JCB behind your back among floor staff. They will serve you beer without permission, and if you ask for extra towels, it will cost you $1.60, but is that okay? Please feel free to make fun of me.

Actually it was my third or fourth time visit . Perfect location, fresh seafood and great service . We visited for company dinner we took one of our colleagues from Japan during their short business trip. They were all happy and we enjoyed a lot . Since the place is big, I noticed some service (like beverage service) were little slow however they tried and gave us great services from bottom of their heart . Especially one of the service staff Ms. WanYi helped us a lot. She tried her best whenever  we needed their assistance and I liked her sincere warm service . Thank you all team and Ms.WanYi for your great service and I’ll see you again.

This was my first experience with Chilli crab and black pepper crab. Overall food was good, service, atmosphere, and location are outstanding.  Very busy and popular area, great photo opportunities.  Crab was good, we had 2 very large crabs, and side dishes were all good.

Very good dishes and good services.  Pretty good Chili Crab and Black pepper crab.  Fried rice noodles are pretty good also.  View of the Sands Hotel and casino across the bay is beautiful.


Option: 2:

Crab fried rice is soooo good! For cajun flavoured crab combo, never expect the spicy version to be so spicy. I personally feel less spicy will be good enough. Brought my own cake, thanks for the decoration, very cute.

This was highly recommended by a local as they offer a good variety of shellfish dishes. We ordered black pepper crab, crab cakes, chili crab with rice cakes, fried mushroom, and my personal favourite the rice with lobster bisque. It was a lovely take on Chinese congee but westernized. We ordered way too much food in advance and it will be better for the restaurant to advice if the food is too much for 7 pax proactively vs us over ordering. Overall the team had fun indulging the food.

Dine for 3 pax for dinner. Ordered the mixed w crab, prawns, oyster, etc. in cajun sauce, too spicy.  We also add the crispy octopus (not crispy at all). Bill close to $150 w UOB card we got $20 discount. Overall, it's a good place if your craving for crab & seafood.

We went here after getting the 50% off from Chope. The prices here are expensive so worth trying if got discount 'coz they serve really nice bag of seafood. The bag is good for 2-3 pax and have a lot of ingredients. The sauce or seasoning was right on spicy and very flavorful. Really enjoyed eating with the hand to licking the sauce off you fingers. It was so good.

The staff are also very friendly and attentive. They give you utensils if you need them while eating.

This is an interesting concept of an American seafood joint but with a Singaporean twist. The flavours are unique to Singapore with local favourites like chilli crab blended into traditionally American dishes. A great place for sharing and the food is quite good as well.


Option: 3:
Name: Greenwood Fish Market @Bukit Timah

Phone: 6467 4950

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

The chargrilled fish dishes are quite nice.
The calamari was great as well. Good sauces.
The individual fish plates looked like it was more worth it than the whole fish when we ordered which came in this long wooden serving board.

We went on a weekend and it was very busy.
If you're looking for a romantic cozy intimate vibe, this is not it. We saw a few families with kids, people celebrating birthdays, etc.
Vibe is casual and crowded.
Staff were friendly.

A busy restaurant. Celebrated my birthday with friends. Chose this place cos I remembered their food never disappoint. Glad that this time round, my friends enjoyed the food as much as I do. Ordered the seafood platter, oyster, pasta and fish and chip. Every dish was well executed and seasoned. Hope to be back again with my family

This could be my new favourite place to eat seafood. Highly recommend the chargrilled salmon done medium rare. But don't skip on the Mediterranean squid too. Fish and chips was good but nothing too special. But surprisingly the Angus burger was quite enjoyable too. Overall this place is really good but service can be a little slow. But when the food is so good I don't really care about that. When I was eating I was already thinking about the next time Ill be back.

Fresh seafood with friendly and knowledgeable service staff. It’s our first time here and we were unsure what to order, but Robin was very helpful and informed us of a few items for us to consider. We ordered the Madai fillet with a pepper sauce and Beef. Fish had a delicious, flaky tender flesh and came in a good portion size. Beef had an uneven cook throughout but still rather enjoyable, retaining the juicy and succulent meat.

We were given a cozy booth table and spend a lovely evening chatting. The service staff was very courteous. The place does feel a little smoky and could do with some better ventilation but still would recommend.

Really long queue so expect a waiting time, loved that you can pick almost any fish available and style to cook it in, lots of choices for the fish and oyster. I went for fish and chips, calamari and fresh oyster, all ingredients was crazy fresh, however wished the fish and chip was a little more crispy. My favourite dish was the calamari

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

The food and service are excellent with every visit. The service staff are friendly, polite and efficient. It was such a delight to be looked after by Joyce who showed a lot of passion.

The crispy roasted chicken had the crispiest and thinnest skin you could get. The XO asparagus was tender and fragrant. Drunken prawns were fresh. The stock was a tad salty though. Of course one must order the signature Golden Sauce Crab. This dish is always memorable.

For dessert the coconut pudding with ice cream is a must. A lovely light dessert to end a scrumptious meal.

I would recommend and return.

It's nice to have a seafood restaurant at the west side of Singapore and don't need to travel to the east just to have seafood.

The food was very good and we all enjoyed it very much. The pork ribs was very tender and it's a recommended dish. We had the dungeness crab and the meat was firm. Drunken prawns is always a must to order when we are there. Definitely no regrets to the food that we ordered. Not to mention, service was good and thank you!

Enjoyable dining experience. Food is fresh and seasoned well. We loved the Salted egg Eggplant, especially the salted egg sauce (thick and flavourful, felt like you’re slapped with salted egg in all directions). Prawns were very fresh and juicy. Crabs were well-seasoned. We loved both the black pepper and golden sauce seasonings. The Eefu noodles was just average. Coconut pudding dessert was the best way to end the meal 😋

My mum told me this stall have been here for many years. The foods are good, seafood taste nice and fresh too. The menu show a lot of variety and mostly in text, so to prepare to read through the menu as the prices are a bit on high side. However the portion are big and service are excellent. The waiter Mr Bon from Philippines can speak many dialects and madarine. The waiter and waitress serve us very well. The crabs is the star so prepare to pay for it. The drinks are expensive too.

Best place for live seafood. Live tanks is always full and many choices. Reasonable price and friendly services. Remember to book on weekends and festive periods. Especially Remember to order gaint crabs in advance. The big sizes always sold out fast.

Reviews: 

Decided to come here based on the location to the hotel so we were pleasantly surprised. The Boiler is definitely worth its salt and deserving of its accolades. Served by the friendly Gabrielle, she offered great advice on the menu without being pushy. She was thoughtful, opportunistically entertaining our little one whilst we devoured our meal. We went for the duo combo with the raging hot sauce and good old fish and chips for the little one. The aroma in the restaurant is the first tell tale that the food is going to be good and it definitely delivered! Was cooked perfectly and delicious! Will definitely be back before the holiday is over👌

Amazing service by Lee for my husband’s birthday, we even got a free Boston lobster which is a great addition! Love the bottomless ice lemon tea too which Lee very nicely refilled promptly for us. Lee made our dinner so much more enjoyable, he also offered to help us take photos when he saw us struggling to take one. Thanks for the amazing time!

There is a reason this place is so highly rated. The seafood was so fresh and flavourful, I just wish I could have tried more. Loved the clams especially but I should have gone for the spicy sauce!

Simply a must try but I would add that they should add potatoes to the boil too!

We just had our family birthday dinner at The Boiler Esplanade Restaurant, and I can't say enough good things about it. Their crab seafood is mouthwatering - fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. What's more, during your birthday month, they offer a complimentary lobster, which was an unexpected and delightful surprise.

The icing on the cake was the friendly service. The staff made us feel right at home, and their recommendations were spot on.

Overall, The Boiler Restaurant is a gem. If you're a seafood lover and want a fantastic dining experience with a bonus lobster during your birthday month, this place is a must-visit. I'll definitely be back!

Celebrated my friend’s birthday at The Boiler @ Esplanade Mall, and they gave us an amazing experience as first time customers.

We were welcomed by friendly staff and assisted us immediately to our table. Shout out to KJ Lee for providing an excellent service from start to finish. And to David too for surprising our friend with a birthday Oreo Cheesecake.

The highlight of our visit was of course their Bombdiggity Bag which had prawns, mussels, clams, smoked sausages, sweet pearl corns and buns. We also added Boston Lobster for an extra boost. I also wanted to emphasize how crazily good their sauce was.

Who wouldn’t come back in this place with good staff and people? Hope to visit this place again sooooon!

Will definitely come back again. Worth the price! 2 crabs for $38. Huge portion, just nice for 2 people. We also ordered the fried squid, $14 for small size. Be careful not to enter the wrong one, there's a seafood restaurant with the same advertising as this place!

Reasonable tze char prices at comfortable setting. Also have appropriate posters on wall, very suitable for birthday dinners with family. More options for crabs if you are in bigger group. Crab meat is fresh and sweet, liked all the dishes that we ordered, even forgotten to take 2 more photos for another 2 dishes cos busy eating 🤭Thanks the patient staff for help clearing tables and making space for birthday 🎂

The crabs were quite value for money but the meat could have been better. The salted egg gravy was too sweet. Chilli sauce was too spicy. Guinness pork ribs were too small in portion, too sweet and fatty. Salad ice plant was rather pricey. Service was good though.

Really really well-priced crabs and yummy tze char dishes!

The chilli crab wasn't too sweet which I liked and the vermicelli version soaked up the crab juices well though it may come off slightly bland to some, but nothing a little chilli can't rectify

Special mention for the guinness pork which I had zero expectations for as I usually don't like proteins tossed in sauce but their pork has a 1:1 ratio of meat and fat which was right up my alley

Recommend making a reservation before heading down as the space is small!

Crabs are fresh and delicious! We ordered all flavours except chilli and everything was equally delicious! Plus the best fried aubergine ive ever had! Wanna go back like right now!

Reviews: 

We ordered the Alaskan king crab for 4 persons cooked in their famous black pepper style. The food overall was good and it came out fast with the exception of the last main dish- Irish roast duck- After waiting a long time we asked about it and it was discovered our duck was served to another table. It was reordered again for us.
The black pepper flavour was too much black pepper and spicy for my taste. It was like too much black pepper on your food. Perhaps it would be more balanced if the crab was served with the fried rice instead of after.
Portions are fairly small.
It should be noted that at the restaurant, you are charged for the peanuts (tidbits on the bill) given to you upon seating and also for cold tap water.
It seems to be a common occurrence to be charged for tap after at restaurants in Singapore

have been coming here since i was a kid. the service is great. recommend the white
pepper crab and the dong bo pork ribs. (you must specifically ask for the ribs as it’s not on the menu).
it can smell quite fishy sitting near the live seafood but it’s all part of the experience, seeing alaskan crabs try to climb their way out 🤣
the garlic broccoli dish was $30 for one floret, please have your fill of veg before coming..

not great for wheelchair users. so many steps and sharp corners. service to serve food is quick. ordered pepper and curry crab. they are okay. no depth in the sauce. the rest are nice.

Expatriates hotspot. Atmospheric location. Food is very tasty but also only for people with deep pockets. Multiple options for crab types and flavours. The chili crabs that I ordered come with huge arms. Their mango dessert is great too. Reservations strongly recommended, touristy restaurant too. Parking is free but limited during peak hours.

We had the pepper crab and the spicy chili shrimp, some green vegetables and fried rice and a bottle of sake.

THE PERFECT MEAL！

Loved the room, with a whole wall of aquariums full of fresh crabs and lobsters.

I’ll go back for sure!

Reviews: 

I wasn’t very pleased with the food today. But I am glad the service and service recovery were pretty commendable.

We booked a private room today for a small event.
Ordered 4 crabs with 3 ways of cooking styles.
The chili crab was great as usual.
Salted egg crabs were less tasty and underwhelming
The steamed crab was not fresh and smelled bit stale. Told the service staff and he brought it back to the chef and was told it’s the wine used. I eaten this before and I am sure the stale smell is definitely not because of the wine. It’s just not fresh. I don’t pay $100+ for a crab with a funny taste and risk food poisoning my guests. Was given a refund for that item immediately which is a great way out of the unhappy experience.

Nonetheless, the coffee pork ribs were very delicious.
Steamed razor clams were awesome too.
The lamb ribs were tender and taste good.

Asparagus with scallops and the signature spinach tofu were pretty blend and so so.

I think the chefs today are not in their usual standards.

Amazing dinner here. Always consistent quality of the crab. They took extra time to ensure that the fish was presented fully. Innovative yam scallop rings. Overall nice dinner with birthday celebration. Walked in.

Excellent service and food. Must order chilli and black pepper crabs. This outlet never fail to impress, the quality has been consistently top tier. Wang Li Xin has been really attentive - my mum requested for quieter corner table instead of at the entrance, and she immediately change it for us.

The seafood here is really fresh and juicy. Had their famous crabs. This time we had the salted egg ones. Ordered the set for 2. Value for money. Service is good also.

Dim sum is also good.

Good to make a reservation as it gets really crowded on weekends.

Great dining experience at Jumbo Ion tonight! From the reservation process to being seated on time, from providing food recommendation to taking multiple group photos for us, the entire team at Jumbo Ion deserves credit for an amazing birthday celebration.

Of course, the main thing: Delicious seafood. And there is a good discount for the Alaskan crab.

Grateful for the help of their manager Lai Yee, who was so accommodating since there was an elderly in our party who’s in a wheelchair.

Very very pleased with the whole dining experience. Thank you!

Reviews: 

We found ourselves in Chinatown and had to try the famous Singapore Chilli Crab 🦀 We ordered 2 portions which was enough for 6 people (crabs were huge 🤩) along with some veggies, prawns and fried rice.
The crab wasn’t very chilli in my opinion, but it was pretty tasty. The meat was really fresh and the food was served very quickly.
Everything is expensive in Singapore, so I’m not even going to comment on that 😂 but definitely worth the experience!

Well, you can do 2 things here, be a tourist and enjoy the food, or be a local and enjoy the food. I'm doing the local / expat thing, and if you look through the higher pricing and the fact that it's a touristy palce, you will enjoy the vibe and the good food. Some of the staff could be a bit more friendly and less pushy, but we like coming here. Again we like the food and it's just a matter of attitude. We are regulars and keep coming back.

Our favorite restaurant in Chinatown, we always feel welcome here and they even remember what we like to drink or eat.
Affordable prices for drinks, food prices increased considerably in our opinion, since we’ve been patronizing this place for almost 5 years already, we like the cereal prawns, sweet&sour seabass and fried rice with egg.

During covid times it was visited for locals mostly, but now it’s packed with tourists, not that I complain, but don’t let that fool you, locals come here too for the food.
Thank you so much for the great service

Very good and nice restaurant in the heart of China town a lot tourist are making a stop in this place , and three different are available to eat local food speciality

If you love sea food then this is the best place to eat and enjoy drinks. So wonderful crowd, food tastes awesome and very good service.

Here to celebrate my friend’s birthday, we all first time here and the experience was great! Especially a staff name Moises, he recommends us some seafood set and even ask us if we want to take a group photo. The food is nice as well, we will definitely revisit here!

The food is great! Love the Duo seafood combo , the garlic butter with crab and every other meat is delish! I like the desert as well - ice cream with molten lava cake(warning : very sweet).
Thank you Moises and team for the experience!

I love this place and their food. The seafood is very fresh and the house sauce is simply superb. Thank you Moises and team for creating pleasant memories for us all the time.

Thank you for the surprise cake. It was such a sweet gesture and we are very grateful.

Good variety of seafood - Dungeoness crabs, squid, prawns, Boston Lobster, clams etc - all prepared and comes in a bag for communal sharing. You have gloves and aprons to dig in and get your hands dirty to enjoy your food. Birthdays get a large sharing set and get a free Lobster.

Drinks are decently priced for beers and whiskey highball.

Having dined in before was a good experience. So decide to do take away. Do note the take away option when you add 1 corn, is 1 part of a corn as show in pic. 1 x sausage you get a whole sausage.

Reviews: 

Nice vegan and vegetarian option. But the vegan food was lacking in flavor. The atmosphere is really beautiful though.  I think the first dish, the desert, and the risotto were very good! And the drinks were very special too! The people next to me had the vegetarian options and they said it was really good. I love the experience though and if you want to impress you vegan friends I would still bring them here just for the view and service.

Joie is an absolute gem for vegetarian dining in Singapore! The elegant ambiance, coupled with impeccable service, sets the stage for an unforgettable culinary journey. Each dish is a masterpiece, beautifully crafted with fresh, flavorful ingredients that redefine vegetarian cuisine. The creative menu offers a delightful fusion of tastes and textures, leaving me astonished with every bite. The attention to detail in presentation is exquisite, elevating the dining experience. Joie isn't just a restaurant; it's a celebration of vegetarian gastronomy, and I can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

I had a fantastic experience at Joie Vegetarian Restaurant! The Monkey Head Mushroom Steak was a true culinary delight. The flavors were exquisite, and it's clear that the chefs put a lot of thought and care into their dishes. What impressed me the most was the affordability of the 5-course meal. It's not often you find such a high-quality dining experience at such a reasonable price. The service was impeccable, and the ambiance was lovely. I can't wait to return for another delicious meal!

We dined at Joie today, July 16, 2023, and it was an outstanding experience. The service was excellent, and the food surpassed our expectations.
The attention to detail in dish presentation was evident. The staff's timing and coordination were impeccable, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The relaxed ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating added to the inviting atmosphere.
In conclusion, Joie offers an exceptional dining experience with attentive service and delicious food. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure. I can't wait to visit again.

My first time trying vegetarian fine dining, the foods were surprisingly good! The waitress , Kelly, was very professional, she explained the dishes to us and also show us the right way to enjoy the dishes. The main dishes , mushroom steak and risotto were very impressed too. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews: 

We are not vegetarian but what is not to like? This place makes eating too enjoyable. The food is very very delicious and the service staff are very very attentive. Super recommendation coming from a pure meat and seafood lover.

Petai - great sambal chili fried with a whole plate of goodness

Olive fried rice - we had two plates, one after the other, enough to justify the deliciousness of the dish

Curry 'mutton' - good curry but something seems to be lacking in the flavour

Salted egg yolk - we had two plates of this too

Glutinous yam (suan pan zi) - delicious? We had four plates of this.

It is in my personal humble opinion that you are missing out on very good food if you have not tried this as a vegetarian.

Food is OK. The grilled mala fish is good! Impressive imitation of the texture very close to the real fish version.
Satay is also nice.
The rest are so so. Kids says favourite truffle fried rice that is usually fragrant at other places has no truffle taste. Frankly, I prefer the high tea at their other outlet.

Very delicious meal here! Portion is big price is reasonable. The fish is a must have! Very tasty 😋 I’m a meat lover and I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this vegetarian restaurant. Good job to the chef! Staff was attentive.

Celebrated our friend's birthday dinner at Lotus. It was indeed a great choice we've made and no regrets too. Food was well prepared and delicious. Atmosphere was chill and clean. Will come back again.

We came just to try the Grilled "Fish" and we were not disappointed albeit the flavour we chose does not resemble much of the original 烤鱼. It was still tasty and we would want to return to try the other flavours. The other dishes were also pretty good. The tofu box was really interesting with some diced mushrooms that provide an unusual taste and texture. The spinach in superior broth was done really nicely it tasted so premium. Tau Kwa Goreng was perfectly fried but a little spicy for me.

We were seated near a cabinet and discard trolley where staff kept walking to & fro, sometimes talking over our heads as they reach for stuff. Pretty unpleasant and lack of service etiquette.

Reviews: 

Price: $6.54 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was very crispy, savoury and slightly sour.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, savoury, hearty and had a good lentil taste.

Chutney: 5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, sweet and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and spicy.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($4.16) was fragrant from the spices used and warm and comforting to drink.

There was a little waiting time but it was definitely worth the wait as the plain thosai was very delicious. From the thosai to the sambar and the two different chutney. Service team were really responsive to requests and new orders.

The place was brightly lit and a cozy place to have your Indian vegetarian classic as well as your familiar Singaporean dishes with a vegetarian twist.

Perfect if you visit with friends/family as you can order various things from the menu and share them together. Our favorites are the biryani and butter naan. Read many reviews saying that the carrot cake is a must try but it didn’t really suit our palettes. The samosas are tasty but not very special. The lychee drink is refreshing, really helps after a long walk exploring the city. Would definitely visit again on our next trip to SG.

The first time I went there, I had the vegetable briyani, Gobi 65, Aloo Gobi and mango lassi. The food was good and the lassi was awesome, don’t fade the lassi.

The second time that I went there, I had the fried carrot cake, murtabak and Gobi Manchurian and I’ll say to skip the Gobi Manchurian as the cauliflower was almost non-existent and I was just eating a lot of batter. The fried carrot cake is decent for an vegan take as it is not commonly available and the murtabak is alright but can be skipped.

Food was really nice. Enjoyed the dishes! The service can be improved, we were more or less asked to leave the moment we finished our food. We understand that they have limited seating and a queue but just felt rushed.

Good variety on the menu but I do find it moderately highly priced. Service was typical yet they really do have interesting things on the menu with Chinese and muslim influence. It has its own character but I do very much prefer pure Indian cuisine. It’s nice for the occasional change. Location was good, walking distance to the Little India train station and restaurant is clean and cool with air conditioning.

Food is good, Service is good too. A little improvement can be done in the seating area and hygienic. They could have much better crowd comming in with that.

Visited Anand Bhavan, opposite to Mustaffa after a long time few years later. I always recommend to visit and try their menu. This is Indian Vegetarian Resturant, better to try their tiffins items rather than rice items. Service will be quick, though there was a huge rush, served within 10 mins. Tired their Masala Rava Dosa, Mini Sambar Idly, Sambar Vada, Onion Uttappam and Poori set, and all
Of them tasted good. Sambar have lot of Brinjals only instead they can add lot of other vegetables also.

Wrong decision to visit this place and worst was to ask for take away. Just wanted to get idly set take away and thought that it would be fast. But unfortunately, waited for about 30 minutes after payment was made. The place has kitchen next to the washroom entrance and it was smelly and very unpleasant to stand there to wait for my order to be delivered to me. Overall, not very clean place to visit. Observed many foreigners there who might be looking for only vegetarian food and had limited choice rather to be there. I am sure it could be managed better in terms of cleanliness, service, order management for simple stuff. However, I was there after many years and may take me another few years to step in again.

Price: $3.60 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was savoury, crispy, soft and had a good sour flavour.

Sambar: 4.5/5
Sambar was savoury, flavourful, a little sweet from the vegetables and familiar tasting.

Chutney: 5/5
The orange chutney was flavourful, tomatoey and a little spicy. The white chutney was quite gingery and sweet from the coconut. The brown chutney tasted peanuty, savoury and was rather spicy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($2.60) was fragrant, warm and comforting but could use more spices.

Service was fast and I received my thosai within 5 minutes. It will be quicker to get your drinks directly from Counter 1 at the restaurant as they seem slightly short-handed in the drinks area. The lady managing counter 1 is really nice and makes your drinks after seeing your receipt. I saw this as a good thing since I could decide when I wanted to have my masala tea instead of having it served while I was having my thosai.

The place was air conditioned and the place can get crowded and is a really bustling place near lunch time.

All in all, I enjoyed my brunch of thosai and masala tea at Ananda Bhavan Restaurant (Vegetarian). :)

One of the popular South Indian breakfast places of Singapore. The food preparation is Tamil style and quantity is apt.

Overall the taste, quality and hygiene was good and rates were genuine.

The presentation of the set meal is particularly exquisite and delicious. It shows the chef's care and seriousness, and the restaurant environment is also very comfortable. The waiters are also very polite. So we enjoyed it during our meal.👍🏻

First time here for the alacarte lunch buffet and was really impressed. Staff were friendly and very attentive (especially Lily, 阿宝, and a third guy who served us - didn’t catch his name), and food was of excellent quality, better than most other vegetarian places we have visited. Dimsum offerings are also unique. Will definitely come back again!

This is my first time to having the vegetarian. I didn’t expect that vegetarian food would be so delicious and special. The baked vegetarian fish and fire cracker monkey head mushrooms are amazing! Every dish is very delicious, the waiters are also very kind and the service is attentive. I will definitely come again next time👍

Nice and chill place which is very suitable for family reunion or holiday celebrations!

All the dishes here are flavorful and delicate, with amazing creativity!

Especially, the hospitable staff here made our dining experience enjoyable!

My favorite vegetarian restaurant. We went there for lunch. The staffs are friendly. All the dishes were beautiful presented. Recommend braised wild bamboo pith in collagen soup and homemade edamame bean curd topped with fresh mushroom. Very delicious.

The food was not bad - a great vegetarian zi char style.

The real disappointment was having made a reservation via Google online, requested for the laksa hotpot and it got missed.
Despite having an email reply that the booking was noted.

Upon reaching the venue, they missed both our reservation and the request for laksa hotpot - it was sold out by dinner time.

Hence, we were unable to get this for our vegetarian friend whom is here in sg for a night, and had wanted to try this.

Table of 12 pax, 8 dishes, total spending sgd300

Pumpkin butter sauce fried abalone mushroom is the best! Crispy honey roasted pork is unique. Tomato sliced dish soup base is not thick, we prefer the original soup base.

Curry fish taste abit sour, but the chef claimed that is normal.

Delicious vegetarian hotpot. As a hotpot lover, this really hit the spot. The laksa broth was flavourful and full of body. They are very generous with the ingredients for the hotpot, feel that with side dishes it could easily feed a family of four. With the visit. Make advance reservations to avoid waiting for a table.

Frequent goer of this place and food has always been up to standard. though not as affordable as in the past, but worth it for the taste. Only drawback is the service and attitude of the floor staff. totally unpleasant service received hence the review

Love their Ah Ma' Fish Head Charcoal Hotpot! Rich and and slurp-worthly, can't get enough of it.

And their Triple Mushroom with Broccoli is a must-try! It is well seasoned and fry to perfection. Soda drinks and juice are delightfully refreshing, too pretty to miss.

Their piping hot Ee-Fu Noodles are so good that my little ones kept asking for more! You got to try their Vegetarian Roast Duck too. It is handmade from scratch with Tofu Skin and Braised Mushroom, love the combi!!

A nice and interesting vegetarian restaurant. They have a good variety of different dishes to choose from, either as individual portion or meant to share. The dishes that we ordered tasted good. Also they have some selection of interesting beverages. There are also a variety of tea to choose from. Overall, a good place for a meal if you are vegetarian or want to eat vegetarian food.

Friendly services provided by the staff.The staff were accomodating to our seat and food request. They also offered to help us take a group photo. There are a wide range of food available on the menu. When we were undecidable on the pizza flavours, the staff recommended two of their most popular flavours - BBQ pizza and pesto pizza. We thoroughly enjoyed both pizzas. Overall, the food was delicious even for some of us who are non-vegetarians. Highly recommend iVegan!

I had few different mains here from asian to western.

I would recommend their black bean burger. The house made patty goes very well with the rest of the ingredients. See picture. The sauce pairs well too. The sweet potato fries are seasoned  just right, not too heavy. Salad refreshes the palette. I also tried their bbq mushroom sandwich with the same sides and different sauce (mayo). It was decent.

For the guacamole sushi, it is unique and worth a try.

For the Asian mains, I have tried rice and noodles for the set lunch. I feel they are on the bland side. However, you can request to add more salt and pepper on your order. The peach gum dessert is also very less sweet and taste very healthy.

The staff is very friendly. Sometimes, complimentary appetizer would be served. Expect to spend close to 20 dollars for a meal here.

Great flavours, great aesthetics and vibes, great service! Staff kindly gave us a heads up that their food is towards the lighter side but all the dishes we ordered turned out so flavourful and satisfying hmm so didn’t face the issue of food being bland at all. Service was great too!

We tried the salad, mushroom soup, sushi and grilled broccoli/mushrooms. All were served promptly and were delicious. Wasn’t too difficult getting a table on weekend dinner.

Reviews: 

What a hidden gem! Very homely and cosy environment with great food!
We enjoyed every dish and the innovation behind each of them. Unique dishes not seen elsewhere and the set meal allowed us to have a taste of all the great dishes. Most dishes were made from scratch, even the ikan bilis! All made with minimal or no seasoning and all natural ingredients. Yum! 😍
Very worth it and I'll definitely be back again!

Great for celebrations. Remember to make a reservation. We were a group of 11 people and service was great. They made special provisions for parking because we had a family member with mobility issues. We also had a birthday cake and celebration.

Foodwise, in my opinion 佛有缘 serves the most unique vegetarian cusine in Singapore. The best is still Miao Yi (for personal reasons) but it closed down 😢 Forget about the 自在 "empire", Shu and coffee shop zizar, it's always the same old thing.

We had the cold dish with "ice vegetable" salad, which is really good. The yuzu monkey head mushroom is always a hit. The sugarcane flower is unique. And last and not the least, the humble bee hoon - is always a family favourite.

A Delightful Vegetarian Culinary Journey at Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant

Apart from the outstanding food, the service at Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant was impeccable. The staff members were friendly, attentive, and eager to cater to our needs, making us feel welcomed and valued throughout our dining experience.

Overall, Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant has truly impressed us with their diverse and mouthwatering selection of dishes. Whether you’re a vegetarian or simply looking to explore plant-based alternatives, this restaurant is an absolute gem. We highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience with top-notch vegetarian cuisine.

The delicate strands of noodles were expertly stir-fried with an assortment of fresh vegetables, creating a harmonious medley of taste and aroma.

The Rendang was a true masterpiece. The rich and aromatic coconut-based curry was impeccably spiced, resulting in a tantalizing symphony of flavors.

One of the highlights of our meal was the Vegetarian Shark’s Fin Soup. It was a delightful surprise to find a cruelty-free alternative that retained the essence and texture of the traditional dish.

The Sweet & Sour dish was a perfect balance of tanginess and sweetness, complemented by succulent mushroom and an assortment of colorful bell peppers and pineapples.

To end our meal on a sweet note, we indulged in the Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts. The smooth and velvety yam paste was flawlessly cooked and paired beautifully with the tender gingko nuts

Old school vegetarian restaurants good not too salty good service. Friendly staff. Must try for old school vegetarian restaurants. They have moved a few times already hopefully they can stay here. Finally found them again. I have been eating at this restaurant over 15 years now...still as good as the first time I tried....

I'm super glad that we have a Chinese vegetarian in Desker Road, stone throwaway from Mustafa. Food was authentic and feeling good old days. Fantastic and thank you for opening an outlet in Little India.

Reviews: 

Vegetarian is a good place for vegetarians for an experience. The variety of food is very good, portion is decent and price is awesome. The sucklings pig is crispy and soft on the inside. The pineapple fried rice is fluffy and flavourful. There is 3 level in the building and plenty of food available. The toilet is clean. The staff is professional and good. The restaurant is also well decorative

A great selection of delicious vegan foods 😋. Everything is plant based, with the exception of entries clearly marked as containing dairy and / or honey, most of which can be made vegan per request. Massive menu of delightful dishes.
Easy to find - right next to the Budda Tooth Relic Temple.
Reservations are recommended

This is a pure vegetarian Chinese restaurant close to Buddha temple in Chinatown. For Indians, this is 'Jain vegetarian' - no onion, no garlic. The food was very tasty. Ben (présume he is the owner) was very friendly. The warmth of the service added to the great experience. Though the menu doesn't look like a vegetarian one, these are all mock-meat..made from tofu. A nice place for vegetarians to get an authentic taste of Chinese food.

Found this restaurant through Google map/reviews & decided have our dinner here. For 6 of us (1 kid), this consider reasonable price and food taste not bad to try. It is within walking distance to/from Chinatown station. Parking wise also very convenient.

A great survivor of the pandemic unlike it's contemporary Miao Yi at nearby People's Park Centre 😢. We are grateful that we still have a place for restaurant standard Chinese vegetarian cuisine. The Ee Fu noodles has a good balance of noodles and vegetables.

Surprisingly, some dishes aren't that expensive, with the mock meat and tofu dishes going for $12 for the small version. You might find some neighborhood vegetarian stalls at coffeeshop to be slightly more expensive! 😱 My only complaint is that a bowl of plain rice is $1.20 🫨 Also note that the resto is on the 2nd floor and might be challenging for elderly or mobility impaired to climb.

A nice place for a quiet, even slightly above budget meal. And the place to bring your friends and family for a good old vegetarian splurge. Either way, bon appetit!

Comforting and delightful korean cuisine that is vegan and vegetarian friendly. Love most of the dishes I tried in my multiple visits here. Highly recommended. There were alot of insects in the restaurant on the day of my visit but it could be because of the rain.

Ordered via grab food. The kimchi jiggae healed my flu. The bulgogi fries were addictive.  The tteokbokki had the perfect chew.  Can't wait to actually eat at the restaurant to have a full experience.

I enjoyed my dish Army Stew which as you can see from the photo was bubbling away for minutes. My wife was rather underwhelmed by her dish though unfortunately.
The Kimchi Jeon (pancakes) were nice enough though not better than Indian flavoured breads/uttapam in that the flavour was not as storied/flavourful as we expected.
Staff were very nice and I'm sure if we had visited it when busier then we would have probably enjoyed it more. Their sister branch we happened to pass one evening and had a completely different feel, more intimate and cosy so we may try that another time. Very nice man on the reception.

The rare place that my daughter who is a vegan to enjoy Korean food. Surprisingly it's quite good even for a non-vegetarian like me.

Exceptional Korean food at a decent price.

Food is excellent & service is prompt. Tofu soup is delicious and flavourful, with the ingredients generously portioned. Omelette & Kimbap are also great.

This is also one of the few Korean places I've encountered where the Kimchi pancake can be shared between 2 people, which is great if you aren't dining in a large group.

Definitely give this place a try if you get the chance! Be warned you may have to queue during lunchtime.

Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

Everything about this place is 5 stars!
The ambience is so perfect that you are at ease the moment you are inside the restaurant. Menu is designed in such a way that you can have the best vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes without feeling less about your dish. Staff is courteous and even after attending so many guests, they always find time to attend to you/your requests. The serving is very clean and within time. They have good sitting arrangements both inside and outside. Billing is fast and accurate.

I went with my partner for a date night and was quite excited to try due to the location and design of the restaurant ..but unfortunately very basic food which was presented like fine dining. The steak was served dry and raw which when we complained was taken back, warmed and served back. 18$ truffle fries were soggy and salty. We paid like 250$ for 3 dishes and dessert.

A romantic place for lovers. Surrounded by nature and good food. There's nothing to not like here.
Amidst lush greenery and pristine forest air, it's truly "Love's in the air".
You can't help falling in love after this.
Finish the meal with a kiss 💋 to seal in the memories. ❤️.
By the way, menu is also halal.. 😊

Nice halal food. The presentation was good and taste was good as well. Good atmosphere within botanical gardens. Interesting drinks with good choices but no alcohol. I had wagyu steak and it was well prepared.

The place is great. Not noisy on a weekday. Staff were excellent. Food options was good. Pricing felts a little on the high side. Restaurant has kids menu option - one of the pasta choice didnt taste great. Serving portion is good.

It was a work dinner where we pre ordered the items of the set menus. I had the Wagyu rump steak which was really good, no gamey taste and very juicy. Dessert was Valrhona chocolate tart which was so sinfully good, very chocolatey. The Halia also served complimentary matcha and banana chocolate macaroons.

The place was very nice, covered with greenery.
Service was great, staffs were attentive and food was served timely spaced out.
Not a place that’s very accessible unless you drive or take a hired ride. If you don’t drive, it’s a little hard to get a ride out.

We really enjoyed having our meal here as the view was fantastic. We went at 6.30pm and managed to enjoy the sunset. Food is reasonably priced considering the service and atmosphere. We were also given a complimentary slice of cake as it was my partner’s birthday.

Great ambience & food. Celebrated my mum’s birthday here. We all loved the food. The beef cheek was really tender and mash was really creamy. The lobster was cooked really nicely. Even the birthday cake served on the house was good 😋 it was a really decadent and rich chocolate cake.

You could even purchase add-on cable car rides at the restaurant for just $5 per head.

REALLY NICE MEAL OUT

Popped into Dusk for dinner with a reservation. The highlight was the service we received, cordial and attentive! The food was simple but well done, but the cocktail mixes 🍹 and beer options 🍺 weren’t very impressive. Being said that, Dusk offered us such brilliant views, beautifully appointed and had an astonishing view of the city. Normally views like that carry a serious price tag, but to our surprise it’s surprisingly affordable here, and both food and drinks were well priced. Thumbs up!

Visited this place with 4 other friends last evening, and we managed to catch the sunset there! The view was amazing and beautiful!

The restaurant atmosphere was quite zen and chill when the sun is still up, and becomes romantic when the sun goes down. Haha! Quite a good environment for dates and/or hanging out with friends.

Most of the food is deliciously yummy, especially their meat items. We ordered the following:
- 3 sharing platters (1 beef, 1 lamb, 1 pork)
- 2 mains (prawn pasta and fish&chips)
- 1 sides (tomato meatballs)

I feel that everything's tasted good but some of my friends felt that the pasta wasn't up to their standards. Oh well~ to each of its own... I highly recommend the beef and lamb sharing platters and the meatballs!

As for the drinks, most of them are quite common like anywhere else but at affordable prices! There are a few unique drinks but weren't available last evening. 😔

Love the atmosphere and vibe. Will definitely visit this place again when there's occassions to celebrate. 😄

FYI, the restaurant is an outdoor one and there's only fans around.

By chance we booked this place for 50th birthday. Stunning views with fantastic service by Zhan Xian and David. The food was excellent. We had wings, calamari, truffle fries and lamb rack portion for 4 pax was big. A great place to hang out for drinks. Complimentary valet parking.

Nuff said on the food quality. No doubt one of the 5 star deserving restaurant in service and food quality along Fullerton Bay. 👍🏼

What I would like to highlight is the restaurant receptiveness welcoming children and making them comfortable. My boys enjoyed the lunch service today.

Service team has been attentive and especially in the case for my wife whom is expecting, we made request if other menu or ingredients can be accommodated. Patience and a listening ear is what we have been greeted with. Upon hearing us, the menu was changed and adjusted as accordingly.

Well done team. 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Came here to celebrate my belated birthday on the 13th November dinner time. I must say it was a great experience! The food we ordered are all delightful and I was made aware that the our meal was personally prepared by their Chef De Cuisine Alessandro Giusetti which made it even more special! Shoutout to this gentleman who was keeping an eye on our table most of the times specially when we need someone to take a photo for us! 🤭 Will definitely consider coming back here on our next special occasion. 🌟

Came here for a birthday celebration / date night and it is exactly the correct place to be at. Good vibes, nice view, decent food. The lady that served us was also very enthusiastic when she brought us the birthday cake! However, we did not get the risotto table service as mentioned by others, was still looking forward to that. But overall, a really nice place!

Had a relaxing Sunday brunch. Menu was well thought out that catered to diverse taste and needs. Braised cheek and duck confit were the standout for me. Eggs benedict was nicely presented too. Pasta portions were slightly bigger so best to order to share. I gave the dessert a miss as I was already full but family members loved the tiramisu and choc lava cake. The Chinese gentleman in spectacles who took our orders was very attentive, warm and smiley though I can't say the same for some of the other staff. Food was of pretty good standard. Priced at $88 per pax without drinks, its very reasonable value.

Great location on Marina Bay. We sat outside for a great view of the Bay at night. Inside, the air conditioning was a tad too cold.

The food was badly let down by the fact that the meat dishes were nearly cold. Everything else was fine, but timing is so important with food, the more so when you're paying a lot of money.

I had the lamb rack and my partner had a ribeye 🥩, as I mentioned, both were cold. The vegetable sides (asparagus and   creamy potato) were great, as were the desserts.

Wine is expensive and the measures are miserly (150cl? Please!) So I had a cold Erdinger Weissbier instead.

Overall, not bad but expected better for the price.
