Surprisingly a very good lunch! Didn’t have expectations and was pleasantly surprised.

We had booked a table outside but the Singapore heat was too much to handle and decided to sit inside, which the staff were very kind in accommodating. Salmon was good and cooked well. The penne vodka sauce pasta was tasty and the caesar salad good as well.

Having lunch here is a great way to get views from the top of Marina Bay Sands without paying the admission fee for the deck.

We had a beautiful birthday dinner here, made better thanks to professional and friendly service, delicious Italian food, and a chill, cozy ambience.

The music can be quite upbeat that is similar to a club but softer, adding to the relaxed yet personal dining experience. Thank you to the team for a wonderful experience in the sky.

Wonderful view
So great for sunset
We were also able to catch the Super Tree Grove light show at 7:45 and then run to other side to watch the Spectra Water & Light show at 8:00

We only ate the truffle gnocchi & giant 1 pound meatball, be forewarned it is a meal all by itself.
The meat ball was great quality meat, my hubby said it was dry for his taste and the sauce saved it but I felt it was pretty juicy, so to each their own
The truffle gnocchi was absolute PERFECTION. The gnocchi was a good size and not to soft or mushy like it can get sometimes. The truffle flavor was very pronounced just the way I like itS and I particularly love that they shredded the truffle like a garnish on top rather than just one huge chunk of truffle. That way I could get a bite truffle and every single mouthful.

And at the end they surprised us with a happy anniversary cake and I have to say that cake was surprisingly good. I really enjoyed it.

Overall very good service by our waiter. We really got the pasta as we asked for. Great. Our table wasn't ready as it just started raining and everyone needed to be moved inside.
View inside not really great but of course outside. Wine was quite pricey and not really good. But if you want to be once up.. best option!

Came here for birthday celebration, and overall had a great experience! The staff and service were all great, and we got a small cake with a birthday message on it.

For food, we had the burrata, truffle fries, ravioli, big meatball, and eggplant parm. I thought the big meatball was quite yummy, but the truffle fries did not have a strong enough truffle aroma. The food we ordered was quite heavy, something to keep in mind while ordering! The 20 layer chocolate cake was enormous and can easily be shared by a few people or more. We also had some cocktails that were nice as well. I found the food quite tasty but this is a place you come to mainly for the views and atmosphere, especially if you are seated outdoors.

Found a hidden gem of a night-time hangout place to watch the English Premier League 🥰😎🤙. Go Liverpool!!! You'll Never Walk Alone! 💪💪💪😁. They serve nice finger food like curly fries, chicken wings etc. There are both alcoholic and not alcoholic drinks to choose from. Definitely a chill place to hangout with family and friends while catching soccer action! 🥰

Saw this place and the reviews was pretty good hence we decided to come here. Honestly, the food was pretty bad and very expensive! We had the curly fries, taste good but it was COLD and the potion was too small for $16. The pasta was not cold, but it didn’t taste good, we only had a few bites. The bangers and mash was nothing fancy. Drinks were fine. Then the baked potato which cost $5 before gst and service charge was so bad. It was so dry, hard and cold. The worst baked potato I ever had. I feedback to the waitress and she was stunned and just said ok. Honestly do not recommend this place at all.

Bread and Butter
Artisanal Cold Cuts
Seared Alantic Scallop
Escargot de Bourgogne
Pluma Iberico
Grilled Baby Lamb Rack
Vichyssoise
Potato Purée
Yoghurt Sorbet

The Summerhouse
📍3 Park Ln, Singapore 798387

🍜 Food wise: Overall it was a splendid experience. With the staff’s recommendation, all of the food presented was superb! My favourite was the Escargot de Bourgogne, dished on a hot Escargot plate, this wasn’t your ordinary Escargo where you eat the meat off the shell, they have made an edible shell where you can simply pop one into your mouth! With a crispy and biscuit like texture, this “shell” delivered the perfectly prepared and cooked escargo, served with Parsley butter, into the mouth. Unbelievely juicy Escargo! This might be the best one have ever eaten!

Next, for the main dish, the recommended Pluma Iberico was incredibly soft and tender, the flavour of the pork burst into the mouth! This Iberico is definitely a strong competition against the Wagyu. This goodie is also served with crunchy Brussels Sprouts, perfectly seasoned, not too salty and there wasn’t bitterness, they also presented the natural sweetness of this vegetable. And finally, the apple purée just balances the meatiness with the refreshing fruity taste!

If you would like a soup, then the Vichyssoise is definitely a die for! This is no ordinary potato soup here, this soup was fragrant, thick, and not too heavy for one person to down the bowl! Yet, this soup is also good for two to share! Try eating the bread dipped in this soup too! Having this while having the cold cuts tasted really good too!

Now, the scallops were fresh, firm, and sweet, seared perfectly, a great starter. The Baby Lamb Rack was tender, it had a nice gentle gamey taste, worth a go too!

Finally, to end off the meal, the Yoghurt Sorbet will be the best! It had a wide range of tastes in one bowl, sweet, sour, minty, and flowery. The mint jelly was fun, it wobbled, it was quite minty and it was not overly sweet. The Elderflower Sorbet melts fast, so do eat it first, try it bit by bit with the rest of the ingredients to have the best of all worlds, and finally let some melt and mix with the rest of the dessert, so good!

✨ Ambience wise: Very romantic restaurant, good for dates, anniversary dinners, and weddings!

🤵🏻 Service wise: Service was prompt, warm and welcoming. With such a spread of choices of food, the staff pointed out all the best that they offered and explained each dish with such detail, the service was definitely a 5 star.

💵 Price wise:
Artisanal Cold Cuts $35
Seared Atlantic Scallop $24
Escargot de Bourgogne $28
Pluma Iberico $48
Grilled Baby Lamb Rack $65
Vichyssoise $16
Potato Purée $16
Yoghurt Sorbet $16

I came here for dinner.  Food is good, but very pricy.  Definitely good for private and more intimate meals if you book the garden dome. There are three garden domes.

The taste of the 65’ Florentine egg and truffle was masked by the spinach, but the taste of the spinach was great.

The French onion soup was sweet and thicker which was surprising.

The wagyu striplion was done as a roast and delightful to have with some charring on the sides.

The duck confit was good and not too salty.

The sorbet was refreshing and the jelly lovely to chew on.

Creme brûlée was good as well.

Good place for more intimate moments.

We absolutely love Summerhouse for its ambience and amazing staff! We come here often as we always leave with a great experience. Special shout out to Serena, Mayer and Isaac who have been excellent in their service and always going out of the way to assist us. Highly recommended place!

Had a dinner here and the foods were great. The staffs were attentive and friendly. Ordered pork collar and black Angus rib and they were good, rib had a nice crisp outside but very tender and juicy inside. Even my very fussy daughter finished all her foods and asked for more! Will definitely come back.

Highly decorated place especially for indoor dining. Staff kindly arranged a prime spot for my reservation. Everything is prepared with thoughtfulness and fine consideration. You can ask anything u need they will be patient. Like handbag baskets and your preferences of order of food services. Everything come w perfectly timed manner, however you should not be in a rush also to enjoy a pleasantly paced brunch. Food is fantastic.

Love the atmosphere 

What an amazing place! Beautiful interiors and exterior too! Very peaceful and comfortable place to chill-out at! What a hidden gem! We were shooting portraits in the park and chanced upon this space. The staff were friendly and helpful. They gave us coupons to entice us in for a drink. We ended up having a delicious meal! Tried the laksa pasta and arrabiatta fettucine today. Will be back to try the other food next time!

Update: tried the hamburger and salmon today! Was great! Soup too!

Very nice ambience and its pet friendly.  I will like express my compliment to the supervisor Leon who have been very friendly and super attentive. As my wife dress was stained by my dog paws, he have offered wet and dry serviette to us which really amazed me on his good customer service. Keep up the good service.

Loved the food! Especially the Padaiappa rice, which was so authentic Tamil.. had a wonderful chat with the owner and he even changed the music to meet our request. Great service and thanks for making our Friday a truly enchanting experience.. will bring friends here next time!

Nice Indian bistro with good live Indian music. Even better food. Their padayapa rice is damn shiok. Their fried chicken wings too.

Visiting Singapore for a holiday and staying with my sister's family who lives there. We came here on a Saturday evening to celebrate her birthday. Her family is a regular at this place.

We certainly had a great time celebrating her birthday. The live band belting out the tamil songs were in their element and they were so gracious to take in all of the song requests coming from the patrons.

This was like an experience never before for me coming in from Chennai to have a tamil songs playing at a resto bar. We had Guinness on tap which was fine. The food orders took quite some time though and all of them were tasting good. I would definitely come back here in my next visit to Singapore as well.

Seafood platter was fine.
Worst Tiramisu I ever ate!
Ambience and music was fine

It was truly a disappointing experience... came in at 930pm, ordered 3 drinks, 1 side 2 mains. Was informed the wait is 1hr...we did agree. Drinks came with french fries. But even after 1 and half hrs, the food order has not even gone into kitchen to start prep bec there were only 2 chefs. Guests who came later got their orders? So does that mean we should come here for songs and drinks only and no food on time for hungry customers? Then customers should be notified early if this is so. We will not be patronising this place anymore.

This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟
- Presentation was really good 👍
- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

My first time dining here and the staffs here are really sweet and customer oriented. They made the dining here with my girlfriend beyond pleasant. They made small talks with you and check on you regarding the quality of the food. The food was amazing but my friend and I couldn’t finished it because we are 2 girls that over ordered. If you are going for a date, this place is extremely ideal. Will definitely be back.

Was here for a birthday celebration. Staff was very nice and provided complimentary tiramisu cake (slightly alcoholic), which tasted phenomenal. Pizza is very well balanced and does not get gelat from a few bites, while the pastas and risottos pack a good flavourful punch. In total, it was slightly pricey but overall nice place to wine and dine.

Regarding indoors seating, music is kinda loud to have a clear conversation. Place is pet friendly and there are many dogs around

Service was underwhelming for the price paid.  Not the worst. But one would expect better.

Food. so long is pizza or pasta or Italian is nice. The pork chop was soso only.  Pizza came before the starters.

Amazing food, one of the best dinners I've eaten, ever.

Both crabmeat pasta and truffle pizza were delicious and exceeded our expectations. Thin crust pizza paired with mushrooms and truffle oil, mmmm.

Our lava cake took a while as the first had an incident. That was fine. However, the second one came and it wasn't lava'ish. No chocolate flow and it was just warm which is disappointing.

Went for a drink with colleagues during happy hour 7+ pm. Love the atmosphere here as it is in Bishan Park surrounded by greenery. The restaurant is also fitted with dim light and a cozy environment.

We ordered calamari, truffles fries, and sausages. The finger food was delicious and great together with a glass of beer. The service was very fast too. Will definitely recommend this place for office workers who want time out from their busy work life, wanted to have a short drinking session, and immersed in the greenery to relax oneself.

A quiet dining place within the bishan park. Easy to park your car and short walk to the restaurant. Food were nice and a variety of wine and beer with happy hours will 8pm. A good place to chill, happy and drink.

Reviews: 

Tried out some of the suggested specialties, including their shrimp fried rice, Sichuan chili oil wanton, and sweet potato salted egg ball. Each dish delivered a unique and delightful burst of flavors.
The prawn and banana fritter boasted a crisp exterior, giving way to a delightful blend of sweet and savory flavors within.
The pastries ordered were generously filled, resulting in a burst of rich and flavorful goodness with every bite.
The Shrimp fried rice deserves a special mention as it stands out as one of the finest I've ever tasted, boasting fresh shrimp and perfectly textured rice, with each bite delivering a delightful array of flavors

What a surprise! I LOVED this restaurant. The most delicious dim sum ever!! We sat in the open area and it was really nice. We didn’t have data in our phones so we couldn’t order with the QR code but the staff gave us a sheet of paper and a pencil to order. Everything was absolutely DELICIOUS.  For fellow tourists: make sure you have cash since they don’t accept card payments (there is an ATM nearby)

The best authentic Dim Sum and Chinese food! Amazing quality, great service… yes you sit on a plastic chair and the place is not fancy… but guaranteed yummy! A must do once in Singapore 😋

Still one of my favorite dim sum joints, offering food served very quickly.
Swee Choon seems to have figured out their winning formula. Offering simple fares at reasonable pricing served very quickly. This dim sum eatery has blossomed from one small shop space to taking over the neighboring spaces for their never ending queue of customers.
We ordered quite a few dishes. Cucumber with black fungus was a surprise crowd winner, even winning over someone who does not usually enjoy cold dishes with its simple and light garlicky taste. The porridge was so so, a rather small bowl though but I wasn’t watery so you do get it chock full of ingredients. The chilli wanton was abit of a let down, as the spice level was abit meh. I loved the Kang kong stir fried with garlic. With the simple way of cooking, it brought out the freshness of the vegetables. I like the fried pork too, it was marinated just right and very tender and not over fried. The tentacles was abit over fried and was kind of like chewing on rubber.
I would definitely hands down visit Swee Choon anytime.
*good to note: I ordered a takeaway of egg tarts, char Siew puff at the outside takeaway kiosk. Waiting time was very short too, and staff ensured items were tied up properly for ease transportation back home. Egg tarts still tasted amazing when they were cold.

Came to Swee Choon's main branch twice on my most recent trip to Singapore and am very impressed.

First visit came right after I landed on a Wednesday night at around 11:30PM with no queue and easily got a table inside as they have both outdoor and indoor seatings and ordered the Sichuan Chilli Oil Wanton, Har Cheong (Rice Roll with Prawn) and Chive Pork Dumplings and service was super fast in the dishes coming immediately after my order was placed! I was very satisfied with all 3 dishes after a 7 hour plane journey.

Second visit came on a Saturday night again at around 11PM and this time had to wait a while as I had wanted to dine indoors. The staff was kind enough to give the WiFi password in order to join the queue as I had no internet access and was also able to order via. QR code which would be handy on subsequent visits. This time I tried the Har Gao, Siew Mai, Plain Chee Cheong Fun and Peking Dumplings and again was very impressed by the service, especially by the pink haired aunty who served me and of course from the food itself.

Do note that the restaurant is cash only and prices are exceptionally reasonable, regardless of the items I ordered being served as either 2 or 4 pieces.

Overall I really enjoyed both my experiences and is easily a late night restaurant that I will certainly come to when I come back to Singapore.

Sending some love from Melbourne, Australia!!

Tried the lunch set. It’s definitely good for value.
The chicken burger is single burger bun at the bottom. The bun is lightly toasted and crispy. The chicken chop is tender and the skin is removed.
The cheese on top is good. Added more flavours to the chicken chop.
The Mexican cheese pasta as side dish is decent, the boiled vegetables don’t have much taste but it’s okay.

Value for money. I like the Mexican grilled chicken that comes with cheese sauce and sliced white onions. It’s hard to find this in typical western stalls but I like this style the best.

Was here on 4th Aug 2023, around 1am after midnight.

Had the smoked duck carbonara and chargrilled chicken chop with ice lemon tea!

Ice lemon tea was sweet but more on the slightly sour side so not my thing but it may be for others.

Carbonara was creamy as well as savoury with a lot of smoked duck bits mixed in aside from the smoke duck slices seen in the picture. Chicken chop was tender and the fried rice had flavour. Both dishes had generous portions and although the food tastes generally like your average western food, giving it higher rating for the price point in par with the quality and quantity of food.

Atmosphere was chill and the customer service was warm and attentive.

Generous portion of collar pork was nicely grilled. Mashed potato tasted similar to KFC 😅. Onion served under the pork could be more cooked. Overall, it's good for the price. 👍 🆗️

You all will love this place if you enjoy chilling in a comfortable environment. It's the only place that remains open until 2/3 am.

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

Fantastic once in a lifetime experience! We had an amazing host - Bernard who shared his life story. He had an amazing voice, sounded like a radio DJ. Randy was really friendly too in guiding us to our seats. The customer service at the lounge was really warm and friendly too!

Very very unique experience and 10/10 will recommend to come to this place. The picture was taken before the dinner and the dinner was served incomplete darkness. The service is very heartwarming and very friendly.  Dining in pitch dark really gives us the perspective on how a vision disabled person experience their day to day life (just the eating part alone). I think I should not reveal too much details but rather let you experience yourself. This unique experience start from the time u step in the restaurant. Really must try!!!

Absolutely great experience. Booking with credit card is necessary. When arrived we waited at this fancy bar area where an appetiser is served. We can order bar drinks too. Lockers were provided to keep your bags, phones, watches that illuminate. Then we were taken to a second floor where the room was in complete darkness. When you can see, the sense of touch smell and taste elevates and became more sensitive. Food and wine were great just have to be careful when consuming since we can’t see. Servers are all very passionate, friendly and professional. They told us they can’t see and we are impressed by how swift and accurate they serve. They were also very engaged in conversations with us. Menu changes every two months we were told. Highly recommended!

Go on a culinary adventure, bring out your inner child, enhance and explore with your others senses. Travel a journey to 12 different exciting yummy dishes.

Tldr: Very interesting experiential concept; Recommended for the novel experience. 3 course menu for $88++ (4 dishes per course, features seafood & red meat); 2 flight wine pairing for $30, 3 flight wine pairing for $40.

Nox is an experiential dining concept where you dine in total darkness while being guided and served by visually impaired waiters. I started off at the bar area (lit up) and got the ‘Kwai Feh’ cocktail ($22) - the gin and grapefruit pairing was pleasant and refreshing. They also served a small canape of celery root puree mousse & uni in a crispy cone (included in the set course), which was light with the sea flavor of uni.

For dinner proper, we had to remove and deposit any luminescent personal items (including phones) into a locker before we were brought to the pitch dark dining hall.

Nox serves a standard 3-course meal (appetiser / main / dessert) for $88. Each course is split into 4 separate dishes, making it effectively 12 different dishes over the 3-course dinner. Wont spoil the menu by sharing the exact dishes, but there was a good mix of seafood and red meat. The food was generally tasty and of good quality, although nothing spectacular. I also topped up $40 for the 3 flight wine pairing. After the meal, the dishes were revealed back at the bar area.

It was also interesting to experience how the visually impaired waiters used tongue clicks and whistles to navigate through the dining area with trays of food and drink without running into each other or dropping things. Overall a very interesting experience; highly recommended to try.

we stumbled upon this place and decided to try out their all-day breakfast! we ordered it with scrambled eggs, english muffin and bratwurst chicken sausage. the scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection, and english muffin (which was just toast?) was toasted to a crispy exterior and a soft interior, and the sausage had a nice snap. the pasta was also cooked nicely and had a nice mushroom flavour. the whole place was very clean and the atmosphere was great. the staff were very friendly as well! make sure to check out this place if you're in the area!

Incredibly extensive menu with plenty of seating. Service is really quick and you order through a QR code so it’s convenient. There’s parallel parking along the road and parking at the malls opposite. The food was good, there’s choice between dum briyani and just briyani and this was the plain briyani, rice was flavourful and the chicken was good. Can even choose what piece of chicken you want. Overall quite nice, i would return and would want to try the other stuff on the menu.

It’s been a while since I came here and the increase in price is really steep; I no longer find it value for money. We got Plain Prata x1, Egg Prata x1, Butter Chicken x1, Garlic Naan x1, Dum Briyani x1 and Iced Teh Tarik x2 which added up to $38.80 for 2.

Prata is average but their fish curry is really diluted. Butter chicken is not bad. Garlic naan is what you would expect it to taste. The only thing worth the price is probably the Dum Briyani. Although it looked like a small portion, there was a lot of mutton buried in the rice and was really filling. The mutton was also tender with really nice gravy. Personally will not be back again.

Good place to have your Indian breakfast. Service is good during the morning.

Last I had supper here at night on weekend, they clean your table as soon as you finish your food to make way for the next diner which is understandable. So, decide if you want a place for good food or a place to hang out.

I've been using this restaurant as a JC peeps meeting base for years. Glad to see that it, together with its competition down the road, has survived the building of the MRT line. When I last went, they didn't have date milkshake. Not sure if its temporary or for good. Date milkshake is good 👍

Prata's crispy and good. Service is ok though it can be slow. But the prawn masala's a real letdown with the small size, you can see the photos of the size of the prawn, which is really the size of a shrimp. Also ordered the butter chicken, which is ok.

Services are good but dont expect restaurant type at this coffee house. Kids love to have their prata with condensed milk which they didnt charge me. Recommended Prata place for family.

Came back to edit my review in the past to downgrade the ratings. They are becoming too complacent and now everything is served not freshly made. Parata or fried rice, both were served cold even though requested to serve the freshly made hot one. Requested and got a reheated parata. Done with the place and will never return to eat cold fried rice or cold parata again. This place is super popular for their Roti Prata Plain and Egg Prata. ( things go down when business becomes too complacent and forgot to serve the product what it meant to be). Good staff with great attitude to serve the customer. This WAS the best place rated by me for variety of prata. Should you need to have a sizzling hot prata to be served, then just let the staff know and they will serve you accordingly. But now they do not do it anymore. You must try this place at your own risk, look around a newly opened parata place around your home which might be better in taste and served freshly made hot ones.
Feel bad to downgrade their ratings but in this business one have to keep it with the pace. Hope they will improve soon but for me I am done.

Meant to catchup with friends over Prata but this place was extremely noisy (and packed), and the staff kept chasing us away even when we were not done with our meals. They kept coming to ask if they could clear our plates when most of them were only half eaten.

We were a big group and had ordered a lot. So it would definitely take more time for us to finish our food. But the experience was extremely poor because of the service attitude.

Was just there for dinner last night with my partner and the overall experience for my first visit there was great!

The taste of the dishes was surprising delicious and the freshness of the seafood was sublime! The attention to detail on each plate and the flavour profile was something that got my wanting seconds.

The cocktail was pretty sweet but overall well-balanced in a very presentable manner.

This first visit was short but definitely looking forward to the other visit that will come in the future. Perhaps a good cocktail session as well!

Kudos to the Lumo team for delivering such a well dinner experience!

[Sep 2023] Intimate restaurant that serves modern European cuisine. The grilled octopus and prawns were pretty good, enjoyed the smokiness that came with the fresh seafood. Service was prompt and warm. Place is fully booked on a friday night, reservation a must.

visited over the weekend and had an amazing experience! The ambiance was inviting yet intimate, creating the perfect atmosphere for a great night out with friends. Food was phenomenal. Usually I would have really great appetizers and mains but desserts are a letdown. Lumo exceed expectation in every way down to the desserts. The sirloin was done perfectly well in medium rare and my favorite is likely the scallops with pumpkin puree. Service was impeccable and overall I had a great night celebrating my friend’s birthday. Thank you to the Lumo’s service crew and chefs!

Made a spontaneous booking on saturday night. Wanted to commend the service, we were served by who i presume was the manager and a super smiley young lady. Very pleasantly surprised by the food. The place is nicely decorated.

Service was fantastic despite only one guy was on the floor service. He managed to get everyone served until some of the staff came in at a later time.

Price Level: 2 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.1
Reviews: 

Finally tried here after passing by many times! I like the chicken rice, it has kind of a home cook taste and the chicken meat is also soft and flavourful. The gray is just nice too, not salty nor blend. The rice has also the chicken rice pandan fragrance. Laksa portion is huge and top with a generous spoonful portion of chilli paste.
Lunch time is very crowded, suggest to go in evening or night for supper as it wont be that hot too.

Such a cozy space for dinner with an extensive menu :)
* Maggie goreng 4/5
* Pineapple fried rice 2.5/5 (avoid this one, there are many other menu to try)
* Teh peng 4/5
* Iced Lemon Tea 4/5 (a bit too sweet for my liking)

Food is Trash, why even bother when the price also makes no sense for the quality the provide. A regrettable experience. Hokkien mee was diluted and teh ice was sugar loaded.

Had a mee goreng with chicken added on. $6+. Chicken was too salty. Decided not to finish the chicken.

The wife had stir-fried plain broccoli. $14. Was a bit expensive as the portion wasn't big for $14.

The boy had the chicken wrap with fries. The best review came from him. He thought the wrap was better that the one at Spize as the sauce was nicer and the wrap wasn't overflowing with purple cabbage 😅

Halal restaurant at Paya Lebar area which remains open 24x7. The price is cheap, yet the food was really delicious. It gets quite busy from 10am till midnight. I tried the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Sambal Stingray, Otak-otak, Super Cooler Drink (based on coconut juice), and I highly recommend it.

Reviews: 

Had a great time with some friends for dinner, it was lovely ambience with all the Christmas decor up! Amazing service staff and even the Chef was so friendly! Every dish tasted so good! We had a ball of an evening at the restaurant, heard they are closing their doors end of the year, it’s quite sad to learn about it because I would really hope to be able to have such amazing Italian food in Singapore. Thank You Chef Valentino

A family favourite restaurant that’s been around for a long time and unfortunately they are going to cease operations soon! Food is great as usual, their garlic bread is good, and it’s white truffle season now, best time to enjoy their truffle tagliolini. Their aglio Olio is unique as it comes with whole cloves of garlic, the seafood or lobster versions taste best. Portions are on the small side making it less value for money but taste is always on point.

What more can I say except that I wished I had dined here earlier! It is one of the pricer restaurants I’ve been to AND it was worth every dollar 💵 spent! Every food and drink ordered hit the spot for us - deliziosa!  Prompt and warm service crew and the chef-owner, Valentino, and his family were present, and personally supervising the service crew and attending to guests. What lovely hospitality! You should be there to soak it all up… food, drinks, great service and lovely ambience (check out the photos!) I will surely miss them when they move out. You can still catch them before their last day on 24 Dec 2023. Dining reservations strongly recommended.

I love this italian restaurant & it has been my top favourite. Food is heavenly, ambience is nice & hosts are really so warm & friendly.  Never fail!

Had my birthday celebration here and loved it. The portion were huge, staff were super attentive by clearing and changing plates frequently. I was pleasantly caught by surprise when the staff sang happy birthday. Highly recommended the lamb shank, pizza, salad, tiramisu and lava cake.

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

TOP notch Italian food, prices are also on the higher side (pasta $40-50, beef $70-100+). In return you get quality for what you pay for. Definitely not a daily dining Italian shop. I came with my friend for a celebration.

Shop opens up with a bar, and then leads you into a dining area where there were ample space and ambience was on point. Good vibes.

Warm bread was fluffy and tasted perfect when dipped with a their top grade olive oil and a touch of balsamic vinegar. Starter was ok. Mushroom soup done right, service was prompt, pastas were all round tasty (one of the best), beef steak was done exactly the way I wanted it, not over cooked and not under cooked, tiramisu was a good old recipe that is worth it.

I must also comment that the restaurant made an effort to portion the food for 2 for every ordered item, when they noted we were sharing everything, this I’m very appreciative of.

The only thing I thought could be better were the bread sticks offered on the table, they were lacklustre as a tidbit or small bite. Maybe it’s just me but I saw most tables did not bother to eat or touch.

Overall, this restaurant definitely deserves a 5 stars.

Always a super experience at Garibaldi’s. What a treat with the amazing starter bread that comes out steamy hot, the salad delectable and the mains delicate and delicious.

Fun to order different dishes so you can have a taste of all the starters, mains and desserts.

We were here for SG restaurant week and had the set lunch menu.
Nice ambience, crowded even on a weekday afternoon. Staff was nice and friendly, took care of our table and topped up the water.
Choice of appetizer: salmon trout or wild mushroom soup
Mains: Mediterranean royal sea bream or Braised beef cheek with fettuccine
Dessert: cheese platter or blueberry yoghurt cake.

Verdict: I loved the seafood dishes as it was quite fresh. Good choice of salmon and sea bream. As for the beef fettuccine, it wasn’t as nice as expected. Perhaps the braised beef did not have much taste. Lastly, the dessert was alright, it was a mix of fresh blueberry, yoghurt and also blueberry jam. They could keep it simple by having a classic tiramisu instead.

Went for SG Restaurant Week. Weakest point for me has to be the service. Feels like eating at a neighbourhood cafe with the lack of attention and care from staff.

Food is very hit or miss. We love the scallops starter, but my burrata dish was very bland. The lobster pasta main was amazing, while the beef was disappointingly dry. We both had the blueberry yogurt dessert and it was alright.

Overall wouldn’t come again.

Joined my friend for the SG restaurant week lunch offer this afternoon.
To be honest, the foods were just not to our liking and nothing impressive. The worst part was the fruits cheese dessert that was so hard and extremely salty like eating a salt cube.

My all tiem favourite Italian spot in Singapore! Super chill place that feels great for a Sunday afternoon lunch. Food is excellent and service is impeccable. Always start with the buratta and end your meal with the itramisu, it's just lovely. Would come more often if I didn't stay so far away!

Good & friendly service staff.
Reasonably good food. The calamari and cold cuts were good. So were the pasta, focaccia, pizza of the day, fettuccine of the day, linguine of the day. Nice deserts too.
However, the beef of the day was over cooked vs the medium rare that was asked for.

The star of this place are the waiters. They are so attentive and kind. They are patient and not pushy. We ordered 2 pastas to share and they platted it nicely. It was so delicious. Al dente and with lots of flavour. The cappuccino and the pistachio ice cream is also “to-die-for”. Make booking for indoor seats. Else, the outdoor seats were shady, not too hot and breezy too!

Came here for dinner on a Friday. Ordered the fried calamari, crab gnocchi, and the sea bass. Food was okay but nothing to shout about. Service was okay, not overly warm. Tried to ask for recommendation from a person that seems to be Italian but didn’t get any. I usually appreciate when they are willing to recommend or give some suggestions.

I wish they would print the dishes of the day with prices rather than reciting it out to you really quickly on the spot. I’m not the kind that want to be shocked when I received the bill or have to ask how much each dish cost.

Saw lots of reviews that the burrata is good and is not on the menu. It seems popular enough, how about adding it in rather than it being a daily special. Someone mentioned it was $43 which is more than some of the mains!

The tiramisu seems very popular as well as I kept seeing waiters bringing it out. Unfortunately we were too full to be able to fit it in.

I may have to give it another shot another time. perhaps by ordering other dishes

The restaurant is a 2 mins walk from my office but I have never tried it on a normal weekday. So on a Saturday, I brought the whole family to the restaurant and I was really impressed by it.

We ordered a few off-menu items like the burrata, guanciale pizza and the cod fish on summer vegetables. Added another mushroom risotto as well. Food is really very good and the service staff is also caring. It's one of the best Italian restaurant I visited in Singapore.

Reviews: 

The food and wine was excellent and exactly as we expected. Really enjoyed everything but especially the chef’s special seaweed pasta and the grilled bacon wraps. Unfortunately the restaurant was busy and because it’s quite open it’s very loud and has a cafeteria feeling to it. The service was quite disappointing, and we had to ask multiple times where the rest of our food was (even servers came a few times to ask if we were done with the table or waiting for more items). The whole thing felt very chaotic and like no one was really on top of things; which is as disappointing. Food was good enough that we  will try again in a less busy night and hope service is better.

Finally got to have a meal here, and real glad we did. Everything looked so good! I think the meatballs, which we had for starters, were simply amazing, quite possibly the best I've ever had - so tender and moist and tasty! 😋  The pasta and the lasagna were wonderful also, deliciously creamy and so rich in flavours (on hindsight I really shouldn't have tried to eat the entire lasagna on my own.. way too rich 😅). And the pistachio tiramisu was a surprisingly delightful treat, though personally I still prefer the traditional version. Definitely coming back for more and to savour the many more other items on their menu. 😊

Food was average.

Crispy golden seafood: under season and over fried. The squid was rubbery, fish was fishy.

Pasta: Too watery. With the bacon added, the taste was alright, but nothing fascinating.

Meatball small bite: tender and flavourful.

Service was prompt, but I do not like how they tried to clear your plates as you are having a meal. Space between tables is also small, making it rather uncomfortable.

Loved the service by the staff. They are friendly and accommodating. They would check about the food too.

Food was great; tasty and generous. It’s nice to now that the class of dish can be found in the area. Love it.

The space is pretty crowded, especially on weekend. Walking areas between the tables and payment area are tight. Worth to mention too, the ventilation can be improved. The air was towards the warmer side (probably because of the crowd during dinner time?) and made clothes smell.

The baked pork belly deserves special mention. The succulent and perfectly seasoned pork is roasted to a crispy, golden perfection, while the meat inside remains tender and flavorful. Every bite is a harmonious combination of savory, salty, and wild fennel flavors that dance on your palate.

Of course, I couldn't leave without indulging in their delectable pistachio tiramisu, which was the perfect sweet ending to my Italian gastronomic adventure.

Great Italian restaurant for a date. The food was authentically Italian and the vibe was so casual and cool. I am all about the wood fired pizza. We ordered pizza with mushroom and meat it was so hearty and delicious. The gnocchi was creamy and hit the spot. The surprise was the dessert. I never had the citrus cake before and it was a revelation. Absolutely loved it. Can’t recommend it enough. Overall the food and service makes this restaurant worthy of a visit again.

definitely enjoyed our dinner here, staff were attentive and friendly. The seafood platter was fresh, the steak was definitely a 10/10. The fresh crab meat pasta was good too. Will come back again.

Nice place but would I go back again? Maybe not. Review below

Food 4 pts
- Quality of the ingredients was good.
- pork collar steak was nicely done with steam veg and the roasted potatoes slay
- wagyu tenderloin was done correctly, however the Angus turned more rare than medium rare which makes me think it was cold when cooked
- beef dishes were a bit overpriced
- pizza was nice though floppy. If you are looking for crispy crust or sourdough base, this isn’t the place.
- food was served fast
- portion are mostly single served and not really meant for sharing or communal dining

Ambience 4 pts
- nice place to chill and meet friends for meals and generally talk

Service. 3.5 pts
- severs were attentive but there was a slight miscommunication between them and my wife who just wanted normal cold water and they open a bottle of cold mineral water for us.

The pasta was the best!! We had Mediterranean salad which was good, it’s like Italian mix with Greece. We ordered spaghetti vongole and spaghetti seafood with Bisque sauce, both are delicious and I almost lick the plate, I’m sad that I’m full already if not will order cheese cake for sure. It’s my new favourite Italian restaurant for now, love the service and vibe so much, it’s casual and classy, parking is complimentary valet is a plus! Will be back 100%

Great Italian dishes.  Especially the starter fish dish.  Superb and nicely executed

Deep fried calamari is so good!

Pork collar was nicely seared and presented

Pizza with anchovies are interesting

Risotto was also good
Seafood pasta was not as exciting though

Overall a good dining experience

However,  I hope the servers can be more attentive in filing the wine glasses of customers when it goes empty.

Reviews: 

Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

food was clean and unique. the presentation was beautiful. staffs were very friendly and attentive. overall, i’ve enjoyed my meal very much

Have not been here for quite awhile, so went for their Thursday steak buffet. Still as good with all the appetizers and pizzas. The steak is soft and juicy but pity the tomahawk is a bit dry. Roast lamb is great as well. Didn’t really ate too much of the pasta though its very good cos need to save space for cheese and desserts!

All the food was excellent, the service was courteous and friendly, and we had a great time. (Honestly, the quality of the Asian food wasn't that great.) The chefs came around during the meal to give us tastings, and it felt like we were at a friend's party. It was a great time. Thank you:)

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

Went for Sunday brunch. Cheese room is lovely with a wide selection of cheeses. Loved the unique chocolate cheeses and burratas. Mains selection is ok, could be larger. Lamb stew was nice. Desserts are good as well.

The restaurant offers an array of 🧀 cheese.
If you are a cheese lover, this will be the restaurant for you!
We had buffet but the selection is limited unlike the conventional buffet.  However, food is delicious.
The service is good. Mr Muru / Mr Nuru (Manager) is very helpful & friendly.

Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)

Other than the desserts and A5 miyazaki wagyu the rest is just average. Burnt A5 miyazaki wagyu comes with bitter taste. Would still recommend diners to top up and try the wagyu beef. If not you might get the duck which is just average.
Waiter was coughing while serving so not sure if that is a good service.
The desserts is awesome and the balsamic vinegar is nice too.

Reviews: 

This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟
- Presentation was really good 👍
- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

Everything about this place is 5 stars!
The ambience is so perfect that you are at ease the moment you are inside the restaurant. Menu is designed in such a way that you can have the best vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes without feeling less about your dish. Staff is courteous and even after attending so many guests, they always find time to attend to you/your requests. The serving is very clean and within time. They have good sitting arrangements both inside and outside. Billing is fast and accurate.

Reviews: 

TOP notch Italian food, prices are also on the higher side (pasta $40-50, beef $70-100+). In return you get quality for what you pay for. Definitely not a daily dining Italian shop. I came with my friend for a celebration.

Shop opens up with a bar, and then leads you into a dining area where there were ample space and ambience was on point. Good vibes.

Warm bread was fluffy and tasted perfect when dipped with a their top grade olive oil and a touch of balsamic vinegar. Starter was ok. Mushroom soup done right, service was prompt, pastas were all round tasty (one of the best), beef steak was done exactly the way I wanted it, not over cooked and not under cooked, tiramisu was a good old recipe that is worth it.

I must also comment that the restaurant made an effort to portion the food for 2 for every ordered item, when they noted we were sharing everything, this I’m very appreciative of.

The only thing I thought could be better were the bread sticks offered on the table, they were lacklustre as a tidbit or small bite. Maybe it’s just me but I saw most tables did not bother to eat or touch.

Overall, this restaurant definitely deserves a 5 stars.

Always a super experience at Garibaldi’s. What a treat with the amazing starter bread that comes out steamy hot, the salad delectable and the mains delicate and delicious.

Fun to order different dishes so you can have a taste of all the starters, mains and desserts.

We were here for SG restaurant week and had the set lunch menu.
Nice ambience, crowded even on a weekday afternoon. Staff was nice and friendly, took care of our table and topped up the water.
Choice of appetizer: salmon trout or wild mushroom soup
Mains: Mediterranean royal sea bream or Braised beef cheek with fettuccine
Dessert: cheese platter or blueberry yoghurt cake.

Verdict: I loved the seafood dishes as it was quite fresh. Good choice of salmon and sea bream. As for the beef fettuccine, it wasn’t as nice as expected. Perhaps the braised beef did not have much taste. Lastly, the dessert was alright, it was a mix of fresh blueberry, yoghurt and also blueberry jam. They could keep it simple by having a classic tiramisu instead.

Went for SG Restaurant Week. Weakest point for me has to be the service. Feels like eating at a neighbourhood cafe with the lack of attention and care from staff.

Food is very hit or miss. We love the scallops starter, but my burrata dish was very bland. The lobster pasta main was amazing, while the beef was disappointingly dry. We both had the blueberry yogurt dessert and it was alright.

Overall wouldn’t come again.

Joined my friend for the SG restaurant week lunch offer this afternoon.
To be honest, the foods were just not to our liking and nothing impressive. The worst part was the fruits cheese dessert that was so hard and extremely salty like eating a salt cube.

My all tiem favourite Italian spot in Singapore! Super chill place that feels great for a Sunday afternoon lunch. Food is excellent and service is impeccable. Always start with the buratta and end your meal with the itramisu, it's just lovely. Would come more often if I didn't stay so far away!

Good & friendly service staff.
Reasonably good food. The calamari and cold cuts were good. So were the pasta, focaccia, pizza of the day, fettuccine of the day, linguine of the day. Nice deserts too.
However, the beef of the day was over cooked vs the medium rare that was asked for.

The star of this place are the waiters. They are so attentive and kind. They are patient and not pushy. We ordered 2 pastas to share and they platted it nicely. It was so delicious. Al dente and with lots of flavour. The cappuccino and the pistachio ice cream is also “to-die-for”. Make booking for indoor seats. Else, the outdoor seats were shady, not too hot and breezy too!

Came here for dinner on a Friday. Ordered the fried calamari, crab gnocchi, and the sea bass. Food was okay but nothing to shout about. Service was okay, not overly warm. Tried to ask for recommendation from a person that seems to be Italian but didn’t get any. I usually appreciate when they are willing to recommend or give some suggestions.

I wish they would print the dishes of the day with prices rather than reciting it out to you really quickly on the spot. I’m not the kind that want to be shocked when I received the bill or have to ask how much each dish cost.

Saw lots of reviews that the burrata is good and is not on the menu. It seems popular enough, how about adding it in rather than it being a daily special. Someone mentioned it was $43 which is more than some of the mains!

The tiramisu seems very popular as well as I kept seeing waiters bringing it out. Unfortunately we were too full to be able to fit it in.

I may have to give it another shot another time. perhaps by ordering other dishes

The restaurant is a 2 mins walk from my office but I have never tried it on a normal weekday. So on a Saturday, I brought the whole family to the restaurant and I was really impressed by it.

We ordered a few off-menu items like the burrata, guanciale pizza and the cod fish on summer vegetables. Added another mushroom risotto as well. Food is really very good and the service staff is also caring. It's one of the best Italian restaurant I visited in Singapore.

Had a great time with some friends for dinner, it was lovely ambience with all the Christmas decor up! Amazing service staff and even the Chef was so friendly! Every dish tasted so good! We had a ball of an evening at the restaurant, heard they are closing their doors end of the year, it’s quite sad to learn about it because I would really hope to be able to have such amazing Italian food in Singapore. Thank You Chef Valentino

A family favourite restaurant that’s been around for a long time and unfortunately they are going to cease operations soon! Food is great as usual, their garlic bread is good, and it’s white truffle season now, best time to enjoy their truffle tagliolini. Their aglio Olio is unique as it comes with whole cloves of garlic, the seafood or lobster versions taste best. Portions are on the small side making it less value for money but taste is always on point.

What more can I say except that I wished I had dined here earlier! It is one of the pricer restaurants I’ve been to AND it was worth every dollar 💵 spent! Every food and drink ordered hit the spot for us - deliziosa!  Prompt and warm service crew and the chef-owner, Valentino, and his family were present, and personally supervising the service crew and attending to guests. What lovely hospitality! You should be there to soak it all up… food, drinks, great service and lovely ambience (check out the photos!) I will surely miss them when they move out. You can still catch them before their last day on 24 Dec 2023. Dining reservations strongly recommended.

I love this italian restaurant & it has been my top favourite. Food is heavenly, ambience is nice & hosts are really so warm & friendly.  Never fail!

Had my birthday celebration here and loved it. The portion were huge, staff were super attentive by clearing and changing plates frequently. I was pleasantly caught by surprise when the staff sang happy birthday. Highly recommended the lamb shank, pizza, salad, tiramisu and lava cake.

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

Visited in Sep 2023

A fantastic dining experience. The dry-aged duck main course was absolutely fantastic and so was the fish/turbot main course dish. The beef carpaccio course was also brilliant. The restaurant doesn’t have a non-alcoholic pairing and that’s probably a small area where they can improve their ‘value proposition’.

Service was top notch.

A definite recommendation for a classy dinner experience

Wonderful culinary experience from the start till the end. The location and ambiance is welcoming and cosy, the staff is friendly and took great care of us, the food is delicious, high attention to details and wonderful ingredients from all over the globe. The chef is very talented and creative. The sommelier chose some amazing wines and champagne to pair the dishes with. Amazing experience.

Modern Italian restaurant serving interestingly innovative dishes especially the amuse bouches. Wine pairing was generous and well thought out - always a nice way to find new wines if a restaurant gets it right! Service was good. Small but well spaced and clean relaxed ambience.

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It’s free anyway. Canapés started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l’oeil to make it look like tomatoes it’s actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce. The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef’s take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one’s pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

food was clean and unique. the presentation was beautiful. staffs were very friendly and attentive. overall, i’ve enjoyed my meal very much

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

This is a very vibrant Italian restaurant with solid sound coming from Bose speakers. Food is great. Slow cooked Lamb Ragu pasta and eggplant parmigiana are amazing. Their firewood pizza is not to be missed too. A perfect environment to stay and chill with a glass or wine or beer after a nice dinner.

I visited this place for a dinner date. We had already made a reservation in advance, as we knew very well that this place would be packed on the weekends.

The staff were very nice to greet us as we made our way into the restaurant and even walked us over to our tables. The waiter at the time was very observant, and would constantly check up on how we were  doing.

More on the food:

(Appetizer)
Burrata Bruschetta - 8/10 🌟
- The Burrata was really lovely!
- The sweet and juicy tomatoes compliments the creamy and milky cheese

However, the bread was a little tougher than expected that our knives struggle to cut through. Nevertheless, it was pretty delicious 🤤😋

(Appetizer)
Eggplant Parmigiana -  10/10 🌟🤌
- Absolutely bussin!
- It tastes better than a regular lasagne, the eggplant is barely noticeable. Which is good in a way as my partner is not too much of a fan of veggies.
- The sauce topped with the cheese just makes this dish one of the best in my opinion

(Main)
Diavola pizza - 9/10 🌟
- Spicy, greasy and meaty pizza
- The spicy and salty sorpressata balances the thick and absorbent pizza dough
- Low-key better than pepperoni pizzas 🤭

*Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture*

(Dessert)
Flambéed Chocolate Ecstasy - 6/10🌟

- Interesting concept of both Hot and Cold dessert

However, our brownies were a little too frozen 😕. We knew it was a hot and cold dessert as there was ice cream served with the hot-plated brownies. But when we tried to scoop booth goodies, the brownie was frozen hahaha. Interesting concept but would recommend other stuff like the tiramisu maybe.

Overall, excellent experience. Prompt service, a little pricey but worth the occasional visits. Came in hungry, left full  😵

Great Italian restaurant for a date. The food was authentically Italian and the vibe was so casual and cool. I am all about the wood fired pizza. We ordered pizza with mushroom and meat it was so hearty and delicious. The gnocchi was creamy and hit the spot. The surprise was the dessert. I never had the citrus cake before and it was a revelation. Absolutely loved it. Can’t recommend it enough. Overall the food and service makes this restaurant worthy of a visit again.

definitely enjoyed our dinner here, staff were attentive and friendly. The seafood platter was fresh, the steak was definitely a 10/10. The fresh crab meat pasta was good too. Will come back again.

Nice place but would I go back again? Maybe not. Review below

Food 4 pts
- Quality of the ingredients was good.
- pork collar steak was nicely done with steam veg and the roasted potatoes slay
- wagyu tenderloin was done correctly, however the Angus turned more rare than medium rare which makes me think it was cold when cooked
- beef dishes were a bit overpriced
- pizza was nice though floppy. If you are looking for crispy crust or sourdough base, this isn’t the place.
- food was served fast
- portion are mostly single served and not really meant for sharing or communal dining

Ambience 4 pts
- nice place to chill and meet friends for meals and generally talk

Service. 3.5 pts
- severs were attentive but there was a slight miscommunication between them and my wife who just wanted normal cold water and they open a bottle of cold mineral water for us.

The pasta was the best!! We had Mediterranean salad which was good, it’s like Italian mix with Greece. We ordered spaghetti vongole and spaghetti seafood with Bisque sauce, both are delicious and I almost lick the plate, I’m sad that I’m full already if not will order cheese cake for sure. It’s my new favourite Italian restaurant for now, love the service and vibe so much, it’s casual and classy, parking is complimentary valet is a plus! Will be back 100%

Great Italian dishes.  Especially the starter fish dish.  Superb and nicely executed

Deep fried calamari is so good!

Pork collar was nicely seared and presented

Pizza with anchovies are interesting

Risotto was also good
Seafood pasta was not as exciting though

Overall a good dining experience

However,  I hope the servers can be more attentive in filing the wine glasses of customers when it goes empty.

They serve some of the most delectable Italian dishes we've ever had, each dish was prepared with exquisite flavours. We highly recommend trying the White Truffle Tagliolini while it is still in season. The ambiance of the restaurant is brilliant, perfect place for a romantic dinner, or just a night out with friends/family. We wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates fine Italian cuisine and exceptional service.

Our server, Cheryl/Cherry, went above and beyond to make our dining experience truly exceptional, we want to express our sincere gratitude for making our dining experience memorable. Your professionalism, friendliness, and knowledge about the menu were outstanding!

Came here for the first time to celebrate an anniversary and it couldn’t have been a better choice.

Sourdough bread was unassuming but soooo fresh and fluffy, the best we’ve had! We enjoyed our starters which were the lobster and the carpaccio more than we did the mains! But overall food was delicately plated and delicious.

The service here was nothing short of amazing as well, the waiters were very attentive and explained each dish to us, checked on how we’d like the food every now and then which we appreciate.

Especially enjoyed the part where we got the option to have our desserts alfresco with the amazing view of the city lights and MBS area.

Pricey but overall would recommend for a special occasion!

From the food itself to the service offered all we could say is it’s stunningly perfect. Mr Ronnie helped us much, even with the picture taking , he’s even so vibrant to all the guests he served.  We’re also glad that the team keep on checking with us on what we needed and they are of such great help , Mr Mark was there to help and even gave us a complimentary dessert. Special thanks to Mr Suren who did a great job and elaborate to us the foods and wine which was served .

The wine which was served to us is just so👌.
Salute to the mentioned names for going above and beyond on serving us.

This is the first time I have visited an Italian place, not had a pizza and pasta primarily, and still walked away full and satisfied. We took a set 3/4 course menu, and the chef was kind enough to bake in dietary preferences (eg. Vegetarian for me). All the items were amazing. But (weirdly) a special callout for the warmest and loveliest bread that I have eaten in a long time. And yes, if you do manage to get a seat outside, the view of Marina bay is just spectacular.

Staff were absolutely friendly and attentive. I brought my mom who rarely enjoys fine dining but she thoroughly enjoyed her experience and were overjoyed with the dessert recommended by the manager. The ambience is cosy. Decor and interior looks ok but not too exciting. Desserts were truly the highlight. We had the espresso mascarpone and amalfi lemon desserts and it was perfect for both our taste buds.

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

The food and wine was excellent and exactly as we expected. Really enjoyed everything but especially the chef’s special seaweed pasta and the grilled bacon wraps. Unfortunately the restaurant was busy and because it’s quite open it’s very loud and has a cafeteria feeling to it. The service was quite disappointing, and we had to ask multiple times where the rest of our food was (even servers came a few times to ask if we were done with the table or waiting for more items). The whole thing felt very chaotic and like no one was really on top of things; which is as disappointing. Food was good enough that we  will try again in a less busy night and hope service is better.

Finally got to have a meal here, and real glad we did. Everything looked so good! I think the meatballs, which we had for starters, were simply amazing, quite possibly the best I've ever had - so tender and moist and tasty! 😋  The pasta and the lasagna were wonderful also, deliciously creamy and so rich in flavours (on hindsight I really shouldn't have tried to eat the entire lasagna on my own.. way too rich 😅). And the pistachio tiramisu was a surprisingly delightful treat, though personally I still prefer the traditional version. Definitely coming back for more and to savour the many more other items on their menu. 😊

Food was average.

Crispy golden seafood: under season and over fried. The squid was rubbery, fish was fishy.

Pasta: Too watery. With the bacon added, the taste was alright, but nothing fascinating.

Meatball small bite: tender and flavourful.

Service was prompt, but I do not like how they tried to clear your plates as you are having a meal. Space between tables is also small, making it rather uncomfortable.

Loved the service by the staff. They are friendly and accommodating. They would check about the food too.

Food was great; tasty and generous. It’s nice to now that the class of dish can be found in the area. Love it.

The space is pretty crowded, especially on weekend. Walking areas between the tables and payment area are tight. Worth to mention too, the ventilation can be improved. The air was towards the warmer side (probably because of the crowd during dinner time?) and made clothes smell.

The baked pork belly deserves special mention. The succulent and perfectly seasoned pork is roasted to a crispy, golden perfection, while the meat inside remains tender and flavorful. Every bite is a harmonious combination of savory, salty, and wild fennel flavors that dance on your palate.

Of course, I couldn't leave without indulging in their delectable pistachio tiramisu, which was the perfect sweet ending to my Italian gastronomic adventure.

Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)

Other than the desserts and A5 miyazaki wagyu the rest is just average. Burnt A5 miyazaki wagyu comes with bitter taste. Would still recommend diners to top up and try the wagyu beef. If not you might get the duck which is just average.
Waiter was coughing while serving so not sure if that is a good service.
The desserts is awesome and the balsamic vinegar is nice too.
