Rating: 4
Reviews: 

This place opens up at 11.30am, earlier than other lunch spots in the area. We decided on a mexican fiesta and as such, popped in for a quick fix and to our delightful surprise, we were not at all disappointed.

My dish was about $19 before GST. It was fried chicken with loads of tomato sauce on it, with cilantro rice and nachos on the side. My friends had nachos and enchiladas. The flavours were good and the cilantro rice was so yummy. They didn’t skimp on the cilantro and the rice was cooked to perfection, every rice with that intense cilantro flavour. My chicken was fried to perfection, and it was juicy and moist. The serving size is generous for what you’re paying.

The restaurant service was attentive, and I loved that they provided free iced water to patrons. Such should be the standard of more restaurants in Singapore.

The decor was quaint and cute.

Absolutely love the Mexican food here especially the Soup with the fresh seafood in it had the nachos with pulled pork which was amazing the enchiladas filled with beef and the set with taco and enchilada with beans on the side I added guacamole as well which was great! Definitely would recommend this! Though service is sometimes quite slow it’s still quite worth while

I don't eat much mexican, but I really enjoyed my dinner here. Was difficult to choose from the menu but thankfully the staff were very helpful with their recommendations.

The spring roll thingy was amazing, way better than it looks.
I didn't know nachos can be served like that, the pulled pork one was good but wish there was more meat.
Beef quesadilla was really good too, altho it looked really flat and sad, but it was actually very flavourful and filling.
Fish tacos tasted quite interesting, I actually couldn't taste the fish at all which is a good thing.

Oh and I love the guacamole and tomatoes and salsa ~

The downside is all the quesadilla/taco/XXX all looked and tasted very similar.

But yea would come visit again! It tastes quite wholesome!

I am a frequent customer and have been ordering from them for a couple of years. No longer in the future as there was a cockroach wrapped in my burrito. I have reported them to the food agency.

It’s been many years since I’ve last been here. It’s a long standing establishment and the food did not fail me.
Ordered the piñatas, chimichanga and calamari. Food was served fast and the server was very friendly.
All the food ordered were tasty, filling and authentic. I’ll be back to explore the menu more.

The staff , Anthony was so accommodating and very informative. He suggested the best food for me and my boss. The weather outside was super hot but despite of that…we had a great time and enjoyed our lunch. Cheers to the staff and management of El Mero Mero👍👍👍👍👍

great experience here! service was amazing, friendly staff and celebrated my friend’s birthday here. great atmosphere with great food! will definitely want to be back. highly recommend!!

not worth at all!!!! fish taco was bland, beef in the beef fajita was quite chewy, vegetables were soft and i guess not bad, cheesey quesadilla added a nice touch. pop corn chicken was prob the nicest thing on this table.

Great food and value for money! Did a lovely birthday surprise for us as well, would definitely recommend

Ambience is beautiful. We are from Mexico and food is authentic and well served portions.

Food was tasty but the portion is a bit small.  Guacamole was served with thin crispy nachos, it was prepared at your table which was a nice surprise.  Quesadillas were delicious but the dips were too small. Beer selection is limited though.  The fried chicken wings were crunchy and went well with beers.
Good crowd even on weekdays.  Both indoor and outdoor dining areas are available.

Quite a famous place in Arab street with a long stretch outlet. Food is pretty good, drinks are good, price is pretty alright. Probably recommended for family during noon and early evening. Place has the vibes for friends and couple during dinner time and late evening. Their tacos is really good. Plenty of tables to sit and they have indoor and outdoor seats. Worth the try in a famous place as such.

Great ambient, the decorations and music.
We were 7 of us there on national day for dinner, ordered quite a lot of different kind of tapas and main course.

The portions were all quite large, the mozzarella cheese stick was so tasty, the pepper was too spicy somehow. The tacos with hard shell was crispy and I love the full loaded vegetables and meat perfectly with the sauces. Grilled chicken chop was well prepared, juicy and tender.

Flan is different then what we have in kopitiam, this texture of flan was not smooth or silk.  Not recommend to order ice cream as it taste so cheap..

Fantastic hard shell tacos, freshly smashed guacamole right at your table. Burger is juicy and my kid says, flavourful.

They even helped light a candle on the dessert for my kid's birthday.

One of my all time fav Mexican bar. The great vibe hasn't change. Colorful, lively, vibrant.

Great service too from the team especially Sunil. Thoroughly friendly and super helpful.

Celebrated Anniversary. A very nice place with tables that have enough room between them and all families n friends can have their lovely time without disturbing any other tables!

Absolutely fantastic...Margaritas at Dempsey Hill in Singapore is a Fabulous culinary destination.
The ambience and setting is beautiful with the wonderful Dempsey hill mini fountains at the exterior and the classy interior finish
The service was attentive and highly efficient
The food was just wonderful. Mexican Cuisine never tasted this good with each item presented beautifully and tasting just right.
A must visit place in Singapore

Cocktails a must in Margarita’s! All good ordered was yums! The beef for fajitas was done just right. Definitely a must come back.

Margarita's seems to have been at Dempsey Hill forever.

This is a restaurant that survived covid and has continued to thrive. Obviously, there are reasons for this.

1. The food has never let me down each time I have come here either with family or friends. The food is freshly made and always tastes great. The sauces are also made freshly. All this effort is clearly reflected in the taste. Portions are large and generous as well.

2. The service is attentive. There are always enough staff around so you can get their attention when you want it.

3. There is a comforting ambience about this place. The restaurant is large, so there is a good feeling of being in a nice, large, well-decorated and well-maintained restaurant.

Although they charge $1 for packing the leftovers to go, they do a meticulous job with it. All the sauces are put into separate containers, different components like the meat is packed separately from the tortilla wraps.

This restaurant meets you at the right level at every point where you need them. Definitely one to revisit again and again.

Compared to what you find in Singapore, the Margarita’s restaurant at Dempsey Hills is a great place for great cocktails and good Mexican food! You can find a a variety for all tastes and desires, tasty and rich!

What is a disaster there is the service! From the second you enter, order, get asked to make your last order by 21h30 and bringing the check without asking for it by 22h20… and the horrible part when they close the toilets (for cleaning) by 22h20 and turning off the fans (outside) by exactly 22:30!!!! Shame guys, a place like this closing by 22h30 and pushing your clients out that early, shows how careless you are to entertain, make your customers enjoy and have another drink! Shame!!!!

5 stars for service!

Was there early on a quiet Saturday evening. Both staff (1 male & 1 female Indians) who served us were friendly and attentive.

Ordered nacho platter, beef steak taco & chicken quesadilla to share with 2 kids. The later two items were not spicy and the kids enjoyed them. As for the nacho platter, only the guacamole dip was not spicy.

Shared a yummy virgin Mango Margarita. Wanted to try the churros but we finished the nachos & got too stuffed!

In the Dempsey Hill restaurant cluster, differentiates it self from the other Mexican restaurants here with its vibrant coloured interiors , live band and great tasting food !
The menu has a good spread of choices .
The staff here also provided very good service , always attentive and eager to help.
The chicken nachos were great and the strips of chicken had a unique tangy taste .
Tried the fish Tacos and Chicken Tacos , both hard shelled option and was great!
The Costillas de Res - slow roasted beef short ribs , finished on smoked apple wood in morita beef jus served with jalapeño corn bread , is one of the best I ever tasted !
The coffee is good !
The live band plays on Friday and Saturday nights 10pm - 1AM . Friday being western and Saturday Latin band ! Will definitely return to enjoy the music as well !

Tacos was nice but food is generally quite average. Great after work hang out place for drinks and occasional live performance available.

We went for a family birthday dinner. They had great vegetarian options and there was a live band playing after 10 pm so overall was a lovely evening! We managed to get bookings even though we booked on Thursday for a Friday evening dinner. Only thing we didn’t like were the soft tacos, they seemed like under cooked tacos, we expected fajitas.

try something new today, Mexican cuisine. very colorful environment make you feel relax, friendly staff provided warm services. Food wise, the baby ribs has been roasted for long but still tender. Taco is not crispy enough. Wanted to try their roasted seafood platter, but it was sold out.

I had a blast at Lucha Loco for the first time with my team. At first, they told us there were no tables available, but thanks to some smooth talking by my colleague and a stroke of luck with a no-show party, we snagged a great table for our group of six.

Hats off to George, one of the waitstaff, who was an absolute delight, super friendly, and full of great recommendations.

We indulged in some blueberry margaritas, chicken and beef enchiladas, lamb tacos, chips, and eggplant tempura, and let me tell you, they were scrumptious.

I’m already planning my next visit because there’s so much more on their menu I want to try. We left with satisfied tummies and big smiles. 😄🌮🍹

Was served by George. Professional, attentive and helpful. As it was my first time having mexican food. He was able to address my questions and willing to share more about Mexican food. Thanks for recommending the sauces!! Esp the green sauce. Super love the crab dish with amazing flavours. Highly recommend blue corn cake for dessert! Ambience was really nice and great for dating/ gatherings!

Food ordered: Fried Papas, Tostadas Crab, Quesadillas Chicken and blue corn cake

Food is not bad, don't be fooled by the portion. It looks small but it is definitely filing. Two of us had cauliflower, tacos and Zucchini flower. We were really full halfway. We had churros anyway, too sweet to decline.. George was servicing us and he was really looking after us, and recommended us the items or else we would have ordered too much. He even got us fee margarita shots. Thanks George! We enjoyed our time there.

Great tacos, especially the prawn tacos.
I think 2 tacos is enough for 1 person along with some small shared dishes.
The staff were all friendly, they came by for some small chats.
We sat outside the entrance and it was relatively warm especially with some alcoholic drinks.

Thankful for George's recommendations! From the moment we stepped in to the restaurant, he is attentive to our needs and queries. His recommendations are fantastic. Most importantly, we enjoyed the food. Would definitely come back again.

Came here with colleagues on a Thursday night and it was quite crowded, luckily we made reservations beforehand. The table we were shown to had these weird pipes at the sides, so because we were a party of 5 people, the 5th person (me) had to either sit awkwardly at the end with the pipes blocking my legs, or squeeze together with 2 other people on one side. I chose the latter.

We ordered a few variety of tacos, wings, and drinks to go along with them. All were decent and they came out relatively quickly too. It was however, really noisy as there were large groups of friends and office workers (10+ people in a group) so it could be hard to speak above the noise. The staff was attentive and professional so that was good. All in all, this is a decent place to head to after work, but if you are looking for a nice quiet place to chill, this might not be the most ideal spot.

Good ambience, with attentive & polite staffs. We had a reservation at a Friday night, yet it’s isn’t too crowded. They offered complimentary nachos which tasted great.

The kimchi fries tasted good too as it’s filled with generous toppings. However, the tacos were bland and doesn’t tasted too cohesive together, which is such a shame. Frozen lime margarita is enough for 2, which is a huge plus point!

Overall it’s food it’s mediocre for its price-point.

The flavor of the Mexican Korean fusion dishes are delicious, although the service and ambiance leave much to be desired.
The seating is uncomfortable, and the small table struggled to hold all the food we ordered. Unfortunately, when we voiced our concerns to the owner, it seemed like they didn't really care. This might be my first and last visit there.

Really like the baja fish burrito, it tasted so fresh and very big portion too. Completely satisfied! Service staff was prompt and friendly. Love the cozy atmosphere and it's perfect for dinner gathering with friends/family.

Really chill place to hangout and have a meal. Waitress came by my table at least 6 times to ask if we needed anything else. That’s rare by Spore standard.

Food was amazing! The chips are fried fresh and the serving sizing is huge! Go for the Taco, Burrito and Quesadillas! A+++++ Well done and deserve my 5 stars rating, we will be back!

Wife googled and found this Mexican place with great reviews..The food was great and reasonably priced! We loved the Angus cheeseburger and quesidilla especially..Nice place to chill and hang out.. =)

Above average food. We tried the beef taco, fish taco and the chicken quesadilla. Of the three, fish taco is perhaps the best choice. Drinks were generally better than the food, had both the margarita and the frozen one. Will I be back? Probably, not that many fantastic Mexican places in Singapore

This place didn’t disappoint! The fish tacos were bomb!!! Super crispy and fresh. Each taco set me back by $10, but I guess I’m gradually resigning myself to the fact that tacos are exorbitant in Singapore…) looking forward to trying the carne asada bowl and tacos next time, plus more servings of fish tacos for sure, and maybe some cocktails to spice up a future evening 🙏🏼

Discovered this gem whilst searching for dinner spots in Little India. Their warmth and hospitality were amazing from the moment we were seated. Khal, our server, did us good by recommending the fish tacos and chicken quesadillas…these were bomb and so were the cocktails mixed by Razi. We are so happy we found this place and will be coming back again for the great food and friendly service! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

The food tastes really good. Cravings satisfied.
Food ordered:
Chimichanga, nachos, burritos, soft tacos, mojito and churros.
The service was excellent. In our one year stay in SG, all the restaurants we have visited. This is by far the best service we have had. The servers are very attentive and proactive.
The place matches the vibe and the food.

Reviews: 

First time to this restaurant.
Love the location.
Love the amosphere.
Love how our furkid enjoy sitting with us.

Food was good but perhaps it will be nice if staff can do better recommendations.

I have to give thumbs up to the staff, being very attentive even on a full seating.

Will return again.

Celebrated my wife’s birthday here. The food was amazing and the service here is superb!

I had the most incredible experience at Super Loco, and it's all thanks to the exceptional service provided by Jenny. From the moment we walked in, Jenny's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for a fantastic evening. She not only made sure our table was perfect, but she also went above and beyond to recommend the most delicious dishes on the menu. Kudos to her 👍🏻👍🏻

They also gave us free churros and mexican lover shot as part of our birthday celebration here.

Surprisingly, even though the food looks so nice, NONE of them (ordered 3 types of food) were tasty. 👎🏻

The staff was NOT friendly/polite at all. Even though there was miscommunication, i didn’t get apologies which made me feel uncomfortable.

The atmosphere is good as they allow lovely dogs outdoor.

Overall, not recommend. :) Thanks!!

Nice and open air spot to hangout, visited after a downpour with the weather nice and cool.
We had chips and guacamole to start.
Buffalo wings and quesadillas were great with the right amount of spices.
Crabmeat tacos were a tad unwieldy, turned soggy when left out awhile.
The food can be a little salty so drinks and frozen margaritas were a nice respite.
It was nice to have 3 different salsas available by the table, the mango habanero does pack quite the punch.
Will revisit for the laidback atmosphere and great food.
Staff were attentive and offered water.

Delicious, modern Mexican cuisine. Great menu with lots of meat and veg options as well as a decent kids menu. Favourite was the cauliflower dish as well as pumpkin tostadas. Service was a little non attentive but otherwise a great experience in a comfortable environment by the river.

Price Level: 2 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Varieties of veg food is available.
Pre booking is highly recommended.
Have been here 2 times and will definitely go again since the quality of food, service and the ambience is amazing.
MBS view dining is great.

Visit Date - 13 August 2023

It was a very pleasant experience at Super Loco @Customs House. On a Sunday it was quiet and we had booked a table outside overlooking the Marina.
It is recommended to visit during sunset, there is a refreshing breeze and slowly the marina lights up all happy and colourful - a perfect way to gear up for the new week.
We were served by Danial. He gave some unbiased suggestions highlighting what he likes and why and some other items why his colleagues like

Based on that we ordered
A Bottle of Pineapple and Calamani Margarita - It was light & refreshing
Trotilla chips with salsa roja

For the main course we had
Wagyu Steak - juicy bite sized on a taco
Beef Quesadilla - quite tasty

This should have been enough for dinner but for us it was not complete without a dessert so we indulged in
Chocolate Lava - as mentioned by Danial, the Mint ice cream and choco-lava cake made a super combo.
Panna Cotta - personally I liked this the best. The tang of lemon sorbet balanced the sweet Oaxaca cheese topped with the crunch of pistachio crumble. This is an item to return for.
Thanks Super Loco

Don’t be surprised by my 5 STAR ratings🤣 I’m pretty sure it’s not because of my birthday🌝

So I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant and it was on a Saturday😊 I love went to other restaurant before but not this location. The VIEW is superb even at 6pm(before sunset)

I ordered Chefs Recommendation $48/6 dishes.. I would say the portion is not too much and just nice for my appetite… So, as I put in the reservation remark column, they gave me a hat that night with a complimentary citrusy shots🤣 Ok, it’s a bonus drink, what do you expect? A glass of beer or wine? 🤣

So.. If you like to enjoy beautiful view with nice Mexican food, you should consider here and make your reservation early at least a week before your selected date😉

Absolutely delicious and satisfying Mexican fare in a chill, laid-back setting by the Bay. No complaints and would definitely return! The chips and dips are a must-order!!

Dropped in just before last call for orders at 9pm on a weekend, but the staff were friendly and helpful even though we were latecomers. We ordered a selection of tacos, tostados, the nacho chips and a salad - everything was served very quickly, tasted fresh, balanced, overall just really delicious.

The nacho chips with the range of dips was probably the star of the night. It’s usually a starter that I take for granted but the sauces here pack a punch - so so good and deceivingly simple-looking. I may not be a regular diner at Mexican restaurants but I’d imagine that it would be hard to top this off. Can’t wait to go back!

We got an outdoor seat beside the Bay Area with the backdrop Marina Bay Sands.
The view was awesome, there were a lot of people gathering around the area just to take photos in the evening.

Everything we ordered tasted fantastic, and the plating was colourful. The service was warm, friendly and attentive. It rained halfway and Solihin quickly relocated us indoor, and offered to leave the door open so we can enjoy the view, until the rain got heavier.

Overall, it was a unique and warm five star experience!
Japanese food near my location:

Price Level: 2 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4
Reviews: 

Take a queue number, and you'll be notified once your number is about to be called. Be prepared to wait, especially on the weekend. Join their membership if you frequent them. Food quality is maintained and they've a large variety of freshly prepared food. On occasions, they've special dishes served.

ITS JUST AMAZING GOOD AND ALL GOOD!!
To me one of the best Japanese restaurant which is debatable but my own opinion.
Lunch time was a lot of people and its just crowded
But the food amend everything
For those who haven eat must eat
Definitely must come and try it once!!
Price : $$/$$$$$
price wise not too bad, quite reasonable for a family meal which is more worth it.

Sushi Tei at Thomson Plaza offers a delightful Japanese dining experience. The restaurant has a warm ambiance with traditional Japanese decoration. Their sushi is fresh and skillfully made, and they have a variety of other tasty Japanese dishes. The service is attentive, but it can get busy during peak hours. Overall, it's a must-visit place for those who enjoy Japanese cuisine in Thomson Plaza.

Servers very kind kept trying to fill my cup with green tea. 😂

The freshness and the taste was acceptable. Pricey a little 113 for two adults one child.

However what makes it nice is the speed of the food. Like machine gun service. 😂 the dishes were flying out fast.

The rest of the dishes were acceptable nothing to complain about. Quite standard Japanese flavour and fare here. If you’re looking at omasake level this is m barely half the fineness. 😂

The desserts were a little too normal for the price. The red bean wasn’t very tasty and the beans were a little hard. Soup was quite plain and sugared. The rest are standard quite similar to ichiban boshi.

A little disappointed for the price but can’t fault the speed and the overall quality which is palatable. See the pics. You’re paying for the decor as well. 😂

I find their consistency over so many outlets and so many years, quite impressive. They very seldom disappoint.
Only sad thing is the portions have shrunk and the prices have risen.

There was a time when Sushi Tei went downhill, but then it picked up again, came back even stronger. At the recent trip to this place, it felt like the food was going downhill again. While quality remains decent, there seem to be a reduction in the portion / quantity, and yet price had increased. This is evident the salmon belly and hotate sushi. Nonetheless, for a quick fix japanese craving, this is still a decent place to head to.

Reviews: 

The food was amazing but a little salty!

Maria did a very good job recommending the dishes.

The restaurant was very busy, we can see that they're short of manpower. Despite that, we wanna shout-out for the tip-top service we received from everyone!!

This was our second visit. We love it so much on our first. Even though, food was taking longer to serve than we expected. But, we thought because the place was packed with people and it was dinner time if I remember correctly, so I guess I can tolerate that. However, on our visit this time, the place only half filled, yet the food is taking around the same amount of time.

Other than that, it’s awesome. My wife thought that the place is somewhat has different vibes compared to the mall, which feels like just a neighbourhood mall. Good atmosphere. Service was good, polite and friendly. Tastes also good, hearty potion (Tokyo Gyu Don).

The food is really great.
Saikoro ribeye beef and Swordfish butteryaki are soft and very fragrant. Roasted dry garlic ma-ze udon is also a dish you should eat. And I really like Snow crab tapas, wild hamachi tartlets, oh my god it's soft, the feeling of eating it melts in your mouth and you will feel its deliciousness.
The space is clean, service is quite fast, no need to wait long. I will definitely come back 🥰

The food is great. Must go for the sashimi bowl. Very fresh. Atmosphere, still alright, because too crowded. Noisy. Service is not good enough. Drinks take multiple turns to serve. Simple beer in bottle took long to arrive, mid way good servings. Others green tea have already served a long time ago. Reminded staff, but jmpatient told me to wait. Bad service.

a really nice place with quality food! def the best restaurant at thompson plaza. the staff are really friendly and helpful as well ☺️ highly recommend the tempura. usually the dipping sauce is cold, but here they heat up the sauce and the difference it made was shocking! it tasted so good!

Reviews: 

Food is good - salad is very fresh with lovely salad dressing. Speed of serving food is good.

The servers are very attentive. Lead server made sure that my elderly aunt was seated at a table that is not too cold.

Back of restaurant, the seats are closer together. We got a nice table for 4 at the entrance.

Would come back again.

the last time i came, the slices were huge and also very fresh. they also gave free ice cream during birthday which was awesome. disclaimer: sometimes the sashimi slices are thinner and not that fresh. but the service staff are attentive and kept refilling the green tea

Nice cosy Japanese restaurant with friendly and prompt service. The food is nice and enjoyable. Ambience is cosy and relax. A break from the congested city restaurant as it is tuck in a shophouse in the middle of residential and industrial  area. Price wise a bit on high but justifiable with the ingredients, food quality and service. Overall a enjoyable dining experience. A nice treasure.

Nov 2022

Exceptional quality for the price. Fresh sashimi & tasty cooked dishes. Throw in good service making this a no-brainer for Japanese cuisine at reasonable price.

UPDATE - Feb 2023
Come again for dinner. The thick cut toro is ok but I have had better. The Saury fish (not in season, so frozen) is perfectly acceptable. Smoked duck with mushroom tastes really good. Tofu salad and cod fish hotpot are not bad either.

Our family always love Japanese Cuisine and Hubby brought us here as he heard the reviews are good.

We ordered Kurobuta Don, Chirashi Don, Chirashi Salmon Steak and Chicken Terikyaki Set. The sashimi is fresh and the kurobuta is delicious! We enjoyed the food here but I guess we are bigger eaters and the portion is not filling for us . :)

Need to make reservation as it is very crowded.

Reviews: 

We were very pleased by the excellent food quality and the prompt, responsive service.

We enjoyed the Premium Pork Loin Katsu Set ($24.90+), which came with a crispy and deep-fried pork cutlet as well as unlimited rice, cabbage, and miso soup.

You can choose from a wide variety of options at the restaurant, including chicken karage and other katsu sets.The gyoza is delicious, juicy, and flavorful.
It's a nice place to get together with loved ones.

I was pleasantly surprised after having a meal here. I didn’t expect much since it is a lesser known tonkatsu place. But after eating here, I would gladly recommend it to anyone who loves pork tonkatsu and ramen. Food portions are sufficient. The tonkatsu had a crispy crust while the pork stayed juicy and succulent. I appreciate the free flow tea and water --  they're one of the few places that still offer free tea and water 🙂.

Came here for lunch today. Ordered the Tonkatsu Pork fillet set which comes with rice, soup, appetizer and fruits. This Tonkatsu set comes with free-flow rice and cabbage. I like that the Tonkatsu pork is deep-fried nicely and not too oily.

My boy ordered the Kyushu Ramen and the soup is rich and flavorful and there are like 5 pieces of Cha Shu which has a nice smoky charred flavour.

Green tea (hot or cold) is on the house. Overall we enjoyed the food here and will definitely be back again!

Had the Tonkatsu Ramen.

🔥 Tonkatsu was crispy and meat was tender (note: not the fatty loin cut, was lean)
😣 Bamboo shoots had overwhelming sulfuric/fart taste, ruined the soup and ramen...
🍜 Noodles were cooked well, decent texture.

Not sure what soup type it was supposed to be originally, but in the end just tasted quite salty and like the bamboo shoots.

Complimentary green tea provided! 🍵

I would rate this 6 stars lol.Honestly I thought the ramen will be smaller and less meat but this proved me wrong! There is 5 pieces of chashu and all of it was so tender and good. The chashu ramen broth was very light but packed a nice subtle flavour to complement. Waiters were also very friendly. I will definitely come back 👍

Reviews: 

We had dinner at this outlet at Thomson Plaza and ordered 3 type of rice bowl with accompanied sets of salad/drink;  Salmon Don, Pork Chasyu Don and Hokkaido Beef Don. The Salmon Don took sometime to be served, though fish meat was fresh. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the pork slices which were tender and well marinated. The beef was nice as well. The outlet has limited seatings, tables are small and there is only few tables for group > 3.

Good quality not bad, quantity more for Primary School kids, can't tell the size from menu picture. Cooking staff seems very unfriendly, there's a customer who spilled the soup over himself and when he requested for serviette, the table staff asked cooking staff to past customer and heard him saying "then no need cook liao arh". 😅

The lobster don  and salmon aburi don is delicious. Can choose add on of $3 - cones with drinks, choice of salad or miso soup  while the $6 add on cones with drinks and either chawan mushi, kareage or hokkaido cream croquette.

A far cry from the standard and quality of their sister restaurant. Granted it is the budget friendly version but for the nominal price difference, I don’t think it’s worth the while. A big step down in authenticity of taste.

$10.90 - Aburi Salmon Mentai Don
$11.90 - Ebi Fried White Curry Rice

This place is opened by sushi tei which is next door. Both our dishes were pretty tasty and the rice was actually really good, though you can tell the salmon wasn't really the high grade sort. However at these prices, you can't really complain.

I'd recommend this place for a quick tasty non traditional Japanese meal, like aburi/truffle/mentaiko stuff.

Used to dine in there and I love the Chirashi. Decided to do take away today. For $16 hotate sashimi and $19 maguro , you can do better in terms of serving and quality. Hotate was thinly sliced and maguro was really fishy. I don’t mind paying for the food but your price and quality must be at least in line with what you are charging.

Everything was amazing, from the chef's friendliness to the waiter's/waitresses' attending. Very satisfied with Ken's cooking and amazing vibes all around. Friendly atmosphere and very fresh ingredients/drinks. Highly recommended.

Cozy little space in a convenient mall. My 10 year old enjoyed her tonkatsu ramen whilst my 7 year old loved his salmon ikura don so much he ordered 2 portions but predictably ate only 1 spoonful from the second bowl before declaring he was too full so I ate that up for him. In addition, the kids had a plate of gyoza each as well, and I quite enjoyed the chawanmushi.

Good drinks, great people and excellent food. The Salmon Sashimi is really fresh. Chefs here are really creative too. Please come and try!

Shoutout to Arlene the waitress, Ken and Andy the chefs for making the place my go to.

This small little joint came as a pleasant surprise. We did an impromptu walk-in on a Saturday afternoon. We were greeted warmly and the service was very good. We were recommended the catch of the day and opted for the Isaki. Half sashimi and half grilled. The remainder of the fish was battered and deep fried into crispy goodness. The sashimi was fresh and succulent while the grilled meat was fragrant and sweet. Overall the food is good. The dried stingray was a surprise as it was one of the better ones I have had. Was hoping the pufferfish come as fried meaty chunks instead of jerkies. The place was cosy and nice to just relax & snack. Overall portions are on the smaller side but prices are not too expensive if you don't go for the catch of the day. Parking is cheap and should be relatively easy to find.

Highly recommend its teishoku with several yummy side dishes: delicious and nostalgic. The Salmon Don also good: great quality of thick cut salmon and bit portion. Yakitori not at the correct point, lacking umami and salt. Overall, a good choice for Japanese family restaurant. And it is really affordable.
The gyoza also amazing

Simple no frills eating place.
Food is overall decent. The sashimi tasted thawed. Katsu-don is ok.

Overall no frills.

Returned here after around a decade. It is just as wonderful as I remember it. There are really few places in Singapore that produce food this homely, consistent and value-for-money.

What have I been doing for all this time?? Feel like I've rekindled a long-lost love. Will try to come back again soon.

Nice cosy restaurant tucked inside this stretch of road famous for prata. Price is reasonable and food is yummy! Service is not bad. Will patronise again when around here. Koebi we tried too not bad.

3rd Nov 2022:
Comfortable & quiet family restaurant with heart-warming food :-) Got the salmon don, 12 pcs sashimi & koe-bi (dried shrimps with mayo), with a bottle of sake to wash it down!

23 Nov 2023:
Finally tried something different- negitoro don. Unfortunately, I feel that the minced tuna is not very fresh so I wouldn’t order it again.

Reviews: 

Had the $58 omakase set which wasn’t worth the price at all. Able to fill up your stomach tho. Dessert was probably the best out of everything, one or two pieces of sushi can be considered decent too.
Staff told us place was packed and didn’t give us really good seats but place had plenty of empty seats. When explaining the dishes, the staff just mumbled through quickly to get it over and done with.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon to try the $58 omakase. Food was overall pretty decent - nothing mind blowing, but it was a pleasant meal. I only feel like the miso soup, dessert and lobster could be improved.

Lobster was clearly frozen and not the freshest because it was pretty dry and tough, and the miso soup was just very very normal like packet miso. Dessert tasted like an odd slightly watery mash of jelly and cheesecake. Sushi and sashimi were good.

Wasn't crowded and ambience was nice.

Decent and chill place to have omakase. You get the food but not the typical omakase experience.
Nonetheless a more than decent dinner 👌

*Note, the beef in the 58++ omakase menu can be changed to a salted egg chicken

Not really like Japen style, the food just normal but the service I feel good.
We order the $58 and $88 and the drink is sake. But for food I feel not really fresh….. especially seafood. So that’s why I feel so so. I think the price I can eat better at other restaurants. ╮(╯▽╰)╭

Nice ! Omakase excellent.. perfect timing served for each dish..Delicious.  Server's very pleasant & good service. Reasonable price.. will be back..best to book reservation.

The service is impeccable in Oka. From the head chef, teppanyaki chef  to the floor staff. Always approachable and friendly. Food portion is generous and cook to perfection.  Will definitely visit again.

Decor can be improved, can create a more Japanese cosy restaurant feel.

Chef Tommy is truly the best when it comes to food quality and service. Everything seems right. The ingredients are good and cooked to perfection. The personal service by Chef Tommy is par excellence! Definitely worth many repeat visits.

Great food. Prices went up slightly compared to before but quality is great. Staff was very friendly and it was a pleasant experience.

My family loves this place as it has Teppanyaki and also regular Japanese food.

We dined at the Teppanyaki counter so my kids can enjoy seeing the chef in action and it was a good decision.

Chef Tommy was very helpful and suggested to us what we can order for kids. His food is also very good! From the scallops, butter prawn, goma chicken and pork belly to the garlic fried rice, all the Teppanyaki items were delicious!

We also ordered Salmon Sashimi, Agedashi Tofu, Tori Karaage and Puffer fish appetiser from the kitchen and they were great too. Highly recommend this place.

I was very busy with the kids and forgot to take pics of the food, and only managed to take pictures at the end of the meal. It was for a birthday celebration.

Very fresh and tasty Japanese food. For SICC members and guests only.

Reviews: 

Just had a weekend lunch at Watami Junction 8, nice that it is not too crowded and the service was good. Food wise I would say it is average because my tempura is oily, the beef hot pot with spicy miso was okay. The chocolate lava cake is a bit over done and the cut open the chocolate inside does not flow out which is a bit disappointing. Well the overall meal is a good value for money but do expect the quality to be a bit inferior to other Japanese restaurants.

First time trying this, and was surprised at the affordability and the quality of the food. Noticed this for some time but never stepped in as I thought it was going to be pricey, but we ended up spending less than $20/pax.

Ordered the seafood hotpot as well as the set items (chawanmushi, apple and udon/soba) and they were tasty! They have a pretty wide range of food items on the menu - including sushi, noodles, rice, sashimi etc.

Queue was pretty fast - the sign said waiting time was 15-55 minutes, but I got in within 5 minutes. Food also came pretty quickly - served within 15 minutes.

I will likely return again the next time I want Japanese food.

Ordered 3 pax set, a bit too much for 3, we left some foods. Love the salad with pumpkin slices especially. Forgot to take pictures of the rest, tempura, salad, beef rice with egg, fish. Membership discount 10%.

Came here for dinner. Food is good for 3 pax. Quality and taste is still relatively good. Fantastic  food experience.

The set for two is sufficient for a family of four.  You get to choose the dishes you want with the set. The dishes are also served promptly. Ambience could be better if lights were dimmer.

A hidden Thai outlet in industrial estate with strong support from the nearby workforce. Food is authentic n lunch value set can be considered. Delicious 😋

Very decent Thai food for its price. Used to be cheaper and came here a lot when studying at a school nearby. Prices went up since 2017 but the food is excellent. The Thai Beef green curry is a must get, so is the basil sauce fish fillet. It is closed from 3-6pm so take note. Recently they seem to start taking reservations, so if you have a big group might want to call earlier to get seats. The Thai milk tea and lemon grass drinks are very nice!

Comfort meal with decent Thai food.
We’ve dined at this outlet several times, good quality food is served here. If you enjoy milky curry, do give their green curry a try, tastier when soaked in the pineapple rice. Their appetizers are all good too, prawn cake is our favourite. Yummy Thai iced tea and green milk tea, sadly the mango sticky rice is always sold out. Take note that Jai Thai doesn’t serve Thai pork dishes.

Decent Thai food with reasonable price. I personally love their fried “Kang Kong” and clear tomyam soup. Will try out other Thai dishes, green beef curry, pandan chicken, etc in the future…

Been eating here for many years, maybe my own taste buds have changed as well but the food doesn't seem as good. A bit too sweet like every other generic thai food chain.

Other than that the prices have gone up and portions have gone down, but that can be said for most places since COVID so it's understandable

Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

All the food was great and in good portions! Seafood pad Thai definitely worth it and not too salty or oily. Mango sticky rice was great as well - not overly sweet and just the right size for sharing at the end of the meal.

Would return to try more dishes!

Nice thai food of good quality.

1. Welcoming appetisers for the platter
2. Thai coconut seafood soup is the best dish from our order
3. The quality of the fish fillet needs some improvement

Service: Good!

Ordered too much and no space for dessert.

Overall can be spicier hence we requested for the kitchen to up the spice level.

Knew we fell into a tourist trap the minute we stepped inside.... Food looked really pleasing from the reviews here, but you're really paying for plating and not authentic thai food. The prices were unreasonably high for thai food in Singapore, too, so no wonder we're the only locals here.  🤣

1. Locals are lined up next door while we stupidly paid tourist/ western prices. Didn't do a good job separating white people's reviews from the noise.

2. The signature Otah at $3++ a scoop was not satisfying. I thought there'd be a special way of cooking with the clay covers, but these was deco. Fish was tough and Otah didn't have 1 ounce of coconut / banana leaf flavour. Basically fish balls with somewhat coconuty paste

3. Fried rice had no wok hei and was deconstructed for no good reason - your chilli padi and onions and whatever that yellow thing was, was raw. Maybe for people to adjust to their preferred spicy levels.

4. Tomyum was recommended by the waitress as their signature but was sour and fishy as heck. Like what is this....

5. Place looks dated and nothing like the pictures from 6 years ago

6. Ok but to be fair, one dish was good and  somewhat unique: Crab Meat Curry. This I will recommend if you want to eat here.

Everything seen here + 4 beers amounted to $160. Could have gone next door or any other thai restaurant for maybe 40-50% less. Note to self: sift carefully for local reviews next time. Take the "worthy of a Michelin star" review with a dollop of salt.

Interior is kept clean and very presentable. Definitely more towards a fine dining type of venue.

Portions were rather small for the price, for what can be considered common dishes.

The food was made to be on the milder side, which is less than authentic. The stir fry and texture of the noodles were pretty well done though.

Absolutely a welcoming place and a must try Thai restaurant in Singapore. They have a great choice of vegetarian options and its absolutely vegetarian! The flavour, taste, service was very good and would recommend this place!

Rating: 4
Reviews: 

Enjoy my dinner with my family in this new outlet. Portions are generous and the flavour is fantastic. My favourite is the Thai iced chendol and please add $1 for the red ruby as it’s very delicious.
Definitely will come back again. 👍❤️

New location is bright n clean. We arrived minutes b4 11. Friendly wait staff ushered us in. However, food took long to b served. Assorted veg platter comes with 2 fishes. Don't think this is indicated in d menu. Won't b nice if vegetarians order this dish. d sambal dip for d steamed veg is good. Disappointed that only red chilli padi is served. Where's d green ones??

Will return again for d reasonably-priced food.

Pad Thai was good. Tom Yum Soup was good. Pineapple Fried Rice was bland and unimpressive. Pandan Leaf Chicken was big but over-fried and dry. Rosella drink was pleasant.

*Update: Very thirsty after the meal. Restaurant uses a high amount of MSG, most likely in the soup. I wouldn’t revisit.

Didn’t have to wait long for the table or food, service was pretty okay. Food was good but not the best Thai food I’ve had in Singapore. Pineapple fried rice is very good and has a nice wokhei! Their snack corner has pretty tasty snacks, try the fried chicken skin!

Food was horrendous, sarcastically a feast for your palette. Been to their Golden Mile outlet and food was decent. Re crowd, there was no one on a Saturday afternoon. Mall parking - was tough to find a lot, perhaps due to the F1 weekend.

• Tom yum soup - salty, numbing for all senses
• Basil beef - dry and tasteless
• Prawn omelette - minimal chopped up / small prawns in the middle which almost couldn’t be found, super oily
• Kailan roast pork - oily, bad consistency, pork was soggy and pieces were too huge, vege was black (which I ate most of anyway hence you can’t see in the images)

Total damage $57


Option: 4:
Name: Patara Fine Thai Cuisine (Rebranded to SARAI)
Address: 163 Tanglin Rd, #03-122, Singapore 247933

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

This restaurant, nestled away on an upper floor of Tanglin Mall, is a great place to come when you want high-quality Thai food. It’s not inexpensive but the quality of the food and service are great, the atmosphere is relaxed and spacious, and they do have a range of set menu options, as well, if that’s what you want. We’ve never had a bad meal here. I think it’s also a good place to bring guests. If you want Thai street food or mass market, there are other places for that, but for more of a fine dining experience, this is a great choice.

Overall the menu looks Pricy. So ordering set meal . Overall taste are not authentic Thai.  Salad taste unique but made mostly from a fruit . The Tom Yum is very salty , the small prawns are not original prawn (懷疑泡過硼砂）.  The beef taste more like Indian style rather than Thai style .

The plus point is the service .

To conclude :  it’s a good place with good ambience and decorations. However if you are looking for authentic Thai food you need to look else where .

“Fine dining price without the fine dining experience!”

Look somewhere else if you’re looking for Thai fine dining. This place is cosy and impressive at first sight, until you have to interrupt your guests by leaving your seat to call the waitresses over. Yes, service is almost non-existent as I had to leave my seat on several occasions just to get a waiter. Not to say too, the food was not impressive. We looked at each other and agreed in unison that we had all experienced better ones in town.

A regretful visit. To sum it up in a sentence, “Fine dining price without the fine dining experience.”

Thai food flavours that come across as being refined, without being excessively salty or laden with MSG, as would be the case if one is used to typical Thai food budget options that are abound everywhere in local estates. We enjoyed some of the dishes, which stood out uniquely - the stir-fried crispy pork with homemade curry paste and long beans, and the fried prawns in filo pastry with avocado mousse. The Iced Thai Milk Tea is robust in its tea flavour, with the sugar syrup on the side. Ambience is a warm amber feel, while service is attentive. Price wise, well, it's not called "fine cuisine" for nothing, definitely not a price range one commonly associates with usual Thai joints. Our a la carte orders for a family of 5 came up to $315. The restaurant does run buffet options at $50 per person on certain days of the week, and they also have a range of set menu options.

came here for dinner during weekdays.  requested for window seats.

good decor, ambience and spacing.  surprisingly the service has wow-factor, i felt like i was in Thailand!👍

very comfortable and all the ordered food was good.  the fish and its dressing, however, were a bit bland for my liking.

Rating: 4
Reviews: 

Quite authentic Thai food, and decent service. Hard to get to unless you drive but parking is free! Their Thai milk tea is really sweet and flavourful, and did I mention it's really sweet?

The Baked Honey Pork Ribs is decent, though it does seem like they only season it last minute. They did cook it until the meat inside was soft but the flavour of the honey is only on the outside, and the inside of the meat doesn't have the same flavour.

Service is good though, and ambience is good. Quiet lunch with maybe 3 other tables with patrons.

Surprise! A dinner date with my husband who chanced upon this place and decided to bring me here.

The place was dim, though, with hanging light bulbs that made it cosy. However, the surrounding area gave me a sensing that this place is abandoned with lots of empty flower pots and other decoration pieces lying around. The sight just makes me feel creepy, especially at night. Of course I am not sure if it's the design/theme of the restaurant.

When I flipped through the menu, the condition of it gives customers a not so pleasant impression. The menu was old, pages were crumbled or wrinkled. The least can be done is to reprint the pages of the menu. Prices for the dishes were little on the high side but that is because I think of the fine cuisine that we are going to have. True enough, I was right!

For 2 pax, we ordered:
1. Thai Fried Rice with Prawns(4 pcs)
- was tad oily
- not much of fragrance
- portion was big that could feed 3 to 4(small eaters)
- accompanied sides were salad, 2 slices of cucumber and a slice of tomato

2. Tom Yum Clear Soup with Seafood
- came in a pot that has a burner underneath
- taste was sour and spicy
- could feed 3 pax

3. Honey Chicken
- Chicken seemed to be fried but not overly done. Still could taste the tenderness of the chicken.
- could feed 2-3 pax
- nothing fantastic, quite ordinary

4. Stir fried dou miaow with garlic
- vegetables maintained its crunch but could blanch it slightly more as it has that rawness of the vegetables taste
- could feed 3 pax

5. Mango drink
- refreshingly good

6. Mango sticky rice
- to go for no matter how full you are
- rice was done up nicely and mangoes were riped and had a good combination of 80% sweetness and 20% sourness
- mangoes blended well with the rice and not forgetting the coconut milk when drizzled onto the rice just enhances its taste. Yummy!!!

We visited this restaurant for lunch after a round of golf at the Champions. One of us is a Thai native and she commented that the food here is really authentic Thai. The only few places you can find real good Thai food, other than Golden Mile, is this place. We had Thai green curry, Thai basil pork, pineapple fried rice with prawns (even though this is not really Thai but it's really delicious), and stuffed chicken wings. The outdoor seating is really rustic and pleasant, albeit a few smokers around us. Service can be improved as there is only one lady serving the entire area.

Recommend by my friend. Went to the other side for cafe. Never know that there is another well-hidden for Thai food. It is so right inside the area, so conceal into the greenery.

Ordered more than 5 dishes including the desserts. The tom yum soup was so yummy. So was the fish cake.

Nice rustic place right next to a course course range. Food was good but what I love most was the environment - something you don't get alot from urbanised Singapore. Sadly I understand that they will be closing on 17 Dec 2023.

Reviews: 

This Thai restaurant located in Holiday Inn Little India.
Great ambiance and service. Food didn’t taste so strong like the authentic one but it’s good for someone who is new to Thai cuisine or can’t bare the strong smell of the fish sauce.
Mango sticky rice was not really good, coconut milk was bland, mango was too ripped and the sticky rice was dry at the outside.

The Thai food here was amazing and exceeded my expectations. Some of the must order would be the stir fried beef and lemongrass sea bass. Both sauces were so appetizing and addictive and both the meats were very thick and tender.

The mango sticky rice is also recommended as you'll get a whole mango that's sweet and juicy, accompanied by three beautiful pieces of blue pea glutinous rice. Kudos to the servers as well as they were efficient in refilling the free water and making sure we're well taken care of.

Had an appetizing lunch at this outlet. Staff were warm and friendly and did a great job with the food recommendations. Finished off with a nice dessert and hot Thai tea. The lemongrass drink is not very aromatic and hope to see more items on the menu. IHG members can get 20% discount off the price. Bento sets take away are available to order online.

Friendly and welcoming, like the laid back atmosphere. Menu is rather limited for Thai dishes. Pad thai, tom yum soups, mango and papaya salads were well done. Rest of the dishes were average. Rather pricey, and for quite a number of dishes to add on meats will have an increase in price. Enter via hotel lobby lift to reach the 5th floor.

Ambience itself enough to get really relaxing time here with nice view of their roof top garden and pool.  variety of Thai Indian and western dishes available. Had western and Thai. Really good. Staffs are also friendly and quality of service really appreciated.

Reviews: 

The food there is scrumptious and the service is excellent 👍🤩☺️. The owner is also very nice and gregarious!😊 What a gem in queenstown area! Don’t miss it if you stop by QT!

I spent SGD$103.35 including Lalamove delivery charges for lunch from Joe's Kitchen. At 11.30AM, an old lady called to inform me that the item advertised on their web page on Oddle Eats was discontinued and they did not update their web page/store.  She then told me she would substitute with Thai fish cakes, giving me no choice. Delivery was scheduled to be 12 to12:30Noon. DELIVERY ONLY ARRIVED AT 1.30PM. I called the restaurant to check about my order which had failed to arrive on time. The staff told me I should call Oddle Eats. SHe said she does not know anything!  I later checked their Glass Door Reviews - not good working environment!

So I had to contact Oddle Eats searching for my order and was told Lalamove delivery was on the way. So from 11:30AM to 1:30PM, I was waiting for my order and super hungry. The food from Joe's Kitchen is BLAH. Brocolli was over-cooked, vermicelli with prawns came with NO PRAWNS (paid $23.40) and the Phad Thai was a clump. The deep fried crispy fish was not fresh and not crispy. The fish flesh was soft like porridge. The Thai fish cakes horribly salty.

Delivery  by Lalamove = SUPER LATE
Staff from Joe's Kitchen = HORRIBLE and CLUELESS; NOT CUSTOMER ORIENTATED
Quality of food from Joe's Kitchen =  Salty, overcooked, terrible and not fresh

DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMENDED. Will never order again from Joe's Kitchen.

I ordered a Thai red ruby to go. Found HUGE lumps of redness and one even had a hair in it. This is terrible. They use teeny pieces of chestnut filled with a whole ball of starch. Super unauthentic and unethical.

Food came out slow. Tomyum soup and basil pork and kailan were not up to standard but I would say the pandan chicken, prawn cake and fishmaw soup with crab meat was good. Fried rice was not oily, healthier.

We're back after 6 years to try the food here! We came in a group 4 adults for lunch on a rainy Sunday. Quite empty.

We tried:
1. Mango salad
2. Clear tomyum seafood soup
3. Beef green curry
4. Pad thai
5. Honey chicken
6. Garlic pork
7. Mango sticky rice
8. Red ruby

Out of all the dishes we ordered, the pad thai was most disappointing as they fried it with tomato sauce. 🥲

The rest of the dishes are 100%!! Loved them! 😍

We had a lunch treat at A-Roy Thai Restaurant at Novena Square.
There were 9 of us, we may have over ordered as there were leftovers.
I must say that the Thai food here is really delicious and authentic.
Special mention of the fish (cooked in lime sauce) - very fresh and well cooked.
As it was a treat, I don’t know the actual bill amount paid.
Definitely will come back - suggest in a group of 6 or more so you can order a variety of dishes. Tip: share the rice so you can enjoy the dishes

Located at a convenient place at Level 3 at Novena Square. A very decorated big place. Staff are helpful and friendly. Vegetarian dishes are available. Fried chicken omelette, tom yam (spicy) soup are awesome. Enjoyed the lunch meal and portions with the four of us. The price may be slightly pricer but the food is really tasty. If you feel like eating good Thai food, this is recommended.

Quite a busy Thur evening dinner crowd! Definitely a favourite w regular customers who like authentic Thai food. Food was served fast and hot and tasty. Pad- Thai was fried perfect and the stuffed Chicken Wings always a favourite. Good portions and lots to choose from the menu. Including the mango sticky rice dessert. Enjoy!

Mum’s friend recommended this restaurant for dinner and we went back to this restaurant twice within the week. The food was amazing. Great and friendly staff! Highly recommended and great to go with family or group of friends. Authentic Thai food!

This place is very clean and the servers sterilise the tables and chairs thoroughly. Authenticity is legit from the quality of food and you can see many Thai diners as well. Tom yum soup has a kick and is not for non-spicy eaters. Hope to try the curries in future.

Came to this outlet a few times and the food has been consistent over the years. Flavourful Thai food and fast service. Spicy and good! Prices are also quite comparable. Price came to about $150 for 8 people with sharing dishes. Good  value!

Nestled at a corner of cheong chin nam road is a Halal certified (please recheck for validity before going) restaurant serving delicious authentic thai food.

Serving portions were big. Special mention on the mango salad, it was super tasty and authentic! So were the dishes we had. You will love it if you prefer slight saltiness in your food. We love what we ordered!

Service was good. Food ordering via QR code. Food served within a decent time and the prices are decent (with exception to the prawn vermiselli which is pricier given the number of prawn given). One probable issue for some patrons is the limited availability of airconditioned seating area.

Will definitely be back.

No frill Thai food. Anytime crave for decent Thai food with decent price this is the place. Try their glass noodle phat Thai, crab meat fried rice, basil chicken and mango salad. All rather authentic. Also you can select less spicy so good for people who cannot take spicy food.

Stumbled upon this gem after hiking at bukit timah. If you are craving for a spicy tom yum soup, this is THE place for you. Our orders came within 20mins. Not crowded even during weekend afternoon too! Near DTL and parking lots available. Price is wallet friendly!

Had been craving for a clear tom yum soup for quite some time now bcos Far East plaza’s cahaya restaurant weren’t selling them anymore. Fyi, Time for thai serves red and clear tom yum soup too!

Their soup was utterly rich in flavour and we ordered more spicy version. I can confirm my tongue was burning but not to worry, its not as numbing as Mala. You know how your throat feels powdery after slurping down some tom yum soup? This tom yum doesn’t do that! Fragrance weren’t overwhelming and the seafood portion were adequate. If you are starving, get the large portion. Rice is not included

Papaya salad was a refreshing appetiser. Tangy, slightly spicy and peppered with crushed peanuts, each bite doesn’t disappoint. Serving was big though, i would say definitely too much for 1pax.

Pandan chicken was alright. Only comes in 3pcs per serving i believe. I prefer Koh nangkram’s (along bugis st) pandan chicken tbh.

Home-made iced lemongrass and thai green tea was delicious. Iced lychee, again normal & safe bet if u didnt know what to order. Will come again for sure.

It’s literally Time for Thai, as we just walked-in after seeing the eatery from the overhead bridge!

There was a set meal for 2 but being small eaters, we ordered ala carte instead. My favourite would be the big & tasty Prawn cakes, the Fried glass noodles were not bad too (although it contains mainly vegetables, u can top up for meat/ seafood), & the Tom yum chicken red soup was spicy!

IG @pingguo301

Reviews: 

*if u don’t like ants, please don’t go to this restaurant. I found many ants on table while I am eating”
簡單來說 : 沒味道，沒鑊氣，價格貴，桌子上有螞蟻，我不知道那些5星好評哪來的。
Sorry to saying that… but I don’t know why this Thai restaurant can get many good review…
Base on the price, this Thai restaurant doesn’t worth it. I suggest travellers can go for Thai food in hawker centre. Taste is not authentic AT ALL, maybe is Singapore style Thai food ONLY. Not real THAI FOOD
First, the pad Thai. Tasteless, no “Wok Hei” 無鑊氣
U know… Thai stir fry cuisine are supposed to use hard fire so to make everything with “Wok Hei” 鑊氣 it just like they boil the noodle and mix with sauce for me when I am eating their pad Thai
For the Thai lemon fish. The soup is like water… not sour at all. It doesn’t worth $34 (even more expansive than I eat in Australia). Believe me, don’t order it, go for this fish is hawker centre, much better than this!!!
And the papaya salad…. Tasteless too, can’t taste the fish sauce and the lime juice. I don’t think they make it in a Thai way as all the ingredients are not mixed well.

Very disappointed. $85 something for 2 people. I rather go to hawker centre than this.

For the restaurant reply : thank you for replying my review. But fresh ingredients doesn’t means that you cook it right & nice and authentic… u know… it about how u cook not about the ingredients. You can cook bad even u have good ingredients.

While searching for vegan/vegetarian Thai food we landed here. The restaurant is located in Chinatown. There wasn't any waiting to get seated. We ordered vegan pineapple fried rice and vegan Pad Thai. Both were delicious in taste and quantity is decent for the price. The service was fast too. Overall satisfied with our meal.

Pad Thai is really really good! Spring roll is okay, pork skewer is very tender and taste well too. The butterfly pea drink is sweet but very refreshing.

Hmm ambience is cool. Service is considerably warm but unorganised. Loved how the gray hair woman always have a smile on her face. There was a bit of miscommunication as my friend wanted her coffee w/o iced on a to go but afterwards, they gave her what she wants. It arrived with more ice than usual.

We enjoyed our dinner! Might come back soon too!

We ordered chargrilled pork skewers, which taste nice with the sauce. The pad Thai has the chicken option, which we think is yummy, as well as basil pork rice. Iced Thai green tea is too sweet even tho we have ordered half sugar, but the iced lemongrass tea is impressive. One of the best Thai food I have in Singapore.

If you love food as much as I do, you will enjoy the place. Great selection (even for me - allergic to rice!) And impeccable service. They are a little pricey though and the vegetables were a little too salty.

Still, I would definitely come back. Really favour the basil chicken. Robust flavour and not too salty.
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the tom yum soup too!

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

Welcome to delightful India right in the middle of Singapore. Located in Race Course road and in the vicinity of Little India this place screams authenticity. The quaint place had nice decor and a good vibe. We had the butter chicken, lady finger vegetable curry, fish tikka, garlic and cheese Naan as well as a starter which was a flatbread filled with a spinach style filling and a curry on the side to dip the bread.  For drinks we had a mango lassi and lime juice. Everything was delicious and the service was delightful and friendly. Recommended to make a reservation as it got quite busy on a Thursday evening.

Excellent dinner at Mustard on Race Course Rd. Restaurant is small and intimate and service is excellent and attentive.  They have a huge menu with tons of choices so we ordered way too much to try many things. Everything was wonderful but especially recommend the house special Chingri Maacher Malai, the Aloo Jhuri, Mutton Biryani and the kathi kababs.

Located in the Little India neighborhood. This restaurant has friendly staff, of which unfortunately not everyone speaks English.

Food menu is extensive and you don't have to wait very long on your food. Not everything was of my personal taste, but I am sure the food was nice. Also enough dessert choices and even typical Indian drinks.

Do note that the air conditioning is very cold here, somewhat too cold (heard the same thing from a co-worker who visited earlier).

Had a very enjoyable meal here. You can taste the actual flavours, aroma, spices.

As compared to other restaurants, you can taste the actual ingredients in the sauces, as they use fresh ingredients and fresh spices.

The briyani was extremely aromatic as well!

10/10 would come back again!

Excellent food!

We arrived at opening at 11:30 specifically bent on enjoying authentic Bengali food—we left satisfied and glad we came early!

The waiters are able to make excellent recommendations. We opted to go straight for mains:

- Kosha Mangsho: tender chunks of mutton in a fantastic thicker gravy

- Chingri Maacher Malai Curry: delicate shrimp and coconut curry presented in a tender coconut

- Maacher Paturi: boneless fish fillet smothered in mustard, gently steamed in a banana leaf

Rice bread does not come with each main, and does require separate purchasing. We opted for:
- Luchi: aka puri, lightly fried and crisp
- Roomali Roti: one roti is rather large, and folded in on itself; delicate with a great chew
- Plain white rice

For dessert, we enjoyed Rossomalai (aka Rasmalai), a dessert in most areas of India, but theirs is fragrant and richly flavored with cardamom, almonds, and cream.

All in all, a fantastic visit for those who enjoy Indian food and are looking for something different than what most restaurants serve. They do include Punjabi items in their menu, which is typically what most people think of when they think “Indian,” but venturing off to possibly “unfamiliar” dishes won’t disappoint!

One of best restaurants of Singapore to have authentic North Indian food. The interiors of the restaurant has a heritage kind of a feel and staff is very polite and courteous.

Though a bit expensive than usual, food quality and quantity was upto the mark and the food was delicious. Even the mouth freshener was really tasty. Would recommend visiting this place for authentic North Indian food.

Nice place and food tasted good. Especially the carrot halwa and chicken kebab. Fish gravy was little off... did not like it. Staffs were kind. The taxi dropped off me at fairmount hotel... but this restaurant is at raffles city shopping mall. But no worries, since both buildings were interconnected, I could just walk to the next. There is a corner to conduct some performance like singing. Reaaaaly traditional for Indians... haha.

Lovely service and food. Had my sons birthday there cos he wanted something different.  The lunch buffet on weekend is best value!! Lovely quality especially the appetisers.  And don't be mistaken the latter was rhe main course for us. Best you can order again and again!! The curries and nans as well as the dessert cum fruits were wonderful. My daughter who love the Indian food in Philadelphia was especially enjoying all the food including the sauces . And they were so kind to take a picture of the family and birthday and gave us a frame for that as well.. well done guys. Only down side, the deco has been there for many years.. a little dated but still acceptable lah..

This Indian restaurant in Singapore offers a unique dining experience. Unlike other Indian restaurants where I usually find the food heavy for dinner, here they have mastered the art of using a delightful blend of spices like turmeric, tamarind, cumin, fennel, and cardamom. The dishes, especially the curry-based ones like lamb, curry snapper fish, and chicken masala, are absolutely fantastic, and they pair wonderfully with the naan and roti. Don't miss out on the flavorful biryani rice too. To add to the exceptional experience, the wine selection, particularly the Shiraz, is a perfect complement to the meal. All of this, combined with the great service provided by Sunjav, makes it a truly memorable restaurant visit.

Amazing experience. The service was so good. Sitting buffet starters, many varieties and can be served multiple times as well as per our requirements. Main course items were less,
The quality of food is good. Their service is exceptional.
While booking the reservation, we mentioned we are coming for a birthday lunch, they arranged kulfi ice cream cake. They took photos and got them printed for us and given as a birthday card, which is unique.
Highly recommended

Reviews: 

As a Chinese Singaporean, I found the dinner to be extremely delectable. Parking can be done nearby in parallel to those shophouses. It was my first time having a South Indian cuisine, I really have no idea what to order so I kindly requested for recommendations and everything was pleasing to my taste bud. The person who took my order yesterday was really patient as well.

Giving my layman description, I’ve ordered meen pollichathu (Marinated spicy boneless fish wrapped in banana leaf), gobi manchurian (fried cauliflower sauteed with special sauce), kozhi porichathu (fried chicken marinated with various spices), porata (its like local roti prata but less oily), fish curry with mango, malabar mutton biriyani, mango lassi (yoghurt drink) and lemon soda. My favourite got to be the gobi manchurian as I have never tasted cauliflower done like this before. Biriyani portion was great for 2 pax sharing or for 1 hungry person, the mutton was yummy as well. Meen Pollichathu needs no explanation as it is one of their best seller and portion is reasonable for their price. The kozhi porchathu was probably my least fav as the chicken felt like its double fried since its a little hard, otherwise the taste is really good. Food were all served within 15mins upon ordering and the temperature was hot (everything is made fresh). Total bill came out to be around ~$87 for 2. I personally think its reasonable as I was extremely full by the end of the dinner and have no stomach for dessert haha.

Would definitely being my Kerala colleagues to try their dishes one day.

This place is special in its way of treating your taste buds with the kerala food in Singapore. The service is good, and the ambiance gives you the picture of the land Kerala.

Went for Onam Sadhya.. all the items served were cold and tasted like cooked in the morning and served for dinner. Taste was also bland and not worth Sadhya. Nothing special in the “Sadhya” served and definitely not worth $24!
Better have Andhra meal at any restaurant, its better taste and value for money.

Amazing food😀!!!. Excellent service. It’s an authentic place to get typical South Indian food.Especially Kerala cuisine. 😋Highly recommend !!!

I've only had lunch meals at this restaurant. The  quality of the meals is inconsistent. When it's good, it's really good.

They offer a lot of meat dishes and only a handful of vegetarian items. But there is enough here to get a good experience of the range and taste of Kerala-food.

Edit: In subsequent visits, the quality further dropped. The vegetarian meals were not served on the banana leaf, the rasam was the worst I've tasted, the puliseri looked pale and was just sweet, the ulli theeyal was too sugary, and everything else was average.

Delicious! I am craving for the food again. They are tasty and taste authentic. I would come again.

I like the service from staff, though they should check on us less. 😅 We had four people asking us about how everything was. The service was excellent because we were asked if we could take spicy food. When the food was served, it was individually to us; it felt like a special treat.

Location is also worth mentioning. I could think of another option where I could get delicious Indian food, but having Punjab Grill at MBS is perfect because there is so much to do around.

One of the best North Indian restaurants I have ever had a meal at. Under the stewardship of their new Chef Gorang Anand the menu and the cooking has been taken to a whole new level. Must try if you live in or visit Singapore.

Actually didn't spend a single cent, was a treat (Pre-opening Dinner Party). Went without knowing what to expect. The restaurant is in MBS. Heard from someone that this is one of the places serving best Indian food in Singapore. The food is relatively yummy. Chicken is tender. Naan is yummy. The uniforms of the waiters add to the uniqueness of the place. The waiters are relatively polite.

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Singapore. I always spend a time to eat there when I am in town. The food is super delicious, service is great and they gave me some Deepavali seasonal dessert the last time I ate there.  Fantastic!!!

Definitely a must-go dining spot to  have food at Panjab Grill to have memorable experience Whether it's a unique chef's Mr Gorang Anand  tasting menu and the staff of Panjab Grill restaurant goes the extra mile to make each visit special.

In addition to the exceptional food and service, Panjab Grill also boasts a tastefully decorated interior that reflects the cultural and flavour richness of India. The attention to detail is evident in every corner, creating an ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

The chef Mr Gorang Anand at Panjab Grill are true maestros in their craft, consistently delivering dishes that not only tantalize the taste buds but also celebrate the art of presentation.

Each plate is a work of art, a testament to the chef's commitment to both flavour and aesthetics.

The presentation is so visually appealing that it almost feels like a shame to disturb the arrangement, but the flavours are so irresistible that you won't be able to resist diving in.

The staff at Panjab Grill are more than just servers; they are passionate ambassadors of Indian cuisine. Their knowledge of the menu is impressive, and their recommendations are spot-on.

They create a welcoming atmosphere, making every guest feel like an honoured visitor in their home. The service is prompt, attentive, and infused with genuine warmth that adds to the overall surprising dining experience and homely taste abroad.  Standout dishes include the  “Makki ki roti sarson ka saag” , a culinary marvel that exemplifies the chef's expertise in blending spices and textures. The “Paneer Bhurji” is a revelation, with a perfect balance of heat and sweetness that dances on the palate. And let's not forget the “Ras Malai, Urad Dal Seera,” a divine finale that will leave you craving for more.

Whether you're a vegetarian enthusiast or a carnivore looking to explore the world of dining, Panjab Grill is a culinary destination that deserves a special place on your must-visit list. It's more than just a restaurant; it's a celebration of flavours, a journey through the diverse and delectable world of Indian vegetarian cuisine.

In addition to the exceptional food and service, Panjab Grill also boasts a tastefully decorated interior that reflects the cultural and flavour richness of India. The attention to detail is evident in every corner, creating an ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience.

Prepare your taste buds for a symphony of spices and a culinary experience that transcends the ordinary!

This restaurant gave us the authentic flavours of India in the heart of Singapore ✨

Reviews: 

The food was alright, not the best I would say in comparison to other places we went charging cheaper. We asked food to be non-spicy but it came spicy. Juice was fresh and came in big cups! Only thing which we felt was worth it. Service was also very friendly but we got a shocker when our bill came!

Firstly the person who served us mistook our order and got us 3 starter soups. We were excited to see 3 small bowls and felt he divided the soup bowl for us. We are used to being served 1 big bowl of soup and him giving 3 was thought of as being kind.
Those 3 bowls however popped up on our bill! When we questioned that when we had made individual orders, he just removed 1 bowl. Didn't cause much fuss and paid. And yes, that soup...not fresh but did not taste or smell aged. Regardless, was microwave heated. Could see the usual microwave stains of oil residue you can easily see inside the bowl and tell it was microwaved.

Why I am giving just a 1 star because what is most disappointing is we were also charged a 10% service charge on top of our meals! I just found out now when calculating our expenses. This the first time to experience that additional charge besides GST in Singapore. Even GST is already added, what you see is what you pay...but unfortunately, not here!
If you want to save costs, I'll recommend going elsewhere. A family member wanted to have a North Indian experience and quite some experience it was.
Due to open setting, there were also some men who were just staring at my mother and when us men looked, they immediately turned their heads away! What nuisance!

Will I plan to go here again? Nah, I'd even avoid crossing this place.

Generous serving!
Had buttered chicken, decent but I've had better ones. The vegetable biryani was good and had ample variation on the vegetables. The mango lassi is pretty good, have that.
A filling meal overall.

Visited this place couple of times last week. Staff is very courteous and food is super. Not spicy at all. Tried veg/chicken biryani, mee goreng, nasi goreng, mutter paneer, naan, etc and everything was super.

Good food and friendly staff , definitely will come back to try other dishes!

Good food and reasonable price. They open until late night. Call first if you going there after 12am.
