Food was amazing and prepared fantastically - delicious and hearty Greek/Mediterranean fare. All the restaurant staff were exceptionally warm, friendly, and kind, and it felt like we were having a sit down dinner at a family home. For the birthday celebration, everyone sang happy birthday as well and we were so well taken care of. The ambience was amazing. Definitely must try and we will definitely come back.

Great Greek Food

Had dinner with a bunch of friends. We ordered to share. The meat sharing platter was of high quality and cooked to perfection despite it being a dish with many different types of meat. The breads and dips were also great.

Service was excellent. We had them arrange tables and then changed tables. They accommodated us each step of the way without any fuss. Service came promptly with a smile.

The place certainly lived up to its Mykonos name - blue and white furniture graced the place. Outdoor sitting was comfortable with ceiling ELV fans constantly cooling the place next to the water.

We went to Mykonos by the bay on 1st July to celebrate my daughter’s birthday. I must say that the service staff was quite friendly but the  quantity of the food actually disappointed us. The food was nice but portions were extremely small so we have to order more food. Specially the platter, which was priced at $29 was totally not worth as the dips portions were too small.

Food is excellent, especially the fish, perfect with the creamy garlic source. Not too crowded on a Monday night, it was windy and comfortable with the outdoor seats. Staffs are attentive. Overall very pleasant experience.

Awesome grilled octopus, hummus and taramosalata. Love the breads. A little pricey but ok to indulge once in a while. Service staff were friendly and attentive too.

First time at this restaurant, and I can say the dining experience was great.

Food is great and the serving is not bad as well.  I can only say good things about the service of the Staffs.
The place is easy to find and the ambience is something to remember.


Option: 2:
Name: The Mediterranean Deli Turk

Rating: 4.7
Reviews: 

Third time back at this restaurant and certainly will be back for more. Authentic Turkish cuisine and we especially love the creamy hummus, chickpea stew and delightful kunefe. Great service as well. Will recommend to visit in a group to try a variety of sides and mains!

Everything is delicious here! Staffs are friendly, the Kunefe is one of the best, and the Karavan kebabs, both beef and lamb, are amazing! 😅 The hot pita bread is also great. In the last 4-5 months, we've visited this place many times, and our friends love it too. Whenever we want to enjoy a meal without worrying about quality and taste, we head straight to this restaurant. 😋 You won't regret giving it a try!

Hummus! Good! The lunch set is value for money - comes with a main + drink + soup + bread + dessert all for $20!
The pita bread is baked to perfection and the submarine bread looks so amazing! However the price for the submarine bread is a little high. Will probably not order this again the next time.
The soup of the day was lentil soup (vegetable soup) its really rich and herby. Very different from what i usually have.
The chicken dish is the highlight of the meal. The chicken meat is sooooo soft and tender. The seasoning is on point. Goes really well with the breads. The rice that comes with the dish is really fragrant as well.
Lots of vegetarian options.
Overall a positive experience and will recommend 👍🏻

Total bill is about $85++

Ordered quite abit for 2 person.  Love the cauliflower salad. Hummus, eggplant dips. As we were celebrating our birthday, the restaurant gave us complimentary tea and a kind of Turkish delight. The staff were attentive and friendly. Will definitely go back for the cauliflower salad and hummus.

This was my second visit today and my colleagues and I absolutely loved the food! I am usually not a fan of Turkish or Mediterranean food but this place is an exception. After trying the food a few months ago for the first time, I have been wanting to visit them again.

Every dish was delicious and tasted fresh and   wholesome. The Mezeplate is a good option if you are not sure what to order as it has a bit of everything and you can to try the different dips and appetisers. I enjoyed the hummus, cauliflower salad and eggplant dip very much. Their lentil soup was very good too - comforting and tasty.

For the mains, we tried two of their lunch set meals -  two rice dishes with the different chicken kebabs which were served with tea, soup and a rice pudding dessert. We also ordered their salmon which was so tender and flavourful. Several colleagues commented that it was the best salmon they had ever tasted!

The highlight of the meal was their dessert - Kunefe which was absolutely delicious! The taste and texture was so complex and had so much depth! The crispy stringy pastry with the creamy sauce, nuts and ice cream was indeed like what the menu described it to be - “a slice of heaven”!

This is seriously an underrated restaurant which serves amazing food and I would highly recommend it :)

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Very delicious food with reasonable price.
My friend from Turkey said this is the only place with authentic Turkish food. My mom who is super picky about food said their food is good. Their dessert Kunefe is both crispy and creamy.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgeable. Will visit again.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!


Option: 4:
Name: Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant
Address: 69 Bussorah St, Singapore 199482
Phone: 9677 9072
Delivery Available: Yes
Dine-In Available: Yes
Opening Hours:
Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.8
Reviews: 

Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Price Level: 2 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 3.9
Reviews: 

We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Enjoyed a lovely evening with family and doggie. Food is nice and the 1 for 1 drinks promo is good too.
Loved the dips platter and mixed grill with different meats
The pita bread is nice and soft and goes well with the hummus.
Great thing is that we can have our dog to eat with us....ha,ha, perhaps more like watch us eat. 😆
Staff is friendly and helpful. TV showing  EPL games too.


Option: 7:

Reviews: 

The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Tried the set lunch ($28++) at Kazbar a while back! Had the Beef and Spinach Stew Set. The set lunch also came with a starter of homemade hummus and babaghanoush with pita bread.

Food:
- Hummus was smooth and creamy while the babaghanoush reminded me of a citrusy relish. My only gripe with the starter was that they didn't give more pita bread because the spreads were that good

- The beef and spinach stew was a very comforting dish packed full of homely flavours. The beef was fairly tender and the spinach was really soft but for some reason I felt that there was too much spinach in the stew. Overall, the stew was well-seasoned and went quite well with the vermicelli rice

- The salad was satisfactory but didn't particularly stand out

Service/Atmosphere:
- This place is always crowded during lunchtime so high chance you need to make a reservation to get a table, especially if you're coming in a big group

- Servers were really attentive and there were no problems with our food

- Atmosphere felt warm and cozy, and was complemented by the fairly dim lighting

Overall, a great experience. Will definitely be back again in the future!

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.

Reviews: 

This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.

The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)

Good food and ambience. Lamb items tasted better. Wish the Arabic rice was cooked more. It was dry.
Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
Dips were delicious. Pita was bland and could've been better.

Kebab platter - 3.75 stars
Sausage was great. Beef and chicken a bit dry. Lamb was salty.

The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!
Korean dining in Singapore:
Option: 1:
Name: Kim Dae Mun Korean Food
Address: 100 Orchard Rd, #01-03D Concorde Shopping Mall, Singapore 238840
Phone: None

Dine-In Available: Yes

Price Level: 1 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Fantastic Korean food that is value for money. They charged you $10.50 for the spicy pork meal they will give you the value of $10.50 meal.

Spicy pork was well marinated, right amount of cabbage as well. The cabbage soup is also good got tofu inside too. Love the whole combination.

Plenty of seats available and the queue moves quickly. My plate of spicy pork came out sizzling 🥵 you can see the bits of sauce splatter on my tray hahah

Worth it 💯

It’s truly a Korean food stall that’s 100% worth the value.
The new items which is the spicy soba is really good. Soba is not soaked in water and it’s the dry mixed type.
The chilli sauce is not spicy and well portioned, so that the soba doesn’t get thick sauces on it.
The pancake is really authentic and first time liking a Korean style pancake.
Shrimp tempura 6 pieces for $5.5, it’s definitely the best deal every.

Taste nice! Portion wise very big.

Got really confused what to order as all the menu looks good.

Price is good for the portion

Think can share for two people.

Each set comes with one side dish. You can choose between kimchi anchovies or cucumber.

I came here 30 years ago, and they are still in operation! Kim’s used to be in a food court setting, but now they have their own setup.

Unique to Kim’s is their water based hot plate. A must try are the beef bulgogi, spicy chicken and kimchi soup.

Heard lots of good reviews on its authentic yet affordable korean food so I decided to head down for lunch on Saturday. We ordered a spicy beef soup which comes with a side of rice and one side dish, a chives pancake as well as beef bibimbap.

The soup was pretty delicious, nicely salted and the vegetables and meat portion was very generous. It wasnt very spicy, which is good for those with a low spice tolerance.

Beef bibimbap was hot (temperature wise) which makes the rice nicely scorched and slightly crispy at the bottom. The sauce is slightly different from others I've tried, with a twang of sweet soy and meaty taste. The bibimbap comes with a small dish of bibim sauce as well, so you can personalise how much sauce you can add.

I do love the chives pancake, its fluffy yet crisp. Theres a nice balance of veges in it, so the chives is not too overwhelming.

Overall, the food is worth the trip for me. Flavours were all on-point and the meals were all quite healthy and not too oily. Great for families to visit!

Aesthetically, the place gives off a canteen vibe (no music and wallpaper decor), but for the price range, it doesnt bother me. Service was great as well, the staff was very helpful and multilingual (-1 though as I wanted another soup and they gave me the wrong recommendation :( )

Reviews: 

We celebrated my niece birthday and as we had quite a few people we were given a room which provides the privacy. Service was attentive and the bbq was done before they serve.  So we do not leave the place smelling like bbq. Plus a huge variety of banchan. Abit pricey and might not be for everyday. But for special occasions it is a good choice for korean bbq

Standard of food is good. My family enjoyed different soups, and meat were nicely grilled for us. Generous servings of side dishes. Awesome

Had lunch here on a weekend and was immediately seated. As it was just both of us, we could not order more to try. Tea was on the house.  There were 10 varieties of ban Chan, including cold marinated crabs which was a nice surprise. We ordered marinated pork ribs and pork belly plus a huge steaming pot of Kim chee stew. The meat was cooked away from our table, as per request. The marinated pork rib was very flavorful    The pork belly was not bad. And the Kimchi stew too sour to our liking.  Staff were all very friendly. Overall a good experience.

Love the meat, tender and juicy.

The side dishes were great, there's also the soy sauce marinated raw crab as a side dish.

Favourite gotta be bossam and the bean paste soup. Packed with flavours and has this umami taste.

A little pricey. Services were alright.

Underwhelming korean dishes. The banchan was nothing special and tasted less than average. The stew was bland and thin in flavour. I would expect the prawns in the soup to be fresh and whole rather than frozen. The egg came in a generous portion. The pancake was very crispy but somehow lacked the depth. Meat was ok. Can get much much better flavours with the price we paid for.

Reviews: 

Food felt very authentic and Korean. Service was pretty fast and helpful. There weren’t many people here when we came here for lunch on Saturday.

The rice portion is pretty generous. Must have it if you get soup. Also ordered a seafood pancake which was great. They were also very generous with the ban chan.

Ordered the 2 person set for $95. Consisting of Suyuk, Dalgakbi and Seafood pancake.

Food was very nice. They were very flexible in the dishes as we are allowed to change the seafood pancake into a seafood stew and two drinks, as long as it does not exceed the original price of that dish 👍🏻.

It was slightly expensive, and the set for 2 can easily allow 3 pax to dine.

Had a really enjoyable meal here. Kids loved the shoyu meat and pancake. Bibimbap was excellent as were all the sides which were plentiful, distinct and authentic. Some of the best kimchi I’ve ever tasted.

Food was delicious and authentic. Side dishes were tasty and refillable. The space is small so tables are close to each other. They made sure that we leave at 8pm for our 6.30pm booking. On the pricier side so would have expected at least plain water to be served. I brought my own basmati rice for bibimbap due to diet and they gladly obliged (same price). Service staff are all very busy so service is efficient but not warm.

Reservations required! Bigmama is super popular and crowded. I walked in when they opened for dinner at 5.30pm and was told I only have 1 hour for dinner as they were fully booked from 6.30pm.

Luckily they prioritised our orders and served really quickly. The very nice restaurant owners took time to explain how to eat the various dishes, which were so so good. Highly recommend ordering the samgyetang, portion is good for 2-4 pax, the soup was hearty and delicious while the glutinous rice is super yummy and filling.

Their refillable banchan was super delicious especially the glass noodles, kimchi and lotus root salad - while they only have 6 dishes, everything was really good and we had a second serving. Suyuk was pretty interesting as well but pales in comparison to the samgyetang.

By the time I finished at 6.30pm the restaurant was already full of people. Can’t wait to come again to try the rest of their dishes. Highly recommended!

-edit- oh yeah they don’t serve barley tea or water which is weird. And their drinks are not cheap. Bring your own water I guess.

Reviews: 

Been wanting to try for weeks not easy to get a reservation online, either it's full or the remaining timings were quite weird.
Finally booked a lunch on a public holiday and secured a table. Initially wondering why the place was so empty when I arrived but after a while it was totally packed.
A little confusing on the menu because the physical one outside the shop had dinner menu and lunch menu and the electronic one only had lunch. Not sure if could only order from the lunch menu tab but upon asking could order from anywhere from the menu. There were duplicate dishes on ala carte and lunch menu because portion size was smaller and it comes with a set of soup and rice.
Ordered quite a few items to try, the most important thing I wanted to try was the marinated raw crab and we also ordered the galbi along with some other dishes like seafood pancake and kimchi stew.
Everything here was good, from the sides to the mains. The galbi was cooked by the staff and it was cooked to perfection. Raw crab was also nice and flavourful and well marinated.
Bill came and it was slightly expensive but definitely worth for the quantity and the quality. Would definitely come back again!

Reservations are recommended. When we visited on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed.

The pork was good. The staff isn't very interactive or smiley, but they are quite helpful when it comes to grilling the meat.

Was brought here by a friend for dinner. He came here here quite a few time and highly recommend me to come here. There were already a crowd when we reached. There was 5 group ahead of us and we waited for almost half and hour before it was our turn.

Apart from the ala carte, they also have different sets available. The Korean bbq here Is cooked via charcoal. The stuff will help you prep the food. Sides dishes is refillable. The marination of the meat was fantastic, not too sweet nor salty.

Overall, I enjoyed the food and would definitely be back again.

The newly revamp joint has a real modern touch. Service is absolutely amazing. Food quality is top notch. Many tables was having the raw crab. Looks good however didn’t dare to try. Seafood pancake was delicious & they don’t skimp on the ingredients. Btw the steam egg is FOC. Every table has it. We wanted to order however the waitress explained they will provide every table with one.
Highly recommended.

First time trying Guiga and I’m so glad we did! Everything from service to food was perfect. I loved the beef tartare and marinated crabs❤️ We got the Black Pork set with a side of beef ribs and the samgyetang, which is by far the tastiest I’ve had in Singapore. We didn’t quite enjoy the steamed egg, maybe cos we let it sit there for too long because we were busy eating up the feast we ordered!  We will definitely be back!

Reviews: 

Nice respectable Korean restaurant in the Serangoon Gardens area. Comes with a variety of ban chan dishes - ten to be exact. I was personally expecting the meat to be grilled on the table but it was done in the kitchen instead. Pork collar was overcooked and tough to chew. The beef on the hand was done alright. The other main dishes that we ordered were slightly better than the BBQ option than we had.

I reached 630pm and had to queue outside for a while for 25mins. The server was passionate and shared with us what’s the highly recommended dish to go for. Order an oxtail soup and a recommended BBQ. Oxtail soup was okay and lags of umami. The pork belly is overcooked and served on a hot plate that’s not hot. Then I would recommend serving on the plate instead if there isn’t any sizzling effect, why bother? Food for thought. I think probably we picked the wrong dishes? I don’t know… but I’m sure paying for that price I can get better BBQ meat for sure. Head down and try for yourself, review is base on my personal preference. You might have a different experience than I have.

Food:
pork bokkeum $30
serving size was generous and it was filled with lots of veg, onions and mushrooms. slight spice gave it a nice kick but doesn’t come with rice. quite a challenge to finish it even if we weren’t full because it got quite jelak
dolsot bibimbap $20
can’t go wrong, really nice and we polished it off
haemul pajeon $17
there was seafood with every bite of the pancake, they certainly don’t scrimp on the ingredients. personally not a fan of how soft the pancake was though ):
additional items:
sikhye $4
really nice and smooth drink, but serving size was a tad small, moreover no complimentary water which is usually a norm in korean joints
hite beer $17, rice $2

10 side dishes came complimentary but nothing really stood out. some were quite salty as well 😅
overall not too bad, but nothing that stood out as being really delicious

Superb Korean food. Great, authentic taste.

Love the japchae - nice texture, flavourful. Oxtail stew is good too. The BBQ platter is fantastic.

This place reminds me of a joint in Seoul that I used to frequent, esp their bokkeum octopus, which has such a generous amount of octopus compared to other places where there's more veg in the dish.. their side dishes are also good and a hit for my toddlers.

Reviews: 

The thousand reviews are mostly from prior locations. This location is new.

So much seating at this place! The price matched the food well. Passable quality food but they throw tons of options at you. Would totally suggest to go for small quantities first to reduce food waste. Having said that the staff is attentive and helpful.

You will be warmly greeted by their staff. The friendliness and attentiveness from this restaurant is fantastic! They deserve a pat on their shoulder it's comparable to HDL man! Buffet price are reasonable with meat and seafood and inclusive of drinks. I don't even need to top up for their soup base either. They have chef cooked the BBQ food and some cooked food dishes. Shabu shabu is cooked by ourself in the steamboat. As I'm a kidney dialysis patient and I can't consume high sodium food so they are so kind to allow me have separate soup pot to put plain water(also the restaurant are not full house so they gave us a big table). They constantly check on us if everything is OK and keep refilling our soup base. Thumbs up on their service.

A jewel from the beloved JCube.
Oppa BBQ is back!

I like BBQ, but good ingredients deserves to be sha-shabu-ed.  Very happy to discover an additional option - a silvery shabu pot!  BBQ is still available but this time its done in the kitchen - so no more smoky clothes after the meal, and served on a cute warming platter 😋

The cooked food section have expanded - from the other reviews there is a variety to surprise every return visit (fried chicken too!).  But most importantly my beloved tteok-bokki is back!

Finally a big thank you to the warm welcoming staff - great to see the crew from Jcube again.  We will be back!

Overall satisfied. For lunch they serve french fries, toppoki, JapChae, seaweed soup and fried Gimmari. I am not a big eater. It's more than enough for me. My son loves the meat.

OPPA Vibes; Definitely a place to unwind over some Soju or Beer. ALL YOU CAN EAT and kids friendly (kids per pax is super affordable. Good spread of sauces, hot food and a separate 3 tier classy trolley for us to put our Buffet loot. This really shows the genuine gesture from the shop owner. Love the friendly staff. Super fresh short plate, beef. Let the pics convince you. Paisei for the messy.

Service is good and prompt. Wide spread of side dishes, porridge and kimchi is the best, but some of them abit salty. My favourite dish here is their Tteokbokki, very soft and chewy, is a must order!

Had one of the beef/pork sets and octopus soup. Was a very satisfying and hearty meal, especially with the free flow side dishes (very yummy!). Service staff were also attentive and helpful! Gave us a free steamed egg dish as well; thank you!

they had a great variety of side dishes, take note some of the dishes cant be refilled e.g. KIMCHI….. which was kinda weird cause it’s a korean restaurant… but anw we ordered a $25 pork belly and two small slim pieces of meat was served.. quality wasnt that great
cold noodles were okay - abit sour but noodles were chewy and refreshing
soft tofu hotpot - soup was not the best I’ve tasted, they included alot of ingredients like octopus, some meat, black fungus, 3 big pieces of tofu, and more

overall it was a meh experience

No frills. Homely simple korean restaurant with very nice food, especially the side dishes.  However be warned that the staff may insist that you order minimum dishes per pax. Even though we were 3 small eater adults + a fussy toddler, we were made to order 3 main courses which was really too much for all of us. So only come when hungry. Their dishes also tend to be a little pricey

Finally returned after a couple of years since the food standard dropped. Served 13 side dishes of which one of them is porridge which I think it's a good choice if comes with young children.  And it tastes nice. Ordered BBQ pork+beef set which the staff helped us grilled and cut into small bite sizes.

We ordered the 4 colors pork belly set - original, wine, miso and garlic. The quality of the pork were all so extraordinary that the smell, while grilling - woohoo - was beyond words! The staff was definitely an expert in cooking the meats - all were perfectly cooked! We were craving for more and ended up order additional strip. The curry flavor was a great surprise too. The overall experience surpassed our expectation and we will be back again! Maybe, 8 color set the next time! 😋🤤🥩

Nice korean resturant at orchard shaw. Enjoyed celebrating my birthday. I had some special request for the table and they gladly helped. Wonderful service

Great food. Definitely must come enjoy.

Love the yuzu makeolli drink

8 Korean BBQ Shaw Centre is an absolute gem for Korean BBQ enthusiasts! The quality of the meat is outstanding, and the interactive grilling experience is both fun and delicious. The variety of marinades and side dishes add a delightful twist to the meal, making it a must-visit spot for anyone craving authentic Korean flavors. The service is top-notch, and the ambiance is perfect for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended!

Came here for a family dinner on a weekday night - the entire Shaw Center was pretty quiet and the restaurant itself was about 1/3 full. Service was quick and friendly, food is so-so, definitely had better. Their speciality is pork (we order the 8-flavor platter ) but it was the 1 beef dish that I personally liked best. The appetizers were fine. Not super impressed.

Went there for company’s team dinner. The first visit was a lasting impression. The meat flavors are so balanced. The prawn with sake was awesome. Reasonable pricing for the quality of food. Service was fantastic.  Vanessa cooked the meat well and very attentive and friendly. Will definitely recommend friends to try and will be back with my family.

Reviews: 

We visited this place for 3-4times. And tried different dishes. The restaurant is ran by Korean. It is authentic Korean cuisine. The atmosphere is chill and cozy. Our favorite food is the spicy chicken feet pot and the beef rib soup.
The panchan판찬there are also nice and the waiter and waitress are responsive. Just that sometime they get really busy.
It would be really lovely to go there for a sip of the hot soup on a rainy and cold morning.
Really like this place a lot.

overall a popular place with good options of home cooking style Korean food, better to have more than 3people sharing , portion is big for 2 person, you may only get a chance to try 1 or 2 type of food. The pork and chicken dishes are big portion. Chicken feet comes with steam egg and rice balls, it’s a good combination and good to share.
Came at around 630pm on a Friday evening, it started to get very busy from 7pm.

Came here on a Wednesday night at 7 p.m., and no reservations were needed. I have walked past this restaurant a few times, but I was more familiar with their nostalgic cultural Korean decorations. They moved recently to a new area along the same stretch, and it's so minimalistic now... A lot more space is catered for diners, with rooms for big groups. Side dishes was pretty okay only. Toilet is huge too!

💧 Water is complimentary

We ordered:

🐔 Jjimdak ($55)
Braised chicken in dark sauce, this dish is one of my favourites in korea. And this standard is pretty okay! Huge portion that feeds at least 4 people. Chicken could have been braised longer to have more flavour. The japchae noodles at the bottom soak up a lot of sauce, so it's quite filling, along with potatoes and carrots.

I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

🍃 Minari Jun ($28)
1st time trying Minari, and we were surprised how fresh this vegetable pancake tasted. It didn't have a celery scent and tasted rather clean. Quite flat as well. Would like it if it's bigger.
I rate: 4.5/5 🌟

🍶 Pine Nut Draught Wine ($28)
The way it's served is pretty interesting! In a small vat with a wooden scoop into a shallow bowl. It was a little gassy and had a faint, nutty sweet aftertaste.

I rate: 4/5 🌟

This place serves very authentic Korean food. Although traditional bbq was available, no one was having that as the standout are the Korean cooked dishes. It's quite close to the Korean food I had in Korea last year. The standout is the braised short ribs. It's so tender and meat falls off the bone easily. Pair the rice with the braised sauce and it's heavenly. The radishes and carrots were so yummy too. 2nd best was the assorted pancakes. It was like no other I had tried before. There were fish, mushroom, prawns and it's so all very special. It really fills you up too. The place was not very closely packed where you're sitting shoulder to shoulder and tables well spaced apart, unlike some other Korean restaurants here. The restroom are also very clean.

Went for an early dinner and was given a spacious seat for our family of 4. Ordered the barbecued pork belly and beef. They will actually sliced the meat and barbecue the meat for you so that you don’t have to actually do it yourself. Ordered the beef bulgogi for the kids and the kids loved it. Not too many of non spicy options for kids though. Kimchi pancake tasted great while the cold noodles were quite soggy. Overall prices are on the higher side, especially the barbecued meats. Service can be improved, cos we waited quite long for the rice to be ready and there wasn’t anyone to inform us that we have to wait for the rice.

One of the many Korean joints in the area. This one feels more of the homely variety. Focus of our meal was fried chicken and it was reasonably delicious although the cheese seemed to dominate the taste a fair bit. The kimchi pancake was nice.

Went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and the place was full.

Ordered the fried chicken platter, jajangmyeon, and seafood pancake. The fried chicken was tender and juicy. Noodles were springy and flavourful. The pancake was a bit disappointing as it was overly doughy and lacked crispiness. The sauce for the pancake was too salty as well.

Lots of free sides were given together with the meal. Overall left with full bellies. Bill came up to $63 for two people.

Ordered the Pork BBQ set for lunch with Spicy Tofu soup and a Stir fry Squid. During lunch there's only 2 tables including ours, service was quite good they bbq for you and service were prompt. The pork were very ordinary not as good as others around the area. The Tofu soup, soup base was good, but I'm not a fan of frozen mixed seafood pack with tiny shrimps and clams, and the Spicy fried Squid were very disappointing too. I'm ok with frozen seafood, but not the kind of pre-cut seafood where it becomes rubbery after cooking, and that's exactly how the squid were like. Maybe I ordered all the wrong stuff from the menu, it looks like their specialty was fried chicken.

A cozy place to have Korean food. This is my second time here as it is quite far to travel from the eastern part of Singapore. The Korean  ambience here to me is a plus. While the food here is not the kind that will blow you away, they are  decent. It’s a place to eat and drink and chill.

Came on a Friday night and the place was packed! Service was quite fast and they have free-flow chilled water. Food was not super amazing but it’s a chill place with kpop videos playing in the bg!

Reviews: 

As a regular customer at Lang Nướng Vietnam, I cannot express enough how fantastic this place is. It has, hands down, the best Vietnamese barbecue in Singapore. The staff are always so friendly and accommodating, and the owner never fails to make you feel at home by personally greeting each guest. And let’s talk about the food - absolutely delicious every single time! The raw prawn dish, in particular, is to die for. It’s obvious that a lot of care goes into every aspect of this restaurant, from the carefully crafted menu to the overall atmosphere. I always look forward to my visits to Lang Nướng Vietnam and highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic flavors and top-notch service. It’s always a treat to dine here!

Food very nice. I like their cockles in tamraind sauxe as well as the prawns steamed in herbs. Service staff very approachable and friendly. Very attentive to your needs. Ambience very nice, feels like you are transported to a local eatery in Vietnam with the low tables and chairs. Vietnamese music in the play too .

Authentic Vietnamese cuisine, with authentic ambience too. Food is nice as expected. Tried the fried chicken wings, snail with spinach and beef pho. Will try other dishes next time when I come back again  :)

Stumbled into this restaurant on a Sunday and it was empty compared to the rest of its neighbours.

We ordered the BBQ meat dishes as recommended and asked for them to help us with the BBQ in the kitchen.

Pork was the best of the lot.
The premium beef was out of stock and we opted for the VN beef. It tasted like protein just not beef. It was coated with alot of sweet sauce and we could quite make out what meat it was.

The coke we ordered was flat and there wasn’t and fizz left.

We packed some more food home.
The usual, Pho, spring rolls to continue out dinner as it was really stuffy and hot in the restaurant.

Staff was friendly except a little forgetful.
We waited half an hour only to be informed they ran out of the dish we ordered.

I have been a regular customer of the restaurant since a few years ago. And now also still a regular customer . It can be said that I will come once or twice a week. The food here is very suitable for my difficult palate. Especially the dish "Cha Ca". The fish is very fresh and sweet. Add dill and onions. Hanoi taste 100% . It is very difficult
to find a restaurant in Singapore that makes such a authentic foods same here . Highly recommend it very much.
The service is also fast and attentive. Hope the business prospers.
They also have wine from a small and very beautiful city in Vietnam. This wine is produced in Vietnam and is also a quite famous wine in Vietnam.

Though the quality of their food and service seem to have gone down compared to before covid, this place is still one of go-to spots for Vietnamese cuisine. They have plenty of choices for main, drinks as well as desserts. Grilled pork vermicelli, Bun bo Hue, che ba mau and iced tea are highly recommended. There are 2 separate indoor seating sections inside the mall, and one area outdoor that’s usually good at evening time.

Nicely grill porkchop flavour on point
Dessert is normal.
Pork amount could have been a little more and it will be perfect.
Order via QR code.
Pay inside the shop after dining.
Alfresco dining feels gd with the right weather. But might get a hint of cigarettes smell once in awhile
service are friendly

A no frills place with decent food. You order from a QR code, and the food arrives petty quickly. The Banhmi was just okay. The fish tasted good. The beef with rice and banhmi bread was also decent. The spring roll was okay with the dip that they provide. Service is average.

No frill Vietnamese food. The beef pho is fine but I prefer the beef more tender. Fried egg is ok. Fried Chicken and Kang kong too. But won’t purposely visit again.

A fantastic little place for a casual sunset dinner whilst in a riverside walk/bike ride. Food was delicious (great Smokey BBQ flavour on our meat, plenty of fresh veges and self serve condiments) at a reasonable price. Photos show the red bean smoothie, chicken bun and beef boon. Service was very fast, although minimal (self order via QR).

The service staff lacks attentiveness and the food service is disappointingly slow. The portion sizes are unreasonably small and the overall quality of the food is low, with some ingredients missing. Based on my experience, I cannot recommend this place.

I guess the good review could be the free 5 dollar return voucher. 🤔

Tried the various dishes shown in picture, all were very good, fried spring roll were packed with meat, chicken was very tender, grilled pork is super delicious with the dry noodle. Everything that we tried taste good and the quantity is not bad too. Used eatigo discount and the whole meal was super worth it. Highly recommend this place and will surely be back!

Food is decent with an interesting interior decor.

However, as ironic as it is, despite being named after the dish, I'd always appreciated the diverse non-Pho menu options at the Rangoon Road branch. I'd believed that might have been the chain's strategy to Vietnamese food seeing as there isn't much more complexity to Vietnamese cuisine in Singapore aside from Pho and Banh Mi.

Thinking that was the standard across all Mrs Pho branches, I was a little disappointed to see that that menu at this branch was rather limited mostly to Pho and Banh Mi with limited other options.

Still, the food was decent.

First off, the food is mediocre or less. The pho soup was just salty and missing that deep brothy taste. The dry noodle were the same as you’d find in any Kopitiam or Hawker’s Centre. The drink cups were the size of kids drinks.. the cup is half the size of an iPhone. The only thing that tasted good was the fried spring rolls but they were very tiny as well.

Also, the place was empty (only us) even though we went during peak dinner hours.

Pho is good. Rather than giving another plate for the leaves and bean sprouts, they're already in the soup, which is a bit different from the western countries. But i don't mind😎

Looking for a truly authentic Vietnamese experience on our sunny island? Long Phung offers a spread of delicious Vietnamese dishes at prices that won't break the bank.

Every dish is packed full of flavour. You'll be left craving for more. And as you're dining, let your cup of Vietnamese coffee slowly drip, and you can enjoy the robust beverage as a perfect finisher to your meal.

Seating space is adequate, but do arrive early if you're looking to dine as the spaces fill up quite fast, especially on weekends.

We were out in the east and decided to try this place because there were a lot of good reviews. Seems like a pretty traditional Vietnamese menu. Food was good and you can tell it wasn’t seasoned for foreigners…it had very sublet but well balanced flavors. We loved all the sauces and the balance of crunch & soft textures. Our favorite was the fried spring rolls the flaky crust was so good it was addictive. The smoothies left a lot to be desired, they seem to be very skimpy on the fruit. Otherwise I love it that the food is also very light so you don’t feel so stuffed at the end. We didn’t get any noodle soup, maybe next time, but most people seem to have some sort of soup. We would definitely go back. The downside is the location (if you aren’t close) but the price, value and quality are all top notch.

Most of their dishes come with sweet sauce which  I like. Beef was okie, not very tender but their spring roll was good. Their crepe was special, inside got prawn and pork belly. I think they add coconut to the crepe

Paid 23.22 for the meal. Food was decent, served very quickly.

All seems fresh. My spring rolls may have been sitting a while as all 4 pieces were stocked together. Tough texture for the skin. Ingredients were fine.

Overall more of a good vibe. Maybe skip the ones I have ordered and get a pho or fish. Didn't satisfy my cravings.

Authentic Vietnamese food. Speedy service. Love the jellyfish salad, grilled squid, and beef stew. Banh Mi bread is exactly the same as those found in Vietnam. Returned twice in less than a week. Highly recommended!

Reviews: 

Service staff are extremely prompt and very attentive. Live band music E.N.T was awesome and sang some of the songs we requested as well. Great place to just chill with your friends.
The food here was excellent too! The wait times were reasonable, and we didn't have to wait too long for our food.
Can come with family.

I’m here every week and the food and drinks are so good! Love the entertainment here too! The live bands here sound great! My favourite dishes are the pork dishes! Especially the intestines!

Update: I tried the banh mi and it was so good! Got the meatball one. Bread was good warm, crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside, meat was so soft and tender and tasty!

Update: I tried the beef banh mi and it was delicious! I still prefer the pork one though the beef was very tasty. The pork one has more sauce so it makes it less dry. The beef one isn’t dry, it’s just drier than the pork meatball one. Will try the fish next time I’m there!

Forgot to take a photo of the chicken skewers - they were small. Considering the price you’re paying, all of the dishes were small. That would be no issue if they were very tasty, but they are average or tasteless. The prices listed are not the final prices. They do not tell you that it does not include GST. You are surprised when you get the bill. $7.50 for one coke, when others charge $1.50-$4.50. Find cheaper options.

popular spot for vietnamese cuisine in singapore! nestled along the river makes for a great relaxing atmosphere, as well as making it pretty easy to find!

service was nice and effortless.
happy hour is 50% off their set of cocktails, beers and house wine!

the food menu is quite diverse in the vietnamese cuisine which was good to see

bad points:
- personally found the food a little lacking - but it could just be that im coming from a viet background and currently living in vietnam.
- cocktails were weak! mostly tasted watered down!

overall food was okay, just not great as all the other reviews make it out to be
it meets the average, definitely not true authentic tasting though

Very nice and chill place for quick snacks and beer. Loved the Vietnamese food and the fast service. It’s on the river side too, so beautiful view while dining/drinking.

Reviews: 

The Vietnamese food in this restaurant comes at a relatively high price, which is a bit expensive. However, I found the food to be lacking in authenticity and taste. The spring roll skin was thick and dry, and the soup lacked the strong flavors I expected.

On the bright side, the service was commendable. One of the staff members noticed that the spring roll might be too big for my son to eat comfortably, so he kindly offered to cut it in half, showing good attentiveness to the customers.

I ordered a vegetarian banh mi for takeaway. The bread was still crispy after the 20-min trip. The lemongrass tofu, sauteed mushrooms and pickled vegetables tasted nice. Wish there was a bit more toppings though as I'm more used to having my banh mi overflowing with ingredients. The staff was super friendly and nice even though I was there for just 10 seconds to pick up my order.

Nondescript Viet joint at the quiet UE square. Food was quite good though I felt my dish (dry rice noodle salad with lemongrass beef) should have more meat, there were too little beef slices. However, we liked the fried spring rolls and my husband enjoyed his chicken pho. A bit pricey (nearly $70) for 2 mains, an appetiser and 2 coconuts.

Visited this place because I had a strong craving for bahn mi and happened to be in the area. Unfortunately, my craving was not satisfied.

I wasn't a fan of their bahn mi. While it had some crispiness, I expected more, and the bread was a bit thicker than I prefer. I ordered the chicken flavour and I found the gravy to be on the sweeter side. They also used a generous amount of vegetables, and the taste of the veggies overwhelmed the overall flavour, which I didn't particularly enjoy.

My friend tried the beef pho, and it also left us with a rather average impression.

Won’t be returning here again.

Moc Quan is a nice Vietnamese restaurant. The slice beef pho noodle is very smooth and tasty. Sliced beef is thin and easy to eat. The sauce is also on the spicy side.

The creme brulee has coffee taste. It's soft, not too sweet, as the sauce is bitter, but with the crystal sugar, the sweetness is just right.

The peanut sauce for Goi Cuon Is spicy. We requested for the peanut sauce to be without the chilli, and the staff were very nice to make it for us.

One of the staff is very kind to offer to refill our water at the end of the meal.

It was a pleasant experience.

They had outdoor seats too, which is good for those who do not want to be under aircon.


Option: 7:
Name: Signs A Taste of Vietnam Pho
Address: 277 Orchard Rd, #B2-15, Singapore 238858
Phone: 8685 4838

Price Level: 1 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.7
Reviews: 

Very tasty pho, meat portion was slightly less than I'd have wanted (just perhaps 1 more slice of beef) but I finished the whole bowl including the soup which was very good.

It's located very near Somerset MRT but in a slightly inconspicuous spot. But if you are nearby, definitely worth a try.

Space is surprisingly quite good for a casual dinner with space for single diners up to big groups.

Some of the staff are hearing impaired but i did not have any problems with ordering and payment. Kudos to the business owner for running an inclusive workplace.

a really pleasant and inexpensive place in somerset. we ordered 2 phos, 2 bahn mi and 1 spring roll — all demolished by the end of the meal. the bahn mi is my favorite. we ordered both chicken and pork, and they are both extremely yummy. unlike conventional bahn mi that is hard, this bahn mi is soft and yet crunchy. would definitely revisit again.

the phos were very good too with a generous portion of meat. spring rolls are fresh and the dipping sauce matches nicely.

most importantly, the service is top notch. the staff is attentive and sincere, and do their best to serve you quickly. do be mindful that you are required to order and pay at the counter, and you can also take this chance to learn and practice some sign language :)

signs a taste of vietnam pho is a very interesting restaurant because it is run by a family of the deaf 🧏‍♀️ the staff here may not be able to respond to your verbal cues, yet they are very helpful and always serve you with a friendly smile :P

we ordered sliced beef + beef balls pho ($12) and lemongrass turmeric chicken ($9). pricing seems very reasonable given that they do not charge any ++!
the pho is not as good as i expected, because the soup tastes more salty than fragrant imo - it might suit those who are into less herby flavours. luckily the noodles texture is just nice and the beef balls are super juicy and bouncy, i would honestly recommend ordering beef balls alone without the slices which might be a bit hard in texture. overall this is an okay bowl of pho but not the best I have tried :P
what really gave me a surprise is the banh mi. unlike my preconceived perceptions of baguettes, this baguette has a pleasant soft texture and buttery taste. i love the refreshing taste of radish and lemongrass which can’t make itself more prominent. the combination of chunky cucumber and juicy grilled chicken is also as good as it can be, but my only complaint is the chicken skin - only if they peeled that off then this would be a perfect banh mi 🫠

Lovely small shop in the basement of Orchard gateway.
Lunch crowd creeped in, and service still very fast! Water is not complimentary.

Beef & Pork Pho are light and fragrant. Noodles are more towards kway teow than Pho rice noodles. Soup is zesty because of lime and sweet from the meat. Portion is just nice.
I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

Spicy Beef bowl is really good. Love how there is a shrimp flavour in it and made the broth very robust. There's not a lot of soup though. Noodles are thick beehoon. Great for hangovers. It's not very spicy. I rate: 4/5 🌟

Avocado Milk Shake was so good! Thick and creamy with avocado fragrance. Good for sharing as it's quite big and filling. M
I rate: 4/5 🌟

The owners are mute so they will use sign language to communicate with you.

We ordered the:
- beef combination pho - it was all delicious and the soup was flavourful, but not overly salty
- rolls - the ingredients were fresh and the skin was nice and tender

We didn't order it this time round, but they serve very very good avocado shakes as well!

Definitely recommend this place 💯

Reviews: 

I have came back here a couple of times already and I have to say it’s really delicious. Especially on a rainy day. Their soup and stew are really makes you feel like home food. You don’t get the MSG taste and their bread is soft. Ingredients anew very generous. The decor also has a Vietnamese feel with a bicycle hanging on the wall. I’m sure to be back here again.

The beef pho is definitely a must try. The meat is tender and flavorful. Have made my own sauce - garlic + fish sauce + sugar + 2 lime. Yums. Will be back to try their coffee next time and maybe the dry version. I chose glass noodles over rice noodles and the portion is a little small. Still feeling hungry. 😅

Very nice place for beef pho. The soup is light but still very flavourful.worth going if you are in the area.Coffeeshop next to it sells the legendary Michelin bar chor mee. This can be a good alternative if the queues are long and you cannot afford the time waiting.

family owned, cosy place. Ordered the the Bahn Mi and Dry Pho. Both were excellent very homely style unlike franchised stores. Drinks were very nice as well! Highly recommend.

The meat was super tender and dry and soup pho were really tasty. Price was a little steep, probably cos it was a store on its own and not at a coffeeshop.
An area of improvement is increasing the quantity of the meat.
Also, staff can learn to not argue about personal matters while people are eating, the discomfort I  felt from a tense atmosphere spoilt the tastiness of the pho broth.


Option: 9:

Reviews: 

We walked past this Vietnamese restaurant and decided to come here for our team lunch. Food was delicious, everything was on point however the were short handed and by the time we were done with lunch, our drinks unfortunately hadn't arrived. The team's very sweet and apologetic but we have to get back to meetings. Definitely will want to come back when service improves as food is fresh and flavourful - one of the better Vietnamese cuisine in Singapore  💯

Beef pho is okay, the beef is the lean meat, and the soup is not bad. The soup without MSG is more sweet.
The shrimp and pork ribs noodle is like the Singapore style. Quite normal. Meat and shirt portioning are small.
Tried the egg coffee. It’s a great experience. The egg is made into milk form as the upper layer. It does have the raw egg taste without the coffee. The coffee is a little bitter.
Went at 450pm and the staff said they only start work at 5pm. However in Google map stated as operating.

Had lunch with colleagues here on Friday - staff here were friendly and had a good number of vegetarian options! I had the Vegetarian vermicelli, it was very flavourful but slightly salty for my person preference. The interior was nicely designed with spacious seats, would highly recommend!

Every dish I tried was an explosion of flavors. But wait, there's more! As if the incredible food and beautiful ambience weren't enough, they even surprised us with a complimentary dessert. It was the perfect sweet ending to an already fantastic meal. The generosity and thoughtfulness of the staff truly made my experience memorable.

I highly recommend Co Chung Vietnamese Restaurant for lunch. Whether you're looking for a place to impress a client, enjoy a meal with friends, or simply indulge in a satisfying lunch, this restaurant has it all. The combination of delicious local Vietnamese food, inviting ambience, attentive service, and even a free dessert make it a must-visit destination. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

Just the right place to relive our Vietnamese holiday!

It was a quiet Saturday to eat at this usually crowded restaurant. The service by staff Ice was fantastic. She even offered to show us her mini garden and gave us a tiny bitter gourd to grow it at home.

Nice ambience and would be good if we could access the other section that is more nostalgic. Food was fantastic and the pancake was delicious.

I love the bamboo rice dipped in chicken gravy. The chewiness and fragrance of the rice made this a simple yet satisfying dish. Reminds me of eating by the roadside in Vietnam. The beef pho is another must try together with the pancake.

Overall a cozy restaurant that brings back memories of our trip to Vietnam.  Will return for more.

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Excellent 👍 💯  Ate here again today for the 6th time since they opened long before covid. Used eatigo this time round. Coffee was excellent! They now serve banh mi too! Recommended to come here and use eatigo discount to grab a banh mi and viet iced coffee(no discount for drinks)for a tea time snack. Banh mi of course cannot win the ones in Vietnam but for the portion and taste is at least 8/10. Please support such shops instead of those big chains and too commercialized ones with not so nice food. Kris+ allowed here took with 6mpd earn rate.

This is my first time to this outlet at Rangoon Road, and I was told by my friends that this was one of the earlier outlets.

I did not even know there was an outlet here at the end of Rangoon Road, where it was very quiet. It's not really accessible unless you drive.

We ordered the sliced beef pho and Hanoi sliced chicken pho as mains, and the fried spring rolls. Our friends ordered the fresh spring rolls as well, but they weren't really to our liking.

The fried spring rolls has minced meat and yam, packed fully, but the size of the spring rolls were tiny.

The sliced beer pho and the chicken pho were pretty decent, but that's also because I have actually never eaten really fantastic or bad pho. The good thing is the portion was quite big, so no lack of soup or ingredients.

Under staff for better services. Still give 4 stars for services. The team of 3 boys, make it work and still bring out great food.

One of the better Pho we ever had try from many other places.

A place I frequent if I need a quick-fix for pho. Menu here has been revamped. Their regular pho, like it or not, comes with Japanese Wagyu. Tender and pricey. They have a “light” portion for smaller eaters — but my guess is to cater for folks used to their older menu (and prices)? You pay a bit less than before, but also get less to eat. Thankfully, their broth is still good. Now, do I need Wagyu in my pho? Not me. I think it is best kept on a grill. I love their wing bean, and its size has shrunk too. Seems like a trend… enough surprises for today. Service is nearly nonexistent. I thought their robot was more cheerful. They “feed you like family” but sure don’t treat you like one. Unfortunately. Finally, I think their toothpicks should be managed with more hygiene in mind (see photo).

Came for lunch on Saturday afternoon. Not very crowded but notice a lot of delivery orders. The sturgeon in a hot plate was very nice and recommended. Also had the pork pancake which was crunchy but a little difficult to eat. In Vietnam it comes with a thin rice paper to roll up and easier to hold and eat. Also liked the salted lemonade and Vietnamese drip coffee.
Middle Eastern cuisine in Singapore:
Option: 1:

Rating: 4.4
Reviews: 

The most delicious Mediterranean food in Singapore. Very friendly staff,- quick service and very nice Singapore Sling. Super clean environment, good ambiance and price worthy. 5/5 will come back for sure.

Unique experience eating middle eastern food. The food was great and there was quite a bit of variety. Also the staff were very friendly! It is a bit on the pricey side but it is still worth the experience.

Tried the set lunch ($28++) at Kazbar a while back! Had the Beef and Spinach Stew Set. The set lunch also came with a starter of homemade hummus and babaghanoush with pita bread.

Food:
- Hummus was smooth and creamy while the babaghanoush reminded me of a citrusy relish. My only gripe with the starter was that they didn't give more pita bread because the spreads were that good

- The beef and spinach stew was a very comforting dish packed full of homely flavours. The beef was fairly tender and the spinach was really soft but for some reason I felt that there was too much spinach in the stew. Overall, the stew was well-seasoned and went quite well with the vermicelli rice

- The salad was satisfactory but didn't particularly stand out

Service/Atmosphere:
- This place is always crowded during lunchtime so high chance you need to make a reservation to get a table, especially if you're coming in a big group

- Servers were really attentive and there were no problems with our food

- Atmosphere felt warm and cozy, and was complemented by the fairly dim lighting

Overall, a great experience. Will definitely be back again in the future!

If you like Hummus, this restaurant/pub has the best Hummus in Singapore 🇸🇬 .
Just order the big portion! You won't regret it.

For a person who doesn't like lamb, I'd like to share that this restaurant is the only one where I would not hesitate to order their lamb shanks!

The atmosphere is good for catching up with friends over a beer and a good Turkish meal.  A change from the usual type of dining places we locals normally go to. The friends I brought there thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

The staff are friendly and humorous.  It can get crowded Friday nights.  So go early!

They are open 6 days a week, closed on Sunday.

Super juicy and delicious kebab and loved the hummus and babaganoush too. The lunch special is good value for the quality and portion. Service was quick and helpful. Will definitely be back to try more.


Option: 2:

Rating: 4.4
Reviews: 

I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

First time at this restaurant, and I can say the dining experience was great.

Food is great and the serving is not bad as well.  I can only say good things about the service of the Staffs.
The place is easy to find and the ambience is something to remember.

Reviews: 

Even though the restaurant is in quite a touristy location, the food is actually pretty good. One of the more popular restaurant along the pathway. Staff are friendly and helpful. Lovely place to be to watch people walk by while enjoying dinner. Parking is limited in the area though.

Food is really great. Had a very nice dinner with family. The street sets the mood for good food.  Food felt authentic and very tasty. We had chicken Mandi, mixed grill and "pizza".

Place also has some good baklava.

Parking lot picture below.

While initially heading for a different restaurant, at which we were repelled by the pushy staff / promoters, we headed down Arab Street to look for an alternative. Most of the other restaurants also had promoters out which tried to lure us in. The guys at Tabbouleh just let us check the menu first and then we asked for a table. Service generally was ok, we waited a bit to actually order, food did not take a very long time though. The atmosphere actually was quite nice, views on the mosque, night time street impressions with a table outside. The food was delicious, I normally don't like Hummus a lot, but here I liked it. It was well presented as well. In the end I got the feeling that despite the 10% service charge it was expected that we give additional tip, which was a bit strange hence the 3/5 for the service. We did like the tea at the very end which rounded up an otherwise nice dinner experience. Thank you very much.

We choose the restaurant because of its good reviews and as the staff was not at all intrusive as most of the other places in the area.
We shared a mixed appetizers plate, which was alright. Overall good, but also no particular highlights.
The iced lemon tea was perfect after an exhausting day.
A plus was the free mint tea at the end, which we really appreciated.
The service could be more attentive, while the food was out quite fast. All in all a rather average experience.

Cozy al fresco location with a view of the mosque, serving great Lebanese food. While the kabab meats and lamb mandi could have a bit more salt, the rice was superb. Chicken however was overcooked and became too dry and hard. They also serve great baklava for desert or take-away. We were served also complimentary mint tea at the end of the meal. Nice.

Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
