The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Very delicious food with reasonable price.
My friend from Turkey said this is the only place with authentic Turkish food. My mom who is super picky about food said their food is good. Their dessert Kunefe is both crispy and creamy.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgeable. Will visit again.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Reviews: 

The perfect place chosen for a birthday celebration!!

From great service, to amazing ambience, to tasty food... everything was simply perfect!

Awesome selection for both veg & non-veg menu!!

2 thumbs up!

Thank you Byblos for making our evening beautiful!

Quality food, ambience and excellent service from staff made the dinner special. Thanks to receptionist Mahiti for always giving a great smile to all guest. It definitely makes a difference.

We celebrated my brother's birthday here and had a great time. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with classic Turkish designs and really put us in the mood for their cuisine.

We ordered the mixed grilled platter to share and they portioned it for to the seven people in our party. The salads were fresh and the dessert was delicious. I highly recommend their kunfa as it's authentic, made fresh and absolutely scrumptious.

My only drawback was the warmth. There could have been better distribution of air-conditioning, other than that we had a swell time. I know there are many other restaurants in the area offering a similar experience but Byblos stands apart with class and authenticity.

LOVE the food!!! Hot, freshly baked lavash bread, delectable and well seasoned kebabs, even the salads appealed to my picky 11 year old. Ambience was lovely, only downside was the music is a wee bit loud (I was sitting indoors), but the staff brought down the volume. Our plates were all cleaned out, clearly we enjoyed dinner at Byblos. Highly recommended!

Food was very delicious, flavourful, and served decently quickly. Our first experience with Turkish food in Singapore and it was an extremely pleasant one. Our waiter was Hassan and the service was exceptional. He recommended different dishes and drinks to us and these were what we ordered: Hummus (served with Lavash), Cheese and Garlic Ekmek, Tabbouleh, Lamb Mandi, the Chef Special Tasty Kebab, Kunefe, and Mint tea. We initially felt that the Tabbouleh was too salty and Hassan helped us exchange for a less salty salad immediately without any extra charge. After the change, the salad was very refreshing and a flavour explosion on the tongue. Saffron rice with the Lamb mandi was incredible and the lamb was fall-off-the-bone tender. The Garlic taste in the ekmek was very intense and the Cheese paired well with the Ekmek, both Ekmeks best paired with the hummus. The mint tea was very light yet could cleanse our palettes well. The Kunefe is unique-tasting and quite heavy so best shared with other people. The degree of sweetness for the dessert because you add the syrup as you wish. We booked a table using the Eatigo discount so all alacarte dishes (excluding drinks) were half priced. Amazing deal.

My second time to come here and service never disappoints. The food is tasty and the ambiance is great😊 highly recommended😊

Nice location and good tea, cool weather with Islamic vibes that place is too good to spend quality time with f&f nice to explore and good Turkish cuisine👍🏻

Delicious authentic Turkish cuisine, great atmosphere and excellent service ❤️

Came back to this lovely Persian restaurant after 3-4 years to celebrate the Wife’s birthday. Last time here was for dinner, with the belly dancer floating around!

This time we were seated indoors due to the afternoon heat! Last few times were seated outside by the river which is lovely in the evening.

It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon ! The food was as good as we remembered it to be.

Look forward to coming back here… sooner this time :-)

flavourful and appetising Persian food! had an enjoyable alfresco dinner by the river with a very accommodating food attendant. the dessert was delicious but the faludeh shirazi was a tad too sweet for us. maybe next time will just stick with the saffron ice cream on top of the faludeh, sooo good. will go back to try more food on the menu!

We enjoy a spread of 3-Course Middle-eastern set lunch for $48++ per person. 🍷And we add on 2 hours of Toi Toi Sara’s Rose free flow for $40++ per person. Here what we ordered:
❤️ Kash-E-Bademjan
❤️ Borani Esfanaj
❤️ Fish Kebab
-Well marinated with special saffron sauce, it is very fresh and flavourful
❤️ Chicken Masti
-Marinated with yogurt and herbs, the chicken is tender and slightly charred given it’s fragrance
❤️ Dessert
-We love the ice-cream with spice and the Pistachios
The wine is good, with tinge of sweetness and hinge of dryness.
We really enjoy our meal in a restaurant with such a serene environment right beside Singapore River.

Good food good ambience..service was good and they went extra mile by accommodating my request for bringing a brownie for our lovely friend turning 40..staff has been has been very helpful and cheerful..
Special shout-out to YIng!!

However, I requested to add one additional pax and.. the person over the call mentioned that restaurant is full, finally accommodate my request. To my surprise, the restaurant was pretty much empty!

One of the best dining experiences in Robertson Quay. Authentic slow cooked Persian delicacies. A bit on the expensive side but no match for the quality they serve.

Reviews: 

Pleasantly welcomed by managers Jerriek and Rey and chef Edward with their warm smiles and sincere service, we felt comfortable and had a lovely dinner.

The food was delicious - the prawn tapas (gambas) was our top pick, along with the grilled octopus leg. Actually the joy of having tapas is that we can all try different dishes and share with friends and family- a very fun experience.

The decor and environment was cosy, with real bricks and European art collections like plates and mirrors from various sources, tastefully displayed to transport guests to another place..

Would come again for a romantic dinner or family gathering, or just a chill evening with friends over yummy Spanish food

A few years ago, I ate the paella with dishes made by Chef Edward. I visited today and ordered the paella that my son wanted to eat, but as shown in the photo, the bottom of the paella was too black and the texture of the rice was the result of cooking by a beginner, and the seafood all had a very fishy taste. There was no saffron scent, it was very salty and how much MSG was used... Even though I couldn't eat it all and left it behind, my tongue felt numb and it tasted like I was going to have a headache. There were only three tables including us, but the customers who arrived later than us were not served first, and when I asked to confirm our order, the waiter cut me off and replied that he would be back soon, which was also unpleasant. I visited again with delicious memories, but today I had such a terrible experience that I will never return. I hope you find your original intention and pay attention to the freshness of the ingredients. (For reference, the mussels I ate at My Little Spanish Place in Boat Quay, which I visited a month ago, were very fresh and delicious.)

June 2023

First visit & the food quality was quite mundane really.The only bit that I enjoyed in the Paella were the prawns which were fresh and of decent size. Other dishes were middle of the road kind , not bad but certainly won’t make you crave for more.
Comfortable ambience & helpful staff. A bit overpriced to be honest.

Nice food with a good ambiance. We love their seafood dishes. Even a vegetable-based has a special sauce to eat with it. We return here a few times for different occasions.

Super nice staff, but at this price point I'd expect more from the food. We ordered plenty and so could sample different things and there were some winners (the pan con tomate was fantastic), but there were too many that were disappointing. The gambas al ajillo, while sizable, had no heat in either sense of the word. The garlic bread was far too oily and some other dishes were over salted.
Finally, and without wanting to sound like a lush, the glass of house red was ok but the volume provided was equivalent to what a sommelier would pour to let someone taste the wine.

We came here for our wedding anniversary and were absolutely impressed! Husband is Spanish so there were high expectations. Absolutely liked every dish, however the squid ink paella and croquetas were a hit for us. Service went above and beyond, would absolutely come back again :)

We were greeted by friendly staff when entering.
Ordered some paella 🥘 . Delicious.
Food was amazing not pricey for restaurant. Spanish delights well served.
Desert was cheesecake with whiskey ice cream.
The staff recommended food which were incredible.
Overall experience 100/10

I like the Beetroot with smoked olive oil sorbet. Stunning dishes. Paella is super nice as well. Good experiences. Very happening places. Price meet the service and dishes.

I think this should be the best place to have Spanish food in Singapore - very delectable and original dishes. Loved the beetroot and strawberry salad in olive oil ice cream. Paella was also very flavourful. No regrets for a Tuesday weeknight dinner.

Lively atmosphere.   It’s a bit noisy so if one will need to speak louder to your companions.  Been here for a few times and experienced seated on a table and counter.   I personally prefer the counter just because I can see what’s happening at the kitchen and it was fun to watch.   Food were all yummy and their Sangria was one of the best we have tasted in Singapore.

Reviews: 

Spanish tapas at its best! They have a really good variety of tapas that you can enjoy in a small group setting. Each tapas were unique with its own set of flavour and texture, teasing the palate, readying it for the main course. Squid ink paella has that sweetness from the squid ink and further enhanced by the fresh lemon. The octopus was cooked perfectly with balsamic vinaigrette and was not chewy at all. For dessert, the churros with chocolate sauce was a good way of ending the meal. Highly recommended place to visit.

We had the lunch sets here and we enjoyed all the dishes that we picked. The Spanish Appetizers and Smoked Salmon Salad are good, the Braised Beef Cheeks are so tender and juicy, the Grilled Halibut is delicious, and the desserts are refreshing. Service is good, except that there should have been a queuing system at the door before it opens for service. Everyone rushed to the host when the door was open at 12. It’s rather messy.

We came on a Sunday around 1.30pm and had the set lunch. Portions were generous especially for the starters - we had the smoked salmon salad and scrambled eggs, which were tasty and well-balanced, the highlight of the meal. The grilled halibut and lamb rump mains were good. The lamb rump was well grilled if slightly gamey and accompanied with a delicious Provençal vegetable side. Desserts were a nice note to end on but tiny in comparison to the previous courses. Service staff were quite busy throughout and could be hard to get their attention, but courses were served quickly after ordering. Very worth it with our 1-for-1 deal but on the pricey side otherwise.

Wine and Co Holland village used to be our go to tapas place but since their brilliant chef left we haven’t been able to find a good tapas. Then we found this place and it will be our go to. Like most tapas places in Sg it’s expensive but the quality of the food is excellent and our favourite dishes  were cooked to perfection and tasted just as they should be.

The staff were very polite and service was quick. It’s a little dark away from the windows and a little noisy near the windows but if you’re going for a quick lunch that doesn’t matter. It’s a little difficult to find.

We came here for dinner and the ambience was lovely. Overall the food was delicious and it exceeded my expectations, especially the dishes we ordered from the warm tapas section. However, service wasn't that great. I had ordered a mocktail but was charged and delivered a cocktail. We also wasn't informed that the wagyu steak was minimum 300g, which left a bitter taste that night. Although it was stated in the menu, it was still misleading to include $28/100g. If it was stated better ($84, additional $28 for 100g onwards) We would have just ordered a dish more value for money such as a lobster. Aside from that, everything was well executed and we would definitely come again another time.

Food was so good, full of flavour and depth. Meat was tender. Portion of 5 Tapas and 1 Paella was more than enough for a table of 4.  We had the red Sangria and boy, it had quite a bit of alcohol. We could taste it on the first sip but who’s complaining? 😆

Service was alright since it was full house and they were short of staff. So that’s understandable.

Atmosphere was quite noisy as it was a Friday night but I can imagine it to be the same during weekends. It’s a nice place to be with great company. However do be prepared to pay more than a casual dinner place. We spent approx. $90 pp.

Would visit again soon!

Food is super good! 5 tapas is enough for two. Ordering another paella was an overkill, luckily the staff said we should just order half a portion. My favourite Spanish in SG!

This is my second visit back at Binomio, this restaurant served good Spanish food. We enjoyed the appetisers and paella today. However, the suckling pig today didn’t not taste good, while the skin was crispy but the meat tasted stinky. ☹️

We were greeted by friendly staffs on arrival. The staff patiently explained each type of tapas he recommended to try. We let him decides and all turn out great and we really enjoy them. We loved the pulpo afeira, the ink paella, costilla de ternera and the nido de huevos rotos. First time tried the nido de huevos dish, the chorizos was generous. The dinner went well without fuss. Will return to tried other tapas, like lengua.

Incredible experience and food, not a single miss. From the tapas to the paellas, to the desserts, to the sangria. Everything five stars. Service is on point, fast, and attentive. Great vibes as well both in private dining room and in main dining areas.
Can't recommend enough.

4 of us, we ordered 5 items to share, including a full rack of ribs, and the price came up to be $222 (excluding drinks). The food are generally good, and I particularly like the prawns paella and prawns. However, we find the ribs is quite salty, although it is tasty.

Encourage you to make reservation as they are very crowded even on weekdays!

Great food and a nice place to chill. The pizza shop opposite is under the same management and they allowed my kid to have a single slice instead of the whole pizza. The pizza was very authentic (dough was crispy outside and soft inside). The pork ribs was so tender and juicy. The paella and Spanish omelette were very good as well.

A good spot for Spanish food in Singapore. Price ~ 70-80$/pax. Almost all dishes we've tried taste great. Good portion as well. Nice ambiance & the staffs r attentive, just that stimes it's too crowded you might have to wait

Got pretty crowded on a Sunday evening but we managed to walk in for an early dinner. Great atmosphere for weekend dining with family and friends. 👍

Spanish omelette was hearty and filling.
Seafood paella was flavourful, texture was just right - moist but not wet.
The nachos were great for nibbling on too.

Went on a rainy afternoon and it was rather cold inside the restaurant.

Food was great and of large portions. Honestly not sure what was ordered because a friend ordered but everything was really yummy!!

I love the omelette, have to eat it fast while it is hot. Grilled potatoes are also great for sharing.

The crust of the pizza is different from those that you can usually find at the normal fast food chain.

The sea salt ice cream is amazing too 😋

Had dinner with the lads yesterday and it was a great time. We ordered each of the mains to be shared amongst us, tapas style. We also sampled some of the appetizers. All I can say is that we were blown away by each dish that came out. Whilst small, each dish was bursting with flavour!

We also took each of all the desserts and it was the perfect way to wrap up the evening.

My second time at Esquina, the last time was prob 2 years back. They are one of the few restaurants that still maintained the quality and consistency of the food. Still as good as I remembered and definitely one of the best Spanish restaurants in Singapore! All the dishes were amazing, couldn’t find a fault.
Price is always steep at these restaurants ($167 for 2 pax), but definitely left the restaurant with my belly very full!

Visited in Oct 2023

Finally visited Esquina during the Singapore Restaurant week for the 8-course menu for $98++. Really well crafted menu which covered a wide variety of items across starters and mains. The octopus and pork main dishes were fantastic.

Service was decent.

A definite recommendation and I myself hope to be back again soon.

Always been a place when you want simple delicious spanish tapas and that stands true after a decade. Menus has changed but their mission to deliver excellent food remains. We came for restaurant week and it was worth the return :)

Had lunch with a good friend at this restaurant. Sat at counter and had the chance to see the team in action. Tried the following- 1 Prawn with sour dough. The olive oil was great with slice garlic. 2. Tuna tartar was very refreshing. 3. Sucrine lettuce grilled and dressed in green yoghurt and macadamia nuts. 4. Sliced grilled octopus tentacles.
Everything was yummy, beautifully presented. I want to come back again soon.

Was here for my friend's birthday. Nice Latin music and friendly staff. The food was a thumbs-up, especially the Squid Ink Paella is my fav. The cocktail is a must-to-order. I highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion.

First time to try.  Nice ambience. One weekday lunch time, and it wasn't crowded. Minimal people dining in, but the service was still slow due to maybe short of manpower. Service lacks assertion.

Moderate selection of tapas. We ordered the set lunch and 1 classic tapas. Set lunch was priced as 19 ++ because you wouldn't get any set that would cost 19$. The minimum is 21 coz, as you can see on the menu, one main is 2$ additional cost the least.

Food wise. All tasted nice. More of the salty side. Paella squid ink was good, salty. But the portion was so little.  Ham croquettes was good also. Iberico pork was good, salty also. The mashed potato was good. Everything we ordered was good for one person. A little pricey.

Free water. And pickled olives.

Overall, it's good to try.

Dinner having Mexican food and drinks and we tried the Tapas Club at Orchard central....it was good and just right. We ordered tapas green peppers, potato brava, squid fritters, pulled pork tacos and of course paella. The tapas are good and tasty. Paella are crisp but I would say I would ask them to make our paella more crispier at the bottom, chicken and other seafood are quite few, lucky the way they cook the rice is good so I forgot to count the meats and seafood. Dessert are the ones we really love and would come back for more, banana fritters and churros with chocolate dip.these you should try when you pass by and dine at Tapas Club. Drinks are OK,lots of wine varieties you could choose from.

I want to share one good experience I have with a staff name Jenny at Orchard Central Outlet. Super accommodating and made us feel comfortable. Her service deserve to be recognised and praise. I think overall the staff did a great job to made us feel welcome. I would definitely come back again in the future :D.

Seafood and chicken paella looks great but taste was disappointing
The garlic prawns and fried squid tapas were better. Also ordered the chocolate lava cake which did not live up to its standard. Service was fast tho and restaurant was not crowded on a sat noon.

Reviews: 

Salut! I am so happy to chance upon this Spanish restaurant. I have walked past this place so many times and if it is not because of Google reviews, I wouldn’t have known how good it is and stepped in. This place feels so welcoming with its warm, chic airy interior, and soothing Spanish music that fills the air. I came here specially for the chef special grilled octopus (octopus con alubias blancas y pimentón), that really paired perfectly with Cava. I wish they have a wine dinner featuring specially curated Spanish wine and their food. Will definitely be back here.

Update: and we are back again to try their Jamon Iberico, Gambas Al Ajillo, and of course the Churros. Delicious.

Drinks were very affordable. Food is ok. Pork was under seasoned. Chorizo had not much taste. Roasted eggplant and clams were good. Tomato bread was soggy. Service ok. Most staff were helpful and friendly.

We decided to try this place after hearing so much about it and it didn’t disappoint. The food was great, with adequate size per portion to match the pricing 😇

We especially enjoyed the tortilla, bikini sandwich and the tomato purée soup. Had lots of cava to accompany the meal too 😊

Came here to celebrate one of my friend's birthday - we made a reservation beforehand. The restaurant had ample seating both on the outside and the inside. When we arrived, it was quite crowded but not too noisy although it was a Saturday night. The menu (see pics) was rather extensive for both food and drinks. Food had a good mixture of starters, sharing and individual main courses. They also had a small kid's section on the menu for those who have kids. They also have pork-free options for Muslims, which was great! We ordered 3 starters and 1 sharing dish (there were 3 of us). One thing to note: the portions for starters here aren't too big, so if you are expecting something bigger, you would be disappointed. They came rather fast, but the issue was that the paella (sharing dish) took almost 45 mins to an hour to prepare - although they said on the menu that it would take 30 mins tops.

Although it did take quite long and we were starving at that point of time, what made the entire experience bearable was the waitress serving us. We didn't catch her name but she was super personable and bubbly, entertaining our every demand by giving us recommendations, smiling and being genuine and even telling us that we could get a free birthday dessert if we signed up for their membership on the spot, which we would have missed out if she did not tell us. She also kept apologising for the long wait, which honestly wasn't her fault so she didn't need to at all!

All in all, we spent about 2 hours there (half the time was spent waiting and chatting). The food was decent and average, the environment was fine too but the professionalism of the serving staff was really what made it all worthwhile.

From the moment we sat down, our server, Bella, has charmed us with the best service and recommendations.

All her recommendations were on point, especially shout out to the clams dish (super juicy and fat clams) and the $10+ Happy Hour Tapas with small platter of best tapas.

We really want to compliment Bella and hope this review gives her the recognition for her great and upbeat attitude for the entire evening. 🎉

Reviews: 

Food quality was top notch and every dish was amazingly yummy and delicious! Definitely one of the top Spanish restaurants in Singapore!

Only 3 areas of improvement:
- to have more cocktail options, they had way too many wine options.
- it was relatively noisy at the courtyard, might be the infrastructure or design of the restaurant where the noise keeps bouncing back.
- should have cleared the plates on the table before serving the new dish, and not get customers to help hold the plates while they are serving.

It's a 4.5 stars for me personally.

My 7 y/o daughter and I enjoyed our dinner with TINTO. The service was impeccable - our server was attentive and patient with us, explaining the dishes as they were served.

The Gambas (prawn) starter was excellent and our favorite! The Grilled Asparagus was great, and we appreciated that it wasn't too salty. The Grilled Squid and Chorizo Paella didn't disappoint, albeit the serving was smaller than I expected.

All in all, a lovely experience and a small notch above Tapas Club.

Pretty good Spanish option in the Dempsey enclave! The gambas is quite possibly the best I’ve had in SG and honestly wish I did not have to share that at all. Paella also very decent and tasty. The only letdown we had was the churros that we ordered, when it arrived it was cold and not at all enjoyable. Ambience is alright, they have a pretty courtyard but the main restaurant is very noisy. Service was a bit slow but still alright.

Really liked this place: Elegant, but still relaxed atmosphere, attentive service. The person who seems to be the restaurant manager is indeed checking that everything is taken care of. I also appreciate that, at the beginning, they ask what type of water you like, including warm and ice water. This is a lovely attention to detail.
They have a full vegetarian menu with creative and interesting dishes - I want to come back to try more of these. Also very good Spanish wine options.
This would be a definite 5 stars if not for the below:
1) At our table, we had one starter and two mains. One of the mains was paella, which takes time to prepare (it's called out in the menu). They brought the other main so early, that one person at the table was pretty much done with the food when the paella arrived.
2) the vegetarian dish of the grilled gem lettuce was really nice, especially the chimichurri. Great use of herbs and flavours. Unfortunately, it was quite oily, which made it very heavy. A less oily preparation would have been great.

PS: The restaurant was full when we were there. For privacy reasons, I edited the other diners - but it certainly wasn't empty.

Party of 4...we came here for a birthday celebration. First impressions upon entering the restaurant exuded positive vibes - ambience, decor, welcoming crew. We were led to the inner section which was very cosy and inviting... I knew a great night was in store. Great menu and price points. We were attended to by the inimitable Ara who made the evening very enjoyable. The recommendations were on point. Food was fabulous. Overall a lovely lovely place for authentic Spanish fare. Highly recommended. Well done guys!!

Decent Spanish place at Boat Quay. More or less always packed. Made reservations and was given the outdoor seating close to the waters. Crab croquette was heavenly albeit a bit small portioned. Patatas bravas was great too with a super addictive sauce! Would have given 5 stars if the paella did not fall short. Have tried better elsewhere, the flavours were simply not the best.

Good spot for sipping wine and chilling.
The ham platter was my favourite, each type has a different fat and saltiness level which is very enjoyable with bread. The other tapas were just ok. The steak (not in photo) is a bit underwhelming as well. What pulled the rating back up is the wine and the service - the sommelier really knows his thing.

Update: Bumping up my rating because of a better experience the second time around. The iberico pork had such a good flavour profile. Meanwhile, the bone marrow is so sinful, yet almost worth all that cholesterol. I'd skip the churros, a little too oily, a little too crispy, and not enough chew on the inside.

Fantastic food, so much choice! We got 3 tapas each and struggled to finish them all. Seated by the waterfront with stunning night time views, just fab! Service was great, food came out very fast and the servers were very helpful and friendly - highly recommend!

Good location and quite easy to get to.
As the name of the place suggest this is a Spanish restaurant so is all the food and majority of the wine selection.

The food was good and the wine selection is nice. Paella was huge.

Service was okay and the place does get busy.

If you looking for Spanish cuisine this could be a good choice

We went to Boat Q outlet and it is not spacious place and very packed with customers.
The food we ordered we enjoyed except the squid rice not up to our expectation. And the price for what we ordered for 3 of us at 288++ would say very expensive and unexpected. Could use this money for even better deal food. But it is an experience!

This was an amazing find.  We meant to go to the restaurant next door but they were closed. We came in here on a whim. The food is amazing. My friend had the goat curry. I had the fish curry. Both were spicy but flavorful. The plantain chips are hot and crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The coffee was amazing, presentation and taste.

We had a wonderful dining experience at this restaurant. The standout feature was their incredibly welcoming, friendly, and attentive service. The staff patiently recommended dishes and even showed photos of them when we needed assistance.

We ordered the peanut chicken stew and goat curry, both of which were absolutely delightful. The flavors were well-balanced with just the right amount of spice and heat, and there was no gamy taste from the goat meat.

The cocktails were also a hit, and the evening was rounded off with delicious desserts. The overall ambiance was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect setting for a memorable evening.

We'll definitely be returning, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to friends. It's a gem worth visiting again and again.

Went there for dinner and I had cauliflower and buttermilk fried chicken for starters and the portion is pretty generous. Absolutely love both of it. Got the fish curry too and it was amazing tho pretty spicy. However we didn't enjoy the Malindi Halwa dessert so much with it's jelly-like texture. Service is really top notch as they were always attentive.

It’s my first time trying Africa’s cuisine, and I’m pleasantly impressed with the food.

We ordered a variety of curry based dishes, with different level of spiciness - and we enjoyed all of them.

Highly recommended the Goat Curry, where in our opinion is the best one there.

Great ambience and fantastic customer service from the staff. Our waiter spent time to recommend us the dishes. The food is definitely on the pricier side and it felt that it might have been adjusted so much to suit the local palate that the food does not feel uniquely african. When the food tastes very similar to local dishes, it does not really justify the high price.

Simply put: delicious food, attentive service, nice ambience. Reasonable prices for the quality and yummy flavours.

This will always be our go-to for golden, crisp and tasty Peking duck.

We ordered some fish with veggies and assorted dimsum as well.

We enjoyed everything, and service was excellent! They even seated us with just 15 mins to spare before the lunch time last order cut-off.

🚇 City hall
🧾 $200+ including the Peking duck

IG @sporkandbeanz

Had a farewell dinner in their PDR - it’s a $1200++ minimum spend but with free corkage for wines and spirits which made it an absolutely phenomenal evening. Service is helpful albeit sometimes difficult to grab attention of, and the food is no doubt tasty. Wish they let us control the music in our own room or at least play more atmospheric music (it was basically lullaby music for the most part). Overall worth coming to if you want a good time with friends.

Great atmosphere.
Food are some very good and some are just fine for the price.
Drunken prawn preparation and live boiling were excellent visually and tasted good.
Peking duck skin were very good but the egg flavored wrapper dilute the taste. And additional cost to serve the duck meat with noodles were quite high.
Shark fin was nice despite no big piece of fin and its all small mixed pieces.
The soup in coconut shell were very nice
The big bamboo clam were nice.

Can't gush more about their service. Little things like offering to cut the cake we brought for a birthday celebration, asking if we wanted to pack the leftovers before we even had to ask, random staff actually looking over to smile and say goodbye while we were walking out after dinner, and that old school culture of staff treating customers like family is something we don't encounter much anymore these days...

Food is perfectly done classic Cantonese food. Peking duck generously yielded enough for a table of 10 to eat at least two rounds for everyone. Really keen to go back and try their dim sum.

Missed this place. Glad that they reopened at raffles city’s Fairmont. It’s right beside koji on the 3rd floor.
Comfy seating and great Cantonese cuisine and other fair. Peking duck was just as good as before. I liked their garoupa fish cooked 2 styles. Black pepper beef was tender and the fried bee hoon was perfect. Soup was perfect too. Finished the boiled pork ribs actually.
You’ll definitely come back. It’s such an iconic name.

We originally came for peeking duck, but the waitress advised us that it would be too much food for the two of us, which I appreciated! We got one of the chefs menus instead. My favorite was the chili prawns and my least favorite was the fried rice, it just wasn't anything special compared to the other dishes.

Service was great and they even set up a kids place setting for our baby, which was sweet, even though he is much too young for solid foods.

The food was mediocre at best, but the service was good. We made a reservation for seven beforehand, yet the table we were assigned was extremely small, could not even fit the dishes we ordered.

Compared to other Chinese restaurants in this price bracket, such as those at the Ritz Carlton and Hilton, this dining experience left much to be desired.

BBQ Meat Combination 2/5
Steamed Star Groupa 2.5/5
Peking Duck 3/5
Sweet and Sour Pork 4/5
Stir fried Kai Lan 1/5

One of the best Peking ducks ever! Please note that all other dishes, despite the high price, are portions for one pax only.

Very expensive but worth the Michelin star!

Fantastic restaurant, small portion but really great. I would say, 烧腊 is the best!!!!!!! Highly recommended for family gathering or special occasions.

Peking Duck was the highlight here. Level up with a touch of caviar. The duck here is more lean and crisp but I do think a little of fat adds to the flavour. Still good nonetheless.

Had a soup (meh, especially for that price) and a Soft Shell Crab with Crab Meat (which was yums, creamy but not to the point of being jelak, guess it helped that we shared instead of having 1 each) and a refreshing petite fours of Osmanthus Jelly and Pineapple Tart.

The complimentary birthday cake was delish too, reminded much of Ritz's Royal Caraibe from 20 years back. Dark bittersweet choc mousse on a layer of caramelised crunch. Service was top notch, attentive yet but imposing, always there but invisibly.

The staff is AMAZING! Our waiter took special care to ensure that we had really nice pictures for the "birthday cake shot".

The food was nice, but nothing too special.

I would go back for the service and ambience alone.

Went there for lunch for the first time. We had orchid lunch set. Especially love the soup, the smoked duck and the lobster rice/fish noodles. We didn't get to take any photo so just find some photos online to show some of the best dishes we had.
Yes it's pricey, but it's worth the money.

Great food and good service. There were just 2 of us and the restaurant was able to adjust the dim sum portion to 2 pieces each so that we could try more variety. Love that flexibility!

Good ambiance with impressive crockery that have beautiful black brush ink paintings of flowers. Each diner was served your individual bowl of fried cashew nuts as appetisers instead of communal serving in most Chinese restaurants. Nice touch!

We had steamed live prawns that were served with very fine strips of ginger, scallions and chilli in a light sauce for dipping. A silver finger bowl with a lemon slice was provided. Nice touch!

Ingredients used in Sze Chuan Styled Stewed Sea Cucumber Fish Maw and Braised Bean Curd Bamboo Pith were fresh and good quality. However the flavours of both were not memorable and the gravy for the beancurd had too much cornstarch.

Fried Rice Crab Meat with Dried Scallops was full of "wok hei". The only dish that left a good impression.

Good hospitality for there is no charge for warm water.

I was here on a weekday afternoon (prior reservation is recommended). The place quickly got crowded at around 1pm, mostly with business folks who presumably were there for lunch meetings.

Excellent place for dim sum. The food isn't cheap here, but what you get in return is high-quality food, in fact the best dim sums in town, and excellent service.

The food quality is overall average. Lobster soup is rich in taste but the serving of the lobster is under expectation. In fact most of the dishes portion is relatively small for that price range.

Service experience is also under expectation. We sat at a place with a blind spot and the service staff are not attentive to our request. I have to walk to the counter for help. Suggest to provide some electronic buzzing system if the restaurant has under staff to serve the customer.

Came across this place via Google search.
Suppose to come here for DimSum. But only available in the afternoon.
But we still decided to stay for dinner.

Food is not bad, very well presented. Taste is pretty ok especially the chicken and the laksa prawn.

But when comes to the service by the restaurant staff, I gotta give them a lower rating. It certainly under expectations.

Firstly, they are not welcoming at all when we were at the counter waiting to be seated.

Secondly, the waiter is not attentive. They have no smile at all (which is important in service line).
When we request for tea or request him to add hot water, he just came and grab the teapot and go off with super monotonous attitude. When we say thank you, the staff don't even response at all (basically like a robot).

Therefore, I don't think we will come back again. The food is ok but definitely not the best compare to the same level restaurant elsewhere. Also the service staff and their attitude didn't impress us despite the restaurant is not busy at all (only 3 tables including our table).

Came for lunch, excellent staff service and quality food. Recommend to come 👍🏻

The food and atmosphere was good but one of the staff had a really bad attitude and kept showing us black face. One other staff was very friendly so I'll rate it as 4 stars. Maybe the first staff had a bad day 🤷🏻‍♀️

Cosy environment. Great for family gartherings. Dimsum. Lobster pumpkin soup having 1 for 1 offer. Nice. Recommended.

My husband located this restaurant on Google maps, it was about 10 minutes walking distance from our hotel. It is situated on the 5th floor of a shopping mall and closes at 10pm. Last order is at 9.30pm.

We shared a starter of crispy crab and prawn rolls. They came separately wrapped with red and green sauce.

I had a lamb rack (one lamb cutlet to be precise) on a bed of potato and vegetables. My husband had braised sliced duck for one person with steamed rice. The food was nice and the service was quick. The plates were not hot, so the food became cold very quickly.

The wine is expensive, but always is in Singapore. More cost effective to buy a bottle.

The chrysanthemum and jasmine tea was nice.

I had always wanted to try this restaurant. But it’s always skipped my mind when I’m at paragon due it’s located at level 5.

So this time round, I’m very focus to go to this restaurant with the purposeful trip down to paragon.

As much as I’m excited and anticipated for this restaurant, it starts to turn me off little by little as i walked in, when we’re seated to our table, we could smell a strong damp and moldy stench arising from their carpet floor… this is a killer for our dining experience in there.

Apart from that, the food definitely still maintain its Michelin standard (though the Michelin was no longer accredited in 2023), also we like the “old” staffs working there, the service from the traditional Chinese restaurant where you can experience, they know their stuffs, and they do know how to talk to customers. Had a great chat with the staff as well.

I guess the restaurant really need to upgrade n change their carpet.

Food was okay, nothing too grand or special. Of all the dishes we got, I would only highly recommend the sweet, sour and crispy fried mushrooms. The kangkong was good.

Servers were very attentive and helpful with the recommendations. Although as a tourist, we didn’t know that every refill of our tea would be charged and they kept refilling without us asking them to - ended up paying $20 for hot water refills.

Atmosphere was okay also, walkway going inside the restaurant gave it a good vibe.

Nice place to have dimsum with families ablnd friend inside Paragon mall. Many choices of dimsum. It is not a big restaurant but a very nice decoration. It was in the Michelin guide. The restaurant was not busy when we arrived. The service is good and workers are friendly.  It serves typical dimsum dishes like other dimsum restaurants. It also  serves regular chinese dishes.  We order multiple dimsum dishes, and foods are delicious. If you order lo mai kai, it will take about 20 minutes  to prepare. Other dimsum items were ready pretty quickly. I like the chicken feet. It is better than the one we have in the States.  It was soft and tastes so good. Other dimsums items are good too but not like wow.  Overall I like this restaurant and the service.

Extended family dinner to welcome back our nephew and niece who are studying in UK, back to Singapore on summer break. The food was great and service was good, prompt, attentive and friendly. We've been here several times and always had good experience.

Visited on 23 Dec 2022 to order mutton briyani for takeaways. The rice is fluffy and well cooked.. almost like fried rice with individual grains.. and the mutton curry is succulent and soft to the bite, with very deep indian smell and taste to the curry sauce. Worth all the $5.50 paid for it

Cheap and nice crab promotion. $38.80 for 3 crab with any flavour really worth the price. But Asam fish taste not that fresh and some vege got bitter and sour taste like not that fresh. However, it is still worth going if promotion still valid.

Now there is promotion on for new zichar restaurant. (1) One whole fish for only S$18. (2) Indian curry chicken $4.50, if add egg and vegetable, it becomes a set at S$5.

Online but no response for whole day, after saying can order we placed order and pickup time. We already on the way to pickup since there was no response, after spam call for few times 6pm+ pickup call say crabs smelly not selling say order cancelled.

Order since 11am confirmed already, no responses no reply. Best part, WhatsApp was ONLINE ALL THE TIME. Absolutely disgusting service, no apologies aftermath and not remorseful through phone convo. NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

I went to the place on a Saturday at 615pm. There was only one other table of diners then. The place got really crowded after 7pm. There was only one waiter serving everyone so service is kinda slow. Food is on the saltier side but still very delicious. Strongly recommend their black pepper crab. Affordable and tasty.

As someone who's on a no grain diet, it's been hard going to restaurants but I absolutely loved the menu and appreciated the variety of gluten free options that I could choose from and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the mussels as I single handedly polished the entire bowl. Great buzzing atmosphere too for a Friday night!

Extremely friendly staff and good service. Grilled Cod Fish is a must try, suoer tasty, juicy and fresh!
Mango mustard salad taste weird to me (maybe just I don't like it) but overall its a good experience!

Have been to Coriander Leaf a few times and most recently again with my husband. Food was great, in fact even better than we remembered! We ordered the duck curry, the garlic naan (best naan we ever had), miso cod and spicy eggplant, and ended with the spiced lava cake. We had a delightful meal, and highly recommend the combination of the red curry and the garlic naan, it's a flavour explosion! We will be back :)

Great food with vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free options. The dishes are Asian / Middle Eastern inspired, and very flavorful with spices and herbs.
It's great for diverse groups: There is no pork / lard used in the premises, and the meat is halal. They do serve alcohol (therefore, the restaurant is not halal-certified), so it really covers a large range of preferences.
Service is excellent:; Very attentive and efficient, and food orders arrive fast.
Special callout: I was there with a larger group. We could pre-order dishes via WhatsApp (quick and easy). The dishes were served sharing style. This was super efficient (no time spent on lengthy ordering process) and allowed everyone to sample very diverse flavors.

Overall, it was a good experience. Some food like the lamb was very good, but the stingray was not fresh. Naan was very good,served hot, and freshly made. Each serving per dish was small, good for 2 pax. Wide varieties of asian food to select from.

Reviews: 

Great place to catch with friends over delicious food and drinks.

The menu never fails to impress with the Asian twists. Huge variety of drinks as well.

Great team to provide a great experience here, and always a fabulous visit.

For 6 pax, we had the crispy crab omelette, truffle roast duck, spicy brussel sprouts, wok-fried wagyu hor fun, XYT hokkien mee, kurobuta char siew. The food was surprisingly good! My personal favourites were the truffle duck and brussel sprouts.

Overall a cosy and interesting bar to dine and chill with friends!

Went on a rainy Thursday night 7pm. There were empty seats & mostly are foreigners. Made a reservation for 5 persons. We sat behind & it’s really dark there. We had to keep turning on our Hp flash light. Service & Atmosphere is very good. Staffs are friendly & restaurant decorations are retro vibes & pretty. Even the utensil they used are pretty. Food portions are small so it’s actually quite expensive. Taste is unique & not bad but I don’t really think it’s fantastic till it’s worth the pricing. We paid over $300+. We had a Yakult cocktail @ $48 for 3 pax, coconut lime mocktail & ice dirty chai latte (couldn’t taste the chai taste) at $10 each.

Lobster kueh pie tee taste good. Ugly broccolini is deep fried till very crispy, not to my liking.. Crab fried rice is tasty as it’s fried with XO sauce. Crispy Squid is not bad but the wilted kale is deep fried also so it’s crispy too. It doesn’t taste like veggies. Crispy crab omelette with the Singapore chilli dip had a tinge of Assam taste. Truffle roast duck is good, skin is crispy. But truffle smell & taste is not obvious enough. Crispy tofu is small portioned, it goes well with the Salty black pepper sauce.

Lastly is the xinjiang style Lamb ribs. We were suggested to order 2 portions since we had 5 person..  For 1 of the plate, whole ribs is totally fats & no meat. Every bite I took i thought I will at least ate the meat part but too bad it’s totally fats. End up i felt so nauseous & my stomach rumbles so badly that i threw up when I reaches home. It’s is the smell of the Lamb ribs 😢…

Kind of anticipated the meal here so was a little disappointed.. Also understand why it’s mostly foreigners since it might felt like fushion Tze char. But I really appreciate their good service.

Hands down one of my top 3 places in Singapore.
The style of the place is so laid back and the staff is very nice.

Drinks and food are out of this world and of outstanding quality.

Come here, have a good time and drink a Soju Bomb!

Cosy little restaurant with a nostalgic atmosphere with good food. The kurobuta char siew was fatty and yummy. The fried chicken wings were not bad and the duck was good too but not much truffle taste.

They also have a good selection of cocktails and we had fun with the menu and drink selection.

Reviews: 

Heard about this establishment from friends who lived near Mandarin Gardens, decided to order out on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty quiet on a Saturday post-lunch afternoon, and I was attended to promptly.

The staff who took my order was conscientious and meticulous. She made sure to present the signature dishes as well as repeated my orders to confirm them. She was also helpful in making sure that I could come back after the food is prepared as I had to run a short errand around the area.

I ordered the small portions of the following: Jing Du pork, tofu with chicken floss, butter squid. The olive rice was available in a standard size.

The family was not impressed with the food, the pork had a sweet vinegary flavour and was quite tough, the tofu with chicken floss was decent, but nothing to rave about. The butter squid was quite mushy, perhaps it was better to have it on-site? The olive rice had wok hei but barely any other flavours.

Was quite disappointed, perhaps due to the hype from the previous reviews. Probably won't be heading back for the food, despite the excellent service. Will also be sharing my disappointment with my friends at Mandarin Gardens.

Good service from the restaurant staff. I liked the foods here especially the olive fried rice, 京都排骨 and butter squid. The food quality is great and consistent. I dined in during lunch time and really enjoyed the quiet atmosphere here with great food.

We dropped by on a Wednesday and got the Butter Squid at 50% off. Also tried the Jing Du Pork and Fried Hong Kong Noodles, all of which were yummy. Ambience was quiet and peaceful, service staff was attentive.

Will be back here again!

I had a great experience at Thaipan on 24 Mar 2023. I went there for my ROM lunch and it was superb! The food was really yummy and the service was good. The staff were very polite and both my families were very pleased with the food presentation and taste! Their yam ring and fried salted egg prawn ball along with their fish were all cooked excellently! When I reserved the place and informed that it was for my ROM lunch, they specifically bought fresh flowers for the table. I would recommend this place as the price point is good too! (Attached photos of yam ring and cereal chicken)

Wow! My wife and I hosted a dinner for 13pax. The boss Mrs Wong curated a 10 course dinner for us that was absolutely amazing!

You have to try their famous curry fish! We opted for the tail as there is more meat, but this dish you have to order before hand!

The ambience now is quiet as this 20 year old brand just moved here 1year ago.

Mrs Wong stopped the business for a while as she had a bad fall, but now she is well and she's back!

Her team is dedicated and friendly, service was wonderful!

There's parking in the IBIS Styles Bugis hotel and around the vicinity, there is even a durian stall across the small road, so a great place for tourist to try out local cuisine and have durian(if you are in the durian season)

Highly reccomended!

Rating: 4.7
Reviews: 

Tried the 7 course meal for a celebratory lunch.

The food was great - loved the Maryuko Uni, smoked organic egg and the desserts. ‘Blanc’ the dessert was phenomenal.

However, service was quite average. The waiters rushed through explanations of their dishes. And while they tried to entertain our questions about the dishes, the way that they did it was quite cursory and generally seemed quite reluctant to hold a conversation.

My first 3 star Michelin experience. I found the service a little stiff, as the evening progressed the staff loosened up a bit which was nice, everything was so extra, the presentation of the food was so interesting and exciting. The food was good but I can probably tick off this experience. Make sure you like seafood! A once and a lifetime experience!
It was pretty cool we got to meet the chefs after.

I certainly had very high expectations of Odette, it having 3 Michelin stars and being #14 in The World's 50 Best Restaurants list at the time of the visit (november 2023).

Well, fame is definitely not everything! From start to finish, what lacked was soul and personality, and the whole experience made me think reputation by terms of media and rankings might be increasingly decadent.

To start off, we were offered a small and uncomfortable-looking table right by the entrance door, even though I had reserved a table in the Private Dining Room over a month prior. We had to insist on being placed in the intended room.

The whole time, it felt like we were doing the restaurant a favor being there and I could sense so much pretentiousness in service, food and ambiance. The flavor and even the high quality ingredients were shadowed by this and the gimmicky presentations of the food.

At a USD 500/SGD 700 price point per person (without wine pairing), I most definitely cannot recommend Odette to anyone.

What a lovely and delicious evening out in Singapore. Service was what you would expect from a 3* establishments. All the dishes, from the butter to the pigeon, were out of this world. The staff was well orchestrated and did a great job of providing information on each dish and engaging us in conversation throughout the evening. Having been fortunate enough to dine at other 2 & 3* restaurants around the globe I would put this in my top 3 in a very close race with Mudec in Milan for number 1 and edging out French Laundry in terms of the menu. I will definitely try to secure another reservation next time I'm in Singapore.

Odette has always been on my to-try list and this year I was treated to a birthday dinner here!

An amazing French experience savoring the 7-course meal. We were totally impressed by the presentation as well as the flavour of each dish. Not to mention the excellent and attentive service by the crew! It was also nice of them to gift a bottle of strawberry jam for every guest.

An unforgettable meal, or rather gourmet journey at this 3-starred michelin.

Reviews: 

Our first time here. The service was hospitable and genuine, no pretense despite being a Michelin-starred restaurant. Alex and Kim were friendly and was impeccable in their service. Food was amazing with unique combinations of fresh ingredients. Chef also came over to each table to interact which we felt was an awesome touch. Strongly recommended!

Well deserved Michelin Restaurants.
The bread is so crispy on the outside and so so so soft on the inside. Pairing with the bordier butter, it is really exceptional.
Every dish of the food is amazing.

The service is so good. When the table is full of crumbs, the waiter will clean it up to sweep away the crumbs. The waiter are also friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes.
When we found a bone in the fish and the chef came out to apologize. Felt the service was so good.

The atmosphere in the round room felt great too.

One of the best fine dining places I’ve ever been to! I can’t keep track of what was being served because there was just so many different courses, but each course was really tasty 🥰 I don’t think I’m a small eater but I was so full by the last few courses, I don’t think I ate any at all. Remember to pace yourself. I’m most impressed by their bakes; their toasty black sesame bread was literally the best bread I’ve ever had in my life.

White Grass is a hidden gem, providing a distinctive dining venture with its fusion of Japanese and European flavors.

Each dish is delectable, especially the bread, pastries, and desserts rank the finest that I ever tasted.

The real flower centerpiece adds a pleasant fragrance, and the stylish decor contributes to the overall charm, making it an excellent option for couples and hosting friends.

On my second visit, I can confidently say they consistently exceed my expectations.

Very good ambience and attentive service. The bread is crispy outside and moist inside. Sesame bread is delicious too. Abalone is well done combined with the sauce and texture. The lobster meat is too soft for our liking. Everything is fine but no distinctive wow factor.

Reviews: 

Nice environment and friendly staff.
And the food is great!

It’s my honour to have an opportunity to try the New Menu. I like the most is my main, the Glacier 51 Toothfish with special mixed with 4 different oils! It’s amazing and taste really good 👍🏻

It’s a wonderful night and dinner with my beloved. 🥂

Recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

My partner brought me here for my birthday lunch and we had a lovely time here. We ordered the 2 course lunch with an add on of extra serving of potato bread & steak.

We enjoyed the potato bread that we ordered a extra serving. The steak was also yummy and cooked to medium rare. The steak came with oyster mushroom was also cooked to perfection. Special shout-out to to the beef tartare(lovely presentation!)& pork steak(burst of flavour!!)!

The duck breast was slightly too rare for our liking.

The service was lovely and friendly and they also surprised me with a apple tart for my birthday.

Nice environment for any celebration
Friendly staff will take care of all the guest
And the food is very nice too
Beef is perfectly cook very tender and juicy and the sauce balancing was nice
Oh ya I like the bread most and the condiment for bread was nice🤩 especially for the butter got a little bit of smoky kick I just can’t stop spreading the butter on my bread haha
But I’m too full to having another bread😫 otherwise I’ll request for one more haha
And the desert was surprising  me also

Overall it’s a perfect night for all

Well guys new menu is coming soon just make your reservation🤤

A lovely place where we spent our anniversary lunch. Food was YUM. A mix of different cuisines rolled into something I'd call contemporary European. Presentation of dishes was spectacular with the beef tartar showcased in a delightfully unusual way!

This is a five-star experience all the way - Alma has a Michelin star in the guide that just came out for Singapore, and deservedly so. They were happy to accommodate vegetarian food for the prix fixe menu, which is great value. The signature tofu with black truffle was sublime, as were the Japanese tomatoes with tomato sorbet. The amuse bouche of tomato with a sour plum film was another delight.

It's a nice space too, with a beautifully designed interior and a superb selection of wines and in particular rare whiskies.

This one's going on our repeat visit list for sure!

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax

Reviews: 

Fantastic once in a lifetime experience! We had an amazing host - Bernard who shared his life story. He had an amazing voice, sounded like a radio DJ. Randy was really friendly too in guiding us to our seats. The customer service at the lounge was really warm and friendly too!

Very very unique experience and 10/10 will recommend to come to this place. The picture was taken before the dinner and the dinner was served incomplete darkness. The service is very heartwarming and very friendly.  Dining in pitch dark really gives us the perspective on how a vision disabled person experience their day to day life (just the eating part alone). I think I should not reveal too much details but rather let you experience yourself. This unique experience start from the time u step in the restaurant. Really must try!!!

Absolutely great experience. Booking with credit card is necessary. When arrived we waited at this fancy bar area where an appetiser is served. We can order bar drinks too. Lockers were provided to keep your bags, phones, watches that illuminate. Then we were taken to a second floor where the room was in complete darkness. When you can see, the sense of touch smell and taste elevates and became more sensitive. Food and wine were great just have to be careful when consuming since we can’t see. Servers are all very passionate, friendly and professional. They told us they can’t see and we are impressed by how swift and accurate they serve. They were also very engaged in conversations with us. Menu changes every two months we were told. Highly recommended!

Go on a culinary adventure, bring out your inner child, enhance and explore with your others senses. Travel a journey to 12 different exciting yummy dishes.

Tldr: Very interesting experiential concept; Recommended for the novel experience. 3 course menu for $88++ (4 dishes per course, features seafood & red meat); 2 flight wine pairing for $30, 3 flight wine pairing for $40.

Nox is an experiential dining concept where you dine in total darkness while being guided and served by visually impaired waiters. I started off at the bar area (lit up) and got the ‘Kwai Feh’ cocktail ($22) - the gin and grapefruit pairing was pleasant and refreshing. They also served a small canape of celery root puree mousse & uni in a crispy cone (included in the set course), which was light with the sea flavor of uni.

For dinner proper, we had to remove and deposit any luminescent personal items (including phones) into a locker before we were brought to the pitch dark dining hall.

Nox serves a standard 3-course meal (appetiser / main / dessert) for $88. Each course is split into 4 separate dishes, making it effectively 12 different dishes over the 3-course dinner. Wont spoil the menu by sharing the exact dishes, but there was a good mix of seafood and red meat. The food was generally tasty and of good quality, although nothing spectacular. I also topped up $40 for the 3 flight wine pairing. After the meal, the dishes were revealed back at the bar area.

It was also interesting to experience how the visually impaired waiters used tongue clicks and whistles to navigate through the dining area with trays of food and drink without running into each other or dropping things. Overall a very interesting experience; highly recommended to try.

An exceptional experience, very fortunate to have visited this unique restaurant last night. These folks have real flair, making the visit enjoyable from the moment we arrived. I think that I can relate to the chefs “cross roads” concept, an amazing set menu with elements from across the globe. Great wine pairing, loved hearing the story lines.  Loved the casual, relaxed atmosphere. Everything presented with confidence and fun.  Well deserving of its Michelin status.  Each course was remarkable, but I was particularly taken with the chocolate fish ball!

I recently visited Nouri and I must say, the experience was outstanding. The food was absolutely delicious, with a unique blend of cross-cultural flavors that truly impressed my taste buds. From start to finish, every dish was beautifully presented and expertly prepared.

The renovated space is also fantastic, with a modern yet elegant atmosphere that adds to the overall dining experience. There is also a renewed chef table.

The service was top-notch and the staff was incredibly attentive. I highly recommend Nouri to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in Singapore.

Thank you, Nouri, for an unforgettable evening!

The owner did a wonderful service. We went in for lunch before our flight and the service was prompt and the food came out in a nice pace for lunch. The food was ok and this is my second time here. It has been consistent during the years. This is a nice spot to bring business guest for lunch as it is usually quiet during lunch in the area where most of the comparable restaurants may only open for dinner.  Yes, it is quite pricey.

Food was great, service was great, atmosphere was great. It was relaxed and we had a good time over good food. All the options were presented to us so well; tea, opening drinks, etc. I was just slightly shocked that the selection of tea to end the meal costed $30ish per pot. But other than that, I enjoyed dinner.

Unique flavors, warm, friendly service, beautiful plates, reasonably priced. Staff generously explained every dish and ingredients and an energetic open kitchen made for a memorable dining experience.

The food was really good and quite surprising. Everything was really original and tasty. Special mention for the main courses which were amazing, espacially the Mussels one. I was also quite surprised, in a good way, by the wines. The only thing I can say is that it was a little too cold in the room for me. Thank you very much for the experience.

The dining experience was very enjoyable. I thought the overall ambience and plating / presentation were 10/10. What stood out most was the hospitality. The staff noted it was my husband’s birthday and gave a little something which was thoughtful and useful - a little goodie bag comprising samplers of Irish cream, the very same bacon butter that came with the soda bread in the menu, and a useful fridge magnet with the recipe of the said bread. Such a nice way to remember the meal by!

Visited in Oct 2023 as part of the SG Restaurant Week

Good starters where my favourite was the treacle bread. The foie gras brûlée was also decent. Among the mains I really liked the beef preparation and also the fish & squid laksa. The meal rounded off with a couple of very nice dessert items. The “Irish Cloud” dessert was particularly good.

All in all, Cure is a very solid restaurant and should be on your F&B places to visit in SG.

We had the Restaurant Week lunch set. The meal was a 6 course meal with add on for an extra mains and cheese platter. You can also add on extra for wine pairing.

The appetiser consisted of 3 small snacks. The Soda Stout Treacle bread with butter was soft and served hot and the fkavours was a delicate balance of savoury and sweet.

The 2nd appetiser consisted of their rendition of Tayto, which had a potato skin with soft cheese, and captured the flavour of potato crisps.

The next appetiser was pig head cheese wrapped with cabbage. Light texture and flavour.

The main course of wagyu  beef was nicely plated, and we really like the flavours of the sauce. Beef was also perfectly cooked rare/med rare, but the portion size was a bit small.

The dessert Irish Cloud was one of the star dishes, it had a white chocolate outer shell with vanilla cream and basil sherbert. The flavours  are light and allows the ingredient flavors to blend with each bite.

Service and ambience was also good overall, small restaurant, with enough space between each table, and acoustic panels also helped dampend any noise.

The service staff was attentive and introduced each item on the menu

Excellent and innovative creations from beginning to end.

We started with the Soda, Stout and Treacle Bread.  Oh what and experience it was as it came with butter that had bacon bits and black onion powder infused in it.  The bread, served nicely warm, looked like a muffin and had great texture.

The Tayto Cheese & Onion was a tad too small, so could not taste the potato, nor cheese nor onion.

The Lovage & Jameson Soft Serve Asparagus Morel was like a tiny ice cream cone, delightful and playful.  Morels were made into a Ragu mousse and hidden deep in the cone.

A family favorite was the Salmon, Juniper & Seaweed which had Japanese influence, as salmon was cured for 3 days, then wrapped with seaweed and covered with crusty bread crumbs deep fried.  This was really a winner and we could eat 10 each, if given a choice.

Queen Scallop, Cider, Horseradish was a refreshing dish with icy yuzu taste, like a palate cleanser.

The Porridge of Sea Urchin was lovely, with generous amount of sea urchin and barley porridge covered with a beef tartare, another crowd pleaser.

The 7 Tales of the Fox & Silver Duck was a good mains.  With duck in 4 renditions, foie gras custard and green apple, chewy ball, crispy tart and duck meat with mulberries.

Childhood Memories of Peat was interesting.  Like eating charcoal.

Shanty’s Whip Citrus Custard is a fruity sweet custard.

We topped up with Tipperary Brie Cheese, Onion Eccles.  Brie was nice and Eccles was amazing!

Excellent services with quality food and fantastic atmosphere. The restaurant only has limited table, definitely need reservations to come here. The place focuses more on a wide range of quality vegetables across the world. Very unique presentation of the dishes! My partner was having the vegetarian option and it was as good as the non vegetarian options. The chef even packed us his hometown cake to bring home for tasting.
A little high on the cost, but worth the experience!

One of the most breathtaking food experience I had the chance to enjoy.

Amazing culinary journey. The contemporary symphony of aromas and textures through a vegetarian focus was fresh, exciting and new. Every dish is meticulously crafted to bring a delightful balance of flavors. The wine pairing was on point. Compliments job to the chef.

Excellent service. Attentiveness and professionalism exceeded our expectations.

The atmosphere was warm, friendly and cosy. We felt welcomed and in optimal conditions to savor our dinner.

We recommend this restaurant to anyone passionate about food.

Beautiful vegetarian cuisine, beautiful ambience, beautiful service and staff. Just take that leap for tastebud and exquisite ingredients discovery. Presentation of the food, attention to your dining experience made it such a pleasant experience. Do come by each season for different culinary exposure.

Chef Jeremy and the team did a fantastic job championing seasonal vegetables. The wine paring was beautifully done for each course to highlight the taste of the food with a great balance.

The ambience of the restaurant was intimate and lovely but the light was slightly dark. It was a birthday celebration and we had a great time throughout the night.

The menu was exceptional, a great variation of vegetables and herbs tastefully balanced and beautifully presented. The choice of courses was perfectly matched. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The chef introduced himself to all the guests and was very accommodating. We really enjoyed our dinner at JAG, a highlight in Singapore.
