Our experience at Braci was probably one of our most memorable meals and the food served was truly deserving of its Michelin star. Would highly recommend getting the seven course menu as there were so many more elements in our dinner incorporated that made it all the more special. Flavours were all very well balanced and overall we left feeling very satisfied.

Visited in Sep 2023

Braci was on my list of restaurants to visit for over 4 years and I must say that it was worth the wait. It is no surprise that Braci has retained its Michelin 1 star for 6 consecutive years. The menu was a progressive one which is definitely inspired by Chef Mattie’s Italian roots. There are 2 choices for people (5 course and 7 course). I would suggest people to go for the 7 course as the additional dishes in the 7 course meal are worth it. One of my favourite parts of the experience was trying out the 100 yr old balsamic vinegar.

If you’re not taking the wine pairing, I would strongly recommend folks to try out a few of their cocktails, esp. their Negroni (one of the most unique ones I’ve had)

Service was good. The restaurant is able to cater to some food allergies (like my shellfish allergy).

A definite recommendation for fine dining lovers.

Amazing time at Braci for a birthday celebration for my husband. The Italian food was superb with beautiful floral aesthetic to each dishes. Staff is polite and friendly too! Special thanks to Chef Matteo who is very engaging and make the day extra special! Love the black truffle "hide and seek" dish which is one of the highlights of all dishes! It so savoury and unforgettable….

nice food nice atmosphere. i tot the service could be more positive. but i still enjoy the experience especially on a chill night in the rooftop. overall quite an expensive experience but they were very nice to add an additional anniversary dessert for us:)

Other than the desserts and A5 miyazaki wagyu the rest is just average. Burnt A5 miyazaki wagyu comes with bitter taste. Would still recommend diners to top up and try the wagyu beef. If not you might get the duck which is just average.
Waiter was coughing while serving so not sure if that is a good service.
The desserts is awesome and the balsamic vinegar is nice too.

Every dish is on point. We curated our own menu and we emailed them in advance. We used the klook vouchers so that saved us $60. We love the ambience that the rotating restaurant has to offer. I must say the view of Marina Bay Sands is stunning. A great place for celebrations. We went there for birthday celebration and they gave us a free birthday cake. The staff were so attentive and took so many nice candid pictures for us. We really enjoyed ourselves dining at Tong Le Private Dining. Thank you!!!!

Food was really good for its price. We had the Colorful Cloud Dinner Set Menu. I will say it started out amazing and plateaued off around the main course. But for its price I am won't be too picky. Service was good, staffs were friendly and professional. The revolving platform gave a 360 view of the city which was a huge plus for me. Atmosphere was quiet when we came early on, but started to get a bit rowdy due to a huge party to our sides despite the closed-off rooms. But overall a pretty decent visit. Will recommend!

I had the pleasure of indulging in an exquisite dining experience at Tóng Lè Private Dining, and I can confidently say it was an absolute delight for all the senses. The first thing that captivated me upon entering here was the stunning view. The restaurant's unique concept of a rotating dining room allowed me to indulge in a 360-degree panorama of the cityscape, adding a sense of wonder and spectacle to the already exquisite dining affair. The menu was a testament to the chef's creativity and culinary expertise. Each dish was a harmonious blend of flavours, beautifully presented and bursting with vibrant colours and textures. I must also mention the impeccable timing of the service. Each course was served with precision, allowing us to savor every bite without feeling rushed. The staff's attention to detail and their commitment to providing exceptional service truly enhanced the entire dining affair. Overall, my dining experience at here was an unforgettable journey of culinary delight and I cannot wait to return to experience their wonders once again :)

Most rotating restaurants live off the gimmick of being exactly that - a rotating restaurant offering a 360 degree view of a location. Many times, the food in such restaurants isn’t a priority, but the experience is. This restaurant, however, serves excellent food and offers a great view of Marina Bay Sands and the fountain and light show in front of the mall, as well as a nice view of parts of the Singapore skyline. The rotation is very slow and it take about two hours to do a full 360 revolution. If you are unlucky, you will be at the opposite side of the fountain show both times it occurs. For a period of the 360 tour you are very close to an office building - so close that you can see the monitors of the people working in the building.

The seating arrangement is varied, from two/four person tables, to separate dining rooms for larger groups. The restaurant has a very good bar which has a great selection of cocktails and spirits. The restaurant is quiet which makes it easy to have a business conversation, if that‘s why you are there.

The restaurant offers a seven-course menu which is perfectly timed for a two-hour dining experience. The wine menu is very extensive and there is a sommelier that can provide advice if you require so. The menu was extremely well thought-through and the various dishes were perfectly combined to provide a first-class dining experience.

The staff is very attentive and friendly, and made us feel welcome from the minute we set foot in the restaurant.

We would come to this restaurant again, and in particular for the dining experience. We were positively surprised by every course.

Location: 5/5 (in the financial district opposite Marina Bay Mall)
Ambience: 4/5
Menu: 5/5 (albeit a fixed menu)
Food: 5/5
Drinks/wine selection: 5/5
Staff: 5/5
Price/quality: 4/5 (pricey but very high quality)

Quality of food matches the price. The family all agreed it was a perfect place for a family celebration. The service was immaculate and staff very attentive to details. We didn't mention it was a BD celebration but when we clinked our wine glasses, they must have overheard us saying Happy BD, and they surprised us with longevity buns. They also understand Chinese etiquette well as our son discreetly wanted to foot the bill, but the attending staff came quietly to check with my husband who was the host if they should accept my son's card. That's so thoughtful as in Chinese custom the host foots the bill and they respected that.

Very nice brunch option. Great atmosphere. You should be mindful you should book a reservation to avoid eating at the bar and that there is a time restriction after which the next batch comes in.
The menu is pretty good but it was surprising to see some classics missing like veg scrambled eggs or eggs benedict.
Dishes are pretty big and high quality. We will definitely come back.

First time having wild honey.
Nice food.
We had quite a “surprise” on the first time ever at wild honey. It ended well.
I hope to see improvements over the check in the supply of bagels.

I had a wonderful birthday dinner here 🥰. The space is cozy and spacious, the food is delicious and healthy (not too sweet, or too salty). Staff are enthusiastic and friendly. The restaurant also gave me a surprise when giving me a slice of birthday cake beautifully decorated with candle. 🫶🏻 Thanks

This is an all time favourite place of mine and I keep returning to Wild Honey for their amazing brunch food, good service and chill but fancy vibes. It’s a versatile place for both meeting friends to going out with a special someone. Really recommend the breakfast here especially the Turkish eggs. This time, we also tried the Moroccan which comes with mixed veggie fritters that were just perfectly crunchy and not too oily. The Thai milk tea is also quite unique and not too sharp.

Brunches is a very unique little restaurant.
The furniture is novel and clearly had a lot of thought put into choosing it.

The car table added a nice touch to the theme of the restaurant.

The food is expensive, rich and has to be accompanied by a drink or you won't be able to finish it.

The display stand with all the finger food paired quite well with the theme.

We celebrated a birthday party there consisting or 50 people minus the staff.

The waiters handled the people fairly well getting the food to tables on time and refilling their glasses.

Whilst we put up the decorations one of my daughters burst a balloon and one of the waitress's dropped a glass and blamed my daughter and the balloon that burst. The waitress  said my daughter popped a balloon so she got scared and dropped a glass.

The owner's service level is exceptional, he was going around pouring wine for every table and was honest to return the extra bottles after the party ended.

There is only one bathroom which isn't very clean but it's not too bad.  The bathroom didn't have toilet paper though.

The place was kept surprisingly cool regardless of the number of people there.

The drinks are also expensive but quite interesting and creative.

Wow. Legit authentic cafe vibes here.

We happened to stumble into this cafe after running an errand. Loved the atmosphere with the unique antiques and deco.

There's a table for two in a car!

The staff are really friendly, and the atmosphere is so calm and comforting.

Generious food portion and quality is comparable to high end restaurants.

Definitely coming back here with friends!
Highly recommend trying this place out. It's worth it!

Great place for a brunch experience. The coffee is up to standard and did not disappoint. Ambience is rustic with a touch of nostalgia. I would definitely come back again!

I like the western foods and the deco. Good place for photography. The dessert and  coffee also good.  This is my second time visiting. Already try the tuna during my 1st visit, today I try the Salmon taste good too. The service are good. My personal view the pricing are slightly on the high side.

Was around the vicinity, visited the cafe together with wife for get our brunch fixed. Interesting decorations they have spending effort. We didn’t have any reservations and luckily enough there were seats. Noticed they have a extensive menu for a cafe. Staffs were friendly and attentive, food taste good too. Pricing is reasonable. Will definitely be back. Thank you

came here twice, the food overall are pretty good, especially their Benedict. (Still a little greasy in the end)
however, there was an aged waiter, don’t know if it’s their manager ( if it is, their training is awful 😅), keep pushing us. Bill and take away our cutlery…

Personally likes the vibes and environment here. But if you prefer a quiet place to discuss or chit chat, it might be not suitable.
The food is superb. I am willing to come back for their grilled octopus. I seldom eat octopus, but yea, their grilled octopus surprisingly delicious. 👍🏻🤓

Have visited Symmetry quite a few times. Really like the menu here with the Shakshouka being my favourite. Vegetarian options available too.

Good, fast, efficient service. Reservation is recommended as the place can get quite crowded, esp. on weekends.

A really good place to have brunch/lunch and a boozy one too.

quaint and pretty café.

we ordered their big breakfast and waffles. personally felt that their big breakfast tasted average, but their waffles on the other hand were so good!! the sourness of the fresh berry compote helped to balance out the sweetness from the maple syrup, and the blueberry icecream was perfect (wasn’t too sweet). they served a pretty mean coffee too, really aromatic blend.

chill vibes all around, can’t wait to be back!

Happened to park just right outside the shop and decided to have lunch here.

I remembered I used to frequent this place many years ago. However, it's quite difficult to get the roadside parking.

The coffee here is still as enjoyable. the price for the main course is kinda steep.

We ordered 2 drinks and 1 chicken burger and 1 salmon.

The total bill is about 90ish.

Might not come back so soon.

Service and ambience are good.

The food quality and taste are constantly nice. Staff are friendly and attentive. It’s one of our staple dining options at Dempsey hill. They also update their menu time to time. The indoor dining area is nicely cooled with spacious seating. However, it is quite noisy during weekend peak hours.
Overall, we like this place and often bring home chocolates and cheese after the meal.

Just the right ambience and choice of songs for a chill and relaxing night for a good gathering with friends… and the crew were very nice to always check in with us to see what we needed… and it was very sweet of the crew to offer us the free desserts … 🥰 will be back

Love the atmosphere.
Food wise slightly above average and there's room for improvement. To highlight, the fish finger is too fishy.  Service team maybe need to be more attentive. Overall still a good place to hang out

My first visit to Dempsey project and it won’t be my last for sure. Food is great not just taste but presentation and creativity! The ambience is perfect especially for pet lovers. Staff are extremely friendly, prompt in servicing and very helpful. Eg. gave us decent advice where to sit to avoid morn sun. Staff was eager to please. Very impressed with the crew professionalism and attitude.

Once in a while when I want to have a carefree breakfast/brunch - I am reminded of these place. The environment in Dempsey certainly helps - and the food selection for breakfast menu has improved tremendously since a couple of years ago.

I do enjoy the breakfast… tasty… but the coffee is a bit of a letdown. For the price offering - I would expect a full bodied aroma coffee without the need of extra shot.

Price wise? Definitely on the pricier end - what is to say with the morning at Dempsey and a relaxing breakfast in an old colonial building.

Reviews: 

There is truly something special about this brunch place. Not sure if it's the decadent food, the superb service or the fantastic atmosphere and decor.

I first ordered their homemade cold mocha brew, and it was very rich in flavor and literally the best way to start your day. For the mains, we ordered fried chicken topped on a crispy spring onion pancake and a giant croissant filled with creamy scrambled eggs and sizzling bacon. I loved both of them, not sure which one more. The pancakes with chicken was very hearty and the egg and bacon croissant is a classic. We ordered their walnut cheesecake for dessert to split and it was moist, but firm at the same time with a tasty frosting. The food prices may seem expensive, but for the great quality ingredients and inspired plates you are getting, it's totally worth it.

The restaurant is a bit small and can be very busy, so make sure to reserve before hand. The cooks are very talented, apparently they won quite a few competitions in the past.

Reserve ahead for the weekend, 75 min dine-in time as it’s super busy. Came for the buckwheat pancakes and loved it. Blueberry compote with fresh fruits and crispy cornflakes crumble complement the  grainy and soft yet moist and fluffy pancake (sounds crazy). Very filling. Scrambled Eggs and harissa fried eggs with lamb are good too.

Went for brunch on 5/8 and had a good experience there overall.

Food: Had seafood pasta (which had an savoury and interesting taste that I like and hence devoured), truffle fries (your usual fries) and waffle ice cream! Okay not too bad but not like super fantastic.

Service: Very prompt, the servers noted our requests throughout meals and food arrived quickly too. Kudos to them for the good service!

During our recent visit, we decided to sample the seafood linguine and the Halibut & Soba dishes. While the prices were on the higher side, I must say that both selections were undeniably delicious, making the expenditure worth it.

For those planning to dine here, I strongly recommend making a reservation in advance, especially given its popularity. However, keep in mind that it might not be an ideal spot for a work session, as the dining time is limited to around 70-90 minutes during peak hours.

Overall, this establishment left a positive impression, and I'm eager to return and explore more of what they have to offer.

Nice ambience with coffee aroma when step into the cafe. The coffee is nice and suit my preference. All the food we order is nice and tastes good. Definitely will come back again.

Excellent place to grab a leisurely brunch if you are in the east. Was there with friends and we had a good catch-up over brunch.
The portions of food were very big, enough for a full lunch actually, but this is reflected in the pricing.
They have a delightful policy of letting kids eat free on weekdays though, so you may want to consider some bonding with your child during the upcoming school holidays!

Very tasty food with a lot of healthy choices available in the menu.

The interior is lush with greens and design is clean and minimal. The soft music in the background brings good vibes to the atmosphere.

We ordered the pancakes, baked Atlantic salmon and smoked salmon avocado sourdough toast. All 3 of them are great! Very reasonably price and the price in the menu is the nett price you pay (no GST and service charge).

Highly recommend to try out this place and I will definitely come back again. The downside is, very hard to find parking if you’re driving down.

Lazy Sunday perk up with Grab order.
We ordered a variety of brunch meals and it came up to be near 100 bucks on the bill.

The food kept its flavour despite taking out.

Nutty Banana Croissant
Peanut butter with a generous spread of granola and banana held together by a lightly toasted croissant. Now for a good balance, they’ve thrown in some berries! Lovely and filling.

Grilled Chicken Burger
The fries was soggy. Now this is a global problem that requires attention. How the hell can you retain the integrity of delivery fries?
The buns was nice and the chicken patty was well grilled and juicy.

Mr Frank
This looks big and intimidating.
Not sure if we got around to finish it but for 17 bucks it’s something you can share!

Good Day Breakfast
This was a mash up of everything you would expect in an English breakfast. There’s salad, sausages, avocado and sourdough. I need a good cup of tea.

We’ve been to the cafe before.
Bright and airy. Lots of plants - but I think they need TLC.

It’s a safe bet guys. Go order and share the plates.

Stopped by for a simple drink and snack on a Sunday afternoon. The place had very nice vibes and the drinks were good.

My only wish was that we had space in our stomachs to try more of their food selection. Will definitely be back for another try the next time I’m in the area.

love this place !!! staff were rlly friendly and atmosphere is just so calm and relaxing

love their deco which incorporates the use of lots of plants, gave the place such a chill and homey vibe, could tell effort was rlly put into the deco  :))

food was great 🤭🤭 ordered the chicken rosti and the chicken thigh was simply too perfect 🤌🤌🤌 got their signature, three musketeers also and it's so good 😆😆

went twice this month and would definitely go back again!!

photos are from both visits I just combined them tgt 😃

Nice spot for a relaxing day! Outdoor or glass window seats are preferable as we can enjoy the greenery scene outside while having a meal. The staff is helpful. The food is not outstanding but not bad at all. Will definitely go back!

High ceiling and spacious cafe. It is located next to the park so the ambience is quite exceptional. Food wise is just ok. The mushroom soup  pizza and beef bolognese are decent. They are famous for their 🍪 cookies.

Had their seafood pan. I must say the bread they served was amazing. It’s crispy on the outside, soft and moist on the inside, more importantly, the bread was warm when served. A perfect combination to dip into the seafood pan.

I think this was our second visit, perhaps after a very very long while! Wife decided to hop by for an afternoon cuppa after dropping off the kids at our in laws.

As we already had lunch prior, we ordered light. A nice pasta to share with coffee. The prawn Bisque was decent.

Loved the atmosphere, very relaxing environment coupled with really nice food. Coffee was great too.

Visited before and tried the Lamb and Prawn Rose this time around. The Lamb was super soft but a little bland, while the Prawn Rose was nice.

There is a playpen for kids at the outdoor tables, hence we weren't able to enjoy much of the nature ambience. However, those with kids would enjoy it.

Food was really yummy, one of the nicer cafe/western foods around! We got the spicy calamari, pork ribs, fish and chips, mushroom soup. Highly recommend each of them! Chill ambience with nice music. Want to give a special shout-out to our server, Chloe, who was super kind and attentive throughout our dinner, which made all the difference :) thank you Chloe! For making our birthday dinner a very pleasant one with your thoughtfulness and friendliness :)

Food standard is great here 👍
We ordered ceaser salad , crab spaghetti and aquapazza. Spaghetti and aquapazza are delicious.

We visited here for brunch around 11am for 2 pax walk-in.
There were few people inside. I requested bigger table as I got a lot of stuffs on my hand and not much customer inside, but a lady staff looks obviously not happy that I requested that.
We left restaurant around 1pm, but restaurant has not packed during our brunch. I am not sure why the lady was so unwillingly give us a bigger seat.

Overall, although the price is not reasonable, it’s still good restaurant in terms the quality of the foods and the atmosphere.

The cafe is part of hotel with separate entrance from mall. Very nice brunch spot. Ordered fish taco and baked egg. Baked egg is petty good because I love chorizo. But fish taco is slightly disappointing. Too much batter and lack of citric flavor
Their dessert menu is also limited. Thrifts, tried their tasting coffee set. MAD milk is naturally sweet from date, interesting idea.

This is an outlet I visited before with the missus and today I decided to invade Oriole with the 3 monkeys !!! The girls loved the overall decoration, they claimed it’s cozy and homely haha. Anyway, all the dishes were ordered by them and they sang super high praises for “whatever-they-ordered” (laughs). They loved the silky and smooth mushroom soup; THEY LOVED THE CHICKEN WINGS !!! They basically loved everything hahaha. We will be back for more Oriole, many thanks for hosting us well, till then !!!

We walked in on a Sunday afternoon and Jazzy assisted us. My aunt had a bad back and requested for sofa seat. Because most of the sofa seats were taken due to reservations, Jazzy mentioned she would try her best. After awhile, she came over and mentioned that the seat was available as they managed to get a sofa seat for us. Jazzy was very helpful throughout and her willingness shined through

We ordered the Sweet Soy Pork Ribs which was rather tender and the Smoked Salmon Waffles which was good. Overall a great experience and special shout out to Jazzy who was helpful, patient and an asset to the service industry :)

It was my first visit with my wife to Merci Marcel, we were delighted by the overall vibes of the restaurant. We ordered the eggs Ben and French Toast Brioche, latte and flat white. The food and coffee were excellent, the portion of eggs Ben was a bit small though. A great place to chill!!

My first visit to Merci Marcel and my friends and I had a good time bonding over the food and the servers were great, especially Marilyn who was patient in giving us and overview of food selects and sharing the specials of the day. Soft yellow lighting gave it a nice cosy family/friends evening gathering atmosphere vibes. Thumbs up!

Very good! Although we didn't have a reservation, they managed to fit us in. The staff were all friendly and provided a fast and efficient service. The food and coffee were amazing, not to mention the cafes' atmosphere was very relaxing. It was a lovely breakfast and experience.

Amazing place, nice atmosphere. Food was excellent but the portions are small (unless you ordered pizza). Also on the higher price range, so do take note. Great for special occasions though!

The atmosphere of Merci Marcel at Orchard is really nice and relaxing. I was able to get some work done the both times I had gone, while enjoying a nice meal. The first time I had gone to the restaurant, I ordered the ravioli. There are two versions. One has nuts and the other does not. They make sure to seperate them. The green sauce is a chai based sauce (not a pesto). The staff is really polite and the manager also walks the floor and checks on each guest. They will definitely see me again.

I had the most incredible dining experience at this restaurant! From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed by a warm and friendly staff. The ambiance was enchanting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that set the perfect mood for the evening.

The menu was a culinary masterpiece, offering a wide range of mouthwatering dishes that catered to various tastes. I started with the recommendation and it was an explosion of flavors that left me craving more. their signature dish was nothing short of perfection. Every bite was a delightful journey for my taste buds.

The service was impeccable; our server was knowledgeable about the menu, attentive, and made excellent recommendations.

Food, Service, Ambience, everything was simply AMAZING. Bong was a super friendly host ( he posed with us too). I highly recommend this place to folks looking out for a wholesome and healthy meal. Lookout for the portion sizes, they are pretty huge.

We were amazed from the entrance. The place has the soul, every detail of the decoration matches. Waiters were really helpful as we weren’t sure what we want to eat. Food arrived in few min, we took veg options- very fresh and tasteful. Burger was a monster and it’s my favorite if I have to choose!

Would give the service here 6/5 if we could because it was excellent. We came here for lunch with the kids and they enjoyed themselves tremendously. Special shout out to the service staff here. It is not easy to find a place that is hip, trendy yet so welcoming to kids and we felt right at home. Food was also yummy, healthy and clean but tasty. Highly recommend!

Love the bake duck confit, pineapple cake, love the friendly staff, love the environment, love the recycling school table and oil tank (outdoor, as a standing table) love the old tcm medicine cabinet as a deco,

Wanna celebrate your birthday? It's not an issue. Ask for sparkler on the cake，(do note it is chargeable ya)

Highly recommend.

Had 1 set lunch with the Mushroom soup, serving for soup was a bit disappointing for set lunch. Not sure if the serving ala carte order would be the same or not. As for the taste, not much of surprise in any way.

The Arrabiata pasta (not fresh pasta) didn't gave the woah effect in any way as well. Saving grace was the fresh prawns.

My wife tried the Gnocchi with gorgonzola. Pasta (fresh) texture wasn't good, sauce not really to our likely.

Another disappointment is the dessert from the set lunch, which we had ordered the flourless Chocolate cake. Look at the picture and you will understand. Taste, so-so, maybe due to the presentation.

Lastly is the Tiramisu, saving grace to not get below 3 stars.

Overall, not a place which we would be considering to go again.

This is my 5th visit to Poco Loco. Each visit I am always bowled over by the great food . This is a hidden gem at Upper Thomson. I have eaten at many Italian restaurants, I have to say the pasta here are extremely good, full of flavour and really satisfying . Not sure where did the chef previously came from but I dare say it is even as good as some of higher class restaurants like Etna. Highly recommend.

Generally the food is fresh and not too bad. We had mushroom soup, calamari, spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti arrabbiata, spaghetti vongole, Panna Cotta and chocolate flourless cake.The first 2 items and the last are worth trying. Could give the calamari a miss though. The restaurant is within 5mins walking distance from tel station exit 4.

Value for money! We tried PocoLoco for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. We ordered 1 dinner set ($45), which consisted of an appetiser, 1 pasta dish, 1 main course and 1 dessert, there’s an option to order a glass of wine for $8. We ordered an extra pasta dish with lamb as well. Portion was good (not too small/big) and our favourite was the pork collar main course (part of the dinner set). Price was nett and drinks were reasonably priced as well ($2 for jasmine green tea and other soft drinks). Overall it was enjoyable and value for money.

Jun 2023. I always loved pocoloco Italian food. We got mushroom soups, seafood pasta and lasagne.
Nothing to complain about.

Made a reservation for 12:45pm lunch. Was slightly late but they called to double check and kept our reservation. Was for a birthday celebration and it’s my second visit here. Their menu changes time to time and I have not tried their current menu before. Ordered 3 mains and all 3 mains are VERY good. Come and try for yourself. Staffs there are friendly and welcoming, one even joined for a birthday song for my friend. Overall, another good experience with Open Farm.

First time visit, we were 2 adults and 2 kids. When we arrived, we were served with a smile from the front staff. Told to wait 5 minutes till they get the table ready.
Joseph (manager) was really nice to manage us to get a standard table instead of a high table (where we placed earlier)

Good menu for kids and adults. Ordered fish and chips for kids. They loved the fish, very light battered and crispy.
We ordered the hanger steak, and steak can only be  served as medium cook. Which is quite annoying when someone may prefer medium rare or other options. The steak portion is literally three pieces, not worth $42. Extensive drinks menu, ordered a lemongrass cocktail, which was very refreshing.

Overall service, ambience is nice. Bit disappointed with the steak portion and pricing.

This place is always booked out, so advanced reservations are highly recommended. It's a great weekend family brunch place with a sizable playground and sand pit for kids to have some outdoor fun. The compound is big with lots of areas for kids to explore. It's a nice space with high ceilings and lots of natural light. The service is on point with a very attentive and warm team of wait staff. However, the food is not as good as I'd hoped, especially for the prices they charge. Overall, lovely space, good service, very kid friendly, OK food, high prices.

Best cocktail in Singapore, Australia and Borneo! Their small plates can vie for Michelin star and their desserts are amazing too! Service standards are also excellent in spite of a full house. I had an entirely vegetarian lunch from the set menu and I love it! Happy National Day!

Me and wife went for birthday and anniversary, staff was super amazing seeing we have baby they help us move seats inside. The ambiance was cozy specious and service was top notch. Food was a different style which we never had before and desert was just purely amazing too. We will come back again :)

Ambience is cosy and a good ratio of service crew to patrons.

Our order:
Crabby in Pesto Sauce
Mussels in a Pot (without chilli for the kids)
Signature Pork Chop
White Wine Pasta with Clams
Truffle Mushroom Risotto
Messy Cheesy Burger
Fish & Chips
Har Cheong Chicken Burger

Verdict - their Pork Chop is a MUST TRY and we will definitely order it again the next round. The meat is really tender and well flavoured. Went well with the garlic and mashed potatoes. They do their mussels and clams really well. Mussels were juicy and cooked to perfection. Our bellies were pretty pleased with our options and we didn't expect the portions to be so generous! Service standards vary according to the service crew set on duty. We were impressed on our 1st visit but nay on our 2nd. We will be back nonetheless.

A family-friendly restaurant, the staff are attentive and would provide toys to young children to keep them entertained.

Food is fantastic, with generous portions. Even the kids meal look to be more like an adult’s portion. Highlight of the meal include the ribeye steak which was flavourful and tender, and the pesto crab fettuccine, which was simply delicious and made me crave for more.

Parking would be an issue for those who drive as there’s limited lots, but those taking public transport, would be extremely convenient since it’s located just 1min outside Sixth Avenue MRT, and sheltered all the way.

Great service, a very cosy place for families especially with kids. Food was really good too including the free meals for kids below 11 on weekends and PH. My kids loved their beef sliders and carbonara! Desserts were on the pricier side though..

Family friendly restaurant.
Food was good and generous portion.

We enjoyed our experience and will return to try out the rest of the menu.

Googled places to eat at 6th Ave as was exploring the Downtown line.

Saw Little Lazy Lizard's menu and thought why not to give it a try. Tried it with my girlfriend for lunch.

When entered, we were welcomed warmly by one of the servers and he ushered us to our table.

Menu had a fair selection of food choices for us to choose. We each ordered a main and light bite to share.

Food ordered:
1. Pork Bulgogi pizza
- lovely and tasty
- thin and crispy regular base

2. French Toast
- portion was good 2 to share actually
- bread was fluffy (think Brioche was used)

3. Lazy Lizard wings (chef's recommendation)
- honestly when it came was little disappointed to see it was like regular fried wings. Maybe was expecting to be more special with its marinade or if its sauce that is outstanding
- deep fried timing was good, light and crispy and wasn't overly salty yet flavourful

I don't mind visiting this place again to try out their mains.

Professional service was provided by the thoughtful and attentive staff. An entire birthday cake, not merely a slice, was given to us. Most dishes were great. The highlight of the meal was the seafood stew. All the breads were also exceptionally delicious. However, the sea bass tasted very ordinary and the sky high price tag went to the showy ‘performance’ by the chef. Restaurant was too dim and had a funky smell.

The staff are very friendly and the food is also tasty. The portion is surprisingly big and we ate till our hearts content.

Staff very helpful and polite. Atmosphere is chill with soft music. Food serve just in the right timing.  Of cause the price is not cheap. But it worth the price overall.

Lastly thanks for the birthday cake. Love it but we were too full to finish it.

Booked Sunday afternoon to have their set lunch, only to find out they only serve buffet that day at $78++ per person. Opted in anyway and didn't regret it, given the fresh ingredients, great taste of Italian and friendly staffs! Personally I love the dessert section especially Panna Cotta! If I had to pick on something, it'd be the dim lighting. No discount on the bill even with Shangri-la Circle membership, but you do get extra points.

Remember, when you get into the lobby, you are on 3F. You need to take an elevator to get down to 1F where the restaurant is.

The restaurant has decent ambience for a semi chic and comfortable dinning experience. The salt crusted fish is delicious and if you want to see some fire show. The winner for me is the crab pasta. Yum!

Everything about this place is 5 stars!
The ambience is so perfect that you are at ease the moment you are inside the restaurant. Menu is designed in such a way that you can have the best vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes without feeling less about your dish. Staff is courteous and even after attending so many guests, they always find time to attend to you/your requests. The serving is very clean and within time. They have good sitting arrangements both inside and outside. Billing is fast and accurate.

Been here a few times thanks to Champions golf course and driving range. It's a good hangout for golfers after their practice and games. They served different alcoholic drinks, including their craft brew.

Diners can view part of the golf course in this unenclosed establishment. The food wasn't spectacular but wasn't shabby too. One could get the typical western dishes here, besides the finger foods. No particular dish stood out to me or I haven't tried enough of them.

The atmosphere was good in the evening with the warm lighting but there were the occasional annoying insects.

Service was fine but it could be hard to get the staff's attention sometimes. It seems popular for families too. The location is inaccessible unless one drives. But there weren't enough reasons for me to drive all the way here just to dine.

Ever been to an eatery where you have relaxing ambience close to Mother Nature, coupled with great tasting food, throw in some nicely house brewed beers and background music? Yes this is the place - all rolled into one!

Their pizzas are very thinned crust with great cheeses and sliced salami. Another dish is their hummus and pita - came with four soft yet crusty pitas. Love their pasta and burgers too. Did I say the flambé waffles lit with flaming vodka and contrue liquor? Nicely done.

Will come back again during the day to soak
in the nature atmosphere.

Microbrewery restaurant at a public golf course is a good establishment. The IPA tasted  nice, but not all its brews were available, so I couldn't compare if others were as good. Humus was okay for bar bites, but $5 charge for additional pita would make the price a bit steep. Having the pita warmed was a nice touch!

Came here for coffee and dessert (apple crumble) which was nice.

Environment: Nice spot to have a meal or drink as its surrounded by nature, that happens to be the downside as well. The place is literally crawling with insects and mosquitos are aplenty. Do bring some sort of repellent, i got bitten a fair bit.

Food: The coffee ive ordered was strong and the apple crumble came adorned with fresh fruits and was quite nice.

Accessibility: The parking is free and onsite. You probably wont consider this place unless you drive.

Price: Not fantastic but you have saved on parking anyway

My family all time favourite restaurant! We love their pizzas, steak and fries (which finally made its way on the menu again) and their deserts. The best part for us was the walk after our meals to the Rider's Cafe just around the corner where we call our cab from. It's a dark walk at night but we enjoy the chat along the short walk as we occasionally see some horses in the stable. It's all gone sadly and I hope the same fate doesn't befall upon this and the Thai restaurant across from them.

Overall okay for what you get. The service is zero self service food Court style western and Asian food. Aircon strong very fast food style. The menu price does not match the computer screen. Its hard to use not friendly user. But food came out ok lah. Nothing spectacular but it's what I expected for tourists trap places like this.

Average food quality with decent amount of serving. I would say it's like a cozy coffee shop with different varieties of food to choose from.
It's like HANS concept with affordable food and ample space for even big groups to dine in.

I rate this place as the “worst eatery” in Singapore. in Salad for 15 sgd with salmon there is 10 grams of salmon itself! The cutlets in the burgers look like they were cooked yesterday, all the salt in the world was put in the fries, the freshly squeezed juices have no taste.

Good food nice cozy place to sit! We ordered quite many things only thing is I didn’t like the chicken nuggets! It was really weird textured on the other hand every other thing we ordered was good. There is a play area too so kids stay busy and let you eat in peace! One more thing there was just 1 host in day time so things were processing very slow.

The food menu needs alot of work. It's really a big mess now and ordering through the POS is very limiting.

Food was ok, mostly packaged food taste. Basi lemak was but dry chicken. Lucky the Chili was good and rice ok.

Coffees are in tiny cups and feel expensive. Tea was not bad.

Really wish we could do add-ons. Kaya toast set comes with drinks but no soft boil eggs. At least that's what it says on the POS. So we didn't order.

Mac and cheese all box type. Although next table has the little pizza which looked decent for kids. Mushroom soup was surprisingly good.

Beautiful space, air con, indoor and outdoor play area for kids. just really hope they get their menu together. They have the staff for it just need to get organised.

3 adults and a kid we spent $50+ for a 'light breakfast'. Many other items not shown in photos.

Very crowded on weekends. Tables are very closely arranged. The good thing is their service is efficient and steady. Despite crowded, food serve was quick and doesn't have to wait long.
We ordered the seafood horfun and beehoon, bitter gourd black bean pork ribs, mince meat fried egg, hotplate tofu, cereal soft shell Crab and baby Kailan. All the dishes were delicious and flavourful. Not very salty and everything were fresh. Good food happy customers.

This place is quite popular with the locals. While the area is being upgraded, it is not very accessible. I do like the Prawn Minced Meat Rolls and Sweet Sour Sliced Fish are excellent options. Baby Kai Lan is too hard for older people. Coffee Pork Rib is a bit bland. Cereal Prawns are pretty lovely. Home-Made Tofu with Minced Meat is disappointing - while the meat is flavourful, the tofu doesn’t absorb the flavour, so you get a too salty feeling from the meat, but the tofu is tasteless. The salted fish fried rice is well received, so do try it.

Lovely place to it Hongkong food, such as Assam Fish Head, Cereal Chicken, Chicken Wings, Prawn Paste Chicken, Tofu with Minced Meat, etc. Located in Novena area, this is a lovely restaurant to visit for sure if you like Chinese/Hongkong casual food. Affordable price also.

great zhi char food.
assam fish head is very nice. the paste is homemade.
xo beehoon fish soup’s soup is refillable.
fried prawn roll is crispy and lots of fillings.

A reasonably priced restaurant with good tasting Chinese food. The oil soaked croaker fish was super crispy. We crunch crunch crunch almost every part of the fish. The sauce was not too salty and just nice to eat on its own without rice. The braised brinjal was really flavouful and umami, best to eat with rice. Will definitely go back again.

A nice neighborhood family alfresco restaurant serving local tze char delights at affordable prices.

The lady boss and staff were friendly and attentive and the restaurant was clean.

The food was affordable and delicious in a home cooked manner. Portions are sufficient for the lone diner. For a group, order more dishes or double portions. If I were to be very picky, the gravy for the dishes can be a tad too starchy.

The food is good and super affordable. There's a wide-range of dishes too! The downside is the place is small and can be crowded during peak hours so you will need to wait to find a seat (or dabao).

Food quality isn’t that tasty, portion rather small. But the staff service was excellent!

My 1st time here as I was near the neighbourhood, yummy dishes, reasonably priced and we left happy!

Solid Tze char. Would recommend their mini fried fish soup 炸鱼炉

Friendly lady boss and nice comforting neighbourhood setting.

Wonderful service by a group of young and well trained staff (all females waitresses!) the place is very kids friendly, kids can enjoy outdoor play freely while parents can watch over their meals. The patio is huge can host long tables and it's airy even on a hot day. Like the simple but tasty food choices.

Stopped for coffee after lunch, very cosy cafe placed in dempsey.

Open level cafe with indoor and outdoor settings. They have a small play area for kids to play, which is equipped with swing, hanging  rods, etc. Staff is attentive and service with a smile.

We ordered cappuccino and fresh juices for kids. Coffee was delicious, right temperature and good flavour.

Definitely recommended to check out if in the dempsey area.

It's a really nice spot for a family weekend brunch at Dempsey Hill. There is a playground with really rustic contraptions for kids to enjoy and for parents to snap some nice pictures. There is a second playground, but a paid membership is required to access the exclusive area. A prepayment of $20 per diner is required to secure a reservation. The food tasted fresh, and the portions are sizable. The service staff are very friendly and welcoming. Overall, it was a great weekend brunch experience for the family with good food and excellent service.

Late update but it should be recorded. Had a really nice Christmas lunch there in last Dec!!

Food, decor and service are all good! Just like went to a cozy restaurant in an European city! We like the appetizers much! Salad sauce is fresh with great balance on the portion. Pizza is crispy and yummy. Main courses are coming with different side dishes. All tasted great. Just the dessert a bit below our expectation.

They served gingerbread cookies to us which is unexpected. And the Santa and Elf family visit really surprised our kids! They can pick a small gift from the Santa’s bag!

There’s little playground and IG photo spots for the kids in outdoor area. It’s nice whatever you’re sitting in indoor or outdoor area.

I’m thinking to come again in Easter Holiday and see what program they will have.

AT feast Singapore, Dempsey venue and the Private Dining space were apt for our occasion. Staff were pleasant and supportive. It is a kids friendly venue. Food was amazing. Kids had a wonderful time and they loved it which is the ultimate barometer of satisfaction.

Overall a wonderful experience for us and the kids alike. Would highly recommend.

Special kudos to
Diana- Events Supervisor for all the communications, arrangements and coordination
Azrin- Operations Manager for all the support during the event
An- Service staff for ‘Going the Extra Mile’ support.

Thank you.

Had 1 set lunch with the Mushroom soup, serving for soup was a bit disappointing for set lunch. Not sure if the serving ala carte order would be the same or not. As for the taste, not much of surprise in any way.

The Arrabiata pasta (not fresh pasta) didn't gave the woah effect in any way as well. Saving grace was the fresh prawns.

My wife tried the Gnocchi with gorgonzola. Pasta (fresh) texture wasn't good, sauce not really to our likely.

Another disappointment is the dessert from the set lunch, which we had ordered the flourless Chocolate cake. Look at the picture and you will understand. Taste, so-so, maybe due to the presentation.

Lastly is the Tiramisu, saving grace to not get below 3 stars.

Overall, not a place which we would be considering to go again.

This is my 5th visit to Poco Loco. Each visit I am always bowled over by the great food . This is a hidden gem at Upper Thomson. I have eaten at many Italian restaurants, I have to say the pasta here are extremely good, full of flavour and really satisfying . Not sure where did the chef previously came from but I dare say it is even as good as some of higher class restaurants like Etna. Highly recommend.

Generally the food is fresh and not too bad. We had mushroom soup, calamari, spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti arrabbiata, spaghetti vongole, Panna Cotta and chocolate flourless cake.The first 2 items and the last are worth trying. Could give the calamari a miss though. The restaurant is within 5mins walking distance from tel station exit 4.

Value for money! We tried PocoLoco for the first time and we really enjoyed our meal. We ordered 1 dinner set ($45), which consisted of an appetiser, 1 pasta dish, 1 main course and 1 dessert, there’s an option to order a glass of wine for $8. We ordered an extra pasta dish with lamb as well. Portion was good (not too small/big) and our favourite was the pork collar main course (part of the dinner set). Price was nett and drinks were reasonably priced as well ($2 for jasmine green tea and other soft drinks). Overall it was enjoyable and value for money.

Jun 2023. I always loved pocoloco Italian food. We got mushroom soups, seafood pasta and lasagne.
Nothing to complain about.

Very decent Thai food for its price. Used to be cheaper and came here a lot when studying at a school nearby. Prices went up since 2017 but the food is excellent. The Thai Beef green curry is a must get, so is the basil sauce fish fillet. It is closed from 3-6pm so take note. Recently they seem to start taking reservations, so if you have a big group might want to call earlier to get seats. The Thai milk tea and lemon grass drinks are very nice!

Comfort meal with decent Thai food.
We’ve dined at this outlet several times, good quality food is served here. If you enjoy milky curry, do give their green curry a try, tastier when soaked in the pineapple rice. Their appetizers are all good too, prawn cake is our favourite. Yummy Thai iced tea and green milk tea, sadly the mango sticky rice is always sold out. Take note that Jai Thai doesn’t serve Thai pork dishes.

Decent Thai food with reasonable price. I personally love their fried “Kang Kong” and clear tomyam soup. Will try out other Thai dishes, green beef curry, pandan chicken, etc in the future…

Been eating here for many years, maybe my own taste buds have changed as well but the food doesn't seem as good. A bit too sweet like every other generic thai food chain.

Other than that the prices have gone up and portions have gone down, but that can be said for most places since COVID so it's understandable

Another dish I like was their yong tou fu, they make their own Toufu.
It was tender and the minced meat were well blend in their toufu.

The food here is excellent, very high quality and flavor is authentic and tasty. The peking duck is really good and the pancakes they used are really unique and delicious. Service is also very good even when busy. The restaurant ambience is very nice and is a great place for many occasions whether entertaining guests or celebrating family events

Over the years, the food standard has dropped IMO as they were really good in their initial few years back in 2011 when the Island new clubhouse was completed. Nevertheless, we still patronize them as the savings on the 10% service charge as member helps to defray the costs of the meal. In addition, the roast duck is nicely done - crispy skin and juicy meat on the inside. As a member's club, the service level from the wait staff is acceptable.

Great place for a sit down family dinner. The service is good and food is yummy! Request for the table with the view - the sunset over the golf course was simply breathtaking!

Came here with a group of friends for dinner. Service was impeccable and the food - we had their pasta and pizza which was really delicious! Their dessert - lave cake was decadent as well. Would definitely come again!

Had a great meal here, from starters of calamari, a tasty seafood soup and burata cheese, to a medley of freshly basked pizzas to hearty al dente pasta, everything we ordered was delicious and authentic. Had to call ahead to reserve for our party of 7 but had an enjoyable evening. Thanks to the helpful service and kitchen staff!

Excellent food and awesome service! Food took quite awhile to come but as they say good things come to those who wait. We ordered both the pizza special (white sauce pizza with ham, mushrooms n some cheese) and pasta special (lobster pasta). I love that the pizza wasn’t salty… Lobster pasta had so much depth of flavor, rest was also very generous with the lobster meat! Our bellies were very satisfied by the end of the meal. Awesome place!!

Small Italian restaurant located among the industrial and residential area at Marymount. They served authentic Italian food that was so good. Recommend to try their fried calamari, carbonara, squid ink pasta, grilled pork, anchovies pizza, lava cake.

Went for dinner and had delicious pasta. Tried the spaghetti with clams and spaghetti with seafood and both were excellent. Tiramisu was delicious as well. Great service from the wait staff. Definitely would recommend to go for a nice dinner

The experience at Birds of a Feather is simply outstanding! The food, service and atmosphere are nothing short of excellent.

For those who like spicy, find the chicken in the chill is a must order! The barramundi dish left a very good impression in my dining experience.

Overall, highly recommend for you to come down and try! I will definitely come back again to try the other dishes.

You have to give this restaurant a try. This is my 3rd visit. I have always enjoyed their food. Presentation is top notch, like a piece of art. Though it's fusion food, the flavours of East and West are cohesive. In my opinion, the people who created the dishes have a profound knowledge of flavours and texture. Who would have thought of grilled octopus and feta cheese? Amazing flavours!

Some of the best modern twist to Chinese food. I absolutely loved every dish I tried when I was there. Here are two of my favourite dishes.
I spent my 18th anniversary there with my wife and we were absolutely impressed! I will definitely dine with you guys again! Unforgettable

A very carefully designed location for a well-balanced preparation of such a lavish selection of appetisers, entrees, and desserts. Not to mention the coffee and cocktails they offer.

Service was also top-notch, from greeting us to showing us to our table, taking our orders, taking our pictures, and repeatedly checking to make sure everything was okay on our end.

You get the impression that everyone is catching up and having a good time, which somehow makes a romantic dinner seem more informal. Friends catching up and couples enjoying a good supper together make up 80/20 of the crowd.

Everything about the experience was wonderful, including the ambiance, the cuisine, the service, and even how clean the restrooms were.

Well done Birds of A Feather team and management. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK! SINGAPORE needs more places like yours. Congratulations for a job well done!

This is one of the best places in town for amazing lunch! The ambiance, service and food is worth the trip there. The amazing part of the food is that it’s not too spicy and the ingredients and herbs are so delicately put together that just lifts the spirits up! You feel you are truly enjoying a great meal prepared by chefs who care about their craft! I’m definitely coming back to try other dishes!!

A great authentic family restaurant nestled within the Japanese Association. Maybe it’s the Japanese families dining around you, but it feels exactly like Japan in this place. Although the food isn’t the best, there is a warm homely flavour to the dishes. Had the seasonal special Hamburg rice with demi-glace sauce and was pleasantly surprised by the huge portion, with the beef being tender and not too gamey. Special shout-out for the salmon head which also comes in a generous portion for a very reasonable price!

Do take note that only members may gain entry or bring guests to dine at the restaurants within the Japanese Association.

We adjourned here for desserts and coffee after lunch at Akane.  The staff here are friendly and helpful.

If possible, request for the private room at the end if you are a large group.  There is a $10 surcharge but this can be waived.

There are special offers which include free flow beverages for $3 each if you order a mains or dessert.  It was well worth it, as we could try their cold brew coffee, cappuccino, mango juice and teas etc.

We enjoyed desserts like matcha ice cream, coffee with vanilla ice cream, mochi and cheesecake cup.

You need to be a member or signed in by one to enter Akane or Donguri.

Hokkaido milk soft serve is the best.
Restaurant closes at 8.30pm.
Member only venue.

The service and taste must be good because it’s the Japanese restaurant in the heart of Japanese Association... did look fine to me.

The dishes like set menu, donburi, and assorted sushi are around $20 should be good pricing. I actually felt like ordering Unagi Bento with a free drink bar for $27 or so...

The problem is, only the Japanese Association members or the escorted guests can dine there and I had to leave the place just before ordering like a guy in a wrong place.

Restaurant is located inside of Japanese Association building, and need to be accompanied with member. Variation of food is quite good, covering from Japanese, Chinese to Western option. Quality of food is also good. Location could be a challenge as no MRT nearby (accessible only by bus).

No comment is needed on the food served in MTR. super fresh.

I ordered Rava Idly, Uddina Vada, Masala Dosa and Masala tea.

Rava Idly: coriander and nut and smth more in the Idly. soft and fluffy. perfect match with mint chutney.

Uddina Vada: wooooow. this is the heaven. 0.01mm of layer of crispy and very soft dough. Woooooow……..

Masala Dosa: was getting full after 2 dishes above… but still i enjoyed it… crispy layer and soft and chewy inner dough

Masala tea: thick. customised sugar level adding sugar prepared on the table.

will visit many more times…..

Must visit place of you love South Indian cuisine. Be prepared for some waiting in the queue since it is very popular. But the turnaround time is very fast. Just love their Thalis with so many flavours, podi dosa, khali dosa, idli.

MTR Singapore is one of the best pure vegetarian restaurants in Singapore. All the food items are yummy and delicious. The hotel is Bangalore Origin and the management has tried to provide the same authentic cuisine of their Bangalore hotels. It is widely accepted in Singapore.

This is my all time favorite Southern Indian restaurant in Singapore! As a vegetarian, I always come back here for their dosas and idlies. If you find yourself in Little India/Farrer Park, you have to try here at least once!

Well, I can’t really find words to discribe the taste. It was just delicious and heavenly feeling to have this comfort food after a long flight.

MTR has been best at what they do, I love their products 😘.

Super duper authentic South Indian food.

Great food, since many years ago. Vegetarian but meat eaters will enjoy this place too.

Mezze platter was quite big even for 2 pax.

Really enjoyed the moussaka and the Spanakopita.

If you pay by cash there is some free ice cream.

First time visiting due to friend’s recommendation. Did not disappoint. Lots of options that don’t make you feel you’re eating vegetarian. Drink menu is extensive but on pricey side. Service was good.

Ambience - The restaurant has this very European, relaxed vibe. Good for families but I don‘t see why you can’t go for a date either 😁

Food - my friend and I ordered the halloumi salad and lasagna. We really enjoyed the meal, the ingredients were good quality and food was prepared with care. However, did feel the halloumi was a bit too salty. They have a variety of Mediterranean and Italian options and can make it vegan too. Didn’t really enjoy the rose though.

Service - prompt service and the staff were polite and friendly

Would definitely return again.

You won't believe how rare it is to have a Mediterranean vegetarian place that has so many allium free options, including the Pizzas. Glad to see original sin survive the pandemic when many didn't.

The Moussaka and Mediterranean pizza were good, though a little too salty but that's probably just me. Nice ambience for a date with friends or the significant other, especially over a good conversation. You pay for the quality. Enjoy!

Wonderful and classy vegetarian restaurant. Had dinner here with the wife on a weekday evening. Food was wholesome, good service and atmosphere. Recommended!

Nice vegan and vegetarian option. But the vegan food was lacking in flavor. The atmosphere is really beautiful though.  I think the first dish, the desert, and the risotto were very good! And the drinks were very special too! The people next to me had the vegetarian options and they said it was really good. I love the experience though and if you want to impress you vegan friends I would still bring them here just for the view and service.

Joie is an absolute gem for vegetarian dining in Singapore! The elegant ambiance, coupled with impeccable service, sets the stage for an unforgettable culinary journey. Each dish is a masterpiece, beautifully crafted with fresh, flavorful ingredients that redefine vegetarian cuisine. The creative menu offers a delightful fusion of tastes and textures, leaving me astonished with every bite. The attention to detail in presentation is exquisite, elevating the dining experience. Joie isn't just a restaurant; it's a celebration of vegetarian gastronomy, and I can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

I had a fantastic experience at Joie Vegetarian Restaurant! The Monkey Head Mushroom Steak was a true culinary delight. The flavors were exquisite, and it's clear that the chefs put a lot of thought and care into their dishes. What impressed me the most was the affordability of the 5-course meal. It's not often you find such a high-quality dining experience at such a reasonable price. The service was impeccable, and the ambiance was lovely. I can't wait to return for another delicious meal!

We dined at Joie today, July 16, 2023, and it was an outstanding experience. The service was excellent, and the food surpassed our expectations.
The attention to detail in dish presentation was evident. The staff's timing and coordination were impeccable, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The relaxed ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating added to the inviting atmosphere.
In conclusion, Joie offers an exceptional dining experience with attentive service and delicious food. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure. I can't wait to visit again.

My first time trying vegetarian fine dining, the foods were surprisingly good! The waitress , Kelly, was very professional, she explained the dishes to us and also show us the right way to enjoy the dishes. The main dishes , mushroom steak and risotto were very impressed too. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews: 

We are not vegetarian but what is not to like? This place makes eating too enjoyable. The food is very very delicious and the service staff are very very attentive. Super recommendation coming from a pure meat and seafood lover.

Petai - great sambal chili fried with a whole plate of goodness

Olive fried rice - we had two plates, one after the other, enough to justify the deliciousness of the dish

Curry 'mutton' - good curry but something seems to be lacking in the flavour

Salted egg yolk - we had two plates of this too

Glutinous yam (suan pan zi) - delicious? We had four plates of this.

It is in my personal humble opinion that you are missing out on very good food if you have not tried this as a vegetarian.

Food is OK. The grilled mala fish is good! Impressive imitation of the texture very close to the real fish version.
Satay is also nice.
The rest are so so. Kids says favourite truffle fried rice that is usually fragrant at other places has no truffle taste. Frankly, I prefer the high tea at their other outlet.

Very delicious meal here! Portion is big price is reasonable. The fish is a must have! Very tasty 😋 I’m a meat lover and I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this vegetarian restaurant. Good job to the chef! Staff was attentive.

Celebrated our friend's birthday dinner at Lotus. It was indeed a great choice we've made and no regrets too. Food was well prepared and delicious. Atmosphere was chill and clean. Will come back again.

We came just to try the Grilled "Fish" and we were not disappointed albeit the flavour we chose does not resemble much of the original 烤鱼. It was still tasty and we would want to return to try the other flavours. The other dishes were also pretty good. The tofu box was really interesting with some diced mushrooms that provide an unusual taste and texture. The spinach in superior broth was done really nicely it tasted so premium. Tau Kwa Goreng was perfectly fried but a little spicy for me.

We were seated near a cabinet and discard trolley where staff kept walking to & fro, sometimes talking over our heads as they reach for stuff. Pretty unpleasant and lack of service etiquette.

Reviews: 

Visiting Afterglow was a vibrant journey into the heart of plant-based cuisine. The experience started with their signature Afterglow Maki Rolls, a perfectly balanced spicy and tangy treat that set my taste buds alight, though they were a bit dry; however, upon request, the waiter kindly offered me some complementary almond spread as a dip.

Next came the Cauliflower ‘Steak’. It was nothing short of a culinary marvel, turning a humble vegetable into a dish bursting with flavor and texture, both hearty and delightful.

Finally came the Acai Bowl, a dessert that defied all my expectations. It wasn’t just a simple bowl of fruit and granola; it was an artful blend of fresh, juicy fruits, the crunch of granola, and the velvety smoothness of acai sorbet. Each spoonful was a celebration of taste, striking a rare balance between indulgence and health. This dish wasn’t just the end of a meal; it was the highlight, leaving a lasting impression of how incredibly satisfying and diverse vegan food can be.

Afterglow isn’t just a restaurant; it’s a testament to the beauty and richness of vegan cuisine. It’s a place where every dish is crafted with care, not just for the flavors but for the story it tells about plant-based eating. For anyone who cherishes vegan food or is curious about it, Afterglow is a must-visit. I loved it and will definitely be back!

Had a very attentive server explaining the ingredients behind the dishes. The menu is well marked for common allergens such as nuts, gluten, alliums, etc.

We absolutely loved the vegan meatballs. Each dish was flavorful and even our non-vegans friends had an enjoyable experience at this restaurant. The salads are also nicely seasoned. Would like to come back for their desserts next time.

The place is quite cozy and intimate but perhaps not suitable for larger groups (6+ people) as it is hard to navigate between tables.

First time visited with a friend for a lunch. The ambience and atmosphere is relaxing. The food portions are quite big and very satisfying. Really grateful for the kind lady who explained us and asked us if we had any allergies etc and notified us of the dishes that have nuts at the same time gave some good recommendations. Very attentive, detailed and the food was delicious. Such a heartwarming experience.

Their last day of operation will be November 30. I love their food and the atmosphere. Anything with their vegan cheese sauce is delicious, such as their baked sweet potato fries 🍟 Nothing is fried here btw - generally the food is rather health focused but that doesn’t mean it’s not tasty. Try their TomYum Zoodles, homemade dips and ofc the cheese sauce while you still can!

Some of the dishes are very nice, but overall too pricey. I like the vegetable purée, tomyum zoodles and cold lasagne very much. The beetroot hummus is good too. Kimchi roll is decent as well.

Today Main Course ~~Cheesy Lemon Zest Liguine with Balsamic Vinegar (they can help removed onion garlic) and Lion's Mane Mushroom Steak with Crispy Mix Veggie. Love it. ❤️

Only two set meal options are available (6 courses or 8 courses ) No À la carte option. No sharing of meals is allowed, meaning all dinners must ordered one set meal.

Overall, the food was just ok, not really fantastic and worth the price.

Compared to another similar restaurant "Element", which I think it is much better and slightly cheaper 😀.

This place  serves creative and delicious dishes inspired by Western and Asian cuisines.The appetiser was refreshing and light, and I especially liked the tangy jelly.   The vegetables were tender and juicy, and the cheese sauce added a nice richness to the dish. The rice was fluffy and fragrant, and complemented the skewers well. The portion was satisfying and filling. The service was attentive and friendly, and the restaurant was cozy and modern. I would definitely recommend Sufood to anyone who loves vegetarian food or wants to try something different.

There are new dishes. Very nice place for vegetarian dishes which is not mock. Never fail to make you feel good after each meal with their smiley staff. Thank you!

The food is very delicious, it feels very healthy, and the service staff are very friendly and enthusiastic. It is a vegetarian restaurant worth recommending. I will come back again

Lovely spacious place with plenty of seating. Wholesome vegetarian meal at decent pricing. Staff were helpful but clearly busy.

They also have a bread bar and small grocery corner selling fresh vegetables and interesting and healthy foodstuff. The coconut bun was tiny but so delicious. Ask for it to be heated up for you.

A tip: it can get really packed so you might end up with a sofa seat rather than a dining table. Try booking a table!

Compared to typical Chinese vegetarian restaurants, which serve mainly fried foods , this restaurant serves many greens options, and the salad really tastes good.

Ordered three different types of pizza, and the odd one is the "Tom Yum." Pizza tastes really a bit weird.  The taste of Yum ingredients does not blend well with the pizza 😅.

We also ordered two burgers, and they are very nice.

Overall, this is a very nice restaurant for both vegetarian or non vegetarian persons who like to have a healthy meal 😋

Very pleasant ambience and super polite staff! I was so pleased to see that there were so many vegetarian options on the menu! :’)
The turmeric risotto was quite interesting, it tasted and looked a lot like an Indian dish, ahaha! The pesto noodles were also quite good.

A healthy vegetarian restaurant that serves great food along Orchard road. The ambience is very cosy and quite with separate sections.
The food is very fresh and delicious. Dumpling was served hot with a lot of ingredients inside. The salad is huge and I love the sauce so much.
This restaurant also provides nutrition count in their menu which is very convenient for anyone who is on diet or care about fitness.
Definitely will come back to try more if I'm around this area and want something fresh in a hot day.
*water is charged.

I find the restaurant a bit dim. The food was fabulous. Everything was nice, except for two. Tom yum pizza and the broccoli pizza. The taste was exotic and overwhelming for my wife and I. Rojak is a must try, and I love the varieties of Tea  in the Menu. I heard the dumping was good, it was sold out during my visit, will try next time.

Reviews: 

Comforting and delightful korean cuisine that is vegan and vegetarian friendly. Love most of the dishes I tried in my multiple visits here. Highly recommended. There were alot of insects in the restaurant on the day of my visit but it could be because of the rain.

Ordered via grab food. The kimchi jiggae healed my flu. The bulgogi fries were addictive.  The tteokbokki had the perfect chew.  Can't wait to actually eat at the restaurant to have a full experience.

I enjoyed my dish Army Stew which as you can see from the photo was bubbling away for minutes. My wife was rather underwhelmed by her dish though unfortunately.
The Kimchi Jeon (pancakes) were nice enough though not better than Indian flavoured breads/uttapam in that the flavour was not as storied/flavourful as we expected.
Staff were very nice and I'm sure if we had visited it when busier then we would have probably enjoyed it more. Their sister branch we happened to pass one evening and had a completely different feel, more intimate and cosy so we may try that another time. Very nice man on the reception.

The rare place that my daughter who is a vegan to enjoy Korean food. Surprisingly it's quite good even for a non-vegetarian like me.

Exceptional Korean food at a decent price.

Food is excellent & service is prompt. Tofu soup is delicious and flavourful, with the ingredients generously portioned. Omelette & Kimbap are also great.

This is also one of the few Korean places I've encountered where the Kimchi pancake can be shared between 2 people, which is great if you aren't dining in a large group.

Definitely give this place a try if you get the chance! Be warned you may have to queue during lunchtime.

Reviews: 

Price: $6.54 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was very crispy, savoury and slightly sour.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, savoury, hearty and had a good lentil taste.

Chutney: 5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, sweet and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and spicy.

Total score: 15/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($4.16) was fragrant from the spices used and warm and comforting to drink.

There was a little waiting time but it was definitely worth the wait as the plain thosai was very delicious. From the thosai to the sambar and the two different chutney. Service team were really responsive to requests and new orders.

The place was brightly lit and a cozy place to have your Indian vegetarian classic as well as your familiar Singaporean dishes with a vegetarian twist.

Perfect if you visit with friends/family as you can order various things from the menu and share them together. Our favorites are the biryani and butter naan. Read many reviews saying that the carrot cake is a must try but it didn’t really suit our palettes. The samosas are tasty but not very special. The lychee drink is refreshing, really helps after a long walk exploring the city. Would definitely visit again on our next trip to SG.

The first time I went there, I had the vegetable briyani, Gobi 65, Aloo Gobi and mango lassi. The food was good and the lassi was awesome, don’t fade the lassi.

The second time that I went there, I had the fried carrot cake, murtabak and Gobi Manchurian and I’ll say to skip the Gobi Manchurian as the cauliflower was almost non-existent and I was just eating a lot of batter. The fried carrot cake is decent for an vegan take as it is not commonly available and the murtabak is alright but can be skipped.

Food was really nice. Enjoyed the dishes! The service can be improved, we were more or less asked to leave the moment we finished our food. We understand that they have limited seating and a queue but just felt rushed.

Good variety on the menu but I do find it moderately highly priced. Service was typical yet they really do have interesting things on the menu with Chinese and muslim influence. It has its own character but I do very much prefer pure Indian cuisine. It’s nice for the occasional change. Location was good, walking distance to the Little India train station and restaurant is clean and cool with air conditioning.

Food is good, Service is good too. A little improvement can be done in the seating area and hygienic. They could have much better crowd comming in with that.

Visited Anand Bhavan, opposite to Mustaffa after a long time few years later. I always recommend to visit and try their menu. This is Indian Vegetarian Resturant, better to try their tiffins items rather than rice items. Service will be quick, though there was a huge rush, served within 10 mins. Tired their Masala Rava Dosa, Mini Sambar Idly, Sambar Vada, Onion Uttappam and Poori set, and all
Of them tasted good. Sambar have lot of Brinjals only instead they can add lot of other vegetables also.

Wrong decision to visit this place and worst was to ask for take away. Just wanted to get idly set take away and thought that it would be fast. But unfortunately, waited for about 30 minutes after payment was made. The place has kitchen next to the washroom entrance and it was smelly and very unpleasant to stand there to wait for my order to be delivered to me. Overall, not very clean place to visit. Observed many foreigners there who might be looking for only vegetarian food and had limited choice rather to be there. I am sure it could be managed better in terms of cleanliness, service, order management for simple stuff. However, I was there after many years and may take me another few years to step in again.

Price: $3.60 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was savoury, crispy, soft and had a good sour flavour.

Sambar: 4.5/5
Sambar was savoury, flavourful, a little sweet from the vegetables and familiar tasting.

Chutney: 5/5
The orange chutney was flavourful, tomatoey and a little spicy. The white chutney was quite gingery and sweet from the coconut. The brown chutney tasted peanuty, savoury and was rather spicy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Masala Tea ($2.60) was fragrant, warm and comforting but could use more spices.

Service was fast and I received my thosai within 5 minutes. It will be quicker to get your drinks directly from Counter 1 at the restaurant as they seem slightly short-handed in the drinks area. The lady managing counter 1 is really nice and makes your drinks after seeing your receipt. I saw this as a good thing since I could decide when I wanted to have my masala tea instead of having it served while I was having my thosai.

The place was air conditioned and the place can get crowded and is a really bustling place near lunch time.

All in all, I enjoyed my brunch of thosai and masala tea at Ananda Bhavan Restaurant (Vegetarian). :)

One of the popular South Indian breakfast places of Singapore. The food preparation is Tamil style and quantity is apt.

Overall the taste, quality and hygiene was good and rates were genuine.
