Reviews: 

What a hidden gem! Very homely and cosy environment with great food!
We enjoyed every dish and the innovation behind each of them. Unique dishes not seen elsewhere and the set meal allowed us to have a taste of all the great dishes. Most dishes were made from scratch, even the ikan bilis! All made with minimal or no seasoning and all natural ingredients. Yum! 😍
Very worth it and I'll definitely be back again!

Great for celebrations. Remember to make a reservation. We were a group of 11 people and service was great. They made special provisions for parking because we had a family member with mobility issues. We also had a birthday cake and celebration.

Foodwise, in my opinion 佛有缘 serves the most unique vegetarian cusine in Singapore. The best is still Miao Yi (for personal reasons) but it closed down 😢 Forget about the 自在 "empire", Shu and coffee shop zizar, it's always the same old thing.

We had the cold dish with "ice vegetable" salad, which is really good. The yuzu monkey head mushroom is always a hit. The sugarcane flower is unique. And last and not the least, the humble bee hoon - is always a family favourite.

A Delightful Vegetarian Culinary Journey at Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant

Apart from the outstanding food, the service at Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant was impeccable. The staff members were friendly, attentive, and eager to cater to our needs, making us feel welcomed and valued throughout our dining experience.

Overall, Relocate Vegetarian Restaurant has truly impressed us with their diverse and mouthwatering selection of dishes. Whether you’re a vegetarian or simply looking to explore plant-based alternatives, this restaurant is an absolute gem. We highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience with top-notch vegetarian cuisine.

The delicate strands of noodles were expertly stir-fried with an assortment of fresh vegetables, creating a harmonious medley of taste and aroma.

The Rendang was a true masterpiece. The rich and aromatic coconut-based curry was impeccably spiced, resulting in a tantalizing symphony of flavors.

One of the highlights of our meal was the Vegetarian Shark’s Fin Soup. It was a delightful surprise to find a cruelty-free alternative that retained the essence and texture of the traditional dish.

The Sweet & Sour dish was a perfect balance of tanginess and sweetness, complemented by succulent mushroom and an assortment of colorful bell peppers and pineapples.

To end our meal on a sweet note, we indulged in the Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts. The smooth and velvety yam paste was flawlessly cooked and paired beautifully with the tender gingko nuts

Old school vegetarian restaurants good not too salty good service. Friendly staff. Must try for old school vegetarian restaurants. They have moved a few times already hopefully they can stay here. Finally found them again. I have been eating at this restaurant over 15 years now...still as good as the first time I tried....

I'm super glad that we have a Chinese vegetarian in Desker Road, stone throwaway from Mustafa. Food was authentic and feeling good old days. Fantastic and thank you for opening an outlet in Little India.

The cut of chicken is very small. Not worth the price

got two tubs of unknown sauce or gravy along with the chicken n fries. the coke zero tasted dilute than from bottle. wonder if they put ice cube in container to chill the drink. Overall good for a change.

Finally tried the well-known Arnold’s Fried Chicken that has been raves about by many and they certainly didn’t disappoint. I went with my wife on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and surprisingly, there was no queue. Waited a bit to make my order at the counter and ordered a 4-pieces meal for 2 before making payment. FYI, only Nets or cash is accepted. Service was relatively fast and everything was ready on a big serving tray. The chicken meat is juicy and tender. I like the seasonings and marination on the meat which are way better than other chain fried chicken outlets. The fried buns are an interesting and delicious side which complement the mashed potatoes and coleslaw. All in all, a very satisfying meal and I would definitely return whenever I crave fried chicken

As an Eastie for over 50 years, I must have been living under the rock. Today is our first time ever visit Arnold’s Fried Chicken. Singapore’s very own KFC.

What can I say? Move over, KFC !
AFC is way yummier. The chicken is moist (I suspect the chicken might have been marinated with milk or Yoghurt) and the “sand”-blasted chicken skin is crispy.
Even the coleslaw is fresher than KFC’s.

All I can say is that AFC has won a new fan !

Happily enjoying 39 year old chicken recipe with family. Great eatery concept. Simple food queue system way of ordering. It’s tender chicken set will get your fingers wanting for more. Brilliant coleslaw for all to share. Here we go for fried chicken goodness.

went for lunch on monday. outlet is quite small with about 12-15 four seaters.
food was served fast.
fried chicken tastes better than other fried chicken faat food chains.
everthing else is self service.
staff came around regularly to clear table

It has been many years since I last ate here.

The fries were rather disappointing as they were cut too thick and were not hot and crispy.

The chicken on the other hand was pretty good. It was freshly fried and crispy and delicious.

While not knocking on the food quality at Arnold's, I believe Popeye's chicken presents better value for your money, as the set meal comes with a soft drink whereas at Arnold's it is charged separately.

I got the set with a crispy chicken burger, fried chicken, fries and a drink. The crispy chicken burger was not spicey at all but the size was good. The fried chicken was juicy, but not spicy as claimed. Fries was very small. Drink was not refillable. Service was a bit slow and could be improved. The restaurant was maybe half full at the time. So, easy to find seating. Overall, pretty good but a bit underwhelming compared to my experiences at Jollibee in the middle east. Portions are a bit bigger there and the drinks are always refillable.

Firsr time here in 10 years
Self service kiosk menu was useless, spagherti was not available however at the counter it was, store does not accept visa or mastercard and thats a massive disappointment.
Food took a while to be served, everthing was just warm
The uncle incharge of bussing tables were chucking all the left overs on a separate open trash bag instead for using the bins itself and that's unhygenic

Dissapointed!

The line was insane….. probably 30 mins in line and then 40 mins waiting for our order to be cooked because there was so many people BUT they did not lie about the chicken because how was it so juicy even with breast meat my mind is blown?? Skin was so crispy it was delicious. The burger was also really good, typical spicy chicken burger there was nothing not to like about it. Spaghetti was yummy too, yes it was sweet but not overwhelming, peach and mango pie was great!!!

Chicken joy and palabok is very delicious.. good for family and friends. Very spacious..

We ordered twice from this branch but still the same, always incomplete items. Next time, remind your crew to check properly before handing it out. IM NOT SATISFIED WITH THE SERVICE.

Glad that I give it a try. Tasty & delicious with affordable price. Should give them a try. Juicy & tender. Service was fast though. Payment can be done cashless.

The burgers are very nice, the side dishes I would recommend to try Hokkaido Croquette and Butterfly prawns.

Great place to order take out during weekday office lunch hours. The service was kinda fast despite the crowd. My favourite is the yakiniku rice burger.

First chance for us to try Popeyes, something my son has obsessed about since he discovered that the chain is in Canada where we will visit his grandparents soon (Popeyes is not in Germany). Compared to KFC the chicken is not as greasy, has a nice spicy heat to it, the cheese fries were good, and the chicken tenders were very good. The location is inside the entrance to a busy MRT line, so easy to get to. Seems to be popular with shoppers and local business workers

It's one of my favourite fast food fried chicken for a quick bite. The fried chicken is always served hot. Mashed potatoes sauce is good.

The Mac and cheese looked kind of ugly but the taste was great. The mashed potatoes and the biscuits were also delicious. Deserve a 0 rating! Dirty tables, extremely poor service, and surprisingly rude people, especially, Thava  who claims to be the manager. Such ineptitude is disgraceful for a manager. She handed us the tray, instead of the take out bag as we had ordered. Moreover, 25% of our order was missing. When asked her about the poor service, she remarked rudely that she was busy. No apology, zero finesse. Shame on you Burger King! Folks don't go here unless you're itching for a bad experience!

They managed to mess up even with the simplest order. Ordered tempura chicken nuggets with curry sauce, and somehow, they didn't give me the sauce. The chocolate Sunday with mint candies in the picture tasted so bad. The soft serve is too sweet but not milky. The candies are stale as if they were old. They gave very little chocolate syrup (compared to McDonald's), which made it even worse. It's definitely my last visit of BK, especially for this outlet.

Absolutely horrible crew service. I see my order prepared and it cons the the counter. Crew checks and calls pit a number. I inform them that this is my order and she insists it is not. It is a number she called a while back. I asked again as she continues to call out the same number. She then decides to check and finds out its my order and just simply says yours and walks away. No apology or any form. I guess this gives me another reason to avoid fast food like Burger King and to eat at home. Foe the cost, triple the amount of food. Thus happened at 11.05 am today at CLARK Quay Burger King.

Burger King food was pretty consistent with other Burger King branches. Food was fresh and quite quickly prepared. Wiping clean of tables and dine-in area could be improved.

not my first time patronising and having a bad experience. previous time food took way too long and tasted spoiled. today i ordered from mayflower grab via because it was the only macs available. milo was spilled all over which could be the drivers fault. caremel frappe was extremely melted with no signs of whipped cream at all. both meals (big mac and double cheese) were missing. found out from driver that the workers forgot to pack it in. i havent got my refund from grab yet. this needs to be improved.

Mcdonath has been always everybody favourites including myself. I love their nuggets. apple pies. corn and esp their French fries. What’s with the tiny piece of bony fried meat that left me wondering which part of the chicken it was. Don’t they even QC their chicken parts before serving to customers? Hope that they can at least have more pride in their work and respect for customers.

Had a great 6 course lunch at Beni! Service was great - the hostess was warm and friendly, and explained dishes clearly. Food was good - subtle flavours that meshed really well together, and beautiful presentation. The lamb in particular was executed perfectly. I also loved the mignardises and that the kitchen was open but calm and not chaotic.

Here for birthday lunch, cosy setting but nothing much to shout about for the interior. Had the lunch menu, food is good but nothing really outstanding that I can remember. Hmm maybe Cherry Gazpacho is quite special. Perhaps its a normal lunch menu, maybe should come back again for special collaborations when they have one.

Some changes to the menu itself. Menu is very refreshing, akin like the Spring season. As always, hostess & chef hospitality are the best. To us, their food, restaurant atmosphere, relationships between staffs & us are what made us being their regulars.

A very nice ambiance intimate dining room that caters to about 6 pax capacity and some counter seats for perhaps, Omakase? Set menus are definitely French and heavy on seafood.

The service was nicely paced, dishes was explained, and professional. Their wine recommendation was good as well.

The presentation of each dish is where the star is. The taste is ok, balanced.

Recommended for date night, probably not the best suit for big  groups or business dinner unless you reserve private room.

We booked the restaurant to celebrate our 25th year wedding anniversary.
We took the $268 set dinner and added on foie gras ($20) for one of our dinner set, and changed one of the dessert to cheese truffle.
All the dishes are wonderfully made, and even the bread basket (uniquely in a cloth pouch) is warm and hot, with specially made bread spread.
The service is amazing and special mentioned to Louis who has made our experience really enjoyable.
We also had Yamanaka-san who personally served us for one of the dishes.
The downside for the place is that it is a small restaurant and seatings are quite closed to one another. It's no issue for us and we mingled with other patrons.
Highly recommended.

It was absolutely delicious. No wonder it has so many awards year after year.

The bun in the pork bun is baked almost to perfection and the sweet and sour pork with lychee was great (a tiny bit to sweet for me).

My two favorites though are the garlic prawn and the crispy beef. I will definitely be going again.

Had a very good dining experience here, the staff Ah Lian very attentive and the manager Fenny also recommended the well option for two pax, which we felt so comfortable. The eggplant with floss is highly recommended. They constantly make sure the patron having their food without worrisome ;) would come and visit here again!

The service was fantastic, and waiters are very helpful. Putien cuisine is not my favorite honestly, but this restaurant makes it so tempting and I can tell dishes were made with fresh ingredients, quite great compared to other Chinese restaurants in Singapore.

Food was really good and tasty! Not the typical China food but which is oily/ spicy.
We were served by WeiYi, service was really good. He was attentive and made sure our cups were filled too.

One Michelin starred Fujian cuisine - So how is it?

We are not familiar with Fujian cuisine so we just started to order everything that looked good on the menu, with a little help from the waiting staff. Chilled abalone and pig trotter jelly was a good, refreshing start. Next up was sea cucumber in abalone sauce and buns with shredded pork meat. Delicious! The main dish was a pot of braised pork belly with abalone yet again. A small portion of Buddha jumps over the wall to conclude the feast 😊

I really enjoyed the smooth, clean taste of all dishes. This was a highly satisfying seafood meal and a great way to explore this style of Chinese cuisine.

An absolutely delightful dining experience! The food, the service and the atmosphere was all incredible. We were treated to the most wonderful waiter in Arvin whose wine knowledge and food explanations were the highlight of the day. He answered all our questions and was forthcoming and generous in sharing his food knowledge. All the dishes were fantastic and very flavoursome. I can’t wait to come back again! We had the amekase menu.

Having dined at this Peranakan restaurant upon a family member's recommendation, we were eager to experience its Michelin-acclaimed cuisine. Opting for the tasting menu, we were treated to an exceptional culinary journey. As someone with Southeast Asian roots, I might be a bit biased, but I must say this restaurant truly stood out. It exceeded my expectations and proved deserving of its Michelin accolade.

Had this slightly less than a year back. Food was delicious, staff were attentive to all our requests. Restaurant was nicely located at Dempsey with free parking. Knowing that we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us a small dessert (kinda) which I felt was very thoughtful of them. The staff were also patient in taking countless number of picture for us. Definitely deserving of the one Michelin star. Will definitely be back again in future!

I believe this brings the best of Peranakan fine dinner to the guest. Dishes are true to the original flavors yet giving a refreshing new twist. Great place to bring visitors to try our local delights but elevated.

Fantastic experience. The food was both friendly and approachable, given these were ingredients I've never tried before. Think elevated family meals cooked perfectly. Patrick and the rest of the staff were professional and genuinely proud of the food. Dessert stole the show.

This is our first time here, and noticing that many ministers have dined at this restaurant, I found that the food is too sweet for my taste

5 Stars for this restaurant.. Although they are a Michelin 1 Star restaurant for consecutive years.

It’s a wonderful night and dinner with my beloved. 🥂

Recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

My partner brought me here for my birthday lunch and we had a lovely time here. We ordered the 2 course lunch with an add on of extra serving of potato bread & steak.

We enjoyed the potato bread that we ordered a extra serving. The steak was also yummy and cooked to medium rare. The steak came with oyster mushroom was also cooked to perfection. Special shout-out to to the beef tartare(lovely presentation!)& pork steak(burst of flavour!!)!

The duck breast was slightly too rare for our liking.

The service was lovely and friendly and they also surprised me with a apple tart for my birthday.

Nice environment for any celebration

Beef is perfectly cook very tender and juicy and the sauce balancing was nice
Oh ya I like the bread most and the condiment for bread was nice🤩 especially for the butter got a little bit of smoky kick I just can’t stop spreading the butter on my bread haha
But I’m too full to having another bread😫 otherwise I’ll request for one more haha
And the desert was surprising  me also

Overall it’s a perfect night for all

Well guys new menu is coming soon just make your reservation🤤

A lovely place where we spent our anniversary lunch. Food was YUM. A mix of different cuisines rolled into something I'd call contemporary European. Presentation of dishes was spectacular with the beef tartar showcased in a delightfully unusual way!

This is a five-star experience all the way - Alma has a Michelin star in the guide that just came out for Singapore, and deservedly so. They were happy to accommodate vegetarian food for the prix fixe menu, which is great value. The signature tofu with black truffle was sublime, as were the Japanese tomatoes with tomato sorbet. The amuse bouche of tomato with a sour plum film was another delight.

It's a nice space too, with a beautifully designed interior and a superb selection of wines and in particular rare whiskies.

This one's going on our repeat visit list for sure!

We had a lovely dinner for my brother's birthday. Food was good, and the portions were fairly generous for fine dining. What I found extra special was who each dish was beautifully presented with such intricate details.

Food was hands down beating expectations. I knew it would be amazing for a Michelin star restaurant but I actually thought it was better quality than just a 1 star. Also appreciated the large diversity in courses and in between tasters for the full menu. If anything there can be too much food you get full!. The smaller space feels more intimate and nice to look into the kitchen area. The option to choose your tasting size was also nice

Cons
- entrance door is difficult to find for building
- wine list is long…but not high diversity in selection. It seemed like the median price was $800-$1000 for any wine bottle. Not many options for simpler but quality,  less exclusive wines. Also although wine is “the” thing for most of these places, still wish there was more spirit friendly options

My favourite fining dining experience in Singapore. The food was exquisite, delicately well-balanced and carefully served. The ambience was intimate and soothing. The butter and bread was heavenly tasty, soft and aromatic.

It was a birthday celebration for us and we had a wonderful time. Definitely recommended for a special occasion.

Stunningly well presented and proportioned lunch taster menu. From the first perfectly warmed brioche and seasoned butter, through an exquisite selection of canapés, fish, duck and desserts the team provide culinary delights that will challenge your vocabulary to do justice to the experience of your tastebuds.

We had the lunch tasting menu (SGD 148) and it was absolutely amazing. Their Parker house roll with Shio Kombu butter was packed with intense umami, and I would have demolished the whole bun (6 servings) if I didn't have breakfast (haha).

The menu is French, with a pretty heavy Japanese influence. Appetizers came in small bites that piqued the palette. The small bites were:

Ankimo glazed in Ponze with Katsuoboshi cream and salted radish
Smoked Eel Riletter with apple and marigold
Spring pea tartlet with smoked cream crue and marinated Ikura
36 month aged comte cheese cornet

The main appetizer was a picturesque feature of aged Hamachi with fennel, shiso and N25 Kaluga Reserve. Superbly refreshing and slightly salty, it set up the tone for the next heavier main course - the Roasted Venison with green asparagus. I could say that this is one of the best roasted venison I've ever tasted - so tender and flavourful, with no gaminess to it. Beautifully executed!

I was also immensely impressed by their dessert - to be honest I feel a lot of fine dining restaurants are a letdown when it comes to desserts, like falling off a sharp cliff in the tasting experience, but I was super super happy that their desserts allowed us to end the meal on a high note. The warm and light pistachio souffle was a perfect complement to the cold and rich Abinao chocolate with espresso cremeux.

The only part I felt they could improve on was the petit fours, not bad but a tad bitter for the earl grey tart and the canelé was way too hard. But look how pretty the Choux is with white chocolate butterflies on top! There was definitely a lot of effort from the pastry chef.

Overall an amazing experience and I think well worth the price tag!

One - starred Michelin restaurant located within Voco Hotel (previously known as Hilton Orchard), serving Modern-Contemporary cuisine,established by Restaurateur-Sommelier Ignatius Chan in 2004. There is heavy influence of japanese ingredients used in the menu and served in the European way. Opt for the menu with two main courses for a wholesome dining experience. Food presentation is beautiful and tastefully presented, and what's good to look at is also good to eat.

Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, a surprise dinner planned by my husband for us. The restaurant is intimate with only a few tables available, so you get undivided attention from the staff. It is also an open kitchen concept which I love so you can see the chefs hard at working preparing their masterpieces for us. I enjoyed pretty much every single dish, the abalone wellington was definitely unique and one of a kind. Overall had a really good experience here.

Had our belated anniversary lunch at Iggy’s as we were having a staycation at Hilton. A lovely resturant with friendly and helpful crew. Love the fact that we are able to view how the chef and his team prepared our meals to the kitchen.

As the husband and I do not take raw fish, the chef was able to customize to our taste by searing the fish, love how the raw yolk enhances the overall taste of the dish. They did an interesting take on the sponge gourd which brought the vegetable to another level. The linguine was average. The roast beef has charred edges which was a nice touch. Overall we enjoyed the 5 course meal at $150++ per pax.

Came here for lunch with 2 overseas guests who would like to taste a Michelin restaurant.  Decided to bring them to Iggy's as the restaurant has been one that has been keeping their reputation for years. Food was great as you can see in pictures.. perhaps ..some touch up to the interior may make the place feel warm and friendly.
Damage : $200 (lunch)/pax

Les Amis restaurant is a gastronomic wonderland that transported me to a world of culinary bliss! The ambiance felt like a page out of a Parisian romance novel, with soft lights and a melody of enchanting tunes. The menu, a poetic composition of flavors, offered a dance of taste that left me in awe. The waitstaff, dressed in elegant attire, choreographed a dining experience that was nothing short of a culinary ballet. Each dish, a masterpiece plated with precision, tasted like a symphony of harmonious ingredients. If you're yearning for a dining escapade that feels like a rendezvous with gourmet dreams, Les Amis is the destination to indulge your palate in a poetic feast!

Ordered the dark chocolate cake and it was so delicious! The cake is placed on top of a tart shell which is very special. Almonds are super fragrant too.
Hope that delivery service can be included in the future and handwriting on the chocolate could be better 😅

Had a very pleasant dining experience at Les Amis. Patrick, our server, was very friendly, attentive, and entertaining. He suggested a perfect wine to have with the steak. He also patiently explained every dish to us. The amuse bouche tartalette with bacon and mushrooms was a good introduction to the meal. Notable food from our dinner are the French egg, crab soufflé, simmered celery root, salted brioche, herb sorbet, and poached pears. The caviar that was thoughtfully used in some of the dishes is an interesting addition of a complex salt flavor; it did not overwhelm the taste of the other ingredients. The wagyu was tender but I expected a bit more flavor and it lacked a bit of surprise. The herb sorbet is most interestingly a refreshing palate cleanser. Overall, it was a memorable and pleasant gastronomic experience.

Truly Michelin 3 stars! Excellent food with great creativity,  best service, excellent wine pairing, and the deserts are the best.  Not cheap but it is worth it!

Everything was impeccable, the food was great and the portions were generous, great wine pairings and amazing service.
Toni and the team were very kind and took genuine care of us.
The Blu Lobster appetizer, their sour dough, the riz de veu and the cheese course were divine.
Highly recommended.

Visited in Jul 2023

The last time I had visited Rhubarb was 4-5 years ago. So a revisit was a long time coming. Good food and great service as always. There are 3 options/dining experiences you can choose from. I went for the most comprehensive one - 3 starters, 1 main with chef’s premium ingredient and 1 dessert.

While I can see how Rhubarb has been able to maintain its 1 star for so many years, I struggled a bit to find some key differentiating factor versus other French contemporary Michelin places. Good food nonetheless.

Service was really good. The dishes kept coming fast and I was done with my entire dinner in an hour.

All in all a very good dining place. If you haven’t been there, it is definitely worth going.

The 4-course lunch Omakase was very very satisfying, with interesting notes and flavours that I’m pleasantly surprised by. I also really enjoyed my chat with Joseph as a solo diner, so that my lunch was a little livelier. I had an absolutely lovely time and would return again.

Decided to go last min as I suddenly met a long time friend. She said she didn’t want to eat something too heavy. The starters were mainly seafood and fruits, which opened up her appetite after a full day of hard stress work. The main was a tender slowed cooked beef. Dessert was a coconut sorbet I think (?). Accompanied the meal with a Riesling. We quite enjoyed the night.
Funny note, one of the appetisers is a mix of fruits and seafood, I confused the apple with an olive. The taste was good though. Please don’t change the dish because of my comment.

Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Outstanding food, worth its Michelin star. Service is friendly. The atmosphere is a little bit let down by the lighting and impersonal musical background. Overall a very nice place to have an amazing meal. Prices very reasonable.

Reviews: 

Okay… the food is good enough to make the queue worth it. The queue moves super slow mostly due to some staff takes very long in dishing. But trust me, the food is worth the chaos in getting the food. Plenty of seating including upstairs.

Their specialty is the spicy squid in squid ink sauce. It’s quite spicy but flavourful. Other classic dishes like fried tofu with egg, chicken curry, beef rangdong and variety of fried dishes are all done well.

It’s Michelin bib, and we are fan of nasi Padang. The black squid samba was great.  The rendang chicken was a little over cooked but the flavourful gravy help.  The the handout anchovies potatoes chilli was ok. Asam fish was well done with perfect ladyfingers.  The samba chilli provided was very fresh and right amount of spiciness and flavour. Cuttlefish was forgettable. Tahgay long bean salad cannot go wrong. Yes I will be back again.  Here there is more consistency than many other NP restaurants around the area.

Decided to give them a try because of good reviews. There’s more seats available upstairs and it’s air conditioned.

There’s one shared toilet upstairs too.

Ordered some dishes to share for 2 paxs and it cost us $26.60.

Honestly speaking, beef rendang and fried chicken is tough and dry. Brinjal was bland.  Begedel is soggy. Asam ikan taste okay.
Also, food wasn’t served hot.

Stayed nearby and came to eat here almost every day! Food is authentically Indonesian and tastes absolutely delicious, they accept credit card payments as well which is quite a novelty in small shops in Singapore (dont know why). Everything we tried was good 👍

Like what many claimed, this was one of those long saved but not checked off places in my books too - finally found a day in which we are craving for some spicy food and decided to head down here!

At 1:30pm, the queue was still stretching out of the store, although it does move relatively quickly, it’s pretty hard to get a table even with second level seating - somewhat like a hawker centre if I may.

The selection was in abundance compared to the other Nasi Padang stalls (which really isn’t in the same league), from the normal begedil to the rare tahu goreng.

💰 the price point is okay - though the tahu goreng at $8 was pricier than the fish and chicken which were $5 a piece.

Food was really good in general! The tahu goreng, grilled chicken and fish are a must order when you visit 🍗 🐠

Definitely will revisit when I’m craving for a good Nasi Padang with a wider variety!
Italian cuisine in Orchard:

Food is alright, flavours are all good but nothing too spectacular.

The seafood in the calamari platter was fresh, no weird tastes. Pizza is on the average side. Crab pasta tasted like the non-spicy version of chilli crab which is quite unique. Would say the fish was the best. The fish itself is roasted very well and also love the layered potatoes.

Overall, felt that it was Italian cuisine tailored to the Singaporean palate. Also, the restaurant is understaffed, there was only two service-crew serving everyone. Atmosphere-wise, it’s on the top  level of the hotel but there’s no views of anything. It was basically a poolside restaurant with the occasional crying / screaming of kids and babies in the pool.

Would only recommend if you are hotel guest or looking for a casual restaurant in the area.

When you're looking for a less crowded Italian restaurant on Orchard Road, this is a good place to hide. Nice small restaurant, located on the Rooftop of Voco Hotel. The food is good, but it could be better. Service staff were wonderful and knowledgeable of the menu.

I’ve visited with my mom during singapore trip. They served great dishes. I especially recommend Truffle Burrata Cheese Pizza. The staff who is Korean guy is very kind and professional. We had a good moment because of him. I want to thank you to he and rest of all staffs.

Love the ambience of this roof top bar as well as the service received!

Thank you Cai Ying, Jeremy and Owen for the exceptional services during my dinner at il Cielo, thank you for making it easy and enjoyable for me and my 5 year old son.

Special mention to Cai Ying, who was especially attentive to all my needs and food recommendations were superb (look at the photos!)

Of course, thank you to Chef Marco and Chef Beh Li for making my foodie son crave for the food even more after we left the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a quiet evening with pool and view of Orchard!

Do try the Burrata Purgilese and the Tiramisu! These 2 are my favourites!

I had a really lovely lunch with my family. It was a special occasion to celebrate and the food and service was excellent (the pool view is great as well). The staff Owen made our day and we genuinely enjoyed our time there. Thanks team!!

Reviews: 

Chanced upon this restaurant while finding a dinning place. I did not make any reservations and at 6:40pm it seems like they are fully reserved up. Anyway the waiter was very nice to let us have a table for outside area.

The happy hour oyster attracted me and to my surprised, the $2.50 per oyster is large and creamy. They did not give some miserable quality for promotional price. Commendable for this!

Ordered the blueberries rosemary smash and they put real jumbo size blueberries and a fresh sprig of rosemary. A very refreshing drink served in large size in my opinion. It lasted me the whole entire 2 hours of conversation.

An ideal place to chitchat in a nice environment that is not too noisy. The service of the staff is very attentive too. The young crews are super friendly.

Oysters are great - super succulent and pair perfectly with hot sauce and lime. Pizza is quite average but the sweet potato fries are something else. Cocktails were average. The interior is beautiful and I heard there a live band plays occasionally.

Kind of hidden from sight.  Hidden in a corner. This place is packed after 12 on weekends. Live singer play around 1pm on weekends. Came for their around the world brunch with many varieties to choose from . Their drinks are good too. Many tend to come here with friends to chill. The vibes are good here. Very laid back atmosphere.. food is fantastic enough because of its wide choices. Mess tin of fries is great for sharing . Quality itself worthy of price point.  Wish I had rooms for cakes.  Maybe next time.

This restaurant is packed on weekends and the attraction is probably the live band and mostly female crowd. The food is actually pretty decent but I’d say the pizza was better than the Vongole pasta (which was rather salty). Service can be slow due to the large number of tables the waitress needs to attend to.

Sides would be more suitable for big groups to share. The food were great. The cheese fries had mozeralla and nacho cheese which provides different layers of taste. The portions of the mains was very filling too. It might get a little crowded even on weekdays dinner so it would be better to make a reservation first.

Reviews: 

Atmosphere is 10/10.There is a lot of space inside.

My queue time is around 10-15minutes depending on certain hours.Avoid peak hours like lunch break 1-2pm to skip the queue.

There are a lot variety of foods and it also provide free flow of plain water.

Service was good here at this branch and my food came rather quickly. Taste is just like how the other Saizeriya branches are around Singapore. Simple, a huge variety of pastas to choose from. All in all.. it's comfort Italian food for the masses.

Quick and basic Italian style food is what to expect here. No white linen table cloths although you can get a small decanter of white or red wine to create more of a moment. They offer a number of vegetarian options, I tried both the mushroom soup and the pumpkin soup. The mushroom is the better of the two with a nicer thick consistency and hearty flavor. If you are a soda drinker like me - recommend adding the free flow drinks to satisfy your cola craving.

Saizeriya is like the Italian food joint for those of us craving Italian food on a tight budget, serving Italian fare fit for discerning peasants.

The standout dishes at Saizeriya include their affordable Escargot and Garlic Focaccia. These offerings provide a garlicky explosion that will destroy your breath for the remaining day. The food quality can be somewhat inconsistent, the pasta sauces were a bit on the runny side in my latest visit.

Staff were fast and alert. They were friendly too. The food was delicious and cheap! Delivered really quickly to the table. There’s also a lot of vegetarian options! Love it there!

We had a fantastic dining experience at Osteria Mozza. Not only were the sides and pasta absolutely delicious, with a wide range of options to choose from, but the service was impeccable. The staff was attentive, friendly, and made sure every aspect of our meal was enjoyable. I truly appreciated the excellent service that accompanied the delectable pasta dishes. The olive oil cake was excellent as well. A little cramped in terms of the seating but nevertheless I'll definitely be returning for more memorable meals!

Most memorable anniversary dinner that I've had. Food is generally good. What stands out most is their service. It's impeccable. Do take note that they have strict dress code requirements. I was rejected initially due to not wearing covered shoes and have to wait till the customer who is using their loan shoes is done with his meal. Having said that, I'm still very satisfied with the overall experience. This shows how good the service was. Special mention to Kishore for his great service and for providing a Polaroid photo of my wife and I to remember the night. Will definitely be back!

My second time here and the food and service is still as great! Special thanks to Margie who took care of us for tonight. She recommended us a few dishes based on our preference and everything was good! My favourite would be the  grilled octopus as it was not chewy or tough but of right firmness. Would definitely visit again! Thanks Margie!

We recently dined at this fantastic restaurant and had an amazing experience. Their pizza (only available for lunch), mussels and pasta were both outstanding, bursting with flavor. The service was top-notch, with Winson going above and beyond to ensure a delightful dining experience.  Who gave us food and desserts recommendations we really enjoyed

Sister and brother-in-law brought us here for a birthday celebration
The food was excellent! Even a Caesar salad was unforgettable. Mussels starter with delicious buttery bread. Beef tagliatelle was very moreish too

Service was top notch!! Super attentive, constant water filling and checking in on us if we needed anything. Was most impressed when they gave us a card with a handwritten note from every single staff on duty + a Polaroid for keepsake. This is service like no other.

Highly recommended please do come here for an awesome Unforgettable dining experience

All the dishes were beautifully executed. I started with Tasmanian baby squid as antipasto, followed by two plates of pasta of the day, namely lamb pasta as well as pumpkin ravioli. Normally, I don't include dessert in my review, but the yuzu sorbet from the restaurant is truly commendable.

Well located in Orchard. Oysters fresh and sweet. Family liked the bolognese and thin crust pizza.

Pumpkin soup was standard, it reminded me of blended baby food.

My personal favourite is the uni pasta, the cream base sauce on the Uni pasta is just right, not overwhelming, savoury enough to also enjoy the  uni. I didn't  taste the yuzu in the sauce but I did enjoy the ginseng leaves as part of the flavor.

All the pasta are generously portioned,  so it's good to share.

One of the best restaurants in Singapore! We have been to many Michelin star restaurants but we think LaD'oro definitely deserves the recognition because it is better than many of them. The food is great in terms of taste, look, creativity, combination, presentation and portion. The chef finds every opportunity to surprise you and show you the difference between Italian and Japanese ingredients. The effort from the chef and experience as a guest is flawless! The menu we had is Autumn and we will be back for the next season. The Sendai Wagyu is the most impressive dish but unfortunately I forgot to take a photo.

Pretty nice and grand Interior, and initially I thought the price will be exorbitant but it's not. Def not cheap but I think it's acceptable to me. 3 of us spent around 50 each for 1 uni pasta (this costs the most but worth it as the sea urchins are quite large), 1 pizza and 1 side (yummy baby squids!), and we were very full. They taste good as well.

we booked dinner for 6.30 pm on a Sunday and there were only 2 other tables occupied. soft music and lighting made the atmosphere pretty romantic for dates! we ordered truffle fries (but they ran out of fries, only had wedges - we still prefer truffle w fries though), Pizza Bismarck and Tagliatelle Hokkaido Snow Beef A5 Bolognese. BOTH the pizza and the bolognese were SO GOOD. we loved it so much. they have really nice and pretty cakes too btw but we didn't get to try as we were very full but will def return to try those!
service by the staff was really good as they were very attentive to customers' needs - they even offered to split our pasta into 2 portions as they guessed we were sharing it!

Reviews: 

The cocktails were great and at 42++ for 3, it’s really a sweet deal.
The antipasti were amazing. We had the melon with ham as well as the octopus which were really cooked well and tasty.
The main dish today was a miss. The beef was really tough even cooked medium. Tendons were striped across the entire steak which should never be the case with a ribeye.

So far one of the two best pizza's I have had beed eating in Singapore. Great tomato passata, decent salami and cheese. All ingredients are fresh and good quality. I was really surprised with short waiting time, just a couple of minutes and all three pizza's have been served. Very friendly and helpful Staff.

The portions match the pricing, so rest assured that you'd be full! I got 2 mains (iberico pork and pesto pizza) for sharing and were beyond full. The food was flavourful and good but was a tad too rich/salty to finish. Come with more friends for a bigger bang for your buck.

Visited Lino 2 weeks ago for dinner, so yeah this is a long overdue write-in. I didn't manage to reserve a table online, so my friend and I just do walk-in. Unfortunately that day the restaurant had quite a few of big groups, hence we got the smallest table there - a little wonky and cramp.
However, I must say that the experience was delightful. The standout dishes that I tried were the Burrata Pizza, Truffle Fries, and Scallop Risotto.
The burrata pizza was a true masterpiece. The combination of the creamy burrata cheese with the freshness of tomato and pesto sauce plus the perfectly crust, not only visual appealing but also bursting with flavour. It's a must try for any pizza enthusiast. Truffle fries - excellent. The risotto was cooked beautifully with a creamy texture that complemented the succulent scallops.
This restaurant is definitely one of the top choices for those looking for Italian food in central Singapore.

I like it, but I'm not sure if I like it enough to come back regularly.

We ordered some items for delivery, and they arrived nicely packed and looking gorgeous. Got ourselves 2 pizzas, a salad, and an extra serving of calamari. Not much heating up was required, to enjoying the taste of the food; which is great. Definitely something that you can readily order for parties and gatherings.

That all said, I'm not sure if I'd pay 20sgd for calamari, or the salad. Even 30sgd for a pizza is a little on the high side, no matter how good it tasted; given that there was no meat on my pizza.

One of the most value for money Italian cuisines in Singapore. All the dishes we ordered were outstanding except for the mushroom soup which was too watery.
We really love the Caesar Salad, Burrata pizza & seafood aglio olio.
Definitely will be back to try other items on the menu.

Great service! Very helpful attentive crew who recommended the Chianti wine which went down great with the pizzas. Good price too for the bottle at $60. Pizzas freshly made, indeed try the burata. Calamari also went down well and overall a very nice atmosphere and casual dining place to hang out/gatherings along Orchard Road. And they open on a Monday night too! Enjoy.

The pizza is OK, crusty chewy edges on a thin crust, 12 inch, good for 2 to share. The surprise fav here was the Caesar salad.

The rest we had were somewhat disappointing, especially the chicken wings that felt like they were double fried leftovers from last night. The fusion pasta of Salmon and Ikura was a failure too, there was a strong fishy smell in the dish. Can't find fault in the Tiramisu, but can't find praise either.

Service was prompt. Reservations recommended.

very cosy atmosphere, simple and quiet. staff was friendly and attentive too. be sure to make your reservation before coming down because the place is filled during meal times.

sweet potato fries are done very well and not overcooked. truffle mac & cheese had the right proportions of cheese to pasta and truffle goes very well with this dish too. aglio olio had full prawn so and sufficient ingredients to go along with, fresh and well made!

have yet to try their pizzas and it looked so good and portion seemed to be decent too. worth coming and trying!

Update: ended the night throwing up multiple times, will be reporting to the relevant authorities.
The horlicks tiramisu dessert is sour and taste extremely bad. We ate just one mouth and gave up. There was zero attempt of service recovery even after alerting the staff that the tiramisu is sour. Stick to their mains if you plan to dine here

Have not been here for quite awhile, so went for their Thursday steak buffet. Still as good with all the appetizers and pizzas. The steak is soft and juicy but pity the tomahawk is a bit dry. Roast lamb is great as well. Didn’t really ate too much of the pasta though its very good cos need to save space for cheese and desserts!

All the food was excellent, the service was courteous and friendly, and we had a great time. (Honestly, the quality of the Asian food wasn't that great.) The chefs came around during the meal to give us tastings, and it felt like we were at a friend's party. It was a great time. Thank you:)

Delicious brunch with an extensive selection of Italian cheese. The Lasagna was also extremely delicious! The service was perfect as well. Money well spent and a very fun afternoon thanks to wine/prosecco free flow as well.

Went for Sunday brunch. Cheese room is lovely with a wide selection of cheeses. Loved the unique chocolate cheeses and burratas. Mains selection is ok, could be larger. Lamb stew was nice. Desserts are good as well.

The restaurant offers an array of 🧀 cheese.
If you are a cheese lover, this will be the restaurant for you!
We had buffet but the selection is limited unlike the conventional buffet.  However, food is delicious.
The service is good. Mr Muru / Mr Nuru (Manager) is very helpful & friendly.

We ordered via Grab for a birthday celebration during Phase 2A and had absolutely no regrets! The portions were generous and came nicely warmed. The highlights for me were the robust flavours of the bolognese sauce, richly portioned with beef , reminiscent of what might have come freshly prepared from an Italian kitchen, as well as the four cheese pizza. The truffle-scented toppings sprinkled with a generous portion of caviar and the blend of cheeses made this a sheer delight and were a crowd pleaser. The kids were very happy with their meal too. Will definitely order again to try the other items on their menu.

We ordered the 4 cheese gourmet pizza, the premium burrata and the pasta bolognese for our sons' birthday. The food flavours were outstanding. We loved the rich truffle flavours for the pizza, the caviar provided the opulence for the burata. And we were so surprised by the strong beef flavours of the bolognese, with its rich tomato flavours. Absolutely delightful! :)

Ordered the burrata pistachio, 4 cheese gourmet pizza, black truffle pesto pizza and diavola pizza for a group lunch. Reviews all round were positive, especially in relation to the freshness, quality and generosity of the ingredients (e.g. heaps of caviar which complemented and did not overwhelm the flavours of the dishes). No compromises here. Will definitely order again :  )

If you like the idea of “Pita bread filled with Indian cheese cubes, sour tasting salami, lettuce with salad dressing and tomato” then please order Italian Focaccia Panini from them. Otherwise nothing Italian bout this!


Option: 10:

The staff here is very friendly and helpful. The food is quite good. The skewers are grilled in front of you. I gotta say the plating, by the way,  is very simple

Enjoyed my dinner here. I liked watching the chef closely while he cooked my skewers. Everything was fresh and flavourful. I found I had too much meat .. wish I got some grilled veggies as well.

I also ordered a bowl of rice as a side.

Love the grilled food. This is their speciality. Came with my daughter to sit counter-side best way to enjoy. Ordered the various chicken parts. I like that the staff are attentive. Top up the drinks without being asked.

Nice little Japanese restaurant with lots of Yakitori meals. The set lunch, Obento B, was value-for-money and has a wide variety of dishes. Recommended.

Great place for after work drink and food. The yakitori is cooked upon ordering.  I saw a review that the garlic fried rice was a must try, it did not disappoint.

Reviews: 

Had lunch yesterday at the Chinatown Point outlet. It has the toughest pork belly dish I have ever ever eaten in a Japanese eatery. Chewed a piece of it for a few minutes and still not broken up. Give up.... need to cut into very small pieces to swallow whole earlier. Good exercise for the jaws though.

Stay away from the iberico yuzu koshio yaki. The pork belly is just too tough. I had many meals there. Their butadon pork bowls are generally OK. Good value for the taste and price, but this was the worst meal i had so far.

Super yummy and service was great. We changed our order after submitting and the service staff helped us change it manually!!! Really grateful. There's also a promo for this signature loin set (in the picture) for GSS! Its my 2nd time here and won't be the last ;)

Came during weekday lunch. Not very crowded, managed to get seats for 5 with 0 waiting time. Ordered their cheeses pork cutlet which taste awesome! Pork skin is crispy and meat is very tender. Set comes with soup and mixed vege. Price is $17++ so after GST and Service charge is about $22

Ordered the Iberico Black Char Siew Don. Iberico pork was chewy soft and tender! Nice! Restaurant was empty though, perhaps just avoid those that was mentioned by other reviewers. But this don was nice! $11.50

Reviews: 

This was dinner in Chinatown Point.  We ordered the Teppanyaki beef set and a pork cutlet.

Taste wise,  it was okay. We hv had better ones, but this was alright.  The set came with the beans,  soup,  rice and some pickled veg.

The pork tonkatsu was rather mediocre.  The crust was over done.

However, the price is not too expensive.  Quite affordable and will surely fill you up.

Ambience is quite nice with great lighting.  Service was also alright.

Overall,  but too bad.

My favourite ramen place in Singapore - excellent choice of ramens at a very reasonable price and great flavours.

Came here on a weekday evening, and the place was half-full.

We ordered the following -

1) Premium Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen - Nice robust broth of ramen that comes with toroniku cha-shu (tender roast pork cheek) and Okinawa ramen egg. Meat was so tender.

2) Hokkaido Oyster Fry - Tender oysters baked that are so cripsy. The sauce pairing is on-point.

3) Cheese Teppan Fondue Gyoza - Grilled Gyozas on a bed of fondue cheeze. This was a really good combination. Gyozas were packed with flavour.

4) Hokkaido Snow Crab Fried Rice on Tonkotsu Gravy - Silky smooth tonkotsu gravy that is served with snow crab fried rice. A little bland, but quite tasteful.

5) Kiwami Freezer

Food was lovely and tasty but staff were just a little shorthanded at times and it was just a bit hard to get their attention.

DIsappointed by this restaurant that is in my point of view over rated.

The food was good but not exceptional.

The service was not good and we food bad to be interrupted during the dinner and be asked to go to the cashier to pay.

Visited during off-peak for dinner. Wait staff were friendly n attentive.

Food is well-prepared. Beef is tender n juicy. Marinade n seasonings aren't too overpowering.. Tomato cheese gyoza is an interesting combi. Teppanyaki set meal is value for money. Will return for more!

Only complaint, d air-conditioning is a little on d warmer side.

Not the usual Japanese food as they are very strong and heavy in seasoning. Most of the dishes are tasty, but a bit on the salty side. Services are excellent and prices are slightly on the medium high end. Appreciate their complimentary birthday ice cream and also farewell sorbet for every guest.
Space is a bit tight and got a table of ladies that was virtually talking in a shouting volume that made our visit quite a displeasure one.

Best dish - charred Brussels sprout and sautéed mushroom

Had a great time here. Food was great and unique. We had the burnt butter prawns, lobster croquette and charcoal chicken. Would reorder the first and last for sure.

Service was fantastic - best service I’ve had in a long while. On my way out after the meal, I mentioned it was my birthday and Joan, the kind waitress, made me come back to the table to serve me really good ice cream with a candle and sake. Really sweet of them.

We had the set for 2 (Wagu Sirloin version) and added on pork jowl and sashimi platter $39. We paired our meal with Akai Umeshu and Earl Grey Sake. The eggplant and edame was ok, the foie gras chawamushi was rich and delightful and the wagyu and pork was perfect 10/10. The skewers were alright except for the chicken piece which was a tad too hard and mainly bones. The truffle caviar noodle was aromatic but we felt the caviar was abit too much and truffle abit overpowering for us. The complimentary birthday hojicha dessert and yuzu sorbet was on point. Service was warm and prompt when i feedback on preference for lower chair and the aircon. I spent almost $270+ for 2 pax for a very filling and overall satisfying meal. Highly recommend and would definitely return again.

Simply amazing food.. we had 9-10 dishes and there is not a single one that we concluded as "so-so" .. Every dish was so tasty and different! I can't even tell you what's the highlight because they were just so good..

Probably the most memorable was the prawn cos we were all wanting extra serving of bread to soak up the sauce . It was full of flavor~

Suggest to try their sets if u are unsure..

Lastly, don't drive there as its in those alley on Chinatown.. parking is good Ng to be difficult.. it's only a few mins walk from China town MRT.. very accessible

The bar was full on a Thursday night.

The service was warm & friendly, and they constantly checked in for orders, or ensure that our sake glasses were full.

The menu was extensive for a small restaurant. We mostly had skewers last night - loved the off menu Wagyu skewers, miso butabara, and my fave yuzu infused tsukune ball. The other recommended dishes like Brussels sprouts & lobster croquette were unique as well. Will be back to try the other dishes next time!

Definitely come here if you are a fresh oyster fan. The raw oysters were fresh, large and juicy. The seared cheese oysters ideally needs to be eaten quickly for the best taste. Scallops were tasty with the two cheese options. The one criticism I had was of the rice bowls. The rice was a bit under seasoned and and there was also just a bit of too much rice for the topping. Despite it being a short grain rice, the rice is also less sweet then the rice typically used in Japan. Staff was friendly and service was quick. Great place to dine alone or for date night!

what an experience!! service was top notch albeit a little slow. but bare in mind, two staffs were handling orders from 3 floors. however they were very attentive and constantly checking in on all of the patrons.

food was simply amazing. no frills, no bull. oysters served was fresh and larger than my wrist. dons were nicely portioned and tastes delicious too!

great selection of alcohol as well! highly highly recommended.

Our favorite couple place! Best oysters in town! Fantastic service and quality of food ! Oysters just slide into your mouth, silky, juicy, yummy ! You must also try their mozzarella beef short plate. Mozzarella cheese just ooze out when you bite on the beef

First time trying oyster buffet…
The oysters were really huge, fresh and juicy! Mini don is good..wished i had 2 stomachs to try all of them.
Service was great..staffs were attentive and fast.

Amazing experience! Oyster and scallops were out of this world! Service was amazing, and the place is nice. Definitely one of the best all you can eat oyster place in Singapore if not the world! Other foods was amazing too. Keep it up:)

I like it! I always like their interesting homemade cheese, especially the kombu one.

Oden used to be a little bit better with garnish on radish but overall it’s still a good oden. Egg has improved.

Drinks are also reasonably priced. The Asahi is more creamy somehow… yum.

Ingredients may not be the highest end but I think it’s authentically Japanese. It’s easy and fuss free. Casual and nice.

Service is excellent.

I will come back again!

VERY NICE meal we had. Happy with the food and taste. Friendly chef cum bosses I believe. Udon was made upon ordering thus took some time to be served. Ordered a 2nd plate of the pork belly hot tapas!! Ramen & Beef curry udon was tasty, thick, and not too salty. Will definitely be back for meals again!
Plus, my bad for not checking the bill, and was wrongly charged for a dish. Glad that the boss saw my text in IG and returned the extra charge to me. Appreciate his kindness. ARIGATO ♡

Decent Oden specialized Izakaya. Many interesting plates of food from Smoked Pork Belly to Crab Namero and Beef Tongue stir fry. Mixed Oden seems good but somehow feel like the individual Oden items would showcase themselves a lot better.
Portions may be on the smaller side but still  great flavors going on here.

Went to meet up with a friend. He suggested omakase and I went along with it, though thought it was slightly expensive.
But! Not regrets! Every single dish was delicious! Especially the nori-syouyu sashimi and the miso flavoured cheese platter. Volume for food could be better, but I'm still loving it
Staff were attentive, food was great and environment was awesome.
I'll probably be back for the claypot dish, highly recommending this place.

The daikon oden is super yummy that we decided to try the tempura version which was good too. The kaisendon although might be small but it is pack with flavours!

Reviews: 

🍣 Food & Taste: The food all tasted good compared to the outlet at NEX. Adequate amount of sauce on everything. Felt satisfied after the meal.

📍 Place: The place does not seem crowded on a weekday afternoon. It is located in the basement of Chinatown Point mall. Very quiet.

🤵🏻 Service: Not bad. The staff acceded to our request to sit at the more spacious table.

💰 Price: Standard

🐣Waiting Time: Reasonable. Was not very long since time is still needed for food to be prepared.

However, the dessert took awhile.

The last time I was at a Genki we had to press a button to send the train back. Here the trains go back themselves. Food is not bad. The minimal service was also friendly - someone told us about the day’s special offer. Price wise it is the same as Sushiro but there’s more variety in terms of rice bowls and noodles.

My favourite branch. The staff are always friendly and patient even when it is crowded and busy. A female server patiently helped an elderly man who didn’t know how to order using QR code. During peak hours there is some wait time but it is understandable.

The salmon felt still frozen and not properly thawed but otherwise the food was decent and value for money.

As usual I will remind that the 5 star rating is given within the expectations of a fast casual sushi place. Expectations are not the same as  a 3 Michelin star restaurant. That said, the food, service, and atmosphere were all comfortable. There is a dining time limit of 60 or 90 mins (I can't remember), and they don't take reservations but beyond that there are no problems. The staff at the Chinatown point branch are lovely and very helpful.

I loved the vibes of the place - clean and calm. Came by during lunch and had the lunch set, the seafood is fresh. First time I truly enjoyed swordfish, tuna and scallops! It was definitely a good experience. I look forward coming again.

One of the disappointing omakase experience I’ve had. Food is not great, staff is not knowledgeable and reservation got bumped.

One of the omakase experience is having the staff explain to you every dish that you’re eating and what order to eat them. 50% of the meal, the staff didn’t even say a word and just told us to eat in any order you like.

Food didn’t feel expensive even though we went for the top range.

3 stars because it’s a small and quiet place. Nice ambience for a get together. Come but don’t come for the food and service.

The food was just ok for the price you pay. Tempura set is at $30. But they serve ice cream which gives a bit more score but overall, taste is just ok.

The service was bad though. The servant asked us to leave even if we were yet to finish our meal.

A wonderful little place in town that seats 16. Marukyu serves up with a rather good Japanese Omakase selection, making them stand out from the bevy of Korean BBQ shops spattered across the area. Great attentive service from their wait staff. Checking frequently to make sure our cups are filled and promptly clearing away emptied dishes. Will help speed things along if the staff were familiar with their own menu. Thankfully their super friendly head chef was moving around the front of house to make recommendation of the seasonal catches as well as his yummy specials. Food coming out from the kitchen was beautifully plated up, a feast for the eyes. Did not disappoint.

A traditional Japanese restaurant with lots of sashimi in their menu. Lunch set prices is very reasonable and most of the sets includes sashimi. Wanted to order noodles they have none when we were there. Ordered some set lunch to try also some sushi. The taste is at most “acceptable” but sashimi is fresh. Server is really going through the motion didn’t feel right to dine at such environment. The place is rather small but clean. If you are only looking for a place to fill your stomach you can consider coming.

We tried the food for few times before our event and the food is delicious. The famous chef, Angus (also the staff) is friendly to help us. We hold an event here, our guests like the food and Japanese highballs. :) thanks

Love this new japanese bar right in the middle of chinatown. All the food are so delicious! The drinks are very affordable and the GIN drinks are the best ever.

A small shop with beautiful ambiance makes it an ideal place to dine with friends. Affordable and delicious Japanese cuisine, especially the Unagi don, it's just $16.
The food we order
1) Unagi Don ★★★★★
I am a Unagi lover, and unagi needs special preparation. They're grilled and basted with a sweet sauce, and served with eggs and preserved garlic. (OMG...is so yummy)
2) Chicken Don ★★★★☆
My boyfriend had this, and he like it.
3) Fried Oyster ★★★★★
My boyfriend had this too, he loves this, so we order another place of this. Its very fresh.
Basically, the food over here is above average. Its worth to try and definitely will come back again.

Must try! Good place for food, drinks and chilling. Highly recommended

This staff there is so nice and polite and accommodating. Their oysters are super thick and juicy and worth the money. I would highly recommend this place.

The food is surprisingly good. The portion is overwhelming for its price, it can actually feed more than two people. The service is great, too. Sebastian, the manager, is very accommodating and approachable.

Very nice. Big serving. Reasonable price. Recommended when you are craving Japanese curry dishes. Good service too

Overall good, but poor service from a singular staff.

We had a mixed experience at this outlet. The food was decent, but the service was uneven. Our waitress, [didn't catch her name but she tied her hair up, wore specs, and wore a red uniform] was very polite and attentive. She displayed great service and was efficient.

However, another server, [Sebastian/Cebestian?] was relatively rude and unhelpful. He wore a black uniform and had a black face mask. When we asked about store policy & promotion items, he seemed annoyed by our questions. He also appeared to be not well service trained to answer such questions, as he could not give proper and polite answers to paying customers. He also spoke unclearly to customers. He displayed a poor attitude and was condescending to the patrons. Hope that management can consider training him more.

We were very disappointed with the service from him. His rudeness and lack of knowledge made our dining experience unpleasant. He also gave his staff member the wrong form for patrons to look at when they're signing up for the 8-minute challenge.

However, we would like to commend the lady waitress, for her excellent service. She was a pleasure to deal with and made our experience much better. The food was great as well.

Good service from the service staffs, polite and friendly. Foods were serve fast and hot. Taste is good. Comparing to Novena and Bugis Junction outlets, here in Chinatown Point is better in terms of services and food quality.

The chicken taste better than the pork i feel, cause the pork taste harder but the curry is so on point and the service here is amazing.
Must try the salmon bites, recommended!!

Reviews: 

It's a little bit pricey but the food is good. Tom Yum fried rice is quite spicy but if you like Tom Yum, this one is a must-try. Stir-fry Kalan with roasted pork is one of my favourite Thai dishes. Overall the food here is authentic and they have many choices. Better come with a group so you can try more dishes.

I have ordered sweet beef with vegetables and rice in total for a price of 16.50 SGD. The dish was honestly incredebly delicious due to very well cooked beef and rice as well as its tasty sweet sauce. The atmosphere was alright for a normal lunch/dinner, although I would say the main disadvantage of the place is that the indoor area have no closed doors and no air conditioning, hence, all sitting areas are fully outdoors which made my experience slightly uncomfortable, as I am someone who prefers to eat food in chilly environments with air conditioning. The service was decent and the food was cooked in a timely manner. Overall, I am quite satisfied with the place and would recommend anyone interested to try out Thai food in Singapore. I will definitely come back again.

I don't usually eat Thai food but I have to rate this one highly. One of the best Thai food places I've been to. As I don't usually take spice very well, I ordered less spice for everything. Everything we ordered came shortly even though the restaurant was packed. Lastly, the dessert was also amazing.

Great pricing, and yummy! No service charge just 8% tax. The papaya salad was fresh, and enjoyed the pad thai and minced pork basil 👍👍 Thai ice tea was refreshing too!

Cooking of the food is good but the ingredients are not fresh, frozen chicken prawn pork really spoilt the taste. Grilled pork neck not even well grilled and got the smelly aftertaste, disappointing

Reviews: 

Drinks are overly sweet.
Lunch sets are from $8.9, which include a main and a drink.

Clear tomyam soup with noodles. Taste is 6.5/10
Green curry is also quite good here.

Would rate 2 star for their food as I don’t think they are maintaining their standard.

Love the seafood glass noodles and kangkong. Very appetizing and the spiciness was just nice.
The steak, a bit too hard to chew, but it’s still value for money. The lemon grass and ice milk tea drink was nice too. Mango sticky rice is a bit disappointing..

My intention was to eat Thai food, ended up eating western food instead. Ordered half spring chicken and jumbo fish and chips. Took around 25 minutes to arrive. I enjoyed the fish especially the tartar sauce, great with the fish and also the chips. The garden salad was not available and replaced with coleslaw which I preferred.

Not much crowded at my visit for dinner. Crowd quite building after but still have seats left.

very good food and even better service. definitely will be back ! everyone was very polite in greeting u when u enter or exit the place, in serving food or replying when u thank them, and very prompt to service when called. food served relatively fast! really enjoy the service here, sharing plates given without asking!! sticky rice cld b more flavourful i felt but the mango was nice and sweet. fish is definitely a must try, sauce really packed a punch n tasted like clear tomyum. spicy, very tangy and appetising. fried rice can be passed. spring rolls are nice and crispy, basic side dish. vermicelli is a must try. very flavourful and bouncy well cooked noodles. loved everything about the meal!

a bit pricey but the foods real good, however, honestly could work on their customer service because the staff do seem quite cold not to mention that they have service fees

Dinner Dine in opens at 5.30pm but there’s already a queue at 5.15pm.

Nice Thai food at affordable price.
Deducting one star cause the food is leaning on a saltier taste. Overall it’s flavour is good!

Fish maw soup with quail eggs: 5/5
Thai basil chicken rice w egg (no spicy) : 5/5
I love the fact that they added long beans and onions to give different layers of crunch and flavour to it! And they accommodate to my request for non-spicy a spicy rice.

Great place for families. For those dining I. Big groups I recommend you make reservations first if you want to sit indoor with air con.

Soo 47 is a casual Thai Street food style restaurant that offers robust Thai cooked food at reasonable prices. Don’t expect the original Thai food taste as fish sauce is missing or at much lower levels in several Thai classic dishes like Pad Thai, perhaps in response to a healthier lifestyle or just a preference of consumers these days. I do miss the heavy the “savory kick” from Nam Pla and Thai condiments. However the dishes are still delicious and I recommend the egg 🥚 dishes, prawn 🦐 cakes and Thai simmered fish 🐟 (add in fish sauce if you like). Service is good and prices are considered reasonable in pricey Singapore.

Operations seems to be a bit unstable. Staff were rushing and appear to be quite chaotic.

The food was decent, and the fish was on point. Will order again when I am back. If you love fluffy omelette, this is the right place. Beansprouts with salted fish was underwhelming, can't seem to bite into any salted fish.

Overall, still a good experience. Hopefully less chaotic.

The dishes are small and you can order a variety of it. Prices are reasonable. We like the steam fish in lime juice. Tom yum clear soup is good too.

Came on a Friday night, had to wait 5-10min for a table.
The steamed seabass was delicious. Highly recommended, the soup of the fish is very tasty as well. The salad was great as well, nice starter.
The staff were friendly and came with our orders relatively quick. The vibe is fine.

Reviews: 

Nice Thai food. I liked the pasta too. Reasonably priced. Great place to catch up with friends.

Wasn't crowded during a Saturday evening dinner. Order the Carnivore hotpot. Very delicious tom yum soup base. The pork and beef strips were very good. Portion was very generous for 2 person. We ordered an additional stir fried mixed vegetables. The Thai milk tea was slightly diluted, but still decent.

Would recommend the hotpot. We will definitely be back again when we have craving for Thai food!

Stepping into the place reminds me of the streets of bangkok and their bustling night life.

We had the Tom Yum Hotpot and Lava Omelette Rice with Crispy pork belly. The food is very well flavored, really good and servings are generous. Great place to gather with friends and family. We’ll be back again!

Nice Thai food place. Had their meaty Tom Yum MaMa hotpot. Good for sharing and it was super creamy (kao) with a good kick!!!
Thai ice tea n lemon grass was also soothing.
Also great to hear they can top up the hotpot soup but we did not have to.
Love the Thai music ballads in the back ground.
Kudos to the service crew who singlehandedly served us. Took a while to serve our orders but it was fine.
Lava omelette was good too.
On the pricy side but great for sharing.
Will be back.

We had Crispy Pork & Garlic Lava Omellete on Rice, Seafood Tomyam Hotpot, and Grilled Pork Skewers. The crispy pork really superb! Good combination with omellete.

The restaurant is very vibrant and funky. Good place for authentic Thai food

Really authentic, delicious, quick and no fuss Thai restaurant. It was almost a full house on a Tuesday evening for dinner which is a good sign. Enjoyed majority of the dishes. Just found the onion omelette too oily so would not order next time but noodles, stir fries, papaya salad and veggies all excellent.

Delicious Thai food along Havelock Road. Great tasty dishes which arrived so promptly upon ordering. Must try their Tom yum seafood which was spicy and tangy, cashew nut chicken and stir fried kailan with mushroom. Will definitely be back to try others 😁

Nice decent Thai food, decent pricing as well. Fried egg with minced meat is nice. Service staffs are friendly and environment are kept clean and neat. Parking available at nearby multi storey carpark.

Food is ok, some dishes are nice while some are so so. The egg oyster omelette, coffee pork ribs are quite nice. However it’s an affordable and family dining place.

The food is superb, chef is Thailand so the food is the original Thailand taste, make me feel I am eating at Thailand. The red tomyum soup is the must order food when you are here. Others food is tasty too. The important thing is the price is standard price which is value for money

Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

While I enjoyed the food for the most part, I found the ordering system a bit wasteful. The stall requires customers to write down their order number on a piece of paper and pass it to the staff, who will only take the order if it's presented on the paper. While I understand that this system can be helpful during peak periods, it seems unnecessary when there are only a few customers.

That being said, the food was quite good. I tried the tom yum soup, olive fried rice, and pad Thai. The tom yum soup was generous in its ingredients and tasted decent. The pad they had a good flavour and wasn't dry. The olive fried rice was okay. While the prices were a bit expensive for a hawker stall, I understand that in this economy, the prices are reasonable. Overall, it was a decent experience.

Solid Thai food store at the corner of Tiong Bahru market. Tom yum soup with so much seafood is only 6.5 (whaaat!) but a bit watery. Green curry is the best in my opinion

Had the garlic chicken and the serving was generous. The garlic has no bitterness so kids should find it acceptable but it lacks the strong garlicky flavour. $6.50 for the dish, add 50c for rice. The portion of chicken is like what you would expect in tze char for small or medium. I will come back and try the other dishes.

Yummy Thai fried kway teow and green curry. Lots of healthy vegetables

This is one hawker stall tucked right in one of the corner of Tiong Bahru Market. It's just located beside the famous Jian Bo Chwee Kueh stall. The decor of the stall is very interesting. After lunch hour, while most of the stalls are either closing or their food items are sold out, this is one of the stall that still served proper meal. I ordered their Phad Thai. I was really happy when they dished out the phad Thai serving on a piping hot ceramic plate which not many hawkers have ceramic cutleries now. Food is nice and the serving is generous, for the price of $5.50.

The gem is located in a residential area in the heartland. Thai food with a real authentic taste run by a Thai guy (one-man show). We ordered Basil Chicken, Tom Yum Clear Soup + Rice, and Pad Thai (Chicken & Seafood). Unfortunately, I forgot to submit photos as the food smelt so delicious and we were eager to eat. I thought all the items we ordered were excellent and tasted great.  Definitely thumbs up! It's definitely worth a try but don't expect a long menu.

great Thai food and fantastic value for money. omelette, steamed fish, kai lan and basil pork were all excellent.
Expect longer waits at peak meal times as the stall is helmed by one gentleman by himself - major respect

New Thai Food stall in this neighbourhood. Generally the food is good, most are quite authentic Thai style. Exception would be the Tomyum soup was not spicy or sour enough as it seem to be mellowed down in taste to more sweetness. Steam Seabass was excellent.

I stay nearby and always pass by this stall. Today I give it a try and never regret. I ordered basil chicken rice. It tastes delicious! The portion is big and price is cheap ($5.50).

Definitely will try other dishes next time!

saw queue and thai peep also ordering so order basil pork and fried kailan. Taste good, for very long time i didnt taste basil pork with fats in it, spicy too. The fried kailan superb - just nice of seasoning, good crunch and it is thin type. good variety of thai food available, option and reasonable price.
