The Thai style steamed fish is fabulous! The Sea bass is fresh, the soup is tangy coupled with spiciness blended well. The fried Tang hoon and Kang Kong were good too. Overall was very good.

Our whole group of people finished all the food ! Very authentic Thai food in singapore 👍🏻 must try out if you are Thai food lover . Cooked and prepared by Thai Chef ! No gst no service charge is a + point 👏

Nice atmosphere and great deco to dine in, authentic tasty Thai food and food prices are very reasonable with no GST and service charge. Most of the service staff and chef are very friendly and are Thais but understand simple English or even Mandarin. Highly recommend if you are in the area.

The glass noddle is sweet based and it’s good. Not so oily. The seafood are fresh. Compare with Phad Thai, will recommend glass noodle.
The steam fishes is a whole complete piece and it’s very fresh. The spices and lime goes very well with the fish. The soup is clear and taste. With initially the sweet layer, then a little sour layer, followed by the spiciness.
The mango sticky rice is amazing. The glutinous rice is not over cooked. It’s just nice that chewy yet not so soft. The mango is fresh and a little sour, one of the best ever tried.

Very tasty authentic Thai food.
A place to go to for Thai food buddies..
Easy parking behind or opp at multistorey car park..
Must try.
Hospitalible boss and staff.
The lunch menu is good for group lunch.
Dinner can come after 6 30pm.
Reserve yr table...

This stall is located within the popular havelock road hawker center. Good location as there are ample parking space and most of the stalls are close with many tables available. Overall it’s still a decent mookata, not enough for the 4 star rating but good enough to give it a try. Chili, fresh meat are pretty average and the rest mostly consist of frozen food.

One of the best Thai mookata places. Love the lamb option alot. Their pork belly original and black pepper is very good too! Came here a couple of times alr and the lamb and pork belly are the regular dishes that I order! Definitely worth a try.

BBQ buffet is the main highlight of this new restaurant near by the lake. 59 dollar for 2 people for food. The only restriction is for items priced 4 dollar and above. Rest all items in the menu including ice cream is unlimited. The quantity and quality of the meat is great. The meat or what ever we use for the bbq provided are very fresh and so it’s very tasty as well. The bbq stove is a gas stove and so the time to prepare the bbq is very less. It’s more of a instant food rather than traditional bbq. The staffs here are so friendly and very attentive. Two things which are the base of this bbq is the quality and taste of the sauce they provide and the base liquid or soup provided to boil in the bbq pit. It can be a good place for any kind of people like couples or even family. A very well recommended place.

Came here for dinner because we were craving for Thai mookata for dinner. Food are reasonably priced at range of 2-5 dollars per plate depending on what you order. In total two of us spent around 38 dollars.

Downside: Meat quality is definitely those which are not high quality. Don’t expect much for the price point.

Mookata lovers... must come and try. So much variety for chilli. Meat so fresh n seasoning so good. Price is so affordable and reasonable. Even if you are first time eating mookata, this place is never a mistake. I'm a satisfied customer and will return again for more.

This is a very reasonably priced Thai hidden gem. We ordered the drunken noodles as we saw that it was highly raved, and be warned that it is flavourful but very very spicy, even for someone like me who can usually take spicy food (so pls ask for less spicy if you can’t take spicy food). The pork basil rice was a steal at $6.90. Chicken wings were juicy, and the steamed tapioca was delicious! Overall the quality of the food is good for the price point. Worth a visit!

Thai Kha is by far the best Thai restaurant in Singapore! Consistent quality & taste of food and great service will convince you to return. Having ordered in the first time during the pandemic, this is my go to place when it comes to Thai cuisine. Order online or visit their restaurant, a beautiful and well maintained space. 😊🫶🏻

Went for dinner on a weekday, very quiet. Ordered through QR and food cooked fresh, but contrary to great reviews, our food was so so. Truly not bad. Drunken noodles was still a bit wet, but tasty enough but lacking oomph. Boat noodles not bad. Egg not crispy enough but tasty. Portion quite large. Spent 37.20 sgd for these 3. A viable option if around the area. Vegetarian options available for most dishes.

Casual place with good food. Tried the drunken noodle, prawns, fried rice and morning glory - liked the spicy kick but prawns were ok. Good food with reasonable price - would come back for casual lunch if nearby!

Visited Thai Kha at Havelock 2 (#01-01/48) for lunch recently!

Food:

- Had the Pork Krapow ($7.90 before tax, asked for less spicy) as my main dish. I personally thought that the pork was soft, tender and well-seasoned. Overall, the dish was well-balanced and tasty, although I wish that the egg was runny - it was cooked through.

- I also had some Chicken Wings ($8.90) to share. Felt that they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. My only gripe with this was that they could have been bigger.

Service/Atmosphere:
- There were 6 of us who went for lunch together, and we all ordered Krapow with varying levels of spiciness and/or additional meat.

There was some miscommunication on the part of the service staff and they mixed up some of our orders. However, I don't deem this to be a serious shortcoming on the part of the staff - my only wish is that they would be better prepared for future orders!

- The restaurant wasn't crowded during lunchtime and is a good value for money option if you're willing to travel to Havelock 2 mall. Seems like a hidden gem to me, if I'm honest.

I will be back again. Very impressed with the quality of the food here.

Kudos to @cravings_satisfied_jay as well for suggesting this place!

Dined in on PH eve. The place was rather packed at sunset.
+ The manager saw that the outdoor fan was blowing directly at my hair so he offered us another table nearer to the river.
+ The river view at sunset that day was awesome.
+ Food was served promptly. Everything tasted great.
- My only gripe was the serving size for some of the items. The churros in particular, were extremely little.
+/- Overall the service was friendly but as the place became more packed into the night, it was hard to get the servers' attention.

A nice Mexican restaurant with different tiers of happy hour prices depending on the time of the day. Their frozen margaritas are delicious and a great accompaniment with their food. I recommend sitting outdoors by the Riverside if you don't mind not having air conditioning..

Ate early evening. Was leaning towards tacos but saw the Al Pastor Red Snapper and had to try it. Glad I did - it was sensational. Would have been 5 stars for atmosphere apart from the sticky table. Will definitely be back for more.

Food was pretty good. We were able to hang out for extended time as there was not a lot of people on a Friday night. Only downside is there’s no air conditioned area. It was very hot and humid. A bit uncomfortable.

We chose the table outdoor because inside is a bit suffocating for me when there was crowded. Decoration with Mexican vibe is cool.
Quesadillas and nachos were so so.
Baja fish tacos was good but not really impressed.
Tried the mango margaritas and vodka soda. The drinks are lack of alcohol in my opinion, specially my friend’s vodka with 80% soda and 20% vodka I think 😂

Finally a decent burrito bowl that is value for money, and the box is filled 3/4 full with loads of protein, rice, cheese, jalapenos, fresh tomatoes, onions and herbs! The works!

We ordered from the Paya Lebar outlet and we're pleasantly surprised as it's hard to find decent and hearty tex mex fast food in Singapore. While this is not Chipotle, it sure beats the measly burrito bowls at GYG (the worst!).

Ordered the Pulled Beef Burrito Bowl, pretty good quality stuff. Loved the jalapenos amd portion is decent.

This is sad. There's literally only 4 small chunks of chicken in each taco. And there isn't any other channel to feedback this to. I bought this as a set meal for close to $20 (inclusive of delivery).

I can't tell the difference between the burrito bowl and the nachos other than the bowl has rice and the the nachos are often stale. I like their wings but I've ordered delivery several times now and almost every time there's something missing (paid extra for cheese, or jalapenos but amount is exactly the same as an order without extras), mismatched order (chicken added instead of beef). Enough is enough, I won't order from here again.

Ordered herbal chicken quesadillas. Paid for extra cheese but the extra is not noticeable at all. With Guzman, without topping up for extra cheese, it has way more cheese. Part of the Herbal chicken doesn't seem fresh as it is abit mushy n we tot it was fish initially. Taste wise is below average.

Chanced upon this restaurant while looking for some Mexican food.  We chose to sit indoors, which was relatively quiet and empty. Service was fast. The food was good too. Will revisit if we are looking for Mexican food again. Maybe will try outdoor seating next time.

Amazing restaurant! Found it by accident and it did not disappoint. They have the best oyster in sg!! Mexican food there was really nice and worth the money too. Definitely will go back again! Staff was friendly too😊

Fast service especially for the food served. Food is OK with reasonable price. There are outside seats nearby the river and air-con ones inside the building.

Very friendly staff...beautiful waterfront view.....Good mexican cuisine, but expensive.....Lively atmosphere with soft music....In each dish, Portion size was good for 2 people....Beer was with buy 2 get one free offer....

It’s not one of the most atmospheric options along the quay, since there was no music and very few customers. However the staff are very friendly and made us feel welcome without being too overbearing. Service was fast and the drinks prices reasonable. As a location for a meeting with colleagues it was ideal.

First time to this restaurant.
Love the location.
Love the amosphere.
Love how our furkid enjoy sitting with us.

Food was good but perhaps it will be nice if staff can do better recommendations.

I have to give thumbs up to the staff, being very attentive even on a full seating.

Will return again.

Celebrated my wife’s birthday here. The food was amazing and the service here is superb!

I had the most incredible experience at Super Loco, and it's all thanks to the exceptional service provided by Jenny. From the moment we walked in, Jenny's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for a fantastic evening. She not only made sure our table was perfect, but she also went above and beyond to recommend the most delicious dishes on the menu. Kudos to her 👍🏻👍🏻

They also gave us free churros and mexican lover shot as part of our birthday celebration here.

Surprisingly, even though the food looks so nice, NONE of them (ordered 3 types of food) were tasty. 👎🏻

The staff was NOT friendly/polite at all. Even though there was miscommunication, i didn’t get apologies which made me feel uncomfortable.

The atmosphere is good as they allow lovely dogs outdoor.

Overall, not recommend. :) Thanks!!

Nice and open air spot to hangout, visited after a downpour with the weather nice and cool.
We had chips and guacamole to start.
Buffalo wings and quesadillas were great with the right amount of spices.
Crabmeat tacos were a tad unwieldy, turned soggy when left out awhile.
The food can be a little salty so drinks and frozen margaritas were a nice respite.
It was nice to have 3 different salsas available by the table, the mango habanero does pack quite the punch.
Will revisit for the laidback atmosphere and great food.
Staff were attentive and offered water.

Delicious, modern Mexican cuisine. Great menu with lots of meat and veg options as well as a decent kids menu. Favourite was the cauliflower dish as well as pumpkin tostadas. Service was a little non attentive but otherwise a great experience in a comfortable environment by the river.

Came down with family of 5. So lucky the owner who is also the chef prepared food that we ordered. Simply awesome. All the food was so yummy we ordered about 7 dishes. Mr Guru also recommended the special of the day! Lamb Shank with Mandi rice!!!! Checkout their specials whenever you order food. Mexican and Turkish Fusion! Food is priced at a very affordable rate and service from Ajay & Kelvin was amicable. Thanks Los Amigos we had a fruitful evening at your cosy restaurant. Will definitely be back for MORE!!!!!

On a picturesque evening, my friend and I sought a place to unwind, and serendipitously, we stumbled upon Los Amigos Mexican restaurant. The ambiance, adorned with vibrant decor and a backdrop of lively music, immediately caught our attention.

Our culinary journey commenced with an array of delectable choices, including the signature Prawn Ceviche, spicy pork belly, rib-eye steak, and a sweet finale of churros drizzled in rich chocolate sauce, all paired with my beloved margaritas.

The Prawn Ceviche emerged as the star of the show—a harmonious blend of succulent prawns and zesty lime, delivering a medley of sour, juicy, crispy, and tender sensations all in one bite. The spicy pork belly added an extra kick to our palates, which I relished, though my friend found it a tad too fiery.

Regrettably, the rib-eye steak didn't align with our taste preferences; its flavor and texture left us disappointed, slightly dampening our dining experience. However, we concluded our meal on a sweet note with the heavenly churros, perfectly complemented by warm, velvety chocolate—a delightful treat.

In essence, Los Amigos offered a mixed dining experience with highs and lows. While some dishes soared to culinary perfection, others fell short of our expectations. Nevertheless, the lively ambiance and attentive service ensured an enjoyable evening overall.

Hola!
Love the vibes of Los Amigos!

Staff are all extremely friendly and helpful!
A shoutout to Boss, AJ, Vinod and Black for making our experience extra awesome!

We had Tacos, Quesadillas, Ceviches… everything was just perfect. I asked for no onions (imagine that in a Mexican restaurant) but they delivered without a fuss.
Love the special Yakult Soju concoction by AJ!
(We will figure out the other 6 ingredients! 😎)
Will be back! Adios!🍻

Had to order 3 times. Half the food didn’t arrive. What did arrive was terrible! Want fluorescent sour cream that tastes like garlic and guacamole that tastes like sugar? Eat here. Want food that tastes good, is what your ordered and delivered timely? Go somewhere else!

It was a team dinner & drinks event.
We had a great time at Los Amigos  with lively music and ambience followed by tasty food and drinks.
With the long list of cocktail options, the Margarita stood out.
Thank you to the owners and the staff for making the evening memorable.

Amazing food and place. Went here for my birthday.
I got the tacos,pizza and nachos. The paneer nachos were scrumptious. It had amazing cheese and melted in your mouth. It had sprinkles of olives and had a handful of nacho cheese.
The tacos were mediocre but it tasted fine. It had a mixture of vegetables dowsed in sauce.
The pizza was thinly crusted. It had a lot vegetable and the sauce was tangy and scrumptious .
They also gave me a complimentary cake which was scrumptious. It was soft and fluffy.

I ordered chicken manchurian and they served vegie manchurian after I complaint they served chicken one. But it is not the same as the menu picture😒 moreover plates are dirty you may see the fingerprint of the waiters in the last photo

Set menus rate 5 stars. They combine good food and value. Mexican and Indian sets both offer vegetarian and non-vegetarian choices for $11-16. I thought the Indian food and the Mexican food were both good. Yes, hawker stalls are cheaper and your mother’s food might taste better to you, but check out the view. If you don’t want crowds, don’t come at 6:00 on Friday or Saturday. We had a late lunch riverside and no waiting. Deep fried items freshly cooked. 👍

The restaurant outlook, ambience, seating and food were good. We had some reservations before walking in to the restaurent as Kids demanded but believe me - It is worth spending time and money here. We ain’t any real Mexican to gauge the authentic Mexican taste but when it comes with Indian flavours and thats when you love the taste.

Ordered all kids choices from the menu but all of us adults got surprised too with the taste of all.

Kudos to the servers as they taken care of the order very well and our appreciations to the chef.

Very good Mexican restaurant (and it is my favorite food in the world). The cocktails are well balanced and they are able to go off menu. The food is great, and the wood grill is bringing good flavor. Negative points: Cocktails are a bit pricey

My team mates organise this dinner session and it was my first time having Mexican food.

We had fish taco, potatoes and beef taco (not sure what is the dishes names). I also thought taco is crispy type but it is pretty similar to peking duck wrap that I am familiar with.

It was a new experience and I enjoyed it.

I understand the restaurant is pretty popular so reservation is needed. The restaurant ambient is nice too.

I mean, it’s good - but not 18$-a-taco-good.
The appetisers are served in relatively big portions (the guacamole is very well seasoned, but again, 26$ for chips?)
The only thing I found amazing and well priced was the half chicken - it was beautifully cooked and seasoned.
The tacos were a let down - greasy, small, nothing special.
And the atmosphere is very, very serious.
For similar prices you can find more creative food for sure.

Every single dish that we ordered tasted sooooo good. Tlayuda de la Casa was something super unique which I have been eyeing on ever since I found out about this restaurant and wasn’t sure which one it was in the menu but the wait staff was super helpful and recommended that we add the lobster meat. It was sweet and savory in all the right balance.

We managed to make it early for the happy hour which has tacos and drinks. However, we ended up in the first dinner seating and couldn’t keep the table past 8pm and we had to pack most of our food to go…

Food was impeccable, as much as the service was great, we believe that it could be better since there was a hefty price tag to this restaurant.

Nixta. Coming from the word "nixtamalization", a process by which maize/corn is processed by an alkaline solution. #TIL.

What can I say? The food here is pretty good but make sure you wallets are thick. Best dish is the Tlayuda de la Casa, a crunchy tortilla with corn all other ingredients. We opted for the additional lobster but the super sweet corn is all I can remember of this dish. The whole dish is just perfect.

Next best is the giant churros. Amazing soft and hot churros topped with cinnamon sugar. The sauces were only a distraction.

The fingerlings cooked in duck fat were pretty good with the cheese and sour cream too. Duck and pork belly tacos were decent but the portions were kinda small. My other friends seemed to like the chicken. While I admit that it was pretty juicy and tender, I find it a bit too salty. Like salt baked chicken.

Service staff were very competent and friendly. One of them even offered to help us take photos.

We did end up going elsewhere for more food.

Varieties of veg food is available.
Pre booking is highly recommended.
Have been here 2 times and will definitely go again since the quality of food, service and the ambience is amazing.
MBS view dining is great.

Visit Date - 13 August 2023

It was a very pleasant experience at Super Loco @Customs House. On a Sunday it was quiet and we had booked a table outside overlooking the Marina.
It is recommended to visit during sunset, there is a refreshing breeze and slowly the marina lights up all happy and colourful - a perfect way to gear up for the new week.
We were served by Danial. He gave some unbiased suggestions highlighting what he likes and why and some other items why his colleagues like

Based on that we ordered
A Bottle of Pineapple and Calamani Margarita - It was light & refreshing
Trotilla chips with salsa roja

For the main course we had
Wagyu Steak - juicy bite sized on a taco
Beef Quesadilla - quite tasty

This should have been enough for dinner but for us it was not complete without a dessert so we indulged in
Chocolate Lava - as mentioned by Danial, the Mint ice cream and choco-lava cake made a super combo.
Panna Cotta - personally I liked this the best. The tang of lemon sorbet balanced the sweet Oaxaca cheese topped with the crunch of pistachio crumble. This is an item to return for.
Thanks Super Loco

Don’t be surprised by my 5 STAR ratings🤣 I’m pretty sure it’s not because of my birthday🌝

So I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant and it was on a Saturday😊 I love went to other restaurant before but not this location. The VIEW is superb even at 6pm(before sunset)

I ordered Chefs Recommendation $48/6 dishes.. I would say the portion is not too much and just nice for my appetite… So, as I put in the reservation remark column, they gave me a hat that night with a complimentary citrusy shots🤣 Ok, it’s a bonus drink, what do you expect? A glass of beer or wine? 🤣

So.. If you like to enjoy beautiful view with nice Mexican food, you should consider here and make your reservation early at least a week before your selected date😉

Absolutely delicious and satisfying Mexican fare in a chill, laid-back setting by the Bay. No complaints and would definitely return! The chips and dips are a must-order!!

Dropped in just before last call for orders at 9pm on a weekend, but the staff were friendly and helpful even though we were latecomers. We ordered a selection of tacos, tostados, the nacho chips and a salad - everything was served very quickly, tasted fresh, balanced, overall just really delicious.

The nacho chips with the range of dips was probably the star of the night. It’s usually a starter that I take for granted but the sauces here pack a punch - so so good and deceivingly simple-looking. I may not be a regular diner at Mexican restaurants but I’d imagine that it would be hard to top this off. Can’t wait to go back!

We got an outdoor seat beside the Bay Area with the backdrop Marina Bay Sands.
The view was awesome, there were a lot of people gathering around the area just to take photos in the evening.

Everything we ordered tasted fantastic, and the plating was colourful. The service was warm, friendly and attentive. It rained halfway and Solihin quickly relocated us indoor, and offered to leave the door open so we can enjoy the view, until the rain got heavier.

Overall, it was a unique and warm five star experience!

Pricing is bonkers tho with rice and dal dishes being close to 15 dollars. Service was excellent and I would come back and try a few other dishes. One issue is the lack of bathroom facilities or washbasin in the restaurant. You have to exit and do a couple of doors down and my nose never did recover from little India’s more underground smells !

I had a great experience at this Indian restaurant

The food was great and I enjoyed the service, the staff were friendly and helpful.

I like the atmosphere, and I appreciated how quickly the food was served.

While I haven't explored many Indian restaurants yet, I'm looking forward to returning to try more dishes in the future.

So far the best chaats I have had in Singapore. Nice and proper place to sit and enjoy the food. Prices are not exorbitant. One thing I dislike is that they don't have a proper hand wash inside the restaurant. Have to go out to wash and come back using the swing door, which defeats the purpose of washing hands. Indian food must be enjoyed by using hands, so hand wash point in the restaurant is a must.

Update on 18 Sep,
Since I liked the chaats, I thought of having at airport as I saw it was at T1 terminal @ L2. When I went there, they said it was moved to different location. Management must take out the signboard from T1 as it gives wrong information.

Very good option for Indian vegetarian food. Was seated very fast and the service was also good. During peak dinner time 8-9pm place will be crowded and generally there will be waiting.
Vast Manu covers most of the Indian variety food. Food is really tasty, especially all the chat items are very nice. If you are looking for   Indian vegetarian food definitely worth a try.

Great North Indian cuisine. Service was slower than expected, however food was good. Be careful when ordering more sides as they charge for everything

Most authentic and flavourful North Indian food experience so far in Singapore… no extra spices, oil or colour… only fresh juicy mild aroma and taste 👌🏻

Best part was that they served everything one by one, so that we could eat and enjoy at leisure and relish the sizzling hot dishes :)

First time here! Amazing food and service! Definitely coming back!

Lots of options, portion is just nice as well 👌

Personal favourite tonight was the Goan Fish!

A really homely establishment serving delectable Indian dishes at affordable prices relative to other places.

The paneer masala was rich and perfect with the Naan basket. The mutton biryani was rich and tender. Accompanied with the Malai chicken kebab, which was served on a sizzling hot plate that oozed rich flavours. Finally, the Gulab Jamun was rich and fragrant without exceedingly sweet. Topped with the Mango milkshake served with passion, the food was downed with great enjoyment.

Come on down if you are in the vicinity, you won’t regret it.

The food was excellent, the service exquisite. Thanks to the waiter we ordered incredibly good food. The Goan fish curry was probably the best I ever had. The mint chutney was very strong in taste, hence it was the first time I ever really appreciated it as an appetizer sauce.

Would definitely recommend, way better than expected.

Love their lamb rack briyani. The briyani was not too oily, flavourful and lamb rack was succulent. Lamb was not gamey at all. Their lassi and dal makhni were very rich in flavour. They have a variety of sauces to complement different dishes which pairs very well. It's affordable for such quality Indian food.
Service crew were very polite and attentive.

Really nice food with an interesting dining concept. Loved sitting on the floor upstairs. The chef / owner was lovely. I think my favorite dish was the butter chicken, but honey everything we tried was lovely. The samosas and the tandoori chicken were also great. Yum!

Had an incredible time here! My group stumbled in not knowing at all what was in store for us.

We first of all were impressed that this place made the Michelin List so many years in a row, and then we saw the hilarious Spice Challenge and were intrigued with all of the fun events this place hosts like the Full Moon Nights & the cooking classes. The owner/chef was so awesome. He was so funny and sarcastic and also encouraged us to get out of our American-Indian comfort zone and wouldn’t let us all just order Tikka Masala as we originally planned, and because of that, it turns out I found authentic Indian food I loved even more! I really wish I lived here so I could take the cooking classes with him!

Many thanks for providing our group with such an entertaining experience and pushing us out of our comfort zones. It was truly a time!

WOW! Where do I even begin… easily one of the best, most delicious places to eat out I’ve ever been to! Great and authentic setting, delicious Indian cuisine and lovely staff to make you feel like home. The spicy challenge is so fun and the taste of the food there is simply out of this world! A must visit if you happen to be in Singapore!

Changed my perception of Indian food in Singapore : well-curated, small portion size, so I didn't feel stuffy while digesting and a bit pricy. Masala tea was better than I had in Mumbai but it would have been perfect if the sugar was on the side.

An amazing and authentic environment with unique deliveries of classic dishes. They have a sauce heat sampler platter to see what heat level you like.  There's a challenge wall for those seeking immortality as well. But the naan and sauces are too notch. A must try. The proprietors are amazing and have a fun sense of humo(u?)r.

Reviews: 

A delight to every South Indian dish that’s being presented! The restaurant holds the legacy with not just the location, the interior but also to the taste with food. We tried a few variations including the famous meal and biriyani. A must try will be the meal combo, served hot. We had to wait for around 30 mins to get seated but it’s worth the wait.. ground floor and first floor has seating capacity. The prices are very reasonable for the quantity being served. Will definitely recommend this place for all South Indian vegetarian fans!

Food here is good, not that very bad. Service got to improve. Environment can be cramped and noisy. Pricey but still okay, you pay what you asked for. I was served food first, even finished up eating the foods but drinks were served after 5-10 after finishing up my meals. Masala tea arrived 30-40 minutes late upon ordering. This is not acceptable at all. And never even apologized for serving the drinks late. I ordered one ice tea and one masala tea. Also, I personally feel the standard of the food have dropped a lot. Used to patronize here often but I think it's about time that the service and food taste is falling apart.
Overall food is 7.5/10.
Service is 3/10.
Environment is 4.5/10.
This review is based on my honest opinion.

Arrived at around 11am on a Saturday morning and there was already a queue. However the queue moves fast!
Was allocated to a seat on level 2. Contrary to what was written in other reviews, I didn't feel that the staircase was narrow. The entire restaurant is air-conditioned and clean.

Be sure to order at the cashier before heading back to your seat, where you'll hand the receipt to the waiter.

The lady at the counter was friendly and honest! She prompted me that what I've ordered is sufficient for the amount of people I came with (rather than allowing me to order more eventhough that'll mean they'll earn more money).

The Bhatura was huge, delicious! So was the mysore dosai! The masala tea was flavourful, packed with spice and not too sweet. The Gobi Manchurian was however a little too salty for my liking.

Be sure to ask the waiters for your Masala Tea if you will like it to be served before/during your meal. If you don't, I noticed that they'll only serve it at the end of your meal.

Will be back!

I saw this on a food travel show and immediately wanted to try it out.

There was a short queue but seated after 5min or so wait. Service was friendly and no fuss. Dining area is simple but as expected.

Definitely lived up to expectations with amazing, fresh, authentic and tasty food. I had the dosai meal which had 3 curries, some chutneys, Daal, sambar, and even a sweet sago coconut pudding. Amazing flavours, colours and spices. A generous meal which was thoroughly enjoyable.

For a sweet finish I tried the almond hawa and milk kova which were both new to me. Very sweet but had their own unique taste and texture which hit the spot.

One improvement would be to use less plastic for serving food - lots of little plastic containers on my meal set and for sweets.

Overall a great experience and will definitely be recommending and be back.

The food and service is always good in Komala Vilas. We stay nearby so we can walk to this restaurant during our jaunt in Singapore.
I wish they include an elevator to go upstairs for lunch. On request they let my parents share the meals but mentioned there will be no refills.
Taste is always exceptional.

Rating: 4.6
Reviews: 

Welcome to delightful India right in the middle of Singapore. Located in Race Course road and in the vicinity of Little India this place screams authenticity. The quaint place had nice decor and a good vibe. We had the butter chicken, lady finger vegetable curry, fish tikka, garlic and cheese Naan as well as a starter which was a flatbread filled with a spinach style filling and a curry on the side to dip the bread.  For drinks we had a mango lassi and lime juice. Everything was delicious and the service was delightful and friendly. Recommended to make a reservation as it got quite busy on a Thursday evening.

Excellent dinner at Mustard on Race Course Rd. Restaurant is small and intimate and service is excellent and attentive.  They have a huge menu with tons of choices so we ordered way too much to try many things. Everything was wonderful but especially recommend the house special Chingri Maacher Malai, the Aloo Jhuri, Mutton Biryani and the kathi kababs.

Located in the Little India neighborhood. This restaurant has friendly staff, of which unfortunately not everyone speaks English.

Food menu is extensive and you don't have to wait very long on your food. Not everything was of my personal taste, but I am sure the food was nice. Also enough dessert choices and even typical Indian drinks.

Do note that the air conditioning is very cold here, somewhat too cold (heard the same thing from a co-worker who visited earlier).

Had a very enjoyable meal here. You can taste the actual flavours, aroma, spices.

As compared to other restaurants, you can taste the actual ingredients in the sauces, as they use fresh ingredients and fresh spices.

The briyani was extremely aromatic as well!

10/10 would come back again!

Excellent food!

We arrived at opening at 11:30 specifically bent on enjoying authentic Bengali food—we left satisfied and glad we came early!

The waiters are able to make excellent recommendations. We opted to go straight for mains:

- Kosha Mangsho: tender chunks of mutton in a fantastic thicker gravy

- Chingri Maacher Malai Curry: delicate shrimp and coconut curry presented in a tender coconut

- Maacher Paturi: boneless fish fillet smothered in mustard, gently steamed in a banana leaf

Rice bread does not come with each main, and does require separate purchasing. We opted for:
- Luchi: aka puri, lightly fried and crisp
- Roomali Roti: one roti is rather large, and folded in on itself; delicate with a great chew
- Plain white rice

For dessert, we enjoyed Rossomalai (aka Rasmalai), a dessert in most areas of India, but theirs is fragrant and richly flavored with cardamom, almonds, and cream.

All in all, a fantastic visit for those who enjoy Indian food and are looking for something different than what most restaurants serve. They do include Punjabi items in their menu, which is typically what most people think of when they think “Indian,” but venturing off to possibly “unfamiliar” dishes won’t disappoint!

Reviews: 

Could not believe this is a Michelin’s recommended place. It’s been a long time since I’ve been here and sadly to say, I’ll not come back again.

I ordered the curry fish head, chicken tikka and chicken biriyani. The expectation of the curry fish head was high but was the biggest disappointment. Not much taste, more towards blend with lots of unnecessary spices. Chicken tikka was not bad but the biriyani was also terrible. Rice was cold and stale.

Let’s come to the service. The server, an Indian guy who took my order was kind of rude and distracted. When taking my order, he was also at the same time talking loudly to other Indian servers. I had to repeat my order thrice. He didn’t seem to be happy working there. He was very uninterested when I asked him a question about the menu and gave the “would u hurry up” face. When he came back with the glasses and water, he slammed it on the table loudly. Only when i stared at him, he retracted back. I didn’t get his name though but I could recognize him. Ironically, the friendliest server was a Chinese lady server that day.

For the price you are paying, it’s definitely not worth it for the food and the service. Both are terrible. The management should do something about most of the servers there. Their attitude seems that they own the restaurant or they are not interested to receive any customers.

I urge anybody or tourist or what’s to visit this restaurant to try other authentic Singapore Indian food elsewhere. You will be getting better food and service elsewhere

Good Indian food here. Fish head curry is a must. Quite a big portion of fish head here. Butter chicken was also good.

It was getting mire crowded at dinner time. Reservation might be required at dinner time. Luckily we came slightly before dinner time.

Price was expensive though. 4 adults cost me SGD 200+

My first visit to this restaurant was a memorable one. The food was remarkably tasty, and the staff’s friendly and attentive nature added an extra touch of warmth. I will definitely be returning for more delightful meals and their top-notch service.

food was very authentic and service was quick. although the pricing will definitely be slightly higher than ur usual indian street spot. this restaurant is well air conditioned and has proper plating and service so price is definitely what you get. staff also abit too eager... clearing plates before we leave the table even. the place wasn't packed so i feel like such etiquette should be rectified to enhance customer experience

22/07/23
Have higher expectations for Michelin restaurants. Fish head curry is average. The curry has full flavour of curry spices but lack of savoury. Curry chicken has similar taste too. Overall food is only slightly above average.

I love the vadai, it's the tastiest I've ever had and I'm surprised how nice and crisp it is outside, and soft and warm inside. Makes me feel like I've been eating nonsense for a long time. The VIP Thali is also absolutely delicious! Likewise the dosai. Service was o-k, the waiter actually got two out of 5 orders wrong, but was quick to serve us the correct item after that.

Didn't get to try the appam where they make it freshly on the spot. Can't wait to come back here again.

Price: $3.70 (Plain Thosai)

Plain Thosai: 5/5
Thosai was crispy, savoury and had a good sour taste.

Sambar: 5/5
Sambar was flavourful, moreish, hearty and sweet.

Chutney: 4.5/5
Orange chutney was tangy, tomatoey and spicy. White chutney was coconuty and creamy.

Total score: 14.5/15

Add-ons: Madras Coffee ($2.90) was fragrant and milky. Very standard and good filter coffee.

Service was quick and the service staff were very polite and friendly.

Time to enjoy a nice breakfast with an appam set and a madras tea (small).

Appam was soft on the centre and slightly crispy on the exterior. Served warm. It goes really well with the orange sugar and coconut milk. Madras tea was thick & creamy, and you can add sugar as you need.🫓☕

The place was packed in the morning, but no queue at my time (8.30am, Sunday). Staff seemed busy & stressed (this has been the energies of many people these days as we are undergoing purging collectively). Boss is kind and friendly, quietly came by to top up my orange sugar when I used it up the first round. 🙏🏻

We went for Breakfast on 18th Sept... no rush at all in the restaurant... very pleasant quick service... very friendly... foid taste wise average and can do better I feel specific to break fast... but the people working are there friendly... unfortunately, they are not accepting visa or master card.. maje sure carry a local card or carry cash..  but they accepted inr and so generous. ... we ordered plain idly, sambhar idly, dosa and coffee... dosa is average and can be better... as it is ganesha vinayagar chaturthi and took some idol photos from near shop.

The appam is to die for. Coffee was good. The vadai is crispy dosa not bad. Cost around $21. For the coffee and appam I will definitely come back.

Apollo Banana Leaf Indian Food is a culinary delight! The Briyani Mutton is a flavor explosion - tender, fragrant, and perfectly spiced. The Tandoori Prawn is a succulent masterpiece, charred to perfection. The vibrant atmosphere and friendly staff enhance the experience. Whether you're a foodie or a spice enthusiast, Apollo is a must-visit for a mouthwatering journey through Indian cuisine. This place is a true gem that satisfies cravings and ignites a love for authentic Indian flavors. Don't miss out on this remarkable culinary adventure!

Went to Banana Leaf for dinner with my colleagues while on a business trip in Singapore, we really enjoyed the authentic Indian food. Our food was served on banana leaves which was a really cool experience plus the food was exceptional and tasty. The service was also good.

My parents and me were there for lunch, ordered the medium sized curry fish head with briyani rice and lime juice. The curry and side vegetables were flavourful, of acceptable spiciness . Medium size fish head portion was just nice for 3pax. The bill came up to $80+.. Feel that their food is over-priced. Go to them  if u don't mind paying a bit more

Ripoff ! The rice which was supposedly free flow is so expensive!

Give it a try when you are in little India. Our bill was about $100.

We ordered medium fish head curry, tandoori chicken and we got the portion of rice which comes with vegetables and gravy.

Masala tea was bad- skip. Overall a nice experience and you can bring your family and friends if they are from out of town!

However it’s not worthwhile to order the rice if u r not a big eater !

First time at banana leaf on a Friday evening. Atmosphere was great. Gotta say the fish head curry packed a punch with the rich, tangy flavour of the gravy. Perfect match with the biryani rice.

Been wanting to try for weeks not easy to get a reservation online, either it's full or the remaining timings were quite weird.
Finally booked a lunch on a public holiday and secured a table. Initially wondering why the place was so empty when I arrived but after a while it was totally packed.
A little confusing on the menu because the physical one outside the shop had dinner menu and lunch menu and the electronic one only had lunch. Not sure if could only order from the lunch menu tab but upon asking could order from anywhere from the menu. There were duplicate dishes on ala carte and lunch menu because portion size was smaller and it comes with a set of soup and rice.
Ordered quite a few items to try, the most important thing I wanted to try was the marinated raw crab and we also ordered the galbi along with some other dishes like seafood pancake and kimchi stew.
Everything here was good, from the sides to the mains. The galbi was cooked by the staff and it was cooked to perfection. Raw crab was also nice and flavourful and well marinated.
Bill came and it was slightly expensive but definitely worth for the quantity and the quality. Would definitely come back again!

Reservations are recommended. When we visited on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed.

The pork was good. The staff isn't very interactive or smiley, but they are quite helpful when it comes to grilling the meat.

Was brought here by a friend for dinner. He came here here quite a few time and highly recommend me to come here. There were already a crowd when we reached. There was 5 group ahead of us and we waited for almost half and hour before it was our turn.

Apart from the ala carte, they also have different sets available. The Korean bbq here Is cooked via charcoal. The stuff will help you prep the food. Sides dishes is refillable. The marination of the meat was fantastic, not too sweet nor salty.

Overall, I enjoyed the food and would definitely be back again.

The newly revamp joint has a real modern touch. Service is absolutely amazing. Food quality is top notch. Many tables was having the raw crab. Looks good however didn’t dare to try. Seafood pancake was delicious & they don’t skimp on the ingredients. Btw the steam egg is FOC. Every table has it. We wanted to order however the waitress explained they will provide every table with one.
Highly recommended.

First time trying Guiga and I’m so glad we did! Everything from service to food was perfect. I loved the beef tartare and marinated crabs❤️ We got the Black Pork set with a side of beef ribs and the samgyetang, which is by far the tastiest I’ve had in Singapore. We didn’t quite enjoy the steamed egg, maybe cos we let it sit there for too long because we were busy eating up the feast we ordered!  We will definitely be back!

Reviews: 

Great tasting Korean BBQ meat! We decided to try this restaurant among the many others along Tanjong Pagar area. Came around 6:30pm and it was fairly quiet and managed to get a seat. But the place was getting crowded shortly.

Attentive and very fast service. The banchans were replenished once we finished some of them.
The meats were of good quality!
Will definitely be back again!

TLDR: Will return

Type: Korean BBQ

Waiting Time: None at 7pm on a Thursday. Food took 10 minutes to arrive from the time we got a table and ordered.

Must Try (‼️): The meat in BBQ Set C - Beef Brisket, Marinated Beef Rib, Marinated Chicken - delicious and good value at $79.80 before tax and service charges // The shredded cabbage salad with black sesame dressing banchan.

Service: Good - the service staff was polite but the chicken was left on the grill for too long.

Note: The restaurant’s ventilation system isn’t great - the smoke will get absorbed into your clothes and hair.

The food is great, excellent customer service, banchan is delicious, so happy to try their Ganjang Gejang.We had a great dinner at Supulae Korean BBQ, thank you very much, definately will be back again.

Supposed to go to another outlet across the road for korean bbq but the queue was too long. Ended up in this restaurant.
Nice refreshing sides.
The meat are delicious and the sauces are what you will experience in korea.
Staff are prompt in getting the meat bbq for you.
Best of all, nice ventilation system as the restaurant is not smokey compared to other outlets.
Ordered their Supulae set

Ordered Set B which comprised chicken and pork. Selected kimchi stew as the side which was disappointing : diluted soup with cabbage and eggs with a hint of kimchi taste and red colouring. Steamed egg was plain steamed egg with no garnishes. Half half pancake was too mushy  with flour inside. Standard had dropped significantly since my last visit a few years ago. The sides tasted like they came out of a packet. Liked the finely shredded cabbage with black sesame sauce though. I think the restaurant has room for improvement if it wants to stand out from the heaps of similar options along this street.  Supulae has been around longer than the rest of the Korean bbq restaurants here and it should do better on their dishes. There is certainly fierce competition but Supulae needs to only not stinge on the quality then Ioyal customers like me will come back.

Reviews: 

We visited this place for 3-4times. And tried different dishes. The restaurant is ran by Korean. It is authentic Korean cuisine. The atmosphere is chill and cozy. Our favorite food is the spicy chicken feet pot and the beef rib soup.
The panchan판찬there are also nice and the waiter and waitress are responsive. Just that sometime they get really busy.
It would be really lovely to go there for a sip of the hot soup on a rainy and cold morning.
Really like this place a lot.

overall a popular place with good options of home cooking style Korean food, better to have more than 3people sharing , portion is big for 2 person, you may only get a chance to try 1 or 2 type of food. The pork and chicken dishes are big portion. Chicken feet comes with steam egg and rice balls, it’s a good combination and good to share.
Came at around 630pm on a Friday evening, it started to get very busy from 7pm.

Came here on a Wednesday night at 7 p.m., and no reservations were needed. I have walked past this restaurant a few times, but I was more familiar with their nostalgic cultural Korean decorations. They moved recently to a new area along the same stretch, and it's so minimalistic now... A lot more space is catered for diners, with rooms for big groups. Side dishes was pretty okay only. Toilet is huge too!

💧 Water is complimentary

We ordered:

🐔 Jjimdak ($55)
Braised chicken in dark sauce, this dish is one of my favourites in korea. And this standard is pretty okay! Huge portion that feeds at least 4 people. Chicken could have been braised longer to have more flavour. The japchae noodles at the bottom soak up a lot of sauce, so it's quite filling, along with potatoes and carrots.

I rate: 3.5/5 🌟

🍃 Minari Jun ($28)
1st time trying Minari, and we were surprised how fresh this vegetable pancake tasted. It didn't have a celery scent and tasted rather clean. Quite flat as well. Would like it if it's bigger.
I rate: 4.5/5 🌟

🍶 Pine Nut Draught Wine ($28)
The way it's served is pretty interesting! In a small vat with a wooden scoop into a shallow bowl. It was a little gassy and had a faint, nutty sweet aftertaste.

I rate: 4/5 🌟

This place serves very authentic Korean food. Although traditional bbq was available, no one was having that as the standout are the Korean cooked dishes. It's quite close to the Korean food I had in Korea last year. The standout is the braised short ribs. It's so tender and meat falls off the bone easily. Pair the rice with the braised sauce and it's heavenly. The radishes and carrots were so yummy too. 2nd best was the assorted pancakes. It was like no other I had tried before. There were fish, mushroom, prawns and it's so all very special. It really fills you up too. The place was not very closely packed where you're sitting shoulder to shoulder and tables well spaced apart, unlike some other Korean restaurants here. The restroom are also very clean.

Went for an early dinner and was given a spacious seat for our family of 4. Ordered the barbecued pork belly and beef. They will actually sliced the meat and barbecue the meat for you so that you don’t have to actually do it yourself. Ordered the beef bulgogi for the kids and the kids loved it. Not too many of non spicy options for kids though. Kimchi pancake tasted great while the cold noodles were quite soggy. Overall prices are on the higher side, especially the barbecued meats. Service can be improved, cos we waited quite long for the rice to be ready and there wasn’t anyone to inform us that we have to wait for the rice.

After a few turns, I decided to try this place because of the reviews. Dun get me wrong, but my experience with the food is just, like I say just ......will I be back.... there's plenty other places to try. The set I ordered was JUST, the side dishes 😔 but the bean paste soup is really good. I have eaten Korean food before the craze. Maybe it's better to  get à la carte. The service is tops.

Restaurant That Are Actually Worth Waiting In Line For !!

Excellent service, staff were all very friendly and helpful and the service was fast too. More than anything, the food was super delicious.

A restaurant I really want to recommend to Local And Korean.

My preferred spot for satisfying my Korean food cravings!

Their kimchi soup is not only incredibly delicious but also delightfully thick. The steamed egg is a real treat too.

The best part? The attentive waiter who expertly handles the grilling of all the raw foods, from pork slices to chicken slices, allowing you to relish the meal without constant grill-checking.

The only challenge is their generous portions; the set meal is quite large for two people, even for a couple like us.

On busy weekends, expect a decent wait with a long queue, but it moves surprisingly fast. We arrived around 7 pm and waited approximately 30 minutes for dinner.

Despite that, I'll undoubtedly return whenever the Korean BBQ cravings strike!

The food is good, there are varieties of meat including marinated and non marinated. Server will help to cook the food for you. They provide lots of sides (7 when I counted). Had Set C which was a combination of pork and beef and complimentary steamed egg with roe and choice of soup. Only thing is the waiting time cos it could be 2 hrs and above and dining time was 90mins.

Had dinner at this restaurant and definitely the top 3 Korean BBQ restaurant in Singapore 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

This gem offers good quality meat which surely justify the money paid! Their pork was tender, fresh and no gamy smell at all. Their banchan were all very delicious except for the fish cake which was too tough and thick.

Steam egg is good, well seasoned and below was charred on point! 👍🏻 The naengmyeon was icy cold and the broth is flavourful but not too overpowering. And it goes so well with the meat.

They provide excellent service, staff were all very friendly and helpful and the service was fast too!one thing amazed me most is the staff will keep asking if your side dishes need to be refill which you don’t see it anywhere.

The atmosphere is pleasant and with Korean staff and their warm welcome, it will bring you to Korea instantly. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Reviews: 

Fun place for fried chicken and beers. Loved the ice cream beer (aka frozen foam). Very neat concept. The chicken was great - you can get almost anything deboned which is awesome. I think we liked the cheese the best, but the garlic soy was lovely as well.

I went there on a quiet Monday night, and the place was pretty empty. A perfect spot for a relaxed catch-up.

We ordered two half chicken dishes - Yangnyeom & Soy Garlic flavour, along with a japchae. The chicken surprised us with its light, crispy batter and tasty sauces. The japchae, on the other hand, was okay and also had a rather small portion size.

Overall, I'd recommend this place for a casual weekday dinner with friends 👍

Tasty chicken and light cooling beer soju. Special ice cream beer. Good place for friends to hangout after work. Not so crowded during weekdays

We randomly chanced upon this when searching for good Korean food on Google so we decided to come here for dinner. Although we made reservations, it seems like the restaurant is relatively quiet during weekday nights (we came on a Tuesday night) - but nevertheless just make reservations in case things change!

We ordered a bowl of Jjamppong and got the original fried chicken to share (attached is the menu to see the different options). Portion is decent but the food was SUPER good! Honestly, the chicken batter was perfect and it was neither too oily or salty for our liking. The jjamppong wasn't too spicy or bland - just the right balance too. They even had a decent serving of seafood.

There was only one service staff member at that time and she was super professional and smiley when taking our orders and paying the bill. The overall vibes was really cool too, with Korean music playing in the background (not too loud so you can have proper conversations without shouting at the top of your voice). All in all, I would 10/10 recommend anyone looking for good authentic Korean food in Tanjong Pagar. It is a short walk from both Outram Park and Tanjong Pagar MRT stations.

Original boneless chicken with onion sauce ($24++ = $28) - 2.5 stars
Enough for one person though I'm probably not a bit eater. But this made me question whether KFC really is just overpriced Kentucky Fried Chicken. The chicken was kind of ordinary, although I imagine it had more meat than you'd find at Kentucky FC (and I haven't been there in years). But the issue was probably the onion sauce, which tasted like fairly artificial and processed mustard. I much preferred the fresh Pico de gallo-like onion sauce at Chir Chir. Would not pay $28 for this again.

======

Boneless chicken with sweet and spicy and rice cakes - 4.5 stars
The boneless chicken was juicer than the bone-in chicken surprisingly. My husband, who usually prefers the latter said he would just order the boneless chicken the next time. It was my second time having Korean fried chicken - given that the last time I had something similar was probably KFC popcorn chicken decades ago, I was pleasantly surprised that there was ample meat and not just a bunch of fried batter. I liked this sauce better than the soy garlic one but it was definitely sweet and towards the end I didn't quite enjoy the sweetness. We got the medium and it was larger than we expected.

Soy garlic 6 piece - 4.25 stars
Sweet sauce and could barely taste the garlic.

Good place for Korean fried chicken, but personally I think the sauces are too sweet for me.

Reviews: 

The Korean BBQ experience was truly authentic, featuring a variety of trays for grilling meat. The assortment of meat flavors and generous portions were impressive. While it might be a bit on the expensive side, the fact that the staff personally cooks for you makes it entirely worthwhile.

The staff members were not only friendly but also knowledgeable about which options would best suit your taste buds.

Will definitely be coming back again.

TLDR: May return for the beef only

Type: Korean BBQ

Waiting Time: 30min at 7pm on a Friday. Food took 10 minutes to arrive from the time we got a table and ordered.

Must Try (‼️): The meat in BBQ Set D - Ribeye, Boneless Beef Ribs, Beef Short Ribs - very flavourful

Good to Try (❗️): Bean Paste Stew - decent // Steamed Egg - decent

Don’t Try (❌): Cold Noodles - noodles needed another rinse as they were too starchy and the broth was bland // Kimchi Pancake - bland, thin, chewy and greasy

Service: Excellent - staff was polite and grilled the meat properly. They also gave us hangover tonic (see last picture), which was a nice touch.

Note: The restaurant can get smoky and the smoke will get absorbed into your clothes and hair.

Ordered BBQ set A with bean paste soup and a bowl of cold noodles. The service staff is very hospitable and polite despite them being super busy during dinner time. Deducting 1 star because the meat has a very smokey flavour after grilling on top of charcoal for a long time. The smokey flavour is not really my thing but idk you might like it. The ban chan selection is also not a lot. On the other hand, I really liked the bean paste soup though, it’s very umami and addictive. The cold noodles are very refreshing, I really liked it

Towards the end and round the corner of the Korean restaurant stretch at Tanjong Pagar, not that easy to find tbh but it was fairly quiet on a weekday evening and meats were of pretty good quality! Seafood pancake and cold noodles were AMAZING. Would come back for sure.

Went there yesterday again with a friend. Since I have a big appetite and just wanna enjoy the food we chose to go on a Wednesday cuz there is like a curfew on weekends, a 90min time limit on Fri-Sun. We ordered the pork set(a generous portion of meat with seafood soup served on a cassette stove, it’s peppery & more flavorful after allowing it to sit for longer. The set also includes eryngii, sesame leaf/lettuce/pickled radish/cucumber/garlic, fish cake, a variety of condiments & the mayo/yakisoba sauce omelette!! I can’t have enough of that), wagyu beef as usual(it melts), and cold noodles (the best!). For someone who doesn’t like rice wine, I was taken by surprise by their premium Soju, it doesn’t have that awful bitter taste or that strong smell present in other rice wine,  rather it has a pleasant taste and fragrant aroma. Not forgetting the fact that I didn’t get a migraine or hangover just goes to show how it’s an alcoholic drink made for everyone, it’s really great for sleep too, NGL I almost dozed off after drinking + the food coma🥴. The only downside is if only I had a second stomach! It’s also really nice to have someone do the cooking for you, the staffs are also very attentive they would ask how you like your meat to be(e.g.medium or well done). To top it off, you get to choose a popsicle from 4 different flavors before you leave & it’s on the house, personally I like the strawberry flavored one, it’s dope! My dining experience here so far has been delightful!

Reviews: 

This is a great fine dining version of Korean BBQ but at a very affordable price. Me andd my gf had the beef set meal at just 99 and it comes with so much beef and free flowing side dishes. The ambiance of the place was amazing down to their gold plated looking utensils and plates. The service was also very good. Definitely worth visiting!

I've always passed by this restaurant, intrigued by its fancy interior and being a huge fan of Korean BBQ, I finally decided to give it a try for a birthday celebration. Unfortunately, I must admit that the experience left much to be desired in terms of both the food quality and overall value. We spent around $240 for a party of three, ordering the Beef Set, SotBap, and Kimchi Stew.

Our initial disappointment began when we were seated right by the door, subject to a constant noise level that detracted from the dining ambiance. To compound our dissatisfaction, the food arrived at our table at an excruciatingly slow pace. When we were presented with a choice of grilling the meat ourselves or having it done in the kitchen. Regrettably, we opted for the latter, which proved to be a mistake because the result was overcooked beef - dry and vapid.

In an ironic twist, the Kimchi Stew turned out to be the only item that stood out.

In addition, surprise cake we brought for our friend took an unusually long time to make its appearance. This extended wait led our friend to catch on to the surprise, spoiling the special moment we had planned.

It is evident that the service staff were trying their best at service and perhaps they were understaffed. Nonetheless, that can't justify the disappointing quality of the food. All in all, it was a very unsatisfying experience and I definitely wouldn't recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.

First time here , restaurant looks amazing and clean! Service is really good! But food quantity is not the surprise me…is good experience,but maybe can more focus on food quality, I have same food in other restaurants and in Korea too.

Korean Cuisine with fine dining but moderate price!

I think this is one of the hidden gem in Tanjung Pagar area and if you love Korean food, MUST TRY.

Service is on par and beyond expectation! They might surprise you with mini food presentation 😂

Food is well prepared.

Suggest call to check table and availability.

They close quite early so dinner do come earlier.

To me, this is definitely a Michelin star worthy restaurant. From the pumpkin soup in the beginning, to the impressive and delectable array of banchan, the attentive service including the grilling of the meat for the diners - all these way exceeded our expectation of Korean BBQ experience here in Singapore, and at a price that is comparable to other restaurants. The brass cutlery used here accentuate the fine dining experience and feeling of indulging in a grandeur feast.  This would definitely be my goto place for Korean fare henceforth.

Simply overpriced for the food standard and their service.

We ordered JabChae, Seafood pancake, Soontofu soup, LA Galbi, and Bulgogi.

JabChae taste good but a bit too sweet.
Seafood pancake, they use too much flour and not cook enough. Too thick and still sticky inside.

Soontofu taste normal.
Bulgogi is also normal.
LA Galbi is taste good but too expensive for it.

Service also not good. Need so long to get staff’s attention to order. Even when we ask them to top up their side, eventually they didn’t do it.
Plus they should instruct soontofu comes with rice.

Overall, to be honest, I really don’t understand why Google review is over 4.
All dishes are overpriced for the quality.
There is a lot of good Korean food with reasonable price.

With three branches scattered across the island, this restaurant is renowned for its stellar tofu soup. You can take your pick from various proteins like beef, pork, or seafood. While there are alternative dishes like bibimbap or bulgogi for non-tofu enthusiasts, honestly, why would you venture here if not for the soothing allure of tofu soup? It's a must-try, deeply satisfying, and my friends who joined me even confessed that they occasionally sneak in for a solo, heartwarming meal.

Beef short ribs were the highlight of the meal. A bit chewy but not heavily marinated so you can taste the beef itself. Surprisingly, the fried fish appetiser was quite enjoyable. It smelled slightly fishy but tasted nice with its light seasoning. Seafood tofu soup was a bit salty but went well with rice. Pancake was oily and bland.

Famous chain from Korea. I reviewed the Millenia Walk outlet which is for dinner which i love. I came to this outlet for Lunch. Super crazy weekday lunch crowd. I was disappointed with my order of beef offal soup. The whole soup is so thick and chunky. I barely finished it. The price point is too high for a weekday lunch. I rather do dinner. The restaurant has no lack of fans. Always long queue even for weekday lunch.

I have been too all 3 outlets and I personally find that this outlet staff are more friendly. First tip, try to make advance booking. I did via Chope. Very long queue during dinner time. Chope has got good deals too. Their portion is very big. I suggest if you have 2 pax, just order 1 combo and 1 side. The corn tea is very refreshing. After a hearty meal, they give free yakult. Yummy

First time here and was shocked with the enthusiastic greetings from the staff.

Table was prepared with dishes to compliment the food and more side dishes came along after ordering.

Ordering process was easy with just a QR code scanner. Food was awesome and we love how friendly and attentive our server Mr Shin Young Wook and another staff that grilled our meat for us.

I definitely feel so welcome here and will only come back here for Korean BBQ in the future !

Compliments to all the staff !

Endured more than an hour-long wait but was worth it. Though what I didn't understand about the queue is that we were asked to wait for 15 minutes and then it became more than 30 minutes. I am not sure if the one who manages the queue was tired or what. But so many groups are coming in and and I kept checking the status of my queue and it always says 1 group ahead of us. But every time someone comes in, we are never called so we ended up waiting longer. Minus one for service because of this. I do understand that we were late for around 5 minutes as we didn't here the call for the waitlist but he shouldn't have told us to wait for a certain amount and not be able to deliver it for us.

But overall, experiencing the wait firsthand, I finally get why there's a line for this spot. Meat was succulent and the rice balls are absolutely explosive in flavour. The must order from their menu. We didn't get to try jjajang coz it was a bit too much for 2 pax already.

The variety and generous portions of side dishes were plenty to satisfy me, so no need to go overboard with the ordering just like we did. Lesson learned. 😅 I am actually already very contented with just their side dishes.

The service was also very fast and genuine. You can really feel that the staff are accommodating you depsite the busy schedule. They are very attentive and cooks the food for you very well.

Out of all the Korean restaurants in Singapore I've been to, the staffs are most kindest!! The meat is so fresh and everything from the side dishes that I could refill at any time was perfect 😋 Other than the meat, the food is so delicious!! It's a restaurant that makes me want to go every day 🫶🏻

Total satisfaction!!! Every item is good, Jajangmyeon, Cheese Seafood Pancake, and BBQ Pork Collar is a must.
Food is fresh and full of umami. Kudos to the staff for being friendly and helpful. They even grill our pork to perfection and always ask what we need next.
The atmosphere is cozy and surprisingly the temperature is cold and comfortable despite it being a Barbecue restaurant.
Last but not least, the food portion is generous too at the price we're paying, I would say it's affordable.

The food was delicious.. specially the bbq (Prime beef), it was really darn nice and juicy!!

The tofu stew was spicy with the right kick for taste bud..

The flying fish roe with rice was delicious and yummy!!!

A good place to have casual Korean BBQ and dishes.

The Korean pancake is crispy.
Pork belly cut is nice.

Affordable buffet prices starting at $29.50 for weekday and plus $5 on weekends.

They don't charge GST which is a plus point.

Reservation is recommended as the place is fully booked.

The toilet is wet and has bad ventilation.
Hope the owner can spruce up the toilets so the overall dining experience can improve...

Amazing and value for money korean buffet at around $32 only! The beef short plate and pork belly was extremely nice. Second time back here. Service was really good too. Buffet comes with free flow of side dishes, free flow of steam eggs and also a top up for the cheese option for just $5! Hope prices and standard remains the same! Love this place

Had the buffet for dinner and it was super good! Meats are all thick cuts and super juicy. Marinaded well and not too salty. Staff was very attentive and fast, always helping to change the grill top. Great space and very good ventilation! We look forward to visiting again and trying other food!

Was looking for a Korean barbecue place in Tanjong Pagar and narrowed down on this option out of many others.

Arrived at around 8:30PM on a weekday, only 4-5 tables occupied.

Staff is friendly and warm. We decided to go a-la-Carte and ordered spicy chicken, soya chicken and pork belly for our barbecue. We also ordered a kimchi pancake.

Side dishes include radish, kimchi, garlic, coleslaw, chilli, tofu etc. Kimchi was pretty good.

All items are fresh. Staff helped us in barbecuing the items well. We really liked the spicy chicken, the sauce added a great taste. Meat was soft.

Good place for Korean barbecue cravings.

This is the place if you are a meat person. We went for the buffet which was value for money. Add $5 per pax for weekends and public holiday. Service was attentive and the lady bosses were friendly too. The buffet offers 7 types of meat. We don’t enjoy the Bulgogi. Go for the beef short plate, pork belly and soya chicken galbi instead. We had 3 rounds and were full. After payment, do help yourselves to complimentary Yakult alike probiotic drinks.

The food quality is overall average. Lobster soup is rich in taste but the serving of the lobster is under expectation. In fact most of the dishes portion is relatively small for that price range.

Service experience is also under expectation. We sat at a place with a blind spot and the service staff are not attentive to our request. I have to walk to the counter for help. Suggest to provide some electronic buzzing system if the restaurant has under staff to serve the customer.

Came across this place via Google search.
Suppose to come here for DimSum. But only available in the afternoon.
But we still decided to stay for dinner.

Food is not bad, very well presented. Taste is pretty ok especially the chicken and the laksa prawn.

But when comes to the service by the restaurant staff, I gotta give them a lower rating. It certainly under expectations.

Firstly, they are not welcoming at all when we were at the counter waiting to be seated.

Secondly, the waiter is not attentive. They have no smile at all (which is important in service line).
When we request for tea or request him to add hot water, he just came and grab the teapot and go off with super monotonous attitude. When we say thank you, the staff don't even response at all (basically like a robot).

Therefore, I don't think we will come back again. The food is ok but definitely not the best compare to the same level restaurant elsewhere. Also the service staff and their attitude didn't impress us despite the restaurant is not busy at all (only 3 tables including our table).

Came for lunch, excellent staff service and quality food. Recommend to come 👍🏻

The food and atmosphere was good but one of the staff had a really bad attitude and kept showing us black face. One other staff was very friendly so I'll rate it as 4 stars. Maybe the first staff had a bad day 🤷🏻‍♀️

Cosy environment. Great for family gartherings. Dimsum. Lobster pumpkin soup having 1 for 1 offer. Nice. Recommended.

First time trying. Definitely a good one. Not a spice-tolerant person but the fish and soup were really delicious before the rest of the spice mixed in. Then it was too spicy for me. But the food was really good. The drink portion was really big too for a single person. Atmosphere was good too, but my one complaint is that some of the staff members were behind our table talking loudly and laughing, I think while on their break. It felt a bit intruding for my family dinner but it's a small issue as it was only for a short while.

This place is a great option for enjoying fried fish in town. The initial taste is fantastic, but it can become a bit salty over time.

The prices are on the higher side too.

If you're planning to dine with a group of 8 people, be aware that this outlet doesn't have a dedicated large table. They usually merge two smaller tables, which might still feel quite cramped for a party of that size.

Love the location. The fish we ordered is limbo fish with soy sauce based. The sauce however is too thin for our liking. The cucumber cold fish is good.

Service wise, is good. Friendly staffs. Their drinks are unique.
Maybe will come back again to try out their signature flavoured fish. Nice renovation decor.

Food is nice n not too spicy. Service is great, responsive n patient, drinks were served immediate at request for me n my thirsty peers! Nice touch to have tissue pack given at each table too. A good place to chat and dine! We had a great time!

We dropped by Tanyu@Bugis Junction to celebrate a birthday: our very first visit (even though we are not totally  fish fans).
Seating and interior decor was comfy and functional. Some guests in the packed house were in highly celebratory mood, some rather loquacious and loud. Generally, the ambience was youthful and energetic.
In particular, the attending staff were exemplary in service and interfacing with us: offering helpful and tactful suggestions and ideas (patiently without being presumptuous or pushy) on menu items, side-dishes, satay-style grilled meats, fish options, types of sauces and flavours, accompanying ingredients, preferred spiciness levels etc
We ordered the Sauerkraut Grilled Limbo-fish (a specie of the catfish family), instead of the Seabass or Qingjiang fish (also a cat-fish); together with some side-dishes.
The grilled fish was thoroughly enjoyable: it was rather juicy, tender and delicious (and, of course, totally fresh), although some parts tasted "fishy" and had a few very fine fish bones as well. Caution recommended .
The Jumbo Lemon and Lime (Tower) was memorable for us, as it was truly a big jar, able to quench our thirst adequately!
If you like to eat fish, then obviously, you'd likely enjoy an outing to Tanyu!
