Reviews: 

We book an appointment for 4 adults and 1 child.  When we arrived, we have informed the staff about our reservation, the waitress didn't  brother to listen properly and showed us the way to the normal rectangular table for 4 adults, as the space is rather small, she told us to put the baby pram  outside the restaurant(we have no idea where to put because the entrance is rather small), at this point of time, we have only 3 adults + 1 child, and waiting for the last person to arrive.

Shortly after, when we are still deciding what to eat, the waitress came over to rush us to place order. One of the order, we selected 4x soups that served individually for 1pax, She comment that our 2year old child cannot finish the soup. I told her we have 4 adults, and like to order on behalf of him.

At the same time, we realised that she only gave us 3 sets of cutleries +1set for our kid. While waiting for our order, I was browsing the promotion offer from the acrylic stand on the table, the waitress wearing a blazer passed by told me that the promotion has expired, not sure why it was still displaying on the table though. The way she speak is as if we can't afford to pay for the food. Some of us are wearing work uniform, and the rest is t-shirt and shorts, I'm not sure if this part of discrimination against consumer or not. We've also requested for a baby chair, and she pointed that the chair is over there, we have to take ourselves.

At 7.40pm, she called my sister who is the one who make the booking earlier today, she pick up the call and found out that they reserved round table for us and we were at the wrong table.

Furious of the poor attitude, my sister scolded the person over the phone(which turns out to be the same woman wearing the blazer) and we even made sacarstic remarks such as asking them if they think we cannot afford to dine in there?

After all the commotion, we agreed to switch to the round table, and the baby chair was automatically placed at the round table. Eventhough they did apologize, my sister has repeatedly mentioned that we made a reservation, but not too sure why this kind of mistake are made. This is a well known and established restaurant, this kind of mistake shouldn't be happening.

After all food is served, my niece doesn't like the fried rice, so we order a warm soya bean milk for her. The waiting time is long, we also request for a straw, and we have to ask several times.

Almost every week, I have the habit of visiting restaurant for a treat to myself or gathering during my off day.

This is my first time encountering this kind of rude attitude and it is happening in morden day in Singapore.

To be honest, all these action were uncalled and it ruined the atmosphere of the gathering with my niece.  It is really a horrible experience, this is our first but definitely our last time at the bugis branch.

Came for the Xiao long bao buffet. The staff inside were ok, only the service manager was really really sweet. You have to finish the noodles before you can put in the order for the Xiao long bao. The best part of everything was the cucumber dish. I will go back just for that😍

Ever been to any Crystal Jade Branch in Singapore.
But this one is the one who has the poorest service.
Food is definitely good and delicious.
Even my 2 years old kids love their Lamian and Fried Rice 🥰

Crystal Jade is the place I love to go for their xiao long bao and noodles.

I tried their pancake. It's nice for the crispy texture but a little on the salty side.

The rice in the hotpot is very tasty. I like the texture of the rice, which is like Claypot rice. The peanut is crispy and nice.

The appetiser is a cold dish that is crunchy and quite tasty. Initially, I wanted to do without, but after the promotion by the lady saying it's what Emperor eats in the past, I decided to give it a try, and it's not bad.

I enjoyed their pomelo tea. It's sweet and just nice for me.

The seats are spacious and comfortable. It's also not very crowded in this outlet.

Staff responds pretty fast to my request.

Latest review:
I come back 3 times and had the pork soup dumplings and they were good. For some reason the 1st was maybe an outlier that day? Also good was the green beans, vegetable dumplings and hot & sour soup. I’ve changed my previous rating from a 3 to a 4 star. However, I would skip the crab dumpling which lacked flavor.

Older Review:
I was disappointed with this place. I've had many soup dumplings before and was looking forward to this Michelin Star reputation. So when I bit into these dumplings only to taste mildly flavored soup, I thought "what was the point"? By itself, it doesn't stand out. With the black vinegar and ginger sauce provided it loses out its flavors. The same could be said for the Fish Maw soup. It is so mild that you wonder why such a long title was used? You can't taste the ham, dried scallop, winter melon or really anything else in this soup. The only thing that wasn't disappointing was the chili dumplings. Overall, an average meal with above average prices.


Option: 4:

Reviews: 

This noodle restaurant, a longstanding presence in Bugis Junction, signifies its enduring commitment to quality. The "cross bridge mi xian" stands out, offering a delightful mix of ingredients. What sets it apart is the choice: you can either assemble the components in the hot soup yourself or have the kitchen take care of it. This interactive element enhances the overall dining experience, making it a notable option for those exploring the diverse culinary scene at Bugis Junction.

Came here for a sat lunch and the shop was less than half full. Ordered the signature hong guo which can either come  all in one bowl or with the ingredients individually plated. Honestly, it doesnt really make any difference cos u will need to dump everything in. But if u are here for the social media post, go ahead to order it seperately.

Taste wise, the soup was quite salty for me which is probably becos of the shrimp paste (?). I actually prefered the fried rice more which had the wok hey. The cutlet was ok too.

It will be a nice place for a casual lunch and i honestly may come back again.

"I have been dining here since 2008 and it has remained one of my favorite places to eat. The Vermicelli Noodles are consistently outstanding, boasting an amazingly soft texture. The ribs were also quite tasty. In the past, they used to accommodate extra noodle requests, but unfortunately, that service is no longer available. However, I'm delighted to see that they have expanded their menu with the addition of many other delectable dishes."

I have the 9 dish cross bridge vermicelli set . It’s a very big bowl of soup, the ingredients are in very small plates.
The soup is so much that can’t finished.
Overall a good experience and the staff are very friendly.

Love their cross bridge vermicelli. The price is very reasonable. And I usually just order their vermicelli but not other dishes. So I can’t say much about the taste. But if you like vermicelli, you should not miss Hongguo! I think the restaurant has been here for more than a decade! I remember I first visited it many many years ago…


Option: 5:

Reviews: 

The quality of ingredients is high. The beef broth mala soup is quite tasty and the medium spice is not overly spicy. Be sure to ask for extra soup. The dry mala is terrible and flavorless.

Plenty of meats and vegetables selections.
Beef meat is thin slices but a little over cooked. No other marination.
The dory fish slice is big but it has a little fishy taste.
Vegetables and mushrooms are good.
The best is all of them are fresh. However, their kitchen will not cut the items into smaller pieces. Some of them can be difficult to chew.
The soup booth is good, drinkable but gets thirsty afterwards.
The store is bright and air-conditioned.

Located just infront of Bugis+. This is one of place for you who looking to eat spicy mala. Price by weight regardless meat or vegetable. Recommend not to take so many, as the price could be expensive. Option tomato soup available for those who dont eat spicy. Normal service by staff. Self service Sauce available at sauce corner. Paynow accepted. Disposable apron also available if you are required. Food was not bad. Sometimes could be long queue during peak hour.

Tried the bone mala broth. The food quality is good and the soup is very thick and full of flavor. It is not susprising that they are the biggest chain in the world. To me, it is on par with Zhang Liang, which is another famous chain.

Special mention: the meat balls are very good and juicy!

$15 for a 400g+ of food. Meat and veg are all the same price.

No service charge 👍🏻. Pick your own food, go to the counter and do your payment, collect your food at the counter.

Ordered a big mala and a medium mala, taste pretty much the same. Only that one has slightly more oil.

Tasty mala soup which I would rate a 7/10. Food however isn’t the best quality. Luncheon meat taste disgusting. Other process food is tasteless. Don’t mind coming back, if there’s no q.

Reviews: 

Tasty noodles in a popular restaurant. A bit noisy and slightly unconformable furnishing, but that's pretty much part of the charm. Tried Signature Noodles and Barley Drink, both a good starting point

QQ Noodle House is a decent spot for a quick and affordable meal in the area. The standout feature of this place is their springy and tasty noodles, which come with a range of sauce and noodle options to choose from. However, the portion size is quite small, which might not be enough for some customers.

Unfortunately, the quality of the food has dropped compared to previous years. I tried the dry noodle recently, and it was disappointingly dry, with too little sauce to coat all the layers of noodles. The crispy wanton was still decent, though.

Aside from the noodles, they also have side dishes available. However, the dining experience is let down by the dirty and greasy tables, and the utensil tray that was not clean. The restaurant itself is a bit run down, with peeling table tops (as seen in the provided photo).

During my visit, I was also given a corner table that was placed too closely together with another table, making it hard to exit. Luckily, I was skinny enough to squeeze through the gaps, but others may find it uncomfortable.

Overall a good option for those looking for a quick and affordable comfort meal, but the drop in food quality and unclean dining environment can be a bit of a letdown.

Food was easy to order via the clear QR code on the table or via the menu. The package sets made it fuss free especially for people who are spoilt with choices. I ordered the Kolo mee, the portion was not a lot for a guy but the chosen side crabmeat soup made up for it.
Some of the service staff seem to have quite a strong accent that the mandarin might be difficult for some Singaporeans to understand.
Store set up was neat, tidy, and clean. Gave a simple and minimalist feel of dropping by for a non-extended meal, consume it, and leave.

wanton mee noodle texture is not as q as I've expected, glass noodle has wok smell and tasty but expensive($8), bkt has strong herb taste but the meat is very tough.

Had my dinner here during a Saturday evening. As a Sarawakian, I don't feel the signature noodles is authentic enough. The look is similar but the taste is not up to level. The ingredients inside the dish is also modified to adapt to local Singaporean style I guess. Anyway, worth a try if you really crave for kampua, not much choice in Singapore at this moment.

Overall I think the food still consider nice there as there is quite some crowd in the shop during meal hour.

Reviews: 

Ya agree with Justin Chong, the chicken pot is j okay, we ordered the mala one, it tastes wuite like mala but tbh its a little too jelat after awhile

To be fair we did a takeaway so maybe its not so great? But if you are looking for like a decent mala pot then i think this is an okay one in the area

I’m not a fan of 猪肚汤, this is however a pleasant visit. Soup is nice. Those who like pig parts can visit here.

辣子鸡 so so only. Meat is tough and not spicy.

Best dish for me is the fried yam which is crispy and addictive.

Had the claypot rice, which i supposed they are not that famous for, and it was slightly disappointing. Amount of chicken is generous enough i supposed but overall taste is fairly below average.
Perhaps try their hotpot instead :)

Staff is really friendly and helpful!
I enjoyed their 辣子鸡 and the “3 eggs veg”.
The 鸡公煲 is alright and I’ll probably skip it the next time I go back :)
Definitely a place to come back and try other options! :))

I dropped by here for a quick lunch as I had always wanted to explore the myriad of Mainland Chinese cuisine available on this street.

I ordered a deluxe pork trotter rice and a pork belly with garlic. Total was $21.

I did not enjoy the pork belly with garlic unfortunately. The sauce was quite different from what I’m used to tasting- it was watery, and tasted too garlicky without being garlicky (in the right way). I had way tastier renditions of this dish, and I found the portion quite stingy.

The pork trotter rice was nicer in comparison. It was filling and I liked the various cuts of pork layered on top of the rice.

The service was good, although I do recommend the shop change the layouts of the tables as two tables located at the front of the shopfront is directly underneath the air curtain. I run warm so I like air con, but even then, it was a bit too much wind blowing down on me and made me feel uncomfortable.

Reviews: 

First time here and came without making a reservation on a Saturday evening about  8pm.  The restaurant was full but fortunately we waited for only around 10 minutes.   Was quote sceptical because I saw many foreigners and thought this could be tourist trap.  I was wrong,  the claypot pig liver is super delicious and the braise fish head is so flavourful.  This is indeed a very good Cantonese restaurant.

If you’re looking for Chinese restaurant with amazing food and friendly service, look no further than this hidden gem. I recently had the pleasure of dining at this spot and was blown away by the quality of their dishes.
The beef meat teow with wok hey was outstanding. Beef was so tender and portion size was generous, even for the smallest option on the menu.
Next up was the roasted duck, which was an absolute standout. The skin was perfectly crispy and meat was tender and flavorful.
Finally, I have to mention the cereal prawn ball, no hassle at all in removing the shell and  flavorful prawns.
Restaurant was the friendly and welcoming atmosphere.
If you’re in the mood for some truly Chinese cuisine, look no further than this spot.

Came here because of the online reviews and  partly we were nearby. The foods are hit and miss. Can order the fried beef kway teow, vegetable and home-made tofu. Will not recommend the Indonesia curry chicken and the roast duck, roast pork and char siew combo.

Food is served quick and they are delicious! Place can be loud sometimes due to the occasional loud talking and laughing by other customers but I would definitely recommend coming here for the food.

Whilst visiting Singapore, my friend took me to lunch at his favourite cantonese restaurant. I can understand why - friendly, warm service and absolutely delicious food served with a smile. The fried rice, sweet and sour pork and special tofu were particularly  notable - all of the plates went back to the kitchen absolutely clean

Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

First time trying Chong Qing and it didn’t disappoint. Fish was grilled quite nicely, texture was smooth and easy to eat without much bones. 中辣 was quite spicy, so please be warned if you can’t take 🌶️. If you’re feeling famished, go for the buffet option as you get free flow of side dishes such as fried mantou, pork belly, chicken, chilli oil wantons and much more.

Definitely one of my favourite restaurant go for dinner/ supper with my friends, the staff there are amazing, friendly and flexible for any adhoc request from us. We always order the patin grilled fish as the portion and taste is super yummy 😋 !
Recommended to anyone who no idea where to go for supper, here is the place!

They actually grill the fish here, not those kind that fry the fish.

Choose the barramundi and it was a nice size and seemed fresh.

Ordered 中辣/medium spiciness and is tolerable.

Can select the other ingredients to accompany your fish.

Also ordered the 口水鸡/mouth watering chicken which was good.
Good valance of vinegar and spice.

Good service from staff and there's enough space between tables so it didn't feel cramped.

Felt like it was a bit pricey, but my Chinese friends tell me it's worth the price.

Very nice grilled fish but was super disappointed and disgusted by the lotus root that we paid 4.80 for. Enquired the waiter and he said it was oxidised. The look of it make our appetite die down. We also ordered their paradise iced fruit tea and it tasted very bland, 0% sweetness so we requested for sugar syrup. To our disappointment, they said they do not have sugar syrup. Also disappointed by the service, it was hard to ask for the waiter to refill the soup / serve us the food as there was only 2 staffs serving the upper floor.

Trying out the grilled fish that I heard so much and see publicity. Ordered a steamed fish,  mala chicken.  Not bad.  Find the fish base soup a bit salty.

Reviews: 

Enjoyed the food here tonight. It was very busy and while service was a tad slow, we recognise that the staff were doing their best. All the tasty food was definitely worth the wait! Will be back to try more food in future! Was very impressed with all the dishes especially the cabbage and the lamb! They are must-try dishes! I really loved the dessert too!

3 of us went there during lunch time and we ordered 3 dishes to share. The fried tofu is crispy on the outside, soft on the inside = taste score 3.8/5. The eggplants are soft and the sauce is flavorful, makes an excellent dish to just eat with rice = taste score 4.2/5. The abalone mushroom chicken soup is not oily, there are 4 pcs of abalone that is thumb size big but it was very tough to chew, taste like a simple mushroom + chix soup = taste score 3.5/5. Overall experience 4/5.

I had a great experience at this restaurant, the food was delicious l, and the seasoning was perfect. I especially appreciated that the dishes were not too spicy.

The restaurant is very popular, especially on the weekends, it can be difficult to get a table without a reservation, and the wait can up to 30 mins.

However, if you are willing to eat outside, you may be able to get a seat sooner.

Also, the restaurant is a lively place, with lots of noise.

My favorites🌟🌟🌟
Dry-fried pork intestines
Dried tofu slices with preserved pork

Super eating this place. Similar to the Mosque Street outlet, the service is great, and the food is consistently amazing. Would be back to try the other dishes. Many tables ordered soups and we will do that in our next visit :) *Must try the lamb* featured in the photos below. DELICIOUS.

Enjoy aromatic and spicy Hunan dishes here! They have a wide variety of dishes and portions are not small, so best to come with family and friends to share the food!

Particularly enjoyed the Braised Pork with Fried Tofu, Braised Dried Beancurd Sticks with Egg, Hunan Style Fried Pork, Spicy Chicken, Spicy Bullfrog Pot, Stir-fried Cauliflower. Order Glutinous Rice Cake with Brown Sugar at the end of the meal for a sweet ending!

📣Check out my IG @samlivestoeat for more foodie reviews! 🥰

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

Superb French dining experience at a reasonable price. We went for the 3-course set lunch and were satisfied with the quality of ingredients used, great cooking, and exceptional service provided by Rimo, Charlene, and team. Recommended dishes: Escargots in garlic butter, Lamb chops, Pear Melba.

We celebrated a birthday here and were delighted with the extra mile taken with the presentation of the desserts. Thanks to this meal, we’ve found another authentic French steakhouse!

I recently dined at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche," and it was an exquisite culinary experience. The highlight of the evening was their selection of red wine, which beautifully complemented the succulent steak.

To start, we savored the pan-seared duck liver, a dish that showcased exceptional freshness and a rich, melt-in-your-mouth texture. It was truly unforgettable.

We also indulged in a delightful off-menu item, the heated Camembert cheese, which emanated a delightful flavor due to its oven preparation. The combination of the gooey cheese and its subtle yet profound taste was a gastronomic delight.

The main course featured the Black Angus prime rib, which impressed with its perfectly balanced seasoning that enhanced the natural flavor of the beef. It was a prime example of culinary expertise.

To conclude this magnificent meal, we had the crème brûlée, a dessert that was both light and zesty, providing the perfect sweet note to end our dining experience.

The ambiance and service at "Les Bouchons Rive Gauche" further added to the overall charm of the restaurant. If you're looking for an exceptional dining experience with an emphasis on quality, this is the place to be. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary journey.

we did encounter a situation at our table. However, it’s important to note that this issue was not related to how the restaurant was run; it was more of an outside factor. Despite this unexpected situation, the restaurant’s staff handled it promptly and professionally, ensuring that it did not affect the overall dining experience. Their commitment to customer satisfaction and their adeptness in addressing unforeseen challenges further demonstrated the restaurant’s dedication to providing a top-notch dining experience.

Best steak we had as a family! Super value for money. So tender and juicy. Super good appetisers. Fantastic service!

Good food, good service and good vibe. The lamb chop was nicely cooked and reminded us of what we had in France. Waitress was of good service. She made sure we were well taken care of.

I had my birthday lunch here and the food was tres délicieux! Special mention for the pan seared foie gras and the ribeye steak. Such depth of flavour at a great value, do check out their lunch set promo if you're coming by in the day.

Big thank you to Rimo, Charlene and Jan for the impeccable service and attention to detail :)

Reviews: 

Excellent services with quality food and fantastic atmosphere. The restaurant only has limited table, definitely need reservations to come here. The place focuses more on a wide range of quality vegetables across the world. Very unique presentation of the dishes! My partner was having the vegetarian option and it was as good as the non vegetarian options. The chef even packed us his hometown cake to bring home for tasting.
A little high on the cost, but worth the experience!

One of the most breathtaking food experience I had the chance to enjoy.

Amazing culinary journey. The contemporary symphony of aromas and textures through a vegetarian focus was fresh, exciting and new. Every dish is meticulously crafted to bring a delightful balance of flavors. The wine pairing was on point. Compliments job to the chef.

Excellent service. Attentiveness and professionalism exceeded our expectations.

The atmosphere was warm, friendly and cosy. We felt welcomed and in optimal conditions to savor our dinner.

We recommend this restaurant to anyone passionate about food.

Beautiful vegetarian cuisine, beautiful ambience, beautiful service and staff. Just take that leap for tastebud and exquisite ingredients discovery. Presentation of the food, attention to your dining experience made it such a pleasant experience. Do come by each season for different culinary exposure.

Chef Jeremy and the team did a fantastic job championing seasonal vegetables. The wine paring was beautifully done for each course to highlight the taste of the food with a great balance.

The ambience of the restaurant was intimate and lovely but the light was slightly dark. It was a birthday celebration and we had a great time throughout the night.

The menu was exceptional, a great variation of vegetables and herbs tastefully balanced and beautifully presented. The choice of courses was perfectly matched. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The chef introduced himself to all the guests and was very accommodating. We really enjoyed our dinner at JAG, a highlight in Singapore.
Mediterranean restaurants in East Coast:

Name: Pete’s Mediterranean Grill
Address: 125 E Coast Rd, Singapore 428810

Reviews: 

Can't go wrong with Petes's for kebabs. Been coming here for years and the quality is always top notch.

Highly recommend the lamb kebabs - they are probably my favourite across Singapore.

Ordered Chicken with Hummus and find it nice 👍Serving was small so ordered another with fries. Chicken was well cooked and flavourful.
Pricing above average.

The food was great. Meat was fresh and tasty. The spicy sauce is fantastic :)

Great taste and good try for our 1st time on Mediterranean grills foods! This are today special dishes!

Seats are shared with a few other stalls within this eatery. You order from the shop you want to eat from.
Falafel were large, crispy, fluffy and delicious. The hummus texture was just right - not an amorphous baby food mush, not too chunky, and very tasty. Lamb kofta was on the salty side for me, but tasty nonetheless and of a good meaty texture. Thoroughly enjoyed both versions of chili blend - the green one and the red one. Warning for regular people: the red one is very spicy. Pita bread was on the flat side, a bit taco-like.
The owner is friendly and approachable.
Will definitely be back!

Reviews: 

I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

First time at this restaurant, and I can say the dining experience was great.

Food is great and the serving is not bad as well.  I can only say good things about the service of the Staffs.
The place is easy to find and the ambience is something to remember.

Visited for the first time after hearing good reviews from friends. Awesome ambience and child-friendly. Helpful staff who helped us with food orders and wine recommendation. Dips were great, octopus tender and flavourful. Desserts were also delightful. The standout dish was the lamb chops!

Had dinner some time last week and the food was pretty good but it was quite pricey. The waiter asked if we would like sparkling or still water and we thought still meant free tap water, but it turned out to be $10 bottled water. Don’t make the same mistake as we did if you don’t want to splurge on water!

Unfortunately, we found a piece of stainless steel dish sponge in our food which is quite unhygienic and dangerous. The staff were kind enough to take it off our bill but this was a very eventful first experience dining here.

Went to celebrate birthday with a few friends. The food and service were good. Only disappointment is that when we were leaving the place, the wine was actually not finished.  The staff could do better to confirm if we still want it before throwing the bottle away.

I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant today, and it was a fantastic experience. We had been here a few years ago and were still in love with their delicious dips. This time, we ordered two servings of pita, which filled us up completely! We just couldn't resist that warm, fluffy pita bread 🫓. After reading some reviews that praised the lamb shank, we took Uncle Bob's recommendation and were not disappointed. The staff was incredibly pleasant, and I want to give a big shoutout to Uncle Bob, Manager Jennifer, and Jay for making our celebration even more special. We'll definitely be coming back! 🎉🍽️😊

The food was fantastic. My favourite dish would be the lamb chops - I've never eaten lamb like this before. It was without the muskiness you typically get from lamb, but it was a clear, smooth lamb flavour.

We had the dessert platter and I'd say the 'spring roll' is the best. the sweet custard with the thin layer pastry exterior makes it the perfect last bite for the meal.

Service was excellent. Special shoutout to Hakim who was very attentive and knowledgeable.

Thoroughly enjoyed my experience here!

The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)

Reviews: 

Third time back at this restaurant and certainly will be back for more. Authentic Turkish cuisine and we especially love the creamy hummus, chickpea stew and delightful kunefe. Great service as well. Will recommend to visit in a group to try a variety of sides and mains!

Everything is delicious here! Staffs are friendly, the Kunefe is one of the best, and the Karavan kebabs, both beef and lamb, are amazing! 😅 The hot pita bread is also great. In the last 4-5 months, we've visited this place many times, and our friends love it too. Whenever we want to enjoy a meal without worrying about quality and taste, we head straight to this restaurant. 😋 You won't regret giving it a try!

Hummus! Good! The lunch set is value for money - comes with a main + drink + soup + bread + dessert all for $20!
The pita bread is baked to perfection and the submarine bread looks so amazing! However the price for the submarine bread is a little high. Will probably not order this again the next time.
The soup of the day was lentil soup (vegetable soup) its really rich and herby. Very different from what i usually have.
The chicken dish is the highlight of the meal. The chicken meat is sooooo soft and tender. The seasoning is on point. Goes really well with the breads. The rice that comes with the dish is really fragrant as well.
Lots of vegetarian options.
Overall a positive experience and will recommend 👍🏻

Total bill is about $85++

Ordered quite abit for 2 person.  Love the cauliflower salad. Hummus, eggplant dips. As we were celebrating our birthday, the restaurant gave us complimentary tea and a kind of Turkish delight. The staff were attentive and friendly. Will definitely go back for the cauliflower salad and hummus.

This was my second visit today and my colleagues and I absolutely loved the food! I am usually not a fan of Turkish or Mediterranean food but this place is an exception. After trying the food a few months ago for the first time, I have been wanting to visit them again.

Every dish was delicious and tasted fresh and   wholesome. The Mezeplate is a good option if you are not sure what to order as it has a bit of everything and you can to try the different dips and appetisers. I enjoyed the hummus, cauliflower salad and eggplant dip very much. Their lentil soup was very good too - comforting and tasty.

For the mains, we tried two of their lunch set meals -  two rice dishes with the different chicken kebabs which were served with tea, soup and a rice pudding dessert. We also ordered their salmon which was so tender and flavourful. Several colleagues commented that it was the best salmon they had ever tasted!

The highlight of the meal was their dessert - Kunefe which was absolutely delicious! The taste and texture was so complex and had so much depth! The crispy stringy pastry with the creamy sauce, nuts and ice cream was indeed like what the menu described it to be - “a slice of heaven”!

This is seriously an underrated restaurant which serves amazing food and I would highly recommend it :)

Reviews: 

I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Very delicious food with reasonable price.
My friend from Turkey said this is the only place with authentic Turkish food. My mom who is super picky about food said their food is good. Their dessert Kunefe is both crispy and creamy.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgeable. Will visit again.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

Reviews: 

We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Enjoyed a lovely evening with family and doggie. Food is nice and the 1 for 1 drinks promo is good too.
Loved the dips platter and mixed grill with different meats
The pita bread is nice and soft and goes well with the hummus.
Great thing is that we can have our dog to eat with us....ha,ha, perhaps more like watch us eat. 😆
Staff is friendly and helpful. TV showing  EPL games too.

I tried the Greek Kebab (Grilled Chicken with Avocado)-Very filling. Only comment is the sauce..only tasted most of it towards the end, not evenly distributed but the chicken had a generous chunky serving. Overall, it was delicious and fresh plus it was nicely sealed that there's no veggie peeping on the paper or any sign of a soggy end of the wrap once I got home. Well done and hope more will get to try it too :)

I love the crispy fluffy falafel and chicken shish wrap here. Selvam was awesome at customizing the wraps and making good chat. Super nice and quick dinner!

Good muslim food available. The person who serve Mr. Hanif

Food taste is secondary, the senior guy at shop is super frustrated and mean with possibly new colleague. Almost as if he will start throwing away things, shouting and all infront of customers.

And obv in this environment the new guy served us wrong order, and seems bit untrained and unaware of what he’s making.

Overall, never visiting again because of atmosphere and food both.

I recently enjoyed a hummus pita and falafel wrap at Pita Tree, and it was a taste sensation! The hummus was rich and velvety, spreading its creamy goodness over warm pita bread that was the perfect blend of soft and slightly crispy. The falafel in the wrap was a crispy, flavorful delight  a delightful contrast to the smooth hummus. The combination of these two in a single bite was heavenly. Pita Tree truly excels at crafting Mediterranean classics with fresh, quality ingredients. This dish left me craving for more, and I can't wait to return for another flavorful experience. A must-visit for hummus and falafel lovers! Somemore Thank you so much Mr Hanif for your suggestion…

Reviews: 

This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.


Option: 10:
Name: Pita & Olives
Address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #B1, K109 Great World, 237994
Phone: 9011 2312

Dine-In Available: Yes

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

Had a take away as there were only a few small tables stuck between food counters so not particularly inviting. Ordered pitta and baba ganush. It tasted good but whether it was made fresh that morning I can’t be sure cause it looked like they were taking precooked pitta out that had been in the fridge although there were fresh dough balls on the counter.

The best Hummus and Falafel I have tasted thus far!
The Hummus is creamy and smooth with generous amount of Tahini and nice Olive oil while the Falafel is filled with Herbs at the right point.
Even though I had it take-away for supper, the food was still delicious.
I had Pita and Olive since 100AM days (more than 10years ago) and the Hummus never fails!
Although there was once when I did a take-away during lock-down, the Shawarma was a little over-cooked which the hit and miss is common with the manpower shortage seen at f&b.
But happy to have the nicely done Shawarma back again this time!
The price is reasonable with the quality provided compared to restaurant prices, not forgetting that the current rental must be way more exp than 100AM days although it is only a kiosk space.
A satisfied and happy customer😋

The Falafel with Hummus and Pita set was $16, although I agree with many users here suggesting that the portion is small, I do think that with the quality of the food, it might not be sustainable to up the portion without a significant price increase.

The falafel were nicely warmed, soft and flaky, great if you're having a scratchy throat and avoiding the deep fried variety. It was nicely seasoned and the warming spices hit just the right spot. I love the olive-tomato-salad thing and wish the portion was bigger but I guess with rising food costs, I find the portion reasonable.

The hummus was really smooth and lemon notes really help to cut through the spices from the falafel. Pita bread had a nice yeasty aroma and was soft and easy to stuff.

My only complaint was that it was really hard to cut and portion the pita bread with plastic cutleries and plates. It kept running about. The place is also quite squeezy and warm.

I'm a big fan of the Pita Pockets as the ingredients are always tasty and plentiful. I'll often take a tub of fresh Hommous home as well. If you are in the Great World area call in and try this great family business.

We were greeted by a Shalom!!!

The recommendations were awesome.
The beef was flavourful and delish. The bread was warm and safe and went well with the hummus.

I would definitely come again.

P.S forgot to take pictures at the beginning.
Vietnamese food in Joo Chiat:

Price Level: 1 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.1
Reviews: 

Looking for a truly authentic Vietnamese experience on our sunny island? Long Phung offers a spread of delicious Vietnamese dishes at prices that won't break the bank.

Every dish is packed full of flavour. You'll be left craving for more. And as you're dining, let your cup of Vietnamese coffee slowly drip, and you can enjoy the robust beverage as a perfect finisher to your meal.

Seating space is adequate, but do arrive early if you're looking to dine as the spaces fill up quite fast, especially on weekends.

We were out in the east and decided to try this place because there were a lot of good reviews. Seems like a pretty traditional Vietnamese menu. Food was good and you can tell it wasn’t seasoned for foreigners…it had very sublet but well balanced flavors. We loved all the sauces and the balance of crunch & soft textures. Our favorite was the fried spring rolls the flaky crust was so good it was addictive. The smoothies left a lot to be desired, they seem to be very skimpy on the fruit. Otherwise I love it that the food is also very light so you don’t feel so stuffed at the end. We didn’t get any noodle soup, maybe next time, but most people seem to have some sort of soup. We would definitely go back. The downside is the location (if you aren’t close) but the price, value and quality are all top notch.

Most of their dishes come with sweet sauce which  I like. Beef was okie, not very tender but their spring roll was good. Their crepe was special, inside got prawn and pork belly. I think they add coconut to the crepe

Paid 23.22 for the meal. Food was decent, served very quickly.

All seems fresh. My spring rolls may have been sitting a while as all 4 pieces were stocked together. Tough texture for the skin. Ingredients were fine.

Overall more of a good vibe. Maybe skip the ones I have ordered and get a pho or fish. Didn't satisfy my cravings.

Authentic Vietnamese food. Speedy service. Love the jellyfish salad, grilled squid, and beef stew. Banh Mi bread is exactly the same as those found in Vietnam. Returned twice in less than a week. Highly recommended!

Vietnamese coffee is a bit sweet for me but after adding hot water; it is ok. Food wise; not too bad but nothing out of the ordinary. Charges 50 cents for half a glass of warm water and waited quite long for it. Smiling face was greeted with frowning faces. Is this place so popular that customers are 2nd class?

Pretty good pho. Thought the broth to be a touch too sweet though (maybe too much rock sugar for my taste). Herbs were generous and fragrant. Meat was tasty. Wish there were more noodles and a larger portion for the price but still worth coming to get.

Really enjoyed my bowl of Pho, I had the $9 one with Beef Slices and Beef Balls! 👍🏻 Broth was very fragrant and the meat was tender as well. Had some roasted chicken for side dish and they were tender too, even though it does look quite dry. Trust me! It’s not! 😃

I am a regular here. Convenient place in Zhao Chiat for a good value quick Vietnamese food fix. Recommend their pho, congee, fried squid

Small Vietnamese restaurant with authentic menu. First time here and happy with the food, generous portion w reasonable price. Will come back again ❤️

Decent Vietnamese restaurant that provides authentic food. We would recommend their chicken wings and grilled pork rice. Service is also quite pleasing.

A fellow foodie introduced me to this Vietnamese restaurant. We tried two type of beef noodle. The classic  beef noodle soup was good in that the broth was tasty. The other special beef noodle was more interesting in that the broth resembled that of Singapore prawn noodle.
Our favorite dish was the pancake where the meat and crepe is wrapped with lettuce and dipped in a sauce. Somehow the combination turned out to be nice.
We also ordered fried chicken wings, spring roll (fresh and fried skin) and chendol.
On the whole, the food is authentic and good. Service was also very good.

Another family favourite joint as we live nearby. Food is always consistently good 👍.

The banh mi is actually a "new" edition to the menu and the one to try is the Traditional. Plain baguette goes v well with chicken curry which is super yummy!

The Banh Cuon (Vietnamese version of chee chiong fun) although pricey (in SG) is worth ordering bcoz you won't be able to find it anywhere else. Freshly done, it is chockfulof crunchy bean sprouts, Thai basil and complemented with slices of Vietnamese ham.

The beef and chicken soup noodles are also to-die-for...try and you won't regret it. Same with the grilled pork chip rice!

Very nice little Vietnamese restaurant. Has a huge menu. We ordered 6 different dishes. All came relatively fast and super fresh. All the staff are Vietnamese and the place had a very authentic vibe.

Nice Vietnamese restaurant tucked between old shop houses. The staff were friendly and helped us with our food and ordering. The seafood noodle came with 2 huge prawns. Very flavorful soup. The duck salad was well marinated …. Leaves you wonder how they make their sauces taste so good. Overall excellent place for dinner with family.

They serve good Banh Mi, very authentic. The baguette was so crispy and soft not hard. I tried the Traditional and BBQ Beef, portion was very reasonable. As for the service, it was good 👍. Very friendly staff. Environment was also cozy. Will come back again.

Really really good banh mi! Our fav is the the chicken - though the others were good too! Affordable and quick to prepare. They have good coffee too!

Grilled pork banh mi was delicious, i enjoyed the pickled vegetables and kick from the chili padi too. Their bread is really light with a thin/crispy crust. Affordable and good place to get your banh mi fix! But i would prefer if the bread was more fragrant.

Great Banh Mi for a reasonable price! crispy bread. Best vietnam drip coffee I've ever had. they also have great service, the ladies were very nice. the uncle is also very kind.

The Best Banh Mi in Singapore, period. (I was born in Saigon) — go for Banh Mi, Siew Mai in a bowl, Goi Cuon (Summer Roll), Bun Thit Nuong.

The food is savoury and tastes better than I had expected! Grilled pork and chicken meats were fragrant and tender...and very flavourful. Service staff are friendly and doing their best despite the manpower shortage. Expect mid-scale cafe price, but the excellent taste of the food is worth it. Portion size is decent too.

We came on a Saturday afternoon. Love the atmosphere and ambience. A good place to chit chat. Ordered the beef sticks, chicken pho soup, dried pork vemicelli and prawn spring rolls. Can say their vietnamese food is good. Will come again.

Food portion is big for the grill pork noodles that I ordered. The Beef stew is tasty and goes well with the baguette but if less salty will be even better. Staff is very polite

We ordered the beef banh mi , crab-pork brain soup and Vietnamese spring roll. We particularly liked the spring roll and the coffee. The soup was a little too thick for our liking but the brain had a clean taste. Overall a nice place a quick Vietnamese meal and coffee.

Cosy and clean. Very friendly service crew. Ordered spicy hue noodle soup, dried grilled pork noodle & beef wrapped in betel leaves. The food tasted pretty good ! Portions are generous as well.

For the pho, the sliced meat was not the juiciest but the flavour was intense. Sliced meat ball were the highlight. Soup was on the sweet side but swirl it with the chilli and you will be happy.

First time having a egg coffee. If you like intense coffee with creamy egg, then give it a try.

Cool ambience & chill vibe beer hangout place in joo chiat neighbourhood. Good value beer $6.90

Legit Viet food at a good price. Coming back for sure!

Friendly and fast service! Good egg coffee, cha gio, grilled octopus skewers. Will come back to try hotpot and others!

Randomly dropped by to try due to reviews. Was surprised to find that they are fully vegetarian. Still didn't disappkint tho. Even my meat loving husband enjoyed his vegan meat burger here.

Ordered their standard chicken bahnmi which was great! The bread was nicely toasted, crunchy yet still soft and nicely balanced with the vegetables.

Their spring rolls are also really good!!

Definitely recommend this place.

atmosphere was rather quiet when we were there which is nice weekends tend to be slightly busier.

Food is really good though, both the beef and pork options are well marinated. we got the bun cha (well sorta bun cha) which came with spring rolls. the rolls appear to be yam based they were crispy and well done.

serving portions were of good size and would certainly come back again to try other options.

Been loving their food since before they changed to become a vegetarian restaurant, the quality has stayed the same since their switch. Bread is still so fresh and has a great crunch while being chewy, perfect banh mi bread.

Rating the food purely based on the mushroom and tofu vegetarian pho. It's really average and not the most bang for buck at $12 (+$2 for egg) but I went for it as I was craving something soupy. Nevertheless, I'd still be back to have my fill of vegetables and to try other stuff!

Ambience wise, this place is on its way to becoming thich nhat hanh's monastery food hall. The Buddhist mantra playing in the background creates an air of reverence; evoking a sense of decorum. I'd imagine that any noise made in this eatery feels disrespectful.

It'd be nice if the space was kept secular and casual so people can just have a hearty meal with friends. Cheers!

Sandwich Saigon used to serve meat but has recently become fully vegetarian in Feb 2023! Almost everything can be made allium-free, as alliums are usually only added at the end of the dish preparation. Apart from the cheese sandwich, all dishes are vegan by default unless you add-on eggs or cheese. There are more whole-food dishes featuring mushroom and tofu, as well as plant-based alternatives such as 'chicken', 'luncheon meat', 'tuna', etc. Some drinks contain dairy and/or honey, but they also have an oat milk option.

Do note that there is Buddhist chanting/music playing softly in the background at the shop. Apart from this shop at East Coast Road, they also have a cloud kitchen concept at Bistro Bytes within i12k Katong shopping mall a few minutes' walk away.

Rating: 4.8
Reviews: 

Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Tasteless shawarma with bland mayo and sweet and sour tasting sauce. It’s like the chef never even heard of the dish let alone know how to make it. I was hungry but even like this I chose to wait for takeaway and threw this away after two bites. For 12$ this was an all round bad experience.

Awful falafel wrap, honestly one of the worst I’ve ever eaten. Covered in horrible sauce, presumably to disguise the dry, packet falafels. Couldn’t finish it

Grilled beef skewers are quite tasty and tender
Highly recommended 👍

Reviews: 

Even though the restaurant is in quite a touristy location, the food is actually pretty good. One of the more popular restaurant along the pathway. Staff are friendly and helpful. Lovely place to be to watch people walk by while enjoying dinner. Parking is limited in the area though.

Food is really great. Had a very nice dinner with family. The street sets the mood for good food.  Food felt authentic and very tasty. We had chicken Mandi, mixed grill and "pizza".

Place also has some good baklava.

Parking lot picture below.

While initially heading for a different restaurant, at which we were repelled by the pushy staff / promoters, we headed down Arab Street to look for an alternative. Most of the other restaurants also had promoters out which tried to lure us in. The guys at Tabbouleh just let us check the menu first and then we asked for a table. Service generally was ok, we waited a bit to actually order, food did not take a very long time though. The atmosphere actually was quite nice, views on the mosque, night time street impressions with a table outside. The food was delicious, I normally don't like Hummus a lot, but here I liked it. It was well presented as well. In the end I got the feeling that despite the 10% service charge it was expected that we give additional tip, which was a bit strange hence the 3/5 for the service. We did like the tea at the very end which rounded up an otherwise nice dinner experience. Thank you very much.

We choose the restaurant because of its good reviews and as the staff was not at all intrusive as most of the other places in the area.
We shared a mixed appetizers plate, which was alright. Overall good, but also no particular highlights.
The iced lemon tea was perfect after an exhausting day.
A plus was the free mint tea at the end, which we really appreciated.
The service could be more attentive, while the food was out quite fast. All in all a rather average experience.

Cozy al fresco location with a view of the mosque, serving great Lebanese food. While the kabab meats and lamb mandi could have a bit more salt, the rice was superb. Chicken however was overcooked and became too dry and hard. They also serve great baklava for desert or take-away. We were served also complimentary mint tea at the end of the meal. Nice.

Belly dancer with amazing dance skills was a surprising addition.
Had a great time.

A bit further down the road from the more crowded food areas, but well worth the extra distance. The chicken kebab lunch special was excellent, the apple tea was also wonderful, and the staff are very attentive.

This was an excellent find while going through that area!

Mezze platter - 3.75 stars
Dips were delicious. Pita was bland and could've been better.

Kebab platter - 3.75 stars
Sausage was great. Beef and chicken a bit dry. Lamb was salty.

The food is really delicious and there are many must try middle east delicacies. The  downside of the restaurant is the service though they charge 10% service charge.

Hi, the best place in Arab street for authentic food. I keep coming back here and the food is very affordable, choose this restaurant if you can’t decide! We even got a free dessert, from Amar, his service was great!!!

Reviews: 

I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Very delicious food with reasonable price.
My friend from Turkey said this is the only place with authentic Turkish food. My mom who is super picky about food said their food is good. Their dessert Kunefe is both crispy and creamy.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgeable. Will visit again.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

First time trying Lebanese food and it was really nice with a very good vibe. the ambiance was all set and whole arab street experince was lit. Hummus with bread and apple teas is a myst try dish over here. The price is on the higher side and I would say going in a group pf 5-6 people will be good as we get to try lot of new dishes.

The food was not too bad. First time having Lebanese food. The chicken was cooked nicely and the basmati rice was seasoned well. The lamb chops were on the drier side. Overall interesting meal. Recommended for group dinners.

Sanobar Lebanese Restaurant in Singapore is a hidden culinary gem that whisks diners away to the flavors of Lebanon. The restaurant offers a delectable and authentic Lebanese dining experience, from succulent shawarmas to flavorful falafels and tantalizing baklava desserts.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the friendly staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various dietary preferences and offers a true taste of Middle Eastern cuisine. Staff is so welcoming and friendly! Whether you're a fan of Lebanese food or new to it, Sanobar is a must-visit, I enjoyed the place so much when I visited Singapore in January!

Visited 13 July 2023 humid summer evening. The following sharing are based on our unbiased personal opinion and experience.

Multiple visit to this restaurant serving Turkish delicacy. Located at Kampong glam, Bussorah street. We had a great and delicious dinner for the night.

The food was filling and delicious dessert 🎂 and Turkish coffee was fantastic. And the dining atmosphere vibes was good with outdoor sitting.

Food 4 ⭐
Services 4 ⭐
Atmosphere 4 ⭐
Return to try again definitely 😁

Drop by the next time when you visit Kampong Glam I'm pretty sure you will like it here. Cheers

Nice food. Requested for some cherry tomatoes on the side and was spot on. Chicken was cook perfectly and tender. Good service staff. Was given a mint tea after meal. 5 star for the chefs and service crew.

A must go to restaurant. ;)

The food is really nice. I ordered chicken wrap. All vegetables and chicken inside were very juicy and tasty. But I think the price is quite expensive considering the portion. Mine was 10 SGD but was not very generous portion. If I consider the location, which is a tourism spot, then maybe the price is reasonable but, still, for locals, I think a bit expensive.

Had their signature lamb chop but was served with Briyani rice. Food taste good here but food portion was a little disappointed. Wasn't very transparent about the cost as the receipt reflected different price from the menu. Wouldn't return to dine here again as it's tad expensive and they charge 10% service charge for a roadside store. 😅

Had a great lunch here. Cheaper than most places nearby and very delicious food.

We had a delicious lunch at  House of Kebab. The highlight was the hummus- lots of garlic & ideal texture.  The  mixed grill meat and chicken was a little dry but tasty and good flavour.

Food is delicious and service is great. Owner is nice and friendly but will upsell quite heavily. I paid $145 for a satisfying meal for 6 but honestly expected to pay not more than $100. Not that I was misled in anyway, I really wasn't. But would have probably been more value for money for us if we had matched the orders accordingly, I.e. two platters instead a lamb kofta and one platter.

To be fair, I received 4 glasses of juice for the price of 2. Original price of the juices were rather expensive originally, but works out to a reasonable $2.50 each before taxes which is reasonable and delicious. I paid about $20 for a Hallomi Cheese which was a delicious fried cheese that the children liked very much. I was gifted a Borek which was crispy and well liked by my hubby.

For Hummus, I paid about $14. Owner was generous and gave me two chickpea hummus and one baba ganoush. I must say that the hummus was nutty, toasty and delicious. Paid about $16 for two of the Pita Breads and also gifted a dessert.

I had high expectations based on the positive reviews and the food and service doesn't disappoint. Would have given five stars if price was more as i originally expected. I still did find my meal value for money though, and I would definitely come back. Thanks for the great food and service and for taking the time to reach out on this. Much appreciated.

The menu offers a wonderful variety of authentic Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors that transported me to the heart of Istanbul. The quality of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation was a feast for the eyes.

The staff at Derwish are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall positive atmosphere.

Had a delightful dining experience at Derwish Turkish! The mixed kebab platter was outstanding; I was trying to control my carbs but I couldn't get enough of the fragrant rice. The hummus was good, although the bread was a bit tough for my liking. However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service. The staff was incredibly friendly and always had a smile on their faces, which added to the overall splendid experience. Looking forward to visiting again!

Everytime I have a loved one visiting Singapore, I always take them here. I always come back here for the food and service. The food is great - big serving and authentic and I love their Bunefe!! ♥️ The service is top notch, leaving us satisfied every single time. Will surely be back with other loved ones who are about to visit. 🥰

Great food and service. Food is definitely wayyy more expensive than the usual, but the taste makes it not such a bad deal. Apple tea is really nice before eating the food, very refreshing and fragrant but after eating any food it doesn't taste as nice.

Peter, the staff here, was exceptionally polite and gave us a warm welcome. When I needed to store my dessert in the fridge, he was incredibly helpful. Peter also recommended their signature dishes, and we decided to try them.

The Tajin lamb shank was a delightful surprise, with tender, succulent meat that practically fell off the bone. The flavors were rich and aromatic, making it a standout dish.

The Meze tabagi was a delightful assortment of Mediterranean appetizers, a true explosion of flavors and textures. It included a variety of dips, fresh vegetables, and savory bites, providing a wonderful contrast of tastes.

For a refreshing beverage, we ordered the Mango Ayran. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tangy, making it a great complement to our meal.

Unfortunately, as there were only two of us, we couldn't order the traditional dessert Peter recommended. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed the atmospheric environment, delicious food, and excellent service provided by the staff.

Great food and atmosphere. Owner is super lovely legit food lover. Go here!

Amazing food, ate there twice

Sultan Mosque Nakamise Street has a lot of restaurants with a nice atmosphere, so I was a little confused, but a local friend brought me to this restaurant. The appetizer platter is full of Mediterranean cuisine (Lebanese?). For mains, we each ordered lamb chops and skewered beef (I don't know the name). I was so absorbed in chatting that I couldn't eat all the appetizers, but they all tasted authentic. The main meat dishes are simply prepared but delicious. I appreciated the thoughtfulness of pointing two large fans at us. None of the restaurants in Nakamise serve alcohol (for religious reasons), so if you need one, you should either drink before coming to this area, or go to a pub a little further out of this area as there are many pubs. Let's go for a drink.

Food is great. Service is excellent. The salad bar was also really good. It's a meat lovers paradise

My first time to this restaurant and it was a great experience. Definitely a must-go place for meat lovers. The salad and food bar had a great variety to choose from and the meat get served direct to the table every few minutes (^^"). And remember to ask for the pineapple!!!

All the meat is quite salty, makes you keep drinking water and fill up your stomach fast. Most of the beef like tenderloin and lamb were overcooked and were lacking in flavour.

Booked our reservation for 7pm but had no issues despite us coming earlier at 6.30. Our waiter, even though he was a trainee (some chinese/asian person) was super on the ball when it came to refilling our water and changing our plates.

When I accidentally dropped some meat on my white shirt, he immediately dropped whatever he was doing and got me a wet and dry tissue for me to clean off the stain. Highly impressed with the service and food. Had a lovely evening together with my wife.

Very delicious salad bar and every meat course brought to you is grilled to a very high standard. Very interesting concept to try various meat cuts. Would love to go back! Try that fried kale from salad bar :)

The experience at Carnivore was fantastic; plenty of meat with wide variety was served continuously throughout the night. Every bite was tender and we enjoyed the service very much. At one point, we even requested the chef for a particular cut, which he very graciously prepared just for our table. The salad bar is very fresh and well prepared. We recommend the ham, pineapples and beef brisket. If you dare to try, get the chicken heart too!

Carnivore started 2 decades ago at Vivo City, relocated to CHIJMES, and just relocated to Robertson Quay.

The meat or skewers were not what we accustomed to. All the variants of beef on skewers had a very strong gaming beefy taste and either dry or hard. Definitely not tender just hard. The short beef ribs not so hard or tough but strong beefy taste. The chicken heart was okay at 7/10. The home made sausage was dried out, was not tasty at all, a dismal 2/10. The bacon wrapped chicken at 5/10. The chicken thigh better at best a 7/10.

The best from carver is the skewered barbecued pineapple at 9/10 and butterfish at 8/10.

Strangely the buffet sides were better overall compared to the skewered meats. Minestrone soup 7/10, black beans with sliced sausages 7/10, potato salad 8/10, asparagus salad 7/10, beef stew 6.5/10.

The assorted chocolate desert was 8/10. The fruit was decent at 7.5/10.

Dunno what to say. We are so used to the higher meat qualities when they were at Vivos City. Just wish they were as good as before. They just started operating less than a month since relocating from CHIJMES so maybe they just getting into the groove.

Service was good, friendly & attentive. Hardly anyone there during Monday lunch as it was a public holiday, in lieu of Deepavali.

This is a meat lovers paradise! Every meat they serve is awesome! My faves are the rump cap, chicken thigh and the butterfish! But on the whole food is awesome, and service is great! I especially loved the service from an elderly gentleman. He was attentive to my needs and made sure I got what I wanted. He deserves 100 stars and he makes my day!

Meats were a bit dried but taste still not that bad, salad bar and dessert okay, overall okay

Felt like meat variety for rotation was alot lesser than what was shown on their website. Pineapples only came twice, of which once did not even made it to our table.

Almost addicted to their Açai bowls. Not gonna lie. — Their interiors, ambience, environment, vibes are top notch and really good for self and group visits to chill, rest and relax. And reflect.

Açai is on the sweetest note of my tastebuds. Sweeter and happier side of life. 😋😍🫶🏼 Gotta love it here.

the acai tasted more like sugar than acai berries, feels like the percentage of acai is much lower than to the other additives. nice space to chill, well decorated, dragonfruit is nice but i found the goji berries a bit hard
