Celebrated my birthday there with my friend and the fold here is super awesome! The meat are cooked to perfection and the servers were so attentive to details and prompt to react. If you are a meat lover, dont miss the experience here!

Some of the items that I really like, (no pictures cause busy eating 😅)
- Garlic Beef
- Picanha
- Duck Breast
- Chicken and Chicken Heart
- Sirloin
- Beef Ribs

And and and! The cheese bread and fried banana were awesome toooooo!

Do try them out!

We brought a toddler with us and it was child friendly. Overall the food were great and fresh. The marination taste really good and was grilled to perfection; the beef was medium rare, good job to the chef! I'm not a fish person but it got me eating second piece, it was delicious and fresh. Our daughter just loves the chips and tomato. Service was attentive and well explained. Good job to Chris and team! Looking forward to visit again!

It was my anniversary celebration. We had
lunch, and it was a carnivore's dream come true. The buffet-style service, with servers continuously offering a variety of meats until you signal them to stop, was a delightful experience.

The meat selection was impressive, and I must say the Picanha, Prime Part of Top beef stole my heart.
Despite that Picanha that stole my heart, there were some others that I think otherwise. Maybe this is personal preference.

Overall, I found their concept of unlimited, high-quality meat servings are truly enjoyable.

Notes: the bottle provided on the table are chargeable. One is sparkling water, the other is mineral water.

No complaints whatsoever. It's worth the steap price, from the sides (pictured) to the array of various meats, all cooked to perfection, to the attentive and courteous wait staff.

My only reccomendarion is to come hungry.

Wonderful place for event or company dinner👍🏻 Our team had dinner in Casa Brasilia. We were excited at first for their churrasco concept. Then, it turned out to be a such good decision😇. The service is so attentive and heartwarming！The food comes with high quality delicious meats and great varieties！ The ambiance of the restaurant is elegant and comfortable！Besides, I extremely loved their brazilian cocktails 🍹it‘s so pretty on photo and pairs well with different meats. Definitely recommend! And will go back with my family and friends.

All day happy hour price for hoegaarden beer and rosee. This place do not serve beer tower.
The food is great, would love to come again with the big group.
We asked one staff to help us to take a photo and after he take 1 photo for us, he took out his phone to take another photo and told us that it is going to post on their Instagram. One of my friend felt not respected, firstly he didn’t ask for our permission, secondly, we don’t know who he is and don’t know what he is going to do with it, and express that he is not comfortable with it, especially he doesn’t like a random person having his photo in other people’s phone. Perhaps, asking for permission might be a good choice.
Btw, the food and drinks are so good!
By the way, I’ve gotten quite a few mosquitoes bite from there.

Nice location at the end of a busy street, this bar is open and airy with plenty of seating and a decent range of beers. The cocktails were also impressive and reasonably priced during happy hour. Food was only ok (fairly run-of-the-mill pub-grab and a little too many fried options) but that's ok. The staff were friendly and attentive. Solid choice for a street packed with options.

A great atmosphere and the food is really delicious. Staff super friendly and readily available for next drinks and orders.

A great selection of Western foods.

Nice ambience. The food is good and the staff attentive. The corner tables have some mosquitos issues but the staff will provide incense when asked. Highly recommend their lamb stew and lala soup.

Always one of my favourite places to go to in Holland Village (among the many watering holes there!). Prices are reasonable, food is quite tasty and the vibe all round is great. Generally not that crowded but if you're in a bigger group do remember to get reservations.

This place opens up at 11.30am, earlier than other lunch spots in the area. We decided on a mexican fiesta and as such, popped in for a quick fix and to our delightful surprise, we were not at all disappointed.

My dish was about $19 before GST. It was fried chicken with loads of tomato sauce on it, with cilantro rice and nachos on the side. My friends had nachos and enchiladas. The flavours were good and the cilantro rice was so yummy. They didn’t skimp on the cilantro and the rice was cooked to perfection, every rice with that intense cilantro flavour. My chicken was fried to perfection, and it was juicy and moist. The serving size is generous for what you’re paying.

The restaurant service was attentive, and I loved that they provided free iced water to patrons. Such should be the standard of more restaurants in Singapore.

The decor was quaint and cute.

Absolutely love the Mexican food here especially the Soup with the fresh seafood in it had the nachos with pulled pork which was amazing the enchiladas filled with beef and the set with taco and enchilada with beans on the side I added guacamole as well which was great! Definitely would recommend this! Though service is sometimes quite slow it’s still quite worth while

I don't eat much mexican, but I really enjoyed my dinner here. Was difficult to choose from the menu but thankfully the staff were very helpful with their recommendations.

The spring roll thingy was amazing, way better than it looks.
I didn't know nachos can be served like that, the pulled pork one was good but wish there was more meat.
Beef quesadilla was really good too, altho it looked really flat and sad, but it was actually very flavourful and filling.
Fish tacos tasted quite interesting, I actually couldn't taste the fish at all which is a good thing.

Oh and I love the guacamole and tomatoes and salsa ~

The downside is all the quesadilla/taco/XXX all looked and tasted very similar.

But yea would come visit again! It tastes quite wholesome!

I am a frequent customer and have been ordering from them for a couple of years. No longer in the future as there was a cockroach wrapped in my burrito. I have reported them to the food agency.

It’s been many years since I’ve last been here. It’s a long standing establishment and the food did not fail me.
Ordered the piñatas, chimichanga and calamari. Food was served fast and the server was very friendly.
All the food ordered were tasty, filling and authentic. I’ll be back to explore the menu more.

Nice place to hangout with friends!
A good variety of beverages at reasonable pricing.
Signature dishes: Seabass Tacos & Salt & Pepper Squid are delicious!

Just had this one drink while waiting for my mates. If there’s at least one reason to patronise this F&B, is friendly staff, Vellroll 👍

Dropped in here randomly after work and had a nice salad and a glass of wine. Good selection in the wine side. Better to sit outside if possible as it can get noisy inside. Good service.

Unfortunately my experience did not mirror that of the many positive reviews. The pizza base was soggy and the pizza disintegrated completely as we tried to lift up slices. The ravioli was drenched in this awful, overly salty and peppery sauce and I couldn't taste anything in the filling. The risotto was not particularly good either. Other Italian places I've been to have been much better.

You cannot imagine the service standards of this place.

Faizal, Jess and Gabriel - our servers for the night were exceptional. EXCEPTIONAL.

Surprised this place has NOT even obtained a Michelin ⭐.

Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Quality 11/10

I don't get it. How is this place charging mad affordable prices while serving food only perceivable at the Hyatt? 🤯

We were sitting outdoor enjoying our dinner!
First time visit the restaurant. Loved the texture of pasta, the sauce was creamy, portion was generous! Mozzarella with ham was delicious, too! The pizza was the down side that the seafood was tasteless and the pizza dough could be better. Tiramisu was good, too!

The pizza here is tasty. The crust is thin and baked nicely. We had the margherita with seafood add on. The squid was a little too chewy but otherwise it’s fine.

Service was prompt. Only downside was that the aircon was a really weak. We were in the restaurant and still felt really hot (on level 1). When we went to the bathroom at level 2, the air con there felt much better.

Delicious and filling pizzas and pastas. Couldn’t finish for 2 people! Worth it if dining with 1 for 1 / 50% offer! The store manager was very friendly and kind — offered to keep my many bags of groceries at the back while we dined and brought them back to me after we finished our meal. Thank you!

Very friendly staff. Food was great also. Nice ambience. Some live music could help. Price was also good.

Decided to visit Wala Wala earlier as its always full in the weekends.
Overall the service was great.
We ordered Draft beers and Fried chicken.
Overall nice evening  catch up with a few drinks .

Nothing to complain about. Food was good. prices were reasonable. The service was good. Nice ambience. suitable for a chill drinking. The place gets crowdy around 8 in weekends. Would suggest to be there around at least 7 pm to secure a cool table.

Nice place to chill with friends.. we love the place. Will recommend  with my friends.

Centrally located within walking distance from Holland MRT station. So can drink more without worries.
Food wise, a little salty on the chicken wings and fried stuff. Pizzas varieties was okay

The premise looks very clean, which is absolutely assuring. Acai bowl never fails, not too sweet and filled with fresh ingredients. I especially love their nut butters but wished that they could give slightly more as it’s always not enough to go around with the acai. 😅

Always had the Acai Flower bowl at other outlets, decided to try Coconut Yoghurt Acai bowl instead. Fresh fruits used, mixed with cruchy toasted coconut flakes, granola, and goji berries. The coconut yoghurt taste not very prominent and serving kind of little, hope to get a bigger scoped.

A promotion is ongoing in Woodleigh mall with 2 bowls for $16. Ordered a Original Flower Bowl and a Nuts for Açaí bowl with 2 butters namely peanut and cookie. The staff were very helpful to help me change my order. Overall experience was good 👍

The staff were so unfriendly with an unpleasant face that make you feel guilty for ordering, my appetite for eating açaí was gone instantly. I said hi with a smile no reply, thank you no reply, looking upset and kind of scary. The açaí is good though but never coming back here again for the service.

Came to support them for their new opening at the Woodleigh Mall! Got the promotion which was 1 for 1 acai bowls and the staff were super nice and acai was super yummy!

Great food! Although the squid ink pasta took 40mins to prepare, you can be sure it is cooked the authentic way cause the flavour is thoroughly infused into all the rice. The tapas were so flavourful, went very well with the bread drizzled with olive oil. Only thing was this menacing crow that was eyeing our food from the tree outside.

Went for dinner on a Saturday - wasn’t too crowded.
Service was great! Really appreciate the staff checking in with us - and when we wanted to look at the menu for desserts, the lady recited the whole list and recommended the lava cake (which we thoroughly enjoyed). When I asked for additional ice for my drink, they gave me a cup with a pair of small tongs!
Food was okay - nothing to shout about, in my opinion. I enjoyed the White Anchovies Salad but my partner didn’t really like it much. He enjoyed the squid ink paella and the Pan Con Tomate. The Huevos Con Todos was pretty good too. Dessert was amazing - I don’t have a sweet tooth so it was cloying towards the end but my boyfriend who loves sweets had a field day. Very flavourful!
But I guess you pay for the ambience.
Not sure I’d make a trip down specifically for it again, but a nice place to try for a date night.

Came to celebrate a dear friend’s birthday and we caught the tapas promotion - 9 tapas for $109.90++. Just nice for 4 of us to share. Each of the dishes carry their own richness - yummy! We polished them off clean! 😁 the staff were also helpful and great in servicing us! Love the high ceilings and spaciousness of the premise that overlooks to the yachts dock. Will definitely recommend this place!

A good place to dine by the sea.

Service requires more attentive staff.
Spoon was not provided when the dish requires such.

The grilled octopus leg was good. Recommended to order.

Paella Pescado seafood rice is average. Depends on whether u like the spice taste, some of us feels the dish tasted sweet.

Gambas Al Pil Pil was also nice. If they can provide bread to go it would be excellent.

Pan Con Tomate was a normal bread with tomatoes topping. Nothing to shout about.

Overall price is not cheap.

This place is pet friendly dog cats etc, hangover brunch was awesome. Been here several times already so food is legit and consistent they’ve change furnitures recently looks more Mediterranean. All you can eat menu within 2 hours also for drinks if you fancy to add 39 unlimited sangria and pava

Two chefs bar was an impromptu decision we’ve made. It was the best decision ever. Food was 10/10 in my opinion. Every dish wowed us.

For 2, we ordered chili lime wings, Italian pork sausage pizza, pan seared barramundi, linguine meatball pasta, and tiramisu gone wild. My favorite was the meatball pasta, something in the meatball was so addictive, felt like there were exploding flavors of several herbs and nuts in this dish but weren’t overpowering. Everything was tied together perfectly with the sauce and most importantly, pasta was Al Dante. On a side note, the dessert, tiramisu was actually huge and made perfectly. Good to share!

And with such good food quality, it was worth every dollar spent. We managed to try a few dishes in one sitting and was a little over being just full. The service was prompt and pleasant so as the environment. Will be returning here for sure!!

Food really nice +, environment is great+, staffs are friendly. Foods are so good to taste. Love the tiramisu.

Excellent thin crust pizza! One Of the better ones I had tasted. Service was good and food came out quickly. Prices are reasonable too.

Food here was AMAZING! Every dish that was recommended to us was so delightful to taste. Highly recommend the mushroom ravioli for starters, the crab pasta, and the pizza (crust was so nicely done) ⭐️⭐️⭐️

Service was great too, they provided 4 wraps for our fajitas instead of the usual 3 as we came as a family of 4. He also shared these amazing recommendations, thank you very much! 🙏🏼☺️ will be back!

Nice ambience for Mexican & Italian food. Love the beef fajitas and Burrata. Sadly line many establishments these days, they do not serve tap water and only served still water at $7 a bottle.

We celebrated my daughter's birthday yesterday and we had a great time! The staff was accommodating and we felt really well taken care of. The kids enjoyed having a pool to splash in before and after dinner.
Food was good, we had the mushroom croquetas - this tastes like breaded mushroom soup; crystal bread - which was a hit with the kids, its basically toasted bread with tomato paste; potato churros - another hit with the kids; octopus tentacle - super yummy; beef steak - tender and juicy; red snapper; highlight was the squid ink paella! We also had the iberico paella - that was OK only.
The white sangria was a little too watered down. Tasty, but abit like fruit juice.

Love this place and the fact that after so many years, the quality of the food remains high!

Undeniably on the higher price range so it’s a bit of a treat whenever we visit FOC. The food and service does not disappoint. Staff tried to accommodate every request we had, which does really make the whole night more enjoyable.

This place serves up one of the best Paellas in Singapore! My go to place for squid ink paella! The black paella came with perfectly grilled tender prawns and scallops!

Ordered the grilled prawns which was served on small sizzling skillet filled with soft tender prawns swimming in a pool of fragrant garlic oil. Hmmmm.. I could cut the all the seafood here with my spoon!

Our favourite appetiser was still the sautéed cauliflower! It looked like a simple dish until we bite into it! There were so many layers of flavours in this dish! One bite into the crunchy cauliflower, paired with the smoked aubergine purée, spiced mayo, pickled onions and a speck of herbs was just divine.

If i can give 10 starz i will gladly give them. Their seafood paella was honestly one of the best we ever tasted in SG. The flavour is bursting with every bite and the texture is legit aldente. Their fish n chips and char grilled portobello was also great tasting.

I would like to commend on their service because they had went the extra mile to provide my partner with a complimentary birthday dessert when i casually mentioned to the staff. Really appreciated that gesture which made our day. Thank you

Manager graciously gave us a complimentary avocado salad for an ordering mistake which took us by a pleasant surprise.

By the way the iberico pork paella is REALLY GOOD!

Nice beach atmosphere. Great pool. Good food. Pate and ham Croquettes were great! Fried Peppers too! Bread was so so. Had their cocktails. Not fantastic though.

Well… walking out of the restaurant feeling regretful on my choice vs the money spent…

Potato with bravas sauce was terrible. That’s the saddest choice I have made. Always a potato lover and for any potato to taste bad for me, it’s really not a good thing. 1/10

Fried squid was just ok n nothing better than ok.
My son said “yuck” which was very shocking to me cos he loves his calamari. 5/10

Spanish omelette was quite good and the portion was huge. 7/10

Seafood and chicken Paella was the best out of all the choice and it was delicious.
Definitely a 8/10

Churros was equally disappointing. Very tough and hard and the oil used must be stale or used for many times. The churros smell very seafood-ish if u know what I mean.

Paying the amount for the quality. I am definitely not very happy walking out.

Went on a weekday night to celebrate anniversary as wife wanted tapas. We ordered crispy fried squid, mushroom croquettes, potatoes with bravas sauce & aioli, Argentian beef steak, garlic prawns, grilled chorizo & potato puree, Spanish omelette, and prosecco. Food was mostly so-so and the potatoes with bravas sauce was the least nice. Maybe the steak and grilled chorizo in potato puree were the best we ordered. The frozen sangria looks good but we didn't order. Staff was attentive and response fast. Outdoor has a nice view of Sentosa.

Sublime tapas with swift service. The Padras peppers, chorizo with potato purée, garlic prawns with toast, fish tacos, and churros with chocolate sauce transported me back to an enjoyable holiday in Barcelona. These were fine Spanish grub and I look forward to trying more dishes such as the paella.

With a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, there’s also a nice grocery shop positioned near the entrance for you to take a taste of Spain home.

Overall the food taste good but the quantity in both our Paella is little (compare to the previous time I ate at Orchard outlet). Mushroom croquet are so good we ordered second serving. The cold cuts, salads and tapas (prawns, chicken wings, squid, potatoes with bravas sauce, eggplant) are good. Seabass can skip, not very tasty.

Great food! Came here for a company dinner and ordered many small plates. My favourites were the ibérico pork as well as the jalapeños, which was a very interesting dish! The mushroom croquettes was also really nice, and kind of tasted like solidified mushroom soup. All in all, I enjoyed every single dish. I do prefer the squid ink paella over the Valencia paella though, as it was richer in taste.

Reviews: 

Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Opening in March 2022, Zuzu Kebab is a Muslim-owned hawker stall specialising in Turkish kebabs. The chef at the helm of Zuzu Kebab formerly hailed from the Turkish Kebab House, a pop-up stall often seen in Pasar Malams / Night Bazaars around Singapore. Zuzu Kebab tends to attract long hungry queues of diners, thanks to their delicious dishes served in large hearty portions, at wallet-friendly prices.
.
Ambience at Zuzu Kebab is shared with the rest of the Serangoon Garden Market & Food Centre hawker stalls. There's ample common seating, with bright lights, and an open, airy, bustling atmosphere. The large and attractive signage of Zuzu Kebab is easy to spot, with people patiently waiting their turn to order.
.
Service at Zuzu Kebab is friendly but structured. Chef takes a few orders at a time, then makes each order one at a time. This results in fresh, made-to-order, piping hot meals each time, though it also leads to a short queue of up to 15 minutes in waiting time. It's usually a 1 or 2 man show here, and while they demonstrate great product knowledge on the menu, they can be rather brusque during peak periods.
.
Food at Zuzu Kebab is Turkish cuisine, with a focus on kebabs. There's a good range of options here, though most folks order the staples. I like that their dishes and meals are healthy and wholesome, not too greasy, and served with plenty of fresh vegetables. Quality is consistently above average, and portions are large for individuals.
.
Prices are wallet-friendly but higher than other hawkers, budget about SGD $9 per person.

Enjoyed the burrito & butter rice with chicken. The pita bread with hummus was yummy. Be prepared to queue/wait for your food during peak meal time.

Good quality and value !!! Just need to prepare for long queue and waiting time.
Kunefe is the best I had so far!! Freshly made, rich but not sweet! Must try!!
The pita bread are freshly made, for garlic and cheese option, they will bake it upon ordering, it is so good just out from the oven , but be prepared for some waiting time, if you are in a rush, take the salad ,kebabs , original pita.

ZUZU IS BACK!! Absolutely tasty and worth the wait. Just look at the char on the chicken. Definitely value for money w the huge portion size. I always come prepared to pack some back for my lunch at work tmr 😍

Great Turkish food in serangoon garden hawker centre. The kebabs servings are huge and the meat is very well seasoned and grilled. The hummus is another highlight, smooth creamy and full of spices. It tasted even better with its pita bread whuch is freshly made on the spot and baked.

Been to Plonk many times over a few years and the consistency of the food, good service staff and quality (& quantity) never fail to impress. Still keeping up the standards. Fish & chips are served in a good proportion. Pizza (thin n nicely done as well) n pork ribs (big portion hor) Crispy wings with a special dipping sauce - not too bad but I thought the wings can be further marinated for people who don't go for the dipping sauce. Fries costs only $5 on Fridays n you get ALOOOT of fries too. Ordered Bolognese n Carbonara (finished before I remember to take photo). The kids absolutely loved it. We loved how much clams we had in the vongole - power la. The staff were also very friendly n kind to hand us spoon n plates for our cake.

Been awhile since I had a beer at Serangoon Gardens! Plonk serves Little Creatures Pale Ale on tap. It was an enjoyable pint and the St Kinda fish and chips was a great pairing. Great attentive service crew and will be back!

Been to Plonk many times, usually for their express brunch. The fish and chips was fantastic, crispy and freshly fried fish with a nice thin batter coating. A whole heap of fries absolutely fried to perfection. Paired very nicely with the Little Creatures IPA they have on tap. Very pleasant ambience as well, open air but cool inside. The tart was more on the chocolate side, fudgy and delicious and paired with vanilla ice cream. On other visits i’ve also had their truffle mushroom risotto which is cheesy goodness.

I was around the serangoon area and looking for something new to try. Stumbled upon Plonk with loads of people having a beer in the front and decided to try this place out. The food was great, the place wasn't too crowded, music volume was just nice, but inside was just too dark.

The food was great and you should not skip on the pizza. Ordered the mushroom truffle, mushrooms are big and chunky, dough was nice and crispy.

Kitchen whipped meals are 💪 strong. Very flavourful pizzas. Eggs and burgers are juicy and crisp to lock in the flavours 🍔

Unfortunately they’re so popular the kitchen is short handed. You’re gonna have to wait 40mins plus for service. You can tell the waiter and managers are harried from the load too. Kudos on their efforts to still be friendly and nice 😃

Check the waiting times if you’re in a hurry to avoid being hangry

Rating: 4.4
Reviews: 

This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there’s sometimes a queue, so it’s wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

A lovely place for those looking for non pork meals. They don’t qualify as a halal place  as they serve alcohol. But good for Muslim friends. It was my first time here and it’s been a while since I had Greek food. I love the dips option from spicy to mild tasting dips. The fried calamari was great too followed by the medium rare lamb which was tender. Ensure you make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Good place to bring friends.

Always crowded on weekends such that even booking a table on same day is sometimes not possible.
I really enjoyed the medium meat platter. grilling was on point  meat was juicy and not dry.
moussaka went down way too easily. Greek dip platter was on point flavour wise and the taramasalata was flavourful without tasting too fishy.
sadly the pita bread is pretty small portioned, I'm not sure how you're expected to finish the dip given with the portions served
Grilled octopus was also delicious.

Service was friendly and efficient.
Decor isn't very Greek but honestly ambience is great (albeit a bit noisy)

It's harder to get a table here than the at its closest competitor, and for  good reason.

Good food. Although the beef can be on the dry side, everything else was delicious.

Highly recommend the grilled octopus. It is not chewy at all. For those who don’t like squid or octopus, try to have a bite.

Restaurant is packed on a Friday night and the food arrives pretty quick. Staff are quite alright. Some could use a little refining in politeness.

There’s complimentary licorice candy. Absolutely love it.

Will visit this place again. But recommend to come here in a bigger group to order a larger variety of dishes.

First visit. Reservation was smooth via seven rooms. We chose an outdoor table as the weather was pleasant. The food was delicious. We had the whole oven chicken and chicken yiro wrap with fries. Pesto pasta was good as well. Desserts were amazing too. Overall highly satisfied.

My favourite Greek restaurant in Singapore of all time.  I have been here 10 TIMES. The food is always so consistently good. They serve the best salad, octopus, sea bream, lamb chop and even chicken. Their dips and pita bread are also to die for. Service isn't as good as it used to be anymore but oh well.

Celebrated a friend birthday here and the staff was quite helpful. We were introduced to a good spread. Wasn’t expecting the food to be good in this type of cafe but was pleasantly surprised of the meat quality and portion. Slightly on the salty side but acceptable. Overall, would come back again.

Loved having dinner here. Food, service, atmosphere all fantastic. Wayne was a great server who recommended some signature dishes - codfish roe was my fav. Octopus was well cooked and kebab was also unique but perfectly cooked.

Came here multiple times including the one at the old location. Also recommended and brought my friends, colleagues here many times! Loved the food, ambience and service! Just so good! This time my friends and I came here to celebrate birthday and the bar manager treated us to complimentary alcohol and gave a small bottle of olive oil (we also purchased a big one!). Their olive oil tastes so gooooooood! The dessert was complimentary as well. I love the fish, octopus and vegetables the best!

Food is fantastic. Price is reasonable as well, total damage is about $50/pax. (We ordered like 7-8 dishes).
Service is pretty prompt. The ambience is good & cozy for gathering & chit-chatting.

The best Greek restaurants we’ve ever been in Singapore. The ingredients are so fresh and every dish is very delicious.
The desert is also the highlight.

Will come back to try more dishes.

Came here for a work lunch as the food was supposed to be good! Apparently my friend said that the standards have dropped and the food used to be better prior to their renovation…

Also, the restaurant has a strict 2 hours rule in place and we had to vacate the place by 2pm for their closing.. not a good experience for sure.

One of the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The dips are yummy, pitas are warm and tasty, the grilled octopus is one of the best I’ve ever had!!!! The tacos giros are yummy and the beef is of great quality! One more thing to mention is that they even serve Greek beer!!! The service is good, decoration/interior design is top! A must go place!!!!

Slightly pricey but the food taste amazing, simple yet flavorful!

The highlight for me was the octopus and eggplant spread 💯

Beautiful interior decor but the place was a little cramped and noisy due to the proximity of the tables. Food was great, esp the grilled octopus, but prices are on the higher end. Worth a try :)

Reviews: 

Came here on the recommendation of my daughter for a lunch birthday celebration.
Knowing I am a fan of Japanese food and hearing this place is rated quite highly so decide to give it a try with my family.
We try the ebi and tonkatsu and also the chashu. The food did not disappoint and everything was really delicious ans savoury. The chef and waiters service was friendly and attentive. And there was also a free flow of cabbage for us as well.
Overall a five star recommendation for this place so do come and try!

Service is great.
Place remains same for a Monday before 6pm .

Miso ramen is still well flavoured and appetising. Helps chase away Monday blues.
Prices have increased for adding noodles so I opt for a add on of rice instead.

Cheers.

We were very happy with the taste of our food and the service level provided! Big eaters like me rejoice with free flow rice and cabbage!

Family’s go to dinner place for tonkatsu sets. Love that the rice and cabbage is free flow!

The tonkatsu is well breaded and fried. Not greasy and still juicy.

Rice is properly cooked, always nicely done. Loving the soup that comes as a side with the meal itself. Cabbage is shredded nice and thin, and the dressing is tart and delicious!

Overall a really good experience!

If you are keen on noodles, the ramen is pretty good as well. Extra serves of noodle and soup can be purchased to top up the meal itself.

Overall, really yummy! Get there early for a table!

One of my favourite Oyakodons(and store, too!) in Singapore, while I often visit for their Katsus, if I ever crave Oyakodons I often find myself back here. Affordable Authentic Japanese Comfort Food.

The Oyakodon has half-cooked eggs which lends an extremely smooth texture to the dish. The Mirin is rich but not overbearing. Chicken chunks are tender, eaten with rice, it’s truly something I come back to again and again.

That said, most dishes here are tasty, so if it’s not your bowl of rice, you can’t really go wrong with the Miso Katsu either(not pictured).

Reviews: 

An affordable pet and dog cafe in the neighbourhood. We came here several times and this time was a special day for us and our precious Stitch who turned 5 years old this year. You could pre order a dog friendly cake few days before your appointment. Our cake is made of pumpkin and fruits so humans could eat it too

Food is not bad for the affordable pricing and we enjoyed it! Service was great and speed of serving the food is considered fast. We enjoyed ourselves a lot and recommend you bring your dog there :)

Better than average human food for a pet cafe! Prices are very reasonable. The floor is a bit gross though because it's vinyl and some owners don't clean up after their dogs immediately. Not wheelchair-friendly as there are steps at the entrance.

A Paradise for Pet Lovers!

This is another hidden gem for all pet lovers and foodies alike. From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed with open arms and so was our furball.

The highlight of our visit was the pet menu, a thoughtful touch that truly sets this place apart. Our pup had a ball choosing from a variety of delicious options and the complimentary water served in bowls was a fantastic gesture to keep him hydrated and happy.

For the humans, the Chilli Crab Shakshuka and Salmon Hae Bee Hiam Spaghetti were nothing short of amazing. Bursting with flavors, these dishes were a treat for the taste buds. The Chilli Crab Shakshuka had the perfect balance of spiciness and richness, while the Salmon Hae Bee Hiam Spaghetti offered as much punch, if not more.

The presence of pee pads made our visit stress-free and convenient, ensuring our pets' comfort. The entire atmosphere exuded warmth and welcome for animals, making our experience very lovely.

We will be back!

Went there twice.
First, the food was really affordable and really good, ordered beef burger, their fish and chip and salmon rice bowl. Quality food!
Second, it’s really dog friendly, the mop water etc is readily available, even leash as well. We
Can leash our dog to the hooks on the wall which allowed us to eat peacefully
Third, the dog food portions were really great and affordable as well☺️ our baby girl really enjoyed it without us spending a bomb on it (picture Was attached can be seen, how big the portion was)
Last, the staff were really friendly, service were good ☺️

Nice food and dogs which brought by owners to create a wonderful experience to us who are not pet owners.

Enjoyed the place here, cooling and great for pictures around the dining area.

Definitely will come back again with the kids.

Reviews: 

Nice respectable Korean restaurant in the Serangoon Gardens area. Comes with a variety of ban chan dishes - ten to be exact. I was personally expecting the meat to be grilled on the table but it was done in the kitchen instead. Pork collar was overcooked and tough to chew. The beef on the hand was done alright. The other main dishes that we ordered were slightly better than the BBQ option than we had.

I reached 630pm and had to queue outside for a while for 25mins. The server was passionate and shared with us what’s the highly recommended dish to go for. Order an oxtail soup and a recommended BBQ. Oxtail soup was okay and lags of umami. The pork belly is overcooked and served on a hot plate that’s not hot. Then I would recommend serving on the plate instead if there isn’t any sizzling effect, why bother? Food for thought. I think probably we picked the wrong dishes? I don’t know… but I’m sure paying for that price I can get better BBQ meat for sure. Head down and try for yourself, review is base on my personal preference. You might have a different experience than I have.

Food:
pork bokkeum $30
serving size was generous and it was filled with lots of veg, onions and mushrooms. slight spice gave it a nice kick but doesn’t come with rice. quite a challenge to finish it even if we weren’t full because it got quite jelak
dolsot bibimbap $20
can’t go wrong, really nice and we polished it off
haemul pajeon $17
there was seafood with every bite of the pancake, they certainly don’t scrimp on the ingredients. personally not a fan of how soft the pancake was though ):
additional items:
sikhye $4
really nice and smooth drink, but serving size was a tad small, moreover no complimentary water which is usually a norm in korean joints
hite beer $17, rice $2

10 side dishes came complimentary but nothing really stood out. some were quite salty as well 😅
overall not too bad, but nothing that stood out as being really delicious

Superb Korean food. Great, authentic taste.

Love the japchae - nice texture, flavourful. Oxtail stew is good too. The BBQ platter is fantastic.

This place reminds me of a joint in Seoul that I used to frequent, esp their bokkeum octopus, which has such a generous amount of octopus compared to other places where there's more veg in the dish.. their side dishes are also good and a hit for my toddlers.

They have a selection of kebab, burrito, quesdadilla etc. Taste is ok, about slightly average in my opinion.  The shop is small, not much seating available. Overall a place you can come for kebab, burrito etc, but only if you are in the vicinity.

The service crew @AMK recommended me Karana (young jackfruit) kebab as I am vegetarian. The taste was interesting and yummy! I will recommend it to anyone wants to try something  not soy or mushroom.

Happened to passby and try their kebab wrap combo for dinner. Service is good and fries are served hot. Staff helps to recommend what sauce is good on different meats. Definitely will be back next time!

I am first time try....
The chicken taste very yummy with vegetables so great. I buy one was Pita pocket for my son and I have kebab wrap so full. Now they have Ramadan combo set person only $8.90 come drink also fries 🍟.
I am so full with combo meals.They all very friendly. Next time I will be dine in... See you again.

Great service by the server. Well done. She was friendly and asked about our satisfaction with the food.

Reviews: 

I had a wonderful dining experience with my family at Old Bibik's Peranakan Kitchen. The staff was incredibly helpful, polite, and friendly, which added to the overall enjoyment of the meal. The ambiance of the restaurant was cosy and welcoming, creating a perfect setting for a pleasant meal.

The highlight, of course, was the food, which had a homely and authentic taste that truly captured the essence of Peranakan cuisine. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a genuine Peranakan dining experience.

Dinner @ Old Bibik Peranakan Kitchen.

Love the Barramundi Assam Pedas! Just right on point!

Here are the dishes i ordered:
1. Crispy Chinchalok Omelette 7/10 (portion is huge! Suited for 4-5pax)
2. Barramundi Assam Pedas (9/10)
3. Kepiting Soup (8/10)
4. Ayam Buah Keluak (8/10)
5. Nyonya Chap Chye (7/10)

P/S: Old Bibik’s cooking suits local palate, hence if you’re looking for authentic peranakan food, move on 🤭

Fabulous food. Super tasty with chilli on the side to adjust to your own taste. Good sized serves, well priced with good old fashioned service (efficient and attentive). Keen to go back as there was much on the menu we'd like to try but couldn't fit it in.  Loved the open setting with fans to keep you cool.

Some of the best Peranakan food we've had in Singapore! Everything tasted great and had a lovely home cooked feel. The sayur lodeh especially was spectacular -best I've had in Singapore. The Nyonya Ikan Assam Padas was something new to us and was very good too. Portions were generous and quality of ingredients felt high -well worth the price. A cosy ambience and warm and friendly service completed the excellent dining experience here. We will be back again with our friends!

Chance by this place when the original venue we wanted to go was close on a sunday. Tasty perankan dishes with wide offering of dishes with friendly service

Reviews: 

Went in at around 2pm on a Saturday afternoon. It was fairly empty (only 1 table occupied). Asked for a table for 2 and sat down. Wanted to order a chendol and a chin chow drink. The server told us we have to order main food. I asked exactly this “we cant just order a dessert and a drink?” The person replied yes and that he cant take our order if we not ordering food. We got up and left.
Cant believe they turned down customers just because we only wanted dessert and a drink? Horrible service.

The place is small and tight. Portions are small - even the medium is enough maybe for 2 to 3 people at most, and cost a pretty penny. For 8 persons, total cost came up to S$241.50.
Taste wise it was ok overall, nothing to shout about.
Hae cho was ok, but tiny.
Ayam buah keluak, at medium size, had only one nut cut into two. The taste was ok. Chicken was tender.
Chap chae was good, but portion was really small and alot of cabbage more than anything else.
Itek was really sour, bit strange but ok. Tender.
Babi pongteh was really soupy. I'm more used to those that are less watery. But the meat was good.
Fish was not fresh. At 38 bucks, not quite worth it, I felt.
Otah was small for the ten bucks it cost. Thought it was way overpriced.
Dessert portions were small for the price tag of 7 bucks. So-so only.

Overall, I felt not worth the price tag. Unlikely to go back again.

wow. House of Peranakan has been the highlight of my week! Great food and service, not many Peranakan food in Singapore, and as a Peranakan myself, it brings me back to my childhood days when grandma would cook. Highly recommended!!!! The staff is really helpful esp. this waiter named Duane

Unique, one-of-a-kind environment.  Food depends on taste, but for me was unique, top class, and tastes home made.  I'm honestly a bit puzzled as to why the restaurant isn't rated higher.  Peranakan cuisine is under-rated.

Everything was great! Friendly owners and a very nice family restaurant. Food was fantastic!!! Service was top notch and food recommendation by owner's grandson was👍👍👍 definitely coming back again especially when family from KL visits! All in all, food and desserts were amazing. So tasty! Thinking about it makes me hungry again!

Rating: 3.9
Reviews: 

Not familiar with the Peranakan foods or favours. They are good but flavours are very subtle not as flavoursome. General all the dishes were delicious , flavours were towards the mild side. Fresh ingredients and we enjoyed the service and ambience !

I decided to explore the Joo Chiat area and took a bus there and walked around. It's a Monday so it's quiet and relaxing. Just felt a bit hungry and wondered what I could find and this restaurant just popped up!  Very quiet on a Monday and i had the whole place to myself for lunch. I must say prices are high for the food, but I decided to treat myself. Service was good and the food was good. I really like the very special Ayam buah keluak and ngoh hiang. I love the decor and traditional objects all around the restaurant. It's a great authentic dining experience.

Came here after watching Ghib Ojisan eating here on his YouTube channel. Ordered ayam buah keluak, beef rendang, assam sotong, otak otak, nyonya chap chye, blue pea rice, chendol and bo bo cha cha. Rendang was very tender, probably my favourite in this list.

Overall, food was decent but so-so. Can find better peranakan food elsewhere for this price range. Restaurant has a nice ambience though, and wasn’t crowded on a Sunday night for dinner around 6.30pm.

staff were v friendly and the food was gd 👍🏽

the best dish we ordered was SAMBAL KANGKONG ! the chilli paste used was very fresh and tastes different from sambal kangkong from other places.

we also ordered: nogh hiang, ayam buah keluak and hainanese pork chop.

they also gave a complementary acha dish.

wanted to try their fish but was a bit expensive (about $48).

total was abt $25 per person !

We came here while scouring for Nonya food in this area.  There were several restaurants in the area,  and I decided this based on Google reviews.

Reservations needed and recommended too.

The food is well balanced in both taste and scent,  unlike other places whereby the spices can be very overwhelming. The Sambal KangKong has that homely style cooking,  similar to mom's. Another item worth a mention is the curry chicken,  with that hint of sour in it,  bringing out the life.

Finally,  never leave this place without trying the Chendol,  always leave room for dessert. It's not too sweet,  though heavy on the coconut.

Overall,  service is fast,  speedy in fact.  I guess this is also due to the crowd that never seems to stop coming in,  we came on a Sat evening.

Worth a return visit or as when one craves for Nonya food.

Here are my recommendations from the variety of food available.

Ayam Buah Keluak - where chicken meets the rich, earthy flavor of buah keluak nuts, creating an irresistibly complex dish!

Loved the DIY Yong Tau Foo and Rojak. Get to choose your favorite ingredients. My Yong Tau Foo paired perfectly with their rich and flavorful laksa soup.

Don't miss the creamy, custard-like Durian Pengat! A divine treat with that bold durian kick.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at “Nyonyas”and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. The standout feature of this establishment is undoubtedly the impeccable staff and their genuine hospitality. From the moment I stepped in, their attentiveness and spontaneous understanding of my needs was evident.

The menu at “Nyonyas”is a testament to their commitment to catering to a diverse clientele. It flawlessly balances an array of international flavors, ensuring there's something to satisfy every palate. Whether you're craving traditional fare or seeking a culinary adventure, this restaurant delivers.

Kudos to the team for their dedication to creating an inclusive dining environment that transcends borders. I'm thoroughly impressed and can't wait to return. Keep up the fantastic work, Nyunyas Team! 👍

what a pleasant find in the east (Katong)! Good buffet spread of Nyonya Peranakan food at only S$38.90++, and is daily lunch. I recommend to try their laksa, kueh pie tee , achar & durian pengat - really good. Kuddos to their Chef David, who runs the kitchen & live station (fried carrot cake is good too!) Service staff is good.

Peranakan buffet spread at Katong Village Hotel. Spread is rather huge for the price, but the food taste is so-so. Curry chicken and ponteh chicken rather bland. Salt duck soup very saltish. Nyonya laksa is is still manageable. The only 2 outstanding are the appetiser, which consists of kimchi, achar etc and durian penget.

There’s a wide variety of food to choose from with a mix of Peranakan food and other cuisines too! There are live stations and diy stations along with their buffet spread which made the experience more fun. I particularly liked the laksa which was very flavourful and the appetising achar too! The staff provided prompt and good service which made the dining experience very enjoyable :)

Disclaimer: Was here for a tasting but I saw how the staff treated other guests similarly as well ☺️

Emmanuel Stall at Marine Parade Food Centre is an absolute gem! They sell normal rice and dishes but what I always come back for is the nonya blue pea nasi lemak. The chilli packs a punch too.

I normally order fish and vetables with the blue pea nasi lemak.Price is decent for the taste as well. Actually the other dishes go together with white rice is good too. Been a patron of this stall since this is my home ground.

Not only is the food exceptional, but the service is also top-notch. They take great pride in their food, and it truly shows in every dish.

The ambiance of the food center is bustling, adding to the overall dining experience. It's a great place to enjoy authentic Singaporean cuisine.

Emmanuel Stall at Marine Parade Food Centre is a culinary delight. If you're in the area, don't miss the opportunity to savor their delicious offerings.

Do take note they are off on Tue to Thurs.Also blue pea nasi lemak only avail on Fri to Sun.

I’ve always wanted to try the Nonya Nasi Lemak at Emmanuel Peranakan, which is one of the more popular stalls at 84 Marine Parade Central Hawker Centre.

No luck this time either, so I went with their regular Nasi lemak. Took fish fillet, chicken, begedel, tofu and fried egg.

Rice is very ok, not flavourful. I liked the begedel and the chicken. Fish is well cooked. The egg and tofu weren’t good - quite bland and didn’t seem fresh.

For $8.5, it’s on the more expensive side too.

LOVE their sayur lodeh!! This dish of theirs hasn’t been getting the attention it deserves - it’s creamy and strong on the coconut milk - probably one of the best I’ve eaten!

Their blue pea coconut rice is pretty interesting too: it kinda has the texture/flavour of the glutinous rice you find at the bottom of kueh salat haha and so it’s stickier then usual and has a mild sweet fragrance to it.

Would definitely dabao my lunches from here if I stay around the area. It’s somewhat pricey but well, it does taste better than the other mixed veg rice options out there!

My perennial favorite hawker stall. The menu is wide. My favorites will be fried chicken wings, cod fish batter, bombs, fish otah. The curry gravy is heavenly. This is a place whereby you can have a decent meal at a decent price. My only grouse is that they should open more during the week.

Friendly shop owner and reasonably priced. The Nyonya nasi lemak is a nice twist of the usual one with excellent chicken rendang. However, the sambal chilli isn’t super spicy.

Overall food was abit disappointing, more on the salty side.  But some people may like it. Environment was good as it was just renovated. Nice and cozy. Service was also fast. Opposite was an open air parking, so no concern.

Great peranakan cuisine by far in the East side! 👍👍 love their assam fish & itik sio dishes, portions were generous too for a small serving. I have to say their dishes served there alludes warm & comforting home cooked food.

The food was excellent - well executed, good ingredients, served piping hot and fresh. Quick too.

We came as a family of four and ordered 7 dishes + 2 desserts. That was entirely too much food as the portions are generous, we could probably do with 1-2 dishes less.

Order consisted of:
- Sambal squid
- Laksa Goreng
- Honey Pork Ribs
- Fried chicken wings
- Meatball soup
- Egg & shrimp fried rice
- Jackfruit curry

Desserts were delicious also, and were portioned for individual consumption.

Overall dining environment is pleasant - clean & comfortable. Service was quick, though staff could be slightly more attentive.

I’m already looking forward to our next visit ♥️

I find their Nyonya food is nice overall, but a bit pricey. Portion is pretty small given the price, maybe due to inflation..

Passed by a few times and always wanted to try it. Last week decide to eat this impromptu since we are around.

If u coming big groups it would be better to reserve in advance as they have to turn away groups due to no seating available.

We order all small portion of Babi ponteh, chap Chye, otah and kepeting soup.

Love the Babi ponteh, chap Chye and soup. Good stuff with nice portion.

Otah is disappointing. Taste not so heavy, nothing to shout about.

Overall will come back again. One of the good Peranakan food in Singapore.

If you have in mind the usual traditional Peranakan food, this is not the place for you. The dishes are more fusion-modern and bar-like. Food is generally appealing to taste buds, staff comes across as friendly, what I really love is the interior aesthetics and vibes.

Certainly interesting for an experience, but perhaps not a return visit, and the prices tend to be a little high.

Service excellence goes to Marivel and Aeron. We had a great dining experience because of them.

Food was great too! Kudos to the Chef!!!

I couldn't say anything bad for the ambience of the restaurant as it bring more effect to the experience.

Here for the four-hands collaboration and got to try dishes of very different cuisines. Very friendly staff and delicious food! Weekend lunch seems slightly crowded do make a booking if you can! There's a beautiful outdoor area that is pet-friendly!

Nice cosy Asian fusion restaurant in the heart of Katong with stunning casual interiors. We came on a weekday evening, and only 3-4 tables were occupied.

We had red wine and decided to have it along with the following :

1) Chilli Crab Cake - Nice crispy croquettes that pairs well with the chilli crab sauce.

2) Rendang Lasagna - Nice rendang sauce, that is not too fiery. Mix it well with the cheesy lasagna and you have a winner.

3) Salmon main served on a bed of mash potato, some noodles and veggies.

As a guest of Hotel Indigo, we enjoyed their breakfast buffet and room service. The breakfast was included with our room rate so we took advantage and the staff was helpful to point out the vegan options and made us a veggie currie and roti to go with the buffet, we were full and taken care of. The fruit was a bit bland and the cappuccino was a bit bitter, but overall good variety for breakfast and we were full for hours.

The room service came in clutch after being exhausted after a long day of walking and shopping. We ordered the Assam Curry Seabass, the Chap Chae, Sauteed veggies, and jasmine rice - we didn’t venture into the fusion dishes and kept it simple. Everything was flavorful, especially the Sea Bass, and it arrived quickly and piping hot, totally satisfying!

A must buy whenever I’m around that area. The shop is very peranakan-ly done up. They sell a wide variety of traditional Nyonya Kuehs, Nyonya bak zhang(Dumplings), cookies and biscuits. They have mini Nyonya bak zhang too. I love the Nyonya and Salty ones!! Mini ones at $1.50, regular ones at $4.50. Fillings gao gao. Support local, you can even use Kris+, by Singapore airlines to make payment 😂

Craving for Nonya Kueh, this is one of stalls is recommended online. But the taste was not up to my expectations.

During Covid, I ordered the Bak Zhang via delivery. The glutinous rice was undercooked, so the dumpling were unpalatable. I do not have this issue when I buy the Bak Zhang from the shop. I like to eat Kim Choo Bak Zhang.

Was gifted this by a friend and when I know it’s from Kim Choo, you enjoy every moment because you know there’s a bit of heritage, history, heirloom you are experiencing.

The glutinous rice layer breaks apart softly to reveal the filling with anticipation. One mouthful and you experience an alternating taste of sweet and savoury of the chinese five spice powder and lean pork.

There will be newer flavours; more exotic proteins; colours - and yes that should be the way.

But I take comfort that there is a homely version we can all return to.

‘Kim’ me the zhang cos I ‘Choo’ the original anytime.

Having bought from KCKC for years, it’s generally has been ok to good but never quite hitting the 5 stars mark. Perhaps it’s because they spread their products to include obvious 3rd party suppliers. So today we decide to try 1 items. fish cracker  has more flour than fish having eaten this snacks from across Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore. it’s also over fried.   Lastly they only accept purchases over $15 if you wish to pay cashless or card or swipe.

Wanted eat Penang fried kway teow but sold out at 730pm . Went for the clay pot rice which was ok. My wife went for ban mian as mee hoon kway also sold out..Shouldn't such places cater for enough items if they want to do business... A go to place if you want a quick and fuss free meal.

My personal review, Malaysia Chiak stall at Singpost generally offers Penang fried kuey teow, a popular Malaysian dish. The overall experience at the stall may vary, but based on customer feedback, the taste and quality of their Penang fried kuey teow is usually average. It's always best to try it for yourself and form your own opinion based on your personal taste preferences.

Overall I feel it’s extremely value for money at $5.50. You get claypot chicken rice with a decent amount of chicken. The rice has a good char and there are tiny bits of salted fish. I think many people give flak about the minimal service but the price reflects the service. It’s one of the cheapest full meals you get in the mall anyways. Not the best claypot rice in SG but definitely above average.

Chilli is definitely very good tho. It’s like chicken rice chili but spicier.

Used to be good when it first started. Food quality and service have deteriorated over time. Recently did take away and the queue system was horrible, its disorganised and staffs are angsty with the need to order and cook... Ended up they did not separate the noodle and it was all soggy...there goes my lunch

$5 Asam Laksa, pretty good taste, will come here again👍💯

Large variety of halal food. Great choices with authentic Muslim cuisine. Out of curiosity, tried the dry lontong which is quite good, something different. Reasonably priced.

Iconic market in the East... has 2 levels comprising the market and sundry stalls on the Ground level  offering a myriad  of grocery and  market items,  and Hawker dining and retail stalls offering apparel and household items on the Second level. Very crowded especially on weekends. Time for a major renovation to the market area and hawker dining area as it's very congested. A few hawker stalls on the 2nd level are "Legacy Hawkers" having existed in the old Geylang Serai Market 50 years ago or more.

Yesterday at Geylang Serai, saw charming  44 to 60 Changi Road, mixed commercial and residential shophouse enclave with a post-World War charm. Time seems to stand still here, offering a serene escape from the bustling cityscape. The slow pace of life allows visitors to immerse themselves in the traditional Malay culture and food that permeates the area. From the tantalizing aromas of Malay cuisine to the enchanting sounds of traditional music, Geylang Serai offers a nostalgic retreat, capturing the essence of a bygone era.

At Geylang Market, you can get almost everything down here. Now under this one stop roof, you can get food, marketing groceries, apparel, fruits & authentic traditional jamu also. Do spent time to wonder around this market be it at level 1 & 2.

Clean, spacious and airy (thanks to the high ceiling) hawker centre with many food stalls. Good for locals and tourists alike.

This malaysia styled bkt is the kind that I prefer, rather than Singapore's peppery kind. Ordered the mix soup which was not overpowering with herbs. Mixed intestines and parts were generous enough, and I like that the ribs are of smaller sizes that just falls off the bone and easy to eat. Despite eating at peak lunch hours, I hardly perspired. Price is reasonable and they accept visa which is a plus. Will try the dry version in the next visit

One of the best bkt!!! Love the soup and the chilli with garlic, so malaysia style. They allow refill of soup only once! The green vegetables so sweet and crunchy.
They have other food like frog porridge, small side dishes if you don’t like the ribs.

First time trying Malaysian style BKT, the herbal soup tastes quite different from Singaporean style. Both mutton and pork are delicious, port knuckle also soft n tender. Highly recommend the rice noodle which goes with the herbal soup very well

nice Bak Kut teh with herbal flavour.
The mutton soup is also good, mutton meet is very tender.
crispy intestine is very unique with the spring onion inside. good texture.
Friendly staff.

Herbal style Bah Ku Teh (pork ribs and organ soup). Youtiao are soggy. We tried signature bah ku teh soup and dry versions and they are nice. We didn’t enjoy the organs. You can also have frog dishes with porridge. A bit pricier in my view. The shop can be improved in many ways.

Went the the outlet at Geylang Serai. We were a bit confused initially as there were 2 entrances/exits. Recommended to split up such that some look for seats and some queue to order as the queue was rather long. Food wise, it is definitely worth the trip down. It was affordable, delicious and the service was great despite the crowd. There were 2 staff at the cashier who will help you to bring the food to your seats. We will definitely return to try other dishes on the menu!

It may seem daunting but here's what you should do when you come here:
1) Find a table to chope
2) Queue to order food
3) Decide whether you want to order the different dishes to be eaten separately (medium or large size) or individually (on the 1 plate for 1 person).
4) Share you order verbally with the staff who will assist to prepare your order
5) Carry your plate to the cashier station nearby (note: if you need help to carry all the separate dishes, you can inform the staff the table number)
6) Pay for your food & drinks
7) Head to the drinks station to inform the staff to prepare your paid drinks and/or grab the canned/bottles drinks from the chiller.

Personally, today I ordered rice with terung balado, rendang daging, urap, bagedil & kuah lemak cili padi. It was a great meal for only $9.6. The beef rendang was sooo tender. The terung balado was cooked perfectly and it wasn't too oily. The urap was fresh. Bagedil was good as always. Lastly the lemak cili padi was flavourful.

After the meal, I also grabbed some traditional Malay kuih for dessert, which costs $1.1 per slice.

Often crowded. Today I went first thing in morning oh mine the nasi is 5 stars. I know breakfast i heavy… they have the best beef rendang,  Teh Tarik is not too sweet and polite staffs. I will definitely visit again soon!!

Snaking long queues for the food with a little madness for weekend ordering, ample seating on 2nd floor. Had the tauhu telur, sotong, Ayam baker, sambal goreng. Hits all the right spots for comfort food for Singaporeans. Efficient service.

The Nasi Sambal Goreng set and Ayam Goreng rocks! Nasi Padang don’t get much better than this in my opinion. Every dish served was delicious and flavorful. Lovely sambal belacan. Overall shiok. But the Goreng Pisang dough too thick and hard not delicate crispy.

Food was served promptly despite us ordering quite a variety of food. There is a crab promotion that is going on. However,
It’s kind of obvious that the crabs are not really that fresh, hence the pricing. Other dishes were quite tasty and value of money. The Kai lan vegetables were very tasty, a must order dish in my opinion. Barley tasted too sweet.

It is ideally situated close to the Aljunied MRT. You can choose between outdoor and air-conditioned sitting.

On various days, there are special promotions. They had $15 soon hock fish and $45 volcano chicken on Monday and Tuesday, respectively. For specials, give the restaurant a call before you visit.

It's a manual reservation, and you should ask the restaurant to text you a confirmation in case they accidentally forget your booking

A good location for gatherings of friends and family.

Food was generally good. The salted egg squid was excellent -- squid cooked to perfection and we actually tasted the salted egg! The pork belly was also very good -- flavorful and crispy-tender. Wasn't a fan of the crispy noodles, though. If you order that, ask if you can have the sauce separate so the noodles stay crispy. Also, one of the waiters threw a tantrum while we were there.

I brought my wife for a good meal in Singapore and notice this simple restaurant along the street when I drive . Penang Seafood ...and we drop by for the seafood ..to our suprise that there had been a promotion to the crab . Price so worth for it. At $68 for 2 crabs.  Simply look at the size of the crab.....and it just so delicious 🤤

All the dishes we picked were really good. Especially the spicy bee Hoon and baby squid garlic. They only take reservations for 6 pax and above. For small group walk-ins, come earlier at 6pm. Wait staff are friendly. Open-air Carpark opposite MRT and walk over. Spent sg$107 for 2 carbs, 3 dishes and 4 drinks, great pricing!

Sedap! One of the few authentic Malay cuisine stalls in this market selling Malay Kueh & traditional menu, like Mee Soto, Mee Siam, Lotong & etc. Serving breakfast & early lunch only. Irregular off day. Unpredictable mood. Occasionally "angin", but most of the time friendly. Highly recommended!

One of the best Malay snacks around. Their epok epok are damn shiok. Jack fruit fritters also shiok. Same quality but cheaper than their T3 branch.

There is a fantastic ayam penyet here, probably one of the best I've ever had. The chicken is moist and crunchy, and the sambal is extremely flavorful.

There is also a putu piring stall that is very much worth queuing for!

I have no issue with the food choices here but the chairs are not good for big sized people. Too soft that the moment I sit, I can feel the legs start to spread. Sometimes I have to put an extra chair to make it sturdy. Can the management change the chairs, please?

Whenever I am within the Geylang Serai area, Mr. Teh Tarik is one of my favorite places to go.

We went there to get our Hokkien mee and fried Kway Teow for lunch. It is near the entrance just beside the pisang goreng stall.

As always, the 2 dishes we ordered are Hokkien mee and fried kway teow. Ironically, although the menu is Chinese but the cook is of Indian heritage and he cooks it perfectly and fast too. You don't have to wait long to get your food.

The Hokkien mee was flavourful and not too soggy. Fresh prawns and ingredients. The Fried Kway Teow with clams is spot on too. The "char" taste is present with the right amount of sweet dark sauce.

Then coupled with teh tarik to end your meal is so blissfully satisfying. Give it a try if you are nearby.

Warung Syuhadah nasi lemak and nasi rawon taste wasn't nice. All 4 of my family agreed. Chicken was so dry and hard. Begedil was very very oily too.

Food quality is surprisingly good - I had the beef rendang, fried tempeh, otah, asam pedas gravy on the rice. Don’t expect ambience or service quality here, it’s a very busy lunchtime crowd and Makcik prefers transactions to be quick and quiet. If you want to know any item prices, just refer to the display board which is fairly accurate.

Tasty Nasi Padang and Malay food

Delighted to dine here today.  Authentic Indonesian food by three young Indonesian sisters who learnt the cuisine from their mom.  Their focus is on delivering quality creative and flavourful Indonesian dishes.  Portion is quite good.  Nice simple cosy cafe in the heartland with limited seating capacity.  Good to make reservations during peak time.  Hope to try more dishes next time!

Very authentic Indonesian food.

I ordered the oxtail soup and the grilled chicken.

The oxtail was so fall off the bone tender and bustling with amazing flavours.

The grilled chicken was very well grilled with a nice caramelized finish.

Loved the chilli paste that came with the dishes. Rustic that comes with a punch.

Will definitely be back for my Indonesian food fix!

Keep up the good work!

Went here on a Monday afternoon. Restaurant was very quiet. We ordered fried oxtail with rice, fried chicken with rice, corn fritters, ginger drink and rose drink (bandung). Oxtail was well-cooked but tasted a bit salty. Fried chicken was nicely cooked. I liked their new item, the corn fritters. Ginger drink was nice but could have been more flavourful. We liked the ambience but would have liked items to be more affordable. Place was also very stylish and posh looking but our cutlery kept making loud noises as we ate. Nice place to go once in a while.

This is my first time trying fried oxtail, I liked the juiciness of meat with a hint of salt. The traditional oxtail soup feels healthy without the overwhelming strong flavour compared to the others that I tried.
A must-try is their signature ginger drink! Not spicy and smells so fragrant!!!

I enjoyed the quiet ambience and the pleasant service. Gonna bring my whole family here the next time!

Great location with a multi storey carpark just beside the restaurant. Staff are very friendly and great with recommendations. Food comes freshly prepared and the sauce on the chicken was very flavorful and the soups they gave with each dish are also worthy as dishes themselves. They have quite a few oxtail options and those are definitely worth a try also.

Quite a wide range of dishes on the menu. Rendang was lean, and hence tougher than expected  though the taste was great. Gado Gado and tahu telur were pleasant, though the peanuts used in Gado Gado wasn't the most fresh tasting. Chicken satay was tender and not overgrilled, peanut sauce was good. Ikan pepes was nicely done. The yellow rice was fluffy, with long grains separating nicely. Overall, they seemed a bit short of staff. Sambal was good.

Food was moderate. The food wasn’t serve hot and the taste was okay. Felt really bloated after eating, immediately I knew food was prepared way earlier and not freshly cooked and serve. I have very sensitive gastric. To go back or not? Nah.

This is not the first time we dine at Tambuah Mas.  The food is good, quite authentic.  Service is not the best, probably due to shortage of staff and poor training.

Authentic Indonesian dishes, rich in flavour. The Tauhu Teloh is one of the best in town.

The experience from making reservation to dining was excellent. They were accommodating to our big group and the service during the dining pleasant. Food was good as usual. Highlight is the deep fried fish which was fresh and crispy. The beef rendang was a bit dry compared to what I had at the Tanglin Shopping Centre branch. But overall the food and service did not disappoint and we all enjoyed our dinner.

A gem that located at 2nd floor of Lucky Plaza. It's Indonesian kind of stall (depot makan). Couple times we tried their food and we found that their ayam geprek with sambal bali / matah is the must have item when you're here. The price was justify the taste and amount of the food.

Their fried boneless chicken was nice, the fragant rice and everything was in generous portion. We tried their other sambal but nothing can beat their sambal bali, the rice vermicelli toward hot & strong white pepper-y smell and taste.

One of the same staffs couple times looked so unfriendly, maybe too tired after working long hour but wore a mask still couldn't hide the look. Since the person's working in service industry he needs to spread the joy, welcoming spirit and friendliness.

Since their sweet martabak is really sought after, it's better for you to order the sweet martabak in advance as they have a limited slot in a day.

They have launched a new menu in their new outlet and boy it was so good!

I tried the Soto Betawi, which is a hearty beef soup simmered in a coconut milk based broth. Its light on the palate, not thick and the umami, they nailed it!

One of my new favorite Indonesian food eatery! I was so glad when I found out that I could order via whatsapp and arranged my own courier because I stay in the east and rarely got the chance to go Orchard. Tried almost everything in their menu and none was ever disappointing.

My favorites are soto betawi, ayam geprek, batagor and tempe bacem. My hubby and I are tempeh (soybean cake) lovers, so we love to try tempeh dishes every chance we got, and we never find tempeh bacem (seasoned tempeh) anymore in Singapore after the last eatery that had it closed down long ago. We were elated that Gading have it, and it was very very delicious! Sadly it was unavailable this time around, but it definitely become our must order dish. The ayam geprek is tender, generous portion and great with any kind of sambal, have tried the sambal mercon, kemangi and bali - all were amazingly good with different levels of spiciness. The soto betawi soup is so rich I always finish it till the last drop. And the batagor taste authentic and very nice, just that the portion is a bit small for its price.

Tried the martabak in two separate occasions, black charcoal (chocolate and cheese with charcoal dough) and classic (chocolate, cheese, peanuts). Had the classic one with add-on wijsman dutch butter at additional $4 and no peanuts. Both were amazing! Adding wijsman butter just made it even more delicious, the extra cost was a tad pricey though, maybe I’d say it’s worth it if it were $3 price point.

Overall, Gading offers great Indonesian food that I will definitely love to order again and again.

I was walking around 313@somerset when I saw this little shop at the basement. I was quite excited to see they are selling martabak (basically Indonesian version of pancake/min Jiang kueh that is more decadent and unhealthy). My normal go-to for martabak is pancake boss at Bugis so decided to give this one a try.

I ordered the original and top up $4 for wijsman butter. Total damage is $19.90. A bit on the pricy side when compared to pancake boss. The martabak can easily feed 2-3 people (better to share due to high calories).

The martabak is delicious, sweet and a little salty from the cheese. They use good quality chocolate rice (much better than the one used by pancake boss).

Nice to see more martabak shops in SG (there is another martabak shop in ION Orchard but I have not tried it).

Overall, I highly recommend this shop for your martabak fix.

Give it 5 stars as the main course were so delicious. The ikan Bakar is nicely done with the kicap manis sauce. Ayam penyet is soft and tasty. Thank for serving us diff sambal as requested. We also ordered original martabak in advanced but the filling still abit bland.
