Sambal Petai King is to die for, it's so good you can just eat with plain white rice. Char Kway Teow is a chef's kiss, I'm not exaggerating, try it for yourself. Sambal fish is so-so,abit sweet ,not to my liking . Nasi Padang also not bad, consist of what I think is vegetarian chicken rendang,soy tofu,vege lemak lodeh and sambal egg belado.Orh luak with oyster mushroom is also good, not oily at all , taste on point , actually better than the real thing.Bak mie is tasty,noodle springy,mock shredded chicken is unnecessary,the fried wonton is good though,I settle with level 1 spiciness which to me is pretty hot. Satay is so-so,don't really taste like the real thing, tasted like regular deep fried mock meat, satay sauce can't mask save it either.
Service is super fast, 5 different person served us, all are very warm, friendly and are always smiling. Even though we came just 30 mins before their break time which is at 3pm.We feel welcomed!

We have never tasted Indonesian vegetarian, find the dishes not bad but nothing special. We ordered the Rendang fried rice, sanbal sweet potato leaves, otahs and gardo gardo. Find it pricey n felt the portion were not justified, especially the gardo gardo.

My first on an Indonesian take of vegetarian fare, as strongly insisted by the friend as a counter-proposal to my initial spot for vegetarian food. Small and cozy restaurant along the ground floor close to the entrance. Great spread of Indonesian food in vegetarian version if you are game for it.

Place is cooling, sheltered, and very accessible from the MRT.

I had a wonderful experience at Warong Ijo!

This new outlet is located conveniently near the MRT making it more accessible.

The vegetarian dishes they offer are simply amazing – full of flavor and beautifully presented. The friendly staff made my visit even more enjoyable. It's not often you find a place that caters so well to vegetarians while providing top-notch service. I highly recommend trying their delicious dishes and soaking in the welcoming atmosphere.

Very happy to come across this vegetarian restaurant!

All the dishes we had were full of flavors yet not too salty. I particularly like Orh Luak (oyster mushroom omelette), Lumpiah Goreng (spring rolls), and stir fried spinach.

Rendang lion mane mushroom was quite spicy and oily.

Saturday dinner was very busy. A very lively place.

Been here twice so far.

Expect to pay at least $8.50 for 2 veggies and 1 meat (at the time of review).

Food is decent taste-wise.

But whether it is worth the above-average cost, I will leave it to the reader.

Personally for me, I rate it as 4/5 overall.

Centrally located, Warung M Nasir is within walking distance from Somerset MRT. Food turned out DELICIOUS and surprisingly even the teh bing is yummy. Highly recommend this place to everyone! I only have two points for improvement to raise. The tahu telor was super salty. Skip this dish please. Also, unsure why the lighting was crazy dim. I could barely see what I was eating. Please turn up the lights! It didnt help the ambience, trust me. But overall, a wonderful meal.

Tasted wee bit on the sweet side otherwise ok.  Quality if rice bit too broken.  Lopez not bad teh tarik too dilute.  Pricing ok.

Love the chicken rendang and sambal brinjal. The chicken rendang is rich in flavour and will give you the mmmmm factor!!  Beef rendang is also a favourite here though, I didn't order it.  For drinks, just order the teh botol.

The perks of eating here are no queues to wait in, and a fairly comfortable seating atmosphere, however, the food isn’t as good as the ones on north bridge rd. The gravies and dishes fall short of a real oomph and flavor. Ok for a quick meal if in the area but I’d rather opt for the real deal elsewhere.

I like Bumbu restaurant’s interior design, is unique and Peranakan decorating. Foods are nice and mouthwatering. I would recommend chili prawns, the gravy is flavourful. I will definitely come back to try other dishes! This place is suitable for company, family and friends gathering, why not?? There have set up the beautiful partition so it gives us privacy when dining.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bumbu Restaurant in the Arab/Muslim neighborhood of Singapore, and it was a unique experience. The restaurant’s decor is a refreshing blend of Thai and Indonesian antiques, which added a distinctive touch to the ambiance.

The food at Bumbu is a fusion of Thai and Indonesian flavors, which made for an interesting culinary journey. I ordered the Tom Kha soup, which was incredibly flavorful and packed with chicken. I also tried the Thai-style chili basil, although it was a bit on the salty side. The olive fried rice was a delightful addition to the meal.

One of the standout aspects of Bumbu was their excellent service. The staff was friendly and attentive, which enhanced the overall dining experience.

In conclusion, Bumbu Restaurant is definitely worth a visit if you’re looking for a unique blend of Thai and Indonesian flavors in a beautifully decorated setting. I had a great time, and I believe you will too!

Had a great experience here this evening! First time here and was impressed with the service and food quality. While the portions seemed a bit small, it allowed for us to order more variety! We tried the chicken buah keluak (love the spoons that came with the dish to help with the nut!), signature rendang, chap Chye, prawn egg, fish maw soup, and ended off with chendol! Everything tasted very authentic! We really enjoyed the sambal belachan too, which was complimentary! Will be back again to try more dishes in future! Service was excellent, and the interior was beautiful!

Delicious Indonesian-Thai food in a beautiful IG-worthy restaurant! We enjoyed the dining experience here.

Not much food pictures because too tasty and hungry to eat immediately. 😂
Jokes aside I appreciate their innovation and effort to making their dishes as they planned to taste as possible. I would say their dishes has many influences from Chinese, Malaysia, Indonesia, even Thailand. Very innovative. Their interior aesthetics were so picture worthy.

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Finally dared to try this Penyet place as 1)it's usually quite empty, and 2)we haven't really felt up to eating a boatload of fried stuff in one sitting. Turns out, it's surprisingly good!

The Tahu Telor is a must-try for all! It's so difficult to get this dish nowadays at your neighbourhood hawker as it's quite labour intensive to make. Soft tofu cubes are deliciously coated in a big mound of egg, the tastiest parts being the flossy burnt ends. Add in a generous heaping of beansprouts, julienned cucumbers and carrots in tangy kicap Manis sauce. The peanut gravy was served separately, so that you can control the amount of sauce/ sweetness you want in your dish. We usually cannot finish a Tauhu Telor but as this didn't feel as oily and heavy, finishing it was a breeze. There wasn't a lot of oil leftover on the plate either.

The Sour Vegetable Soup is good as an appetizer or palate cleanser between heavy dishes. Cabbages, long beans, turnips and peanuts were simmered in a sweet-sour broth with flavours of tamarind, galangal, turmeric and shallots. It was refreshing but I found the peanuts undercooked and rather crunchy. Not sure whether I love or hate nuts done as such.

The Fried Pomfret was quite basic, it was lightly battered in some turmeric cornstarch and served with Spice Level 5 Fiery Chili. This dark coloured Chili gives quite a good punch unblocking my blocked nose but it was not strong enough to mask the fishiness of the fish. I felt that the pomfret was not super fresh as I could taste some staleness near its belly portion.

Lastly, we had the Mozzarella Smashed Chicken cutlet. The chicken meat was really tender and not dry at all, the bits of flour coating hanging on it was flavourfully soaked with mozzarella cheese, which was thrown atop the chicken and lightly torched before serving. We chose a Level 1 Sweet Chili to be served with it. This Chili is great for beginning spice eaters as it's super smooth and sweet with an oniony taste.

The smashed fried duck really came off easily when poked with a fork, we tried the Level 3 Shrimp Paste chili with it and the pairing turned out heavenly. I found the Level 3 chili a little sweeter than expected but it was well received by the others.

The Honey Marinated Beef Ribs were also thoroughly pre-simmered to achieve tenderness, although meat grain was slightly stringy and tough, the sweet kicap manis marinade made the dish whets up a good appetite and made it easier to swallow. The Level 2 Green Chili was one of the least sweet chili, with aromatic notes of coriander and green pepper.

The Teh Tarik Kosong Ice is really rich and good. It was full bodied with vanilla notes with a rich, milky mouthfeel.
It's a nice place to overindulge and grab a deep fried dinner. Cleanliness of the place could be improved. There were strands of hair and bits of batter on the benches we chose.

Will revisit to try more dishes!

Total damage: $37-42 for 3 pax

Yummy Indonesian food.  Surprisingly good.  The chilli has up to 7 levels to be selected.

We ordered Ayam Bakar Taliwang Kampung (S$14.50), Iga Bakar (beef) (S$14.50), and Tahu Telor (S$8.50).  We opted for level 3 chilli which was spicy and good enough for our liking.

Will definitely return for other food.

Update as of 28 Oct 2022:
Tried the fried chicken, gado gado and my favourite tahu telor.  The chicken was nice.  As for the gado gado, it was just ok as it had the same gravy/sauce as tahu telor.

Portion abit small but the taste is cook. Chicken are nicely fried and tender. Chilli Aso shiok but quite spicy

Recommend to try!

There's a good spread of Indonesian dishes. The food was good. The asam rebus soup tasted good but could be better if they also use belinjau nuts and leaves (but I know it's not easy to find in Singapore). The tahu telor was also good but could be improved by having more tahu to attain a good balance between the tahu & telor. The grilled chicken was okay although the meat was a little dry; could be a bit more juicy and moist and tasted better if fresh chicken was used instead of frozen chicken. The fish (tilapia and pomfret) dishes were my favourite. The fish meat was juicy and tender whilst the exterior was crispy and well prepared. I will visit again and will want to try their equivalent of beef bakso and other dishes also. Well done guys!

A little too pricey. $10.30 for 1 ayam penyet (takeaway). Rice was also charged. Taste of the food was not great. I will stick to the good old ayam penyet ria or president in the future.

Came all the way from KL for a work trip and stopped by this resto for a good lunch.

The food is tasty, we took a few lauk lauk with rice. The tauhu goreng was good, and it deserves another repetition the next time I stop by Singapore.

Food portion is good. Could be a lot if you’re not a big eater. But still worth it and your tummy will thank you 🤣

They have outdoor seatings as well as air conditioned area upstairs. You have to order at the counter first. It could be quite busy during lunch hour, but worth the wait for the food !

Spoiled by choices, vast selection of mains and side dishes on display. Tried a handful of dishes and most of them are fragrant and tasty. Their vegetable side dishes were also well executed. Kind of slightly salty for me.

However, prices here are at a premium, especially with the limiting portion served. Good authentic nasi padang with their main customers observed as tourist during my visit. Not a meal to be enjoyed daily at this price point. And especially during lunch time, the hot weather is a push away factor for me to revisit.

Rumah Makan Minang Pte Ltd is one of the best Malay food restaurants I have ever been to. This hidden gem located on Kandahar Street serves authentic nasi Padang that is so tasty, you will be dreaming about it for days after. The menu offers a lot of selection, but be prepared to wait in line as the dishes can run out quickly.

The restaurant's atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff members are friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend trying their Rendang and Soto Ayam, which are so flavorful and cooked to perfection. The dishes are served fresh and hot, and the portions are generous.

The only downside is that the restaurant is quite popular and sometimes can be crowded, so I suggest getting there early or being prepared to wait in line. Overall, if you're looking for authentic Malay food that is both delicious and affordable, Rumah Makan Minang Pte Ltd is the place for you.

I came here a few times and the queue really speaks for how popular this place is. The fun starts with queuing and ordering the food. It’s also good to come here in a bigger group, so you get to savour the various dishes. My favourite is the tender beef rendang and the tauhu telur. Their best part is that there is an air-conditioned seating area on level 2 that is accessible by a staircase at the side.

I've eaten malay cooking for aeons; the taste and flavours of each kind of dish are ingrained in my DNA. Sadly, for such a popular name as Minang, the food is poor in taste and very pricy. For the lunch I had, it cost me $45 sgd.
There are many small stalls in foodcourt that can rival this restaurant.
The taste is just not up to standard, lack of salt, flavour and richness of Malay cooking. If its about healthy living, there are alternatives that they can add to maintain the standard. Like KFC, McD, they remain consistent throughout the eras... if these big names can do it, so can they.

l I must say, this place is one of the best spots to savor a delicious plate of Ayam Penyet. I tend to opt for their BBQ chicken over the fried version, simply due to personal preference. While their service might come across as blunt, it's undeniably efficient. And let me tell you, their fried tofu is a must-try; it's a personal favorite of mine. The self-serving free flow of soup is a major plus. Price-wise, it's a bit on the higher side, typically exceeding $15. All in all, if you're in the area, it's definitely a great choice to relish some Ayam Penyet!

Surprise, surprise, we didn't expect much at all, thinking it was just another average restaurants, we were so delighted we had one of our most memorable dining experiences.
The grilled chicken, satays, beef rendang, were cooked to perfection! This was the closest thing to eating in Jakarta. The price is reasonable too, this will be our favorite to eat when we crave Indonesian food.

Good food. Self serve soup. Good variety of options to choose from. Fairly good portion side. The grill beef feels quite dry for me but the rest was good. 🤷‍♂️ good serve fairly quickly.
Have good seatings for group. Maybe just me but it’s was a bit warm inside the restaurant. Not a bad feed but I expected better? Reasonable price for the location.

The fried chicken and beef rendang were delicious ( with ooomph!).  Gado gado was ok but the tahu telor can definitely be improved, perhaps because it was reheated and not freshly prepared.

Yummy Ayam Penyet and other Is Indonesian dishes at affordable prices.

The chicken was succulent and crispy without being greasy. The accompanying tofu and tempeh were very good too. Tofu was soft on the inside and tempeh was crispy. The catfish was very generously sized. Overall, I would say the portions were generous.

Only dish that was a a bit of a letdown was the kangkong which was a little soggy. Still, we will return for other dishes.

We have been coming here on days when my mum requested for vegetarian meals, always enjoyed eating here. Food available suits even my picky nephews 😅

We always order the curries and toufu, and pastas for kids. 😋

Shiok!!!! Impressive food place. As an Indian vegetarian, I enjoyed every bit of it. The food order can be altered even to suit vegans. Don’t miss this place must try place for everyone locals as well as tourist, don’t forget to try Singapore delight food Laksa.

The restaurant is located just opposite the Beauty World MRT station. We had lunch (3pax) on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded. Service was prompt and polite, prices were reasonable. We loved all the dishes (bitter gourd in black bean sauce, fried egg & tomatoes, steamed tofu) except for the deep-fried sweet and sour mushroom, which wasn't exceptional (more chewy than crispy). They have a good selection of infused rice and serve different hot and cold beverages (including BBT). Recommended!

was there at 9.15pm, we know your last order 9.30pm and the cafe has no crowd.

Hmmm perhaps your boss earn enough for today and you suggested us to take away instead?

Quite disappointed and decided to travel else where to fill our hungry tummy instead.

I will reconsider whether will want to visit your place again if given the choice.

Nice vegetarian food! The Nasi Lemak has a nice flavour on the rice, though not overly done, chilli goes with this dish in my opinion. The ngoh hiang is a bit hard but the taste make up for it. If you don't like too hard stuff, maybe you want to skip this dish. Toufu has a great mixed of sauces. Claypot rice looks better than the taste though, so I'll skip this next time, as I'm one with heavy taste. Cereal "prawn" is very well done, such that I can just go with cereal and rice if need to. Overall, this place has enough dishes and set meal to cater to most, so I'll not take any stars off, especially the ambience and service is well above average.

Great food, since many years ago. Vegetarian but meat eaters will enjoy this place too.

Mezze platter was quite big even for 2 pax.

Really enjoyed the moussaka and the Spanakopita.

If you pay by cash there is some free ice cream.

First time visiting due to friend’s recommendation. Did not disappoint. Lots of options that don’t make you feel you’re eating vegetarian. Drink menu is extensive but on pricey side. Service was good.

Ambience - The restaurant has this very European, relaxed vibe. Good for families but I don‘t see why you can’t go for a date either 😁

Food - my friend and I ordered the halloumi salad and lasagna. We really enjoyed the meal, the ingredients were good quality and food was prepared with care. However, did feel the halloumi was a bit too salty. They have a variety of Mediterranean and Italian options and can make it vegan too. Didn’t really enjoy the rose though.

Service - prompt service and the staff were polite and friendly

Would definitely return again.

You won't believe how rare it is to have a Mediterranean vegetarian place that has so many allium free options, including the Pizzas. Glad to see original sin survive the pandemic when many didn't.

The Moussaka and Mediterranean pizza were good, though a little too salty but that's probably just me. Nice ambience for a date with friends or the significant other, especially over a good conversation. You pay for the quality. Enjoy!

Wonderful and classy vegetarian restaurant. Had dinner here with the wife on a weekday evening. Food was wholesome, good service and atmosphere. Recommended!

We tried their Mala Xiang Guo, Oatmeal Mushrooms and Butter Cream Lotus Roots and we love them all as they were flavourful and tasty! Will definitely visit again to try other dishes :)

The dishes were delicious, will definitely visit again. Spent about $20/pax including drinks.

Comfortable setting, good legit mala, vegetarian hokkien mee is delish. There's quality in the food. Spent abt $15 per pax. Will be back again.

Love everything that we ordered, especially their Fragrant Spicy Grilled Fish! Can't get enough of it, best eaten hot! 🌶

Quirky small cafe that appears to be well renovated, but comes with practical downsides - afternoon sun was blasting into most of the available seats/tables, table was shaky, blasting Korean music which destroyed the ambience, etc. Ordered iced coffee which was more than $10 and served in a very small glass. Service staff were friendly which made the experience feel a little better. Not a place I will visit again.

The waffles here are fantastic and their dessert here they do not use normal sugar. It's hard to find nice crispy waffles nowadays. Hidden gem in bukit Timah area.

Outstanding service and food. We enjoyed every sip of our coffee with the music. I love the place and surely will come back more often. Staffs are very accommodating.

Ordered their pizza. Said it will take 10mins. No problem. After 15mins, needed another 6mins. Fine.
Pizza was sparse. Too crusty, over baked, pizza base was soo salty. With only 3 ingredients:- cheese, 3 capcisum and a few mushrooms. Don't waste yr money. 30april@5ish pm.

Given your ‘earthly pretence’, disappointing that you choose to serve dine in food in plastic bowls with plastic cutlery.
Your reason ‘we use plastic because we are very busy’ didn’t quite wash I’m afraid.
So come on - please get your act together.  Currently there is little to distinguish yourselves from Mac Donald’s.

Sunny ☀️ Choice at Bt Batok. Their Assam “Fish” Rice set one of the best I tried, not too spicy soupy texture not thicken sauce. I ❤️ the raw fresh radish beetroot salad. Been here many times. #vegetarian #brownrice #assamsoup

Very tasty, delicious and makes me feels like home. The ingredients are 真材实料！Very nice lady boss as well. Highly recommend and I will be back!

The food here is delicious and value for money; this was my first visit, and impressed with the variety of food offered here. You can also purchase packed vegetarian/vegan snacks. In any place where no harm is caused to animals or humans, you can expect good vibes from such places. So do visit this place. I highly recommend it.

Delicious Lei Cha. Rich hot soup served in a thick walled bowl to retain heat.

Barley Gingko is thick and nice too.

Lion mane curry is rich and spicy!

Repeat visit.
Ba Bao Rice is surprising good

Located at Bukit Timah Market & Food Centre, stall number #02-188.

Price: $7.00 (Lei Cha Brown Rice)

The ingredients of the Lei Cha (Thunder Tea Rice) includes fried bean curd, sweet chye poh (preserved radish bits), long beans, stir fried cabbage, mani cai (sweet leaf), black eyed pea, toasted peanuts and sesame. Tea soup is basil based and kind of resembles Thai green curry in taste minus the coconut milk.

All the ingredients they used are very fresh and tasted delicious as a whole. The tea soup might seem little at first but the amount given is just right.

Looking forward to trying the Bee Hoon set next time!

Do come support the lesser known dishes in Singapore!

First time trying leicha, was curious about how the tea would taste. Opted for kosong set and was amazed how FULL i was 60% into my bowl. I enjoyed all the crunch factors from celery (i think), beans, peanuts (the best imo). The tofu was soft and yummy.  The portion is really generous.

The tea...is not what i was expecting. It's like an acquired taste for me, i cant say i like it when i first tried. It's more of getting used to that taste. Would continue trying leicha elsewhere to compare how different/similar it can be.

Overall the whole bowl has a light taste, not too heavy nor salty. Enjoyed my meal!

Usually takeaway, but the thunder tea will be better if thicker and more cencentrated. Can't even ask for me to go with the rice, the amount is not enough to complement the rice and veg.

Very good taste amongst the rest I have tried. Good find if you want something healthy from this hawker centre. Something nutty yet Asian in flavour.

So yummy and wholesome. A bit pricey but worth it. Balanced flavours with generous portions of veggie and taukwa, complete with beans (more protein!) and crunchy peanuts~ requested for thunder tea paste since this was a takeaway, and I added my own water to it. On the saltier side, though I guess this is common, so I added more water to balance out the taste a bit. Still very tasty though. Will be back to try the beehoon :-D

We had our dinner here on Good Friday night with the last minute reservation from google.
We ordered a starter, a pizza, a grilled meat platter and a Lebanon dessert. The food worth 2 stars. The meat was pretty hard, the starter was too sour. The dessert was really not able to match our taste. The house wines was tasteless, but the red wine taste better when it pair with the meat. I will strongly recommend you only order the red if you want to have their one for one house wine promo.
Our bill was $128, you can get a much more better grilled meat platter and better food at other restaurants. :)

Le Rida has a rustic ambience somewhat akin to an old time eating house in a small town. Quaint and homely
Freshly baked pita bread with lemon chick pea hummus was delicious and filling
Mains of Lebanese lamb kafta kebab had the right balance of flavour and crunchiness.
Wash it all down with 1 for 1 Heineken draft at $17.90

Manager Sanjiv was both friendly and helpful in his recommendations and unlike in some establishments, he did not push you to over order.
Definitely worth a return visit!

Didn't think the food was thaaaat amazing. Nor was the service. But at least they let us drink outside drinks.
HOWEVER, i requested for no garnishing on my hummus. When the guy brought it over, there WAS parsley on it. And all he said was "just pluck it out". --.--
So if i was allergic to that, i should just pluck it out.... nice. The hummus wasn't good either. I've tasted better. Like a friend who went with me commented... it isn't creamy enough. Also, comments about the baklava was that it was too hard... and wasn't good.

Absolutely loved the food, I am heavily into Mediterranean food. I have tried most of the places around Bugis as well. The food here was so fresh, with perfect taste and presentation. It was completely worth it travelling from East.
The service was quick, the portion size was generous . We ordered mezze plateer and tabalu salad. They were scrumptious loved the customised heart shaped Pita bread. Hummus, was so creamy and so were all other dips.

Would strongly recommend.. It has become one of my favourite place..

Enjoyed a lovely evening with family and doggie. Food is nice and the 1 for 1 drinks promo is good too.
Loved the dips platter and mixed grill with different meats
The pita bread is nice and soft and goes well with the hummus.
Great thing is that we can have our dog to eat with us....ha,ha, perhaps more like watch us eat. 😆
Staff is friendly and helpful. TV showing  EPL games too.

Love the location, the ambience and music is great and the fact the it’s so near the mrt ❤️ the tiramisu was nice but it doesn’t live up to the “tiramisu” there was no coffee taste, all I tasted was coconut. It tasted okay but maybe “coconut chocolate” would be a more realistic name? The burger tasted great but the sweet potato portion was very very little:( and was a tad bit dry wish it came with sauce or something. I probably would come back again even though it’s a bit expensive but normal cafe price haha. Probably will wanna try other raw cakes but the tiramisu just didn’t cut it..

Great place if you need to do some work.  Wifi is available, and it's not very noisy.  Only 2 tables have a power point nearby that I can see though.

We went on a Sunday morning, foodwise there's many vegan options. Not very familiar with vegan and gluten free but I felt the food were very gentle to the palate unlike ur usual hawker fare.

Atmosphere were great, staff services is great an not too crowded. I would think its a great experience and food combination is well thought out.

Lacks generosity!! I’ve been 4 times to the living cafe & each time I came back feeling dissatisfied & hungry. Not because I can’t order another main dish but it doesn’t make sense - what’s the point? The menu is great but the portions are restricted. We ordered for 2 people, vegan wrap, veggie delight pizza (barely any vegetables) & some deserts. Ask for the sauce & you are asked to pay $3 on top. I prefer to be charged on the dish & I’m happy to pay $25 instead of $20 but serve me a well thought wholesome plate please.
I think there’s a misconception that Vegan people don’t need much food despite paying more for their dishes.
Most of the deserts contain honey, so they are out of bounds for vegans.
Hopefully some heart is put in to this great place to make it feel more warm 🍀🙏🏻

Food was pretty good but the cappuccino with soy milk and beer root latte with oat milk were terrible. Prices were OK for the high quality ingredients but service was almost nonexistent other than putting food on my table (ordering and payment was done online and no drinking water was provided). Cafe was rather cosy but not good for gathering as customers have to leave after just 1h 15 min (despite it being half full on a Sunday during brunch time). Also, you HAVE TO provide both mobile number and email address for ordering, which is an involuntary release of private data just for a meal. 😅

Located in the Beauty World Food Centre.

Order Claypot Yi Mee $4.50. Is yummy as cooked upon ordered. Located in the front row. Will tried others food in next visit

Food is so good, variety of quality n quantity of ingredients put in a dish. If want to try a vegetarain food this is the place. Hawker price extremely affordable too ($4  for my Hor Fun) But not open for dinner n close on Sunday n PH.

Value for money vegetarian zi char. Taste is good and cooked well. Popular n busy during lunch. As there is only one cook some items may not be available to help cope with the orders.

Superb vegetarian food. Had the claypot e-mian. Good mixture of different beancurd type ingredients, flavorful stock, green vegetables. All for just $4.50. Served piping hot in a claypot.

Service was fine but not outstanding, with the staff forgetting my request for ice water until i finished my meal. Nice ambience next to the beach with comfortable sea breeze. As for the food, black pepper crab was fine. Fried yam with scallop didn't taste freshly fried which was disappointing compared to what i tasted previously at the Ion outlet. Hor fun was decent. Mocha pork rib was the highlight here with the pork rib crisp on the outside and the meat tender plus a strong coffee flavour. May return for the ambience.

We were treated to an exemplary dining experience thanks to Julia. Her attention to detail and thoughtful arrangements for our lunch gathering went above and beyond! She anticipated our needs with professionalism and added special touch to our meal.

Lobsters, chili crab and black pepper crabs were amazing.

Thank you for the great seafood and hospitality 😊

Jumbo East Coast never failed to impress me for the past 20+ years. I’ve also met the most amazing person, Julia, since I patronised Jumbo East Coast. She is so amazing and always making sure that whoever I bring over for meals are always given the best service.
Thank you Julia and her amazing team for always making our experience at Jumbo an amazing and memorable dining experience. Kudos to you and your amazing team! ❤️

Wonderful food, helpful staff and great location by the beach. The place was crowded for a drizzly weeknight but the energy was awesome. The chilli crab could be a tad spicier. I hope they didn’t tone down the spice level for the many tourists who dine there. Their mocha pork ribs was super delish and tender. Everything was tasty!

Excellent tasty chilli crab, the flavour is very good and delicious, not too spicy. Other dishes are really worth to try too. I recommend the cereal prawn, very tasty and crispy. Atmosphere is nice by the sea. I suggest to make a reservation before visiting.

Celebrated younger sister birthday at Long Beach VIP room which has a minimum spending of $1000. Overall the food is awesome but somehow we don’t seem to enjoy the Canada crab.. the service is also top class as they are friendly and serve us well. Keep it up!

Came here because there’s a queue for Jumbo beside this restaurant. Decided to give it a try as this place’s quite busy too. We were ushered to a table but then it’s hard to get the servers’ attention when we were about to make orders.

We ordered the Canadian chili crab as recommended by the server and it didn’t disappoint. The crab was huge and fleshy where I craved for more of it as the chili sauce was so good. We even ordered mantou buns to dip in the sauce and it’s delicious.

The steamed fish was delicious as the flesh was soft and flavorsome. The razor clams with minced meats and vermicelli were fresh and flavorful. I liked the noodles with oysters too especially the crispy bits of the topping.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely superb, and the service was top-notch. During my visit for lunch, I had the pleasure of trying both the chili and pepper crab dishes. The crab meat was incredibly fresh, and the dark pepper sauce was a standout—it paired perfectly with the crab. To end on a sweet note, I indulged in the mango coconut dessert, which was not only beautifully presented but also impressively layered. I highly recommend this place for an unforgettable dining experience!

I've been here twice, and both times are good. Food is tasty, especially love the Irish duck and white pepper crab. The staff are friendly but not attentive as it seems like they are very short-handed. Overall, the experience is enjoyable, and I will be back.

No matter how tight is your schedule in your Singapore visit, you have to try the crab plate in Long Beach UDMC. UDMC is rightfully famous for its delicious black pepper crab, the plate that I ordered there. The crab is cooked tender, and the sauce is incredible. This was my first time eating a crab and I am definitely not disappointed.

I should warn my European friends that the price rates are quite high in this restaurant, the prices are excluding tax (US style) and no service in the restaurant is free (even tissues).

I recommend Long Beach UDMC for visiting once but only once

Sze-Char with highball 🥃, beer or stout from tap. Fried rice, horfun and stingrays cooked in two - butter and sambal. Curry rice sets with sunny side up 🍳 is awesome too. Not your usual coffeeshop but booze with your locals

Went to order Fish head steamboat. it is good! the soup broth is nice and not overly salty. i dont feel thirsty compared to other place i patron.
The fish portions is good enough for 3 adults who just order the soup without other dish. We waited for 30 mins on a sunday evening as they are shorthanded.

We know this coffeeshop to be famous for the Fried Hokkien Mee.  Tonight, at 8pm, we arrived, relieved to know that this coffeeshop can host  a party of 5pax  (some coffeeshops turn us away because they only have the capacity to monitor 2pax in this pandemic).

Alas, the Fried Hokkien Mee was sold out. We stumbled upon Lagoon BBQ Seafood. We ordered:

1. Yangzhou Fried Rice (Excellent. The best YZ fried rice i ever tasted in SG. Got wok hei and each grain of rice is gorgeously evident)
2. Salted Egg Yolk Sotong (Excellent, Tasty and Crispy)
3. Sambal Kang Kong (Good, could be spicier with more sambal)
4. Sour Plum Pork Chop (Excellent. Umami)

I have lived in the east forever and I never knew of this Tze Char place. Well, I'd be back. This will be my go-to place in future. Move over, Hokkien Mee.

The best charcoal fish head steam boat in the east!!
Remember to try the Har Cheong Gai, hot plate beef cubes, clay pot roast pork taofu also 👍👍👍

Ordered hot plate tofu but the tofu was sour, thinking it’s us, we went on to try the sauce and even prawns are indeed sour. The $12 stingray was also a very meagre portion that probably look like $7.

I had an incredible dining experience at here. From start to finish, everything was exceptional. The ambiance is inviting and elegant, setting the perfect mood for a memorable meal. The staff is knowledgeable, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. Their passion for hospitality shines through, making us feel truly valued.

Recently dined at this lovely restaurant and was blown away by the amazing food and service. The dishes were absolutely delicious, prepared with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavour. The staff was friendly, attentive and make sure aspect of our dining experience was perfect. Highly recommend! They provide a free delicious handmade abalone dumpling during the day!

Lux Cove offers a fantastic seafood experience. The ambiance is charming but can get crowded. The service is friendly and knowledgeable.

Alaska King Crab with the promo , the waitress suggest me the 3 eat , its very surprising me.

Prices are on the higher side, but the quality justifies it. Overall, a memorable seafood dinner.

Wonderful experience on first time home delivery . Great services from the professional chef and service crew on site . Exactly same taste and service when you at the restaurant. My family and friends are very delighted and satisfied with this home delivery experience . Will definitely engage their service again

Today's family reunion my family and I having dinner at Lux cove restaurant. The decoration of this restaurant is very sophisticated.
What surprised me was the food and the way it was served. Especially the seafood decoration, not only exquisite but also very fresh. If you have the opportunity to bring your family and friends to try the food in this restaurant.  I highly recommend Sashimi here, not only words can describe its freshness.

Recommended to order their fried baby squid. It was really very good, firm to chew, crispy and delicious. Very addictive. Sambal stingray was fresh, meat was tender. Sambal was spicy enough too. Definitely worth a try!

We used to love the BBQ stingray from this stall. This time round, we ordered the stingray $20 and blood cockles $8. The cockles didn’t taste fresh. The stingray also didn’t taste as good and fresh as before. My friend and I who ate the cockles had  diarrhea the next day. I don’t recommend this stall anymore.

First time trying the food from this stall, usually we have a specific stall that we always go to but decided to give other stall a try this time round.  Quite surprised that they are Halal certified, so its Muslim friendly. Menu is pretty extensive, can cater to different tastebud. Like most stalls over here, they have bbq seafood as well.

Ordered 3 dishes, sambal stingray, Kailan in oyster sauce and an onion Omelette. Food took about 15mins to 20mins to be ready. Taste wise, not bad but there is room for improvement. One thing I didn't really like was that the food was already cold when served. My guess, was due to waiting for all the dishes to ready and served together and as a result the food turn cold.

Overall, food was acceptable. Not really sure if i would return though.

Cockles stank of mud. Inedible. Will not recommend. Hoping we will not fall sick tonight!!

Super yummy mee goreng and loaded with flavour! Perfect spot to stop off while cycling the PCN to refuel.

I won’t say much.. photo said a thousand words!! Crab is around 800+gram cost me $86 but it’s REALLY WORTH IT! The meat is so meaty and fresh! Oh My GOD! Im surprise to find this standard in hawker rather then in Famous crab restaurant.. Seeing is beliving!! Come down try yourself.. 👍🏻👍🏻 oh yah. The aunty wearing Rolex is very friendly too. 👍🏻👍🏻

Loved the sambal stingray and the BBQ prawn. Had the order as take away so the family can dine at the sea side area. The lady is so thoughtful and ensure that all the utensils and the needful are properly assorted for us. We had a fabulous sunset meal at the seaside.

Outstanding!  The stingray was tender, and the sambal had just enough heat.  The satay was delicious. The calamari was crisp and tender.  Combined with the outdoor setting on a beautiful evening, it was amazing!

A beautiful and thick slab of stingray, nicely grilled with a smooth texture. Sambal packs a punch too and surely not for the faint of heart!

Loved the BBQ crab that I ordered for a mini celebration today. The meat was thick, solid and chunky, crab weighed 900g. Everything they cook here tastes great. Usual favourite items I order are Tua Tao, BBQ Spicy Stingray, Salted Egg Prawn and Deep Fried Baby Sotong!  Loved it!

Impressed with the food here! Sotong, stingray, Lala and even the kailan tasted great!! Salted egg Sotong is crispy and nicely flavoured! Would come back to try other dishes.

Tasty pepper crab. Live fresh crab and good size. Reasonable price with very good service. Highly recommended to seafood lovers.

The only place I go to for seafood, it’s always consistent and reasonably priced. Would recommend their cereal prawn, black pepper crab and steamed fish. No regrets, only regret over ordering and not being able to finish all the good food.

My go to stall when I am at east coast and have craving for some seafood. One of my favorite dish from there is the bbq stingray. The sambal chilli is very good - spicy and have a good aroma. Stingray is fresh and generous! The okra goes very well with the sambal also! Recommended to try if you are in the area

Old school kind of restaurant. Supposedly creator of chili crab. Tried both kind of chili crab with and without eggs, it was different and nice not so ketchup taste n less starchy. We had the fried fish with Thai mango sauce, good! Crispy US duck was good, tender n skin was crispy.

Superb dinner and seafood experience with the work team. Everything was done excellently. Deep fried baby squid, duck, Cereal prawns, fish and crabs. Amazing. Will want to come back again with family.

16 Jul 2023: back here to celebrate mum BD. Nice food, firm meaty crabs and excellent service. Tried the curry fish head as it was birthday girl's favourite.

I love the old school vibes here! Traditional Chinese restaurant set in the 80s! This place has been around since 1956, and the food is great! Service is also good! Love the chilli crab here and they are apparently the creators of this iconic dish! We had Buddha jump over the wall soup, baby kailan, chilli crab with mantou, and a fried mee sua. What a memorable and amazing experience! Will definitely be back again soon! We also got to say hi and bye to the friendly founder and owner on our way out!

Nice food n great service. The boss is always friendly n welcoming. My gal loves the Chili Crab n it’s always a must have dish on the table for her when she goes to Roland Restaurant.

One of the old school Chinese restaurants that the entire extended family goes to over the years during special occasions. Has nice Tim sum and Chinese cuisine. 5 stars for sentimental value and nostalgia. Good to know that the restaurant is still around after all these years.

Family had a 10 course meal to celebrate a few birthdays.

Cold dish was so so. Would prefer sliced lobster with mayonnaise to lobster balls among other things.
Lotus paste bun was ok, but it is always fun to have it styled as longevity peaches which are linked to Chinese mythical stories.
Buddha jumps over the wall was nice, but every individual soup pot ingredients are non-uniform. You never know what your going to get till you open the lid. 😂
Suckling pig was awesome! Crispy! 😋
Razor/Bamboo clams were delicious.
Asparagus was decent.
Drunken prawns were ok.
Chilli crab is the signature dish with fried Mantou buns which are a childhood favourite. 🤩
Steamed pomfret was good.
US duck was yummy.

Yummy food and the price is not too expensive. Love the deep fried fish with sambal chilli, super crispy! Hor fun has good wok hei too.

Had lunch - boss mee sua, coffee ribs, prawn rolls, fish maw soup, crispy sotong, cai Po tofu. Pretty standard zhi char food. Good quality and tasty. Best dish would be the crispy sotong. Boss mee sua below average.

$50 for grouper hotpot with 8 slices of fish filet and lots of fish parts in the soup. Really nice. When I was there, I think every table ordered this so a must have. $12 for the prawn paste chicken. Nice with the soup if you like meat. Best thing is no corkage charge for wine lovers with dinner. Bad thing is 10% service charge on bill. You need to tell the helpers 2-3 times to do something. Like..can i have a soup-base refill. Can I order now? So the service charge is really not for service but to pay the staff, which is fine but when it is added automatically onto your bill for ok service, you feel somewhat disappointed. Nevertheless, the food is good and people/staff is quite nice. Overall, I will be a repeat customer.

We were taken to this restaurant by our Singaporean friend on a weekend trip. The food and atmosphere were great, and the price was reasonable. The signature chilli fish tasted amazing. The service was outstanding - friendly waiters. The restaurant is about 20 minutes drive from the city centre.

Loved the red grouper fish steamboat. Tasty broth with deep fried yam, spinach and cabbage with fresh slices of grouper fish.  Sambal kangkong was good, balanced flavour of spiciness, and saltiness from the haebee.

Our very regular dining place. Been here many times and years. Food is good and reasonably priced. The have aircon and non-aircon seatings. Make sure you reserve your table as no way to get a table if you walk-in.

Managed to do a last minute booking, place was crowded, got a table in the air con section, was a bit noisy…overall the food was nice, special mention was the drunken prawns, prawns were fresh and big.. crunchy and juicy..

One of the better seafood restaurants that you can get in the east in a very traditional setting. Food is fresh even for takeaway. There is a discount off the price on the menu for takeaway as the prices in the menu seems to include service charge. By the way, the yam paste is not too bad!

A hidden gem of a restaurant. This place screams tradition and serves up classic Singaporean Chinese dishes in the most authentic and old school way you can think of. Everything is amazing but be sure to try to the chilli crab, roast chicken, hor fun and yam paste dessert. Free valet parking is included.

Visited this seafood restaurant with friends and family during my stay in Singapore. The food was absolutely delicious with their speciality being the “chili crab” I also managed to try their coffee ribs which were absolutely divine. The silver fish fried rice was definitely worth trying which is a type of salt fish mixed in with the rice. The Hor Fun was also great, so from a good perspective it was all exceptional. The seating is set outside with large tables and although it did feel kind of warm there were plenty of fans to help combat the heat.

went for dinner as we really wanted to try beef wellington. taste of the food is good. but serving size is quite small for the price.
place is a bit busy but there’s only a few servers so they’re hands are full. so a bit of wait time. but they are very nice people.

Exceptional service - a well oiled friendly machine. Genuinely impressed at how smooth everything was. Food (chicken wings and steak) were spot on too. It's got a bar vibe overall with a combo of tables and chairs + tables and bar stools.

I liked it very much. Very good ribs and chowder. Excellent service. Nice ambiance. Happy Hour 4pm-6pm. Large food menu for dinner (starting at 4pm). Large drink menu too with many options for tap and bottle beer, wine, cocktails.

Food was delicious, well priced with decent size portions. Scallops and Beef Wellington were my top picks however If I'd gone again a steak was next on the hit list. Looking for a warm and cosy venue on a cold night? Look no further than Brazz, no booking no worries. Visited twice on our 11 day Queenstown holiday and thoroughly enjoyed both visits.

The food and coffee were simply delicious and the staff were professional, polite, welcoming and friendly.
I had a really nice breakfast and will be back. :)

Reviews: 

We stumbled upon this restaurant by pure chance, and what luck it was! The food was incredibly delicious, and the atmosphere was very inviting. However, the service left much to be desired; they weren't particularly friendly or attentive. Don't miss out on their amazing bread!

This was really disappointing! First, the owner asked if we want sparkling water. We asked for tap water. We were given bottled water and charged $5. We thought it was law that drinkable water is free, or at least cheap. Second, we were given a small table next to the door which had freezing air flowing in. I politely checked if we could change a table as there were three free ones. The owner almost yelled “no” and walked away. The other tables would have been good. Third, the seafood pasta I ordered was awful! It tasted no flavor, the white sauce was just cream, no garlic or wine or oil, and I found heaps of celery in it. It’s just weird. The pizza had lots of fresh toppings but needed seasoning. We paid $105 for a beer, a juice, a water, a pasta and a small pizza and we opted not to tip.

Yeah that famous garlic bread is famous for a reason, so delicious! They have half portion options for their food which is so great! Also fun to add to the chalk walls in the bathrooms

Good hearty food in a rustic old style farmhouse. We had the portofino pizza (highly recommended), spaghetti bolognese (a classic done well) and the spaghetti with chicken livers (delicious). Portions were decent sized and good enough to share. Prices are on the high end but that's pretty much what to expect when in Queenstown.

They don't take reservations, so just show up early and put your name down for a table. Service is efficient and food is out pretty quickly.

They “surprised” us by adding celery to our Her Majesty’s Pleasure pizza?? It was disgusting and not anywhere on the menu or list of ingredients. They need to tell customers before adding random ingredients to their order — especially with pizza that has specific listed toppings so you can customize.

The bolognese sauce on our second pizza still had whole bay leaves still in it, which are inedible.

Also, this is the only restaurant we’ve visited in Queenstown that makes you to pay $12 for water instead of offering free boiled tap water.

Came here about 2 times.

Absolutely loved our dining experience here. Food, service, and atmosphere were amazing. Sherie (hope I got your name right) was the friendliest/warmest host and actually explained to us the menu and followed up with thoughtful wine suggestions.

I highly highly recommend eating here. Everything from their steaks to seafood were top drawer. Will be back for sure.

Couldn't be happier after dining here at Botswana Butchery. My partner & I are visiting celebrating our engagement and we were not disappointed! The food was delightful. The waitress we had was friendly and so attentive! We even got a complimentary dessert which made our day! Was seeking a quality steak all week long and I finally found it! This is the place to go to for sure!!!

Highly recommend Botswana. Service was great and the food was amazing. We had the crispy squid, lamb loin, t-bone steak and eye fillet with sides and they were superb and the pudding for dessert was delish.

Great dining experience on a cold, snowy day. Beautifully cooked whole NZ lamb shoulder served with absolutely perfect duck fat potatoes - crispy on the outside, soft in the middle and hot. We ordered the seasonal vegetables which was asparagus with hollandaise sauce; again, very tasty. The slow cooked lamb was served on a warmed plate accompanied by a nice jus and mint jelly on the side. Able to carve it with a spoon - cooked to perfection. Staff were great, the experience exceeded our expectations.

The truth is, I had no idea what I was getting myself into. My best friend booked this restaurant, a couple of months ago.
My God, the food, the food, the food! we had a great selection of entrees (the octopus is to die for). For mains, I had the Wagyu, medium and it was phenomenally cooked. For dessert, I had the pudding, and I could taste the apricots. In terms of atmosphere, it felt like I was in France. Very rustic, very old school, but felt like I was a king, if you have an opportunity to eat here, do it!

Reviews: 

We recently dined at Lombardi in Queenstown and had a truly delightful experience. The variety of dishes we tried left us thoroughly satisfied. We savored the mouthwatering medium rare beef, the succulent confit duck, and the flavorful salt and pepper calamari. The catch of the day was unfortunately not up to par, but the attentive staff promptly resolved the issue when we had to send it back.

To accompany our main courses, we indulged in the delectable polenta fries, which, while a bit lackluster in taste for our liking, were still enjoyable. The Caesar salad provided a refreshing and tangy addition to our meal.

For dessert, we were treated to the heavenly trio sorbet and the classic crème brûlée. Both desserts were prepared with finesse and left us longing for more. What made our dining experience truly memorable was the personalized dessert arranged for my dad by the kind and attentive staff. It truly showed their commitment to providing exceptional service.

Over the years, Lombardi has received numerous awards for its outstanding culinary offerings and impeccable service. The restaurant has consistently been recognized for its commitment to quality, earning accolades that showcase their dedication to excellence.

In conclusion, Lombardi in Queenstown is a must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable dining experience. From the mouthwatering beef and amazing duck to the flavorful calamari, the restaurant's menu boasts a range of delightful options. Though a couple of dishes fell short of expectations, the exceptional service and attention to detail more than made up for it. Lombardi's well-deserved accolades reflect their commitment to providing a remarkable dining experience.

Celebrate my birthday here last march. Nice food and service plus great view from restaurant.

Great service, amazing fresh food and very quality. Very nice view as well.

Food  large  portions delicious.
Could do with some extra staff training.

Was fortunate enough to try out this restaurant after a day on the slopes as it was part of the hotel & was too tired to venture out to the city.

This place definitely did not disappoint! The breakfast options are nice but dinner was even better! It also had a nice cosy & fancy restaurant feel to it during the dinner service.

The service by Kyle was fantastic, friendly & attentive.

We ordered:
- the soup of the day (pumpkin) 👌🏼👌🏼
- seared scallops with octopus 👌🏼👌🏼
- fish of the day 👌🏼👌🏼
- bakes lasagne 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼

Standout dish was the baked lasagne for me & would fly back here just for that (& the views)! Having said that all the dishes were fantastic & well flavoured.

They also had daily specials & happy hour. The mulled wine was tasty as well!

Keep up the good work!


Option: 6:

Address: 88 Beach Street, Queenstown 9300, New Zealand
Phone: 027 349 4469

Price Level: 2 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)

Reviews: 

It’s a nice place to have a meal. Decent view of the wharf through the windows. Free clean filtered water (some venues don’t have this). The steak and ribs were nice (ribs especially were good value). The lamb was nice but slightly over cooked. I recommend this place and would try it again.

We love this place so much we went twice! Lovely views here too. Order the steak. Medium rare.  Lamb skewer. The yummy flavoured chips! And the tiramisu brownie! I’d love to return here one day…

Went for dinner on a Monday night. Service was excellent although we always are early eaters.

Great selection of meats and meals (vegetarians need not attend). We had a meat share platter. The ribs were delicious,  the chicken was moist and cooked so well, the sausage had a nice kick and steak was tasty.

I was also impressed at the drinks options, I do enjoy a bourbon and there was a great selection.  Also similar section for Whiskys.

Couldn't fit in dessert (even with the nice selection they had) but thought finish it off with an Espresso Martini.

Highly recommend Flame if you are in Queenstown.

Had a late lunch here after getting off the old steam boat. Loved the atmosphere, staff were super friendly, good local beer, restrooms were clean. Food was alright, maybe 3.5 stars. Our ribs were decent, maybe needs a little spicier smokier bbq sauce for more oomph (we asked for hot sauce and at least they had that), the coleslaw was lacking sauce and flavor, very bland, chips were good. The rump steak was good, but the burger was not, dry and kinda sad. Generous portions though. We would probably go back to try some different dishes next time at dinner time as they have more options, and for the friendly staff and atmosphere.

Didn't have reservation but was seated within 10 mins. This was on a Monday, around 9:30PM. Place was still packed. Somebody took my order right away. Had my starter and waited for almost 20mins for my main. They were busy so I guess it was understandable. Food was great in general.I would say they have one of the best ribs I have ever tasted here in NZ. Chicken was moist and flavourful but the Mozambique Prawn was a bit mediocre and underwhelming. And their chips! I am not a fan of chips but theirs were delicious. I actually finished a serving of chips for once. Serving was huge. Don't worry if you can't finish your meal. You can ask for a takeaway container so you can just bring home your leftover. Lunch sorted! I would still recommend this place to people wanting a decent meal while in Queenstown. They also open til late so if you are arriving late in Queenstown and you want to have a good meal before heading to your accommodation, head to this place.

Was hosted very well by our server Joseph! He was friendly and well spoken. Atmosphere was great. Ordered the market fish alongside a scotch fillet and both was excellent. Not to mention their scotched carrot which was so amazing. Overall highly recommended to try their steaks!

We had fabolous night dine in here, atmosphere is decent. They have good table service and acknowledge us so well for the menu, it's worth to have a wonderful night here. The food is unique and well-served.
The first floor you can have bar drinking with friends. Second floor are the restaurant part. Also they have nice dessert menu after having steak feasting.

No doubt about it, this place is seriously amazing! Just let the chef work their magic and enjoy the deliciousness. The staff here are super friendly. It's hands down the best spot for steak in Queenstown, my favorite restaurant in town.

Thanks so much for our wonderful experience and divine food.
Both our maitre D, and fabulous French waiter Charles were so professional and they ensured we had all we needed constantly, to make the night be a smooth seamless banquet of courses,
along with the other staff.  Sincere thanks to the chefs we didn't meet.  Food we wont forget!
Beautiful surroundings, best wines and lovely comfortable décor.

Absolutely the best steak I’ve ever had. Just trust the chef to cook the meat how it’s best done and enjoy. The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable of all the different cuts of steak. This is definitely the best steak place in Queenstown and probably my favorite restaurant in the town. For a side, get the truffle Mac n cheese too 👌🏻

Reviews: 

Had dinner here for our last night in Queenstown. Food was amazing & our waiter was super on to it! We went with the Trust the Chef option and i was surprised, almost everything that came to the table was something I wouldn’t have ordered but I enjoyed it so much especially the vegetarian options. They had live music playing when we arrived and it really just added to the great vibes of the place. Would definitely be back next time im in Queenstown.

Food was promptly prepared, well presented and tasty, which is amazing considering they were really busy. Bread was a generous amount. Staff were attentive.

Public Kitchen and Bar is the best restaurant I ate at in New Zealand. Food was incredible! We ordered the “Trust the Chef” option which I highly recommend. I loved every dish. The grilled squid with pineapple salsa was incredible and fork tender. I’ve never had better. The pork belly had the most amazing flavor and was cooked perfectly. For dessert was a delicious traditional pavlova and a coconut crème brûlée which were both incredible. Great location, ambiance and staff! They even played some of my favorite songs!

Had a birthday meal here. They welcomed us with a birthday card on the table, which was a lovely touch. We had a range of dishes for 3 adults and 2 kids. couldn't fault any, salmon was lovely, pork belly delicious, even the kids pasta was made with love, not just thrown on a plate as an afterthought. The service was warm and friendly and most importantly, knowledgeable about the food and beverage offerings. There was live music playing which was noticeable and enjoyable but not too loud as to disrupt conversation. Nice vibe with the booths and big middle table. Great views from some seats, though we prefer the booth tables. They even assisted with a birthday candle in the desserts.
Thanks, it's not our first time here and won't be the last.

Absolute delight. We came for just a mulled wine, saw others meals so decided to order ‘trust the chef’ three courses. Each meal was very tasty, we were both so full. I enjoyed the blanket that was on offer on the deck too. Staff were super welcoming as well 10/10.

Price Level: 3 / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4.2
Reviews: 

French onion soup - This was a good onion soup. The soup base was intense like the French ones but the French were too salty. This one was just right. One thing it can improve, more cheese.

Legendary seafood chowder - The name itself was a gimmick. I've had way better chowder from many many places. This was probably one of the more average one. Not saying it's not tasty, but the amount of cream, the thickness, and from all the seafood ingredients, you want to have a balanced but also strong enough to taste the presence of them.  Not impressed.

Beef bourguignon - Average.  The beef were fine but the sauce overwhelmed by red wine, you want to have red wine to compliment the flavor of the beef not the other way around. This one I couldn't taste the flavor of the beef but just wine.  The pasta was Al dente👍🏼.

Sirloin steak - Great quality. The beef is tender, tasty. The thickness of the steak actually became an issue.  The grill steak I had in America is not big by volume but thick as texture.  I also preferred stronger grill taste.  Normally, you need a very strong grill to char it, locked in the juice and then it'll crisp up on the outside then lower it to grill it to medium rare. Or you can sous vide it to perfect temperature and charred it with strong flame grill.  This steak was not grill to crisp, in fact, it was warm when it was served.  The peppercorn sauce also underwhelmed.  I had to add fresh ground pepper to spike up the flavor.

This is a fine dine restaurant, I expected more from it. Otherwise, it's still quality cooking and it's not fair to compare to Michelin stars restaurants.

One of the best restaurants I have been to! Could not fault the food, service or ambience. Beautiful decor and very attentive and personable staff. Daniel was fantastic! A must visit when in Queenstown.

Wow, what an amazing restaurant! The food was of exceptionally high quality, and the service was outstandingly friendly and helpful. Our waiter went above and beyond to assist us in choosing dishes and even took a beautiful sunset photo of us outside the restaurant. The meal itself was simply superb; we had the steak and ordered a dessert of cake and crème brûlée.

This restaurant is amazing! The food is top-notch, and the service is super friendly. Our waiter helped us choose dishes and even took a great photo of us. The fish was absolutely delish!!!!

My partner and I celebrated our engagement here last night and the service was absolutely amazing! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was amazing too, a big Thank-you for making our night so special 💗

We will most definitely be returning the next time we’re in Queenstown!

Some vegan options available - that's a great plus.
Red wines and white wines are all from Italy. Understandable although New Zealand has excellent wines in its own right. BUT wines - be red or white - are served at room temperature. Sorry, I couldn't drink my white wine. My wife ordered ice cubes... to improve the situation somewhat. I will never ever order wine in a restaurant in New Zealand - this restaurant killed it completely by serving white wine at this temperature...
Food was okay.

Exemplary authentic italian food with delicious handmade pasta, love the angus beef ravioli! Staff very attentive too, prices reasonable too around $24 for a pasta. Garlic bread will be better if there is more garlic, but bread is handmade and still good

Great service and atmosphere, awesome pizza. The only issue is the carbonara, the egg was added when the dish was too hot, so in turn i ended up with scrambled egg through the dish. Easy mistake for a novice. But overall a good experience.

Was super excited to try this place!
After a long day out adventuring Queenstown, we decided to order in. I was hyped for some authentic Italian as advertised but what we ordered was not that.

The gnocchi sauce tasted like it had been poured out of a tin from the supermarket and was topped with tasty cheese. The margarita pizza tasted like domino’s. Both meals were cold when they arrived and the delivery took 45 minutes longer than it said on the app.

For the price I paid ($62) I was expecting authentic Italian. Would not recommend if that is what you’re expecting.

OH EMM GEE.......HANDS DOWN - BEST ITALIAN FOOD IVE TASTED in a long time!!  The flavours were absolutely delicious as was my Aperol Spritz!  Amazing service just made this whole experience FANTASTIC!!  A MUST TO VISIT in QUEENSTOWN if you love ITALIAN CUISINE 🧡
Taiwanese food in Lavender:

Reviews: 

Went to visit this establishment with my family. Used the voucher found on Chope where we got a main and a drink for $8.99. It was absolute value-for-money!

The main dishes were generally okay, with quite small portions. However, they were nothing much to write home about. The drinks and sides were the stars of the show, and I would definitely be back especially for the fried chicken.

However… the desserts here were really expensive, costing as much as a main dish. If you are craving Taiwanese desserts, you’re better off going to another place like Nine Fresh.

Very nice Taiwanese food bistro if you miss Taiwan food! The braised pork belly rice is very flavorful, oyster egg omelette is differently made compare to sg style, and the egg crepe roll is also very crispy.

Very satisfying meal indeed. I had a very joyous dining experience! My family and I enjoyed the food very much 😄

This time I ordered something new like Fried Chicken with Cheese, and all my family members love it so much!
Love their meesua too, but I ran out of it yesterday. So I ordered their pork belly rice and udon, scallion oil chicken rice and as usual, the food at 8 Degree always satisfies my craving for Taiwanese food!

Their Bubble tea also spoil me with their choices.. all yummyy!

Try them out! Super recommended!

Food was pretty good! Reasonably priced too. Shop is simple but service was good and Aircon always nice in Singapore. Recommend you try their eggroll with floss. Somewhat like a crepe/fresh popiah roll.

Also recommend trying the sesame cold noodles paired with a fried chicken with cheese.

Pork rice was also nice, not too sweet, hardboiled egg was also very good quality and with their spicy chili dip. Very good!

Oh I also really liked their bubble tea. Even at zero percent sugar it was good. The pearls here are really chewy soft and can tell it's made fresh.

Will be back to try other dishes when I'm in the area again.

Tasty Taiwanese food at affordable rates. I had the scallion oil chicken rice and the portion size was decent and chicken was very succulent. Pearl milk boba tea was really nice too. Must visit if anyone is looking for an authentic no frills Taiwanese food around the hood.

Reviews: 

Overall, yummy food at a cosy eatery at wallet-friendly prices. My partner and I ordered scallion chicken rice, veg, pork floss egg roll with cheese, milk tea, honey butter toast.

I don’t usually eat rice bowls but I thoroughly enjoyed the scallion chicken rice which was flavourful and fragrant! Would definitely recommend this dish.

Loved the hot milk tea at 50% sweetness too. I don’t really eat pearls but this one was nice!

Would have preferred the egg roll to be more cheesy with the usual crispy kind as it turned out to be more of a soft chewy dough - still rather interesting and some may like that.

Honey butter toast was a nice dessert to end our meal!

Had a nice dinner at this Taiwanese restaurant. The staff is really friendly and the cafe itself is cosy. Loved their scallion oil chicken rice. It was very flavourful. We ordered 2 mains, 2 side dishes along with their signature pearl milk tea. The price is reasonable and definitely worth the visit.

Our favorite to go when we craving for Taiwanese food. The Pork Belly Rice is a mix of fatty and lean braised pork, pickled veggies, all on fluffy white pearl rice. 🤤 The Scallion Oil Chicken Rice has this killer fragrant sauce and perfectly shredded chicken. Worth the try

Service was impeccable and food was served promptly. Their chilli is really good. Mixed it with the 卤肉饭&大肠面线and it gave both dishes more flavour.

Milk tea is really fragrant, I had ordered 0% sugar.

Aiyu Bing was nice, but could have been colder and it would be even better. Portion is huge. Worth it.

Had a great dinner at 8degrees with my family, we really enjoyed the signature pork belly rice as well as the other dishes! The prices are affordable and it’s a hidden gem in Kovan. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Highly recommend the milk tea with pearl 👍 and scallion pancakes!

Reviews: 

Undoubtedly the best Taiwanese restaurant in Singapore! It's an authentic Taiwanese Zi Char place serving all the classic local Taiwanese stir fry dishes!! We felt like we were taken back to Taiwan as soon as we walked in. Super popular amongst the Taiwanese expats in town and always full at night even on weekdays - better to make reservations in advance!

Would recommend to taiwan style zir char aka 热炒, if lunch kinda pricy and slow.

We are 1st in the Q, but it took bosses 15 minutes to serve. So, for those who only have 1 hour lunch time, kinda rush. Imagine a 15-minute round trip to the office, 20 minutes to serve, 5-10mins to order, you left 15 minutes to chunk in and 5 minutes to settle the bill. Hahhaa.. we ladies still need time to touch up makeup.

The male boss is kinda friendly, we are here 10 minutes earlier, as the open only at 12pm. He is nice and brings us to the table and has a small chat with us. The lady boss is not chatty and kinda charcoal face (maybe bad mood that day)

Environment wise, kinda chill place to drink and eat, suitable after work come with friend or colleague. They have 1 private room, so they should be able to fit in 8-10pax (I guess, better call in and confirm, not sure if have minimum spend as the lady not answering my small talk)

The food is average, I only tried a few, and hence, I can't comment much. Maybe you can find 1 fine day and try more.

Rather quite day for them, only 3 tables from 1150 am to 1 pm, maybe their crowd from evening/dinner.

Really loved the 卤肉饭, felt that it was really authentic and affordable. As for the other dishes they weren't particularly spectacular except the deep fried oysters but it was not bad to say the least. I enjoyed the varying types of tea they offered.

The food was generally served quickly, and the place itself was quite vibey. Felt a little like stepping into Taiwan.

The crispy fried oyster was delicious. The oysters were big and juicy, and fried so crispy that it wasn’t oily at all. The fried rice with shredded pork was also fragrant and seasoned just right. One gripe is that the pork was a bit fatty (personal preference though).

Wide variety of food to choose from that we ordered too much. All tasted quite authentic Taiwanese. Place a bit so small so can get full house real quick

The braised pork rice is good though portion kinda small. The cheese foam tea is excellent while the fried mushroom a bit oily and not very seasoned.
Service okay, staff quite relaxed and atmosphere good.
Overall, a good restaurant. And it will permanently close soon.

Braised pork rice has a nice taste but very small bowl.  Oyster mee sua was quite nice. Shredded chicken is available at top up.

We also had the garlic beef $26 after tax.. Had multiple pieces too chewy.. Personally find it overcooked and not much taste for me.

2 pax : mee sua x 1, braised pork rice x 1, garlic beef x 1, aiyu jelly x 1, 1 plain rice total paid  $23 pax after svc charge & Gst.. 吃不包 😂

Nearest public car park is J0100 very walkable.

Lovely corner shop along Pasir Panjang Road with quaint, yet homely decor. Being in an industrial area, it was relatively quiet during a weekday dinner.

Food was very tasty and the flavours were reminiscent of Taipei street food.

One inconvenience is the ordering system as you are unable to see the available variations (e.g. hot/cold drinks selection) unless you order one and check if the variation is available. Could use some improvement if you need to cut on waiting staff.

My favourite place for Taiwanese lu rou fan, it's the best in SG. Do order the onsen eggs as well, perfectly done with marinated and soft yolk. The Mee Sua is not bad too but the vegetable dish is overcooked and too soft for me. Best of all, prices are very reasonable. Take note that portions are small hence the name for big eaters.
It's a small restaurant so go early to avoid queues. Service is fast though.
It is the only restaurant I know where you not only order using your phone but pay also.

Really delicious and cute train themed place!

Their braised pork rice 卤肉饭 tastes really fragrant! Delicate pieces of pork meat and fats paired with soft rice, toppen with their braised sauce. Each bite is delicious! Sadly the bowl is a little small and doesn't come with an egg or other sides.

The chicken is also yummy! Salty from their shallots, paired with fluffy rice tastes good!

I got their oreo coconut milk drink for $5 which was decent but a little pricey. Plenty of oreo bits in their fresh coconut milk. Their taro drink is also chewy but on the very milky side.

Would love to come here again!

There's a home cooked taste to the food. I ordered the 卤肉饭便当 (pork bento). It was light on oil and salt, which I like and is healthier. Serving size is just about right for an adult male. It seems to be managed by Taiwanese so the food should be authentic. The place is small but cozy and decorated with old school nostalgic household items. It's a good place for a quiet lunch. Overall a thumbs up and would visit again.

Has the lu rou fan set which taste good on it's only, the mushroom tempura is well seasoned too. Egg is old school hard boil though, so nothing too exciting there. Oh ya chili is really good and goes well.

The salt crispy chicken is very underwhelming, feels like very poor chicken quality. Milk tea is ok, the pearl feels a bit dry.

Honestly price point is steep for comfort food.

We ordered the braised pork belly rice set, intestine mee sua, and egg pancake with cheese and pork floss. The taste was very homely and generally good, though I wished that the flavours were stronger. Perhaps it's just my personal preference, but I would have loved a bit more of the oiliness that those at a street stall in the night market would have, which makes it a little more authentic.

We still enjoyed our time there, and the decor was also very nostalgic, with typewriters and cassette tapes!

A good place to have some Taiwanese food! We ordered braised pork rice, mee sua with braised intestines & oysters, fried chicken and fried king mushroom! All rice and mee sua were good. The fried chicken was succulent and the fried mushroom was really moist and juicy inside! Overall a really pleasant dining experience!

Salty crispy chicken rice and Crispy Cheese & Pork Floss Egg Pancake is nice 👍 . Lu ru fan(mince meat bowl has more fats then meat though.
Black tea kosong with pearl bubble tea ($4) was good

Pretty solid Taiwan food at Paya Lebar. Food was great but customer service could be better. Aunty at the cashiers gave me the feels that she is rushing off to the loo and needs your order & payment ASAP.

Ordered Braised Pork rice. The taste is good but the portions are super small. $5.40 is definitely not enough, can easily down 3 bowls.

Would prefer there is more meat given. What to do?

Attendance saw me standing there, rather than attending my order they were chatting. Probably wanted to form a queue to take the order all at a time.

Well executed Taiwanese street food. Fried chicken and honey grilled chicken were crispy on the outside , juicy on the inside. Good selection on the menu and the crispy mushroom was a little too hard and chunky for my liking… I was hoping for some plum powder to go with. The 卤肉饭 was just okay for me.. too little sauce, rice was not soft enough and overall I think I have had better. Seats are limited, so be prepared to share table :)

A good place to go to if you have a craving for some Taiwanese street food! The prices and portions given were reasonable! ($5 for a bowl of braised pork rice) And the taste was quite similar to the original version! Overall a pleasant dining experience!

Visited at 8pm++ onwards during 28 Oct 2023 as dine in. As a part of memories in my SG days, usually I'll visit it if I passerby. Although the atmosphere and food as good as always, but experience this time is totally makes me yucks.

During I'm going to collect my order as Teriyaki Chicken bento, a male staff with a Ah Beng bag blocked the entry, I tried to go out after collection but failed due to the order fall to the floor accidentally.

Fine I'm not blaming to anyone since I need to take my responsibilities being wrong estimation during go out, but what really make frustrated is the attitude of the male staff with bag —— keep blocking the way, not taking any action but only with words which irresponsible "not my business ah!" Luckily the senior lady (maybe is supervisor since I saw her from 2021) and a male staff with Chinese tone helped me to prepare new order, kudos and great thanks to them🙏If without them I might provide a lower rating 😤

This worse experience just a feedback about your staff attitude. I would like to said honestly, safety precautions required to make since the entry is small till inconvenience to pass it (at least keep the SMALL entry convenience to pass over, especially peak period to prevent any accident——maybe next time another accident which is more serious caused?). Besides that kindly train your staff from service perspective, I don't want to see another Taiwanese Cuisine shop which I like falls after the collapse wave during COVID-19, due to bad attitude from it's staff.🫤 (And also it's hard to find Taiwanese Cuisine such affordable+tasty in nowadays!😭)
