I recently dined at Enjoy Xia Hokkien Mee. Our experience during lunch hour was somewhat disappointing. Surprisingly, there was no lunch crowd, but that didn't necessarily translate into a great dining experience.

The food was just average, lacking the depth of flavor we expected, and it leaned towards the pricier side, making it hard to justify the cost.

We attempted to use deals via Burpple, but unfortunately, the staff's unfriendly response left us quite disappointed with their attitude and service.

On a positive note, the restaurant had an alright atmosphere with a nice design, but it didn't make up for the underwhelming food and staff interaction.

My friend and I ordered the Hokkien mee, crispy hor fun and prawn cakes. The Hokkien mee was flavourful and satisfying, and the crispy hor fun was surprisingly good but might be a bit jelak. The prawns were a bit powdery and tough though. I didnt enjoy the prawn cakes as it tasted a bit weird.

When we were checking out, they offered a 10% discount in exchange for a Google Review. They didn’t specify if it had to be a 5 star review tho, so take it as you will.

Hokkien prawn noodles tastes really good in my opinion but really too oily from the roasted pork & lard added I believe. I’m certain that the amount of oil can be halved at least. Other than that, prawns are fresh & huge. Place is IG friendly. Service is ok.

Mai hiam buay pai.  I love their man tou, Hokkien mee slightly above average for me but lots of ingredients which justify their price. Pork cheek also not bad. Second time patronised this restaurant because we wanna try their Hokkien mee. I will not return again for their Hokkien mee but other dishes, why not?

Pretty average food. Nothing much to wow about. Need to reserve early for seats, walk in will be taking a risk. Maybe is the hype from influencer that’s causes everyone to come. Prawn noodle above average but for selling price not much worth it because of the big prawn that’s all. Stingray was kind of disappointed due to was deep fried first, kind of wasted to execute this way. Overall not worth the price paying for.

Reviews: 

I recently had the pleasure of savoring the exquisite flavors of Taiwanese cuisine at Abundance, and I must say it was an absolute delight for my taste buds. The attention to authenticity in every dish is commendable, transporting me straight to the vibrant streets of Taiwan.

From the first bite to the last, the dishes showcased a perfect balance of savory and aromatic spices. The culinary expertise is evident in every detail, from the impeccable presentation to the rich, complex flavors that left me craving more.

The menu at Abundance reflects a true passion for Taiwanese food, offering a diverse array of options that cater to every palate. The friendly and attentive staff added to the overall enjoyable dining experience, making me feel welcomed and ensuring that each dish was a memorable journey.

If you're a fan of Taiwanese cuisine or just eager to embark on a flavorful adventure, Abundance is a must-visit. My taste buds thank me, and yours will too!

Food:
Food was really great with creative choice from the restaurant. Taste was really good. Dessert (ice cream roll) is a must-try for me. Interesting cocktails, craft beers, and drinks.

Service:
The reservation was at 7pm but the seat was not ready within 15 mins (understandable as it was a large group but could be improved).
Brought a cake for celebration. When I asked for the cake, I was expecting the cake to be served by the staff but I was given the cake and served it myself instead. (Service charge was in the bill, so customer would expect better service)

Atmosphere:
Ambience was great but could get noisy in peak hours. I could not hear clearly what my friend was saying who sit two seat away from me (maybe could improve on sound absorption?)

Lovely place for some novelty Taiwanese cuisine! We had the chicken and the prawn buns. O thought the dressing that came with the chicken bun was too wet for my liking, but the chicken was well fried and crispy. The prawn patty was quite nice too! Truffle fries is a pass. The sauce for the dumplings was a touch too heavy for my liking, though the addition of lard is a nice plus. Finally, the dessert is really good in my opinion, because I'm a bit of a weirdo and I like coriander ad peanut with ice cream. It makes sense to me, but I get it's not everyone's thing. Shout out to the staff who checked how many pieces I wanted the ice cream cut into. She had considered that I was there in a family of three, and that I might not have wanted the default sliced in two. Will definitely recommend, and also come back!

The atmosphere was rather cramped and basic, but the food made up for it. Nestled at the block near the MSCP, this place is a treat. The balsamic fries were an interesting find. The gua bao was a hit. Kids also loved the beef noodles. The salted egg prawn gua bao was nicely done. One dish I didn't like the fish paste chicken... a bit overpowered by the fish paste. Lack of kids' utensils and plates make this place slightly kid unfriendly, although high chairs are available. It's a simple fix that the management should look into. The meal was rounded off with their black sesame ice cream popiah and the peanut with coriander ice cream popiah. The latter is a definite must try!! It was so good we forgot to take a photo of it. Price wise, the food is not cheap, but the innovative menu is a treat! Was crowded on a Sunday evening, and I recommend booking ahead.

Been wanting to try this for a while and totally meet our expectation! We came around 12pm for lunch on Sunday and was seated directly. Ordered the food via QR code, very fast and easy. Nice and cozy place, felt very homey. The food was served very quick aside from the ice cream.

All the foods were cooked perfectly with great quality. The Gua Bao was especially extraordinary; explosion of flavors with great texture. We really liked the Prawn Toast as well. The Red Hot Chili Dumpling Noodle was thick and chewy as how I like it; the dumplings were very nice. The XO Fried Rice wasn't very special, but tasted good.

Overall very satisfied with the food and experience, although the price is at the higher end :)

We tried:

- Chicken Bites sides in sesame & honey ($5.50/set)

All bentos also comes with half a braised egg & pickled vegetables that go so well with the meats & QQ fluffy rice! Honey Chicken (as with our sides) was so well marinated & crispy even though it was packed up. The fragrant pork belly rice has a good ratio of meat-sauce-rice that makes it delectable! At least 5 plump oysters swimming in my mianxian, & I'm so gleeful downing it! I highly recommend the sesame chicken bites too - a must-order side to accompany your meal, or just pair it with a bbt for a quick snack! Bbt here are the large 700ml cups & $5 a cup with toppings already included is such a steal! Ours are their bestsellers, the first a refresher, & the latter oh-so-smooth we need another cuppa! 😋

Ordered salt and pepper mee sua. Super good and flavourful. But need to wait 15 mins for the food  to be ready. The staff will inform you the waiting time before ordering.

Not bad la. But the rice was too mushy. And when they said bento, I sort of expected a bento. This is more like a bowl. Price a bit high for the size.

Mango tea was ok. But the agar ball was weird. It was more of a popping ball.

Nice mixed of chicken with sides, flavourful and satisfying. Nice taiwanese flavoured.
Only shortcoming might be the preparation time.

Really not sure how this place has such good reviews. When I came here with my friends, we all left sorely disappointed.

The beef noodles wasn’t great. It’s hard to explain but it just wasn’t good. Lacking in flavour and basically just salty. The chicken wings that came with the set although well fried, the meat wasn’t moist and you could tell that it’s a cheap frozen wing.

The indoor portion of the restaurant also had a rather bad smell, but at least we could choose to sit outside.

Will definitely not be back here or to even try other branches.

Blanco Court Beef Noodle is a beloved establishment in Singapore, renowned for its delectable bowls of beef noodles. As you step inside the unassuming eatery, you are immediately greeted by the rich aroma of simmering spices and savory broth, setting the stage for a culinary experience that is nothing short of extraordinary.

The star of the show at Blanco Court Beef Noodle is, of course, the beef noodle soup. The broth is the heart and soul of this dish, and Blanco Court does not disappoint.

Really a delicious bowl of beef noodles, with tender beef slice, smooth noodles that mixed very well with the gravy, spicy tangy chilli sauce to mix with the noodles, beef, gravy. Soup is delicious too. Only thing is that the portion slightly small at $9.90...but as we know..inflation...inflation.

Greedy me bought the Large Superior Bowl cause I wanted it all!

The portion was huge and the ingredients were all clean & fresh.

Slightly Salty for the dry sauce, I used the like and chilli paste to reduce it.

The soup was flavorful. I asked for a refill & they gave me a bowl.

Comfort food especially on a rainy day. Dinner Queue was reasonable as Thai Food was crowded.

The best beef noodle I've tasted. Ordered the superior beef noodles and the beef slices, tendon, and balls are all superb. The sauce was initially starchy but turned more fluid as I ate.

Food was excellent! Loved the onion soup, borscht soup. The steak on iron pan was really delicious and super well seasoned! Didn’t expect it to taste that good. The tomato fish was sadly a miss for me! But the Irish coffee was delicious!!! Even my partner who is a super non-alcoholic person loved it and love the cream the whole presentation. What a gem of a place! Lovely!

A meal starts with a soft warm bread with butter. Lamb shashlik and cherry jubilee are still good as ever!
Unfortunately not so much on the borscht soup. Although tasting good as before, the Borscht soup was lacking in ingredients, very little cabbage and 1 piece of beef inside. Not worth the price.

the interior really brings you to a whole new place after walking up escalators of a seemingly abandoned and pretty run down building.
we had borshch soup which was really hearty and good we both loved it - must try when you’re here! 👍🏻
the upside down crab was also really good (tip: add salted butter onto the toast before adding the crab meat on top - the slight saltiness does a huge difference). We loved it though should have finished it while hot/warm because once cold, got a bit too jelat.
I had the fish en papillotte which was not bad (not much special) and the fish was SUPER SOFT but probably better for sharing; got a little boring after a while. He had oxtail stew which had a little too much fats, it got too jelat after a while too so better for sharing too.
We ended off with the waitress recommended cherry jubilee but we both found it very underwhelming so we had say no harm passing!
Overall a nice dining experience as the staff were really nice and attentive ☺️

Set above Far East Shopping Centre on the 6th floor, Shashlik Restaurant is one of those establishments that blends fond memories with consistently pleasing meals. The journey through the aisle of shops from way back yonder, with its varied mix of some newer ones, together with that single-file escalator, makes a sweet start to a culinary venture that feels like a warm embrace of the past.

The ambience while plain is rather pleasant, with wooden furnishing making a calm statement where food takes the lead. The wait staff were a mix of the young and elderly, who infused our experience with a lovely blend of professionalism and genuine warmth. Adding to that, their friendly banter invites diners into a space that feels both upscale and homely.

The Borshch soup, a creamy treat made even better with sour cream is always a personal favourite. The Tenderloin Shashlik while looking rather plain on a sizzling plate, gave bursts of exceptional flavours, complemented with a simple side salad. My companion opted for the Impossible Meat Balls with Pesto Pappardelle Pasta, while the other ordered the Chicken Thigh Shashlik. The obligatory order of fries was, as always, a welcome addition. The rice ball was not what we expected with its crispy texture, but pleasant nonetheless.

The pricing is slightly above average, but it does find some justification in the consistent quality of food and service.

Shashlik Restaurant positions itself with its intriguing blend of Russian and Hainanese cuisine, stemming from an even more interesting history. The cuisine, varied yet harmoniously blended, is not merely a meal but an essential culinary adventure, offering a unique and memorable palette of flavours.

Over the decades, Shashlik Restaurant is a testament of time-tested culinary delight. It stands as a resounding recommendation for those seeking a culinary journey that offers both unique flavours and a dash of nostalgia.

Always satisfied at the restaurant.

Location,  it's not really within the Orchard belt so it's great not to be in the traffic! There's an open air car park nearby.  Taxi drop off is next to the building.

Food is really yummy and of good quality.  The bun served is super good! Hot,  soft and tasty!

Ambience is good.  Keep a very cosy,  yet comfortable and exclusive feel.

Very welcoming staff.  All are friendly,  approachable and polite,  and with a good sense of humour.  And they all prepare you for your photography or video time knowing one would like to do some picture or video taking.

Price wise,  generally it's good reasonable for the venue,  Ambience,  quality and service.

Enjoy the time there for celebrations!

we made a reservation and were promptly served upon arrival.

food took a bit of time to arrive, noting they were all served hot and fresh.

food was nice and interesting, dumplings is their hit menu item here. I find the skin a bit thicker than the Asian dumplings, nevertheless they are flavourful. They have a variety of flavours for their dumplings.

good service and easy to order system.

Fun place to dine. Dumplings and cocktails are ace and service is awesome. Some food misses the mark. Will be back to try their extensive and interesting menu! More details below:

Food:
- Assorted dumplings are worth the try! Had lots of fun with the flavours and having them with the salsa and the sour cream
- Cocktails came with fried dumplings, I loved how they were salted, super great bar snack.
- Enjoyed the unique cold summer soup too!
- Some of the mains were a tad salty (chicken patty and mash) but really homey and warming and all came with veggies
- All food arrived in order so we had a cohesive meal

Service:
- The staff came to give recommendations and talked to us about the dumplings, very attentive.

Atmosphere:
- Quiet, peaceful, a great place to go for a date!
- Decor also very interesting and rustic

First time trying Russian food, I must say that the food, particularly the dumplings are very delicious, they are very filling. This is one of the foods I highly recommend, the service are excellent too, the staff would give recommendations and explain the food when it’s being served, thirdly, the restaurant is decorated with many Soviet era items such as Soviet newspapers, posters with Cyrillic text and even a Soviet Army ceremonial trumpet. Overall, good experience, food and service. 10/10.

The interior is inviting for a relaxed meal, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The set lunch appears to offer a variety of fusion and Ukrainian broths, along with pasta featuring a selection of 6 different dumpling flavors. A great option for a chill lunch or dinner during the week.

I actually visited here a few years ago to try their ‘angmoh’ dumplings before they rebranded and found them rather interesting as compared to the usual Chinese dumplings. Glad that I’m able to try more dishes this round

What we had
🥟 Angmoh Dumplings Combo, $17.90
8 flavours in total. Salmon, minty ram, black bull, wild hog, golden hen, siberian (beef & pork), paneer and potato. The dumpling skin is thicker than the Chinese style. Fillings-wise, I enjoyed the potato and chicken

🍄 Cheburek, $22.90
Fried pastry with a choice of fillings. We picked cheese & white mushrooms. The pastry is crispy and filled with cheesy and juicy shroomy goodness

🐟 Draniki (Rosti), $24.90
Fried rosti served with smoked salmon. The rosti here is more similar to hashbrowns in terms of texture and not the usual crispy grated potatoes texture that I’m used to but it’s definitely more flavourful and well seasoned imo

🍰 Medovik, $12.90
Multi layered Slavic honey cake that is great for those with sweet tooth 😜

🥃 Shots, $10/shot (inhouse infused vodka)
🌶️ Ukrainian Red Chilli Pepper
Sounds scary but it’s actually not that bad.. I think? It does have that spicy and peppery kick tho, give it a try if you dare 🤪
🍊 Mandarin - slightly fruity
🍇 White Grape - for those who like it sweet

A very beautiful and clean restaurant to try out. I have never been to a Moldovan restaurant before and decided to check it out. The menu is small with a variety of options. The food was very good but certain dishes can be pricey. I will potentially come back and try something else.

The food is very good! I would consider it home style. I had the braised lamb and the pan fried potato pie. Both very flavorful and authentic. Good service, good atmosphere. I would recommend it.

Great food, good atmosphere, good service, good beer and wine selection.

I started with the chicken and mushroom crepe appetizer, which was delicious. Then I got Tyask grape beer, which was unique. I tried the cabbage salad with sausages. Both were great, but the sausages were amazing. I also got the stuffed grape leaves, which I loved. I can’t wait to come back and try more!

We went for dinner with live music.

The food is just delicious. I don’t normally eat lamb, but they recommended it, so we ordered it.

Order the polenta.

The service needs improvement. It took 30 min to get our food. The waitress never came back to ask “do you like the food?”, “can I get you another glass of wine?”, “can I get you more water?”. We could have ordered more wine, so that was a missed opportunity for the restaurant.

If you can scan and pay, why wouldn’t you let me place my order using Toast? It would have been much faster.

Go for the food, but be patient because the service is not the best.

Thw food here was ABSOLUTLEY AMAZING. The sour cherry desert was delicious, the Chicken and Mushroom crepe was so good, the chicken and mushrooms was minced together. The potatoe dumplings were very good and the Braised Beef was MOUTH WATERING.. the chef had to have cooked the braised beef for hours to make it that tender, the red wine sauce and seasoning on this meal is unexplainable good. This is a must try place.

Nice neighborhood bar and grill. Food was very good The service was excellent and the atmosphere of the restaurant was very nice and quaint. The prices were reasonable and although I didn't hang out at the bar I could imagine this being a decent neighborhood spot

I had the pleasure of enjoying drag brunch here on Saturday. Breakfast tacos were great. My server was delightful. Fun atmosphere. The drag queens, kings, and things were exceptional. Highly recommend the venue and attending an upcoming drag brunch. So fun!

Pub with TVs, a fairly large separate dining room, and some outdoor seating on a covered patio. Aspiring to be upscale, evidenced by the food prices - not quite there yet but still a great experience. Excellent beer selection with good variety.

Went tonight for the first time and although I saw multiple staff (including someone behind the bar) they all refused to look over at the hostess area for a good 5 minutes then we finally got seat on the patio. While seated, we waited a while, finally a server came out but didn’t even acknowledge our table (they passed our table to go to another table) and went to another table. Came back our way with still no acknowledgment and went back inside. Waited a few more minutes and asked another customer if we needed to go inside to order and they said normally servers do come out but they have been really slow at that moment. Finally walked out and went to another restaurant down the street.

I went here in the middle of the day with my husband for a late lunch. I really enjoyed the meal. We ordered a borscht which comes with a pirozhok, which is like a savory puff pastry with meat inside (although they have a vegetable option as well). Both were really well flavored and the pastry was very crispy and fluffy, a rare find in the pastry world. We also ordered the smoked salmon blinis, which were very good. Blinis are not your typical crepes, they are slightly heavier and chewier, which is very satisfying with the sour cream and salmon. It’s always a pleasant experience to go to a restaurant that isn’t run of the mill, but has good food.

A Delightful Journey Back in Time

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Review:

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this hidden gem tucked away in the heart of the city, and I must say, it was an experience that left me utterly captivated. From the moment I stepped through the doors, I was transported to a bygone era, a time of elegance, sophistication, and culinary delights. Allow me to share my delightful journey at this charming establishment.

The first thing that caught my attention was the enchanting kitchen atmosphere. It exuded a nostalgic aura, taking me back to the days of grand dining halls and lavish banquets. The attention to detail was impeccable, with vintage decor, elegant chandeliers casting a soft glow, and beautifully set tables that evoked a sense of timeless elegance. The lady owner's touch was evident in every corner, creating a warm and inviting ambiance that was both cozy and refined.

The menu, oh, the menu! It was a culinary masterpiece, offering a selection of Russian fare that was truly a feast for the senses. Each dish was meticulously crafted, showcasing the rich flavors and traditional techniques of Russian cuisine. From the hearty borscht and tender beef stroganoff to the delicate pelmeni and indulgent caviar, every bite was a revelation. The infusion of vodka with various flavors added a unique twist to the dining experience, providing a perfect complement to the sumptuous dishes.

To further elevate the atmosphere, a talented pianist graced the establishment with their melodic tunes. The classical music filled the air, intertwining with the clinking of glasses and the laughter of delighted patrons, creating an atmosphere of enchantment and refinement. It was a true symphony of culinary delights and soul-stirring melodies.

But what truly sets this establishment apart is the personal touch of the lady owner. Her passion for hospitality and her commitment to creating an unforgettable experience for her guests shone through in every aspect of the evening. She effortlessly made everyone feel like a welcomed guest in her own home, ensuring that every need was met with grace and warmth.

In conclusion, my visit to this establishment was nothing short of magical. The kitchen atmosphere, with its nostalgic charm and elegant setting, took me on a journey back in time. The Russian fare, infused vodkas, and live piano music added layers of delight to an already exceptional experience. To the lady owner, I extend my heartfelt gratitude for creating such a haven of beauty, taste, and hospitality.

If you're seeking a dining experience that transports you to a world of elegance and grace, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this extraordinary establishment. Prepare to be enchanted, indulge in exquisite cuisine, and let the melodies of the pianist sweep you away. You won't be disappointed.

Once again, my sincere thanks to the lady owner for curating such a memorable and beautiful experience.

Visited: July 2023

Authentic Eastern European cuisines served in a rustic vibe.

My friend and I came here a while ago to try authentic Russian fares. As expected, we were the only English-speaking group at the restaurant, but our server was very welcoming and accommodating. It seemed like there were several groups coming in to celebrate special occasions, and we were fortunate to enjoy live piano throughout the evening.

We shared a couple of apps and a soup, and I had the sturgeon tzar with Russian kasha for the entrée. Served with a side of sour cream, both the blintze and the pirozhok were good, but the latter pulled ahead as a winner. Wrapped in a crispy baked pastry, the meat pirozhok was very flavorful, and I especially liked pairing it with the traditional beet-based soup - borscht. Sturgeon was also a nice surprise, and I liked that its texture was a bit similar to that of cod.

Overall, our experience at Cafe St.Petersburg was definitely far from typical dining experience in Boston. Nevertheless, we really liked the feeling of being transported to a local restaurant in a small Eastern European country, and I would highly recommend giving them a try.

Very yummy soups they have , pretty nice and polite waitress , adequate prices . Soups were around 8-10$ . They serve it with bread . Thank you for your warm welcome!

if you want home cooked food. on a friendly environment.. with great prices.. this is the place for russian. Georgian. Ukrainian foods.. it is a large place to have parties.. staff is great.. not a fancy place but that is why you go.. prices are very reasonable.. food is fresh.. it is like grandma is cooking for you..  come home and enjoy here.. they open they are open.. if not they are not.. but if they are there they will cook for you. be nice and they are the best

We visited BRONWYN (I have no idea why they capitalize their whole name.) Friday because October calls for German food. I love German food and there aren’t a lot of German restaurants around. I’ve been there before, but this was a wonderful visit. We started with the pretzel, big soft and covered with course salt. It comes with a very nice horseradish mustard, spicy but not overwhelming. For an up charge you can also get beer cheese, but I greatly prefer the mustard.

They were celebrating Oktoberfest, but I’m not much of a beer drinker, so I started with a cocktail. They have a variation on a Negroni called Czech Yourself, made with Czech fernet, gin, and Campari. Although I’m mostly Irish-German, I do have some Czech ancestry and as you well know I’m a gin guy, so I had to try it. Very nice, I actually preferred it it to the traditional Negroni. After that I had a couple glasses of Austrian Grüner Veltliner. I’m not Austrian.

For dinner we split the Spätzle and the Schnitzel. The spätzle is larger than I’m used to but nicely browned and served with spinach and onions. You can add a sausage to it if you like. We added a bratwurst. This dish is delicious but huge. I took some home, and it heats up nicely in a frying pan the next day.The schnitzel was also excellent. It is topped with a mushroom cream sauce and served with warm, bacony potato salad. I would get both of these dishes again with no hesitation. I’d even get the spätzle to go because it reheats so well.

For dessert, we had the Apflestrudel, apples and golden raisins stuffed into a pastry and topped with buttermilk whipped cream. With it, I had a shot of Jäegermeister, which I didn’t shoot, I sipped.

The staff was dressed in traditional German attire and the small space was decorated for Oktoberfest. There aren’t many seats and it’s crowded, but definitely charming. The service was very friendly and the atmosphere was casual.  It was a relaxing feast. Union Square is about the worst place to park, but once you find a spot everything is great! I’m excited to go back to try the sauerbraten and of course more of their haus sausages.

Always a blast during Oktoberfest! Don't forget it's there the rest of the year. Perfect to stop by and satiate your want for a soft pretzel.

Very classy and authentic German gastropub in Summerville. Plenty of parking spaces, friendly and warm ambience! Food was amazing and priced reasonably!

Fun German pub with welcoming vibe. The burgers and wurst got high marks from our crew. The wait staff was flexible and fun.

Don’t skip the pretzel! Food is awesomely German (duh!) and so is the beer. Be brave and get the Liter.

There is something nice and family about this place. My 7 and 10 year old grandkids love it, hot dogs and root beer, interesting German type food for grown ups and great big beer selection. It's in a basement, lots of benches and picnic tables. We keep going back.

The laid-back vibe, surprisingly decent food, and great beer selection makes up for the dingy basement feel. They did a great job of making full use of the outdoor space, so that should definitely be your first option if the weather is good. The restaurant should check that all the table umbrellas are fastened - ours was missing the tightening knob and it almost hit us when a big gust of wind blew. I love how they have a truly unique brew shop right next to the dining area.
The staff was very accommodating and as sweet as can be.
The food was very good. Salads were fresh, the pretzels were soft and warm, and the deviled eggs were top notch. The chicken curry chicken salad was a massive bowl of just chicken, and it was definitely tasty, but all the chicken we had was a little rubbery.
This is truly a unique spot and is a great place to chill, grab a bite and drink a few brews.

It’s always great to come here, drink great beers - both local and international, enjoy tasty food, and enjoy the company of others - everyone is just so thoughtful here, from the staff to other guests.
100% a worthwhile stop if you’re looking for a tasty brew (three different ounce serving options), food, and/or a family-friendly spot.

Great beer selection, nice outdoor tables (with view of parking lot...), decent German food. A good option in Belmont Centre [sic].
Schnitzel was decent. Knockwurst and sweet mustard were good. Warm potato salad was a bit too vinegary for my taste, and didn't have enough bacon grease (but others will like that!).
Friendly and efficient service.

Stopped by for dinner when visiting family in town, we must've stayed 3 hours and ordered the whole damn menu... Outstanding & unique dishes, everything was tasty. Plenty of perfect pairings with beer & sausages.

Staff was knowledgeable and very helpful. Can't recommend this place enough. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town!

Loved the contactless menu & ordering as well. Such an efficient system that I wish more places used.

If you want a juicy flavorful steak I suggest going elsewhere. Came here for my birthday the other day. Service was great and I was so excited about the food until I actually tried my dish. I ordered the seared tenderloin with butter poached lobster. It was the most flavorless steak and lobster I've ever had. Literally, every other steakhouse I've tried was better than this, and this is the 4th stop. The only downside to my birthday was the steak. The fries and dessert were good but for it being a fine dining steakhouse... highly disappointed.

We recently dined at The Capital Grille to mark a birthday, and our experience was truly wonderful. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. The food was superb, although the drinks could have been a bit improved. Nevertheless, we all had an immensely enjoyable time. The ambiance contributed to a fantastic birthday celebration, and the special birthday plate they presented added to the overall experience.

Chestnut Hill location. Fabulous restaurant for a special event. Just celebrated a birthday there. The cocktails are great. Try the Double Oaked and Rye Manhattan. One of the best Manhattans I have ever had. The tuna tartare appetizer was great. Beautiful presentation and great flavor. The bone in rib-eye was delicious. And the service is superb. Ask for Miranda-she is terrific!

We celebrated my birthday last night in Chedtut Hill, MA and it was outstanding. My dirty martini was just right! The tuna tartare was delicious! And my filet mignon was perfect. Miranda took great care of us and made sure it was a special night. Can’t wait to go back soon!

First time visiting TCG and I must admit, it was FABULOUS. First, the manager Jeff runs a smooth ship.  His staff are just an amazing group of people.  Feel free to ask for him, he is the real deal.  Had a minor hiccup and Jeff made it right without us even saying a single word. That…is truly superior customer service at its best.

My waiter Patrick and his co-worker Jose were simply nothing short of remarkable.  I mean, you want a great dining experience, ask for one of these guys, I mean…they WOWED me.  The food was absolutely amazing and the passion fruit mojito was excellent.  The bone-in ribeye…..just O.M.G! The place felt like you were in a law firm.  They do offer valet parking at the front door and the bathrooms were very nice and clean.  Plenty of parking and dress appropriately. Don’t wear t-shirts and your grandfather’s overalls, dress nice, it’s a nice and classy place that your significant other will truly enjoy.

So, amazing dining experience and would I return? That would be an emphatic HECK YEAH I WOULD.

Go to place for soups and salads. The Greek salad is always delicious and fresh especially with the grilled chicken breast on top. The pita on the side is always freshly made and delicious. The Greek lemon chicken soup and homemade gazpacho are also favorites.

A deli with huge salads and sandwiches. They did not have table service, but lots of booths and tables were available. Most of the items on the menu are big enough to serve for two. I took home half of my Cobb salad. Wife took home half of her corned beef sandwich. Onion rings were enough for two, and were very good. We did not try any of the dinner items on the menu.

Ordered a “lamb” gyro and I’m almost positive it was actually just beef chunk…. The gyro tasted okay but it was tough to believe anything about the meat was actually lamb. Walked in and it was empty (given, it was a Monday at 6:30pm), the lighting was dark, could barely see into the display shelves at the counter. Just a lot of work that needs to be done here before I’d consider going back.

Everything turned out perfect! I worked with Sean to cater my party. He gave me great suggestions for the menu and the amount. Everything was ready for pick up  at the time we agreed with clear instructions for reheating. The food was delicious, and we all enjoyed without stress. We especially loved the hummus, pita, tzatziki, the pie, kebab and the beet salad. Thank you Sean and Putterham Grille!

A nice selection of sandwiches, salads and deserts. I went there for Lunch and it wasn't crowded, there quite a few tables were taken. We had the Mezza platter which was enough for several people to share. The decor is pleasant so are the wait staff. The food was very good, and the portions are ample. Prices are reasonable. Parking is really available.

I’ve been a regular at Devlin’s for over 2 years and this review is long overdue! My family threw a surprise bday here for me which was also a blast. The food is amazing, lots of comfort food items and also fun desserts, drinks, and apps. The patio is an absolute gem, one of the best in greater Boston. Can’t say enough good things and highly recommend giving Devlin’s a try!

It's one of my favorite spots. The food is always consistent. I got the plantain tacos. They weren't bad! The steak ones were better though. The sticky toffee pudding dessert was amazing. The service is always great. Don't miss trying this place out.

Great pun food and salads. Bloody Mary was just average but good none the less. Private outdoor patio area (well away from the street) with it's own bar is a perfect place to get together after work. They have a varied brunch menu as well. Worth the trip?

Steak tips the right size for medium-rare were perfect, as was the grilled brussel sprouts and lobster casserole...in a comfy classic atmosphere backed by attentive wait and generous barkeep services. Made our multi-cultural trio feel relaxed and focused on each other's conversations. ✅✅🎉

Quickly became my favorite outdoor patio dining experience. Much more spacious than I was expecting and has a pretty full bar as well. And it's a warm and cozy environment despite its location. Also some of the best burgers in town

I really enjoyed this neighborhood dive. Somehow I never made my way over here and now I wish I had gone sooner! With so few neighborhood bars in the area, I'm so glad that I not only found one, but a great one. It looks like there is. Trivia night on Tues which I will def check out!
The atmosphere is bright and cheery despite a little sticky menu grime. While you wait they give you the most buttery salty movie theater popcorn to munch on. The food was very good. I recommend the surprisingly good clam strip roll and the burgers are juicy and delish. Gluten free rolls are available too.
The service here is stand out. The wait staff is genuinely friendly and they truly offer great service.
I wouldn't come here to impress visiting in town family, but for those more frequent times where you want a comfortable friendly neighborhood spot where you can watch the game, enjoy a cold beer, and eat some comfort food, this is your place.

Everything is great at this place food is amazing can't go wrong with anything here to eat. But a must try is the wings they are so big and juicy. I couldn't pick a sauce or flavor so I got plain bone-in and got sauces on the side. It is a home feeling kinda place not so updated but worth eating here. Don't miss out on a wonderful experience people. I been there two times already bringing more people each time I go.

Interesting rustic pub feel.  The wait staff was on target. The menu consists of sandwiches, apps and a couple of entrees. The food was pretty good.  Basic food with reasonable costs.

i have to say that this place has the best onion rings! i have had many dishes here but almost always get onion rings. this visit i got the smoke house burger and my partner had the ultimate chicken sandwich which i have had before. everything had a great flavor and was cooked to order. the staff was attentive and very polite. will definitely be going back.

We go there all the time! Love this place! Great food, great atmosphere. Great bartenders and servers. NEVER a problem. Unfortunately..  last 2 visits we got chicken wings which are usually perfect. Got Teriyaki a  thin sauce so we could see the freezer burn on our wings. It was disgusting. At home if you grab something out of the freezer and see freezer burn you throw it out as to not serve it to your family and friends. Disappointed in the cooks, as how would the owners know? They rely on there cooks to serve to their Guests quality food.  Cooks if you won’t eat it throw it away! Owners talk to the kitchen! Are  you aware of it what’s going on? We will NOT stop going just letting you know.

Stopped in on my way to work to try them out. They had just opened and I was kindly greeted. Ordered the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit with sausage. It was so good! The biscuit was soft and flaky, the eggs were freshly cooked up and the sausage and cheese were perfect. I also ordered a cold brew which was really tasty. Not bitter at all and perfectly done. I wish I could have stayed because the atmosphere was super cozy. I will be back!

The tacos are delicious-light but filling and very tasty.
The blueberry scones are just wonderful.
Can't wait to try some other of their breakfasts and lunches!

Bettina’s is the hidden gem of Newton. I’ve been coming back frequently to try new items on the menu and have not once been disappointed. My “usual” has become the delicious brioche egg sandwich along with a cold brew. Absolutely worth stopping in!

Best breakfast and lunch around. Nice hand-made breakfast sandwiches. Their muffins tend to still be warm when they first open.

Bettina's Bakery is great. Their Honduran Baleadas are delicous.  i recommend add avacado.  They can even make it gluten free.  Everything is freshly made, but still very quick and friendly service. Reviews: 

Went to the Timbre+ outlet in expo and it was a decent plate of lechon. The skin was crispy but a bit too hard. As for the meat some parts were juicy but some were too dry and hard. The accompanying vege also seemed a bit sad..

Eaten here twice - once in the evening and this time during lunch. The grilled pork belly is very juicy and slightly crispy on the outside, and has that awesome bbq aroma. I would love to eat that chilli but I did not as I would definitely break out in sweat. It’s so satisfying just eating the pork belly and rice.

We had a Lechon dish ( roasted pork with rice) quite nice, but another time we try the a potion without rice, it was too many fat inside. We always eat in the timbre near expo. I guess should tell the staff give us the less fat one 😁. Their sauce is yummy with the meat

Disgusting attitude from the large Chinese woman serving. I have bought Filipino food from here several times yet have never encountered the type of attitude I just received from this so-called server. I approached the counter and in my friendliest voice I asked "Hello, do you have lechon?" The woman totally ignored me and refused to answer me even though I asked three times. Eventually she snapped and shouted "Yeah, I know you want lechon." I asked her if they had it (they often sell out) and again she refused to answer me. I will not give my money to support someone with such a disgusting and hostile attitude so I spent my $40 at the Thai stall next door where I received friendly service. Will not go back to this stall while this disgusting woman who doesn't understand customer service works there.

I believe that this is the Filipino version of roasted pork rice. The meat is tender and skin is crispy. Soup that came with it was a tad salty but it blended well with the set.
The restaurant is located in Timbre+, a cool looking conversion from the typical JTC factory canteen.

5-star service with average dishes.  This may be the first restaurant that my eldest specifically asked if I was going to provide feedback because he loved the service so much.  I have to concur, the staff at Gerry’s certainly made us feel right at home.  The dishes however were average at best, reminiscent of what I’ve had elsewhere, but definitely on the pricey side and seemingly confused as to what customer palates they are catering for.  The sisig and grilled squid are worth a try.  We’ll be back given it’s family friendly and a convenient option when we have a craving for Filipino food.

Never had Filipino food before, and was pleasantly surprised by the fare at Gerry's Grill. The restaurant has a friendly family restaurant vibe, and the service is good.

Recommended dishes include the mackerel with grilled pork, and the Halo Halo dessert.

Be careful of over ordering as portions tend to be very generous as well. Will come back again.

Standard dropped :( I last ate this in 2019 and it was so so good. But in my recent visit in Oct 2023, it didnt taste as good as before.

Pork sisig was a total let down. I remember this place has my fav sisig but this time, it just tasted off. Very charred and lacking in flavour.

Adobo was okay but veryyy salty.

Lumpia used to be very good too. Now, just average.

Perfect place to go to in Singapore if you want quality Filipino food to satisfy your cravings! Service is quite fast. Place is clean and cool. Staff are friendly. Food is delicious. Very much happy and will visit again 😊

Tried this Filipino restaurant as a reco from a Filipino friend. Food was ok, a bit pricy and quality is mediocre. We tried a bunch of dishes because it was out first time. Each dish is about $17 (nice portions tho). The grilled and roasted pork were the best. The yellow noodle dish (can’t remember the name) was really weird but strangely addictive. Everything is a bit oily so be prepared. The place is very quiet (we went for a late lunch) so no issues to get a table. Overall a so so experience…it felt like being in the Philippines which was the objective.

Paid $48 for this at LECHON PINOY. Not coming back.

Ordered Lechon Sisig which WASN'T SIZZLING, it was warm but NOT HOT. Flavour was more towards (shredded) Lechon than a sisig fusion, lacked basic sisig ingredients like onion, soy sauce and egg.

Ordered Laing and Bopis too. While I couldn't complain on the flavours, they were ala carte portions and of course priced as one dish. I asked if there's a side dish option so I could order more, but was told they don't. In the end, me and my company had too much leftovers.

This is a crook place. Twice I ate there, they charged crazy prices. I thought I wanted to try filipino food but never at this place again. A small bowl of beef lungs, he charged $7.50 & it stank and tasted bad. the same for a bowl of vegetables takeaway..$7.50 too!! What a rip off! 🤬🤬🤬

AVOID AT ALL COST!!! robbery at broad daylight. pretty expensive for a filipino food. which is not that extra ordinary when it comes to taste. $25 for lunch.

I had the Lechon in Lechon Pinoy (i believe they are the same owner with Lutong Pinoy). The Lechon was perfect - moist interior and crispy exterior

The beef soup is very nice. Broth is very tasty and the meat so tender. $14 for 2 bowls of rice and soup with big chunks of meat.

Reviews: 

Located on the 4th level of The Clementi Mall, head to green MRT line and alight at Clementi station and take the exit towards the mall. Head up to the 4th floor and they are located beside Wing Stop.

The concept of this restaurant is interesting as they are not halal and serves premium pork, chicken and beef, even Wagyu for a personalized BBQ. Restaurant occupancy is about 40 to 60 pax and dining is allowed for 60 minutes. A QR code will be provided by the staff when they show you to your seat which will be used to browse their menu and order food. Staff are friendly and trying their best to serve you as fast as they can.

The meat they serve is acceptable and with the price of their value meals, it's really value for money. I would recommend paying a little more for the extra portion. Each value meal comes with a small bowl of kimchi and a variety of sauces on your table. Beef lovers might just love it here as you can grill your meat to your liking. Chicken would not be as easy as they use the thigh meat and when sliced, there are many small pieces which could drop into the grill. I have the say the pork is great and with the option to add on pork jowl, you have to come try it for yourself.

Overall a must try for Yakiniku lovers that aren't looking for a buffet setup but just for a quick BBQ fix at an affordable price. I have snapped their QR code for you to take a queue number while you're heading down as the queue is longer during peak hours thus won't need to waste too much time.

Yakiniku Like’s beef is the freshest amongst All the Yakiniku and they have many side dishes when you order set with even choice of rice quantity. The only con is that when 2 pax are dining, have to share a table with 2 other pax. Happened to share with a man who was coughing throughout our meal, very unhygienic.
Maybe Yakiniku can consider putting a movable screen in between groups of customers  to avoid the spread of viruses.

Food is as usual nice. However I still feel they should extend the eating time to more than 50 min.

My daughter and I were on the way to JEM for Yakiniku-GO, when this place popped up searching through Google maps. Attracted by the Taiyaki Mochi, we decided to try. It’s almost, but not as good - sauces, smaller heating bbq area, less spacious. The one plus is the Taiyaki Mochi - was a real treat, but possible to buy frozen options online to do at home. So bottom line, still prefer our original place for Yakiniku.

Overall a pleasant dining experience! Second time visiting this outlet. Restaurant environment is clean and the design of the grill makes it non-smoky and greasy when grilling meat. Restaurant staff are friendly and helpful too, they were quick and sincere in rectifying the mistake when one of the staff sent me the wrong kind of meat. And I think the quality of the meat cuts is pretty good for the price point! Nice kimchi side dish too.

I'm glad to visited there ! Filipino cuisine is known for its variety of flavors, textures and colors. From the flavorful adobo to the soup. there's something for everyone. I'm sure you found plenty of delicious dishes to enjoy.

I had an incredibly disappointing experience at this restaurant. Not only was the food served to me raw, but the owner's aggressive and confrontational attitude towards my complaint was truly unacceptable. As a customer, I expected to be treated with respect and professionalism. I strongly advise others to be cautious when considering dining here, as my encounter left me feeling both unsafe and unsatisfied

Great Comfort foods here!!!
Shout out to Mamita's Kitchen
:) Mapa meat or veggie ulam, panalo

Helped my Filipino colleagues to buy their lunch from here and they were nothing but utterly RUDE! requested for vinegar, patis with chili padi and they commented "so many requests a!" When I reach our ofc and open the orders, they ended up not giving the requested vinegar. The service was ridiculously BAD. I have helped my colleagues from other Filipino stores in Lucky Plaza many time and they were never like this.

For all places I've tried, their bulalo is the best in Singapore.

The other food I ordered (longganisa & bicol express) is the same or better than other places but not the best.

Reviews: 

Visited the restaurant on a Tuesday afternoon. It's a rustic Pinoy place serving the familiar Philippines fair. If you really like strong tasting food, then this is the place to visit. Bulalo soup is SGD20 per bowl, and it's large enough for 2 pax. They serve desserts herr as well if you are game for it.

Tosilog is actually a combination of the different components of the meal - Tocino (cured pork), Sinangang (garlic fried rice), and Itlog (egg). The cured pork was so thick and flavourful, almost like a version of charsiu with sweetness to it, but might be somewhat tough for some. The Sinangang was the star of the show though, so fragrant and aromatic and paired so well with the meat and egg. The soup was sour (in a good way) and helped to cut through the oiliness. Overall, enjoyed this Tosilog Set ($7.50).

Had the Maja Blanca ($2.30 per pc) too. Also called Coconut Pudding, this is made from coconut milk, cornstarch, and sugar. Corn kernels are also added to give added sweetness and crunch. Thick and creamy, this was similar to the Nyonya kueh of my childhood. The toasted coconut flakes at the side also paired so well with the pudding. Delicious!

Filipino caifan with a large variety of dishes to choose from. Saw many filipinos choosing the fried bangus fish and took it. Was disappointed as it was cold and tasted like mackerel with a slight sour taste not worth the price of 9.50. The kare kare fared better. It was thick and rich in peanut flavour and came with soft stewed vegetables and chunky pork belly

Feels very homely! I love coming to this place once in a while to try out the different dishes. Yesterday I had some sisig and other side dishes, it was delicious!

Price is still general.

Food is ok, just that it is not very hot as it turn cold very fast due to the great aircond despite of helping us to microwave it.

Will go try out other dishes there.  :)

First time in this place and it's quite interesting as the first thing that hits you are all the Filipino breads, fried snacks and desserts and the front. Enter from the right through a small corridor to reach the restaurant. Self service so you order can get you food order disc and sit and wait.
Items like pan de sal, kutschinta and flan are showcased at front with wafts of freshly baked bread enticing you to buy buy buy.
In the restaurant a simple menu awaits but a very tempting one as the grilled chicken and pork belly were excellent.
The presentation was simple with just one bowl of rice. You would need to order vegetables separately if you wanted a balanced meal.

This is just a regular butter cheese bread which is selling in a Philippines Bakery & Restaurant in Lucky Plaza, Singapore. Though it’s fluffy and buttery, no other things stands out for these. Probably can give other items a try next time.

Overpriced And Disappointing.  This restaurant serves classic Filipino dishes and priced a bit higher than other Filipino restaurants in Lucky Plaza so I thought its going to have at least good quality.  Boy was I wrong.. I ordered pork kare kare and its tasteless and is not as creamy as its suppose to be.  The meat is also very bland.  The bagoong saved the whole dish.  Order also took a bit longer than usual and its not crowded at all.  The dining area is poorly lit and looks like an abandoned warehouse.  Service also not great.  Never coming back.

Ordered lechon kawali because it was recommended by my my friends. It was ok, but i think lechon in the food court b1 would probably be the better choice. It’s slightly harder and quite pricier compared to the option mentioned. The good thing about inasal is that it also offers desserts and breads from the philippines which taste really good, will probably go back for those and maybe try some other dishes also. Another thing to add is that it’s not as busy as other restaurants during the weekends when others are fully packed.

Delightful Filipino restaurant no shrinkflation here beef bone soup is rich with taste of marrow and more meat than we can chew. Dont miss out their Liempo, nicely marinated and reminiscent of street side grilled meat.

The Lechon $12.50 set is good. Very crispy skin. Goes very well with the sauce. On the other hand, the sizzling hot plate (Lechon sisig) $12.50 set is too salty. Just get the normal Lechon.

Always curious about Filipino food and their famous Lechon so gave this restaurant a try.

The Lechon has crispy skin and quite juicy. Overall flavor of the various dishes is more muted and tend towards a more thicker starchy type of sauce. Not so to my taste buds. If you like more subdued flavor and thick sauce then I think this restaurant is for you :).

The dishes that we enjoy the most are Lechon Sisig Meal ($12.8 comes with 1 drink) (grilled pieces of Lechon that is quite fragrant and has nice crunchy pieces) and Chopped Lechon Meal ($12.8 comes with 1 drink).

Their signature roasted chopped Lechon is a must-try. Crispy skin, soft tender juicy meat paired with the house made sauce. Next to try is the Mango salad and Sisig.

The Lechon skin was really crispy, and the best part is the tender and juicy meat under the skin!! Will definitely be back to order a half kilo slab of that. The lunch queue starts around 12:30p on a Sunday, so need to get there early.

Probably the best Lumpia you can find in Singapore! The Lechon have some crispy skin that can hear the sound even when you are sitting opposite! The chicharon has a very unique taste as well! The soup sinigang taste very similar to what you get in Philippines. Highly recommended

Not crowded with people during Sat lunchtime, no flies, even thought outdoors, not hot. Food is Halal for Mala! Taste good, my Muslim friend enjoyed together with me. They also have other dishes such as fried rice, chicken rice available. Chicken meat is tender. Overall, happy experience with my friends there to catch up and eat slowly together.

I have tried the chicken rice set, niang doufu and mala hotpot.
But the most delicious is the mala soup hotpot, while the other foods taste normal. Spicy levels are available from L1-L3.
The place is comfortable because there are fans and half of the place is an open space with a roof.

Always come here for their mala and it never disappoints!!! I love having it with their seaweed soup on the side as well. I bring everyone i know to eat mala here at least once haha. Pricing wise, it’s well worth it in my opinion. Staff are super friendly and helpful too! Always a pleasant experience here.

One of the best halal mala ever!!!!! Love that it has a wide variety of ingredients! Very affordable as well. Service is quick and friendly!

We enjoyed eating in this place. Our favorite is the hakka Yong tau fu.

Recently we tried the kampong fried rice. It was also nice and tasty.

Reviews: 

A good prata place serving good prata and a lot of other food too. Today, I decided to try something new other than the usual prata order. Ordered Briyani, and it came with a huge "mountain" of rice, and instead of chicken on the rice,  the chicken was served in a separate bowl and was soaked with curry to the brim of the bowl. It is heavenly for curry lovers. Recommended.

Nice place to have lunch, dinner or even supper. The food is rather good and the beverages like teh tarik and masala tea are delicious and not overly sweet.
The staff are a mixed bag. Not really good with customer service except for a young chap (either Malay or Filipino, not too sure) who is really pleasant.
Ambience is reasonable for the category and price it charges.
The range of food is wide though it does not have the some of the offerings from Evans Road. They are nice enough to put the papadam in a basket for us.

Kosong prata was crispy and good. Chicken murtabak had bones bits so that's quite bad even though overall taste was decent. Tea drinks were alright. Burger was ok. Service was decent.

Would still prefer springleaf overall but can't deny that this is more affordable

Scoody Dooby Doo Hotdog was very good. However 2nd order was incorrect (wrong dish came) and undercooked. 5 stars for the Hotdog, would eat again.

Stop eating from here a few years back. Back then, the food was not as good as before and the cost went up. Heard there was a change of boss. Decided to give it a try again. Cost consider ok. Luckily the food standard is good again. Love the fish curry n chicken marsala.
Turkish cuisine in Paya Lebar:

Reviews: 

Honestly, wasn’t the most impressed with the service here at first, asked for order and the person simply said yes can continued doing his own stuff for 5minutes.

However, when the food came, i didn’t think too much about it afterwards. Starting from the hummus, absolutely generous and delicious portions. Perfect appetizer.

The butter rice with kebab was crazy delicious, we literally scraped the plate clean from the rice and the greek yogurt like substance in the centre.

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Reviews: 

The menu offers a wonderful variety of authentic Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors that transported me to the heart of Istanbul. The quality of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation was a feast for the eyes.

The staff at Derwish are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. Their attentiveness and friendly demeanor added to the overall positive atmosphere.

Had a delightful dining experience at Derwish Turkish! The mixed kebab platter was outstanding; I was trying to control my carbs but I couldn't get enough of the fragrant rice. The hummus was good, although the bread was a bit tough for my liking. However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service. The staff was incredibly friendly and always had a smile on their faces, which added to the overall splendid experience. Looking forward to visiting again!

Everytime I have a loved one visiting Singapore, I always take them here. I always come back here for the food and service. The food is great - big serving and authentic and I love their Bunefe!! ♥️ The service is top notch, leaving us satisfied every single time. Will surely be back with other loved ones who are about to visit. 🥰

Great food and service. Food is definitely wayyy more expensive than the usual, but the taste makes it not such a bad deal. Apple tea is really nice before eating the food, very refreshing and fragrant but after eating any food it doesn't taste as nice.

Peter, the staff here, was exceptionally polite and gave us a warm welcome. When I needed to store my dessert in the fridge, he was incredibly helpful. Peter also recommended their signature dishes, and we decided to try them.

The Tajin lamb shank was a delightful surprise, with tender, succulent meat that practically fell off the bone. The flavors were rich and aromatic, making it a standout dish.

The Meze tabagi was a delightful assortment of Mediterranean appetizers, a true explosion of flavors and textures. It included a variety of dips, fresh vegetables, and savory bites, providing a wonderful contrast of tastes.

For a refreshing beverage, we ordered the Mango Ayran. It was a perfect balance of sweet and tangy, making it a great complement to our meal.

Unfortunately, as there were only two of us, we couldn't order the traditional dessert Peter recommended. Nevertheless, we thoroughly enjoyed the atmospheric environment, delicious food, and excellent service provided by the staff.

I had the pleasure of trying Turkish cuisine for the first time, and it was truly a delightful experience! The standout dish for me was the lamb; it had absolutely no odor and tasted fantastic. The grilled items were a highlight as well, bursting with delicious flavors. The restaurant’s ambiance was beautifully decorated, and the staff was both charming and incredibly helpful, taking the time to explain the dishes to us. While it’s not the cheapest option, the prices are fair for the quality you receive.

One thing to note, though, is that the platter we ordered was described as “for two,” but for Asians, it’s considered a generous portion. So, if there are four of you and you’ve already ordered other dishes, I recommend going for the platter for two only; it’s quite substantial. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience!

First time having Turkish food and was really
pleasantly surprised. Their dips and bread was really exceptional. The bread was steaming when it came out it was both crispy and fluffy at the same time. The platter for 2 was also great all the grilled meats was tender and flavourful. Portion was also huge.

Very impressive food & service displayed by the dedicated front staffs and chefs. It’s nice walking in the street after a wine & dine session in the area. The staffs were very attentive, price is reasonable.

Very delicious food with reasonable price.
My friend from Turkey said this is the only place with authentic Turkish food. My mom who is super picky about food said their food is good. Their dessert Kunefe is both crispy and creamy.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgeable. Will visit again.

Went here for a birthday celebration and the attention to detail from their service staff is amazing, didn’t mention to the staff that it was for a birthday celebration, only had a note in the reservation. But they went above and beyond, having candles in the dessert and even giving us props to take pictures with and proceeded to then print out the photo of us to keep!

The food also matches the service, authentic Turkish cuisine done perfectly, the Hummus was so good we had to order a second portion! I’m not usually a fan of chicken but the chicken that came with the platter blew my mind, so juicy and tender. Then comes dessert, my first time having Kunefe and the only thing I have to say is that I wish I didn’t share it, wanted it all to myself 🤣

Definitely coming back here again!

This is the most awesome place in all of Singapore! Huge veranda overlooking the park, delicious Turkish food! Super hospitable staff! Everything is always delicious, fresh, you can only enjoy food and views with such pleasure here! I would never have thought that there were such wonderful places in this city!

I ordered the baked cheese rice with chicken and it was pretty good, adequate cream sauce with the rice, the chicken was tasty & the melted cheese made it all better overall. Although I would say that the portion is slightly small, but perfect for one person. The other dish was kebab chicken rice - the shredded chicken was really good and the rice had a delicious buttery taste too. It came with some salad on the side, although without salad sauce, when paired with the chicken and rice it was a good meal :) The drinks prices were too high though, does not seem worth it.

Awesome food - awesome people - great location!
True Turkish hospitality!
Our favourites are
-the Turkish tea
- Adana kebab
- Lahmacun (bread with Lamb meat )
- Ekmek (Bread)
- Lavash (Turkish Bread)

Pricing is a bargain compared to other Turkish Restaurants in Arab Street.
For us it’s our everyday go to!

Food is a little towards dry but fragrant and taste is acceptable. Service is not so fantastic, 2 people sharing but no side plates and only given 2 thin pcs of serviette which we used to  hold the pizza. Venue is still considered good and outdoot sitting is pet friendly.

Overall, it's something can consider to try. Still grateful for making their outdoor sitting pet friendly.

Unassuming on the outside with minimal decor on the inside, I thought that there’s no way this place could be selling authentic middle eastern food!

But of course I was wrong. Meat dishes are decently priced and delicious, baked goods are fresh, and the Kunafe is deeelightful.

We also ordered Chicken Mandi. Overall, being a Turkish restaurant, the spices used are different from what we thought was Mediterranean. The chicken Mandi was only ok.

Overall, it was a very well laid out restaurant in line with the vibe on the street.

The latte and Turkish coffee were good. My son loved it.

The ambiance is great. The staff are very helpful and very courteous.

Great food, great atmosphere. Not sure why there aren’t more people. Do note the 20% offer!

Hummus was delicious, platter for two is a lot. Two guys and one of me girl… so stuffed. Great meal!

Really enjoyed our meal here. Food was fantastic, serving was amazing and the service was excellent. The severs were very polite and courteous especially Kiran! Thank you so much! Definitely coming back.

It’s my first time being here and i love it!
The food are nice, the service are good too, especially Sahi.

This was my first time here and we arrived just before closing.  I was pleasantly surprised that the full menu was still available!  Istanbul Grill’s served up an delightful meal, with great humus, and  top notch Turkish coffee.  Our server even hand-made our delectable balaclava!

Highly recommended!

I had a great time eating delicious food at your restaurant. The staff were committed to great service and were very friendly. The atmosphere was awesome and I definitely liked that you have a very modern style. Most importantly, every food and drink on your menu tasted great

I've had lunch there. The waiters were friendly. They gave me a complementary Apple Tea 🍵 since it's lunch time. The food is pretty good. The Turkish taste is there. They have plenty options. Unfortunately most of the beef items were unavailable. Had to choose the lamb ones. It's really tasty nonetheless. They also have good chicken and vegetarian options.

We used the Eatigo discount and its definitely worth it.. the foods are great, taste just fantastic to our liking! The waiter is friendly to recommend us their signature foods too..

My first time having Turkish cuisine and I enjoyed my food here. Love the hummus, great flavour. Ordered Istanblue kebab - Doner and lamb chop has great flavour, goes well with rice, rice was flavourful. Their garlic yogurt dip is tasty too I love it.

Got to try kunefe, really sweet and not for those who doesn’t have a sweet tooth. Washed it down and cleanse my palate with their Turkish Apple tea. Fragrant, but can’t really taste much apple note for the tea. Overall, decent.

Service by the Chinese guy was good, but the food was really so so and would have been very expensive (avg $25/main) if not for the entertainer app we used. We tried their most popular mains and switched the rice to pita bread. But the bread was very stale and tough, the meat was so so and we ordered hummus which tasted rather diluted. The only good dish was the kunefe, although somehow it's really oily. I'm not sure if that's normal cos this is only the second time I'd eaten kunefe and the last time I had it elsewhere, it wasn't swimming in oil. We literally poured the oil out on a separate dish and it was a lott of oil...

Setting was pretty although it was mostly empty on a Sunday lunch time, not surprised 😅

Authentic Turkish food prepared by the best Turkish chef in Sg. Good place to visit with colleagues or family

Great food and service! Decent range of vegetarian options too including the pide and starters

Good experience, wrap was decent, not worth to spent there, best dishes were Mixed Mezze and Mixed Grill, but if you are not a big eater choose only 1 of this dishes. The tea was good, lasted us the whole meal, decent amount. They also gave us a complimentary baklava. Nice touch. 200+ for 3 person.

Incredible Turkish food - despite being at a touristy location, the quality was excellent and of good value.

This was a popular spot on a Saturday night, given our last minute reservation, they only had slots 8pm and later.

Needless to say the slight wait was worthwhile - the various breads were so fresh and done in house. Meats were succulent and well seasoned, all around excellent, there wasn’t a dish we didn’t like.

Portions are generous, given the choice of would be nice to go with a group of 3+ but we won’t complain about leftovers!

had an amazing dinner here! brought my family to try turkish food for the first time and they enjoyed themselves :) the owner was extremely hospitable and gave us a complimentary kunefe as well as some tea. the food was amazing! solved my middle eastern cravings ~

My first authentic Turkish food experience highly recommended by my friend. And it totally blew my mind - how hearty and flavourful the food was and how warm the staffs were. The biggest take away was the hummus & bread and baklava!!

What an experience! The grilled meats were succulent, juicy and bursting with exotic flavors. You honestly can't go wrong with any of the dishes. The mixed grill platter is really all you need.

And of course, dessert was just off the charts. There's a reason why everyone posts pictures of the baklava. It's simply the best I've ever had.

Here's a picture of the cup of tea I had to round off the perfect experience and I highly recommend you do the same!

Celebrated my birthday here with my hubby on 16 Nov 2023 and it was a pleasant dinner for us. We are satisfied with the ambience, food, drinks, service and the atmosphere.

The staff are polite and helpful. We ordered the Mixed Jumbo Kebab Platter for us to share and followed by Kunefe with ice cream for dessert. They even sang birthday song to me when they presented the dessert with a candle on it. It is very nice and I appreciate their thoughtfulness.

We are impressed with the jumbo platter as all the meat and veggies are well prepared, well marinated and well cooked. We finished everything off the plate. It is simply delicious. We also enjoyed the Turkish Tea and dessert.

We will definitely return to try out other food from here again.

If you follow my Google reviews, you'll know I'm very critical. Yet, this is a restaurant that I'm giving a full five-star rating. That is because it's really perfection!

This was my third visit, and this time was with a group of friends. I was not kidding when I shared that I liked the food here more than what I had when I was in Istanbul! Was it because they catered well to the local Singaporeans? I'm unsure, but I really liked the Turkish food here! Most importantly, the service quality here had been great thus far! Please maintain!

Such a gem! The food was so I’m very impressed!! Some meats are dry but overall the food is so good! I love the hummus dips! Our table was nxt to the glass so the view was amazing!!! The food does get cold fast because the place is cold!

I love love love the desserts they are super sweet as expected of Turkish desserts but with their tea or coffee it is perfection! Will come back for the desserts!!

My partner and I had a wonderful anniversary lunch at Sofra Turkish restaurant. We were impressed by the authentic and delicious Turkish food, the friendly and attentive service, and the cozy and relaxing ambience. We ordered the mix platter salad, the chicken Adana kebab, the baklava, and the Turkish coffee, and we enjoyed every bite and sip. The salad was fresh and flavorful, the kebab was tender and juicy, the baklava was sweet and crunchy, and the coffee was strong and aromatic. The portions were generous and satisfying. The staff were very kind and helpful, and they even gave us an extra dessert to celebrate our special occasion. We felt very welcomed and appreciated. The restaurant has a nice view of the CBD and esplanade, which added to the romantic atmosphere. We had a great time at Sofra Turkish restaurant, and we highly recommend it to anyone who loves Turkish cuisine. It is one of the best Turkish restaurants we have ever been to.

Amazing food. Would recommend! Good options but most of it are variation of similar items. Service is friendly and prompt. Prices are slightly above average but portions are good for sharing, so its good for groups. Great outdoor views (minus the heat). Would be good if there are those  mist-fans or coolers outdoor.

Was recommended this nice little Swiss restaurant by a friend.
The food was overall good. The malakoff and coucou salad was very good with us feeling of wanting more. The crescendo of the evening would definitely be the venison striploin from their seasonal menu. Really nice texture and went perfectly with the cranberry sauce accompanying it. Wanted to have the chocolate fondue for dessert but we were so stuffed that we just opted for the seasonal dessert of vanilla ice cream with Chantilly cream.
Service staff was excellent and attentive. Always checking in on us to make sure everything was to our liking.
Thank you to Chef Yves and the staff of Coucou for the wonderful evening.

Nice place with interesting food. Cheese fondue is slightly expensive but unfortunately had a slightly bitter taste. Would not recommend this dish.
Rosti and steak is good. Desserts are ok too.
Service is great with many attentive servers, there was almost no wait for any requests. Atmosphere is good too, just slightly cramped but not to much inconvenience.
Overall a good experience and nice place.

My second visit to Coucou: first time with a group of 6, the next with 2. Better to dine with a bigger group as you can try more dishes (the cheese fondue might get a too rich after a while). The meringue dessert was not too sweet and was paired well with fresh berries.

The service staff was very friendly and patient with us. As we were leaving the restaurant it started raining heavily , so we decided to head back in for some desserts. As it was getting quite cold inside, we requested for a table outside and the waiter was very accommodating where he took the extra effort to find us another table.

Thank you for a great dinner and will return again!

we called in to make a reservation instead of online and they were nice to arrange an indoor seating for us nevertheless ☺️
we ordered the original cheese fondue (comes with free flow bread) - amazing though gets a little salty after a while!
we also had cordon bleu which was crispy but quite lacking in taste (likely because of the saltiness from the cheese fondue which ruined our taste buds haha) and spatzli (very disappointing in taste).
total damage was $150~
note: for the cheese fondue min order is 2 pax which is $70++ so can just order for 2 pax then whole table (more than 2 pax) share also OK 👍🏻

Would rate this place 4.5/5!! We ordered the Cordon Bleu, Rosti Zermatt and the Ovomaltine Mousse. Cordon Bleu was nice - the breaded crust was well done, the chicken was yummy but could be a little more moist. Rosti Zermatt was slightly underwhelming for us - the cheese and ham were good, but rosti was a little too thick and hard. Ovomaltine Mousse was amazing - the ginger bread was yummy even on its own and the mousse was really light. We spent $97 for three dishes. Staff was extremely attentive - filling up our cups many times without having to ask for a refill. They also cleaned our table before serving the dessert. Had an enjoyable time here!
