Reviews: 

I recently had the pleasure of dining at a restaurant that left a lasting impression on me. The star of the show was undoubtedly the steak and fries, while i order the oysters as well. The fries were absolutely amazing, perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, making for an irresistible side dish.

While the quality of the steak was commendable, I must admit that the accompanying sauce fell short of my expectations. It had a slightly acidic taste that didn't quite complement the flavors as I had hoped. However, this minor setback didn't overshadow the overall dining experience.

The service at the restaurant was top-notch, with attentive staff members who were friendly and accommodating. They ensured that my dining experience was pleasant and enjoyable. The ambience of the restaurant added to the overall charm, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere that made me feel right at home.

In conclusion, while the sauce accompanying the steak was a bit disappointing, the delicious fries, excellent service, and cozy ambience more than made up for it. Additionally, the restaurant's location in a beautiful area added an extra element of charm. I would highly recommend visiting this establishment for a memorable dining experience.

The steak at this restaurant is delicious, and I highly recommend trying either the entrecôte or the tenderloin. The quality of the meat is exceptional, and it's definitely a highlight of the dining experience.

However, I must mention that the service could use some improvement. On a couple of occasions, I had to remind the staff to provide napkins, which is a minor inconvenience. Additionally, the waiters seemed inexperienced in pouring wine, resulting in a small amount of wine being wasted. It would be beneficial if the staff received further training in these areas to enhance the overall dining experience.

One aspect worth noting is that the restaurant charges $3 per bottle of still water, as indicated on the receipt. While this might not be a significant issue for some, it's worth considering for those who prefer complimentary tap water or have budgetary constraints.

On a positive note, the ambiance and surroundings of the restaurant are quite pleasant, making it an ideal location for a romantic date. The attractive setting adds to the overall experience and creates a welcoming atmosphere.

In summary, while the steak at this restaurant is undeniably delicious, there are a few aspects of the service that could be improved, such as the attentiveness of the staff and their knowledge of wine pouring. Additionally, the extra charge for still water might be a consideration for some diners. Nevertheless, the restaurant's charming ambiance makes it a recommended choice for a memorable date night.

Ordered a set meal(58++) for lunch.
For the starter, the snail prepared with butter and garlic is good while the baguette is kinda soggy and considered normal. 3.5/5
The green salad is below average. Lettuce not fresh and seasoning bad. 2/5
For the main course, the trimmed steak is good. I ordered medium and readiness is excellent. The secret sauce is a bit sour for me but still good. It would be better if the gravy could be served separately. The portion of fries is super large and I cannot even finish half. 4/5
For the dessert, Paris Brest is chosen but it really disappointed me. The cream is soaking, making it impossible to be cut into small parts. 2/5
Overall, the taste is good, mainly contributed by the taste and portion of the main course. 3.5/5
Service is good and attentive but I might be smoked. Atmosphere is good. Wine and cocktail list falls on the expensive side.
In summary, it serves some good steak but other dishes a bit disappointing. Besides, kinda pricey.

Had a nice lunch at the quiet atmosphere in the afternoon. The drinks served was tasty and the wine is good as well.
The lunch menu is very affordable and the signature steak is flavourful. The sauce and fries are free flow as well. Do note that the salad and steak are already part of the 2 items fixed in the set lunch when choosing between 3 course and 4 course.
Overall, would definitely come back again to try more of their selections and to thank the service staff Nisha for providing us good service!
Dined: Oct 6th

glad that we reserved a table indoors on a Saturday evening as the place was pretty packed when we arrived. service was friendly & prompt, with the staff knowledgeable on their menu offerings. limited mains available, but it wasn't an issue for us as we came specially for their steak & fries. requested for my steak to be done medium-well & was really pleased with the doneness when it was served. also happy to know that they provide free flow of their perfectly salted fries! oh so yummy! 😋 just note parking might be tricky if you're planning to dine during peak meal times though.

Salad was quite sumptuous, only that we had to ask for additional dressings and some salt to add flavour. Beef cheek was fantastic and recommended, while the pumpkin mac & cheese was ok although I were not crazy about. Night time was a great place to be. Price was above average.

We were here to celebrate a colleague’s birthday. The ambience was great and food was delicious. Homemade Gnocchi with Porcini Mushrooms was certainly my favorite. Service staff were friendly and attentive. Overall it was a pleasant and enjoyable dining experience.

Delicious Italian food in a nice, mostly outdoor setting. Very nice patio, much of it covered if needed, and some indoor seating. Food was great, loved the gnocchi in truffle cream sauce. The namesake mozzarella dishes were also very good. The service was friendly, but sometimes hard to find. Would definitely go back again.

I came here for dinner with a friend. The restaurant is in a great location and the outdoor space is particularly lovely at night. Their speciality is of course the variety of Italian cheeses they offer, but this also leads me to why I don’t come here more often: the menu isn’t really the best for couples. It would be great if they offered portions or even a mix of cheese dishes that were sized and priced appropriately for two people to share. As it is, they’re a little large and, frankly, rather expensive. Likewise, the rest of the menu offers some nice dishes, but it’s not a huge range and we struggled a bit to find things we could share. For larger groups, I think this would be less of a concern, and there is a set menu available, as well. I just wish they had a more couples-friendly menu. The dishes we tried were of course all very tasty. Likewise, service was nice and friendly.

We ordered the smoked burratina which was really good and I mean the mozarellas are a must order since its in the name. Pastas were good but the mains stood out for me. Service was great as well, staff were attentive and friendly. I really loved the ambience as well, the outdoor seating just felt so cozy and intimate.

Reviews: 

First time here for the Mexican food and it is surprising good. Enjoyed the food! I do not know remember the exact name of the food my friend ordered but here are the pictures! I like the red wine with fruits. Tasted sweet so good for ladies. The meat in the pan is the chicken.

It was a packed evening with a good crowd.
We ordered 3 dishes. I would recommend a party of 4 to really go enjoy the food as they are made for sharing.

After a while, you start to see similarities in the ingredients and basically dipping into the same sauce and same protein spread across different wraps. I thought there would be more varieties.

On the whole, service was 5 stars.
Attentive and warm.

There’s nothing much you can do with the sewer smell when you sit outside and smokers from the neighbouring drinking joints.

Service and food are top notch! Celebrated my birthday here and they gave me a little birthday surprise, I think they do this with all customers celebrating their birthday and it's truly a thoughtful touch! Am definitely coming back!!! Thank you so much for the warm, homely service 🙏

Came by for an afternoon lunch over a weekend. Found the food a bit underwhelming and under-seasoned. Had the fish tacos and quesadillas. Would have been nice if the taco shells were handmade. Anyway, the salsas and dips saved the under seasoned quesadillas for me. We were the only guests at the restaurant at that time.

Vivian was very welcoming and sincere in recommending us the dishes for the night. Dishes were cooked to perfection and we really enjoyed every dish. Pearlyn and Uncle Ben’s service was also top notch. We were there to celebrate my sister’s 18th birthday and she had a blast! Will definitely recommend to anyone who’s looking to try Mexican dish, it’s one of the best out there!

Lovely food, great vibes and the service was excellent. The paella is the best we’ve had in SG, really! The flies at the alfresco tables were a bit annoying, so might opt for the indoor sitting in the future. We’ll be back!

Glad to discover this Spanish dining gem. Firstly the place has a very welcoming vibe with its laid back countryside style and soothing lighting. The tapas here somewhat more authentic than some other places. What really wowed me is the Paella which is so delicious. Definitely will come back when I have crave for Spanish fare.

The food here is good. We over ordered but still managed to  finished everything.

My only gripe is that
1. I wished the anchovies (which were really great) came with bread to balance out the saltiness
2. The Pedro Ximenez was abit pricey for 100ml

Had lunch here on a Friday afternoon. Friendly staff, food tastes amazing and very authentic! I’ve been to Spain twice and glad to enjoy the same authentic taste here. I love the vibes and will definitely come back here again!

the food is absolutely divine!!! (especially the brussels sprouts & patatas bravas). short ribs were really tender so that was great. paella was alright for me personally. really liked that the tapas came really fast.

the cafe is really quaint and cute, love the design but because its size is rather small, the noise depending on the crowd can get quite deafening, inevitably affecting the atmosphere.

Visited for the first time after hearing good reviews from friends. Awesome ambience and child-friendly. Helpful staff who helped us with food orders and wine recommendation. Dips were great, octopus tender and flavourful. Desserts were also delightful. The standout dish was the lamb chops!

Had dinner some time last week and the food was pretty good but it was quite pricey. The waiter asked if we would like sparkling or still water and we thought still meant free tap water, but it turned out to be $10 bottled water. Don’t make the same mistake as we did if you don’t want to splurge on water!

Unfortunately, we found a piece of stainless steel dish sponge in our food which is quite unhygienic and dangerous. The staff were kind enough to take it off our bill but this was a very eventful first experience dining here.

Went to celebrate birthday with a few friends. The food and service were good. Only disappointment is that when we were leaving the place, the wine was actually not finished.  The staff could do better to confirm if we still want it before throwing the bottle away.

I celebrated my birthday at this restaurant today, and it was a fantastic experience. We had been here a few years ago and were still in love with their delicious dips. This time, we ordered two servings of pita, which filled us up completely! We just couldn't resist that warm, fluffy pita bread 🫓. After reading some reviews that praised the lamb shank, we took Uncle Bob's recommendation and were not disappointed. The staff was incredibly pleasant, and I want to give a big shoutout to Uncle Bob, Manager Jennifer, and Jay for making our celebration even more special. We'll definitely be coming back! 🎉🍽️😊

The food was fantastic. My favourite dish would be the lamb chops - I've never eaten lamb like this before. It was without the muskiness you typically get from lamb, but it was a clear, smooth lamb flavour.

We had the dessert platter and I'd say the 'spring roll' is the best. the sweet custard with the thin layer pastry exterior makes it the perfect last bite for the meal.

Service was excellent. Special shoutout to Hakim who was very attentive and knowledgeable.

Thoroughly enjoyed my experience here!

It was pouring when we arrived. The restaurant should do an extension shelter to help patrons exit the car. Even the lady at the reception did not help to offer an umbrella and just stood at her station. First experience entering the restaurant is spoilt by the lack of the service.
Once we were seated, the service staff were attentive. The food was delicious. The sourdough with smoked butter was really good. The bread was crispy on the outside and soft and warm inside. The butter was smooth and smoked well. The rest of the dishes were good too. The jamon was flavorful.
The staff offered us to move to their bar for drinks and we moved there once we settled the bill. The bar was cosy and comfortable. Love the vibe.

A beautiful restaurant with excellent and attentive service from everyone. Nothing much to complain about the food, as bread lovers we the warm sourdough and smoked butter did stand out for us, that we ordered another half way into the service. Meat were all well cooked. We were hoping for a chocolate based dessert. The alternative of the interpretation of cafe con leche works well too.

I had a fantastic end-to-end booking experience at this restaurant. The hostess was not only friendly but also very accommodating. The food was delightful and, as a pleasant touch, "muy rico" as they'd say in Spanish. Although I was initially suprised to find a limited cocktail menu. It didn't detract from the overall experience. Based on my visit, I've already recommended this establishment to a friend. I'm also looking forward to visiting another restaurant of theirs - Next Door Spanish Cafe, in the near future.

This is one of those in my todo visit place for a while. The food and service surpassed all our expectations. The sourdough bread may look normal but it is so crusty outside but soft inside. What is more amazing is the house smoked butter which is unlike anything we had before. We were recommended the charred cabbage which is so refreshing before the main dish which is the dry-aged beef rib. It is enough for 3-4 pax comfortably to have room for other dishes. We ended with Pina Colada and a scope of lemon sorbet. It’s a memorable experience I must say.

The foods are alright but pricing is on the steep side. There is a speakeasy bar in the restaurant itself called 60ml. They make great cocktail and ambience there is much better:)

Tasty mexican food at decent prices. Very good service and staff are nice and friendly. Love the ambience here too. They have alfresco style dining and often screen sports matches etc.

Just passed by this place and decided to give it a try! Unexpectedly good! Flavorful and interesting taste you won’t get with other typical chain burrito stalls.

Daily rice bowl available at approx $8.90 with proteins, available on public holidays too. Give it a try!

Portions may be small for big eaters though.

A very welcoming restaurant serving flavorful Mexican delicacies. The staff there were extremely approachable and helpful in recommending dishes and constantly checking in on us. A must visit if you are craving Mexican cuisine and I recommend the Pork Carnitas. Worth the travel to go back again 😊

Went there for a couple of refreshing beers to end my day and it was great. It was almost closing but the kind staff still served us. We finish our other pint at the chilly outdoor area. Good management!

Absolutely fantastic! Went here for lunch with a friend. Really friendly service and totally fresh and flavourful food. We will be back!

Really good selection of Italian food. Reasonable prices and nice vibes to the place.

Good for a family meal or with friends over drinks and small bites as well.

I will reconnect the pizza and pasta for sharing. Do order their cold or hot sides to start off with.

Outdoor seatings are good during evenings.

Will be back again very soon.

Great pasta but a little on the pricey side! Portions are very generous and good quality as well so you get what you pay for! Heads up, do not sit outside unless you want to be a buffet for the mosquitoes like us😭

Staff was very friendly, food came on time, not too crowded on a late weekday evening.

Pizza was as expected, thin crusts are my favourite and the sauce spread was in appropriate amounts. Ordered the marinara pizza.

Regretted the aglio olio, noodles were too thick, rather tough and garlic was overpowering everything else. Ravioli was right on point with the amount of sauce as well, generous serving.

Desserts were nice

Back in Singapore for a quick trip. Caught up with an old friend and we decided on one of Singapore's OG Italian restaurants.

Soup and pasta were okay. Competent. Tasty enough... although my Carbonara was a tad salty and the sauce was just a bit too thick for my palette.

Was looking forward to the Tiramisu... which was like the go-to hip dessert there during my youth long long time ago 😉 ... I was disappointed. The fingers were not well soaked... it was dry. The chocolate powder was overdone... that was an overdose. My memories were slightly tainted 🤨

Was there for dinner on a Sat evening with my family of 8 person. We took the inside table with aircon. The ambience is cosy and nice. The taste and quality of the pasta is generally good. The cream sauced pastas are really thick and rich and can be a little to jelak to finish. My Carbonaro is too salty for my liking, it could be due to to bacon in it. If I am not wrong, I think their they used fresh pasta. Price is of mid-high range. Overall we had a great time and enjoyed the dinner.

The food was amazing! The curries and naan were delicious. We loved the samosa as an entree. The atmosphere was great and staff were very friendly and welcoming. It’s a great place for dinner with friends or family. Perfect for sharing.

I visited Masalaa Bar on a weekday evening, and I must say, the ambiance was quite enjoyable. The Indian street food and Desi-themed cocktails they offer were a highlight of the evening. I tried their Saffron Royale cocktail, and it truly lived up to its reputation; it was indeed nice.

The culinary journey continued with a huge masala papad and Vada Pav, both of which were incredibly tasty. The Pani Poori shots with alcohol were a delightful surprise, resembling tequila shots in appearance. The chicken biriyani was another standout, bursting with flavor and deliciousness.

While the food and drinks were of very high quality and incredibly tasty, there is room for improvement in service quality. Responsiveness and the dessert experience could use a bit of enhancement. Nonetheless, Masalaa Bar offers a delightful blend of Indian street food and Desi cocktails that's definitely worth trying for the culinary adventure.

When we had eaten food few months ago, was good . But today, service was bad, they refused to give napkin after two pieces ,
Pistachio kulfi was made from burnt milk . Chiki ice cream was melted like milk, and full of excessive cardamom. waiter says fridge was not working well
.it bothers me, even after giving feedback, there is no apology or feeling sorry .no remorse

Great food and ambience. Non-alcoholic mojito rocked. Tried many vegetarian options and all were good.

Visited Masalaa bar for the first time and we surely were not disappointed. The food menu is limited but has great options for those craving Indian food and some popular Indian snacks like pani puri.

We ended up trying the masala papad, paneer tikka, tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala and pudina paratha. Also ordered one of their chilli cocktails which was quite delicious.

Other than one of the paneer slices being burnt, the food was quite delicious and flavourful.

The prices are slightly on a higher side but if worth visiting for a fun evening.

Good service and tasty food. Good music from the 70s and 80s. Suitable middle age and older crowd. Wide range of liquor to choose from.

It's one of the best bars I've been too. The vibe js just amazing with an amazing service !
Try the sotomein(fish ball) it's to die for ..their chicken wings crispy on the outside succulent on the inside ! Their stir beef fry with wagyu beef is just so mouth wateringly juicy !
Definite visit if you are looking for a good drink and good food with a great atmosphere..
Oh almost forgot, you can get a bottle and come back later and use it ! Worth every penny spent...don't miss going here if you're in Singapore.

The Pork Ribs was tender and tasty. The Chicken Tikka Pizza was crispy and had generous amount of topping. This is probably one of the best pizzas I have ever tasted in Singapore (I do like the crust thin and crispy). Definitely a place to come back to.

Excellent place to hang out. Got outdoor & indoor. Indoor no cigarettes smell at all. Lots of beers & liquor options. Their small bite snacks order come hot and freshly cooked. My boss favourite place to hang out. He had been coming to this place for years. The staff basically knows him!

Yesterday went for second round for his farewell party.

It was a full house but took some time to figure out why? Impossible burger -must try!

It was my first time over there.  I sow a lot of good reviews and etc.
So we decided to   check it out.
It was a full house so it took a moment. But of course,  that how most of the people are going to choose the place. Nobody likes  empty  pubs and etc.  So far so good.
We got a small standing table for two. And we got a menu in 2 min. I was a good start.
Now its getting a bit more complicated.
Service.   The staff were friendly enough.
The first lady gave the menu and another lady took the order.  Her hands were occupied with a dirty plates so she didn’t write the order. Maybe it wasn’t the case, but nobody cares as long as the result will be satisfying .  But it usually goes with the order mess up as we were predicting.
So we ordered 4 glasses of wine,  onion rings, impossible burger and pasta to share.  It was a different waiter every time so I was actually wondering about the result.
And yeah, it was some mistakes like a missing onion rings and 4 glasses became 6. But I do aware about quantity doesn’t mean quality. So even if 10 people will take the order it will take some time to get the job done.  So just be ready to wait and etc. I was prepared.
Food. Food was tasty. I did like the impossible burger  the most.  It reminded me the time when I wasn’t a vegetarian yet  . Good job.
Drinks. The house pour wine was a good one as well.
This place has some drink promotions and happy hours till 8.00 pm so you can check it out!

Over all> well

A lovely location by the beach on the East cost. They serve Mexican, Indian, Italian dishes. Beer available on the tap. Food quality OK. Beer pricy at S$14+
Overall OK for one off visit, especially watching cricket, soccer matches in groups since they have multiple large screens.

Food was ok, service was acceptable. At the beginning, I took a spoon of the butter chicken and found a food wrapper inside. Still, ate and didn't complain. Towards the end of the meal, at the last pc of my naan, I discovered a strand of hair stuck inside. I must be unlucky to see 2 inedible items in 1 meal. Still finished our meal, but not gonna return here again.

Happened upon this great spot for lunch right next to the beach , we had the mexican fare and it didn’t disappoint - tacos , nachos, pasta and pizza - all good. They have a huge menu for both mexican and indian cuisine , next time we will try the indian menu. Service was good and staff friendly. Will be back.

Service is really bad. The staff seem to ignore you and you have to call them multiple times to get your order/ food.

Location is superb. Food is ok. Price is quite high.

Being on the East Coast Park and one side facing the beach is an added value for this restaurant. Good ambience and if we sit out, view of the water will be clear. Food was average, okie okie taste. We ordered a mix of Mexican and Indian dishes, all turned out to ve average. Prices are maintained as per the location. Staff is very friendly and during weekends orders will be served with a delay due to good crowd and many orders. Overall it was a good experience.

Even now I'm not really like fast food products but when I came back here after 26 years ago, they still give excellent service to the customers..

Very slow and bad service. Accepted voucher of a greater value than my meal and did not tell, only to lock it and inform that it was locked into the system already and cannot be refunded. Whoever the manager was on 20th Sep, 8.34pm.

Standard McDonalds ... crew usually polite and service is above average.

3 stars because no shaker fries as advertised. Only regular fries. And cannot accommodate to simple request to add tomatoes & lettuce to order of angus cheeseburger only can remove cheese & ketchup but no add ons. Geez so calculative. I given up the 2 cheese slices. C’mon lol

And so many items not available besides the shaker fries. If it gonna be 24 hours kn a Friday night ... stock up.

Manager don't have any idea about how to make payment with PayPal or pay now ...infact he was confused with ez link payment. Finally I make the payment with Ez Link..

We’ve ordered fish tacos, spiced wings, oxtail gnocchi, habanero prawn plantain tart & curry goat stew. All the dishes were so flavourful & delicious!
Special shout-out to Martin, the manager, and his team for the attentive & great dining service provided. We really had an enjoyable time at the restaurant.
This is our first visit and it will definitely not our last! (:

Came here with my husband and in laws for his birthday. We started off with the doubles and plantain nachos, then had the spiced lamb, jerk chicken and fisherman stew, all of which were excellent! All of us had cocktails to go with our meal, and the house lime punch was so yum. We have to commend the manager for his wonderful service.  while we did not inform the restaurant that it was my husband's birthday, he made it extra special by giving us a cocktail on the house and also made our desserts complimentary. Thank you very much for the lovely experience and we will be back for sure.

First time trying jerk chicken after seeing it countless times online. Fair warning, it packs a punch! 🥵 I ordered the Jerk Chicken Skewers and Fish Taco. The taco was drenched in a delicious sauce and I highly recommend ordering this even though it is slightly on the pricier side.

Would love to return with friends and family since none of us have tried Caribbean cuisine before!

The fisherman’s stew which came with rice and beans was the star of the night - the sauce was filled with seafood-y flavour and goodness. Will come back again just for this dish, and try other appetisers like the Mac and cheese balls. The other dishes we tried were quite decent too, like the BBQ pork ribs.

Excellent selection of food! We had the nachos, curry goat with rice and spiced lamb. Every one of them was well-seasoned, leaving our stomachs feeling happy.

An area of improvement would definitely be the space- lighting was terrible for good photos. It looked a bit rundown, unless that was the effect they were going for.

Great Indian food here. Serving portions are quite good. tastes authentic. We went for lunch,  so it was not that crowded. Likely to get crowded at night.

It’s my first time in Singapore and this restaurant did not disappoint. The food is so tasty, the staffs are friendly. We met the owner and he’s so accommodating. There is also a live band at night. CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!

Food was ordinary. Ordered something but something else came. The staff was too busy and it was too loud so we ate it anyway. The staffs were disrespectful and not very accommodating. We told them that the booking was for 2 but they wrote it as 3 and gave us a table and kept on telling us to move to allow walk in customers and last minute booking customers. However, the atmosphere was fun and the singers made our night. Not sure if I’d go back again though.

Was a wonderful experience on Wednesday at Rocking Rickshaw! Amazed that as busy as it was, the waiter still had a smile on his face and tried his best to get our food and drinks to us fast! Food was very good and of course prices are more than competitive. Definitely a highly recommended place for a night of food and drinks plus the live band was great!

We super enjoy our dine here. Though we are not into Indian food but it was sumptous..not a food to waste. And what I really love are the drinks and the live band. We truly recommend this place.

The first thing I liked about this place is the lighting. It was perfect with no glare to eyes. Menu item names were funny. haha.. triggering to try it out. Would suggest this place for both couple dining and team dining. For desserts, expect for vanilla ice cream nothing else was available. Little disappointed that I could not try out the creme brulee :-(
Nachos was too good. Must try. Food was served hot and we all loved it.

The Troublemaker

Al Capone's Sports Bar + Dining
📍Kallang Wave Mall, 1 Stadium Pl, #01-15, 397628

🍜 Food wise: For bar food, this was surprisingly good! Better than good actually. Each item on this dish was made perfectly, although it was saucy but it wasn’t too greasy.

There was this lamb masala, thought to be an oily dish, but it wasn’t! It was fragrant, well balanced flavour of spices and it came with soft and tender lamb! The meat also had the nice aroma of the spices, they were generous about it too! They came with crispy hot bread that one can dip into the sauce of the masala, delicious!

Then there was nachos, so good! Nice and crispy, the nachos were well layered with the guacamole, cheese, and salsa, so refreshing!

There were also a variety of sausages, 4 different sausages, firm, soft, and tender, some more juicy and the other. Taste wise, they were not very salty, not very sure what was the difference in them though.

The salad was also tasty and refreshing, fresh, sweet, and appetizing!

✨ Ambience wise: Great bar! Very cozy and serves delicious beers!

🤵🏻 Service wise: Great!

💵 Price wise: $45.90

🫵🏼Where else will you recommend?

Share with me in the comments below👇🏼!

🤗Remember to follow me to see what can make you hungry!

I hardly complain about stuff but i think the establishment needs to improve.

We waited quite a while for your meal to be served, while the others who came after us were served first

The lamb shank is such a disappointment! Unfortunately, it didnt make its mark. For the many lamb shanks i have eaten, this one had ONE slice of carrot and ONE slice of garlic bread. The whole dish tasted like it was bought from the wholesaler and heated up over the stove.  Sticking some rosemary and a chilli padi will not add any flavours. Huge disappointment 🙄

The sea bass came much later and by the time it did, the lamb shank turned lukewarm. We requested for roasted vegetables instead of mash potatoes and were told that they can't do so. At least the bass was fresh, but nothing to scream about.

When we aaked for more warm water, we were told they already gave us a complimentary glass and had to pay $1 if we wanted more. Hmmm I would imagine that the establishment had already factored these costs into its pricing... Anywayzzz

I doubt we will be back again. We only went in because there werr seata and the other places we wanted to go had really long queues.

We came here with a big group after a great CrossFit workout at CrossFit Unit in the same building. I only took one for which is my Bangers and Mash but the group ordered all kings of food. The portions are very generous and worthy the price and can be for sharing. We also tried the wings, fish and chips and pasta. All were good.

Food is goods and so are the beer taps. Have Guinness on the tap and have the rest of the team having beers and 1 bottle of whiskey. Food selections are a lot, and the same goes for alcohol selections. The only issue is short-handed and take some time for things to come.  Highly recommend on the platters and the fried chicken in the bucket.

Reviews: 

Update: Decided to drop to 4 Stars after my 2nd visit.

2nd visit:
Went with my gfs to this outlet yesterday. Most of us ordered their set dinner menu which comes with main course & tea set - $15.90. Or, you can change your drink with an add-on of $3.80.

The consensus among my gfs and I is that although the price for the dinner sets are good, the quality of their mains needs improvement. My Mee Sua was way too salty. The fried salted chicken that came with my Mee Sua was quite tasty. The hot tea & drinks were also really good.

Although the restaurant wasn’t too crowded, the senior staff attending to us was quite impatient. I was trying to pay for the bill through my phone, and realised that the only way we can get the $5 discount is by signing up as a member.

The way the senior staff attended to my queries wasn’t too professional. After I signed up as a member, our mobile order disappeared from my phone. She then came over to take our orders manually, and seemed impatient when doing so.

I was very mindful that we keep to their opening hours, and asked the staff politely what time they close.

When the same senior staff replied, she emphasised that it’s 9.45pm quite loudly. I think the way she replied is quite uncalled for. She could have just given a neutral reply.

Although I love their desserts, I am not sure whether I’ll return to this outlet after the unpleasant experience.

1st visit:
My lucky day! 😂😂 I had the restaurant all to myself for about 2 hours on a weekday late afternoon.

First time at this eatery. Frankly, what caught my eye was the pretty interior with the huge Turquoise (my fav colour) Ceiling Centrepiece.

I needed a comfy place to have some happy food (aka desserts 😂) & do some work. I asked the staff if I could sit at the big table at the back of the restaurant.

The staff told me that it’s meant for big groups, but kindly obliged me with my request. That made me happy!

What made me even happier was that the dessert that I ordered - Souffle Stackers with Honeycomb Ice Cream - was super yummy! I also ordered a decaf lemongrass tea as I was feeling a bit guilty eating the huge portion of dessert ☺️

I had a good time at this eatery, and I managed to get my work done. It would have been great if the restaurant has wifi. I had to use my personal hotspot to do work on my laptop.

I’ll definitely be back at this outlet or their other outlets to try their other foods.

Ordered a $6.90 small pot of tea and I was told the refill can only be once. I wonder how much does it cost for the tea leaves!?
The soufflé pancakes are not bad, but the rest are not worth the $.

Amazing customer service especially by Sharon, who is very patient in introducing the food & drinks & she went the extra mile to ask if everything was ok & took care of our requests professionally……

Very impressed with her service 🙏🏻

Also, U must try the 美人茶 - Yuzu Pu’er with Peach Gum!!!! It tasted so so so heavenly!!!!

We wanted to try the food typhoon cafe for quite some time and we are happy we finally tried the food here. The items we ordered were close to the taste we had in Taiwan! Dessert looks and tastes awesome! Staff service was excellent! We are sure to come back again!

I recently dined at Typhoon at Kallang Wave Mall and had a mixed experience. The service was generally polite and very attentive throughout the meal, which was great. The portions of food were impressively huge, and considering that, the prices seemed reasonable.

However, I can't recommend their Mee Sua dish as it lacked flavor and the ingredients seemed untraditional. It consisted of a bowl of Mee Sua with chopped up chicken cutlet. On the bright side, the chicken cutlet itself was delicious. Additionally, I highly enjoyed their mala edamame and would definitely order it again.

Despite the positive aspects, my dining experience took a downturn when it came time to pay the bill. The staff member who assisted us had a rather unfriendly demeanor and seemed to give off a vibe of "you owe me money," which left a negative impression.

Overall, Typhoon is a decent place to enjoy somewhat traditional Taiwanese cuisine with reasonable pricing. Just be cautious when ordering the Mee Sua and hope for more consistent service throughout the entire dining experience.

I was in a dilemma... should I gate keep this place or write this review. Decide not to be selfish. Lol! I visited this place 3 times. Twice for dinner and once for lunch. The seafood and dim sum are so fresh and value for money. My family used to patronise a seafood restaurant in the west but the prices have been increasing. Yet, the quality of seafood we had on the last 2 occasions there was disappointing. So, when we found Ji Xian, we decided this will be our go-to place for seafood! However, do not expect much from the service nor the ambience. Enjoy!

Seats a bit squeeze. Food taste is good Cantonese style. Serving seem to have shrunk. Service wise is still good. Helps if you know Cantonese.atmosphere old school type of restaurant. But highly recommended for Cantonese food.  Good and nice dim sum too.

First time eating in this resturant. Started with some dim sum, love the chicken feet cos its so peppery 😋 Actually not a bad place to eat dim sum! Had the Geoduck sashimi, haven’t had this for so long since hong kong. Slight crunchy texture, really individual preference but I quite like it. Bamboo clams, braised lobster noodles, veg with pork lard, fresh steamed fish etc all so good! Will definitely be back to try more of other dishes!

Came over for dim sum lunch on a Saturday. Ordered their signature dishes, mainly dim sum. Firstly, quite impressed by the variety especially live seafood and the affordable prices. Ambience is like a friendly neighborhood restaurant with a cozy atmosphere. Foodwise is OK, pretty average, slightly better than those foodcourt standards. Portions and pricing are good so making it value for money. Service was prompt and efficient. Really wanted to try their live seafood next time. Anyway, really enjoyed the dining experience.

Seafood is very fresh. Steamed prawns are really lovely. Other zi char dishes comes standard and service level is good.

Food is okok not that bad n not that wow, sour pork meat is sliced thin yet hard n dry not the normal shape altho the sauce is not bad but the meat really cannot make it.. veggie not bad taste good.. egg okok, fried squid is hmm crispy, the price of the pomfret is 58 kinda ex MAYBE next time can try that since is their recommended dish..

Short walk here from Lavender Street. Ordered the Sambal fish, ginseng chicken which stands out. The yam ring is so so as well as the swear and sour pork.

The belacan fish is really good! Value for money at $48 and we ordered some of other dishes which did not disappoint us at all. Ordered Sweet sour pork, omelette oyster, and veg which was sufficient for 4

Really loved rhe singapore chili crayfish! With fried bun and oyster omelette.

This was an amazing find.  We meant to go to the restaurant next door but they were closed. We came in here on a whim. The food is amazing. My friend had the goat curry. I had the fish curry. Both were spicy but flavorful. The plantain chips are hot and crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The coffee was amazing, presentation and taste.

We had a wonderful dining experience at this restaurant. The standout feature was their incredibly welcoming, friendly, and attentive service. The staff patiently recommended dishes and even showed photos of them when we needed assistance.

We ordered the peanut chicken stew and goat curry, both of which were absolutely delightful. The flavors were well-balanced with just the right amount of spice and heat, and there was no gamy taste from the goat meat.

The cocktails were also a hit, and the evening was rounded off with delicious desserts. The overall ambiance was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect setting for a memorable evening.

We'll definitely be returning, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to friends. It's a gem worth visiting again and again.

Went there for dinner and I had cauliflower and buttermilk fried chicken for starters and the portion is pretty generous. Absolutely love both of it. Got the fish curry too and it was amazing tho pretty spicy. However we didn't enjoy the Malindi Halwa dessert so much with it's jelly-like texture. Service is really top notch as they were always attentive.

It’s my first time trying Africa’s cuisine, and I’m pleasantly impressed with the food.

We ordered a variety of curry based dishes, with different level of spiciness - and we enjoyed all of them.

Highly recommended the Goat Curry, where in our opinion is the best one there.

Great ambience and fantastic customer service from the staff. Our waiter spent time to recommend us the dishes. The food is definitely on the pricier side and it felt that it might have been adjusted so much to suit the local palate that the food does not feel uniquely african. When the food tastes very similar to local dishes, it does not really justify the high price.

The crab Pao fan here is good. Other recommended dishes are Ipoh Hor fun & their signature dish, red wine Por ribs.  The La Zi chicken was however a let down. I think the quality of the food has come down recently.

Ordered flower crab paofan ($38) and prawn paste chicken ($12). Good tasting broth for paofan and generous amount of chicken for chicken.

Some downside is the seafood ingredients are not fresh, prawn is so rubbery. Also very costly at $38. Good to try but don’t think I’ll be back soon as I think they’re many paofan that are cheaper with better ingredients in the food scene now.

Despite the good reviews, unfortunately, not for me. The Ginseng Chicken Claypot taste more of wine than ginseng. The Pork Ribs is total disaster, the waiter pour white spirit and lights up before serving. He doesn’t check if the fire burned off the spirit. Imagine you could taste the heavily liquor pork. Vegetables & Tou Fu are normal.
Service is below average.
Price is not cheap as the area is not consider a prime area.

Taste: 8/10 Chicken breast is slightly dry but otherwise the flavour is pretty alright. Mild ginseng taste. Love the variety of mushrooms in it!

Cost: $38 (3-4 pax)

Waiting time: 10 mins on Saturday 1230pm

Overall: Will come back to try the flower crab paofan

Tried the Ginseng Chicken Pao Fan. Love the combination of egg rice and broth. Portion was huge with lots of ingredients. Chicken was very well done and fall-off-the-bone tender. Would definitely come back again to try the other dishes.

It’s sad that the best tasting item was the wedges. Although the chicken was well cooked, the chili sauce, the spice level was ultimately disappointing. Not tasty, too salty, the ketchup sauce tastes so much better.

As much as I enjoy the staffs mingling and enjoying their work, but the chefs were talking a tad too loudly.

Yummy food, big portion. A variety of sauces like ketchup, garlic, herb and those with different level of spiciness.

Had the Tuesday deal which is Chicken Pita bread (buy 1 and get another for 50% discount) including 2 sides each. Added a pineapple ring for additional $1.

Recommends also the quarter chicken. Free flow water provided! However the water tasted weird so 1 star less.

my experience there was amazing. i love the food and how nice the people are over there. personally, although it is a little pricy, the wild herb sauce there made me love the food but the amazing service there made my experience even better. you should definitely go down and experience it for yourself!

One of the better Nandos outlet in Singapore. Service is fast and friendly despite it being a peak hour lunch. Food came hot and relatively fast. Get up to 25% off if you’re an NSF with 11B. Good atmosphere. Nandos, pls open up an outlet in the North!!

Nando’s is well known for their peri peri chicken, we had boneless thigh and chicken breast, they are both cooked very well and tender. Love the sides too. Quality of food is fantastic, just the quantity has reduced quite a lot. The restaurant is very beautifully decorated as you can see from the pictures. Service was also great. However we feel a bit warm in the restaurant, seems the aircon is not too strong. Got to order and pay for the food online before the order is placed. Cutlery and sauces and side plates are all self service at a corner counter. Will be great if they operate like a normal restaurant instead of having to order and pay online and take cutleries on our own.

One of the few times you go to a restaurant and feel that the amount you paid for the service charge is worth it. The floor staff attend to you immediately and ensure the food served are hot. Unfortunately, there were some mishaps with the food served. When informed, it was immediately rectified and a new dish was served. I am very impressed with the service and the quality of food. Kudos.

We were there on a weekend for a late lunch. The place was very empty. We were ushered in quite quickly, but when we wanted to place an order, we waited quite a while to be able to get someone's attention.
3 out 4 items we wanted to order were not available, but we were not informed when we sat down, hence very disappointed. They also have a pasta menu that is not available for weekends too..
Food came quite fast, but the plates have very disgusting dirty and wet cotton string wrapped handles. I cannot imagine anyone's hand touching that and then touching the fries or wrap. Mocktail was a glass of diabetes, 15% to 20% syrup, coloring and milk. The orange cake was a miss too. It tasted like tapioca kueh.

We had a comfortable good time on a rainy Sunday evening, eve of PH, at Ela (Bukit Batok)! Our favourite dish was actually 'Keto' with Pulled Beef - the cauliflower rice was very well done with a generous portion of pulled beef! #mustry
We would like to do a special shout out to the one and only floor staff that night, Yani! She was like a wonderwoman, running the floor service alone, serving at least 5-6 tables of guests professionally - from bringing guests to tables, to taking orders, clearing tables, making drinks, serving the dishes etc.! Mad respect! Thank you for being so attentive and patient with your warm services! Will be back at the new outlet to try other items soon too! 🥳

It was so cozy and absolutely loved the vibes. The food was exceptional and the service was great.

The smell of the pita was sooo good and the pita on my lamb was soaked with flavor. Tho you may want to note that lamb generally has a strong smell/taste. My suggestion is to maybe elevate their dessert as the cake tasted like any ordinary lemon pound cake with an ice cream scoop on top. Wish there were smtg more special.
honestly would come here again.

Food is good, atmosphere is just nice, very family friendly place for people to hang out. The lamb ribs is the bomb; grilled octopus is ok for me, the portion is a bit small for us. But overall is amazing dining experience for us.

I recently visited this Bak Kut Teh place, and it was delicious! The meat was tender and juicy, and the soup was nice and peppery. The tenderloin soup was also tasty. It is worth a try. The location is far from the center of town, but it is worth the trip.

The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender. Soup was not overwhelmingly garlicky or peppery and there's a taste of sweetness of the pork in it. Pig trotters was fabulous too.

A Bak Kut Teh stall that is the main anchor stall in a coffee shop. Order at the counter, and food will be served to the table. Soup refill is self-service.

Reasonable price and above average taste. One of the better BKT in Singapore thou there was no wow feel.

Food not as good as before. Prices increased but quality of food gone down alot. Soup is over salty now, side dishes too oily, mei cai contains too much hard unchewable parts which I need to spit out constantly.
It took away my pleasure of enjoying this popular bak koot teh. We're quite the regulars here by the way. Disappointed.

Love the BKT.  The meat is tender and soup, which is pepperish and flavourful.   The pork trotter is very well done,  soft and juicy, which just melts in your mouth.

Ordered the Butternut Chicken Pizza and Cinnamon Sweet Potato Fries, both were very good. The pizza is thin crust, crispiness was just nice, chicken & butternut portion was good together with the cheese very well match. Sweet potato fries had a hint of cinnamon, cooked very well, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Recommend both item, will be back to try other dishes.

Yummy pizzas. Bought the meat pizza & some portobello pizza- the latter was served up in a really big juicy portobello, t'was the best! Pls give this a try. 1 pizza is about the size of a medium sized plate. Bought 2 pizzas and 1 baked pasta. Total cost was $26.

Visited for lunch and the baked spaghetti chicken was so flavorful! The meat was huge too. Added on the portobello mushroom with cheese, tasted amazing, well seasoned! Will definitely come back 🤓

Excellent thin crust pizza with minimal variety of ingredients that worked hard to give such delicious pizza. Ate once there and ordered to-go twice. Consistency is there. The butternut chicken pizza is my absolute favourite. The saltiness of the cheese juxtaposed with the sweetness from the butternut squash worked well together with the chicken. And the crust of the pizza, the thinnest i've never seen even in Italy, holds the other ingredients well. Kudos to the team!

Chanced upon it while craving for pizza places near Lakeside Gardens. Got the highly suggested butternut chicken pizza and classic choice, Hawaiian pizza. Thin crispy crust, generous cheese and sufficient toppings. The chicken pizza is worth recommending. Surprise were the fresh sweet potato fries (way better than Nandos) and Holland Portobello (3 cheese-stuffed mushrooms with balsamic vinegar).
There is also a membership discount by liking their Fb/Instagram page. It’s located on Level2 (extension building after the parking lot) at Taman Jurong Market and Food Center.

Drumstick with chicken wing combo at $6.80.

Superb long Q and I join in wanting to find out why...

Very tender and juicy chicken. Rice is fragrant too..

The only downside is the chilli still need improvement compare to my must go store in Gek Poh Shopping Center kopishop. That's why minus  stars.

Overall, can eat and will come back again if around the area.

Long queue. But can’t say it was worth the wait. Maybe the chicken quality went down after the shortage…. Skin felt really oily, and the breast meat a bit dry. Rice was nice. Chili nice. Ginger sauce nice. Maybe come back after the chicken supply comes back to normal.

Great and deliciously good Chicken Rice The prices are reasonable. For half a Chicken with 4 plate of rice, it costs you less than $15. They friendly family business. Worth to eat! Very fragrant rice too

This boneless chicken rice stall attracts a crowd. They are usually sold out around lunch time. So it is advisable to come slightly earlier, before noon if possible. Taste is great and the chilli is fantastic. Price is reasonable and the hawkers are friendly.

By 1pm you are probably stretching your luck, as most days they could be sold out by then or favourite parts of the chicken are no longer available.

Chicken is awesome. Price is good.
Half chicken is $15. Love their skin. The sauce pairing is good. Traditional taste.
Rice on the other hand a bit hard but the taste is moderate. Can be stronger tho.
Soup was clear and savoury. It so damn worth it lah.

We came here for breakfast in the wild and then again for lunch since it’s the only place to eat in the zoo. Buffet was ok but not great. The items weren’t refreshed often and so we missed out on a lot of them. Some were just substandard, like the hashbrowns were all soggy and the fruit on the fruit platter was underripe. At lunch the queue was massive and we waited 20 mins to place our order.

Overall the experience is good and walkable. But the food is on the high side. And their chicken rice is prob the worst I ever tasted in my 40yrs livelihood in SG. And it's 13.90 some more.....

Came here for MND Family Day 2023, the restaurant's standards have never changed, consistently practicing the art of scamming tourists and locals alike.

Chicken Rice too much bones
Ice Lemon Tea you're only getting 1/4 of a cup since 3/4 is filled with ice.

Breakfast in the Wild at the Ah Meng Restaurant is one special dining experience that let's you dine in a restaurant with animals roaming nearby.

The buffet selection is fabulous, offering both local and western dishes.

The main highlights are the animals that they bring out during the breakfast time - all with photo sessions.

There is usually a long queue to take photos with the Orangutans.

My overall experience was satisfactory.

The only restaurant inside Mandai Zoo.
It was so crowded that we was so hard to get a seat.
Wait for almost 1 hour and my child is starving 🥲

Not enough stars to rate this place highly enough. Awesome selection of everything: food, wine and local artisan goods from South Africa. And a great gin selection to boot! Wonderful service ... I got mine same day from order to delivery. Highly recommend.

I'd been away from home for 3 months and this store provided me with my comfort food from home (Durban). Felt like crying while eating my chips and sipping my five roses tea. Thank you. Quick and easy service.

Not a review of this place but the delivery driver speeding on the 1st lane PIE. Have photos and video.

Love I’m getting all the South African goodies we can’t get in Singapore. I would recommend the milk tart Tate’s just like the original because it’s cooked fresh.

Still good value for money. Everything is self service but easily navigable.
Limited menu but yummy and fresh
Food was served colder than usual which used to be piping hot. A not fancy but good for a simple non fussy meal

Classic meatballs are delicious as usual. Pork ribs were also juicy and tender at affordable prices. However, they were clearly under staffed as each staff has to manage a food section on their own. They also looked frustrated and overworked, which led to them snapping at some customers. The ordering was also slightly confusing as peole could order differently but the price for some meals were not stated upfront.

Good food at good price. There is always a queue here during meal hours. Popular place for the young & elderly, even for people who ate not here to shop for furnitures. The all time favourites are the Swedish meatball, fried chicken wings. They offer special items from time to time like Mala crayfish, baked chicken with curry sauce, black pepper pork chop etc.

Great, tasty food for sharing at affordable prices, though it can get very crowded and queues can be long. Recommended to go during weekdays or non-peak dining hours to secure seats and have a less bustling environment.

Needless to say much more about this iconic eatery. Visited again after a long while to buy furniture and have lunch there. The chicken wings and meatball are still tasty like I rmb. Tried their salmon dishes which are decently priced given the ingredients inflation. Cheese cake is super smooth. Very value for money. Minus point is the crowds

It's a market that is quite busy and crowded for all 3 meals, due to the number of above average stalls there.  However there isn't good ventilation and it does become stuffy.

Many good food stalls but open Lunch onwards...for Bkt.try the Muslim stalls..very good ..

One of my top three hawker centers for the food and ambiance. Wide range of food options from leicha and caifan to Penang and SG-style laksa. Also parata options, chicken and duck rice, soba, and more. It’s also spread out so the breeze gets through. there’s ample seating at 11-1230pm on a Sunday. It’s well lit so you don’t feel like you’re eating in a dungeon. Extra points for being close to ikea

ABC BRICKWORKS, a heartland hawker center. Open all day - Chinese India Malay food. Have a reasonable good food to try. Today manage to try THE MEEPORK - the minced soba was great (see photo) and JASON PENANG - the char kway teow ( the light ) was excellent, Penang laksa was good too. There are still plenty to try on my next visit.

The claypot chicken rice ( Yuan Yuan ) was so satisfying ! Rice was soft, drizzled with black sauce brought to mix round with all the ingredients. Chinese sausage not hard, chicken tender and not overly dry, and bits of salted fish just nice for the portion and not an overkill. Veg can be a little bit more but it’s not a deal breaker :) love it when it is served piping hot and warm all the way to the end digging the burnt rice crusts out from the sides of the pot. Maybe I don’t eat claypot rice for a long time so the experience may sound a bit exaggerated.   The or jian ( oyster omelette) just a few doors away on same row was nice and crispy that put a smile to my face when I crunched the omelette bits in my mouth combined with the oysters oozing. Oysters were of good size - not too big. It too small.  Ended with iced Ching Tng  with generous ingredients! Impressed ! Uncle has a cheerful demeanour too ;) .

Really enjoyed our brunch at this cozy restaurant. Highly recommended for those that are looking for brunch menus that are not generic (like your eggs benedict, pancakes, etc). Also their plating was on point and the ingredients were super fresh & well prepped. I will definitely come back again.

Small cosy joint that serves excellent Scandinavian food. Though menu is limited yet the curated specialities are made with such excellent culinary standards. Enjoyed the shrimp toast and fish stew so much, we practically wanted to wipe the utensils dry. Love the simplistic clean look of the place and inviting ambience. Will surely return to try the other things on the menu.

Cosy, relaxed little cafe serving Nordic style toast with some amazing toppings. Just the one vegetarian toast option which was the mushroom so tried that with the bean side salad. Both really fresh and tasty. Also had a delicious herbal tea. The staff were very friendly and took a lot of pride in the venue and food. My friend had the seafood stew which looked generous and she really enjoyed it. Worth a try

Delicious open faced sandwiches in a beautiful, unpretentious and welcoming space staffed with warm family vibes! The potatoes were great as well and the tomato with fennel seed soup is a winner. The level of detail in the tableware and decor is admirable too. 10/10 will come back!

This is a cool little spot for having simple but delicious Scandinavian food! I especially loved the bread that came with the fish stew. The meatballs, too, are certainly not your run-of-the-mill IKEA meatballs!

It would be nice, however, if there could be stricter rules against people bumming a 4-person table by themselves, with a laptop, during lunch hour, with nothing but a glass of water.

Value for money chicken chop set meal at a promotional price of $7.80. The smoky, tender and juicy chicken was great on its own even without the gravy (though it would have been nice if the sauce was slightly saltier). Fries was crisp and piping hot, while the tanginess of the coleslaw was perfect.

My only gripe was there was too many tendons in the chicken chop, disrupting the overall eating experience. It would also be good if customers are given the flexibility to select their own side dishes, instead of sticking to the usual fries and coleslaw.

For the price of $13.50, there was definitely some expectations plus i actually tried since I seen xiaxue raving about it. I reached around 6pm and there was only 1 staff. He was busy frying stuff for the western food options and took my order for noodles while informing that I had to wait for a while. I was damn annoyed when he took my order as he kept frowning. The best part is he frowned again when I requested for no meatball and guess what? Check the photo 😂 he was the same guy who made my noodles but I think he may not be supposed to be the one, maybe he just took over cos his colleague was not there... Anyway, scallop is not fresh, fishball is standard factory made type, soup is a weird diluted msg taste, soft shell crab was hot but batter is very thick, and noodle texture is poor. I would say if you really like bak chor mee (No. 25), go to next block 161 stall during day time the young couple makes amazing bcm you won't regret.

I ordered a sirloin steak, medium rare.

The cut was a bit dry and less seasoned to my liking.

I have yet to try the rest of the dishes. I hope my dining experience can be better refined the next round.

This is probably the most expensive meepok I’ve ever had, but I just couldn’t resist not trying their 𝐏𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐢𝐮𝐦 𝐒𝐞𝐚𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐌𝐢𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐝 𝐌𝐞𝐚𝐭 𝐍𝐨𝐨𝐝𝐥𝐞 ($13.50) 😆

It came with premium toppings, like abalone slices, prawn ball, pork slices, minced pork, crispy soft shell crab, tobikko and clams.

Overall, it’s a good and satisfying bowl of meepok to try though it’s quite a splurge for a hawker food 😛 so I won’t buy it repeatedly..

Went around 2pm on a weekend and there was no queue. Chilli is a bit too spicy for someone who can’t really take too spicy food but I imagine someone who loves spicy food will find it quite nice with the springy noodles.

Interesting food court with unique food stalls. The chairs are special and hippy, with a touch of heritage. Nice hangout place if you wanna have yakinuku and beer at night. In the day, wanton mee and liver bak chor mee are good choices.

Rong Fa Bak Chor mee: If you love pork liver, or just lots of ingredients in yummy soup accompanied by al dente noodles, this is the place! The liver served is in HUGE chunks, and lightly blanched, so it is tender and melts in your mouth. So much ingredients in the soup too... 2 meatballs, 1 fishball, fishcake slices, sliced taupok, chunks of minced meat... The noodles are well-cooked and seasoned too. If you order the double balls soup, you get a range of fish balls and meatballs with fillings.

Only downside is the wait. We went at about 1.30 and waited for about half hour. Fortunately, it was worth the wait and we were not in a rush.

Worth the price we paid, which was a total of $13.

Tasted the wanton mee and minced pork noodles, waiting time for for mee pok was 45 min for a non busy day. Wanton mee char siew is nice!

Bunch of variety of food stalls hiding inside this industrial canteen slash beer garden. There is thai, vietnamese, western, bachormee, japanese don, chicken rice. Quite varied options to try, however location is a bit obscure. Food was generally good and tasted above averahe for it's price point.

Nice place for beer. They have draft and bottles beer. Only 4 stalls are open on weekday nights.
Tried the thai food. Ordered the egg, fried rice and noodles. All was good except fried rice was salty.
Western food was nice , tasty and priced reasonable.

Excellent selection of affordable beer on tap served in chilled glasses. Only $8.80-10 a pint. Happy Hour from as early as 7.30am (yes, morning!) till closing, every day. Even credit card payment was available.

Food stalls seem to have a rather high turnover rate. Currently, there are stalls selling Thai, Japanese, Vietnamese, Ipoh cuisine, Grilled lamb, Western and Bak Chor Mee. However, there is nothing much left to eat after 8pm except for mookata.

It's overpriced at 4.30 for a set (because no butter), but maybe because of the coffee.

Came here for lunch during weekday on several consecutive days. They have a good variety of rice, noodles, vegetarian food available. Tried their vegetarian store, chicken rice store and Yong Tau foo store. Prices are affordable and food tasty. Can get quite crowded during lunchtime due to nearby office crowd. Please continue the great work. 🙏

2) The cheong fun stall has vegetable fillings or 3 other fillings (e.g. char siew). Good.
3) The dessert stalls has a variety of hot / cold desserts. The bubor cha cha & chendol are highly recommended. 👍

Nice Food  Center with numerous stalls at affordable price. A bit warm.

02-26 Yong-tau-foo stall (see pic). Lady seller is super friendly and serve with a smile. Very Hygiene way of keeping the yong-tau-foo items in enclosed cabinet for selection! Price is super good in the midst of today's high food inflation (display on stall signboard). Variety of items good enough for most patrons. Laksa & Tom Yam soup is good. If you are in the area, do support her for the low pricing to sell more quantity to sustain her operations. Closed on Sundays.

Ordered apple crumble with a huge scoop of ice cream. Delicious, could be a little more seasoned. Fisherman pasta was filled with plenty seafood. Prawns were especially fresh. Pasta was Al dente. Sauce was delicious although a little salty. Great service and environment (indoors)

Service can be warmer. It really doesn’t cost much to wear a smile when introducing your patrons to their table. Had a steak with warm potato salad, received almost well done instead of medium rare.  We asked for more water once, and it didn’t come. Water comes with a small charge. Our group was seated upstairs, and one of us had to make our way down every time if we wanted to ask the service staff for assistance.

It’s been a while since my last visit to Fika. Was rather disappointed by the quality of the food and service rendered this time round.

I recalled the server used to take order but now we have to self-order at the counter.  As we were seated at the second level, it was rather a hassle to go up and down a few time just to order and ask for water. If they want to have self-service ordering, at least allow customers to scan and order via QR code.

The meatball was rather dry and the grilled chicken was slightly salty too. We requested for candles and they did not offer too. Could feel a huge difference in the overall experience this visit, and would likely not return again.

Never fell in love this easy with food before and yes i said it. I love how tasty the meatballs are and the beef stew are made with almost perfection. Definitely come again next time to try some new dishes next time.

Although the food was alright, the seat I was at was vibrating throughout the whole meal and it was really annoying. We later realised that we were seated directly above a ceiling fan installed on level 1 which is likely the cause of the vibration. Our table was next to a window and I found it rather glaring but was sternly told by one of the servers that the curtains must be kept open. While I respect that the restaurant might have a good reason for such a rule, the message could have been more politely communicated.

Large range of food available here. Spacious with generally clean tables and chairs.

Some recommendations:
1. Love Lian Kee minced meat noodles (soup and dry!).
2. There is a popular Chinese stall selling dumplings and noodles - always snaking queues.
3. Chinatown beef noodles (soup and dry)
4. Soy sauce chicken
5. Balonglong juice and avocado shake
6. Prawn mee
7. Muffins

There has been a general revamp and change in stalls. But overall, still a good place to find affordable and tasty food.

There are lots of great hawker stalls here, including dumplings, prawn noodles, claypot laksa, roasted pork rice, muffins, the iconic Mr Avocado, among many more! Always spoilt for choice when I come here. It gets crowded and bloody hot during lunch hour, though.

Very good food court...great choice and great taste with all dishes Asia can offer, at reasonable prices...go where the locals would go

Patronized this 古早味Big Prawn Noodle Stall in Alexandra Village Food Centre. It was 3pm, hence no crowd in the Hawker Centre.
I was second in queue. Ordered a Pig’s Tail Prawn Noodle and another Pork Ribs Prawn Noodle. Our orders were served within 5 minutes, self collect.
I was a little disappointed when the orders were collected - the two bowls of Prawn Noodles did not appear like those in their photo displays.

In the Pork Rib Prawn Noodle, the prawn were pretty small - 4 halves small prawns deshelled without prawn heads but with the tails attached. Two pieces of pork bone chunks instead of pork ribs and four slices of lean pork. One miserable strand of vegetable.

For the Pig’s Tail Prawn Noodle, the prawn serving, lean pork and vegetable servings were similar. There were 4 pieces of pig’s tail.

However, we must say the prawn soup was really good. The pork bone chunks were well seasoned and texture were nice. The lean pork slices were quite tender. And oh…the pig’s tails were really soft and the skin and meat slide off the bones easily.

Besides “feeling deceived” by the photo displays and the small sizes of prawn, the servings were reasonably sized and the meals tasted good overall. $6 for each bowl of noodle was reasonable.

Relatively cheap place to eat with lots of options. Went here around 10am and it wasn't crowded. The place is clean and food was served quickly.

Many good food options like mutton soup, fried carrot cake, duck rice, wanton noodles and Nana curry. The hawker centre us a little run down and could definitely do with some upgrades. It is also not easy to find parking especially during peak hours and weekends

Great old school hawker centre. Enjoyed the NaNa Curry. Spicy but tasted good. Hokkien mee was also tasty with bits of fried pork crackers on top and mixed with into the noodles. It was hot in the afternoon but will go there again.

Now this is the real deal. With a plethora of options, I stumbled upon fantastic selections at incredibly reasonable prices. Situated in a bustling location, it exudes a wealth of character that makes the visit absolutely worthwhile.

This hawker center (recently renovated in Nov 2022) caters mostly to the breakfast and lunch crowd and come dinner time, many stalls are closed or their food sold out by 7.30pm+.

One notable and nondescript exception is the Vietnamese Cooked Food stall located at the corner of the hawker center (next to the Modern Old School coffee stall) and facing the carpark.

This is a one-lady operation helmed by a hardworking Vietnamese lady, Ann who speaks Mandarin, English and some dialects. For carbo eaters, check out the Ribs with Rice (Com Suon) (generous rice portion!) and Bahn Mi (bread). They are both delectable and very filling even for those who feel Vietnamese food are light. Many customers, especially the ladies, are seen ordering the Pho with Beef and Noodle Soup.

The stall operates from 10.30am-10pm. Something to consider if you are coming here for a late dinner, or wish to skip the lunchtime crowd at the other popular stalls. At 9pm+, most stalls, except the drinks stalls,  at the hawker center would be closed. Paynow and Paylah are available.

A Huge hawker center with many stalls some a few with Michelin Bib.  Nice airy and clean environment with ample parking around the hawker.

Hidden Gem Unearthed - Redhill Food Centre Singapore! 🍲✨

Amidst the bustling city, I stumbled upon a culinary oasis at Redhill Food Centre. This unassuming hawker centre revealed a hidden gem - a delightful $1.5 chicken rice with a mouthwatering taste of soup. The flavors danced on my palate, leaving me pleasantly surprised by the incredible value and authentic taste.

Redhill Food Centre is a treasure trove of local delights, where passionate hawkers craft affordable and delicious dishes that satisfy both the stomach and the soul. A true haven for foodies seeking a taste of Singapore's gastronomic delights without breaking the bank.

•Bak Kee Satay BeeHun

I recently had the pleasure of trying "Bak Kee Satay BeeHun", and I must say, it left me thoroughly satisfied. The star of the dish was undoubtedly the satay sauce, which perfectly complemented the noodles. The rich and creamy satay sauce had just the right balance of sweetness and spiciness, creating a harmonious flavor explosion, which I find it very creative.

The noodles, accompanied by tender squid, succulent pork liver, and thinly sliced pork meat, were a delightful addition. The variety of textures and flavors added depth to each bite, making it a truly memorable experience.

One word of advice to fellow food enthusiasts: devour this dish quickly! The noodles have a tendency to soak up the flavors, and while that might sound tempting, it's best enjoyed when the noodles are still slightly firm.

•Fried Oyster

Out of so many dishes the stall offered, I would recommend their Fried Oyster, non-greasy, and the oyster was just cooked right. Not too raw or not too cooked.

Char Kuey Teow was just so.. so only in my opinion, and nothing to shout for.

Little do you know:
The difference between fried carrot cake black or white are not only the colour of the sauce itself, but also the taste. To all tourist, remember to choose the white instead as that's what local Singaporean will choose. If you are curious with the black sauce, it tends to be sweeter if you like it.

One of my go to Hawker for breakfast, lunch probably not recommended for dinner.
Prata, duck noodles, Chee Cheong Fun, Nasi Briayani, chicken rice, curry rice, bread and toast, soya beans, soft boiled eggs. What you name it, will definitely full-fill your 90% of your choice.
Prices might not be as economical as you thoughts, but it won’t be rocket high. Saturday & Sunday are packed, avoid peak hours.
Enjoy!

Good variety of food stalls here. Been here thrice but so far all the stalls I have tried are good. Only tried the pancake this time which I personally like for the crunchiness as well as softness and non-dryness (if this is the right way to describe it).
Would update next time upon visiting

Here to mention that this dessert stall’s chendol is weird. Taste more like ice kacang. Forgot to snap photo of my tau suan, but they are good 👍 at tau suan.

It’s another great go to place for the family.

海南仔 in the Chong Pang Hawker food center cooks and sells fried carrot cake, fried Chao Kuay Tiao (fried noodles), Fried Oysters and many common local food. We understand the humidity, the heat in Singapore and the hawkers needing to stand for a really long time (if the business is good). However, my recent experience with the service staff was bad tempered and unable to convey what further information he needs to take my order. The food was mediocre. People only queue for this stall because the good stall (selling the same thing) was closed.

Pretty average. But the serving size though. At $4.50 the hokkien Mee is really one of the larger serving size I have encountered. This is the thick bee hon variety which I don't prefer. Should have asked more chili for the taste.

Edit (Jan 2023): doing my dd to review their fkt. Small plate cost only $4.

It was better than their hokkien Mee. Generally more savory (salty) [my preference] than sweet, Chinese sausage is a contribution to that as well. Cockles was very small and few in between.

Noodles is just slightly on the softer side for me but i am sure many will find it enjoyable.

Added: White carrot cake $3

The bigger chunk variety, it is pretty average. Chill has a kick and the preserve radishes add a more savory profile to carrot cake. Otherwise if u like scramble egg this might be up your alley. The egg isn't crispy at all but large chunk of scramble egg so is like 50% scramble egg 50% average carrot cake

Not sure how this place was even awarded the Michelin bib gourmand award because the food tasted pretty ordinary. Ordered 4 dishes from the stall and NONE stood out at all. In fact there was no queue at all for it in that forever bustling Chong Pang Market. Ironically, it was a stall selling similar stuffs just diagonally behind it that had a queue of over 20 persons.

Char kway teow not bad, the wet kind. Feels abit like mee goreng in fact only sweet sauce instead of tomato sauce...
Quite big cockles and not stingy with the numbers.

Carrot cake ok only, maybe should try the other stall next time

We saw a long queue for this stall. I can say it is very popular and many locals really like their cooking. We ordered the white carrot cake and it was pretty good. The chilli goes very well with it and the egg was perfectly fried. So nice. We like the fact that we can ask them to put more onion chives on top 'coz it adds more flavour to it.

Despite the long queue, it moves fast and they also cook and serve the food very quick. The uncle is also very nice and cheerful.

Lazy staffs ... Super Duper bad service !

Dropped by for quick dinner. Food was so so. Price reasonable.

Menu is extensive, that's not necessarily a good thing. Didn't know where to start so we went for the tim sum (since most had some on their table).

place was very warm although indoors, seems like aircon is all broken.

plenty of fish scales in the fish slices in the horfun though, almost wanted to ask if it’s part of the dish.

the dim sums are still edible but not recommended.

Drinks had a charred taste, but it’s still acceptable i guess?

not sure why it is rated 4 stars? i wouldn’t give it above 1 star, a random kimly dimsum would have tasted better, so i am doubting the ratings here

For Dim Sum and Pao Fan lover, this will be a good place for you!

A place to enjoy the old school vibe. It has a good selection of dishes and dim sum, from the typical Zi char items to Hong Kong style quick bites. Their pao fan (rice is rich broth) is a must order. Thoroughly enjoyed that.

Place is generally not overly crowded. Parking can be an issue if you go at lunch time. Expect parallel parking lots.

A unique restaurant with some strange decoration that added to its charm. The chill vibe and cooling environment with fans made it a pleasant spot, but be warned about the mosquitoes. Luckily, we arrived early, as the place filled up quickly. Although the food took a while to be served, the quality and generous portions made up for it. It might be a bit pricey, but the overall vibe is worth it. We will visit again with friends next time.

Discovered this hidden gem after driving by and the atmosphere was alluring. Looked like a full house, but staff made space for us. I was already expecting a bit of a slow wait, so bearing that in mind, food was definitely worth the wait. Drinks (root beer and Heineken bottle) came within 5 minutes of sitting down, first dish (fried rice) came around 30+ min after, and everything else came quite quickly after that.
Highly recommend the onion rings, satay and fish and chips. Serving sizes were generous and tasted great.
Not sure what’s with the recent low reviews - this place definitely is a charm for what it is. If you’re expecting super fast, quick, and “high class” restaurant vibes, then this isn’t the spot for you. If you’re looking to chill, have a hearty meal, enjoy the atmosphere without rush, then this little gem of a cafe does the job.
