The burger’s sauce was too salty for our liking, and the pork ribs was not that meaty and tasted bleh. We liked the unique atmosphere though.

A lovely place to chill. As I was driving so didn't drink. They have a good selection of food and drinks. Must try if you're ard the area or at least Tey to make yr way there. Secluded and quiet. Go on a weekday as I heard it is usually very packed on the weekend.

Good satay. Avoid the chicken salad if you want less calories n vegetables, it’s loaded with chicken and sauce. Rustic and great place to hang out for a drink at night. The next time I will try their peranakan dishes. There is no ac, so it can get hot in the day.

It’s a hidden gem that only got to know this place now whereby they have been here for almost 2 years (open during covid time). Its actually sister restaurant from its main restaurant at Bedok. It’s family friendly with mostly all round table setting. Easily good for 6-12 pax. This place can be very crowded so be there early to avoid disappointment. It’s very spacious, nice ambience and comfortable to dine in. It’s a Teochew restaurant, hence must try their signature dishes. Chilled Teochew Pork Trotter Jelly, Homemade Teochew Prawn Ball, Teochew Kway Teow are some of the must try. There is currently promotion on extra value set on weekdays dinner only which is really value for money. You can have choice of fish/prawn, chicken/duck/meat & veg/tofu/omelette on top rice, soup & tea/water. All good taste great and portion is decent for 4 adults. Especially the coffee pork ribs, it’s tender juicy and yet flavorful. Kway Teow also got wok hey. The only disappointment we have got is we did not manage to get our oyster omelette 蠔煎 order on our table during our 45 minutes dining time (6:45pm-7:30pm). Not sure if they missed our order but they claim that its still on order queue even we finished all our extra value meal. We just have to give up with disappointment. You can’t expect customer to wait oyster omelette for another 30 minutes whereby you have already finished your dinner. Probably they just couldn’t cope with the order and do not mind missing one or two customers along the queue in any case they will still sell it to a later customer (probably a shorter time).  That’s a 2 star rating for Service. Hopefully can try it when my next visit (with reasonable waiting time).

Had an assortment of dim sum for lunch. Overall pretty average. I reckon the cooked food might be better? It was quite crowded during lunch hour. The charsiew pau was probably the best of them all.

Authentic Teochew Cuisine.
Sat Dinner, luckily we have made a reservation as the place is almost full .

Food is served very fast and they asked if we want to slow down the pace... and then last 3 dishes did not come till they activate again😅
I would say the food is within our expectations of a good teochew cuisine and portions are good.
Only exception is the teochew kway teow, L portion but hardly enough for 8 of us.

Best American bar in Singapore. Amazing pool table and the best people you'll meet in your life. Only 4 stars because I don't remember half the night.

Enjoy the moment  in nelson bar yesterday, Love the vintage atmosphere and with friendly bartender zila and shine was amazing thank you for your wonderful hospitality will come by and visit you guys again.

You can literally meet Mariners from every seafaring county on earth, good cold Tiger & you can stumble back to the ship if need be.

Media Invite~

Started in the 50s, Nelson Bar used to be frequented by sailors and captains who docked at the Sembawang naval shipyard, making it one of the oldest bars in Singapore.

The bar’s history is still retained through pieces left by sailors – old pictures, life buoys and scribbles on walls – and a pool table that’s made out of decommissioned ships.

You must visit Nelson Bar to experience this nostalgic spot and perhaps learn a thing or two about this bar’s past over some drinks and a game of pool with friends. Pool table is not available due to COVID-19 restrictions these days.

For vegetarians and non alcoholic people like me,they do serve a range of mocktails and plant based dishes etc.

It is a place to rest,relax,listen to music and mingle with nice people.

Zila served me well.

Thank you Mashel for inviting me to such a historical place.

The wine is good, with tinge of sweetness and hinge of dryness.
We really enjoy our meal in a restaurant with such a serene environment right beside Singapore River.

Good food good ambience..service was good and they went extra mile by accommodating my request for bringing a brownie for our lovely friend turning 40..staff has been has been very helpful and cheerful..
Special shout-out to YIng!!

However, I requested to add one additional pax and.. the person over the call mentioned that restaurant is full, finally accommodate my request. To my surprise, the restaurant was pretty much empty!

One of the best dining experiences in Robertson Quay. Authentic slow cooked Persian delicacies. A bit on the expensive side but no match for the quality they serve.

Grew up eating their orh lua, however I was there last week for supper and ordered the big serving. The flour/starch was super hard and all in small bits like fried crumps. There were only 5-6 pieces of oyster and they were over cooked and felt mushy.
Only the chilli is good, but it is the same chilli you get everywhere, nothing special

Date of visit: Wed 4 Oct 2023
Time : 9.50 pm

Tried the fried oyster omelet flour 耗煎for the first time. Priced at $5.

Egg was over fried. The flour was too oily. See what remains on my plate.

Carrot Cake / Chye Tow Kueh (SGD $5) @ Bedok North 85 Fried Oyster Carrot Cake.
.
This remains a popular stall in an equally popular hawker centre, though allegations that quality varies by the mood of the chefs has some truth.
.
Generally above average and decent value for money, the plates borders the edge of smoky goodness, with soft moist texture to the carrot cake, and a good spread of egg over.
.
The black is better, as the dark sweet soy sauce with the egg creates a tasty sweet eggy savoury salty flavour. The white loses slightly as it lacks crispness, and the savoury sweet eggy salty flavour is mild.
.
.
.
Fried Oyster Omelette (SGD $5) @ 85 Bedok North Fried Oyster.
.
This popular supper spot has decent quality of dishes.
.
Their version has more distinct chunks of fluffy egg and soft crisp potato starch, making it great for those who don't like it mixed.
.
The oysters are medium sized and juicy. Lends briny salty sweet flavour to the smoky eggy savoury notes of the base. Chili has a nice spicy sour kick that builds on the palate.

The oyster egg portion is big for 8 dollars. The best part is actually the sauce that comes with it.

Despite the 2.8 goggle review, still decide to give this bedok north oyster omelette stall a try. The S$5 hokkien mee is decent, and I like their chilli so I asked for more 😋.

Review as posted on my IG: Yummymich

Reviews: 

Few years ago, my first time tasting their curry chicken noodle was not a pleasure experience. It was too salty too oily too expensive.

Today, after probably 5 years later, I pay my 2nd visit, very hopeful to enjoy a different and improve tasting experience.

Yes. They has improved a lots. The curry flavour was well balance, not too salty, spiciness just nice, not too oily and portion was decent and price is reasonable.

As compared to the famous and popular curry chicken noodle at Hong Lim food centre, they are not as good as that top standard, but their flavour and taste was already very close. In fact, their portion is bigger than the popular one.

Glad to see their great improvements and no wonder always long queue. Highly recommended if you like curry chicken noodle.

💥 Welcome to my food sharing Instagram: jkgourmets. 欢迎游览我的美食IG: jkgourmets

A simple above average curry noodles.
Pro tip, adding too much chilli yourself will alter the taste. You will not taste the curry aroma and instead you will only taste peanut flavour kinda gravy.
There may gut be a long queue during peak hours.

Remember to put extra sambal into your curry chicken noodles for the spiciness and fragrant. Always ordered the medium size, as small size was never enough for my craving of it. A single bowl of CCN served with a generous portion of Hainanese Steamed Chicken and tau pok, the meat was juicy and tender. Overall it taste good and delicious.

Long queue for a reason, and will queue for it again!

There's always a long queue. It's my second time (gave it a second chance), but i can't quite fathom why still. The soup is the most distinct part of the dish here imo; it's more milky than most others and perhaps this is its draw, but my friend and i couldn't get into it. Everything else is rather on par with the average curry chicken noodles, and you might get better cuts of chicken if you're lucky. As a bonus, the chicken portion is rather generous.

So not worth it! Just 2 pcs of chicken meat and so many tau pok and 1 pc potato.  I'd rather get the curry noodle at golden mile market. So much tastier.

Date of visit: Wed 4 Oct 2023
Time : 10 pm

Tried this stall for the first time. Ordered a small meatball noodle soup priced at $3.50.

Quite many people ordered. Got the beeper to inform you when it’s ready.

Soup is alright but salty. Noodles are springy maybe tough for old folks. Portion quite small.

Overall taste is good.

More than 10years apart, the taste and flavour are well maintained!
Comfort food.
Soup is simple yet comforting.
Noodle texture is done just right. Minced meat blends well with the hot soup and tastes really great with the noodle.

Relatively clean and very organised in terms of ordering system and buzzer.
Speed is quick as there is a system within the store.

I love the broth so much as even though it is very greasy and oily, the soup has a sweetness from the minced meat, and the alkalinity of the thick mee kia noodles is not too heavy. The noodles are so chewy and quick thick. I love it!! Minced meat is soft and generous as well. The addition of the dumplings is a must! It has sa fragrant sole fish flavour in it.

Using the old school style of ceramic bowl, it feels like I'm eating my grandma's food ❤️

First time trying a soup version of Bak Chor Mee! Maybe because I was never a fan of bak chor mee, this soup version tasted underwhelming for me. The soup felt under seasoned and the noodles were quite average. The only thing I like about this dish is that they gave a lot of pork balls at only $4.50! Overall a underwhelming experience for me....

This is a nice bowl of soupy bak chor mee. They do one item and do it well, and no wonder it has a big following and long queues.

Tried the $4.5 Bak chor Mee on a Sunday morning. Luckily, no line and was served in 2 minutes.

One thing that is distinctly clear is the number of meat balls, which are really soft and nice to chew.

The soup is nice and not like water. Good flavour. Asked for extra chilli, and that adds some much needed spice. Good amount of minced meat as well. Noodles are soft.

This is a feel-good meal.

18/11/23
had cravings for pork knuckle.
2 dishes that contained pork knuckles did not disappoint. the skin was evenly crispy, and meat was soft and tender. they taste quite similar to the ones you get in germany.
the mac and cheese was great, too.
you can skip the soup, was good, but save your tummy for another sausage platter😉
only 2 of us, so we couldn't order much to try. We will be back to try new dishes~

waiter and waitress(chinese) was very hospitable.

One of many outlets in Singapore serving hearty German fare and beer. Akin to a German beer hall in atmosphere with friendly staff serving the delicious food. Visiting during Oktoberfest presents more food and drink options and that makes it very popular, requiring advance booking. Value for money considering the amount of meat that’s served.

I am a Germann living in the US and visiting Singapore. This place is absolutely amazing. The food is authentic and delicious. They even import the breadcrumbs for the Schnitzel from Austria. The Erdinger Helles was one of the best I have had. Five stars all around! (and yes, I went 3 times here in 4 days)

Had a great time at this place. As much as I love Asian cuisine, after about 13 days it is always nice to go back to some western comforts and you can’t go wrong with a chicken schnitzel and a beer. The staff were all great and always made sure to serve your beer with the obligatory “Prōst!” which is generally used to say “Cheers!” The deserts were nice and the ambience at this location was quite calm which is a welcome change to the busy street markets, food courts and hawker centres. Really glad I visited!

This is a nice German beerhouse in Katong and has a few branches around the island. A reservation is recommended as it's quite popular and fills up fast.

Service is friendly and quick. Beer are strong and taste great in the sweltering Singapore heat. We tried the following -

1) Schweinshaxn (Signature Pork knuckle) - So so good. Crispy but meaty, this is a good rendition of pork knuckle. It was so much that we had to pack some of it. Served with bacon sauerkraut and potato salad.

2) Brezn (4x Pretzel) - Liked how this was presented, but the taste is okay.

This is the best Cheng Tng in SG! A refreshing dessert featuring the natural sweetness of sweet potato, the chewy richness of dried persimmon, and the subtle crunch of winter melon strips.  It's thirst-quenching and perfectly balances flavors and textures. With each bite, you'll experience a symphony of tastes that rejuvenate your palate on a hot day. Do note it's with ice chips, not shaved ice.

Used to come here for the Cheng Tng in the past. However, standard has dropped over the years and it is not as good as before.

Overall, still a decent bowl of Cheng Tng, although price has also increased due to inflation: $3 per bowl.

Very generous with the variety of ingredients they used!

Surprised to find strips of dried permission and even sweet potato chunks in it! Portion was huge and it’s was such a delight to have this on a hot day.

Only wishing for it the be less sweet and served in shaved ice.

For cyclist, this is a great stop for a break!

A nice bowl of cheng teng. On the sweet side. Ice chips instead of shaved ice. Pricey at $3.

Had cheng tng ($3) on 15/7/23, was excellent! My personal favorite

The best thing is the noodles and broth. Noodles were cooked just right, chewy and tasty. The soup was packed with flavors and I loved that it had a garlicky note. Overall always a good place to slurp down a good bowl of mee.

Really inconsistent. Sometimes good, sometimes bad. These days they do not close past midnight. The queue is much more forgiving these days hence ok to pop by for a quick meal. Always order the large one.

Meatballs are good and the noodles are quite al dente.

There are a few bak chok noodle stalls in this hawker centre.  This stall served not only soup noodle but also dry noodle.

This is my preferred stall as the meat balls and minced meat were tastier for my liking.  I also prefer their ordering system.

You will be given a caller after your order.  You do not have to wait there.  While waiting for the food, you could queue for other stalls.

Soup was thick and rich filled with minced meat, noodle springy. Pair with generous amount of fishballs and meatballs.
A bit tough to find seats and parking lot during weekend peak hour.

Ordered the small portion. Was quite satisfying. Love the overall taste. Bring back many memories of those late night supper at Bedok 85 back then. Will definitely come back again.

Wow! The food here is really amazing. Each plate is lovingly cook to perfection for each customer. From the beginning to end, I can see that the chef is very passionate about his food and want to share it with his customers.

Definitely 5 stars.

We tried the top 3 items on the menu - Signature Mee Tai Mak, Dry Laksa and Dry Mee Siam. The Mee Tai Mak is fried with century egg! It is a very unusual ingredient for fried noodles but it blends in so beautifully! It is also full of wok hey! Excellent. The mee siam is so full of flavor! Dry laksa is also amazing.

All is nice but really recommend the signature mee tai mak!

Omy the mtm is really good! so much textures & flavours...can't really pinpoint everything but it is defo a pleasureable one!

Laska was lemak fragrant & really special!

Mee siam was OK, but I think cos I was wowed by the earlier 2 dishes more! But still a lovely dish though I wished it more tangy in its flavours!

Prawn paste chicken wings and prawn rolls are very nice. Dry meesiam is great after adding lime! Dry laksa is pretty good too. Mee tai Mak is not bad.

Tried the dry laksa small portion and the prawn roll. Was blown away by the taste. Also bought a calamamsi spread home to try. Will be back to try the mee tai bak and har cheong kai next round. Love that everything on their menu is tasty yet fairly priced. Will recommend that one order the medium size portion. Small portion is just not enough.

Ordered the dried laksa and mee siam. Both are bad. Dried laksa lacks the usual laksa aromatics eg. haebi, laksa leaf. Can only taste coconut milk. Dried mee siam is sweet and too wet a consistency. Overall just badly executed.

The only stall opened in the evening so we had a nice quiet space to dine. The prawn paste chicken was seasoned very well. My husband liked the fish soup. Dishes were not too salty. Can’t ask a lot on the service as it is a hawker stall. We spent $30 for 2 of us. Might come back and try other dishes as stall owner seemed passionate and diligent with his craft.

Decided to do a dinner take-away at  this zi char stall at Blk.16 Bedok South. Wait time was slightly shorter than 20 minutes even though there were a bit of a queue. Pretty fast I must say. Ordered the following dishes and my taste bud's verdict: 1) Sweet sour fish; It tasted ok. Nothing to shout about. 2) Black soy sauce pork with ginger; The pork slices were tender with a nice gingery taste. The bits of fried pork lard gave an additional porky flavour. 3) Fried sambal kangkong; Sambal flavour was nicer than most places. 4) Fried rice; The rice was lumpy and soggy. There wasn't any wok-hei flavour in it. Disappointment. 5) Fried prawn paste chicken (Har cheong gai); Perhaps the best dish. The chicken wings were crispy on the outside and tender and juicy inside. My favourite dish here. 6) Fried tofu with vegetables; Tasted just like any other zi char stall. It's saving grace was the bits of fried pork lard which added an extra texture to the dish. Overall verdict: It's about the same as the average hawker centre/coffee shop zi char stalls.

We (3 covers) had Har Cheong Gai, crayfish soup, bitter gourd pork ribs, prawn omelette, and mixed vegetables with one rice for $48.

It’s a busy stall so it’s best to arrive and order before 7pm. Make your payment at the point of order and make sure you know your table number. Har Cheong Gai was amazingly juicy and crisply fried! The meat inside was tender but not very flavorful.

Overall it’s a great value, and delicious to boot!

Gem of a zhi char store at the hawker centre of Blk 216 Bedok North street 1. The food is generally delicious and cooked with good wok hei.

The prawn paste chick is crispy on the outside with good prawn paste flavour, and juicy on the inside. The braised red garoupa fish head with bitter gourd is very well seasoned, and for us the star of this meal. The Kang kong is properly cooked.

Prices are not quite Hawker centre level, but for the  food you get it’s well worth the money in my view.

One slight drawback: if you’re going for dinner, there are few other stalls open except for Sin Ho, so you’ll have to buy your own drinks.

Highly recommended.

They served a delicious seafood soup with a awesome broth. And the prawn paste chicken was equally tasty. It was nicely fried and had a fragrant prawn paste taste.

Arguably one of the best genuinely-handmade epok-epok around. The epok-epok were freshly fried. If you like crispy epok-epok, this is a must have! Flaky, crunchy yet feeling light in the mouth. The fillings were reasonably filled too. Both potato & sardine options were well-marinated & tasted awesome 🤤 Oh did I mention it costs only 60cents/piece? Bang for buck definitely.

Enjoying epok for the very first time. A flatter dough. Crisper than regular curry puff. With a delicious potato and vegetable filling san curry powder. Very enjoyable.

Here they use a slighter riper sweeter banana to make their goreng Pisang.

60 cents each.

My go-to place for my epok epok fix. Very popular epok stall in this small bedok corner hawker center. The popular filling are potatoes and sardine. If possible, call to order or be prepared to queue and wait. The stall closed on Monday and Tuesday. Recommended

Not hard to get lucky with fresh epok epoks given their turnover rate. We got these fresh from the fryer, perfect for a midday snack. At 60CENTS a pop, what's not to love? Yang's epok epok firmly belongs in our hawker culture and we need to protect places like these.

Best epok epok in Singapore! The crusts stay crispy for hours. We usually take away 10 of each: Potato epok epok, Sardine epok epok, and Goreng Pisang in the afternoon.

The epok epok stay crispy on the exterior until at night! Amazing. The filling is good too.

Highly recommended.

- chahaya rossaz, one of the recommended food stalls. Claypot rice flavourful and tasty. Loved it

Cons;

Also known as Bedok Corner Food Centre, is located at No.1 Bedok Road. This food centre is a very good place to try all kind of popular Halal street food at a reasonable prices. Of course there are also some Chinese food like Carrot Cake, Boneless Chicken Rice, etc.
It’s just a 10 minutes bus ride from Tanah Merah MRT Station.

I chanced upon a new roti prata stall. Decided to try my luck and order sardine murtabak and nasi lemak. The murtabak was absolutely delicious and the nasi lemak is totally solid! Finished the murtabak before I can take a picture. Do enjoy the picture of the nasi lemak. It is situated at the corner.

Dropped off passenger around East Coast and was trying to get some quick bite and continue my grab driving.
First time here but this place is pleasant, clean toilet, good food (thought that I only tried this carrot cake).
Ppl here all very friendly ❤️❤️❤️

Excellent new kebab place here,  Baraja Kebab, with a genuine Egyptian chef! Ordered a few dishes and everything was delicious! I’m definitely coming back, we need to keep this gem open!

Reviews: 

Very patient staff and you can tell they’re trying their best to cater to every needs. There was a customer complaining of bad smells and I saw them shuffling around just to please that guy despite a rather busy weekend. (To begin with, I wonder why that guy chose a table near the toilet)

Anyway, the food is unique here. Expect your Benedict’s with salted egg sauce, chicken with Milo and ice cream served in tempura style.

Ambience is a little warm for me despite Aircon running at full blast.

Made a reservation but was late but staff were super friendly and understanding. Ordered Egg Benedict and Salted Egg Chicken Burger, upgraded to the set with Cappuccino and Mushroom Soup. Food came super fast, like within 5-10 minutes of ordering! The cappuccino and mushroom soup were great, loved the latte art 🥰 Also the eggs Benedict was on point, compared to other eggs Benedict dishes I’ve had at other cafes. Servings were generous and left feeling very satisfied.

Had dinner here. Found this place by accident. The food was delicious. Certain portion was a tad salty but not a deal breaker. Definitely need to make a reservation the next time I'm coming here.

Reasonable prices, good service and atmosphere, waiting times can be a bit long. Coffee was fragrant and not acidic. Unfortunately I found the raclette to be too pungent, even more so than blue cheese. Otherwise this is a nice small Cafe to hang out at.

We came here at 2pm on a Sunday, not crowded but the service was damn slow and bad. We ordered at 2:11pm, 1 steak with 5 dollars top up for the cheese and 1 salmon. Half an hour later at 2:41pm, the food were still not here so we went to ask the staff, they said 6 more minutes. Waited for about another 8 minutes still no food so went to ask again and they replied rudely "now, now, now!" Ended up our food were still not here. Finally my salmon arrived, only the fish was hot, the sides were all cold, terrible! Steak arrived around 2:52pm and we had to wait another 5 minutes for the cheese that we paid $5 for. Of course the steak turned cold! Ordered medium rare, what came was medium well to well done. Come on... you all can do better, waited more than 50 minutes for trash food. My hubby ate 1 mouthful and asked for refund. Within 1 minute, the female cook came to clear the food angrily making quick and noisy moves. Wow, serve so slow clear so fast, worst service I've experienced.

Ordered the $39 set menu for 2 which came in fairly small portions. Their signature sweet sour pork with lychee is good, not overly sweet nor sour. The bean curd vegetable dish was on the bland side. Our fried rice had some wok hei but the portion is more for a person instead of 2. The herbal prawns (6 of them) soup was not over powering of herbs if one is not fond of angelica. The free dessert was white fungus with red dates. Although sweet, it was cold and a nice way of ending my meal. Good thing abt this place is no GST or service charge and actually the service personnel is attentive and polite. Food was served fast as well.

Putian style food place. Neat and nice location. Ordered the set meal for 2 pax. Food is tasty enough but portion is more for small eaters. In fact the portion can be finished by 1 person with big appetite. Drinks like tea and coffee can be ordered from the coffee shop next door and consumed.

1. They have worms in their broccoli. I found 2 worms so i minus 2 stars
2. They served me one of the hardest and toughest chicken i’ve eaten so i minus 1 star
The rest of the food served tastes fine, not too bad lor.
But if you have a fear of worms I don’t recommend you to come (:

Fast turn around, fast serving, attentive staff, friendly and great food.

Highly recommended the xin hua thin noodle if you like stir fried bee hoon. If you like soupy kind, you can op for fujian noodle.

If you can take raw seafood, you can try the garlic raw cockles.

A very popular small eatery in Lorong Ah Soo. About 4 tables inside and 4 outside the restaurant. Can get crowded at peak hours for lunch and dinner. Ample parking available.

Tried the Putian Lor Mee and fried sweet potato noodles. Flavour is mild but delicious. At $6 for 1 pax it is reasonable price for restaurant setting.

Can order dishes when dining with more pax. There is enough variety for a yummy lunch or dinner.

1 of the best porridge I've tried . The serving is quite a lot. Big chunks of liver in the porridge with fried shallots and spring onions. The porridge is tasty and smooth. Don't mind coming back again to try the other options . It's crowded during lunch time but the shop assistant will help you find seats

How can a porridge restaurant garner such a high number of reviews and such a high rating? The answer is the porridge is really that good and very affordable.

There weren't much seats in the restaurant so most people would opt to takeaway. The queue was quite long and I had to wait about 30minutes for my porridge. Even though I ate it about an hour later, it was still piping hot.

The porridge had a slightly smoky aroma with a gooey consistency like typical Cantonese porridge. Initially I was afraid that I wouldn't be full so I added on some sliced pork to my pork ball and century egg porridge, and a youtiao but I kinda regretted it as they were so generous with the ingredients that I felt like I just came back from a buffet after finishing the porridge.

I would recommend getting the minced pork ball and century egg as the combination works the best.

Best porridge in town! Be prepared to queue for at least 15 mins and then wait about 30 minutes for your piping hot bowl of creamy goodness chockful of ingredients! Go for the signature porridge. My parents frequently travel accross the island just to eat here. Ingredients are generous and great quality, squid thick and tender, liver so velvety and just ooh la la. It can be confusing to secure a table, approach the lady manning the delivery station. Price? Cheap! For the quality you pay!

Tasty porridge, especially when complete with the you tiao and additional egg. Do consider 45-60 mins during peak breakfast to lunch time hours. If dining in, tell the walking/cleaning aunty you need a table then given a number and take a seat, once she found a seat, then you may start to queue to put your order.

20 min wait for porridge after my order #14 was placed. Fast action by all the crew to clear the q. Enjoyed my hot yuanyang while waiting.
Found the meats n innards too sweet, expecting savoury.  Not sure if the powerful waft of durian, next door was the factor.

The portion is big and it only cost $7 !!! But I think their usp is the sauce of the chicken chop, so the fish and chips just soso lah and they even didn’t give tartar sauce just a normal mayonnaise. Recommended for all their chops except fish and chips.

Tried this stall many years ago and ventured to try out again with my son and daughter. There's a pretty long queue but it is moving fast with efficiency. We ordered mixed grill ($12), Pork Chop ($7) and Chicken Chop ($7). The friendly service crew processed the orders very quickly and deliver the food to our table within 15 minutes.

Portion wise, they are huge! Taste wise, I would say there's some room for fine tuning and improvement. But its already pretty decent and tasty.

I noticed that the several tables around me, all ordered mixed grill too. So its a very popular choice here. Your have Chicken, Pork and lamp meat on the same hot plate. Very satisfying experience, dining here.

The legendary Hougang Ah Beng western.. The food is excellent.. But at the price point don't expect very good service.. Want service, go restaurants and pay service charge. Atmosphere, coffee shop, don't expect air con.. Want air con, go restaurants and pay service fee..
Nothing to complain, just simple western food..

Patronised this store more than 20yrs ago, i rem manned by a few ah bengs at that time, very popular stall with a messy q system. Fast forward 20yrs later, still popular, seemed to be manned by same guys and chicken chop is still good. Pork chop can skip though, too hard. Portion of the sides quite generous.

One of the best western food hawker stalls I've ever tried. Seriously don't know why it has such a low rating, portions are good, meat is well cooked and tender, and prices are very reasonable. Will be able to enjoy it more since I'm moving across the road very soon!

One of the best Ayam Penyet I’ve had given the kick of the sambal & flavoursome of the rice! The chicken itself was crispy, and huge. I’m always ordering it via GrabFood, and given the 10-15mins delivery time, food was always served at its best quality. Never fails to disappoint. Other dishes like the Briyani and satay as well were delicious! Definitely something you should try given the price 🫶🏻

Their food is ok, butter rice is nice. Chicken cutlet reminds me of my secondary school fried chicken snack. The price increases a few times. I order online but they gave me wrong/missing order. If order at their stalls, the preparation could take sometimes, then sometimes they will closed their stalls to go smoking at the carpark.

Generous portions, delicious food, friendly staff! Western Ambeng idea was definitely a hit with the family as usually everyone is so fickle for iftar choices and they love the variety of sauces as well!

Underrated western food that happens to be halal. Warm and friendly staff that greets with a smile. Food portion is very very generous. The aglio olio is especially superb. Worthy of #cleanplateclub

Decided to check out the long queue that is consistent during peak hours. While cooking time may varies depending on what you order. There is a buzzer system and I will say it is worth the wait. Taste wise I got what I paid for. If there is one small niggle, the price is considered on the mid tier side considering it is inside ci yuan cc.

Reviews: 

Like to eat onion prata but find the price $2.30($1 over plain prata )unreasonable as onions is very cheap.
So got the Prata kosong which is pretty fragrance and quite crispy but Egg's Benedict is disappointing, very salty with the ham and fried cheese gives a weird taste & texture.... soften and spoilt the prata. Dal curry is plain salty w/o fragrance nor texture.
The Mutton Mysore is soso and the fish Assam curry is surprisingly good despite some reviewed that it's sour and watery🤔, hello it's Assam curry!
Can come eat the prata kosong 👍

Ordered bull’s eye and Egg Benedict Prata. Bull’s eye nicely done. But sadly Egg Benedict’s yolk was broken during the process. Staff apologised to me and I said it’s okay. Good service. But the Prata still taste good 👍

Tried the kosong, the thosai and the paper thosai. The prata was fluffy and crunchy on the outside. The thosai and paper thosai texture is nice.

As for the fish curry, find that it is lacking in flavor. Mainly can taste sourness. I feel that a dash of salt will bring up the flavor. Possible that the chef wants to create a healthier version and reduced the salt. Anyway, I am giving feedback more based on the taste :).

Tried this Prata stall run by young enterprising owners. Their food is made to order. We ordered the cheese Prata and Egg Benedict. The cheese they used is mozzarella cheese, not the normal square ones. The Egg Benedict Prata is very creative and it elevates the prata dish to next level. Love how the egg benedict was done and it goes well with the prata and turkey ham and cheese. The mutton gravy was thick and full of flavour. Very shiok. What impresses us is the cleanliness of their stall. Will definitely frequent this stall. A must go to for Prata craving.

Briyani and the chicken was very dry and so little curry provided. Somehow was not provided curry for the bull's eye but it was still nice but my expectations is certainly dropped

Have a sudden craving for chicken and visited Arnold’s. Fried Chicken was tasty, however the chicken parts were relatively small given their price point. The coleslaw is refreshing and the other sides were acceptable.

For a price of $13, including a soft drink. It’s really on the high side.

Fried Chicken: 4/5
Coleslaw: 5/5
Fries: 4/5
Fried Bun: 5/5
Price: 3/5

Fried chickens were not too oily. Fries were good - crispy on the outside and mushy potatoes insides. Overall, a decently good meal albeit higher price. Restaurant environment can be improved - didn't feel very clean.

I always love Arnold Chicken one of the best in SG
The way they fry the chicken is tasty
Great chicken

The chicken is crispy and not too oily. Waited a short while after ordering despite been a PH today but the mashed potato is lose out to kfc.

Just because it's almost always non crowded, one of my favorite branch.

A gem in Hougang serving a good variety of western food from fresh oyster to the typical chicken and pork chop. Pork chop was tender though we wish there’s options to choose the sides. Mushroom soup was decent and fried was well fried. The cheesy escargot was unique. We dipped the Fried with the cheese! Generous portion for spaghetti. Staff were friendly too. Cashless option via QR code payment available.

1st time there. Their grilled pork chops (bestseller) was really tender and especially flavourful (eat with their mustard). The portobello was nicely breaded and fried under their Portobello with grilled chicken. Good deal to add soup with drink for extra 5.90. Place coikd do with some background music to liven up thd restaurant. Will be back tk try others in menu.

The staff was coughing badly and didn't wear a mask! I am irked by this behaviour after the COVID pandemic. The prawn and grilled chicken pasta was not bad, but the "aglio olio" lacked parsley flavour. It tasted like garlic and chilli pasta. The mushroom soup was also not flavourful and lacked texture. I prefer to have some bigger bits of mushrooms for texture and bite.

Just bought oysters for takeaway, and I'm impressed how well packed they are. Even more impressive are the plump and fresh oysters! They are really juicy and super tasty!

5 stars for service - all staff were friendly and helpful.
2 stars for food.
Beef burger - The beef patty was pretty dry.
Grilled fish fillet - Fish fillet was way too salty. Would be nice if there were more vegetables, they just looked too sad. For this price point, there are many better western fare around.
Pasta bolognese with fried chicken - The sauce was a little bit too sour but still bearable. The crispy chicken was nice. Overall, this is the best meal.
Americano was OK, not acidic but too bitter for my liking. Staff was nice to provide some milk for the coffee. Service was really good.

A convenient place to get yummy similar to home cooked food, plenty of dish choices for you to choose from. Some could be a little bit salty though, but generally we enjoy the food. It’s almost a monthly must have. Price could be on the high side when you choose a lot of dishes.

Their sides are really fragrant and delicious! Just wish it wasn't so pricey and had bigger portions. We spent about $10 for 3 pax since we got 4 bowls of porridge and 5 sides.

Their duck is so chewy and delicious! Paired with their crunchy taogeh and just a strip of parsley :)

I like their braised tofu which had a LARGE pirtion of minced pork on top. Dip a cube into their braised sauce and its so tender to tear into the tofu skin!

Their sweet and sour pork is nothing special, just a little cold.

Overall its good but just too pricey and a little expensive. But good quality and fast!

Long standing Teochew Muay of this area, famous for customer fighting and smashing the stall some years ago. Overall the food is good and service is not bad if not busy hours. Authentic old school dishes that comfort the stomach. Pricing is on the very expensive side, good to bring foreigners here to get sticker shock on how expensive road side food can be in Singapore. Parking is as bad as forever. The best dish is the salted veg chilli stingray, the sauce pour into the porridge wah like shiok and feeling old school childhood. Overall it’s good.

Really love the food here 😋😋

They have large variety of dishes to choose from.😁

Particularly I really like their sweet & sour pork, egg tofu dish and their mince (pork) meat w/ salted egg.😋👍

Their prices are very reasonable too 👍

And they are strategically located along the Upper Serangoon Room and within walking distance to Kovan MRT Station.

Will definitely comeback here again for dinner or supper 😁

Wide variety of selection. Decent porridge. But not fantastic. Reasonable pricing. Best thing is stall open 24hours. Expect to queue during peak hours. Parked at carpark blk373.

A very small stall which might go unnoticeable if you don't walk close to it, am impressed with the number of flavours it offers. Of course am not going to try the usual stuff so I got the green tea and the yam. Price is pretty reasonable and the size of each is quite big. The filling is really quite thick so the mee jiang kueh is almost bursting.

Value for money and definitely a good snack for the sweet tooth people.

Chunky and generous paste fillings with very thick pancake (mee jiang kueh) skin and crust. Sold out by early to mid lunch time.

Very popular Min Jiang Kueh! It was a bit on the sweet side for me, and each serving is quite filling.

Reviews: 

The food was really amazing. I really enjoyed everything on the all-inclusive menu that we had. Every dish was delicious. It was a shame the only dish recommended to us was not available.  I can't score the atmosphere as high as we were the only table all dinner. So you feel a little looked upon by everyone working there. I also think price wise for the all you can eat and drink package I think it's expensive, really the same as a hotel price, the portion sizes maybe could be a little small and reduce the price a little, we didnt have room for dessert, but they were already included on the menu, we did ask for another drink but was refused. We had a good time and probably would come back in the future

Wanted to try something different and chance upon this restaurant at Mohd Sultan. The dishes cooked from the tajine are awesome. We had both chicken and veal. Both are savoury and flavourful. The batbout which is a round, firm and chewy dough goes extremely well with the tajine dishes.

Do notes you must order two portion for the tajine dish which will cost you almost $70 per dish.

New Moroccon restaurant run by a very friendly Moroccan owner who's super helpful and has built a great varied menu that we thoroughly enjoyed.

Going as a group to this restaurant is probably a good choice so you can order a few different dishes and try as they are all good for sharing.

The specia slow cookedl lamb shoulder dish was our favourite, the lamb was so tender and juicy and meat falling off the bone, cooked perfectly with rice and the combination was wonderful.

We tried Tajine and few other dishes which were all good and made it for a wonderful Moroccon feast.

Glad we have Tajine joining latest scene of diversity in culinary works. The salty sourdough mini buns gave quite an interesting pairing compared to usual pita bread. I love the light intensifying broth that comes with braised monkfish. Lentils dip surprised with almond flakes, while the hummus and grilled eggplant are lighter than the norm Indian and Middle East buds. Tasteful decor within small space, friendly and attentive staff to brighten vibes. Would hope to see more well maintained restroom, for it's the only one for all.

Visited this TRADITIONAL restaurant yesterday, so it claims. I thought the meat was well cooked and all. Unfortunately the flavours were underwhelming and portion was small. Please note this is a 2 persons portion. The lamb stock was very light in colour too seems like watered down. One is suppose to pour the lamb stock over the Royal couscous dish. I expected a more robust flavour and looking forward to more spices. We are in Singapore and very exposed to différent foods with lots of spices like briyani, and all the dishes available in a Nasi Padang joint. So I was surprised to learn from this restaurant that North African food seems “very clean”.

I love thé cocktails though, they were really yummy. We would have come back to try the starters and some other dishes but we won’t be coming back. So why two stars? It was very odd that the Israeli floor manager asked for our feedback and when we provided our truths that we love food just that the spices were underwhelming. She seemed defensive but most importantly she said that the Chef is just interpreting Moroccan food in his way and has tone down the spices for Singaporean taste buds. I was surprised to hear. Aren’t you marketing Tajine as a traditional Moroccan restaurant so I expect that? Not a watered down or modern interpretation. Just traditional please.

Oh and food prices were really expensive.
100 plus per person for Royal Couscous, corne de gazelles (dessert) , 2 cocktails and one mint tea each.

First time having lunch here today. I ordered from their Weekday Brunch Special Menu which is available from 11am to 3pm.

I ordered Pan Fried Dory Fillet in Cilantro sauce with some greens and fries ($12.90++) plus $4.80++ for the Meal Upgrade to include the soup of the day and a drink.

Rating for the main course: 4/5 (the fish portion is just nice it is well cooked but the fries are slightly salty.

Rating for the spinach soup and bread:
4/5 (the soup is delicious and the bread is nice)

Overall, this place is ideal for lunch and dinner with family or friends but it does not impress me enough to give a 5-star rating.

The Larder cafe has never fail to make my day. Standard of the food is still there. Ambience good. Enjoyed the Truffle fries & Salmon thoroughly.

The food was good! Got the brunch set meal of the chicken skewer and pasta, with soup and drinks. Go if you would like to have a cafe feel at a reasonable 'cafe' price (for the set).

Hidden treasure of Toa Payoh! There are not many cafes in TPY that offers, coffee, food, all day breakfast, beer, ice cream in a cosy setting.

Scan QR code and self order but the servers are friendly and easy going. The layout inside lean toward a bit of Retro settings, nice pics with warm lights.

Food was good! Every dish was a 4-5 stars but hands down it’s the desserts that’s gonna kill! Ice cream, Crème Brûlée, waffles! If I had more space, I will try the rainbow cake.

The Waffles and Ice Cream is really very good.  The other food I would say so-so and can be missed. So I'd only be back for Waffles.

The place is really noisy when running full house. We can't wait to leave right our meal. It's so stressful to eat in such noisy environment.

Cafe is on 2nd level. Not wheelchair friendly.

Delicious and inexpensive. A surprising and delightful find. If you crave for something different from the usual hawker fare, you should try this. The portion size is generous and the stall owner is friendly too! I am coming back again.

THE biggest meat portions in the whole market. Awesome flavours, different from the usual Muslim food store.

Mandhi rice with Mutton was amazing. The owner of the shop really nice and friendly. Mutton was really tender, rice balance and with good flavour, not very overpowering. Big portion. I ate half way, decided to take photo 🤣😂

Absolutely delicious and savory kebabs at such a reasonable price!

The other food here like the Lamb and the BBQ Kofta are flavorful and soulful. The store owner is also a friendly Moroccan man who is bubbly and very clearly very happy to serve his customers.

Give the nasi lemak a break on your next visit and give this place a try!

Recommend:

1. Kebab
2. Lamb

my first time trying, delicious and economic! very generous serving. $3.50 for this plate of sambal chili chicken rice. every spoonful is an even mix of rice & chicken! looks very spicy but it’s not, the taste is special, very unique. the stall has many dishes. i think i can try 1 dish every day 😋😋 please support this stall!

Overated abd expensive Malay food in toa payoh. Different price for malay. Very unreasonable. Avoid at all cost. Portion pathetic . $13 for this food !!

Nice nasi padang. The beef rendang is good and traditional. Rempah of the rendang is great and fresh. Ask for extra gravy for rendang as it is more traditional dry style. Other dishes is good too. They are generous with the gravies so that added complexity to the dish. I think firstly the dishes are traditional and what dish we choose to balance with each other is important. It is almost the same for all nasi padang too. Overall it is a great gem for authentic nasi padang. Well done!

One of the best nasi Padang in Toa Payoh. The beef rendang is stew till very soft n tender.

Authentic Indonesian style nasi Padang done very well at good prices. Very popular with a queue during lunch time. Can tell many are regulars.

The gravy is flavourful and not overpowering spicy which is great for me. Also lotsa variety to choose from. The beef looks really tender even though I chose the Sotong, which is fresh and tender.

It is a true local treasure that brings the authentic flavors of Malay cuisine to our neighborhood. If you're in search of a memorable dining experience that celebrates the heart and soul of Malay culture, look no further. This eatery is a must-visit, whether you're a local or just passing through.

Reviews: 

I came to Singapore few weeks ago and was looking for Mediterranean restaurants. I stumbled upon this gorgeous place 5 minutes away from my hotel. I tried Kebabs on day one and man it was delicious. Atmosphere is great and all servers are friendly, specially three girls Urmi, Wendy and Fina are super nice, they make sure to get you a table quickly, take the order in timely manner and also make valuable suggestions on the menu. They always keep checking if everything is fine and customers are enjoying food. I loved the desert suggestion after eating my dinner. After first day I have been to this place 7-6 times and was always greeted with same service. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go again before I leave Singapore for USA.

We had the sultan's delight and mussels with garlic cream and cheese toast. The sultan's delight is really enjoyable. We could taste the smokiness from the eggplant puree and the lamb stew is really tender with tomato based sauce. It's tangy and smoky with some crunchiness from the pine nuts. Really enjoyable. But the mussel is pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but they're quite generous with the amount. The garlic cheese sauce is ok only.
Service was good and attentive.

Excellent experience with vibrant dining experience. Food has great range of taste to excite the palate. Service is welcoming and top notch, they also gave a complimentary cake.

Visited for my birthday meal with my family as I was craving some Mediterranean food and this place had great reviews. However, the whole experience ended up kinda disappointing - as I had high expectations too on my first visit.

Service:
- It’s a restaurant but I felt like there was not much service per say.
- It’s a pretty high price point but they don’t serve complimentary water (charged at $3 a pot of hot water, or $11 for Evian water only)
- Ordering isn’t as fuss free as they try to make it. Online ordering only from mobile app, with just one physical menu at the door. Asked for any extra copies for easier viewing but none available. You also have to pay upfront in mobile order.
- Feels like I visited a restaurant but received fast food style service.

Atmosphere:
- Overall atmosphere is okay. Like a typical restaurant

Food:
- Average, I’ve had much better at other places for a similar price point.
- Pita bread, spreads and kebab grills were okay.
- Saffron rice & Briyani rice were disappointing. They use basmati rice which gave a nice texture. However, flavour is so subtle that I could barely taste the difference between the 2.

Summary:
Would I return? Definitely not! For the price point, the food and service didn’t live up to expectations for a highly rated restaurant. Will continue on my hunt for yummy Mediterranean food!

First time at this restaurant, and I can say the dining experience was great.

Food is great and the serving is not bad as well.  I can only say good things about the service of the Staffs.
The place is easy to find and the ambience is something to remember.

Lovely elderly lady selling snacks and drinks. I come here regularly when it's too hot for the sugarcane. It's $2.50 which I think is a bit pricey but I suppose she needs to stay in business. The sugarcane is refreshing.

29/3/22

Highly recommend their fried chicken and begedil! Begedil is served hot and soft. Very tasty! However, the lady at the cashier wasn’t friendly at all.

Our go-to nasi padang stall! We come here weekly, and the standard is consistently great! There is a huge variety of dishes to choose from, and the spread is delightful! The dishes are neatly arranged.

We have tried and recommend their ikan pedas, curry fish, fried fish, sayuh lodeh, fried chilli potato, fried tempeh (our favourite!), omelet, Paru, beef liver, etc. We have tried their fried chicken wing, curry chicken, beef rendang, ayam Penyet, but still overall perfer the ikan dishes. You have to ask for any of their curries to be added to your rice! Sometimes they have desserts like banana ball (?) and lopez... Order them! They are yummy!

Their drinks are also strong and tasty. We usually order teh and Kopi tarik kurang manis.

There is usually a queue but it moves pretty fast because the servers are efficient.

I have brought my mother here, and she claims that this is the BEST nasi padang stall in Singapore! We also dabao some dishes every time we visit. Do come and support!

Been coming here frequently during lunch.
Place is packed and well organised.

They have daily specials and I tried the nasi lemak and follow up with the mixed rice meals.
Both were below $10.

The fried chicken is awesome, tempeh is delicious, beef rendang fantastic. Prefer when the fried chicken is hot out of the fryer but still awesome.

Will return again and again.

Hari Raya Haji package :
I am really impressed by the Raya Haji packaging! 😍  This is really very smart! The food is really delicious, not greasy and has a balance in taste!

I subscribed to the Lunch tingkat for my Mom too.  She sends me photos when she receives her food.  She always compliment that the food and dessert is always delicious and the generousity in its servings.  The menu is balanced with good protein (array of meat, seafood) never repeats and I can sense that is always thoughtfully crafted.

Had Nasi Padang ($7) for lunch on 2/8/23, was good.

so damn worth it!!! beef udon was $6.50 and the portion is damn big bro. california maki mini was $4??!! Oishii chicken don was $6 and the chicken came in damn big pieces!! the people were so nice and efficient :D

Great food, cheap and really huge portion. We went out of the way to come to this place. Will definitely come again. Really nice ppl serving, clean and they take pride in what they serve. Forgot to take pictures though...but though it's in a hawker centre setting, it definitely taste better than some restaurants I hv been to.

Cheap and value for money! It can be hard to find something different to eat that is halal in Toa Payoh and this was not bad! A bit far to walk from MRT though and service was a bit slow though there was no crowd. But food was good for the price!

Update Aug’23: Tried the Nasi Lemak and it was good! Skip the chicken wing and get the begedil instead 👍🏻 chilli was more on the sweet side, but good nonetheless! Definitely will be back for more in future.

I give 5 ⭐️ because of the heart of the owner!

But this one — nasi lemak + ikan bilis + a piece of egg + sambal + cucumber

There was a queue but it move quite quickly. Next time will have only the nasi lemak and will try out the mee rebus and lontong.

Delicious Nasi Lemak! Portion is good and the rice is extremely fragrant. Will definately be back.

Great taste even though just $1.
With this price, the ingredient is not bad at all. Better than those pricier ready packet.
It is not prepackaged so you eat fresh food they cook morning 😊

Unbelievable variety at unbelievable prices !
One of the few hawker centers I can find non-carbs dishes easily: from steamed fish, lady’s fingers, gourd soup (from Yong Tau Foo stall), oyster egg and finishing off with the amazing desserts from Dove Desserts.

Glad my assignment is recurring !

When you visit Kim Keat Palm Market and Food Centre for lunch, I recommend trying the signature Lor Mee from Jia Wei Xia Mian Lu Mian (家味虾面滷面). They use high quality vinegar that complement the dish without overpowering it. A satisfying meal! Portion is generous.
To note the stall rests on Fridays.

I just had this basil pork rice with eggs. Marvellous!! $5 per plate. Yummy! They are open Sun to Friday.

the popular Toa payoh west food centre. Another beloved option among the area’s residents is Kim Keat Palm Food Centre, which boasts a plethora of stalls selling the likes of noodle, velvety chee cheong fun and various refreshing desserts.

They offer a captivating feature where customers can conveniently place their orders using a table-mounted kiosk. Each table is equipped with one, allowing you to make the most of your waiting time by browsing the web, shopping online, or enjoying a game. Additionally, they provide wireless chargers, so don't forget to charge your phone while savoring your meal. The staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating.

To be fair, this rating is based solely on their signature chendol. Was graving for dessert and chanced upon their chendol advert outside their shop. Looked so good so proceeded to order their signature chendol as take away. My work place is only a few shops away and not that far. Almost immediately I opened the tub and was disappointed that the 'shaved ice' was all melted. The ingredients were also very pathetic plus the coconut milk was very lumpy as seen from the photo. I think they use ready-made coconut milk as I could see boxes of them at the counter. Very heart pain that I paid $5.09 for this lousy 'signature' chendol.

Omg~ so nice! I love the texture of the noodles, the small little container of chilli yet potent enough, the fried wanton that has filling and not just fried wanton skin and the overall portion of the meal! The soup is strong in flavour, slightly to the the salty side. Bakso is good. My complete set cost about 10.50 with a drink (lime juice or lemon tea) (i prefer lemon tea), 2 wanton and 2 bakso. I thought quite reasonable! Please don't change ur taste or standard for this particular Jakarta chicken noodles~~~ I always love indo chicken noodles! The sulawesi noodles is just as good too, just that the chicken feels lesser but chilli spicier. No matter how, am coming back again and again! Note: Service may need to slightly speed up when there's more customers but I'll definitely wait for good food! Also, this particular section of shop has always been small so seatings very limited and slightly feels more cramped with people eating and queueing.

Friendly Staff and very attentive to customer.
Love the springy noodle texture that is authentically indonesian! Must try is the Bakmie Rica Rica and Bakmie Yamin Bandung.

Complete the set with a cup of Cendol, its the real indonesian cendol and you could choose jackfruit or durian topping.

👍🏻

Good option if you are looking for authentic bakmi and cendol. The cendol is great, choosing the less sugar option has the right amount of sweetness for me. The pangsit goreng is also good. The bakmi however is just average, but with not much option in Singapore, this is a good option.

Been frequenting Wine Connection at Downtown East. Coco is always friendly and she’s very attentive to guests needs and provides excellent service. The food is great here; especially love their pesto fettuccine .Always served fresh with lots of shaven cheese. Great place to hangout with family and friends. Good choice of vegetarian options

The staff, Kati, Apple and Coco were very helpful, providing assistance whenever required. The food was served was promptly, with high quality. Every dish served surpassed expectations. Keep up the good work!

Truffle mushroom fettuccine was heavenly. Hawaiian pizza was awesome. Both dishes around sgd20. Ribeye sgd35 was a disappointment (3/5 stars at most). Dessert medley sgd19 was alright but hits and misses (4/5 stars at most). Giving this place 5 stars coz they serve complimentary water and service was attentive yet not obtrusive. Great ambience too, chairs were comfy tables were large. Serviettes were thick and luscious. Place was dimly lit, quite romantic, yet so many diners were large groups of family, still able to enjoy. Plenty of baby chairs available and children's cutlery also provided. We will definitely be back for the fettuccine and the pizza. Give the ribeye a miss.

Good food and plenty selection of wine ,
Specially thanks to Kati who served me thru out the whole dining experience,
Soft spoken person and pleasant.

Kati's service is excellent. He is very sincere. Understand customer's need. He recommended a very good wine to me and my wife. Definitely look for Kati again next time I'm here.

Attended a Barista Basics coffee workshop on 26th Dec in this lovely cosy Dutch Mountain coffee lab. Got a good understanding of expresso as well as palatte development in this two hour coffee course. Put my hands on the grinder machine as well and got some basic ideas of how to recognize and appreciate good expresso. This course is truly helpful if you wanna learn everything about coffee bean's history, global logistic and how to make your own decision to get the best suitable type for yourself. Looking forward to the upcoming course about Coffee Cocktail Mixology in 2021.

A fantastic workshop that taught me more than I could have hoped for about coffee and its making! The barista course was very informative, well explained and fun at the same time. We got a lot of information from history, over beans to coffee quality and equipment. I can highly recommend this workshop held by our lovely host Serge.

Had the original greek recipe Cafe Frappé prepared by the amazingly friendly Serge😊 it is always a pleasure to enjoy a great coffee and company! Looking forward to my next visit👍🏻

Great coaching from Serge! Learning and enjoying new coffe ideas, what else does one need?

A very unique and creative drink shop. The boss is funny and easy-going. You can talk to him about any interesting topic and chat about everything. He can catch any joke you throw out.
The coffee looks good and tastes good;
The drinks are healthy and look great;
The wines are carefully prepared and are full of innovation compared to traditional bartending.
Don't miss it

Coffee cocktail is a new feature of our store and is rare in Singapore. Don’t miss it...

Ok back to the food, no standard at all.
Brown rice so smashy, steam chicken tasteless no marination at all even they have a big part of the chicken but tasteless, really tasteless, their chillies no match at all with the steam chicken.

My conclusions go and buy steam chicken rice from the Chinese stall way much better than eating steam chicken from this stall.

For ayam penyek I dare not try after I alreday tasted the steam chicken with no taste at all in the meat, marination is very important to have a good chicken flavours.

This is my own opinion ya, so for this , I only give 1 star ⭐

One of best Ayam Penyet I have ever had. The chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Pair with rice and curry sauce which makes the whole dish very satisfying. The sambal belacan is spicy which makes the chicken tasted even better.

The staff are friendly and helpful.

Worth to queue/travel to eat: Yes

The food here is surprisingly good. What stood out the most is the portion of the chicken; They are generous with the size of the chicken, hope it remains this way. The size of the chicken is bigger as compared to most Ayam Penyet places. The set comes with rice as mentioned on the menu below. Service is just as fast despite having to serve orders collected by delivery riders waiting to collect. Also kudos for treating them nicely, reminding the riders to double-check their orders.

I like that they provided sauce and chilli in smaller separate containers for takeaways, easier to make hot if I choose to eat it at a later time. I also like that they provided curry gravy such that the rice is not dry.

One star missing for charging the extra chilli (at 50 cents each tub) and not separating the chicken from the rice for takeaway.

One of my go-to at Pasir Ris hawker. The fried chicken is quite big and crispy! The curry and chilli is decently good. It also comes with fried crunchy bits and tauhu. It’s a good portion for 6.50sgd! :)

came here to try their nasi lemak set A (+ luncheon meat, sausage, fish) and a teh o bing. Dish came up to about $10.20; but the best thing about this dish is the flavourful sambal!! the sambal did the dish justice, spice is just right and all the different ingredients to the dish are made hot and fresh on order!

chicken wing is well seasoned and crispy, fish filet was a tad over-fried though.. and the rice is decently hot and importantly flavourful too! Definitely coming back again for the sambal and the rice - the rest are supporting ingredients😅

as for reviews about the staff being rude or what not, i dont ever see them being like that..even when there is a long queue and they’re busy. they have character but so long as you’re not out of the line, i doubt they would too. in fact, they’re friendly and helpful!

Very nice cozy food corner in HDB void deck along Pasir Ris Drive 6.

Dropped by for breakfast while on an early morning cycling trip in the area because it was the only place to open that early (7am). Auntie is brash in character and blunt but it makes the place more endearing as a heartland food corner IMO (as long as you haven't been an annoying customer to get on the receiving end).

Ordered the set A nasi lemak with otah, yuan yang and bean curd with longan. The main food was alright. Nothing outstanding about it, though it's nice that it's light on oil and freshly cooked, and the "otah" was basically flavoured sponge rather than actual otah, which was disappointing.

I like their (seemingly handmade?) dessert offerings, and the cold bean curd, sweetened by the longan, hit the right spot to bookend the meal. It helped that there was a seat with a view of the road outside and some nice greenery.

Can't really comment on comparative pricing for the area (or the recent price hikes) since I don't live in Pasir Ris, but as someone who's used to the higher prices in the North-East, it definitely remains on the affordable end of the spectrum.

tl;dr nice cozy heartland breakfast spot. Don't mind the auntie, try the dessert.

Ended up ordering food here over two days and it was a mixed experience. The service was friendly and quick.

The morning  kway teow noodles were tasty but there was too much tofu in the ngoh hiang and fishcake.  The mee goreng was enjoyable, if a little sweet, and I liked the chicken chop with rice. The ayam goreng with fries was disappointing though. It did not look like the menu photo at all, and was in fact over fried till black and the meat was super dry. It seemed as if it was someone else’ order that was cancelled and then refried. It was inedible.

I have been patronizing this place for more than 7 years. The food is decent and the price is reasonable. This eatery has its character. I have no problem with the operator. It's either you love it or you hate it.

Tried beehoon mee 1st time, expensive & taste ordinary like any beehoon mee stall. Serve cabbage in a separate bowl. Portion for beehoon mee little, over fried fish fillet, wings nothing to shout about. Halal certified thats why ex maybe! 1st & last time .

Latest favourite is the fusion nasi bryani - stingray!!
The flying noodle is also my kid's favourite now.

2 floor hawker center. Second floor is more modern.

It's spacious. The place has ample seating relative to number of stalls.
Lots of good food options. We tried 4 places and all were 4+ stars.

Enjoy !

23 October 2023 - A bright and airy hawker centre with high ceilings. Passenger lifts serves both floors of the hawker centre as well as the multi-storey carpark. Has a well known hawker stall by the name of Wild Olives located inside it.

Have not visited this eatery for awhile. The service and meal served are still awsome. Highly recommended, especially for family get together. Thank you Ms Ai and team!

Nice fun cheery place tucked in a corner. Food was a total let down sorry to say. Far far cry from established eating houses with zi char style. Food had zero wok hey and rather tasteless and almost bland. I looked around and I am pretty sure I wasn't alone given the handful of half eaten food. Quantity is reasonable and menu had good variety which was probably its saving grace. Hyper fast serving time as well if you need a quick fix.

Ordered this under food delivery for a family dinner and we were satisfied with the quality and taste!

The set for 2-3 pax is extremely worth it, and we added on one more meat dish. The Har Cheong Gai deserve special mention as it was the type that just has fried chicken skin with minimal batter, and was bursting with flavour. The sweet and sour fish was also tasty.

Portions were a little small, but will definitely order again and try more of their seafood next time ☺️

They replaced another one and still looks the same.  The chicken noodle bowl is extremely salty and the seaweed taste bad.. Don’t even deserve a 3.8 star as shown in the google review. Will never come again and avoid this restaurant in downtown east!

Nice cosy restaurant in the busy area of Downtown East. Food is priced well, affordable meals that actually taste good! :)

Go for the sets, it’s more worth it (and also because the portions are not that big). Great flavours, hardworking staff.

Only gripe: If you could increase the food portions, it’ll be more filling and I could enjoy eating more of the great food! ^^

Ordered a beef bulgogi & karage teppan as well as the promo Takoyaki with drinks.

Food is decent, nothing special but perfectly serviceable but portions are lacking. I honestly couldn't tell i was eating beef as it's more minced then bulgogi. The surprisingly good item here was the Takoyaki. It's nice & crispy on the outside while remaining soft & fluffy inside even though it's only filling is the batter. Though given the behaviour of the staff, i wouldn't try it when they're busy.

It's pretty much a self service style of eatery, you order at the kiosks in front, then collect your food when it's ready & get your drinks from the dispenser.

I wouldn't worry about it being too busy though, 2pm on a Saturday & i was the only customer. Make of that what you will. I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're in a rush & just need fuel for your body.

Tad bit salty for the ramen but do enjoy their croquette and does the dispense coke taste better for some reason idk. Really nice and friendly staff too

Read many good reviews and it's my first time coming here to try.

The Banh Mi sandwiches are all nice tasting n their own way.

Roasted pork - still slightly crispy and flavourful. I added pate for $2 which is creamy and complements the sauces and meats.
Grilled BBQ pork - the meats is well marinated and kinda like a savory sausage. Not bad.
Slat baked roast chicken - children like this cos the meat flavour is milder than the pork I guess
Spring rolls - quite large pieces, suggest to buy and share esp is also buying the banh mi.

Overall must eat! I believe the rat saga is well over and I wish the staff and business all the best to continue providing great Vietnamese fare!

I am not a fan of Banh Mi but this changed my mind about this humble sandwich. The bun was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside while the generous fillings were flavourful but yet not too salty. The coffees were good too and were huge enough to be shared. Glad that dine-in is available again as the ambience was very quirky and authentic. Friendly service too. The menu is diverse and includes pho, spring rolls and flan. Those who stay nearby to this gem are really lucky.

Ordered number 4, with the roasted pork, and all the fixings (cucumber, coriander, spring onions, pate). They’re super generous with the servings, and there’s lots of ingredients stuffed in the lightly toasted baguette; the whole thing was the length of my forearm!!

The takeaway corner also has friendly staff, especially the cashier who patiently asks every customer how they’d like their order, and helps make recommendations when the extensive menu makes choosing just 1 thing too difficult.

10/10 would love to come again!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Banh My Saigon in Singapore, and I must say, it was an absolute delight. This unassuming gem of a restaurant offers a culinary experience that is nothing short of exceptional.

The first thing that struck me about Banh My Saigon was its cozy and inviting ambiance. The warm and welcoming decor creates a comfortable setting for a memorable dining experience. The staff, too, were incredibly friendly and attentive, adding a personal touch to the entire visit.

Now, let's talk about the food. Banh My Saigon specializes in Vietnamese cuisine, and they do it with an authenticity that's hard to come by. I started with the traditional pho, and it was a flavorful bowl of comfort. The broth was rich, the noodles perfectly cooked, and the meat tender and full of flavor. It truly transported me to the streets of Vietnam.

The real star of the show, however, was their banh mi. The crispy baguette, fresh vegetables, and a choice of mouthwatering fillings make for a sandwich that is an explosion of flavors and textures. Whether you're a fan of classic options like the grilled pork or daring enough to try their unique creations, you won't be disappointed.

One thing that stood out for me at Banh My Saigon was the attention to detail in their dishes. It's clear that the chefs take great pride in their craft. The presentation was as impressive as the taste, making every meal a feast for both the eyes and the palate.

What also impressed me was the affordability of the food. You get high-quality Vietnamese cuisine at reasonable prices, making it an excellent option for both casual dining and special occasions.

In conclusion, Banh My Saigon in Singapore is a true culinary gem. With its warm ambiance, friendly staff, and delicious, authentic Vietnamese dishes, it's a must-visit for anyone looking to embark on a culinary journey to Vietnam without leaving Singapore. I can't recommend this place enough, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Banh Mi is really delicious with many varieties and the baguette is crispy on the outside which makes the cracking sound as you bite!

The setup is just like in Vietnam with low tables and stools! The eatery is run by Vietnamese folks and the menu includes pho and other vietnamese food items.

It is a surprising find in a HDB block with ample carpark lots!

Anyway, decided to try their banh mi. The bread was soft inside and crispy outside. Nice sauce and well marinated meat.

Very rare to find Vietnamese cuisine in food centre. Laksa seems to be the popular for most residences. But decided to try the original Vietnamese pho. No regrets. Great little cafe with affordable food with food that easily out match the pricing by a mile!

The coffee and vermicelli bowl were the highlight dishes for me! The Viet rolls and pizza came in a close second. Despite not being the top rated in my book, every single dish that came out of the kitchen was beautifully presented and satisfying to eat. No complaints in the food department!

The service was excellent as well!! The owner gladly and proudly introduced dishes to us and took her time to let us know what to expect from the dishes. She was absolutely easy to talk to, more than happy to answer any questions that you may have. Note: There are items that aren't on the menu. Strike a conversation with her, and she'll gladly tell you about the items that weren't shown on the menu.

The coffee took a while before their ready, but absolutely worth the wait. My advice is to order another drink together with the coffee to sip while you wait.

The vermicelli bowl is bee hoon based, soaked, and marinated with beautiful flavours of Vietnam! If this is your first time eating Vietnam cuisine, this would be a great introduction, something familiar to welcome you into a new cuisine. The only thing people might not be accustomed to is that the vermicelli bowl is served cold.

Overall, it's a must try! Even if you're new to Vietnamese cuisine, this would be a great place to start.

Loved the fried spring rolls, super crispy and tasty. The fresh rolls were also super generously stuffed with prawn and pork. Overall really yummy & will be back. The owner is super sweet too :)
Only downside for me was the ventilation (the place was abit smoky)

Fried Ice Cream sounded like a very interesting proposition so we thought to give this restaurant a try. First impressions is that the food was carefully prepared and looks good. We liked the chicken wings and vermicelli more than the rice plates. The pizza was by far the best dishes but not filling as it’s super thin. I think this restaurant is still new as orders still gets mixed up (serving later customers earlier). The Fried Ice Cream was very beautifully prepared but all of us felt it was kinda watery inside probably due to the heat from deep frying. Very friendly service from the cashier. Ambience was a bit hot for lunch and the additional spotlights made it even warmer.

A nice local food place serving Viet dishes. Like the Lemongrass Chicken Vermicelli Bowl & Fresh Rolls. Ordered the paper Pizza series: Lemongrass Chicken n Mentaiko Crabmeat which is small unique bites. Tried the Viet Coffee Phin Affogato as well. Give it a try !

Was there to try out the fried ice cream. The ice cream was good and very reasonable priced menu. Very friendly staff and very good service. Very decent and nice environment with nice deco. Will definitely come again to try out other items in the menu.
