Our usual Vietnamese stall at the nearby market is closed and on one grocery trip we walked past this and thought to give it a try.

We got the Signature Pork Banh Mi ($6.50), Chicken Banh Mi ($5.50) and Beef Rice Vermicelli ($6.50). It seems you can request for no spicy / less spicy / more spicy for the Banh Mi.

It's a takeaway-only stall with no seats at the bottom of a HDB block. There was one lady assembling the Banh Mi, another at the back whom I assumed was preparing ingredients, a man manning the cashier. I do hope they are refining their processes because I waited 20-25 mins for my order. There were 2 people who had ordered ahead of me. It didn't help I needed to rush off to work, but I did feel the wait was a bit too long.

Signature Pork Banh Mi looked like it was made from sliced ham - to be fair the slices were tasty, we were just expecting actual meat. It was also unexpected that other ingredients (veggie and condiments) weren't very tasty / present. Perhaps we have been spoiled by Banh Mis that cannot be closed due to overflowing veggie and meat for a slightly lower price....

Flavours-wise, the rice vermicelli wasn't very exciting - that is, compared to the usual market stall or even the one I have at work. I'm not sure if the sauce is diluted or if it's their recipe, but it's somewhat flat and mild. I was concerned it would be spicy but had zero issues. The amount of meat given was pretty good for the price. I did feel there could have been more veggies though!

We're not in a hurry to purchase again, but never say never :)

I was walking around and saw this newly open place selling banh my and coffee. It looks authentic so I decided to try and loved it. The person who was making banh my was actually a Vietnamese and the taste was great. It was crispy and delicious.

I also ordered a coconut milk coffee and it was very good as well. It was strong but refreshing at the same time.

The Bánh Mì was assembled by herself infront of your eyes with fresh ingredient and toasted after. The crispy loaf had its unique taste from pâté, french word for paste that’s usually made from some meat.

Bánh Mì & Coffee by Phan have 4 different Bánh Mì you can choose from.
- Signature Pork Bánh Mì $6.5
- Black Pepper Beef Bánh Mì $6.5
- Shredded Chicken Bánh Mì $5.5
- Golden Egg Bánh Mì $5

They also served other authentic Vietnamese cuisine like Spring roll(3pcs $5.50), Shredded Chicken with rice vermicelli($5.50) and Black pepper beef with rice vermicelli($6.50) which are really affordable to the hood.

There’s a distinct fragrance from the Milk Coffee ($2.50 Hot) that I couldn’t really describe what it is. I also recommend trying their Ice Coconut Milk Coffee ($3) here.

As a regular customer at Lang Nướng Vietnam, I cannot express enough how fantastic this place is. It has, hands down, the best Vietnamese barbecue in Singapore. The staff are always so friendly and accommodating, and the owner never fails to make you feel at home by personally greeting each guest. And let’s talk about the food - absolutely delicious every single time! The raw prawn dish, in particular, is to die for. It’s obvious that a lot of care goes into every aspect of this restaurant, from the carefully crafted menu to the overall atmosphere. I always look forward to my visits to Lang Nướng Vietnam and highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic flavors and top-notch service. It’s always a treat to dine here!

Food very nice. I like their cockles in tamraind sauxe as well as the prawns steamed in herbs. Service staff very approachable and friendly. Very attentive to your needs. Ambience very nice, feels like you are transported to a local eatery in Vietnam with the low tables and chairs. Vietnamese music in the play too .

Authentic Vietnamese cuisine, with authentic ambience too. Food is nice as expected. Tried the fried chicken wings, snail with spinach and beef pho. Will try other dishes next time when I come back again  :)

Stumbled into this restaurant on a Sunday and it was empty compared to the rest of its neighbours.

We ordered the BBQ meat dishes as recommended and asked for them to help us with the BBQ in the kitchen.

Pork was the best of the lot.
The premium beef was out of stock and we opted for the VN beef. It tasted like protein just not beef. It was coated with alot of sweet sauce and we could quite make out what meat it was.

The coke we ordered was flat and there wasn’t and fizz left.

We packed some more food home.
The usual, Pho, spring rolls to continue out dinner as it was really stuffy and hot in the restaurant.

Staff was friendly except a little forgetful.
We waited half an hour only to be informed they ran out of the dish we ordered.

I have been a regular customer of the restaurant since a few years ago. And now also still a regular customer . It can be said that I will come once or twice a week. The food here is very suitable for my difficult palate. Especially the dish "Cha Ca". The fish is very fresh and sweet. Add dill and onions. Hanoi taste 100% . It is very difficult
to find a restaurant in Singapore that makes such a authentic foods same here . Highly recommend it very much.
The service is also fast and attentive. Hope the business prospers.
They also have wine from a small and very beautiful city in Vietnam. This wine is produced in Vietnam and is also a quite famous wine in Vietnam.

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)

Reviews: 

This unassuming joint in Kovan has a small but tasty menu of Vietnamese salad bowls and banh mi. It is a quick-serve concept that caters to healthy eaters with less sugar and salt, and virtually no MSG or oil. Special mention goes to the avocado mousse ice cream — a rare find in Singapore.

[What it’s good for]
The banh mi classic (S$9.50) is stacked full of pate and butter spread, Vietnamese pork ham (cha lua), pork floss, pickled carrots and daikon, and enough chilli to make you sweat. The ham is the standout star, thanks to its meaty juiciness. The banh mi beef ribeye (S$13) features premium beef ribeye that's sliced fairly thinly and roasted perfectly with a flavourful tenderness and a touch of five spice. The sandwich is stuffed with a heap of coriander and fresh chilli. The pork belly bowl (S$10.80) comes with a generous portion of chunky and fatty pork belly, which is tender and nice to chew on. There’s also a certain smokiness from the marinade that melds harmoniously with the other ingredients. For the more health-conscious, try the regular pork bowl (S$10.80) that is less fatty than the pork belly version and vibrates with a more savoury umami flavour.

Vietnamese coffee (S$4.60) is the only drink served here. It's rich and has a dark flavour profile, with strong chocolate and caramel notes. The avocado mousse ice cream (S$6.80) — dark green avocado mousse at the bottom of the bowl, with coconut ice cream, desiccated coconut, almond flakes, and chopped peanuts on top — is a beautiful dance between the decadently creamy mousse and denser, milky ice cream.

[What it could improve on]
There was a lack of sauce (think sriracha) and oil — perhaps olive or sesame — that could take the banh mi here to another level.

[Our quick takes]
Is it conducive to conversation? -—Yes, but I can’t imagine it’s the kind of place you’d want to stay at for long.
Is a reservation necessary? — No reservation needed!
How to get there? — A 13-minute walk from Serangoon MRT station should get your appetite started. Otherwise, there are several buses from both Serangoon and Kovan MRT stops.

[Things to note]
If you like the salad sauce, you can add 50 cents for another container — totally worth it.
Do note that this place is hardly suitable for groups — there are just eight stools and three wooden tables. I’d consider it more of a delivery and takeaway spot.

Read more at HungryGoWhere for the full review

A hidden gem around upset Serangoon, nested among the boutique cafes. Well toasted bahn mi with generous ingredients, could be stronger in taste with more sauces but still great overall!
Ordered the grilled pork bowl filled with lots of well charred grilled pork balanced out with crunchy vegs and rice vermicelli, will try the other bowls next time!

Located deep within a commercial space in between Kovan and Serangoon is this humble Vietnamese restaurant.

Dishes ordered were the chicken bowl and pork banh mi. Personally I would give the banh mi a miss mainly due to the tough pork meat used. On the other side, the chicken bowl was such a great deal, ingredients were generously given, mints and greens were so refreshing and crunchy while the nuts within gives a good crunch in texture.

Little downside would be its price and location.
Also please take note that there are very limited tables (3) for dine-in as this place mainly serves takeaway.

We tried the Pork Bowl, Chicken Bowl and also the Tofu Bowl. I like the char-ness with the roasted pork and chicken in both the meat bowl. I like that there is the option of tofu bowl which is vegetarian, as you know, we have all got one of such friend.

They are filled with greens including romaine lettuce, japanese cucumbers, big cherry tomatoes, mint, basil, pickles carrots and daikon. The mint gave a refreshing taste. There’s also chopped roast peanut for that addition crunch and taste.

The Chilled Vietnamese Coffee is really bold and strong with added sweetness from condensed milk. A little sweet and could do with some melted ice for that perfect taste.

Delicious Vietnamese food! We had the pork belly and chicken bowl which was very flavourful. The chilled Vietnamese coffee tasted bold and refreshing. Will come back again!

Been there a couple of times and have seen the turnover of staffs. Barman with earrings is not so attentive. The rest of the staffs are so so. They need to learn how to walk while looking around rather than looking at the floor. Myanmar, India, Philippines staff good! The rest better wake up. Nonetheless Vibe wise band is good. Service can be better on a slow Monday Night. Good draught promo but bottle wise still expensive. Food was decent! Overall I”m just truthful.

There's live performance on Friday. I enjoyed the performance and the setting of the bistro. The place has a big seating, so during peek hours, you need to be patient. Food are always good. Their lamb chops were nicely done. Seafood marianna and chicken wings were nice too.

It's an ok bar to chill out with friends. its annoying with their Chinese live band, no international vibes. Was ok at first with English songs from the stereo till the live band started. Price was ok for a bar standard. Had a calamari and soju with coke for about 40 bucks

Highly do not recommend. UNHYGIENIC PLACE, FULL OF INSECTS with bad service recovery.

Lizard on their counter. Black bug in my cocktail. My drink was still a full glass as I only had tiny sips. The staff (lady with short hair) tried to return me the same drink sans the bug. Told me to speak to her supervisor instead.

Her supervisor was apologetic but insincere. He gave me a replacement drink that was extremely diluted with water. Based on the other reviews on here, this is their standard SOP.

Avoid at all cost unless you are willing to put your stomach at risk. There are much better bar options elsewhere.

Great place to enjoy a drink or two with family or friends. Live music entertainment helps liven up the atmosphere. It's getting crowded over the years compared to when it first started.

Went on a Monday evening, not my first time here. Always love their baby back ribs, juicy soft and tender moist from outside to inside, their mussels are also very good. Friendly staffs and serene surroundings, serves very good beer, will definitely come back again.

Nice area at Punggol settlement. By the seaside on the 2nd level, you can feel the sea breeze and occasionally sighting of climbing monkeys on the trees. Enjoy the sun set and enjoying the beer.

Service staff was excellent and attentive. Great service I must say, kudos to the team.

Despite been a bar, there’s kids menu for my kido so the adult can drink at ease without worrying what to order for the kids.

The beef burger was superb, as the veg were fresh as it can be and the patty is as juicy as it should be. No wet buns or whatsoever.

Mussel was well prepared, and my family enjoys it.

I regularly bring family and friends as this place has a great atmosphere, excellent food and perfect service. It's an enjoyable moment every time we go.
It's very cozy. The sea is litterally 10 meters away. There's a huge fish tank to make your kids busy. And the staff especially Melanie and Ken are very friendly and always go the extra mile to wow our visit giving us not choice to come back regularly.
Thank you.
Gregory

Made reservations for a simple dinner with a friend here. The location itself, which is at Punggol Settlement, is really inaccessible if you aren't driving a car. The nearest LRT station is Punggol Point, after which you would have to walk 1.2km. Not too sure about the bus, but I am pretty sure it's not too frequent as well.

However, this restaurant was worth the long journey. First of all, we were really lucky to be able to sit indoors because it had started to drizzle slightly. We were also seated directly in front of the TV, which was coincidentally showing the Women's World Cup between Colombia and England. Although we don't usually watch soccer, the atmosphere and the hype made the experience all the more worthwhile and we found ourselves watching it intensely too. For the food, we ordered spaghetti aglio olio, truffle fries, mojitoh and peach coolers. The aglio olio was delicious, although the portion could have been slightly more. The peach coolers was perfect to cool me down during a hot day, after which I ordered one more glass of it. The staff was also really professional in ensuring that our orders were swiftly prepared and that the food came out fast. Overall, if you are willing to travel a bit further, we recommend coming here for a chill night with friends or family. You can even walk along the coast after dinner, which was really relaxing.

We had a last minute family gathering (25 adults) for dinner at George's by the Bay.  The atmosphere was great.  The service was slightly slow but understandable given our large group and other guests at the restaurant (it was also a public holiday).  Kudos to staff for being accommodating - we had reserved tables for 16 but had to accommodate an additional 9.  All the dishes ( chicken satay, chicken wings, fries, chops, fish and chips, mushroom soup, garlic bread, and more) were delicious.   Will highly recommend and return!

Stumbled across this place today and decided to eat here with my mum. Very no frills and simple place.

She had a falafel moussaka, and I had the mexican beef bowl. The moussaka was delicious but I feel like 5 pieces of nacho chips wasn’t enough and mind you this cost $13…..

The beef bowl was a little dry, could do with some kind of sauce but it was good and we finished both dishes. The churros came freshly fried and was good too, but would have preferred actual choc sauce vs the hershey choc syrup.

Only gripes; the overly sugary lemongrass drink that was served premade with no ice. Had to ask for ice twice but given few pieces…..  also very weird that we dined in but were served with plastic cutlery when we clearly saw metal cutlery, it was a little strange. It was practically only 2 tables and the lady served my food to the other table…. Could tell she wanted to take it back to serve me but they already started eating it.

I think its a quaint little place but some things need to be improved. At $30 for 2 expected just a little more.

Excellent service. The beef Mexican rice bowl was not bad. With the homemade drink, I spent less than $10. I was there alone at 5 ish and I had the entire place to myself. I don't remember music playing but it sure would be nice to listen to some tunes.

Small quaint shop located near Tai Seng Mrt, they had a $10 set meal that had a wrap, small hash brown and a lemongrass tea. There was a small side of nacho chips with salsa.

Nothing amazing but I guess it was better than nothing coz there wasn’t anything there open before 11am

Dropped-off my 10-months old laptop at LENOVO Service Centre at 3 Irving Rd, #01-17 Tai Seng Centre. BITC, Singapore 369522 on Tuesday 18 April 2023,

Thus decide to settle my late lunch within the area too.

One will be spoiled with choices as there are so many small eateries and cafes. I was drawn to  Olive Mediterranean & Middle East which was located across the street at 11 Irving Place #01-14/15, Tai Seng Point, Singapore 369551.

Ordered for myself a Mexican Rice (Celantro & Spinach With Beef) Bowl at S$7.50.

If you are a small eater, the serving portion is just right. However, definitely a "No. No." for someone who has a heavy duty digestive system, I would recommend that you order some nachos or Quesadillas too.

In my opinion, the rice is mildy aromatic (I was expecting a more pungent aroma of Celantro and spinach).

I will rate the minced beef topping as "healthy choice".  It is relatively quite nice BUT will not leave one any special impression.  It will definitely taste alot better if there is a little more fat (this will enhance the juiciness) and more spices are added.

However, if you working in this area, it is a great place to meet up with your colleagues and friends after work.  You can sufficient outdoor sittings surrounded with plants.

Stumbled on this place as i happened to be browsing around. Been awhile since i had my tacos and wraps, decided to try this as i noticed they had very high reviews.

Had the beef Quesadilla - loved it as it was simply nice
Chicken Saffron Stew - Soooo tender and nice but soup wasnt as thick as i wanted but thats purely due to my own taste
Hashbrowns - Thumbsup as we all loved it. Hearsay its even better than M's hashbrown but i leave it for u to judge.

Service wise was top, very homely feel given by the lady boss and staff. She took her time to guide me through the menu and shared with me what we should order.
I must say the food takes a pretty long time to come for a quiet Monday Afternoon but i guess Good Food - Time to prepare so no complaints from me on this.

Overall i recommend this place based on the food served + prices. Very nice and they deserves better businesses. should be pretty quiet when its after office hours.

Will be back again :)

Pizza was crispy and fragrant at the same time, the tomato sauce parts was absolutely amazing.

Strawberry drink was okay!!! Not super special but nice!

In the middle of Arab street you find this restaurant. We were welcomed by a real Turkish guy. Very friendly and he could advise us what was the best to order. We sat outside, along the street. Within 15 min the table was full with all kinds of grilled meat. Real Turkish flavors and a nice apple tea were enough to make my day complete. Eating here, and watching the people pass by is a big joy.

Parking in this area is very hard, as you can understand.

Had a great dinner here today. My friend saw this online with high rating stars so we just stopped by after work.  And yes, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is awesome, love the music too.
So if your family or friends are outgoing and friendly, this is the right place for you to gather together and laugh together and dance together !

Cuisine is new to me as a traveller. Trying the dish with my arab friends and the chef being a wonderful host in telling us about the different food added to the stellar experience of dining here. Service was awesome. Food was a good blend of flavors.

Just returning home from an amazing service and hospitality from Cappadocia.
Chef Ahmed Hagras went out of his way to arrange a very sweet surprise for my husband's birthday at my request.
The whole staff sang happy birthday for him with a special kunafe.

The food itself is finger licking good, no doubt. But the experience was way better.

Thank you everyone at Cappadocia for helping make this day special for him.

Seems to be a favorite spot for the young ones - perhaps they were drawn to the eat all you can buffet. Good view of the sea and the park. Nice spot for an evening meal. But there is no restroom at the shop, you will have to go to the public restroom at the park nearby.

Good spread of ala carte dishes. Especially the cheese beacon is a must try. Black pepper pork, Taiwan sausage, honey ham and juicy big prawns. If you have friend like Thai milk tea, they come with tower. Although is open air concept, do wear lightly or casually as you clothes will be all smell of cooked meat and smoke after eating. Service is ok just no smiles no further recommendations from staff. Will come for the food, variety of chill sauces and free ice cream. 😊

Reasonably priced mookata, with nicely seasoned meats. The buffet is quite extensive, and they even give ice cream at the end.

That said, the service could be better. When explaining the menu to us, the staff told us that we could order everything on the menu if we get the buffet. Right after we confirmed that though, he took a pen and marked off all the items that we couldn't order or were not available. I mean this is something you should have let us know as we were making our decision, and is quite misleading. Some of our orders were also missed out, so we had to reorder. Granted it's a buffet menu and it didn't cost anything to order again, it's additional effort on our end to keep track of what hadn't been served.

Atmosphere-wise it's pretty chill, you can have a look out to the sea and the breeze is nice. There are a lot of houseflies however, which were pestering us and our table of food which made the dining not so pleasant. Lighting was pretty dim too.

Been there few times. Had late dinner with Family on last Sunday night. Quite crowded and it seems that the staff are struggling to cope just like how others had reviewed.

Overall having buffet is more worth it and it does taste good. Nice environment to dine though it feels so cramped as tables beside and behind are just so close to one another.

Parking about $4plus. So overall still okay. Worth trying!

Went on a Thur nite. There is a steady stream of customers so it best to make a reservation.
Ambiance is good facing the sea and with background music
Food is reasonable price for the quality given.
Staffs are friendly, responsive and efficient at clearing the tables.
Overall a good place to chill out with friends with food and Chang 🍺

Wonderful experience at the Med last weekend. First time trying Mediterranean Food and it blew my mind. Nat took the time to show us around the house and it was beautiful.
We were led to the roof top during sunset and the view was stunning.
We had some snacks at the roof top while they were preparing the dinner.
After sunset, we head down to have dinner.
Strongly recommend!
Love ALL the dishes presented.

Celebrated our engagement at Med@59JCT and had such a wonderful and charming experience! Al and Natalie were the best hosts you could ask for, from start to end. They were so generous, kind, and charming as they shared the intentions and origins behind each dish and design choice. I loved hearing about how they chose to emphasise some of the Peranakan and Chinese design elements of the house whilst infusing it with their own identity and culture!

The house was as beautiful as the food was delicious - we came here for a meal, but left with so much more!

GREAT dining experience at Med@59JCT. We had enjoyed the delicious Mediterranean food prepared by AI. AI explained the food and story about the food. Love it all.
Not only the delicious Mediterranean food, a good chat with AI make the dining experience even better.
Will be back again.

Had the best private dining experience with my closest friends at Med@59jct. Al and Nat were the most friendly and welcoming host, Nat brought us on their house tour and explain patiently to our questions.. we were very intrigued by the many interesting displays in their place. Al, is like a master chef! The dishes were amazing one after another, with each dish explained by Al carefully. We were belly full!!!
Special mention to the moroccan spiced carrots and tomato zucchini bake. Al mentioned that food doesn’t have to be complicated… We can feel all the love that Al and Nat has put in for the private dining experience.. My friends and I enjoyed ourselves throughout the dinner and will definitely be back for more.
Bonus tip, just add on the wine pairing.. You won’t be disappointed! 😉🍷

Went in a group of 4 in early 2023.
Food - delicious, varied, made with a lot of care and accommodated 2 vegetarians in our group. Portions were very large so go hungry.
Hospitality - Al and Nat were very warm and answered all our questions patiently and in a lot of detail.
Shophouse - really tastefully renovated and love that all the pieces have a story.

Highly recommended and hope to return. Thank you Al and Nat for the lovely dinner.

First time eating at Garden grill based inside the SGCC club, the nice little restaurant upstairs is cozy, though a bit old.  Promotion pricing for meals was quite affordable.  $30 for 3 course, $40 for 4.  Definitely worth the price. Wine was also not marked up too high.  Food was good.  Shoes required.

A cosy place for family and small group of friends to gather. The service staff all did a great job from welcome to preparing and serving the food. An old English setting but filled with warmth. The food is all great and will definitely be back again next month.

My family regularly dines here for special occasions as we're members of SGCC. We're never disappointed with the food or the service. Do look out for monthly promotions as they'll focus on different cuisines, and they normally have a weekend semi-buffet (choose a main, while the appetizers and desserts are buffet).

Amazing steak! Cooked medium rare :)

Have been coming here with my parents since I was a kid, and it's always been good. The food is great and the service is always top notch.

The first time we visited the restaurant, there weren't a lot of people around. The drink was definitely not something I am used to, I wouldn't order it again. The dumpling was not bad. The Lu Rou Fan has too much rice for me, maybe enough for other customers. The food doesn't stand out much to me compared to other Taiwanese food restaurants. However, if you live nearby and feel kind of lazy to travel out to get Taiwanese food, they are a good alternative.

Food was good but I couldn't quite figure what it was lacking, probably because I'm unconsciously comparing it against other taiwanese restaurants. I appreciate that Bubble Tea wasn't overly sweet.

Ambience is nice and interesting.

Held back 1 star on the rating. I'll give it a go again when I'm in the area.

Great place! Week nights was rather quiet and empty but service was still impeccable.

Pricing a little high for the food you are getting. But if you like Taiwanese food this is a very decent place!
They have many outlets and this is the first time trying this outlet! Would definitely come back!

This is a spacious restaurant serving Taiwanese delicacies in Serangoon. Arrived here at 1:30PM on a weekday and the place was mostly empty.

Service is friendly and quick. Ordered the following -

1) Pork dumplings in fiery sauce - 6 soft dumplings in a wonderfully spicy sauce that’s not overpowering.

2) Pork wonton noodles with guan miao noodles - Soft dumplings again. Well cooked noodles. Ask for their extra signature chili to add a spicy zing to your meal. Loved this to the last bit.

Reliable, great tasting food. Really glad that they have vegetarian options on their menu. Love their noodles and fried rice:

Love the pan fried carrot cake & milk tea. Porridge. (Century egg and mincemeat) was too plain can only tasted the salty taste. Siew Maii was quite good but personally don’t like the mushroom flavour.  Braised chicken feet was abit too sweet for me but overall was good.  Bo Lu Bao char Siew filling was really good, but the bun dough have a very good yeast smell.

We love Chinese cuisine, we avoid eating at high end Chinese restaurants, we prefer hardworking independent chefs who have small eateries with authenticity in their cooking, this place is the cherry on top. As usual we ordered dishes we are familiar with, their dim-sum selections for dinner is a mini menu so we choose 2 , and 3 main dishes, quite enough for us as we are small bites people, more on quality of the food than quantity, I must admit Chef Wong have skills. And we will be back soon for lunch. Service was great too, happy we came !

I can vouch that it’s the best and most underrated dim sum in Singapore - in terms of its taste and presentation 👍🏻

If you’re skeptical like us to think that the signatures beautiful dim sum are probably just gimmicky, think again! so glad we tried them, they are so delicious 🤤 芋角 skin was so flaky yet not oily, taste of yam filling is so well balanced and not overly sweet like the average ones. 虾饺 skin is very delightful and thin. Everything is done to their perfection *chef kiss*

Highly recommend and would definitely visit again!

P/s: Room for improvement- we can smell waft of cigarettes 🚬 coming from the outside as we’re seated near the entrance.

Clean and comfortable eatery with fresh and tasty dim sum - hargao and deep fried prawn dumplings were impressive and bursting with firm prawn flesh, buns were hot and freshly made, chicken feet and pork ribs were also very good 👍 love their kopi siewdai (no sugar added) too!!  Floor was manned by very friendly ladies :) will be interested to try their bolo butter buns and orh nee tarts the next time.

This is the best dim sum place in the area. Food is affordable and so much better than many other dim sum places in the same price range. I really enjoyed everything that we ordered. Service is also very good. Will definitely be back again, and also try more dishes! Highly recommended! Safer to make a reservation as it can be crowded at certain times and the place is quite small.

👍:
-The omelette was nice and crispy.
-The chicken skin was a yummy appetiser.

👎:
-At an exepsnive price of 21.90, the prawn vermicelli was very disappointing. It wasn't like the other Thai outlets where they fry it till its dry and fragrant. This one was basically sitting in a pool of lacklustre gravy. Just disappointing.
-The premium pork cheek wasn't good as well. It had a very smelly pork meat smell that can be slightly nauseating to people who dislike this kind of smelly meaty smell.

Overall, nothing fantastic or mind-blowing. It's the kind of restaurant you'd just try it once and probably not wanna return.

First time visited and it would be our last. The sambal kang kong had no sambal taste. The phad thai was worst than foodcourt’s and lastly the garlic fried chicken was so hard and overcooked. Worst of all, my partner had diarrhoea the whole night after that dinner. Hope NEA go and take a look.

Food taste average. The restaurant is windy and spacious. Able to cater for large group, we had about 10 pax. The fried omelette is a MUST try. I love the chicken wing too. Other dishes taste rather average and small.

Not too bad thai food, but I had better ones here in Singapore. Looks a bit lacking of staff in front, had to walk into the restaurant before they noticed us.

Was quite turn off by the way the male server just turn his back away while point his finger to a table for us to seat. When I was ready to ordered, I waved to him and he just look at me with no response.  Food was ok but some was way off. The drunken noodle taste like dish washer and belachan kang kong was not spicy. Had to head off to the hawker center for a rojak to wash down the taste. $30/pax

Got the mushroom seabass, medium spicy and added Chinese cabbage. Portioning is quite little, can only find a few pieces of veg and that's about it.

Service was also slow. Our noodles was not served as we were almost finishing our food. We checked twice with one stuff who told us that he will check for us. Then we checked a third time with another staff and staff told us they forgot our noodles. She asked if we would like to cancel this item since we are almost finishing our food. We said ok. Our noodles came shortly.

Seasoning and food is quite nice and flavourful.

We specifically chose this Chong Qing for its location and crowd. We reserved well in advance as this place requires reservation during the peak hours.
Ordered Grilled Tilapia in spicy fragrant sauce and few veggies like potato, lettuce, tofu. The flavours were amazing and fish tasted really fresh and there was no fishy smell as you usually feel while eating any seafood. We got a plate of home made buns and rice to go along with it. Cooled ourselves with cucumber salad. For drink we got sour plum four seasons tea and local craft beer. Everything we ate or drank were worth it.
Staff was friendly and accomodated our request of getting rice later and also getting some of those buns take away. Definitely will visit again, Cheers :)

We brought our friends to experience mala cusine and were told that the Classic set meal for 4 pax offers whole seabass so we accepted their recommendation. The medium seabass was slightly small in our perspective because we were expecting a larger fish since fish is the main item in this set. Each one of us got a little portion and it tasted fishy and unfresh, we didnt enjoy the fish at all. Nonetheless, we thought the presentation of this dish was beautiful and the side dishes in the fish tasted yummy. We were wowed by all other side dishes like Spinach, Lala, Sweet&Sour Pork, Watering Chicken, etc.  We feedbacked to the Server on our experience and glad that they will inform their kitchen. In general, their service level is friendly and helpful.  It is the fish dish that ruined the overall eating experience.

Saturday lunch at 12pm, only customer in the restaurant for a while. We ordered the set with the grilled fish and several side dishes. Fish was fragrant and flavorful, but the portion was a little small for 4 pax. Generally on the saltier side as expected of Chinese cuisine. We had a good lunch together.

Excellent food and customer service. My food was in a mess when the grab driver delivered to me and was irresponsible to reply or answer my call. When I call in the restaurant to ask for a solution, immediately after seeing the photos that I send them. Without second they arrange to send me those damage food to be replace and resolved my issue. Would like to thanks chong Qing grilled fish serangoon for your fast reply and your efficiency. Especially to Jia Zhe for your help.

Was here for my farewell together with my colleagues but I arrived late and the rest were about to finish their meal already. So I just ordered a bowl of Chirashi Don. This is already very filling. And I love their thick cut sashimi. The service is good as their kept checking if we need anything throughout our dining experience. As we are seated indoor, which is air conditioned, it’s comfortable.

Sashimi feels not very fresh. Mentaiko tamago & jellyfish quite good! Fried ebi and octopus average. Overall, expected the food to be better due to the good reviews. Perhaps they are more specialised in their dons, might pop by one day to try their dons. Service was not bad.

The sashimi here doesn't quite match up to other places in terms of flavor. However, the tamago and Japanese jellyfish are highlights; the mentaiko is seared to perfection and the jellyfish is marinated beautifully. As for the fried dishes, the tako karrage and ebi are decent but not outstanding in taste.

Experienced the outdoor (sheltered) dining on a cool evening. Service staff serving us was friendly and helpful and took time to share with us their popular items and also other items that we should try. We ordered the wagyu beef bowl, which was really flavourful and done-ness was on point. We also ordered the chirashi don and the tuna, salmon & swordfish slices came in thicker slices as compared to many other places. We also enjoyed the fried squid, crispy and tasty. Overall, a good experience dining here and we will be back.

Had a great experience here, enjoyed the takowasbi and parents liked the dons. Sashimi was good too. Shout out to Angeline! Thanks for the great service and assistance throughout out meal!

Reviews: 

Went for the weekday set lunch and was very impressed. Best chocolate fondant I ever had (but wish there was a scoop of vanilla ice cream).

I've to caveat this by saying that perhaps Argentinian food isn't for me. So please view this review with a (huge) pinch of salt, especially in view of the other glowing reviews here.

To me, the food just doesn't hit the spot. I'm left feeling confused - and cold inside. Ordered the Chapa for appetiser - it tastes like normal bread with cheese fondue - nothing to comment about. For my mains, I ordered the grilled zucchini stuffed with risotto - and it's fairly disappointing. It was served with white sauce that has a subtle milky flavour but no risotto to be found. It may be hidden. I stopped eating after the first piece because there's nothing exciting about the dish. I was left stagnant and not looking forward to my next bite. We also ordered the vegetable platter - the vegetables tastes raw and bland, and the potatoes taste a bit coarse inside.

Overall, I don't find the food value for the money. It didn't even attempt to take flight. Apologetically, I've to say that it was a fairly sad dinner for me and my company.

Though the staff was very friendly and attentive. I've to credit that.

Since I am a vege lover, I selected this restaurant because I saw good options of vegetables dishes in their menu. My first time tried Argentinian grilled food and we love so much of their potato rescoldo in grilled vegetables platter. Grilled potatoes are crispy outside and soft inside, saltiness is just nice. I love the smoked asparagus with fried garlic too. Steak is ok and lamb is good too. My hubby likes the Empanadas. Dessert - Dulce De Leche Cookies, Love it!!. I should have ordered more cos the size is a bit small. Service is great, attentive and know customer needs without a need to ask. View is great. Can see the fireworks at Marina bay for NDP rehearsal.

Food was really delectable and I would return for a second round! Loved the black cod. Beef was really flavourful and savoury. Their dessert chocolate hazelnut cake was one of my favourites! Wished the table service could be better in terms of knowledge of their menu. Overall a pleasant experience in a warm and welcoming environment.

Visited FIRE 2 years after having an amazing experience there, left a little disappointed with the same dishes we ordered. Quality and taste definitely dropped, plating needs to be more practical on the lamb.

Conclusion, dont ever try to take away for western food. They are more interested to fulfil grab order then walk in.
Mookata is ok but not the western food or zi char.

Had the hot plate tofu, unfortunately the taste was just 1 layer which is savoury!

Then we ordered homemade herbal tea as indicated in the posted menu. He said don't have and stared at me with face "very long and black". See how rude that was. I told him if off the menu already should take down that menu poster. After taking the drinks to our table, he keep staring at us for few mins with the same expression. I came all the way from Bedok to this sengkang coffeeshop only to get badly treated. This coffeeshop should change their name to 1 star coffeeshop instead. The service rating here is for the drink stall. My experience here was really "buey tahan" See-Uncle.

We tried the japanese food stall, the food portion is good for its price. The tray quite heavy to carry when ordered for 3 pax. The outer area of this coffeeshop is quite spacious with natural ventilation and high ceiling.

my 9yo son loves the Brown sauce chicken chop + baked bean + coleslaw. the chicken and mushroom sauce was bubbling when served. Do take note that the western food takes sometime to be served.

Thohirah Restaurant is a great place to have a tasty and economical meal. I loved the fish head curry, paratha, and biriyani that I ordered. They were all well-spiced and flavorful. The prices were also very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. The only downside was the customer service, which was not very attentive or friendly. However, I did not mind it too much, as the food was so good. I would definitely visit this restaurant again and suggest it to anyone who likes fish heady curry and prata type food.

Plain prata is recooked it is hard as rock. First time having tissue prata without any sugar coating inside. Asked the staff abt it, he pass me a bottle of sugar. The standard has dropped tremendously. During payment the staff/ owner just talking on the phone without interaction with the customer/ telling how much and all.

Great mutton briyani! Meat is tender, non gamey at all! Paired with it's flavourful briyani and thick curry, each mouthful is a match in heaven!
Portion is huge@$9.50, would come back to try other dishes.

Food coma kicking in while writing this review😅

the Worst cheese prata i ever taste. The cheese taste like plastic.and the Masala thosai too much cinnamon stick till i ate like afew and throw back.

Pretty disappointed with the food here. No longer serving yummy food. Many places serve better Prata than here, plus the food is not hot! You can give the Nasi Lemak a miss too! Served Cold and rice has no coconut taste and fragrance.

Had an amazing dinner with my friend on a Friday night. Reservations required. Service was great. Food was fantastic. Especially love the tenderloin, it’s so tender and yummy. Also love the bread we had, it’s well worth the price of $16.

Fantastic steak & food & service! You’d probably also be able to get a decent steak here for 

It was our first time visiting Bochinche. The restaurant has a lovely ambiance and the staff are polite and helpful. The manager kindly explained to us the differences between each cut of meat.

For starters, we had the SD bread basket and ox tongue carpaccio. The bread slices were delish with butter. The ox tongue carpaccio was an interesting blend of flavours that worked well together.

For the main, we ordered the Heavenly Meat Board with 4 different kinds of steaks. They were perfectly cooked medium rare, served with a bit of smoked salt, garlic confit and padron peppers, which elevated the flavour immensely. Sides were chips, broccolini and wild mushrooms. Kiddo had the cheeseburger and finished the entire thing off!

To finish off, we shared the nectarine tart and espresso creme brulee while kiddo had a scoop of vanilla ice-cream. The creme brulee was delicious. Creamy with the wonderful fragrance of espresso. We enjoyed that immensely. Were not too crazy about the tart though. The nectarine slices were not ripe and still hard after cooking. The sharp tang wasn't to our liking.

All in all a wonderful dining experience. We'll be back for more!

Great place with great food.

The staff were amazing as I celebrated my wife’s birthday. The steak was beautifully done and all the food recommendations were good.

Kudos to the people for making this place awesome.

Edit -

Forgot to mention that we also ordered the hand cut beef empanadas. Sad to say my nenek can make better epok epok.

Ordered the “Robbins Island” Wagyu Bone In Striploin (MS7) along with the creamy Mac-cheese pangrattato, broccolini pomegranate (without bacon bits) and Chips Provencal.

The wagyu striploin was cooked well but lacked the juiciness that wagyu steaks typically have. The steak was also under seasoned but was accompanied by smoked Maldon sea salt and roasted peppers.

Chips was fried well and had a nice crisp bite to it and was salted just right.

Broccolini was grilled perfectly and had a nice charred smoky taste to it but was overly salted. Portion was a tad too stingy in my opinion for the price. Served on a medium sized plate it looked like a few broccolini might’ve escaped during plating.

Surprisingly the creamy M&C was the best of the lot! Very creamy with gooey cheese and a nice layer of bread crumbs on top to give it a welcoming different mouth feel and texture.

Over all I think Bochinche is worth a visit due to its lovely homey interior but do be prepared to spend a few dollars here. 3.6/5.

This is probably my favourite Indian restaurant. Food is excellent and everything is mostly very good.
We've tried many dishes and most would not disappoint except for the squid. The biryanis and pratas are of huge portions and the sides are generous and tasty.
Some signature items tend to sell out early on weekends so you may wish to go early or try them on weekdays instead.
The staff are friendly too and they also give good recommendations and advice. The seating arrangement may not be the best but it still offers relatively comfortable seating and acceptable views.
There are vegetarian choices too so those with vegetarian members amongst friends or family can eat happily together.
We will certainly continue to visit. Car parking is of no issue as it is within the neighbourhood shopping mall.

Fantastic dining experience at Banana Leaf Rivervale mall! Prem, the manager, was gracious enough to set up a table for 10 people for us! The food tasted fantastic! Very good customer service! Prem checks to see if everyone at the table is satisfied by asking if we need anything or if there is enough food. He goes above and above in his service! He will always beam while he serves us, without fail! Definitely returning here! ♥️

Tasty food & great service! Serving was generous and definitely filling for sure

Kudos to Premnath who helped us changed our vegetable dish that was way too spicy for us.

Will be back for more!

I had a rather heavy day at work, and whenever this happens, I love to imbibe in one of my favourite foods, Indian.
There’s something about the spice, the smell and the flavours that give me that ‘kick’ I need to continue with my workday!
So I drove to the Mall and walked into this place. I always (well, almost always) have my Garlic, butter naans with mutton keema. Minced mutton cooked with a spicy thick broth, with peas to pop, and something magical happens with I top my naans with this dish.
Alas! They don’t make keema here, but the nice gentleman who attended to me offered me an alternative. Keema naan!
I thought about it awhile, and reluctantly said yes!

Certainly a great recommendation from him! What I had was a paper-thin, buttery, garlicky, naan, sprinkled with seasoned minced mutton on the insides. It’s amazing how they do this! The whole concoction still looks like it’s half the thickness of an average plain prata! Don’t be fooled ok? Bite into it, and all that buttery, garlicky goodness pops in your mouth, and the insides render flavours reminiscent of a mutton murtabak, but only ever so slight, and not as overwhelming. What can I say? It was a delight to eat! I savoured every bite, as I downed this delectable dish with an equally spicy but delicious rasam soup and some fish curry for a sip.
The naan was so good, that after a few bites, I realise the fish curry had become redundant, and remained untouched until I finished all of my Keema Naan!

Great service, good food, and I love the quiescence of this place amidst a crowded noisy mall! I’m happy, and will surely be back:)

One of the best fish head curry ever in Singapore.  Fish head was meaty and FRESH..curry is superbly tasty and tangy.A MUST TRY!!  Masala chicken is fantasic , a good portion meat , soft and juicy. Staff Gulshan from Rivervale Mall is commendable..attentive and polite . Will definitely  come again and recommend  to all my friends! Hats off to the chef!!

Recently, I had the chance to visit  this restaurant. It was crowded with people, and we had to wait a short while to be seated. The restaurant service was not up to the mark as the server was inexperienced and didn't seem to know what to do. The service was slow, and it took us more than half an hour to get our food served, even though we arrived early.

The black pepper crab, which was supposed to be the restaurant's signature dish, was overcooked and not very fresh. The taste was average, and it didn't live up to its hype. The best dish we ordered was the vegetable dish, which was delicious.

The fish maw soup disappointed us, and the prawns were not very fresh. It was the least worth ordering.

The restaurant had an upmarket and elegant setup, but the food quality and service standards didn't match up. It could be a concern for those who are short on time due to the slow service.

On the bright side, the restaurant had a clean toilet, which was a good experience. Overall, the restaurant wasn't a great dining experience, but it was worth it if you're in the mood for good veggies or a clean restroom

Simple dinner, just ordered steamboat Ang Go Li and chrysanthemum tea. The food was delicious and fragrant. My husband doesn’t like fish but he was enjoying. Just nice for 2.

The Mala grilled fish is our must-order dish every time we visit. The portion is enough for 2-3 pax. It's the best-grilled fish I have in Singapore. It comes together with some potato thin slices, black fungus, peanuts, and cabbage. The fish is fresh, so the meat is very tender! Please try it out, everyone!

We ordered the 回锅肉, but it is a bit oily for us.

We have come back to visit serial times. The food quality maintains good, and the service is excellent!

Nice little 煮炒, air-conditioned, neat and clean. We had deep fried squid, tofu and broccoli. The prices may be steeped compared to coffee-shop prices but I think it is worthwhile as it is after all air-conditioned. I like it that the food isn't salty or taste like msg. The tofu was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. As I don't eat pork, I simply scrapped the pork toppings from the tofu. I appreciate that the waitress is service-oriented. She was attentive and the food were served very promptly. Oh yes, their barley was homemade without the canned drink type of taste. We'll definitely be back!

This is a Chinese style stir fry dishes with BBQ spicy while fish as it's signature dish! the fish was large and fresh, fragrant and spicy(non spicy sauce available as well) and only costs $35! other dishes we ordere includes sambal paste long brand, sweet sour pork cubes, hotplate seafood beancurd, hotplate beef slices all were flavourfully executed too. We were surprised even drinks offered was wide range: Pu er flower tea, coconut sugared milk tea was fragrant yet not too sweet and smooth to have. Overall highly recommended to come and savour if in this part of SG!

Our first visit since its makeover. It's now so much more crowded than its predecessor Legends. I love the buffalo wings! I can take spicy food well, but level 3 was already quite spicy. Recommend to pair with some beers for even better taste. The live band was a plus esp if sitting indoors. The music can also be enjoyed outdoors as the sound system was pretty decent.

Went on a Thursday night, rather crowded but managed to find a seat for 1 pax.
The drinks selection is pretty good but do ask the price before ordering as the menu price is before ++

Food wise it is ok, edible and nothing to shout about. The impressive bit was the live band. They were good and made up for the avg food.

Ordered the grilled chicken, seafood marinara and take out pizzas (Pepperoni, Hawaiian).
Grilled chicken was slightly tough and too salty with sides(mushroom+potato and some greens)
Seafood marinara with spicy tomato sauce was nice and not that spicy actually.
Pizzas topping were slightly salty and well done.
We were seated outdoor and there were bug flying around and one went for a swim.

Second try: Ordered burger, fish n chips, buffalo wings and ice cream. Burger was ok, salad was black at the tip. Fish and chips was well done. Buffalo wings - sauce was not nice, spicy level 2. Ranch was not cold while celery stick was too thin and soft, no crunch.
Ice cream was creamy with tiny marshmallow and nuts.

First visited to this place and did not expected it to be crowded. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Only limited seats in the restaurant which have air-cond. Outdoor can be breezy too as it’s near the river. They offered limited but general choices of Thai/Viet food, Pasta/Pizza and Western grills. Not wide selection, but it’s good variety to choose from. Thai prawn cake abit salty, probably it’s from vendor, not house made. But glass noodle seafod is good, quite refreshing and appetizing. Carbonara cooked to al dente and we like the creamy sauce with well smoked bacon. Pizza is a missed as we think taste like from frozen food. They have beer promotion at Happy Hour (

Couple of good selection of beer choices. Food varieties are good too. Really like their luncheon fries, given very generous portion.  Their prosciutto pizza are just average. And had jug of beer and a bucket of mixed beers.

The ambience is great both outside and inside seating for chilling.

The live band was nice but inside seating will be harder to chat with ur company.  Outside seating will be preferable for chatting. Inside seating sound system are better.

Do take note: if it rains, the cantilever shelter only able to extended to first 3 rows. The rest are not covered.

Went right after they open to reserve for 2.30pm timing. Food wise uncooked food like meat is like what usually you would get in a normal hotpot buffet and not beauty in the pot standard but cooked food wise is probably more like beauty in the pot standard.

During lunch or tea time, is worth to get the premium set which has better product at a reasonable price. Dinner maybe not.

Overall, not bad but with hard to book reservation online, the queue system and chances not getting seats even if arrived, probably would be worth the trip if live nearby.

The front desk is really a minus, unprofessional in the way that she didn’t guide us on how to order and proceed with the electronic menu, and do not have the heart to genuinely serve the customers. She was in a random and long conversation with one customer instead of serving customers who are in real need and there is no one who is doing the cashier duty coz she is busily talking :”( . Really wish to replace the front desk person who is the in the first contact with customers. Might not be coming back if she stays in this working attitude

My wife and I came here for lunch. $29.9 premium + $3 peak surcharge. Total $78.17

About 1135 am then we entered due to long queue. Our reservation was at 1130 am. Timer in tablet also start from 1130.
1150 am. Pot with soup base served.
1200 pm. Ingredients are not served yet. The manager came to every table to add time to the tablet, and told us that if still not enough time, to let him know. He said system got issues. The timer added about 20 mins.
1210 pm then start serving us. But only got the prawn paste.
Waited till 1227 pm then served us again with meat.
3rd serving is 1255 pm. Prawn paste, crab sticks.
1257 pm gave us prawn. Kelp.
1.10 pm then final stuff.
1.30 pm finished eating. Still left about 7 mins in the tablet (we asked the manager to add more time halfway through)

Not much selections at the sauce station. Even shi li fang has more to choose from.

Sliced US beef is indicated as sold out in tablet. It was enabled only after we notified the manager.

Cheaper than Shi li fang if choosing the same premium food. But enjoyed better dining experience in Shi li fang. But perhaps this isn't an accurate review due to them having issues with their system.

Paradise Hotpot disappoints on multiple fronts. The poorly trained staff at the entrance add to the initial negative impression. The narrow interior feels cramped, especially around the self-service sauce area, which is invariably overcrowded. Continuous need for fuel replacements disrupts the dining experience. Moreover, the ingredients are very average . Overall, this hotpot restaurant is highly unrecommended due to its inadequate service, cramped space, and mediocre food quality.

I love that you get an individual hotpot here which is perfect when eating alone. I love their pork bone soup, mala soup and the tomato soup. Ingredients here are always fresh and service is always helpful and polite. They have various discounts available and you can use Kris+ to earn miles here too.

The staffs treat you with with great courtesy and service, when my family just ordered plain water only. The staffs even help to refill without prompt. Thumbs up! Definitely a recommended place to go. Will definitely suggest to my friends for a chill out there again.

Went for a drink over there. Just a simple place for drinking with a few friends

Been here way before they have a new look.
A "feel at home" environment to have a drink.
Want to sort out some thoughts over a drink, or have a chat with staff to laugh off a lousy day, it's the place I will go.

Super chill bar for a night out catch up with friends.
Beverages are at an affordable pricing.

One down point is the air-conditioning, not cooling.
I guess I will go for the outdoor alfresco option next time ;)

Had a surprise celebration for my husband here. It’s so easy to book a table via WhatsApp. Special thanks to Jamie & Mark for the perfect coordination. Must order the Asahi dry black!!

This restaurant is the 1st Halal establishment that I know that introduces the Beef Kut Teh to the muslim community in Singapore. Over the years the flavours have not changed a bit and the soup is so refreshing and not with a overpowering of herbal fragrant & taste. Not too salty either but just nice for me. Though, the soup is good and beef is tender, the amount of meat, to some maybe, too little and soup is too much. Serve with sambal, I think, belacan and white rice.

We also ordered Beef Claypot Rice and its is also 1 of my favourite here. The portion is a lot for the rice, sauce & beef but a bit too salty because it also have salted fish in the sauce and the burnt bits the bottom of the claypot is the best part and to not get too burnt you must scrap and mix the rice with sauce etc,  as soon as it is served.

Sambal Kangkong is a must as side dish and the portion for small is generous and delicious. Well balanced flavours.

Situated at Bukit Gombak and jammed between a few other restaurants, Habib has made a name for themselves.

Wanted to makan dishes and so we decided on Habib. My sis loves this place for their butter naan and normally when I'm here, I would just almost always have individual dishes. However today was different decided to try individual dishes and boy it was a smart choice.

Sambal Petai, Black Pepper Beef, Sambal Sotong and Beancurds were all super sedap lah! Delicious!!!! Simple mouth watering. I can't gush enough on how good it was. And the portion size was absolutely fair. I don't care if I sound bias but it really was that good. And service timing was also on point. Maybe it was off peak but we had our drinks in less then 10 minutes and another 10 minutes all our orders were served.

My only grouse would be that a clearer instructions about the ordering process and the clearing if tables be put in place.

All in all, I would definately be here again and hopefully they keep up to their standards! Pls do not falter or regress cause that would be absolutely disappointing.

Food : 4 / 5
Staff : 3 / 5
Ambience : 3 / 5

If you're looking for a delicious and filling meal, then Habib Family Restaurant is the place for you. This family-owned establishment is known for its delicious Bak Kut Teh made of beef and mutton, which every foodie in the area should try. The menu is full of tempting options, but the Bak Kut Teh is the real star of the show. The broth is rich and flavourful, with a perfect balance of spices and herbs. The beef is tender and juicy, while the mutton adds depth and complexity to the dish. All in all, Habib Family Restaurant is a must-visit if you're a fan of Bak Kut Teh or just want to enjoy a delicious meal.

Must try halal beef bak kut teh at this muslim family restaurant located at Bukit Gombak

The claypot style bak kut teh is very herbal and is better than most chinese versions.

They also give big chunks of beef

You can opt for bee hoon option
Around $8 for a big portion

Also must order their sambal stingray. For $15 comes quite big and very meaty. Loved the spice as well!

Habib Family Restaurant
374 Bukit Batok Street 31, HDB, Singapore 650374

Tiktok: unconventionalpassionss

Nasi Goreng Kampong $5
Rice with black pepper sauce - Chicken - $7
Kopi Cino (Coffee with Milk) - $2
Bandung - $2

I thought it was overpriced but it was definitely worked it. Ordered it at Grab!
Would definitely order again, keep it up!

And thanks for cooking with love!!
Always remember why business is doing so good, because the food you create is what you're passionate about! CHEERS

Was not too crowded on weekday dinner time. Ordered mutton murtabak and tandoori chicken Briyani. Wait was about 15 minutes very normal. Place was clean and neat. Mutton murtabak was average. Tandoori chicken was flavorful. Size was slightly small. Rice serving was large.

A restaurant just near the Bukit Batok MRT. The food is delicious and the service is quite good. We visit them regularly and they have never disappointed us so far. There is a big variety of food and the prices are reasonable. There is a story upstairs with Aircon and a larger seating area.. the downstairs story may seemed cramped up and noisy. So if you need to relax and have a better experience, always opt to dine at the upper floor. Afternoon hours are less busy and the staff attends to you quite soon. But we have been there during evenings and found the place busy and the food orders take time to come.

The lychee and milo dinosaur is lovely. And the thosai are really soft and nice. Chicken biriyani, Rice and Curry, Tom yum sea food rice and chicken fried rice are must try’s in this restaurant. They are open passed 12 midnight as well. We will surely return again for a meal here.

I love mee goreng yet I hardly came across a good one. Even when you occasionally had a good plate of mee goreng and came back again, the 2nd time may disappoint because it may not be cook by the same person, the simply fact that most Indian eatery are not manage by 1 person but by a team.

The mee goreng here was moist enough and flavourful but by no means fantastic, and probably because I hadn't had one for a long time where marginal utility play a part.

Used to be good  and a frequent at this stall but now
1. Price increase
2. Tastes drop tremendously
3. Got an upset stomach and diaahrea
4. Unhygienic environment

I takeaway four prices of prata kosong at $1.30 each. The size of the prata is probably the largest I have ever eaten!

I was given two large packets of gravy. One is fish curry, the other was Dahl.

The fish curry was sour and a little too salty.

The Dahl was thick and not watery. This is the first time I ever like Dahl curry!

Tried the mutton briyani. Rice is good, mutton is tender and comes with an egg.

Price is on the high side at $9.00.

I order this chicken briyani, the taste is good, you can taste the spices.. but the staff is not friendly to customers, it’s a bit rude

Love the Indian rojak here. Tried their mee goreng and nasi briyani as well and they were good too. The price is similar to other neighborhood cofeeshop. The boss and the staff are very friendly and even gave us discounts when we do not have small change. One of our must go to places for Indian rojak!

One of my favourite Indian restaurants, the gombak location makes it an ideal food place after a workout at gombak sports hall/stadium!

Amazing tissue prata (2.70), very crispy and large portion.
Standard pratas are good.

Got the lemon chicken rice too (6.30), very large portions, crispy, nice lemon sauce, a bit different from the Chinese tzichar kind but this is not bad too.

I love the drinks here, the teh tarik and teh halia are amazing. The dinosaurs are super gao, there's a wide variety of drinks.

Food taste okay. Reasonably priced. Almost full house when we reached at 10.45pm. Noted that a couple of tables ordered western food.

We ordered red Tom yum - average, Pad Thai - beef is over cooked, but there is wok hei. Fried baby squid - got to eat while it’s hot, otherwise wouldn’t be crispy.

Quite good place to go for supper since it opens until 2/3am.

It's our first time dining here. We came on Sunday lunch hrs, not much crowd. We were served approximately 15 mins after ordering.
There's a variety of dishes for Thai food lovers. All look super appetizing .
Love  their initiative of customising the table to display all the menu with the prices stated clearly on it. So convenience for customers to choose from.
We ordered  fried kuey teow & Singapore fried Beehoon.
Both suit our taste bud..thou we felt that the portion could be more :)
I love the teh o longan which definitely quench my thirst in this hot weather. A must try!

It was our first time dining here. Service was quite fast. The only thing the runner who send the food is not sure of what he is sending us. It was nasi goreng kampung, but he told us it is nasi goreng seafood. So i rejected the food at first, another server came and say it is nasi grg kampong. Alhamdulilah it is delicious. Only that dissappoint us is the nuggets set that cost $6.50. The fries is dark, some is hard and some soggy and oily. It looks like it was being refried again. Hopefully they can do something about it.

What i like is the wide range of variety of food available.
Order chicken fried rice, it was fine, but just.
Came out within minutes of ordering, chicken wasn’t that fresh, hard.

Finally the west side has decent food. I have to admit, their food is really nice. I tried their seafood tomyam spaghetti, it was spicy and delicious! I was a bit skeptical at first cause usually it is hard to get a perfect spicy sour taste for tomyam spaghetti but this one is simple and hits just nicely.

Their beehoon goreng was great too!! At first my hubby was upset cause the beehoon came not only super late.. it looked soggy and wet..He likes dry kind of fried beehoon... But the moment he tasted it..he was like wow... I tried it too...it was really delicious! It has the spicy chilli padi taste with a touch of tomato sauce as well ...

Their red spider drink remind you of childhood pink cough syrup! Maybe it the combination of strawberry ice cream and their red gassy drink..

Ambience is nice too...if you come at night, it feels cosy...
But parking is weird as the nearest parking in front of the shop it is only meant for season parking holders only.. therefore need to have to drive all the way at the back of HDB and park inside.

I really like eating here compared to the nearby coffee shops. It’s clean and airy which makes it more comfortable. Staff are friendly and efficient!

The chicken rice is pretty good, to me the amount of chicken is slightly more than usual stalls 😅

I always get the Ampang sauce for yong tau foo. The fried items are always nicely done and they will cook the veggies separately. Yet to try the other bases but there is also Hakka sauce, Tom Yum, laksa and soup!

Overall, worth to stop by this place for a satisfying meal if you’re nearby. It’s just across the street from the MRT anyway. They sell kopi/teh, canned beverages and also accept various cashless payments too

The very first time I tried yong tau foo that was fried and filled with delicious meat sauce was from Dajie Bukit Gombak! I instantly fell in love with it! I got hooked onto their Hakka sauce! I loveeeee how oily, crispy and delicious the yong tau foo were when paired with this sauce!
Remember to eat it there and then as it can get soggy! Y.u.m.m.y!

The only thing I think they can improve is on their soup though.

The food at Da Jie Niang Dou Fu (Dajie Makan Place) never disappoint! Used to frequent the Clementi outlet when I was a student at Ngee Ann. Nowadays, we venture out a little further to the Bukit Gombak outlet. We really like the food here! Spoilt for choices!

Food is very good but service by the staff AWESOME. They are pleasant and freindly even during their busy period

This place is a monthly visit requirement even pre pandemic 😊

Enjoyed the chicken rice (good portions), the Yong Tau Foo was good (more variety would be nice) and price was reasonable for sure.

Biggest issue with me since day 1 I visited here was the tiny tiny tables. 2 person to a tiny table is just super crowded and uncomfortable. 2 tables seating 2 people (as per the required regulations) would not breach the space and distance requirements. So hopefully they can look into this.

The food can be nice, the staff can be wonderful but when the set up is uncomfortable, the whole experienced is compromised. Again, hope they will look into this.

Food : 4 / 5

Came here 2-3 times. Friends mentioned that their food standard fluctuates. Apparently when there’s lesser crowds, the food is good. It’s probably only a 70% pack on a sat evening.

So this time round every thing was on point.
Also they offer free flow of icecream though there was only 3 flavors.

Tried during lunch time, the area was pretty hot despite the kind gesture of the staff to bring cooler. Tried few food, they are nice but not leaving much impression. If you stranded there with no much choice, can try their Salted egg chicken, seafood bee hoon and Roasted pork. Not recommended: Fried Rice, stir fry vegie and yam Ring.

Though the food is tasty, unfortunately it is alittle too oily for my liking. I really enjoyed the fried pork dish intially but after the 3 to 4 slices it was really sickening. We ordered the chill crab dish where the meat was already extracted (since we were lazy to deshell it ourselves) and while the crab meat portion was pretty generous, the sauce was too watery to my liking. It felt like an oily soup dish with crab meat in it. The four heavenly king dish was good since I didn't taste much of the raw veggie taste and the salted egg yolk chicken was good too just that it was pretty heavy towards the end.
Overall I will still visit this place for it's other dishes such as the hokkien noodles or fried rice which seems promising

Always liked coming to this bustling joint that's fast gaining popularity. They even started engaging a magician to entertain patrons while waiting for our food to arrive. The Hokkien Mee and White Seafood Bee Hoon are must try items but portion is slightly small. We liked the prawn paste chicken and coffee ribs too. Kiddos welcomed the free ice cream for dessert. Will keep coming back!

Visited JB 101 many times over the years. The food is delicious and service is good. The ambience is good too. We love the fragrant lala and fried pork. The curry fish head is nice too. Convenient to find car park here.

Went at 1130am, 1 staff outside,  1 staff inside making drinks and 1 staff for packing and taking calls.
Full House by 1145am and still just 1 guy outside to take orders from all tables.
Manager needs to rethink the staff planning. Food and drink might be prepared fast but it's pointless without people to serve to the customers.
Been coming here for years and food is still up to standard though, good job on that 👍

Today we celebrated Mother’s Day at Jiak. I have been wanting to try this eastern after recommendations from my colleagues. As reservations were full, we went early to try our luck. Blessing that the timing we went was perfect and we are a seat on arrival. There were only 5 of us so we did not order too much. We ordered the Signature Seafood Black Beehoon; Prawn paste chicken; Sweet & Sour Seabass; Ladyfingers and a Seafood fried rice as the girls are too sceptical to try the black beehoon. I must say all the dishes are cooked to perfectly suit my palate😋 I was initially worried if the black beehoon would come with an over empowering flavor but no, it didn’t! In fact it contains the freshness of the seafood in the dish and overall a 👍. The fish is another one worth recommending. Personally I love sweet & sour dishes and this one is done right on the spot. Fish is fried till it’s crispy to every bite and the sauce nailed it all. Chicken comes covered with loose crumbs which my daughter finished to the last bit! The 2 desserts which they have, the chendol and mango ice were sweet and serve as the icing to the cake for the evening. Great place with tasty food. One minus point is, the food took a bit long to be served and there was one staff giving our free snacks to appease the diners but I am not sure why our table was left out when we are the second table to be seated🤨 Not a fair gesture on his part. I would have rated 5 stars if not for this.....

the ambience is nice! we ordered kopi o chicken, mee soto, and curry fish head.  looks exactly like in the menu. i would have ordered veggies too but my dad doesn’t eat them. Will come here again to try more dishes!

Prawn paste chicken was good! Decent dinner, had the set for two and added prawn paste chicken, also topped up $5 for dessert, total bill came out to ~$60.

Informed the staff that the plate served was dirty and requested for a new plate, there was remnants not washed properly, but staff says it's not dirty, just a hole?? and never came back with a plate. Poor service. Regret signing up and paying for the membership. Staff should not throw their unhappiness to work at customers.

Ordered the divine chicken pot recommended on display, but the chicken had gamey taste, and the entire dish is super salty we rather waste the $18 than eat it, would not recommend it.

Update since management has shared that the feedback is helpful - adding on, other areas of improvement we hope to see:
Training of staff on the membership before processing any payment, and to listen to constructive feedback to improve and acknowledge. At the point of payment, no staff asked me whether customer is a member or whether there are coupons to offset either. When I feedbacked about the dish at the cashier the staff simply looked at me and completely ignored my feedback, pretending like she did not hear a thing.

Very generous and kind people, always give me the feeling of Itaewon class(Korean TV show), whenever you go there staff will treat you in very good manner, either you are doing dining or take away, service wise they are awesome.

Below are the breakdown of features,

Pros:

If you wanted to eat good food and want some positive vibes, just there and speak with any staff member.

23rd July…its open guys…since 21st July…a day after Eid Adha…check it out…
Latest as of Jun 2021 for those whom has not known yet…they r under reno LAH …n maybe somewhere in July is ready…i did saw more seats will b available…Yahoo!
The only problem is...Insufficient seatings but the rest is quite good...
Second last shop away from the drink stall...only open half day bug the lontong goreng...its sambal goreng its much much better than Allif🤫...sambal sotong...superb
1st shop after the drink stall has good variety of food and delicious...if u r early u can try their mempedal..grizzard
Nasi ayam is not too bad...they have their own style...

Friendly service, comfortable well ventilated dining venue. But skip that, let’s talk about the FOOD 🤤 I had sambal beef fried rice and this dish has CHARACTER! Most sambal fried rice I have had are just good because they’re spicy, but the fried rice here has an umami flavor that complements the spice! The chili is also awesome and a must eat condiment pairing with any of their dishes! For the beef itself, don’t expect too much from it. It’s pretty lean, but at $6 a plate, this is a very value for money meal! One happy and satisfied customer here!

This place is not $, it deserves $$$ or $$$$. 1 hotdog, 1 mini sotong a size of my thumb will cost you $4. As a customer, I find it hard to eat $4 dish with the portion I get. Felt like a food scam.

No doubt the food here is nice, but i had a bad experience dining in. It was during the new rule of max 2 to dine in. They have insufficient seats at the main dining area (outside the stalls area. I bought my food and went to look for an empty table to sit. It was full. So i look around inside the stalls area. Found an empty table and went to sit there to consume my food. At the end of my meal, was told cannot sit there. Those tables are for staff only. But there was no sign and no one said anything. They should put signs saying "No eating here. For staff only". It was very misleading. Next time, better to take away. Never going to dine in there.

Good taste of dosa with good chutney taste. The onion pakoda was nice too. Reasonably priced and good service staff. The vegetable biryani, North Indian naan set were also was nice when tried on other occasion.

If you would like to have your meal on time, never ever order this restaurant food via any delivery platform! Their waiting time is always at least 1 hour and above. Unless you don’t mind that your lunch become tea time or your dinner become supper.

I’m a regular here. our Saturday lunch at home is usually vegetable biriyani, Palak Paneer or Kadai Paneer, rotis from here. The biriyani and Paneer dishes are cooked extremely well. But their Tandoori roti preparation is below average.

For dinner, we have the Kal Dosai or Paneer Dosai or Parotta kurma from here and they are amazing!
