The food is tasty and the portioning is just nice!

Not many halal seafood casual dining restaurants with nice comfort seating seats around Jurong. Especially outside the shopping malls!

Find SAFRA Jurong, and find Rasa Istimewa.
Overall seafood is nice and at affordable prices. A recommended place for family.

Salted egg chicken is a must try. Hot plate bean curd with seafood is delicious, spinach with mushroom is soft and delectable, and the sliced fried fish with sweet and sour sauce is an awesome complement as well. Drinks are refreshing too, and the variety is amazing compared to your typical Chinese restaurant. Being halal, this place is welcoming to all rave and religion! A go-to choice for delicious homely Zhi char if you’re in the Boon Lay heartlands. Comfortable ambience with soothing decor, lighting and music makes this an ideal location for a relaxing dinner over which to catch up with friends or family.
Worth coming back again, value for money 👍🏻

I would like to thank all the staff serving us as quickly as possible for our iftar.

The food was not delivered early before breaking of fast which is appreciated. I know that with this type of system will be bound to encounter delay on 1 or 2 dishes (which for us is the ala carte dish, Mee Hon Kong.) Nevertheless, rest of meal was nice except the Tom Yum Soup (tasted bland). Apart from it, we have a wonderful experience there.

Would recommend others to iftar there. Slightly pricey but for the service and ambience, it is well deserve.

Got the family combo. Yu Sheng was different yet felt premium. Food is generally excellent and well prepared. Only complaint is the fried noodles were too salty during our visit. Developed sore throat the next day. But flavor and texture is still there.

Staff are generally friendly, and ambience is good, only because it wasn't too crowded a little before peak dinner time. Will recommend to my friends around my area.

Food was great. My mother in law wife and daughter enjoyed the food. No complaints!

The food came fast and was piping hot for the hot plates. Taste was great for the beef and tofu and was cleared very quickly.

Stingray taste was good and non rubbery. The youtiao was very crispy and there was sufficient fish paste inside!
Kai lan was tasty with wok hei

Thanks for a sumptuous lunch!
Ps the usual waiters are quite ok. The tall, young man wearing the green polo was very friendly:)

Wide array of selections to choose from prawn noodle, chicken rice, fritters, Nasi lemak, fish soup, soya drinks, duck rice, and more recently newly opened pork trotter rice. Day 1 launched at Boon Lay Place Market. Some of the hawker stalls open as early as 6am, and the Kuay Chap stall even open 24hours. Evening stalls included satay, fried chicken wings, Zi Char and even grilled string ray etc. Always crowded with throngs of patrons visiting different stall throughout the day. Attached is pork trotter rice from Bai Nian!

Variety of food choices.. lor mee is not bad :)

I wanted to have something light and ate carrot cake. It's very tasty and not oily like the rest. The only set back at Boon lay are the sitting arrangements. Time for a TOTAL REVAMP... 🙏🙏🙏🙏

There’s a famous Nasi Lemak stall at a corner and another chinese version which is equally nice. My favourite Chong Pang satay stall that sells nice satay and bbq chicken wings. If you like Hokkein mee, there’s a stall diagonal opposite to the satay stall, which is very nice. And there’s a stall selling nice Ngoh Hiang, aka deep fried stuff seasoned with five spices, facing Boon Lay place.

As for dessert, other than the typical bamboo cane drinks and the many different hawker drinks, there’s an auntie selling assorted soya bean drinks and dessert.

In short, it’s a hawker flair paradise!

my first time to prata wala, i ordered a new menu item - wrap salad series butter chicken. there is also wrap briyani series. took quite a long while waiting for it to be ready. i could see the staff figuring out how to wrap it behind the clear glass counter. maybe cause it's a new item, i'll give them the benefit of doubt. i thought it would be subway's wrap's size but it's significantly smaller. butter chicken and its accompanying gravy/sauce is definitely sufficient. taste is on the spot, matches the wrap, not too spicy, not too strong. however, the salad (veggies) is meager. i only remember seeing one piece of lettuce and several countable strips of onion and carrot (i presume carrot? cause something orange). surely lose out to subway and/or stuff'd since the price range is about the same. hope they can improve on that, otherwise this wrap idea is a good menu add on. i also ordered hot teh tarik which is on point 👏🏽. restaurant is set up for fast food setting, i don't remember seeing any high chairs for kids though. their tray return is also all the way inside with minimum shelvings, they were already fully stacked with returns when i put my tray there. i thought it kind of discourages people to return their trays, especially when it gets crazy busy and crowded. on a good note, i spotted a really petite albeit thoughtful/useful hand wash basin at another corner of the restaurant.

I tried the deepavali special Dahi puri and chilli chicken briyani. I could say this is so far the best briyani I had. Chilli sauce is not too overpowering, and the curry goes well together with it. Pair it with a crispy pappadum, and acar, the taste is heavenly. I would also like to say thank you to the friendly staff, Naveed, for the service and  recommendation of Mango Lassi. It helps to lower the heat from the food and is very delicious too. First time trying out Dahi puri, quite an interesting taste experience for me. Sweet, salty, and a mixture of spicy makes it a well snack for anytime.

Price: $6.30

Masala Thosai: 5/5
Thosai had extremely crispy edges, the potato of the curry was more like a mash, there were carrot, peas and lentils which added a nice crunch.

Sambar: 4.5/5
A hearty and moreish sambar containing lentils with some heat from the chillies.

Chutney: 4.5/5
Red chutney is flavourful, tangy and tasted tomatoey. White chutney has A LOT of coconut with tiny bits of ginger. Very refreshing.

Total score: 14/15

Butter chicken biryani, add egg ($1) and masala chai came up to $15.40 which is very reasonable given the portion. See how small the fork and spoon is in comparison to the plate lol. Sauce is addictive, chicken is tender, egg is delicious. I like everything about this ☺️ The service was also very good and friendly. One small thing is that the place is very cold, so the food gets cold fast. Other than that, everything is awesome. I like that they have a small sink so you can wash your hands and they have napkins as well.

We ordered the butter chicken briyani (pictured; $11.90) and curry chicken briyani ($10.90) and the portion size was so huge that each dish could be shared by 2 persons. The curries were pretty good, though the curry chicken was slightly tough. It was busy on a Sun afternoon but there were still a few seats available. Service was friendly.

Standard drop way to low compared to when Ayam penyet is newly launched. Super disappointing. Can u see how pale the dory is?! Really waste of money, its not cheap mind u! And as usual alot of things in the menu are not available during order.

I like the gado-gado so much.
The ayam bakar also quite good.

The tofu was good. The yellow sauce tasted amazing. But the chicken in ayam penyet was so dry without any sauces. The only moisture in it was the chili which is super spicy…

Bad experience with their service team. My toddler spill the drinks on the table and floor, the service crew just ignore us thou the shop was 50% empty. They were just being blinded that the spillage on the floor. Initially tght some of the crew would help to bring out the mop, NOBODY bothered. Food there also felt normal compared to intiallu when they opened. Bad expereince that i would not even think of having any meals there. If there is no star rating on their service, i would change to 0 star.

Crispy Perfection: The chicken was exceptionally crispy. The outer layer had the ideal crunch, giving way to tender and succulent meat inside. It was clear that the chicken had been expertly, and most importantly, freshly fried to achieve this level of crispiness.

Flavorful Spice: The seasoning and spices used in the chicken were well-balanced, providing a harmonious blend of flavors. The spiciness was present but not overpowering, allowing the other flavors to shine through. The combination of herbs and spices added depth to the dish.

Accompaniments: The dish was accompanied by a reasonable portion of fragrant rice and sambal chilli. The sambal added a delightful kick to the meal. The fresh cucumber slices on the side provided a refreshing contrast to the spice.

Portion Size: The serving size was just nice for an average Asian eater.

Presentation: The dish was presented neatly, showcasing the crispy chicken on a bed of rice. The vibrant colors and the overall presentation were visually appealing.

Affordability: One of the most commendable aspects was that it offered great value for the price. You get a delicious and substantial meal without breaking the bank.

In conclusion, the Chicken Penyet exceeded my expectations. It's a dish that combines texture, flavor, and value, making it a must-try for anyone who enjoys Indonesian cuisine or simply loves a good crispy chicken dish. I would highly recommend it to fellow food lovers.

The dish impresses with its meticulous presentation, featuring a perfectly grilled and seasoned hamburger patty served alongside a bed of fluffy rice. Had Bacon & Kinoko Hamburg Steak Teishoku. The food is good but not excellent probably due to my personal preference of not so greasy food to begin with.

Walk in on a Sunday early evening at around 5.45pm and there was only one group ahead of us so waiting time is around 2-3 minutes.

Ordered the truffle omelette set at $18.80++ and avocado pork hamburg set at $16.80++.

Each set come with a side dish, a salad, a tamago soup and a rice.

Service staff are very attentive and excellent customer service.

Will definately return to dine in again.

I was quite hungry, but unfortunately, the food here left me with a sense of normalcy, which in itself speaks volumes.

Here's what I ordered:

1. Tsukimi Pork Hamburg Don - The hamburg was rather tasteless, but fortunately, they provided soy sauce on the side. I must say the egg yolk was a highlight. In fact, I ordered an extra egg to mix with the remaining rice, elevating the dish.

2. Tamago Egg Soup - Surprisingly, this simple soup stood out amongst all the dishes.

3. Thick-Cut Bacon - A decent choice if you're hankering for bacon.

This was my first experience tasting hamburg steak in Singapore! We conveniently placed our order through a QR code, and the food arrived promptly after we ordered. We opted for the Bacon Hamburg Steak Set Meal and Tsukimi Hamburg Don, and both dishes were incredibly delicious! The Japanese ingredients were impressively fresh, leaving a delightful taste in our mouths. We're already looking forward to returning to try other items on the menu!

Extreme disappointment with the quality of the food. Unsatisfied by the tasteless dishes and overly salty omelette that I received.

We ordered seven dishes from your restaurant, which came to a total cost of $96.12. However, upon receiving my food, I was immediately struck by how bland and unappetising everything looked. Each one was seriously lacking in flavour, and I found myself struggling to finish even a single serving.

To make matters worse, the omelette that I ordered was incredibly salty, to the point where it was almost inedible. The fried fritters turns out to be frozen fish and tempura with fried chicken instead calamari. The fried rice is dry, bland and has zero fragrance. I hope that you take this feedback seriously and work to improve the quality of your food and the overall dining experience that you offer.

The beef rendang is tender and I will recommend as first meat dish if this is your first visit.

Nicely located corner makan place so you get some good wind circulation... Essential when eating spicy food.  😂 Staff are friendly and chill.

Good Nasi Padang dishes and Nasi Ambeng set! 2 meat and 1 veg with 1 drink costs $13.50. Spicy and great taste, easy to eat and not too heavy. Friendly service.

Accidentally found another branch here, the  Mee Sua is as good as the one at Bukit Panjang hawker that I missed it so much.
This is inside a new, clean and spacious food court. Not too crowd in the morning to have Mee sua as breakfast.

Hearty portion of mee sua at 5$
Light and clean soup so suitable for piping hot soup for breakfast or lunch
Soup flows in my blood so this bowl speaks to my soul

Mee Sua comes with pig liver but I slways change it to lean pork slices but its great taste is not altered. Its taste reminds me of Mee Sua in soup cooked for me by my mum, her mum or her sister as a comfort food when I had had measles or fever or they cooked it on weekends to take a break from the rice staple. To me, a taste that reminds me if my loved ones and their love each time i patronised the stall. Thumbs up!

Totally worth the price. $5 for soup mee sua and the soup is power much! Love the handmade meatballs and the lean meat is marinated too! I believe they added huadiaojiu to the soup and the fried ginger level up the soup.

Will be back to try more of their other noodles.

HERE: 3x

再来阿嫲面线. Chye Lye Ah Ma Mee sua, S$4. Wanted to eat the famous J99 ban mian in this coffeeshop after my swim. It is opposite Toa Payoh swimming complex. Unfortunately my favorite ban mian stall is not open on Sunday. Hence I tried this Chye Lye Ah Ma Mee Sua it is pretty good, especially when I feel hungry and cold after swimming. I think food tastes extra good after having a swim. 😋
,.
The ah ma meesua is yummy, they drizzle hua tiao wine into it, with fried ginger and chives this makes a hearty warm meal. 😋👍 I asked for extra fried ginger. The minced Pork ball is tastily marinated. The stew mushroom is also flavorful and quite soft. I will be back again for this yummy and healthy meesua. 👍

Review posted on my IG: Yummymich

Food was quite alright - I ordered the Nasi Lemak Set B and it tasted just fine, but coffee was a little lacklustre.

The staff was quite friendly but it's mostly the decor and atmosphere that hooked me up.

Nestled in a shophouse opposite SINDA, the view of the trees and street brings me back to my childhood in the 80s, something which vintage decor alone cannot provide.

I'd also appreciate the ample parking spaces available and quiet neighborhood. It wouldn't be the same if they weren't nestled here.

A charming nasi padang place in an equally charming neighborhood, complete with a handsome silkie chook freely roaming the premises. I chanced upon this place while exploring the area seeking breakfast and it felt like i was transported back to old kampung days.

A good thing about coming early is that the curries and padang dishes are all piping hot. The food was all right, not very spicy (might not appease hardcore sambal lovers) - was happy to find sayur manis lemak here.

What i loved best was the laid back vibe, and the friendly staff who served up the warm nosh with warm smiles. Refreshingly un-Singaporeanesque.

Servers are really friendly and food is amazing. Love the choice of 3 types of chilli sauces. Price is reasonable as well. Premise is well ventilated and clean.

The coffee shop, decor, location, car park and even a resident chicken makes this place a great idea.. but it's more than a great idea now that I've tried it (maybe I was hungry and enjoyed the food a tad more).

I think their dishes are not very spicy which is a nice change (from all the mala).. they were nicely executed, taste, texture and all. And by today's standard, $12.50 for this is not exorbitant (compared to some nasi padang at Geylang Serai).

Great place for Nasi Padang , easy to find parking. Came after lunch so I guess most of the items were sold out. Would definitely come again

Nested in a food court within an industrial estate. This humble corner store offers one of the best Appams in Singapore. We had the egg, plain, Ondeh-Ondeh and Kaya with a side dip of Ikan bilis sambal. Very nice!

They have other food too: thosai, bryani, etc. Worth a try if you are in the area!

Went there because of the good review. But I really don't know what's so special about this stall.
1. Dirty utensils, have to dig and find those slightly better ones.
2. Dirty dining area. Prolly school holiday, u have to tahan sitting on dusty seats. Wet tables due to rain.
3. Because the whole place is empty and this stall is the only one that's open. U could clearly hear what's going on in the kitchen. All I'm hearing is the microwave sound every other min.
4. I thought only if u take away, it would not be crispy. But I was wrong. Even if u eat there, it's the same.
5. Had the ondeh ondeh, the palm sugar tasted sour.
6. Worst of all, the price shown on the signboard is student rate. And when I told the lady that I'm a student. The reply that I get is. Sorry, key in already, cannot change. Win liao loh. $4.50 for a so-so appam only.

I ordered the nasi lemak appam and ondeh ondeh appam. To be honest, u should just go have the real nasi lemak instead.

My overall review. Not deserving a second visit.

Appam is quite ok. To be fair, we didn’t try the special ones. Just did the plain. The appam is lacking in flavour but the texture is good (nice springy taste). Price is on the high side ($2.50 for one plain).
The foodcourt is clean and airy.

Need to be patient once order, because each and every appam is made upon order (including those in food delivery order). But it’s worth the wait. Had the egg appam & plain appam. It’s so fluffy in the center and it’s amazingly well cook in the center. It’s not oily nor greasy. Next time can try other modern combinations.
Take note: They only have takeaway after 6:30pm to close 7:30pm.

Is really nice if you eat at the shop.  They should improvise their packaging. This is definitely a good packaging but is doesn't help to maintain the crispiness. Should try using paper container. That would help slightly.  Just like those waffle shop.

Lunch stop for my cycling route. Friendly people. Mura ang food sakto.

This place has variety of food. Prices are reasonable $4-5. Tried the dry chilli pan mian and was good. Uncle would knead the dough and Aunty roll the dough on d spot to make individual bowl of ban mian. The dry ban mian cost $4 was good. The mkt  has soya bean stall selling refreshing soya bean. Ordered the $9.50 seafood soup and it was filling enough for me. But if you’re a big eater you should definitely go for the $11.50 one.

Would come back to try the crayfish and red grouper the next time.

The quality and portion has dropped tremendously. Look at the portion size, especially the soup given for the $9.50 basic portion! Soup is also just salty now. Best to boycott such black shops who constantly raise prices, shrink portions and compromise on quality.

Confronted the stall owner about portion size and he mumbled some nonsense about his soup being about "taste" which is total nonsense! He reluctantly gave a few more spoonfuls of soup - never ever again.

A honest and personal review on this.

Ordered Clayfish Seafood Soup, $13.50, because of the price (I think), the portion is generous, it got clayfish, minced meats, dory fish, prawn and some sliced tomatoes.

Maybe because of the minced meats given, a huge portion, almost filled whole the bowl, there is not much of the “seafood” taste in the soup. The food tastes more than mixed pork soup, 猪杂汤. The sweetness came from the pork instead of seafood.

If you are looking for a food portion that worth for the price, this is the right place.

Paying $9.50 for a pathetic medium size if seafood soup, charging me additional 50 cents for a takesway bowl that pack almost nothing in that bowl! Feedback on the spot but worker say that more soup will ruin the taste, what a “splendid” excuse. Not patronising it ever again!

Reviews: 

During our dinner gathering with three of us, we decided to try out this restaurant that offers a variety of cuisines, including North Indian, Muslim, Western, and Thai food. However, we were a bit disappointed when the service person provided us with a menu that seemed incomplete. Drinks like coconut and canned drinks were not listed on the menu, which left us wondering about the full range of beverage options available.

Despite the initial confusion with the menu, we were pleased to discover that the restaurant accepted both e-payment and cash payment methods, making it convenient for all of us to settle the bill.

As for the food, we ordered a selection of dishes from different cuisines. To our delight, the taste of the dishes was quite decent, and we found the overall spiciness level to be manageable, as it was not overly spicy. The variety of flavors from the different cuisines added an exciting twist to our dining experience, and we appreciated the diverse range of dishes available.

Overall, while the incomplete menu and missing drink options were a minor setback, the positive dining experience, delicious dishes, and the option for various cuisines made the dinner gathering enjoyable. We would consider visiting again in the future to explore more of the restaurant's offerings and perhaps inquire about their full drink menu.

Chance upon this eating house on the way back from JB. Amazing food! Nothing is not nice about this place! Opens till 2am, best place for indian muslim supper. Their mee goreng mamak is one of the best eaten so far, hard to get a place that serve mee goreng merah the correct way and taste. Beef soup was flavourful too and peppery, chicken rice is nice too. Will come again to try their kambing soup!

Quite amazed on their cooking speed too, the place was rather full yet all the food came within 15mins. Staff are also friendly, only downside is the parking.

Lots of varieties here, choices of food will make u drool 🤤, servers and waiters all are good and prompt, price wise is ok but not your regular typical coffee shop. Place is big and can cater combined tables to supply for a larger quantity of customers for dinner gatherings. Parking is also not a problem for not cars and bike, toilet and washing available too. 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Wow. Absolutely blown away by the hearty and delicious food. Not to mdntion the realllly affordable prices! Would definitely come here again because oh my god beats al amaan and other places by a MILE!

Butter chicken is ridiculously creamy and buttery for just $7! Thick chunks of chicken coated in gooey curry. SSo yummy! The garlic naan wasn't as garlicky as I liked but still a good complement!

We also got their palak paneer which is more... unconventional. Thick green spinach curry which is less creamy and has cottage cheese curds! Interesting taste, though I prefer their classic butter chicken.

Their roti prata is on the softer side, not crunchy you you won't get sick of chewing. It was soft and fluffy, a little floury. Tasty!

One of the best Mamak food in the North.

Tom Yam very tasty and spicy
Chz naan very soft
Beef Kwey Teow also very tasty.

Cuttlefish and century egg rojak ($8.50) - Average. The flavour of the sauce could have been stronger and thicker. The portion was small. Even the cucumbers. The cuttlefish was not bad. The century egg was fine.

Decided to check out the hawker centre at Marsiling mall as I was in the area and chanced upon this absolute gem of a stall.

The owner was friendly and extremely professional, and even though it was peak hour, the food came quite quickly.

I really enjoyed the satay, with its smokey aroma and succulent meat which was delicious especially when paired with the peanut sauce. Definitely recommend the the crispy taupok and rojak as well.

I learnt that they are a third generation hawker in Singapore from the owner too! Definitely check them out - and support local hawker talents while enjoying a great satay experience in the north.

Observed the satay meat shrished this time as we ordered regularly when we are there. Fruit rojak are fresh and portion small.

Our all time favourite satay and rojak in the whole of singapore, consistent and always a pleasure ordering for our lunch. ❤️ ❤️ ❤️ love the friendly and efficient service especially Godon and godon wife are truly a charm.

Even though we went during dinner, they gave us a beeper so we didn’t need to stand and wait at the store. The food was really good and my favourite was the cuttlefish rojak!

Reviews: 

Decent neighbourhood hawker centre. Supermarket, shops and a Burger King located on 2nd floor. Multi-story carpark for drivers out there.

Food wise my opinion is that Marsiling Mall is average. There are some stalls here that deserve a look at if you’re in the area but I wouldn’t go out of my way just to eat here.

The wanton mee stall always has a long queue. People mainly order the wanton mee or the lor mee but it also sells fried chicken noodles. Got the wanton mee at $4.50. The portion of noodles is not a lot , good amount of char siew (not fatty or chewy) and a small piece of fried wanton. It also comes with a bowl of soup with 2 small dumplings.
The coffee stall sells not too bad coffee and soft boiled eggs which are nicely cracked into a bowl for you. The Kaya toast could have been crispier (in comparison with Ya Kun).
Not easy to find a cool table on a Sunday morning. Quite a crowd here. There are quite a variety of foods here. The giant fans help to circulate the air in the hawker centre.

📍 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐡 𝐒𝐮𝐠𝐚𝐫 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐞 • 𝐂𝐨𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐞 • 𝐓𝐞𝐚 (𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐌𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐇𝐚𝐰𝐤𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐞, 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠)

Starting our morning right with 𝙎𝙚𝙩 𝘼 ($3.50) that came with 4 kaya toast pieces, 2 eggs and a kopi ‘o’, and 𝙎𝙚𝙩 𝘽 ($2.70) which was similar but without the drink ☀️

Kaya butter toast: Very crispy thin! Just the right thickness of butter, kaya leaned on the less sweet spectrum but could be more fragrant. I liked how they used the traditional brown bread though number of butter slices was inconsistent.

Eggs: Yolks were soft and creamy 🍳

Overall, my dad preferred this to Ya Kun due to its affordability and decent quality!! There’s always a queue at this stall despite a few other stalls selling kaya toasts in the same hawker centre, and I can now see why after trying 😋

Follow @iloafbready Instagram for more food reviews! :)

Good variety of food choices, I like the 'Bukit Panjang Dessert's ching teng and bobochacha.

Good Lao huo tang as well.

Some of the hawkers like to put their stuff on the table near their stall especially under the fans and chope place there. This makes it difficult for customers patronizing other stalls to find seats or to be sitted under cooler table as the place is deem stuffy especially in the day time.

The pig organ soup, pig liver, pig stomach soup are fresh and taste sourish nice 😋 at Fu Qiang pig organ soup stall. Coffee O is strong enough at Yinle hot & cold beverages. The hot & cold desserts 😋 at the stall operate by an old uncle & auntie near to the escalator nearer to woodlands stadium.

Attach photo shows the hawker stall owner's stuff on the table under 2 wall fans ):  Seemingly people think that someone has choped the seat, but it's the stall owner 's stuff when we inquired about it being there for more than an hour. We went to Sheng Siong supermarket after our meal and back in about an hour's time yet the stuff are still there ): this no good especially that these are the 2 walls fans in that row of stalls and there's no other cooler place for customers to sit and have their meals.

Hidden gem here in Woodlands. Great tasting middle eastern food at less than half the price of those restaurants at Arab street. Everything was flavourful, juicy, and with just the right texture. We had the Lamb Mandi, Chicken Quesadillas, and Kunafe - all were amazing. Portion sizes were HUGE too. Highly recommended.

This is an amazing kebab place. Everything is delicious and real deal. They just opened Arabica Grill just behind this outlet and it's equally amazing. If you are in mood of good Arabic food, no better place in Woodlands than this.

Ordered via grab food and its so goood. My lamb mandi was still warm when it arrived.  The lamb shank was super tender and juicyyyy!!! First time to try knafeh and its was so yummy too, crispy outside but soft cheese inside 💯 Will try the quesadillas next time as I’ve been reading a lot of positive reviews on it. 🤤

Ordered the Kofta Mutton. Very juicy and tender. Even better than well know restaurants. They might be located in a coffee shop but the food is great.

Ate the mixed kebab and i must say that it is the best kebab i have ever eaten in my life. Had this quite a while back (~3 months ago), and i think about eating this every now and then! The meats are so juicy and tender, moisture is locked into the meats unlike some other kebabs sold by other stalls that have dry, stringy meat. Seasoning is so good as well. Will definitely come back here again to try their other dishes

Perhaps the only place in the north to get your dose of authentic satay! 👍🏼😋

This place has the best chappatti I ever eaten. They originated from old woodlands interchange which has been demolished. Looked for them for years and found him at Marsiling Mall. You should try this chappatti and kheema before you die. I never give 5 star rating unless as nobody's perfect. The chappatti bread is also soft and has the powdery floor which makes its taste unique. Not oily and healthy. Kheema is quite oily but you don't eat it everyday!! Lol.

Visited this place multiple times. One of the best chapati and kheema in the north! Don’t need to travel down to CENTRAL just to have Azmi (Norris Rd) cause this place have awesome chapati as well.

Tried more than 7 and this is by far the best mutton briyani in woodlands.
Rice is well cooked and fragrant, mutton so falls off the bone tender, curry just the right consistency and spiciness.

Bhai's rice has singular grains that is both fragrant and well spiced. The keema w/ chapati is second only to Norris road's. Full piece of chicken thigh and drumstick for a flat fee. This guy is the Briyani king 👑 of woodlands.

One of the best place to enjoy with friends and good food. Service is very fast, staff and owner is very friendly. Always first choice to go for drinks with friends and Best part is Momos. In singapore no other restaurent serve this tasty momos.

Lovely little place in Little India away from the bustling street. The food is good especially love their grill lamb special. I would skip the butter chicken as it’s a little on the sweet side. The dumplings are good although it do taste like Chinese dumplings. The lamb biryani is so flavourful! Will definitely come back

It was lunch time and today we decided to check out Gurkha Palace.
Ordered Lassi, Chili momo,  Naan, Chicken tikka masala ,  mutton and chicken Biriyani.
Good Service, Ambience is great.
Staff is helpful, attentive and kind to offer suggestions.
Food was served in reasonable time. First came the Mango Lassi. taste and flavour was a bit different. Not the flavour and smoothness as I would expect.
Chili Momo came the next and it was just super delicious. Well cooked, rich in flavour and slightly spicy. The texture was perfect. We loved this dish the most.
Next the Naan and Chicken Tikka masala, Naan was thin and soft. It had good flavour. Chicken Tikka masala gravy was nice but a bit salty.
Lastly, the much awaited Biryani..  the rice had a good flavour but rice in  both mutton and chicken Biriyani tasted the same. The meat was well cooked but lacked the freshness. Seemed like the meat was cooked separate and added to Biryani Rice. Overall It's a different taste. Something different from the  usual Indian style Biryani.
Portions were generous. Overall  it was not bad experience.

1st time here. Make a reservation for 6 pax Lunch. Atmosphere and food was great! Chicken briyani, Prawn Briyani an chickenTikka must order! Butter chicken was missed out from the order but it doesn’t matter cos I’m coming back for more👍

Food was very good!
I am surprised!

It is not pricey, very well cooked and clean.

Toilets should improve in cleaning but the people from the restaurant were very kind.

I recommend to try out

I don't think reviews matter that much. This place has lots of bad ones but it was packed during my Sunday evening visit.

Anyway, here's mine.
Staff were friendly enough. Prices MUCH better than the two places nearby that are popular with expats. Especially for beer. And the Sunday specials are hard to beat for price. $9+for Thali. And the portion was very hefty. I think this place is popular for prices more than food.

My mutton tasted very familiarly western Chinese. I've lived in China for the past 4 years and there was definitely a Chinese spice going on. It wasn't bad at all. Just didn't taste northern Indian to me.

One of the thali side dishes was black beans and they were hardish like briefly boiled peanuts. Maybe that's the way they should be?

Visited this place randomly for dinner and drinks. Happened to see as Nepal Cuisine, so wanted to give a try. Beer offers are good, food prices are fine, however, the taste of the food is below average. Staff is very friendly and courteous, Manager Jessie is taking care of the place very well. Food lags taste in terms of spice, chili and freshness.

Food was delicious! The meat platter was a great choice, allowing us to try all the different flavors in one platter, though the green meat looked a little too "radioactive"! 😂 The ambience was just so-so.

When we first entered, the waiter attended to us mentioned that waiting time for the food is about 30 minutes to 45 minutes.

The food came within 15 minutes, and is really delicious. They provided papadum and room temperature water. The service is alright and the food is amazing. Per person, average damage about $25+.

I enjoyed their naan and one of the chicken dishes. Tasty, will return!

Absolutely wonderful Northern Indian and Nepal cuisine. Having spent many months in Northern India, I can say that this food is about as authentic as it gets. Service was great! The atmosphere is very generic. But the food is wonderful. I will be going back

No queue and place was relatively empty when visited on 26 October 2023, Thursday morning. Ordered via the counter, payment was by cash as debit/credit cards aren't accepted (other cashless payment methods are accepted though). Order came quickly after. Pratas were served piping hot and crispy. Sauce trays for the prata gravy could be a bit cleaner though. Overall a pleasant experience.

Finally back here after a long while for a feast! 🍽️ Used to order their crispy masala thosai & red bean prata regularly when I was still in school~

🍳 ThosaiMiyaki (*for meat-eaters only; $7.90)

Launched on 5 Aug, this creation continues Springleaf’s tradition of launching one super innovative new dish every year — as part of their Ultimate Series💡

Inspired by the Japanese okonomiyaki, this crispy thosai base was topped with shredded cabbage, sliced turkey ham & bonito flakes. The omni dad & mom enjoyed this!

🍋 Yuzu Gula Soda

Top up $2 to get this as a set with the ThosaiMiyaki. A nice balance of sweet, tangy & fizzy — feels like multiple worlds colliding into one 💥

🪄 Magic Meatless Murtabak ($7.90)

Includes a medley of lentils, mushrooms, curry leaves, vegan mayo and mildly spicy korean sauce. Didn’t really taste the curry leaves but appreciated the protein-rich pulses, juicy and umami mushrooms and creamy sauces! 😋

🍔 Vegan Impossible Murtaburger ($11.20)

Very hearty burger-like creation, with two thick & chewy pieces of prata sandwiching lots of stretchy vegan cheese, impossible burger patties & sauce 🧀🫕

🥞 Hi-Fibre Plain Prata ($1.70)

Interestingly doesn’t taste like it’s high-fibre. Seems like margarine or something was added to make it look really chewy and yellow.

❤️ Red Bean Prata ($4.40)

This brings back memories of post-hike / after-school days 💭 Very sweet & super super crispy, just like what I remembered! ✨

We enjoyed the foods at Springleaf Prata Place. The Prata sugar is crispy, my girl loves it. I like the masala chicken and nasi biryani. The staff there is very friendly too.

We found a cockroach in our food!

We raised the complaint to the service crew and they offered to give us a replacement. But we're already grossed out about this as we are unable to eat anything here. The service crew suggested that it might have fallen from the ceiling. But it is dead already and one of its legs is chopped off as well. I cannot imagine it being from the ceiling as the leg would fall far away or it would be alive and walk off normally.

I don't think I can eat outside for a while now

One of their smallest outlet with limited seats.
So there’s a rule that you have to order first and they will assign table for you at the counter. However some idiots will just chop seat and then q to order. Previously they do have a sign saying the above rule. But now they took it down. Thus there’s this constant confusion. I am happy for this rule but I hope that the staff can be consistent to tell the people off.

Today they are kind of lack of staff as the plates were short and the orders took longer than usual.

maggie goreng which is overly salty.

My fav here is mozzarella cheese prata. 10/10
Plain Prata is crunchy and nice.

Milo dinasaur is in a small cup which I think they do not have enough cup. Kind of sad when it cost more than other drinks.

Had dinner at the restaurant a couple weeks ago.  Ordered Roganjosh, chicken biryani, chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.

The taste of all the dishes was truly authentic and flavourful with all the aroma from the spices, but not overwhelming.  Love that the gravy was thick and the portions of chicken and lamb is also pretty good.  My favourite was the garlic naan, crispy and garlicky, it really went well with all that gravy.

The servers were polite,  helpful and prompt. The restaurant itself was also nice and cosy. Thoroughly enjoyed the dinner.  Only thing is that there is very limited (parallel) parking along the road. There is a small public carpark nearby, a short walk from the restaurant but it is pretty difficult to get a parking lot too during dinner hours. Parking aside, the food and ambience is really good, give it a try if in the vicinity.

The garlic naan was great. The paneer butter masala could be less sweet and have more Indian spices. The noodles could be cooked in a bigger fire. The mutton set was very nice.

The portion is reasonable for sharing. I enjoyed the Basmati rice which is perfectly steamed to bring out the nice fragrance and texture. The sauces are great to go with the rice and naan.

My friend takes me here to taste Nepalese foods. Wow ! It’s super delicious and very tasty. Tea is the best ever I have tried in Singapore . Pretty similar to Burmese Tea . Will go back again definitely.

Will nvr be coming this restaurant again. Had to remind them to provide the mint chutney which is typically served with the papad, $14.50 for chicken thali and you will only get 3 tiny pieces of meat which wasn't worth it. Bad incident of one waitress serving the thali in an abrupt way, can't even place the plate straight it was served slammed on the table slanted sideways. Gave feedback to the male manager, he asked me if I am from the industry also which I assumed he meant if I'm a waitress too? I think its rude to ask customers that type of question. Very unpleasant experience overall.

Ordered the mid size claypot rice, small claypot pig organ soap & large portion vegetables.

1) claypot rice is filled with reasonable portion of chicken, lup cheong & salted fish. The claypot rice fragrant is released after mixing well with black sauce and oil. Portion wise not enough for 3 pax hence we have to order another small claypot rice.

2) Pig organ soup ingredients portion not enough to justify the price of $7. The soup is not well cooked with the pig organ, resulting very artificial taste. Recommended to order the fish soup in the same coffee shop instead.

3) vegetables overcooked.

5) able to accept CDC vouchers for payment

The taste of this Bak Kut Teh is far from some of the mediocre ones I've ever tasted. I won't try again.

serves hokkien/ klang style bak kut teh, which is dark and herbally. pork ribs were tender. soup was flavourful. with options to add enoki mushrooms and meatball.

had the claypot chicken rice. loaded with lupchong/ wax sausages, salted fish and chicken.

chilli is good. provides a nice umami kick, but not spicy.

staff is very friendly and welcoming.

very pleased. will return.

Not recommending to visit this place any more. Seems to have a change in owner after the renovation. Firstly the portion of bkt has dropped to pathetic level and price has went up. Secondly, the soup is very bland and taste more like soya sauce/salty water, no longer taste as the previously proclaimed herbal soup bkt. Thirdly the service is also very bad, with the server just rushing for you to make order. Lastly the cutlery were also quite dirty. Sad to see this place has dropped its standard.

Always the best Bak Kut Teh (Herbal) option in Choa Chu Kang! Recently the coffee shop got renovated so ambience is slightly better than last time!

Really thick and herbally soup, that is very flavourful. Standard has not dropped since my days in PJC (2013-2014). Food still as tasty!

Options to add enoki mushroom or meat balls available as well. For people who only eat pork ribs for their bak kut teh, do let the stall owners know. For organ lovers, their intestines are cleaned relatively qell and liver is nice as well!

The 'Shish Mahal' Indian restaurant was just across the road from the Ibis hotel we were staying at, and we visited it three times, having some delicious curries there and cool beers.

Very inexpensive for Singapore, with excellent staff who made us feel really at home, and kept offering us additional titbits.  It's a great place to eat, and the area around it - 'Albert Court' is very interesting.

Good indian food, quick service and great hospitality by the staff. We had dal tadka, paneer kadhai, roti and rice, the food was tasty, good quality and portion size. Paneer unexpectedly was quite soft and creamy. A meal for 4 would cost anywhere between 65-80 SGD.

Came here for a late night snack and some beer. While they were kind enough to accommodate my order despite the kitchen being closed, the cheese balls were still cold at the core. Beers are fresh and cheap tho. Would come again for that.

Was given complimentary papadam which was really nice! The chicken briyani was fragrant and flavourful and was nice to have together with the palak paneer and garlic naan!

The staff was also very friendly and helpful!

Good place to  eat indian and nepali food.
Price is reasonable .Staff are receptive on your request. Atmosphere is amicable . You have choice for both indoor and outdoor. cheers

The place feels small and crowded. Furnitures quite old and needs to renovate. Food are expensive. They even have a promotion but actually not really a promotion price. They just added their current meal bundle price just to look like a ($58) promotion. I walk out the restaurant not satisfied with what I paid. We ordered Ultra and Mega burger. The Ultra burger looks small in actual compared to their posters and in this photo. Don't be fooled by it.

Visited swensens on a Saturday night in a group of 3. Went around 6+pm, managed to get a seat after waiting about 5min.

Our waiter was patient and professional, took time to explain the perks of the swensens memberships and the vouchers we could use (nowadays the swensens memberships is quite rewarding but also quite complicated - requires the use of telegram). There was another waiter subsequently who was a bit rude when we asked for our banana split - literally didn't acknowledge us and just waved his hand at the kitchen and walked away.

Ordered one pizza, one battered fish and chips and one meatballs to share. Came with 3 free drinks (topped up 1 dollar each to get special drinks), and a free banana split because of all our membership perks.

Total bill of 60 for quite a filling and value for money dinner. Thank you

I remembered my first visit to this Swensen’s outlet. As a kid, it was nothing short of an excellent experience. Staff was nice, my fish and chips classic was delicious, and my ice cream was nicely presented. That was in 1998.

25 years on I still walk out from this branch a happy diner but no longer a kid. And I would absolutely change nothing about this restaurant.

Overall, the food is ok. I have ordered a combo "steak & chicken", the steak somehow well prepared as per my order "midium rare", as some restaurant could still see bloody in the middle.
Fish & chip is ok, too. No special vs. others.
Swensen's should be famous in their ice cream, but I'm not able to find the special of it. The milky cream is not as strong and a bit watery. Just hope could improve further.

The fish and chip is not up to standard. Batter too thick for my liking. Fish too bland.

Worst of the worst is chicken in basket. The chicken is not fully cook. Is cold inside. Apparently the waitress just took it back to the kitchen, fry it and bring it back to me without any explanation or any apology.

Thats about it for my experience.

Streats Cafe needs no introduction.

I used to find the food on the average but at a recent visit, I change my mind a little. The food is still on the salty (flavourful) side but I do enjoy the Claypot Rice Porridge with Seafood and Minced Chicken Ball.

The soup dishes which my friends order also taste overly flavourful, to me. I hope they don’t have to drink lots of water after the meal. 😆 Oh, but I like the HK Carrot Cake with XO sauce. That scores another thumbs up from me. 👍
#tiramisooojiaks #jiakjiakjiak #sgfoodie #streatscafe #friedcarrotcake #claypotriceporridge #kimchisoup #halalfood #halalsg

This "hybrid" cafe serves HK style dishes as well as local fare. They have a small selection of dim sum (I like their siew mai), small selection of "Nasi Lemak", small selection of local tze char dishes...you get the drift. When put together, however, it becomes quite a smorgasbord of choices.
The Nissin Soup Noodle is one of their more popular choices. It's like a more glamorous Maggie Mee, with 'liao' inside. The soup is tasty and overall it's yummy. And who doesn't love the oversized soup spoon that it's served in?
The Nasi Lemak - hmm. The Nasi is not Lemak, and the Acar serving is quite pitiful (nowhere near as shown in the menu picture). However, the fried chicken was great, and the prawns were fresh. And the sambal, while not the best I've had, was good enough.
The star of this cafe, to me, is it's ambience. Tucked away at the corner of the mall, it's 2 storey ceiling with glass windows one one side makes for a cosy and warm casual dining experience. Worth a visit. Or two.

Consider A Moderate Halal Restaurant For Fusions I Would Say, Not Very Fantastic, But Can Be Consider Above Average Comparing w Some Few Other Fusion Cuisine Restaurants Out There... 😊

order the food on 1930, food delivery takes 30 mins. Message from Streats set to aim to deliver the food by 8pm yet it is 8.23pm now and the food is not delivered yet.

Very slow service, not going to order again.
Will advise my friends and relatives not to order from this outlet in Bukit Panjang Plaza

The beef noodle was the worse I ever tasted in my life especially for a Hong Kong restaurant. The beef was hammer to tenderiise it and was so salty . I told the staff and they literally shrug it off . Never will I go there again .

The thai fried rice has no thai influence at all but taste good as a fried rice. The fried rice texture is dry, fluffy and every grain well fried. The chilli padi adds the extra heat and drizzled with lime to give the spicy tangy taste (maybe that’s the thai part) and fried chicken is a good side that makes the meal more hearty. The place is quite messy, service is normal. Eat and go place.

Tried this dish (Aroi Royale) as its different from their zhi char dishes.

Not bad. Tom Yum soup based with seafood varieties and noodles. Serving was huge for 4 pax.

Ordered via online from the table QR code. Hassle free.

The staffs were polite and courteous.

Overall, nice experience. Thank you.

Set meal was really worth it. About 28++ for assam fish, veggie, sichuan soup, 2 rice. It was marketed to be for 2 pax but would think 3 pax is good for it too (maybe order 1 additional side). Would revisit to try their fish head / other seafood options.

Good old Halal Zhi Char . We tried some normal or usual selections. I must say , I love the mee goreng and prawn paste chicken wing . Overall food tastes qreat but as the place have no sound proof,  it get noisy at time especially when it crowded.

Weekend and it's time for lunch and buddy picked West Coz. I'm up for it for sure.

We arrived around 2pm thereabouts and the place was not that crowded. We were seated and given our menu by a lady. She seem rather uptight, not rude just the tone I guess. Nothing to be bothered much by. In fact she was nice enough to inform us to call when we were ready to order.

The choices! Oh my, that was the biggest issue albeit a good issue to have really. So we decided on Assam Fish, Sambal Kangkong, Oyster Omelette, Black Pepper Beef and rice of cause. The male server came and took our orders and in about 15mins all our items arrived. That's a nice thing. Probably because it wasn't that crowded.

The pictures speaks for itself. The portions were generous, the veggies seems fresh however I would assume the assam fish to be different, you know the red soupy type rather than what I believe to be coconut based gravy. And half a fish head? Hhmmmm ... Nevertheless it was still delish. For the price point, was it worth it, definately. Would I be back here again, sure.

Oh, and after we ate and went out to catch a breather, saw the lady leaving on her bicycle. Thank her and she smiled and went on her merry way.

All in all, enjoyed it.

Food : 4 / 5
Staff : 4 / 5
Ambience : 3 / 5

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 3.4
Reviews: 

Went here for lunch during weekends. There wasn't much of a queue and they were relatively fast in preparing your order. I have waited approximately ten minutes before they serve you the food. The price is reasonable, the food is great and it is definitely worth the price.

It is quite hot here so I recommend you to sit somewhere exposed to the outside air so that there would be an occasional cooling breeze that would circulate the air so that you wouldn't feel that hot.

It's best to eat here in groups so that you would be able to enjoy the different varieties of food together. Recommend this to your friends too!

Google reviews is pretty accurate, very very average Korean food here.
Served up by very authentic Korean ladies but the food(I tried) were not close to authentic tasting at all. The kimchi stew and ginseng chicken soup tasted like premix or just stock, with lots of msg and not made with fresh ingredients. I was super thirsty after eating. The soup was watery and not tasty.

Price I feel is ok, not too expensive for the portion which is rather generous, 1 stew and rice will be very very full.

However with the number of other Korean options in this building, I won’t be back for this Korean food.

I have to blame myself for not reading other reviews before ordering.

Seafood stew with rice $13.90 at a hawker centre. Taste bland and the ingredients (prawns and mussels) are not fresh.

The only thing authentic about this place is probably the store owner who is a Korean.

Rooftop dining and great place to chill at night. Serves Korean food and beer. Love the oiginal fried chicken wings, crispy on the outside, tender inside. Located in the hawker centre decorated with assortment of plants which adds a botanic side yo the place.

Overall about 3.5 stars for this popular Korean food stall.

The ginseng porridge $10 was pretty good. Tasty, comforting food and the portion was a huge ball. The ginseng was cut into thin stripes so it doesn’t come across as super bitter when I bit into it.

However, the seafood soup was lacklustre. The main complaint would be that the prawns and mussels were not fresh at all. I was struggling to peel the prawns so much it simply disintegrated. I just gave up eating it.

Peak hour wait could be from 30 mins onwards so be prepared to wait during dinner time!

Rating: 3.9
Reviews: 

Had a quick lunch here, pleasantly surprised by the seafood kim chi soup. It’s one of the best I’ve tasted. There’s crab meat in it which makes the soup authentically ‘seafood’ in flavour. Everything tasted v good. A surprise find this one!

Always a quiet and chill place where you’ll almost be guaranteed a seat even on Friday nights. Food options are decent but some dishes are a hit or miss. The fried chicken had lots of batter and the flavour didn’t feel like Korean fried chicken (somehow it reminds me for sweetened dark soy sauce). Will return mainly because it’s quiet.

The hotplate beef is served on a cold plate. The banchan is not worth a repeat. You get better fried chicken at a fast food place. The tofu kimchi soup is ok. The chive pajeon is thick and uncook at the center and doesn't taste Korean.

Not much of ambience but a good place for some quiet moments and good , reasonable price k food. Although I am not a fan of k stuff, the pancake is really good and the various fried chicken. Do go for the sets as they are more worth it.

Homely and very customizable which is a plus for vegans/vegetarians! Naengmyeon is a must at Gayageum whenever I finish trekking nearby especially during hot weather. The jeons are tasty and in good servings - there's banchan too but not all side dishes are vegan.

Reviews: 

We had cold noodle, kimchi stew and fried dumpling! Their price point is considered steep for typical Korean dishes . The kimchi stew is average, not too spicy nor flavourful. However it is a good meal to wind down after a long day! The cold noodle texture is great and refreshing. We enjoyed it.
Their fried dumpling is a great snack to go along with the main dish.
They serve complimentary side dishes and barley tea.  I’m unsure if the side dishes are refillable as I did not request for refill.
The ambience of the restaurant is acceptable!

I’m neither Korean nor have I been to Korea, but I definitely believe this is what Korean food is supposed to be.

I loved every minute in the restaurant. Its ambiance is very warming- almost like you’re hosted by a warm lady.

Hearty and rustic dishes that really hits the spot.

Hearty authentic Korean food with large servings, you're definitely not leaving this place without a full stomach.

Cold glass noodles were delicious (not too spicy despite the color of the chilli).

They had baby octopus noodles which serves 2 pax, and actually this was the standout dish for me. The baby octopus was really delicious, my first time having it and really left me with a great impression.

I dined in a group of 8, which was a little large, best to dine in groups of 2-4.

Visited for dinner a couple of times. The food is delicious, and the portions are big.

It is a small restaurant with a low ceiling, and isn't acoustically treated, so it feels too noisy to have a conversation without raising your voice (which then makes the problem worse).

Another odd thing we felt was that either the tables  are shorter than usual, or the chairs taller than usual. We could be wrong, but our backs felt a little sore halfway through the meal.

Owner is extremely Cheerful and is full of smiles. The food is absolutely stunning, making me crave for more everytime. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to all Korean food lovers! Food is also authentic and fresh 😋

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Decided to do this review when I saw my old photos of this place. Came here because my regular Korean BBQ place next door was too packed.
Remembered that the marinated meats were good. Overall a good experience although you have to do the meat grilling yourself unlike at....

It’s a long time since we had Korean bbq & decided to give it a try since the ratings are good. The side dishes are really good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️, better than most Korean restaurants. We ordered beef & pork set. It came with the soybean soup that was quite tasty ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ and the steam egg which we didn’t really like it as much ⭐️⭐️⭐️ since it is harder than the usual steam egg. The meats : iberico pork collar, pork belly & beef striploin were good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ except the beef ribs as it was quite chewy ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. We were given free beer due to our spending amount. Overall it was a great experience.

Have always wanted to try the wood fired meats ever since I heard about them and today I got a chance. We ordered a set meal for pork with three different types of pork, steamed egg and also kimchi beef soup. The set is pork omma set meant for 2-3 pax.

Meat were generous and really more than enough for two pax. They recommended 2-3 pax but it should be more like 4 pax as both of us were not big meat eaters.

We ordered a wood flavour charcoal that is suitable for pork - hickory wood which tbh we both cannot smell it and cannot even taste the difference!! The steam egg could be better as it was chao tar at the sides:) the marinating of meats were left to us and the variety of salt and pepper to me were one of the more unique features of restaurant:)

The set comes with ban chan and they were delicious. There were free flow of ban chan until they ran out!

I like the kimchi and the ikan bilis banchan:) my friend like the ikan bilis banchan and ordered 2nds for both. By the end of the meal both kimchi and ikan bilis have ran out!!!

There were drinks on special offer but since I drove we did not get the offer.

Was surprised they don't do the cooking for us and also the young girl who first approached us seem new. There was also a housefly landing on the wood panels after we finished eating!!

The meat set was still a little frozen when served. The fried chicken was pretty average while the beef soup lacked ingredients and it doesn't come with rice. The seafood pancake was floury and non crispy. Food was alright, nothing surprising.

One of the staff doesn't know the differences between a receipt and a ticket and was augmentative about it. He said because we add on orders and not order at the start (which we totaled over $300 for the bill) doesn't count for the free flow beer for the table. While it was written on the poster outside the restaurant that "with minimum spend of $250 in a single receipt per table" he feels he had the need to go outside take a photo and show us to prove us wrong. At that point it just made us feel that the restaurant was kinda scammy. In the end he said only for this time he let us have the free beer. But kudos to the rest of the staff that were friendly, attentive and filled our drink fast.

Overall the food was mediocre and the service should be quite good but there's always a bad apple that spoiled the experience. Or maybe it was the management policy, who knows. I won't recommend this place instead just try the next door O.bba Jjajang for better Korean food.

Its my second time coming back here and they notice me directly!! Excellent service friendly &  accommodating staff !They welcomed me with their best smiles, assist me well especially in ordering ❤️ Hemah, Venissa and Sylvester 🫶🏻 were the best as they always check up on me for top-ups ! with my beer & etc.🤩

Excellent Customer Service! Ill keep on coming back here! thats for sure !

Best Regards as well to Kitchen Staffs who prepared all the food ! It is very well prepared the meat and my favorite seafood soup😍!❤️  thumbs up  and keep up the Good Work Everyone👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Rating: 4.3
Reviews: 

Very delicious food prepared by passionate chefs. Risotto, angel hair pasta, spicy pork ham pizza and wagyu beef steak were all cooked to perfection. The whole experience was brought to another level by extremely warm service by genuinely friendly staff. We would be back again.

Came to celebrate Father’s Day lunch on a lazy Sunday.  Place is not crowded and quite a nice homely atmosphere.  Ordered pizza, lamb chop, burrata cheese plater and bruschetta bread. All tasted delicious and pizza is really good.  Finished with nice coffee and tiramisu dessert.  Service is fast and prompt.  Overall a pleasant experience and the bill came up to $126 which is reasonable for the quality of food served.  Will certainly be back.

A nice cosy Italian restaurant nestled inside a private apartment. You will be spoilt for choices as they have a great authentic Italian menu and everything is tasty. Interior decor is also nicely done with a homey touch. Very friendly staff and chef as well.

I used to order often from them 4-5 years back as I was living next door and I returned for a dinner (last visit was probably 2019). The atmosphere is still great (old school italian place), the food is still amazing. Had the burrata, the 4 cheese pizza (I always order this wherever I go and Al Borgo is top 3 in Singapore for me) and pasta (angel hair with prawns). Nice Super Tuscan red wine at 90$ a bottle. Had deserts too (tiramisu and affogato with whisky instead of coffee). Total damage approx 230$. I left happy in spirit and tummy

It's definitely a great restaurant for who wanna taste real Italian food!! Thanks so much for giving us a lovely and unforgettable evening :)

Sunday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM

Price Level: None / 4 (0- Free, 1- Inexpensive, 2- Moderate, 3- Expensive, 4- Very Expensive, None- Price Data Not Available)
Rating: 4
Reviews: 

Excellent curry rice. Piping hot and crispy pork cutlet matched with silky smooth Japanese curry and steaming rice.

One of the best curry rice I have had.

The curry packs some spice is not the all-sweet curry sauce. Cutlet is flavourful; the crunch and temperature of the meat is excellent!

One of the star outlets of this hawker centre. Atmosphere is what you would expect of a hawker centre. The pigeons are a problem for this hawker centre but shouldn't distract you from the good food.

Look at what you can get for $10. Definitely 5 stars for someone who value quantity over quality yet quality is decent for a hawker fare Japanese curry rice. Pork katsu was the best out of the 3 meats on the plate while the other 2 were forgettable. Very extensive menu for such a small stall which makes ordering decision quite a headache.

Update Jul 2023:
Had their Char Siew Don which is definitely value for money at $5.50 though it's quite lacking in the taste department. Their char siew was succulent and the rice has the right texture but the sauce just doesn't felt right. I guessed the lack of mayonnaise was the difference, there's a reason why most Japanese outlets would add them in their CSD, something that the owner shd consider including.

Update Aug 2023:
Had their Poached Rice which is so far my favourite dish at this stall though it's recipe essentially derived from their ramen by changing the noodle to rice.

Update Aug 2023:
Finally got to try their ramen again which I had it long ago but didn't left an impression. Totally enjoyed it this time eventhough the tonkotsu broth lacked some depth(as expected for a hawker fare) but this can be gloss over by avoiding the original flavour and order either the spicy or black garlic flavour. A 80% restaurant's quality at less than half their price.

Update Aug 2023:
The Miso Rice w Mentaiko Pork Cutlet is my least favorite by far. The miso rice was too mushy and tasted like kimchi rice which I happened not to like. Pork cutlet was ok but the Mentaiko doesn't seems to compliment the meat as well as it did to salmon.

My favourite ramen place of all time!!!! Even better than typical ramen restaurants who claim to be “michelin star’. I always order their signature ramen bowl ($8.00), comes with the ingredients as shown. The pork slices are SO THICK and crispy on one side! Absolutely savoury! Also gives a generous amount of black fungus & the noodles are not overdone with texture in-place. Broth was flavourful yet not too overwhelming.

Even when their food is excellent, their service is impeccable as well. Due to the layout of the food centre, rain splashes quite heavily beside the stall (causing some flooding water as well). The owner came to deliver the ramen to me personally & even wrapped the ramen bowl with a layer of cling wrap + put seaweed in a plastic bag to prevent water from going in, even though I was dining in. Was blown by the effort & it showed how much pride they put in ensuring their ramen quality tasted the best! Kudos! Recommend anyone to go try!!!!!

Atmosphere is not that great - sg weather hahaha & area is not clean, but I’m not going to shortchange this stall of 5 stars as it’s the foodcourt’s issue xD

I purposedly went to Beauty World Food Centre just to try this ramen stall. I read that this stall is one of the 'must try' in the list. I went through the menu and saw that the ramen called BLACK KING (GARLIC) has 3 thumbs up sign. I ordered a bowl costing $9.90. It did not disappoint me. The broth is tasty with rich umami flavor while the noodles are al dente. The thing that I liked most is the barbecue slices of pork with nice  charred flavor while maintaining the tenderness of the meat. It also comes with cabbage, japanese style soft boiled egg, and generous topping of bonito flakes. I would definitely recommend this stall. An affordable ramen that is only a fraction of cost than a normal ramen would be.

Buta Kin must be a favourite at Beauty World Food Centre. There is a waiting time of 15 minutes for the Ramen.

To me, good ramen is one with great-tasting broth, and the noodles must be cooked to my liking (a tad on the hard side). This ramen store ticked all the right boxes (almost). The broth was lovely, but it bordered on the lighter side on the taste. The noodles were perfect. The Char Siew or Charred Pork Slices were delicious and with a little charred flavour. The umami was perfect.

For extra ingredients, like one boiled egg and extra Char Siew, the cost turned out to be $11. Cheap for the food court? Not exactly, but compared with the ramen restaurants, it is very reasonable.

Verdict, I would certainly come again. I like it.

Reviews: 

Finally tried the Colombian chicken ($5.50) for lunch. There’s option to add steamed vegetables (which I didn’t).
Tender meat, with lots of gravy, and nice salsa to accompany. The rice is flavored too which is a great addition. Not bad a meal! Portion would be small for a guy.

I have no idea what authentic Colombian food is but this stuff was delicious, inexpensive, and reminded me of my mom’s cooking. Owners were super friendly too! I ordered a second plate immediately after finishing the first. Also the chili is among the hottest I’ve had in SG! Which is a good thing.

Succulent chicken meat coupled together with aromatic rice and perfectly seasoned chopped tomatoes 👍🏻
Be sure to add on more vegetables for a nutritious meal
I tried coming a few times specifically for this shop, but they were closed.
Today I finally get to try their delicious food 👍🏻😀

Gobbled up all the rice before taking a photo because I was too hungry.
But hey, at least I've tried and tested it 😁

Ordered Colombian chicken rice. It came with two huge chicken thigh and drumstick. The Colombian flavour had an sweet and savory taste which was really nice. Owners were friendly too.

Humble hawker stall selling something unique and affordable - Colombian chicken rice for $5.50. One of the rare instances where the food itself looks better than the photos at the stall front!

All portions served include a drumstick and a thigh so the meat was very tender and came off the bone easily. Can taste the mix of various herbs and spices within the sauce. Refreshing tomato salsa at the side. Loved the extra dollop of spicy chilli padi - this added Singaporean touch elevated the whole dish! Pay an additional $1 for a bowl of mixed vegetables. I was supposed to limit my intake of carbs but couldn’t resist finish the entire bowl of rice here with the sauce. Good service and will try the apple crumble next time.

Reviews: 

Arrived at 11.15am before the lunch crowd. Boss was a really friendly chap and recommended his specialties Nasi Kunyit and Mee Siam but I ordered Prawn Noodles and I was not disappointed.

This has got to be the best prawn noodles I had this year. The soup has solid taste of prawns. The yellow noodles were springy in terms of bite with crunchy bean sprouts. Loved their sliced red chilli sauce when you dip the two shells off prawns into. Brings back memories of how grandma would cook prawns noodles traditional way when I was young.

If the prawn noodles was already so good, must come back soon to try their specialties.

Visited 18/09/23.

It's a small space.
But not there to soak the environment.
Here to eat good food and we weren't disappointed.

We had good Mee Siam and also Mee Rebus.
Both were fantastic.
The chilli - da best. 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
Taste were spot on. Portion was HUGE too!

No complaints from our side as we stuffed our mouths with deliciousness.

Will come again also for sure.

The cakes are soooo delicious, especially the chocolate tart and the coconut. The coffee/tea and food prices are cheap and everything is good quality! Less sugar used in cakes and kueh too but tastes immense!

my parents & i visit this place pretty often & their standard is very consistent! all their dishes taste good. howeverrrr, i think you can give the drinks a pass 😵‍💫.

the owner is a very friendly guy who greets everyone by ‘sister’ & ‘brother’. the place & the dishes are very homely. their kueh’s and traditional nonya desserts are also v tasty!! i’d say give it a try if you’re in the area as it is also very value for money. portions are also filling enough!

Food here is great, I had the Nasi Kunyit, Teh Peng and the Nonya Chendol. My friend ordered the Laksa Lemak, and made me regret not buying that even though the Nasi Kunyit was good. The Laksa just had a very thick and gao soup / sauce.

The Teh peng is different from most shops in that it's not too sweet, rather a thinner feel to it, and the flavour is more subtle. Something different that I enjoyed!

Oh, the seats aren't too comfortable for longer meals, and the payment is a little confusing, I don't know exactly when to pay (especially if you're ordering desserts or having a friend join a little later. But otherwise, I'll definitely recommend this place, especially the Laksa.

my first time to try marinated raw crabs. it was surprisingly delicious, juicy and meaty. the one with the sinfully sweet orange fat was better. the meat selection was overshadowed by the crab but they were very good, too - melts in your mouth level good.

staff was warm, friendly and attentive.

My first time here. Great service! Meats are good and cooked as requested. Generous with side dishes as well.
The whole restaurant is clean and spacious. Great atmosphere!
Will come again next time with my friends.

Yesterday, we had a blast celebrating my sister's birthday at Nami Korean Grill House. The food was amazing, and while the cost was on the higher side, it was absolutely worth it! The service was fantastic, especially thanks to Kaijie, who took care of us most of the time. He definitely deserves a shout-out for his excellent service.

Great service and ambience nicely located within a quaint neighborhood. Really liked everything we ordered and glad we tried the marinated crabs which were fresh and tasty. Will definitely be back to try out other dishes.

Well-marinated Korean Bbq food and nice side dishes. High quality meat, and beef was super good.  Fried chicken & glass noodles were delicious, steamed egg was fluffy and pancake was excellent too.  Service was impeccable as well.

Came here for lunch and there was already a long queue. Tried their sliced fish mee sua and added fish maw. Apparently all their noodles are handmade. Really tastes similar to home cooked food. There is a good balance of ingredients, just the right amount of everything - greens, fish slices, meat, mushroom etc. They were quite generous with the fish maw. The chilli and black sauce complemented really well with my dry mee sua. Comes with a bowl of soup as well. Would pop to eat again next time. Definitely recommended, especially when queue is short!

Worthy of the name Top 1, the noodles are decently priced and delicious.

We had the Tom Yum You Mia , Abalone Clam Mee Sua and Ban Mian. All 3 were distinct in their own flavors.
The Tom Yum soup was more of a thick gravy with a nice kick. The default soup was flavorful.
Lots of ingredients in all made us pretty full.

The 30 cents chilli is skippable if you are a chilli fiend, otherwise it is acceptable to normies.

We paid $16.80 for 3 bowls of soupy goodness. The only downside is the 30 mins plus queue time but I would say it's worth it.

Long Queue, ordered $5 dry ban mian. Although a small table spoon of chilli paste, it's very potent. Enjoyable experience when eating.

Meats and condiments are comforting.

Next time I will order a larger portion the next time.

Waited about 15 mins in line and another 10 mins after ordering for a dry ban mian. Very tasty ban mian and soup. Portion is a bit small compared to other ban mian places but I think this is very good quality. If you don’t mind waiting time then this is nice.

Top 1 Home Made Noodle holds a special place in my heart as my ultimate go-to stall for exquisite noodle delights. Despite the inevitable queue, the wait is undoubtedly worthwhile. Offering selection up to 8 distinct noodle varieties, from thin strands to thicker cuts, this multi-generational establishment has consistently delivered impeccable quality.

One of their standout dishes, Dry Noodle aka (Gan Lao Mian) stands as my personal favorite. Its chewy noodles bathed in a tantalizing combination of rich dark sauce and spicy chili create an explosion of flavors on the palate. The addition of premium toppings prawns, fish, and abalone elevates the experience to an unparalleled level of indulgence.

While the queue might seem daunting, the freshness of the soup speaks volumes about their commitment to quality. For anyone yet to savor the delights of this noodle haven, it's a must-visit destination. Top 1 Home Made Noodle is not just a stall, it's an experience that seamlessly blends tradition with culinary excellence. Prepare to be captivated by the harmonious marriage of chewy noodles, exquisite flavors, and premium toppings

Anyone have not tried it go for it you will love it for sure!

Rating: 4.5
Reviews: 

This restaurant really has it all! The service, the food and atmosphere. We were also served by an amazing waiter, Kai. One of the best genuine services! His recommendations for food and drinks were top notch =) He even insisted to take away the leftovers. And he was right, still so good the next day! Don’t miss taking photos outside the mansion. It’s too pretty to miss!

Came here for a birthday celebration and we were served by the pleasant and friendly Kai, who gave us excellent recommendations and advised us on the portions. Service was great and our food came super fast to the point that we got full a bit early. Kai noticed this and helped slow down the subsequent dishes. We had the octopus and truffle egg mash for starters. The dishes were all superb and up to standard but the portions were pretty big too so be warned not to overorder. The highlight for us was the seafood paella and the iberico pork, each spoonful of the paella was bursting with flavour and fresh seafood, we felt like we were one with the ocean itself. Our table for two was also very spacious. They served a light Basque baked cheesecake on the house for our birthday celebration. Will definitely be back again!

We celebrated my wife birthday at Una on a Friday. Only set lunch option available unless we pre ordered tapas. Service crew is very friendly here, keep checking our water is filled. The food is delicious! The server also surprised my wife with a slice of cake for her birthday! What a great place to celebrate birthdays.

Overall it was a great dining experience. The staffs are friendly.
The foods are delicious. The Ibérico pork was great however it could’ve been better if it was cooked medium rare. As in the picture the right side was alright while the left side was kinda dry, about medium well to well done.

Had a fantastic dinner and wine pairing at Una. Michelin starred Chef Diego Grimberg and Una have established a culinary partnership. We got a sample of his dishes and it was just divine. From his Beef tartare with truffle, to pickled beetroot, octopus rice, beef sirloin and don't get me started on the chocolate and olive oil dessert - everything was fantastic

Nearest hawker centre to mount faber. Good pit-stop for breakfast /brunch … lotsa variety of food options. Many popular stalls with a long queue. Queued for the “Ban Mian / Fish Soup” … ordered Ban Mian (handmade noodles) & couldn’t resist to add a few pieces of golden fried batang fish. I enjoyed it 🤓

Simple tasty meal @3.50 . Portion given is ok.
Nice gravy with fresh garlic , celery , chillies.
Always sold out fast before 1pm

Kopi O $1.80 x2 cup. 90 cent each. Food here are reasonable price and mainly good for most stores here

I think this is one of the best food courts in Singapore. In particular, there is excellent Malay and Indian food! A lot to explore.

Great place with variety of food choices for everyone. Always go this particular stall called NM Hussain Mee Goreng to try their Mutton Soup and fried rice. Best taste and opposite is a parata shop too named Al Amin.
