Reviews: 

Good hearty bowl of mixed beef dry noodles.

Sesame oil is added by default.

If you like the taste of beef in all it's glory, I would recommend to skip the sesame oil altogether.

The sesame oil is good but it is also overpowering the main star of the dish...the beef!

I have eaten quite a few dry beef noodles but most don't add sesame oil.

I love the generous amount of dark brown gravy accompanying the bowl of noodles. The soup was flavourful and great.

Quite hard to find this coffeeshop/food court as it is on the 2nd floor and only easily accessible by staircase that leads to the main road.

Highly recommended!

👍👍

Ordered mixed beef noodle with gravy. Food is so so only. Gravy is thick enough but too salty. Not much ingredients. Stall owner is very unfriendly and unhelpful. Shouted at me for ‘not able to understand and order’ in a way he understood. Also almost knocked off the tray with the food in front of me and never apologized. Will never order anymore.

Had no 2 which is w tendon.
Excellent bowl of beef kway tiao soup, tendon is nice & gelatinous which takes time to do.
Extra points for having 3 types of chilli👍🏻.
Will try the dry version next time.
Only downside is the coffeeshop is pretty warm despite so many fans.
Try to sit near this stall as it’s cooler on this side then the side w the economical rice.

Still one of e better dried beef horfun I have eaten.
$5 for a sliced beef bowl. Add $2 extra meat. Omg.... love it.
Soup s beefy n umami. 😋
Worth it. Must try.

Was attracted by their variety of beef noodle options, beef balls, mixed entrails and many more. Decided to go for my all time favourite dry beef sliced rice noodle.

Impressed by their choice to use porcelain bowls and it is the rooster printed type, gave me a traditional olden days feel especially with the piping hot soup and noodles. Many vendors have abandoned forsaken such practice to save cost and for ease of handling. This bagged their first star!

Generous portion of noodles and beef slices, the portion of meat is definitely enough to last with the noodles which is so rare to find nowadays. Many foodcourts’ renowned beef noodle stalls in only give 4-5 tiny thinly sliced beef with few mouthful portion of noodles.

The gravy is thick & tasty towards sweet but still acceptable for me who usually prefers more savoury food. The sliced beef is tender and chewable. The soup is flavourful but can be improved as it lacks the wow factor of simmered soup base. The effort to top the soup & noodle with generous amounts of garnish is applaudable.

Not the best that I have tasted but it beats many foodcourt ones. It is value for money at $5 with good presentation and taste. Thumb up, will be back to try the other variety.

Side note: Help yourself to the type of chilli sauce and cincalok.

Was there for after lunch dessert, didn’t try their main. Unfortunately we didn’t like the kueh and desserts. The bobo chacha has too much sweet potatoes and a little too sweet. Chendo, as you can see, not lemak enough. Not much fragrance to the rice kueh selection and some rice weren’t well cooked. The sugee cake has a little nutty feel but overall not to my liking. But the ambience is quite good, with choice to sit in aircon inside, a little cramp though. You can sit outside, sufficient fans and air cooler fan around. Tables and chairs looking clean.

The food is nice and serving is good for 2 people. Like that it is dog friendly at the outside dining area. Can slightly before lunch time on a PH and it was almost full during lunch. 👍🏼 glad I found this place

White rice is different. Was using Indian rice. It good. Foods nothing special, it just a normal peranakan dish. Can go and try it out. One of the quiet place and environment I like.

This place is good. We spent $76 today. The kueh pie tee is so good - Met my expectation. The ingredients of the food here are fresh and good. The only disappointing item is the Bobo chacha - too little soup but they give lots of yam and sweet potatoes. The yam is not soft enough。it will be nicer if the texture is the 粉 粉 type.  Service is ok. They accept cash or PayLah only. No credit card payment.

Authentic and delicious Peranakan food. They also serve Peranakan snacks and kueh.

Family run. The food is home cook quality what you would like to eat every night.

The location is really interesting. Gives me the feeling of a Taiwanese restaurant that is outside of the city, when I travel to Taiwan.
The restaurant spreads the table giving good space to enhance the dining experience.
Food is generally good, although I find some dishes a little saltier than what I would prefer. But 真的不错吃！😊
If you have got been here before, give it a try! Quite a unique place.

Classic horfun and fried rice done right at this tze char place in the Yeo’s Building at Telok Blangah.  Tried one of their signature dishes - Ultraman chicken which is salted egg popcorn chicken - pretty good! Super fast service and nice retro vibe to place

Awesome food. Was so good and ate a lot. Portion is reasonable. Ordered approximately 11 dish of varying sizes for $250++. No regrets.

A classic Chinese Tze char eatery for the nostalgia. Food was decent and not too salty. I really liked the pumpkin tofu as the tofu was very silky. Coffee ribs were a bit of a misrepresentation as it was pork slices (easy to eat coz it’s boneless I guess?) Am still on the search for a good Yam ring which wasn’t fulfilled here although still ok but  unfortunately the Yam felt like it was cooked in overused oil. Fried mee sua was underwhelming.

Aunt picked this place for her 84th birthday treat & was disappointed. The place kind of messy maintained outside & ordered dishes are not the best. The chilli crab doesn't look & taste as said. Management proposed to wash the sauce off to re-cooked into pepper crab, which still tastes average. The sauce for the fish head had so much starch that turned into paste when cold. The black pepper beef is overcooked, rough & tough like John Wayne. Although the desserts are thrown in by Management & I'd the yam paste which many highlighted... my verdict ... disappointed.

We'll 04 agreed that this'll be our 1st & last.

First off, this uncle is such a pleasant, polite and friendly man! Not an ounce of arrogance despite being so popular. Truly admirable!
As for his char kway teow, it’s one of the classic renditions still available.
More on the moist side, slightly sweet, a good amount of tasty crispy pork lard but not too much of the lard oil, which is good because it doesn’t feel so sinful.
Really good for cockle fans!
Best eaten there.

Uncle is so sweet! He opened the stall a little early at around 4pm because there was already a "sitting" queue on a Saturday. Usually, he says it's around 5pm.

It's totally worth the craze- wok hey Kway Teow with crispy lard and delicious cockles. Only 1 size portion - $5 and max 10 per order.

If you are done, you can return the empty plate to the grey bin and the chopsticks to the smaller green bin.

Uncle also does his stall preparation is secret with the binds down. 😂

Prepare for 1.5h queue. Uncle cooks plate by plate so each person about 10mins on average. One of the best CKTs I ever had in sg and is on the wet side. Pork lard very crispy and fragrant, stock used is sufficient. 1 size only at $5. The queue is too long for me to eat this again tho

Hand down one if not the best Char Kway Teow in Singapore! Came in $5 portion only. Plenty of fresh cockles and crispy pork lard in the noodle. Sometime you have to wait a hour or more if people in front order a lot of packets but it is definitely worth the wait! Uncle is soft spoken and friendly too!

Long wait time as he fries each plate at a time. But puts in a lot of effort for each plate. No lap cheong but loaded with lots of cockles and bean sprouts. Five dollars per plate no more no less and so filling.

It’s good mutton briyani for $6.50 with tender meat. It’s not gamey like most I have tried. Usually I dnt take mutton. But this is real light in taste but with strong herbs.

Simply one of best mutton briyani you can find. Rem to ask for extra curry which fused with fragrant mutton flavor.

The usual stall that we have always patronised was not open on the day and thus we were given a good reason to try out the other popular stall in Telok Blangah Food Center. We remembered many of the diners enjoying their plate of Briyani from one of the Muslim stalls and guess it's our time to try it out now.

At one glance at the stall signboard, they are offering biryani and roti prata only. For Briyani, there is a choice of chicken or Mutton.

Who needs a good presentation of the food when it tasted good? For both Chicken & Mutton Briyani, do expect the eye-pleasing serving that has a delicious drum or meat topping up the plate of Basmati Rice, papadum and colourful pickles to entice you. Instead, I would say what they prepared was a bare minimum, cut cucumbers, meat and rice with a plate of curry.

The first mouthful of the rice had landed me an understanding of why people are patronising them. No doubt that the food was simple and straightforward, I must say that their rice is very fluffy and non-greasy at all. There is no gamey taste from the mutton. The meat was tender and the meat literally fell off the bone with the slightest effort. I drenched my plate of Briyani with the curry gravy given and had enjoyed every grain of it.

Mutton Briyani - $6.50

The chicken Briyani too, was tender and delicious with meat falling apart easily. Curry was thick and satisfying.

Chicken Briyani - $6

Overall, food is of the right amount of spice and not overpowering in any aspect of taste. I will be back again!

I would have given them 5 stars if the biryani comes with papadum.

Very thick and flavorful curry (both chicken and mutton). Both meat was cooked to almost perfection.

Very fluffy basmati bryani rice. Not oily and delicious. Mutton was soft and tender.. curry have just the right touch of spices. Popular stall

A nice coffee shop w a variety of food and all were pretty good!

We tried the stall selling ipoh food and their curry mee was really nice, especially the soup version. Beef noodles from Horiginal was really nice and not too gamey. The portion is really huge! Oyster omelette was not bad too.

Wanted to eat mee goreng at the food center but it's closed.

Came over to the coffeeshop and noticed a new Indian food stall, so I ordered mee goreng from them.

It looks, not the usual red Indian mee goreng, just an unusual color.

The shock was, $7 for a plate.  Everywhere else is selling at $4.50 or at most, $5.  $7!  It's really expensive!  I was really unpleasantly and uncomfortably surprised!

Back to the mee goreng.  It doesn't taste the familiar mee goreng taste.  The sauce, was it chilli or tomato sauce? It taste a bit stale so I didn't want to take it.

Noticed there were a lot more Mutton than the usual, so that's why it's $7.  BUT who pays $7 for a plate of fried mee goreng at the coffeeshop or food center?

I wouldn't want to try anything else again, for I'll likely get another shock I'm not prepared for.

Good luck guys. I wonder if the business can last.

1 star for the drink stall. Ordered teh c and it tasted horribly diluted. Just a sip and I am done with it.

3 stars as there are really quite a number of interesting food stalls here including the famous char kway teow supposedly with generous serving of cockles with a super long queue. Tried the prata stall and it was pretty good.



Very good char kway teow and beef noodles

Here got lot of good food, clean and a quiet environment.

Stopped there after a long walk on the hill. Was a great place to discover the real local neighbourhood live away from the tourist areas. Super friendly service by the hawker stall staff and excellent food at good value.

Not so crowded usually. Several good stalls for lunch. Duck rice, CKT, noodles and Bah Chor Mee.

A pretty okay and decent food centre which is not too heaty - the ventilation was actually quite okay.

The prawn noodle here is pretty good. You got to go queue early (11.30am or earlier) for lunch. Well priced and filling.

Good food but not for morning bird, if you are too early there is nothing there.

Smallish place but houses some great local food

Nice porridge and chicken served at Tiong Bahru Wah Yuen Porridge. Only open on weekends, please note

The tea at 七时年代 was good

Try the Hong Kong Soy Sauce Chicken hor fun

LABRADOR Malay food stall’s lontong was good although the tau kwa was hard

Delicious bryani rice at Sabeen Sara! Mutton was soft and basmati rice was light and fluffy. The prata dough was freshly handmade at the stall!

Yanan ban mian was surprisingly nice especially with the fresh fried fish.

The black carrot cake is kind of sweet for me. The white one tastes good thuo. Other stalls like the Prawn noodle, Char siew noodle and seafood Hor fun worth trying too. After 3pm all shop will be closed...

Would recommend the basil pork rice (tasty & value for money $7.90) and the fried pork neck (tender and juicy meat, lightly fried).

Would not recommend the pineapple rice (too dry and lack of pineapple) and red Tom yum soup (too thick and salty even after we requested for less salty)

Service from staff is very good. Place can get crowded during meal times.

Standing itself at the wild west of jurong. A rare find if you are alone.

Lonely looking for some vibes before going home.

Try this place. Still people from all walks are here. So you won't feel lonely. Drinking talking,

Trying the bbq pork neck and of course goes with Chang beer.

Peace.

Overall dishes are tasty. Their pad Thai, Tom yam and deep fried garlic pork is a must try!

PS: Just take note that there will be queue during dinner time. So do make your way there earlier to avoid the crowd.

A place to go to when I have Thai Food craving. We always get a table as we visit on weekdays. Service staff are pleasant and friendly. Tasty Thai food which are reasonably priced with huge portion. Will be good for 4 pax or more if you would like to try more dishes.

Our all time favorite is their fried pork cheeks which is only $12.

Their pricing on the menu is nett price, so i personally it cheap for such authentic Thai food adapted to local taste buds.

The crispy  pork cheek very nice. Go with Tom yum clear soup and mango salad. The yellow curry seafood smell fragrance and tasteful. Price affordable rate. Highly recommended as it really authentic Thai food.

Delicious white pepper bak kut teh with refillable soup! It's worth it for $10.80 as there are 4 pieces of pork ribs which are quite tender. The waitress also took initiative to refill our Pu er tea and soup. Food was served promptly after ordering. Clean and spacious environment. A hidden gem in Taman Jurong!

Pretty nice BKT with 2 types of base soup for your preference. Impressed that they also have some tze char dishes for those who are not into BKT. Recommend that you get premium ribs since its easier to eat with tender meat. Soup are refillable - hurray! Prices quite reasonable but rice at $1. Comfortable and spacious interior, suitable for families with kids. I personally prefer the white peppery Bah Kut Teh soup over the herbal one. There is a huge variety of options for diners. The chicken rice set was pretty good too. Reasonable price.

IG: sgfood13

Service could be better. Food taste average. Used to have dimsum menu but sadly they removed it. You get a refill of the soup though( once ), which isn't allowed at other branch.

Update Nov ‘22: Soup isn’t as flavourful anymore, and a lot of the dishes were undercooked - chicken was red, pork rib was red, bitter gourd too tough.. dropping to 2 stars ⭐️

Can’t find any fault with the quality and taste of the food here, it’s all wonderfully done.

There is also a 1 x free refill on all soups, which pretty much fills 60-70% of the bowl. Also, it’s a good idea to takeaway the refill portion of the soup if you can’t finish both bowls in one setting 😉

However, the service level and price is a little off imo. (Or maybe we just weren’t used to the GST and service charge after 4 months at home - $116 for 4 pax, you be the judge)

Delicious and nurturing Chinese home dishes. Preferred the lotus root soup with more herbal taste than the chicken herbal soup which is too sweet. The homemade tofu is very good. Just soup and tofu with rice for 2 is very filling. Ordered 1 soup and 1 dish and get another soup free. Great bargain for a satisfying meal! 👍🏼

Food was good. Place was good.
